text: The book of the generation of Jesus Christ , the son of David , the son of Abraham .
text2: IESVS CHRIST Dauid - en semearen , Abrahamen semearen generationeco Liburuä .

text: Abraham begat Isaac ; and Isaac begat Jacob ; and Jacob begat Judas and his brethren ;
text2: Abrahamec engendra ceçan Isaac . Eta Isaac - ec engendra ceçan Iacob . Eta Iacob - ec engendra citzan Iuda eta haren anayeac .

text: And Judas begat Phares and Zara of Thamar ; and Phares begat Esrom ; and Esrom begat Aram ;
text2: Eta Iudac engendra citzan Phares eta Zara Thamarganic . Eta Pharesec engendra ceçan Esrom . Eta Esromec engendra ceçan Aram .

text: And Aram begat Aminadab ; and Aminadab begat Naasson ; and Naasson begat Salmon ;
text2: Eta Aramec engendra ceçan Aminadab . Eta Aminadab - ec engendra ceçan Naasson . Eta Naassonec engendra ceçan Salmon .

text: And Salmon begat Booz of Rachab ; and Booz begat Obed of Ruth ; and Obed begat Jesse ;
text2: Eta Salmonec engendra ceçan Booz Rachabganic . Eta Boozec engendra ceçan Obed Ruthganic . Eta Obed - ec engendra ceçan Iesse .

text: And Jesse begat David the king ; and David the king begat Solomon of her that had been the wife of Urias ;
text2: Eta Iessec engendra ceçan Dauid reguea . Eta Dauid regueac engendra ceçan Salomon Vriasen emazte içanaganic .

text: And Solomon begat Roboam ; and Roboam begat Abia ; and Abia begat Asa ;
text2: Eta Salomonec engendra ceçan Roboam . Eta Roboamec engendra ceçan Abia . Eta Abiac engendra ceçan Asa .

text: And Asa begat Josaphat ; and Josaphat begat Joram ; and Joram begat Ozias ;
text2: Eta Asac engendra ceçan Iosaphat . Eta Iosaphatec engendra ceçan Ioram . Eta Ioramec engendra ceçan Ozias .

text: And Ozias begat Joatham ; and Joatham begat Achaz ; and Achaz begat Ezekias ;
text2: Eta Oziasec engendra ceçan Ioatham . Eta Ioathamec engendra ceçan Achaz . Eta Achazec engendra ceçan Ezechias .

text: And Ezekias begat Manasses ; and Manasses begat Amon ; and Amon begat Josias ;
text2: Eta Ezechiasec engendra ceçan Manasse . Eta Manassec engendra ceçan Amon . Eta Amonec engendra ceçan Iosias .

text: And Josias begat Jechonias and his brethren , about the time they were carried away to Babylon :
text2: Eta Iosiasec engendra ceçan Iacim . Eta Iacimec engrendra citzan Iechonias eta haren anayeac , Babylonerat eraman içan ciradenean .

text: And after they were brought to Babylon , Jechonias begat Salathiel ; and Salathiel begat Zorobabel ;
text2: Eta Babylonerát eraman içan ciraden ondoan , Iechoniasec engendra ceçan Salathiel . Eta Salathielec engendra ceçan Zorobabel .

text: And Zorobabel begat Abiud ; and Abiud begat Eliakim ; and Eliakim begat Azor ;
text2: Eta Zorobabelec engendra ceçan Abiud . Eta Abiud - ec engendra ceçan Eliacim . Eta Eliacimec engendra ceçan Azor .

text: And Azor begat Sadoc ; and Sadoc begat Achim ; and Achim begat Eliud ;
text2: Eta Azorec engendra ceçan Sadoc . Eta Sadoc - ec engendra ceçan Achim . Eta Achimec engendra ceçan Eliud .

text: And Eliud begat Eleazar ; and Eleazar begat Matthan ; and Matthan begat Jacob ;
text2: Eta Eliud - ec engendra ceçan Eleazar . Eta Eleazarec engendra ceçan Mathan . Eta Mathanec engendra ceçan Iacob .

text: And Jacob begat Joseph the husband of Mary , of whom was born Jesus , who is called Christ .
text2: Eta Iacob - ec engendra ceçan Ioseph Mariaren senharra , ceinaganic iayo içan baita Iesus , cein erraiten baita Christ .

text: So all the generations from Abraham to David are fourteen generations ; and from David until the carrying away into Babylon are fourteen generations ; and from the carrying away into Babylon unto Christ are fourteen generations .
text2: Bada Abrahamganic Dauidgananoco generatione guciac , dirade hamalaur generatione . Eta Dauidganic Babylonerat eraman içan ciraden arteranocoac , hamalaur generatione . Eta Babylonerat eraman içan ciradenetic Christgananocoac , hamalaur generatione .

text: Now the birth of Jesus Christ was on this wise : When as his mother Mary was espoused to Joseph , before they came together , she was found with child of the Holy Ghost .
text2: Bada Iesus Christen sortzea hunela içan da . Ecen Maria haren ama Iosephequin fedatua cela , hec elkargana gabe , içorra eriden cedin Spiritu sainduaganic .

text: Then Joseph her husband , being a just man , and not willing to make her a publick example , was minded to put her away privily .
text2: Orduan bere senhar Iosephec , ceren iusto baitzen eta ezpaitzuen hura diffamatu nahi , secretuqui vtzi nahi vkan çuen .

text: But while he thought on these things , behold , the angel of the Lord appeared unto him in a dream , saying , Joseph , thou son of David , fear not to take unto thee Mary thy wife : for that which is conceived in her is of the Holy Ghost .
text2: Baina gauça hauc gogoan cerabiltzala , huná , Iaunaren Aingueruä aguer cequion ametsetaric , cioela , Ioseph Dauid - en semeá , ezaicela beldur eure emazte Mariaren hartzera : ecen hartan concebitu dena , Spiritu sainduaganic duc .

text: And she shall bring forth a son , and thou shalt call his name JESUS : for he shall save his people from their sins .
text2: Eta erdiren duc seme batez eta deithuren duc haren icena Iesus . Ecen harc saluaturen dic bere populua hayen bekatuetaric .

text: Now all this was done , that it might be fulfilled which was spoken of the Lord by the prophet , saying ,
text2: Bada haur gucia eguin içan da , Iaunac Prophetáz erran vkan çuena compli ledinçát , cioela ,

text: Behold , a virgin shall be with child , and shall bring forth a son , and they shall call his name Emmanuel , which being interpreted is , God with us .
text2: Huná , virginabat içorra içanen da , eta erdiren da seme batez , eta deithuren duté haren icena Emmanuel , cein erran nahi baita hambat nola , Iaincoa gurequin .

text: Then Joseph being raised from sleep did as the angel of the Lord had bidden him , and took unto him his wife :
text2: Lotaric iratzarturic bada Iosephec eguin ceçan Aingueruäc manatu ceraucan beçala , eta har ceçan bere emaztea .

text: And knew her not till she had brought forth her firstborn son : and he called his name JESUS .
text2: Eta etzeçan hura eçagut , bere lehen semeaz erdi cedino : eta deiceçan haren icena Iesus .

text: Now when Jesus was born in Bethlehem of Judaea in the days of Herod the king , behold , there came wise men from the east to Jerusalem ,
text2: Iayo cenean bada Iesus Bethlehem Iudeacoan regue Herodesen demborán , huná , Çuhurrac Orientetic ethor citecen Ierusalemera ,

text: Saying , Where is he that is born King of the Jews ? for we have seen his star in the east , and are come to worship him .
text2: Cioitela , Non da Iuduén regue iayo dena ? ecen ikussi dugu haren içarra Orientean , eta ethorri gara hura adora deçagunçat .

text: When Herod the king had heard these things , he was troubled , and all Jerusalem with him .
text2: Bada regue Herodes ençunic hori trubla cedin , eta Ierusaleme gucia harequin .

text: And when he had gathered all the chief priests and scribes of the people together , he demanded of them where Christ should be born .
text2: Eta bilduric Sacrificadore principal guciac eta populuaren Scribác , informa cedin hetaric non Christ sortzeco cen .

text: And they said unto him , In Bethlehem of Judaea : for thus it is written by the prophet ,
text2: Eta hec erran cieçoten , Bethlehem Iudeacoan , ecen hunela scribatua duc Prophetáz ,

text: And thou Bethlehem , in the land of Juda , art not the least among the princes of Juda : for out of thee shall come a Governor , that shall rule my people Israel .
text2: Eta hi Bethlehem Iudaco lurrá , ezaiz Iudaco gobernadorén arteco chipiena , ecen hireganic ilkiren duc , Israel ene populua bazcaturen duen gobernadorea .

text: Then Herod , when he had privily called the wise men , inquired of them diligently what time the star appeared .
text2: Orduan Herodes secretuqui Çuhurrac deithuric informa cedin hetaric diligentqui , içarra aguertu içan çayen demboráz :

text: And he sent them to Bethlehem , and said , Go and search diligently for the young child ; and when ye have found him , bring me word again , that I may come and worship him also .
text2: Eta hec Bethlehemerat igorriric , erran cieçén , Ioanic informa çaitezte diligentqui haourtchoaz : eta eriden duqueçuenean , iaquin eraci ieçadacue , nic - ere ethorriric adora deçadan hura .

text: When they had heard the king , they departed ; and , lo , the star , which they saw in the east , went before them , till it came and stood over where the young child was .
text2: Hec bada reguea ençunic parti citecen : eta huná , Orientean ikussi vkan çuten içarra hayén aitzinean ioaiten cen , haourtchoa cen lekuaren gainera ethorriric gueldi cedino .

text: When they saw the star , they rejoiced with exceeding great joy .
text2: Eta içarra ikussiric bozcario handiz boz citecen haguitz .

text: And when they were come into the house , they saw the young child with Mary his mother , and fell down , and worshipped him : and when they had opened their treasures , they presented unto him gifts ; gold , and frankincense , and myrrh .
text2: Eta etchera sarthuric eriden ceçaten haourtchoa bere ama Mariarequin : eta ahozpez adora ceçaten hura , eta bere thesaurac desplegaturic presenta cietzoten estrenác , vrrhe , encensu , eta myrrha .

text: And being warned of God in a dream that they should not return to Herod , they departed into their own country another way .
text2: Eta diuinoqui ametsetan aduertitu içanic ezlitecen Herodesgana itzul , berce bidez retira citecen bere comarcarát .

text: And when they were departed , behold , the angel of the Lord appeareth to Joseph in a dream , saying , Arise , and take the young child and his mother , and flee into Egypt , and be thou there until I bring thee word : for Herod will seek the young child to destroy him .
text2: Bada hec retiratu eta , huná , Iaunaren Aingueruä aguertzen çayó Iosephi , dioela , Iaiquiric har itzac haourtchoa eta haren ama , eta ihes eguic Egyptera : eta aicén han nic darraqueadano : ecen Herodesec bilhaturen dic haourtchoa hiltzeco .

text: When he arose , he took the young child and his mother by night , and departed into Egypt :
text2: Iosephec bada iratzarri eta , har citzan haourtchoa eta haren ama gauaz , eta retira cedin Egyptera .

text: And was there until the death of Herod : that it might be fulfilled which was spoken of the Lord by the prophet , saying , Out of Egypt have I called my son .
text2: Eta egon cedin han Herodesen finerano , Iaunac Prophetáz erran çuena compli ledinçát , cioela Egyptetic deithu vkan dut neure Semea .

text: Then Herod , when he saw that he was mocked of the wise men , was exceeding wroth , and sent forth , and slew all the children that were in Bethlehem , and in all the coasts thereof , from two years old and under , according to the time which he had diligently inquired of the wise men .
text2: Orduan Herodesec ikussiric nola Çuhurréz enganatu içan cen , asserre cedin haguitz : eta bere gendea igorriric hil citzan Bethlehemen eta haren aldiri gucietan ciraden haour bi vrthetaco eta behereco guciac , Çuhurretaric diligentqui informatu içan cen demboraren araura .

text: Then was fulfilled that which was spoken by Jeremy the prophet , saying ,
text2: Orduan compli cedin Iaunac Hieremias Prophetáz erran vkan çuena , cioela ,

text: In Rama was there a voice heard , lamentation , and weeping , and great mourning , Rachel weeping for her children , and would not be comforted , because they are not .
text2: Voza Rhaman ençun içan da , deithore eta nigar eta auhen handi . Rachel bere haourracgatic nigarrez egon , eta ezta consolatu nahi içan , ceren eztiraden .

text: But when Herod was dead , behold , an angel of the Lord appeareth in a dream to Joseph in Egypt ,
text2: Baina Herodes hil eta , huná , Iaunaren Aingueruä aguer cequión ametsetan Iosephi Egypten ,

text: Saying , Arise , and take the young child and his mother , and go into the land of Israel : for they are dead which sought the young child ' s life .
text2: Cioela , iaiquiric har itzac haourtchoa eta haren ama eta ioan adi Israeleco lurrerát , ecen haourtchoaren arimaren ondoan çabiltzanac hil içan dituc .

text: And he arose , and took the young child and his mother , and came into the land of Israel .
text2: Harc bada iratzarri eta , har citzan haourtchoa eta haren ama , eta ethor cedin Israeleco lurrera .

text: But when he heard that Archelaus did reign in Judaea in the room of his father Herod , he was afraid to go thither : notwithstanding , being warned of God in a dream , he turned aside into the parts of Galilee :
text2: Baina ençunic ecen Archelausec regnatzen çuela Iudean bere aita Herodesen lekuan , beldur cedin hara ioaitera : eta ametsetan diuinoqui aduertituric retira cedin Galileaco bazterretarát .

text: And he came and dwelt in a city called Nazareth : that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the prophets , He shall be called a Nazarene .
text2: Eta hara ethorriric habita cedin Nazareth deitzen den hirian : Prophetéz erran içan cena compli ledinçat , ecen Nazareno deithuren cela .

text: In those days came John the Baptist , preaching in the wilderness of Judaea ,
text2: Bada dembora hartan ethor cedin Ioannes baptista , predicatzen çuela Iudeaco desertuan :

text: And saying , Repent ye : for the kingdom of heaven is at hand .
text2: Eta cioela , Emenda çaitezte : ecen ceruètaco resumá hurbil da .

text: For this is he that was spoken of by the prophet Esaias , saying , The voice of one crying in the wilderness , Prepare ye the way of the Lord , make his paths straight .
text2: Ecen haur da Esaias Prophetáz erran içan cena , cioela , Desertuan oihuz dagoenaren voza da , Appain eçaçue Iaunaren bidea , çucen itzaçue haren bidescác .

text: And the same John had his raiment of camel ' s hair , and a leathern girdle about his loins ; and his meat was locusts and wild honey .
text2: Ioannes hunec bada çuen bere abillamendua camellu biloz , eta larruzco guerricoa bere guerruncean inguru : eta haren viandá cen othiz eta bassa eztiz .

text: Then went out to him Jerusalem , and all Judaea , and all the region round about Jordan ,
text2: Orduan ethor cedin harengana Ierusaleme eta Iudea gucia , eta Iordanaren inguruco comarca gucia .

text: And were baptized of him in Jordan , confessing their sins .
text2: Eta batheyatzen ciraden harenganic Iordanean , bere bekatuac confessatzen cituztela .

text: But when he saw many of the Pharisees and Sadducees come to his baptism , he said unto them , O generation of vipers , who hath warned you to flee from the wrath to come ?
text2: Ikussiric bada anhitz Phariseuetaric eta Sadduceuetaric ethorten ciradela haren baptismora , erran ciecén , Vipera castá , norc auisatu çaituzte hira ethortecoari ihes daguioçuen ?

text: Bring forth therefore fruits meet for repentance :
text2: Eguin itzaçue bada fructuac emendamenduaren digneac .

text: And think not to say within yourselves , We have Abraham to our father : for I say unto you , that God is able of these stones to raise up children unto Abraham .
text2: Eta ezteçaçuela presumi ceuroc baithan erraitera , Abraham dugu aita : ecen badiotsuet , Iaincoac harri hautaric - ere Abrahami haour suscita ahal dieçaqueola .

text: And now also the axe is laid unto the root of the trees : therefore every tree which bringeth not forth good fruit is hewn down , and cast into the fire .
text2: Bada ia aizcorá arborén errora eçarria da : beraz arbore fructu onic eguiten eztuen gucia piccatzen da eta sura egoizten .

text: I indeed baptize you with water unto repentance : but he that cometh after me is mightier than I , whose shoes I am not worthy to bear : he shall baptize you with the Holy Ghost , and with fire :
text2: Eguia da , nic batheyatzen çaituztet vrez emendamendutara : baina ene ondoan ethorten dena , ni baino borthitzago da , ceinen çapatén ekarteco ezpainaiz digne : harc batheyaturen çaituzté Spiritu sainduaz eta suz .

text: Whose fan is in his hand , and he will throughly purge his floor , and gather his wheat into the garner ; but he will burn up the chaff with unquenchable fire .
text2: Bere bahea bere escuan du , eta garbituren du bere larraina : eta bilduren du bere oguibihia granerera : baina lastoa choil erreren du behinere hiltzen ezten suan .

text: Then cometh Jesus from Galilee to Jordan unto John , to be baptized of him .
text2: Orduan ethor cedin Iesus Galileatic Iordanera Ioannesgana , harenganic batheya ledinçát .

text: But John forbad him , saying , I have need to be baptized of thee , and comest thou to me ?
text2: Baina Ioannesec haguitz empatchatzen çuen hura , cioela , Nic behar diat hireganic batheyatu , eta hi ethorten aiz enegana ?

text: And Jesus answering said unto him , Suffer it to be so now : for thus it becometh us to fulfil all righteousness . Then he suffered him .
text2: Eta ihardesten çuela Iesusec erran cieçón , Vtzac oraingotz : ecen hunela complitu behar diagu iustitia gucia . Orduan vtzi ceçan eguitera .

text: And Jesus , when he was baptized , went up straightway out of the water : and , lo , the heavens were opened unto him , and he saw the Spirit of God descending like a dove , and lighting upon him :
text2: Eta Iesus batheyatu cenean , bertan ilki cedin vretic : eta huná , irequi içan çaizcan ceruäc , eta ikus ceçan Iaincoaren Spiritua vsso columba baten guissán iausten eta haren gainera ethorten

text: And lo a voice from heaven , saying , This is my beloved Son , in whom I am well pleased .
text2: Eta huná vozbat cerutic , cioela , Haur da ene Seme maitea , ceinetan neure atseguin ona hartzen baitut .

text: Then was Jesus led up of the Spirit into the wilderness to be tempted of the devil .
text2: Orduan Iesus eraman cedin Spirituaz desertura , deabruaz tenta ledinçát .

text: And when he had fasted forty days and forty nights , he was afterward an hungred .
text2: Eta barurtu cituenean berroguey egun eta berroguey gau , finean gosse cedin .

text: And when the tempter came to him , he said , If thou be the Son of God , command that these stones be made bread .
text2: Eta ethorriric harengana tentaçaleac erran ceçan , Baldin Iaincoaren Semea bahaiz , errac harri hauc ogui eguin ditecen .

text: But he answered and said , It is written , Man shall not live by bread alone , but by every word that proceedeth out of the mouth of God .
text2: Baina harc ihardesten çuela erran ceçan , Scribatua duc , Ezta guiçona ogui beretic vicico , baina Iaincoaren ahotic ilkiten den hitz orotaric .

text: Then the devil taketh him up into the holy city , and setteth him on a pinnacle of the temple ,
text2: Orduan hura du eramaiten deabruac Ciuitate saindura , eta du eçarten templeco pinacle gainean .

text: And saith unto him , If thou be the Son of God , cast thyself down : for it is written , He shall give his angels charge concerning thee : and in their hands they shall bear thee up , lest at any time thou dash thy foot against a stone .
text2: Eta diotsó , Baldin Iaincoaren Semea bahaiz , egotzac eure buruä beherera : ecen scribatua duc , Ecen cargu emanen drauèla hiçaz bere Aingueruèy , eta bere escuetan eramanen autela , eure oinaz harrian behaztopa ezadinçát .

text: Jesus said unto him , It is written again , Thou shalt not tempt the Lord thy God .
text2: Erran cieçon Iesusec , Berriz scribatua duc , Eztuc tentaturen eure Iainco Iauna .

text: Again , the devil taketh him up into an exceeding high mountain , and sheweth him all the kingdoms of the world , and the glory of them ;
text2: Berriz hura du eramaiten deabruac gucizco mendi gora batetara , eta eracusten drautza munduco resuma guciac eta hetaco gloriá :

text: And saith unto him , All these things will I give thee , if thou wilt fall down and worship me .
text2: Eta diotsó , Hauc gucioc emanen drauzquiat , baldin ahozpez adora baneçac .

text: Then saith Jesus unto him , Get thee hence , Satan : for it is written , Thou shalt worship the Lord thy God , and him only shalt thou serve .
text2: Orduan diotsó Iesusec , Habil Satan , ecen scribatua duc : Eure Iainco Iauna adoraturen duc , eta hura bera cerbitzaturen duc .

text: Then the devil leaveth him , and , behold , angels came and ministered unto him .
text2: Orduan vtziten du hura deabruac : eta huná , Aingueruäc ethor citecen , eta cerbitzatzen çuten hura .

text: Now when Jesus had heard that John was cast into prison , he departed into Galilee ;
text2: Eta ençun vkan çuenean Iesusec , ecen Ioannes presonér cela , retira cedin Galileara .

text: And leaving Nazareth , he came and dwelt in Capernaum , which is upon the sea coast , in the borders of Zabulon and Nephthalim :
text2: Eta vtziric Nazareth , ethor cedin eta habita Capernaum itsas aldecoan , Zabulongo eta Nephthalingo bazterretan :

text: That it might be fulfilled which was spoken by Esaias the prophet , saying ,
text2: Compli ledinçát Esaias Prophetáz erran içan cena , cioela ,

text: The land of Zabulon , and the land of Nephthalim , by the way of the sea , beyond Jordan , Galilee of the Gentiles ;
text2: Zabulongo lurrá eta Nephtalingo lurrá itsassorraco bide aldean Iordanaz berce aldetic , Gentilén Galileá :

text: The people which sat in darkness saw great light ; and to them which sat in the region and shadow of death light is sprung up .
text2: Populu ilhumbean cetzanac argui handi ikussi vkan du : eta herioaren regionean eta itzalean ceunçaney argui altchatu içan çaye .

text: From that time Jesus began to preach , and to say , Repent : for the kingdom of heaven is at hand .
text2: Orduan - danic has cedin Iesus predicatzen , eta erraiten , Emenda çaitezte : ecen hurbil da ceruètaco resumá .

text: And Jesus , walking by the sea of Galilee , saw two brethren , Simon called Peter , and Andrew his brother , casting a net into the sea : for they were fishers .
text2: Eta Iesusec Galileaco itsas aldean çabilala , ikus citzan bi anaye , Simon , Pierris erraiten dena , eta Andriu haren anayea , egoizten çutela sarea itsassora ( ecen pescadore ciraden . )

text: And he saith unto them , Follow me , and I will make you fishers of men .
text2: Eta dioste , Çatozte ene ondoan , eta eguinen çaituztet guiça pescadore .

text: And they straightway left their nets , and followed him .
text2: Eta hec bertan vtziric sareac iarreiqui içan çaizcan .

text: And going on from thence , he saw other two brethren , James the son of Zebedee , and John his brother , in a ship with Zebedee their father , mending their nets ; and he called them .
text2: Eta handic aitzinago iraganic , ikus citzan berceric bi anaye , Iaques Zebedeoren semea , eta Ioannes haren anayea , vnci batetan bere aita Zebedeorequin , bere sarén adobatzen ari ciradela : eta dei citzan .

text: And they immediately left the ship and their father , and followed him .
text2: Eta hec bertan vncia eta bere aita vtziric iarreiqui içan çaizcan .

text: And Jesus went about all Galilee , teaching in their synagogues , and preaching the gospel of the kingdom , and healing all manner of sickness and all manner of disease among the people .
text2: Eta inguratzen çuen Galilea gucia Iesusec , hayén synagoguetan iracasten ari cela , eta resumaco Euangelioa predicatzen çuela , eta sendatzen çuela eritassun mota gucia , eta langore mota gucia populuaren artean .

text: And his fame went throughout all Syria : and they brought unto him all sick people that were taken with divers diseases and torments , and those which were possessed with devils , and those which were lunatick , and those that had the palsy ; and he healed them .
text2: Orduan io ceçan haren famác Syria gucia : eta presenta cietzoten gaizqui ceuden guciac , eritassun diuersez eta tormentaz eduquiac , eta demoniatuac , eta lunaticoac , eta paralyticoac : eta sendatzen cituen .

text: And there followed him great multitudes of people from Galilee , and from Decapolis , and from Jerusalem , and from Judaea , and from beyond Jordan .
text2: Eta gendetze handi iarreiqui cequión Galileatic , eta Decapolistic , eta Ierusalemetic , eta Iudeatic , eta Iordanaz berce aldetic .

text: And seeing the multitudes , he went up into a mountain : and when he was set , his disciples came unto him :
text2: Iesus bada ikussiric gendetzeac , igan cedin mendi batetara : eta iarri cenean hurbildu içan çaizcan bere discipuluac .

text: And he opened his mouth , and taught them , saying ,
text2: Eta bere ahoa irequiric iracasten cituen , erraiten çuela ,

text: Blessed are the poor in spirit : for theirs is the kingdom of heaven .
text2: Dohatsu dirade spirituz paubreac : ceren hayén baita ceruètaco resumá .

text: Blessed are they that mourn : for they shall be comforted .
text2: Dohatsu dirade nigarrez daudenac : ceren hec consolaturen baitirade .

text: Blessed are the meek : for they shall inherit the earth .
text2: Dohatsu dirade emeac : ceren hec lurra heretaturen baitute .

text: Blessed are they which do hunger and thirst after righteousness : for they shall be filled .
text2: Dohatsu dirade iustitiaz gosse eta egarri diradenac : ceren hec asseren baitirade .

text: Blessed are the merciful : for they shall obtain mercy .
text2: Dohatsu dirade misericordiosoac : ceren hæy misericordia eguinen baitzaye .

text: Blessed are the pure in heart : for they shall see God .
text2: Dohatsu dirade bihotzez chahu diradenac : ceren hec Iaincoa ikussiren baituté .

text: Blessed are the peacemakers : for they shall be called the children of God .
text2: Dohatsu dirade baquea procuratzen dutenac : ceren hec Iaincoaren haour deithuren baitirade .

text: Blessed are they which are persecuted for righteousness ' sake : for theirs is the kingdom of heaven .
text2: Dohatsu dirade iustitiagatic persecutatzen diradenac : ceren hayén baita ceruètaco resumá .

text: Blessed are ye , when men shall revile you , and persecute you , and shall say all manner of evil against you falsely , for my sake .
text2: Dohatsu içanen çarete nehorc iniuria erran drauqueçuenean , eta persecutatu çaituqueztenean , eta hitz gaichto gucia erran duqueitenean çuen contra , gueçurrez ene causaz .

text: Rejoice , and be exceeding glad : for great is your reward in heaven : for so persecuted they the prophets which were before you .
text2: Boz eta aleguera çaitezte , ceren çuen saria handi baita ceruètan : ecen hala persecutatu vkan dituzté çuen aitzineco Prophetác .

text: Ye are the salt of the earth : but if the salt have lost his savour , wherewith shall it be salted ? it is thenceforth good for nothing , but to be cast out , and to be trodden under foot of men .
text2: Çuec çarete lurreco gatza : eta baldin gatza gueçat badadi , cerçaz gacituren da ? ezta guehiagoric deusgay camporat iraizteco eta guiçonéz ohondicatu içateco baicen .

text: Ye are the light of the world . A city that is set on an hill cannot be hid .
text2: Çuec çarete munduco arguia . Ecin estal daite ciuitate mendi gainean iarria .

text: Neither do men light a candle , and put it under a bushel , but on a candlestick ; and it giveth light unto all that are in the house .
text2: Eta eztute iraichequiten candelá eta hura eçarten gaitzurupean , baina candelerean , eta argui eguiten draue etcheco guciey .

text: Let your light so shine before men , that they may see your good works , and glorify your Father which is in heaven .
text2: Hala argui begui çuen arguiac guiconén aitzinean , çuen obra onac ikus ditzatençat , eta glorifica deçaten çuen Aita ceruètan dena .

text: Think not that I am come to destroy the law , or the prophets : I am not come to destroy , but to fulfil .
text2: Eztuçuela vste ecen Leguearen edo Prophetén abolitzera ethorri naicela : eznaiz ethorri abolitzera , baina complitzera .

text: For verily I say unto you , Till heaven and earth pass , one jot or one tittle shall in no wise pass from the law , till all be fulfilled .
text2: Ecen eguiaz diotsuet , iragan daiteno ceruä eta lurra , iotabat edo punctu hutsbat ezta Leguetic iraganen , gauça guciac eguin diteno .

text: Whosoever therefore shall break one of these least commandments , and shall teach men so , he shall be called the least in the kingdom of heaven : but whosoever shall do and teach them , the same shall be called great in the kingdom of heaven .
text2: Norc - ere beraz hautsiren baitu manamendu chipién hautaric bat , eta iracatsiren baititu hunela guiçonac , chipién deithuren da hura ceruètaco resumán : baina norc - ere eguinen baititu eta iracatsiren , hura handi deithuren da ceruètaco resumán .

text: For I say unto you , That except your righteousness shall exceed the righteousness of the scribes and Pharisees , ye shall in no case enter into the kingdom of heaven .
text2: Ecen erraiten drauçuet , baldin abundosago ezpada çuen iustitiá Scribena eta Phariseuena baino , çuec etzaretela sarthuren ceruètaco resumán .

text: Ye have heard that it was said by them of old time , Thou shalt not kill ; and whosoever shall kill shall be in danger of the judgment :
text2: Ençun vkan duçue nola erraniçan içan çayen lehenagocoey , Eztuc hilen : eta norc - ere hilen baitu , hura iudicioz punitu içateco digne date .

text: But I say unto you , That whosoever is angry with his brother without a cause shall be in danger of the judgment : and whosoever shall say to his brother , Raca , shall be in danger of the council : but whosoever shall say , Thou fool , shall be in danger of hell fire .
text2: Baina nic erraiten drauçuet , ecen nor - ere asserretzen baitzayo bere anayeri causa gabe , iudicioz punitu içateco digne datela : eta norc - ere erranen baitrauca bere anayeri , Raká , hura conseilluz punitu içateco digne datela : eta norc - ere erranen baitrauca , Erhoá , suzco gehennaz punitu içateco digne datela .

text: Therefore if thou bring thy gift to the altar , and there rememberest that thy brother hath ought against thee ;
text2: Beraz baldin eure oblationea eramaiten baduc aldarera , eta han orhoit bahadi ecen hire anayeac baduela cerbait hire contra ,

text: Leave there thy gift before the altar , and go thy way ; first be reconciled to thy brother , and then come and offer thy gift .
text2: Vtzi eçac han eure oblationea aldare aitzinean , eta habil : lehen appointadi eure anayerequin , eta orduan ethorriric presenta eçac eure oblationea .

text: Agree with thine adversary quickly , whiles thou art in the way with him ; lest at any time the adversary deliver thee to the judge , and the judge deliver thee to the officer , and thou be cast into prison .
text2: Aicén adisquide eure partida contrastarequin fitetz , harequin bidean aiceno , ezemón eure partida contrastac iugeari , eta iugeac ezemón sargeantari , eta presoinean eçar ezadin .

text: Verily I say unto thee , Thou shalt by no means come out thence , till thou hast paid the uttermost farthing .
text2: Eguiaz erraiten drauat , ezaiz ilkiren handic , renda diroano azquen pelata .

text: Ye have heard that it was said by them of old time , Thou shalt not commit adultery :
text2: Ençun vkan duçue ecen lehenagocoéy erran içan çayela , Eztuc adulterioric iauquiren .

text: But I say unto you , That whosoever looketh on a woman to lust after her hath committed adultery with her already in his heart .
text2: Baina nic erraiten drauçuet , Norc - ere beguiesten baitu emazteric , hura guthicia deçançat , hambatez adulteratu duqueela harequin bere bihotzean .

text: And if thy right eye offend thee , pluck it out , and cast it from thee : for it is profitable for thee that one of thy members should perish , and not that thy whole body should be cast into hell .
text2: Bada baldin eure begui escuinac trebuca eraciten bahau , idoqui eçac hura , eta iraitzac eureganic : ecen hobe duc hiretaco , gal dadin hire membroetaric bat , eta eztadin hire gorputz gucia egotz gehennara .

text: And if thy right hand offend thee , cut if off , and cast it from thee : for it is profitable for thee that one of thy members should perish , and not that thy whole body should be cast into hell .
text2: Eta baldin eure escu escuinac trebuca eraciten bahau , trenca eçac hura , eta iraitzac eureganic : ecen hobe duc hiretaco , gal dadin hire membroetaric bat , eta eztadin hire gorputz gucia egotz gehennara .

text: It hath been said , Whosoever shall put away his wife , let him give her a writing of divorcement :
text2: Halaber erran içan da , Norc - ere vtziren baitu bere emaztea , bemó separationeco letrá :

text: But I say unto you , That whosoever shall put away his wife , saving for the cause of fornication , causeth her to commit adultery : and whosoever shall marry her that is divorced committeth adultery .
text2: Baina nic diotsuet , ecen norc - ere vtziren baitu bere emaztea , salbu paillardiçaren causaz , adulterio eguin eraciten draucala : eta nor - ere vtziarequin ezconduren baita , harc adulterio iauquiten duela .

text: Again , ye have heard that it hath been said by them of old time , Thou shalt not forswear thyself , but shalt perform unto the Lord thine oaths :
text2: Berriz ençun vkan duçue , ecen lehenagocoey erran içan çayela , Ezaiz desperiuraturen , baina rendaturen drautzac Iaunari eure iuramendu promettatuac .

text: But I say unto you , Swear not at all ; neither by heaven ; for it is God ' s throne :
text2: Baina nic diotsuet ezteçaçuen iura batre , ez ceruäz , ecen Iaincoaren thronoa da .

text: Nor by the earth ; for it is his footstool : neither by Jerusalem ; for it is the city of the great King .
text2: Ezeta Lurraz , ecen haren oinetaco alkia da : ezeta Ierusalemez , ecen regue handiaren ciuitatea da .

text: Neither shalt thou swear by thy head , because thou canst not make one hair white or black .
text2: Halaber eure buruäz eztuc iuraturen , ecen bilobat churi ezpa beltz ecin daidic .

text: But let your communication be , Yea , yea ; Nay , nay : for whatsoever is more than these cometh of evil .
text2: Baina biz çuen hitza bay , bay : ez , ez : eta hauçaz goiticoa , gaichtotic da .

text: Ye have heard that it hath been said , An eye for an eye , and a tooth for a tooth :
text2: Ençun vkan duçue , ecen erran içan dela , Beguia beguiagatic , eta hortza hortzagatic .

text: But I say unto you , That ye resist not evil : but whosoever shall smite thee on thy right cheek , turn to him the other also .
text2: Baina nic erraiten drauçuet , Eztieçoçuela resisti gaizquiari : baina baldin norbeitec io baheça eure escuineco mathelán , itzul ieçóc bercea - ere .

text: And if any man will sue thee at the law , and take away thy coat , let him have thy cloke also .
text2: Eta hiri auci eguin nahi drauanari , eta eure iaccá edequi , vtzi ieçoc mantoa - ere .

text: And whosoever shall compel thee to go a mile , go with him twain .
text2: Eta norc - ere nahi vkanen baihau bortchatu lecoa baten eguitera , albeitindoa harequin biga .

text: Give to him that asketh thee , and from him that would borrow of thee turn not thou away .
text2: Escatzen çayanari emóc : eta hireganic maillebatu nahi duena ezteçála iraitz .

text: Ye have heard that it hath been said , Thou shalt love thy neighbour , and hate thine enemy .
text2: Ençun vkan duçue ecen erran içan dela , On eritziren draucac eure hurcoari , eta gaitz eritziren draucac eure etsayari .

text: But I say unto you , Love your enemies , bless them that curse you , do good to them that hate you , and pray for them which despitefully use you , and persecute you ;
text2: Baina nic erraiten drauçuet , Onhets itzaçue çuen etsayac , benedicaitzaçue maradicatzen çaituztenac , vngui eguieçue gaitz daritzuèney : eta othoitz eguiçue oldartzen çaizquiçuenacgatic , eta persecutatzen çaituztenacgatic .

text: That ye may be the children of your Father which is in heaven : for he maketh his sun to rise on the evil and on the good , and sendeth rain on the just and on the unjust .
text2: Çuen Aita ceruètan denaren haour çaretençat : ecen harc ilki eraciten du bere iguzquia gaichtoén eta onén gainera , eta igorten du vria iustoén eta iniustoén gainera .

text: For if ye love them which love you , what reward have ye ? do not even the publicans the same ?
text2: Ecen baldin çuey on daritzueney on badarizteçue , cer sari vkanen duçue ? eztute publicanoéc - ere hori bera eguiten ?

text: And if ye salute your brethren only , what do ye more than others ? do not even the publicans so ?
text2: Eta baldin çuen anayey solament beguitharte eguiten badraueçue , cer guehiago eguiten duçue ? eztute publicanoec - ere horrela eguiten ?

text: Be ye therefore perfect , even as your Father which is in heaven is perfect .
text2: Çareten bada çuec perfect , çuen Aita ceruètan dena perfect den beçala .

text: Take heed that ye do not your alms before men , to be seen of them : otherwise ye have no reward of your Father which is in heaven .
text2: Beguirauçue çuen elemosyná eztaguiçuen guiçonén aitzinean heçaz ikus çaiteztençát : ezpere sariric eztuçue vkanen çuen Aita ceruètan dena baithan .

text: Therefore when thou doest thine alms , do not sound a trumpet before thee , as the hypocrites do in the synagogues and in the streets , that they may have glory of men . Verily I say unto you , They have their reward .
text2: Bada elemosyna eguiten duanean , ezteçála trompettá io eraci eure aitzinean , hypocritéc eguiten duten beçala synagoguetan eta carriquetan , guiçonéz estima ditecençát : eguiaz diotsuet recebitzen dutela bere saria .

text: But when thou doest alms , let not thy left hand know what thy right hand doeth :
text2: Baina hic elemosyna eguiten duanean , ezalbeilequi hire ezquerrac , cer eguiten duen hire escuinac .

text: That thine alms may be in secret : and thy Father which seeth in secret himself shall reward thee openly .
text2: Hire elemosyná secretuan dençat : eta eure Aita secretuan dacussanac , rendaturen drauc aguerrian .

text: And when thou prayest , thou shalt not be as the hypocrites are : for they love to pray standing in the synagogues and in the corners of the streets , that they may be seen of men . Verily I say unto you , They have their reward .
text2: Eta othoitz eguiten duanean , ezaicela hypocritác beçala : hæy laket ciayec congregationetan eta carrica cantoinetan çutic daudela othoitz eguitea , guiçonéz ikus ditecençat : eguiaz erraiten drauçuet ecen recebitzen dutela bere saria .

text: But thou , when thou prayest , enter into thy closet , and when thou hast shut thy door , pray to thy Father which is in secret ; and thy Father which seeth in secret shall reward thee openly .
text2: Baina othoitz eguiten duanean , sar adi eure gamberatchoan , eta eure borthá ertsiric , othoitz eguióc eure Aita secretuan denari : eta eure Aita secretuan dacussanac rendaturen drauc aguerrian .

text: But when ye pray , use not vain repetitions , as the heathen do : for they think that they shall be heard for their much speaking .
text2: Bada othoitz eguiten duçuenean , ezteçaçuela anhitz edas Paganoéc beçala : ecen vste dute bere anhitz edasteaz ençunen diradela .

text: Be not ye therefore like unto them : for your Father knoweth what things ye have need of , before ye ask him .
text2: Etzaretela beraz hetarát irudi : ecen badaqui çuen Aitac ceren behar çareten , esca çaquizquioten baino lehen .

text: After this manner therefore pray ye : Our Father which art in heaven , Hallowed be thy name .
text2: Hunela beraz çuec othoitz eguiçue , Gure Aita ceruètan aicena , sanctifica bedi hire icena :

text: Thy kingdom come . Thy will be done in earth , as it is in heaven .
text2: Ethor bedi hire resumá . Eguin bedi hire vorondatea ceruän beçala lurrean - ere .

text: Give us this day our daily bread .
text2: Gure eguneco oguia iguc egun .

text: And forgive us our debts , as we forgive our debtors .
text2: Eta quitta ietzaguc gure çorrac , nola guc - ere gure çordunéy quittatzen baitrauegu .

text: And lead us not into temptation , but deliver us from evil : For thine is the kingdom , and the power , and the glory , for ever . Amen .
text2: Eta ezgaitzála sar eraci tentationetan , baina deliura gaitzac gaichtotic . Ecen hirea duc resumá , eta puissancá , eta gloriá seculacotz . Amen .

text: For if ye forgive men their trespasses , your heavenly Father will also forgive you :
text2: Ecen baldin barka badietzeçue guiçoney bere faltác , barkaturen drauçue çuey - ere çuen Aita cerucoac .

text: But if ye forgive not men their trespasses , neither will your Father forgive your trespasses .
text2: Baina baldin barka ezpadietzeçue guiçoney bere faltác , çuen Aitac - ere eztrauzquiçue barkaturen çuen faltác .

text: Moreover when ye fast , be not , as the hypocrites , of a sad countenance : for they disfigure their faces , that they may appear unto men to fast . Verily I say unto you , They have their reward .
text2: Guehiago , barur daguiçuenean , etzaretela itchura tristetaco hypocritác beçala : ecen desguisatzen dituzté bere beguitharteac , barur diradela guiçoney agueri diradençat : eguiaz erraiten drauçuet , ecen recebitzen dutela bere saria .

text: But thou , when thou fastest , anoint thine head , and wash thy face ;
text2: Baina hic barur eguiten duanean vncta eçac eure buruä , eta ikuz eçac eure beguithartea :

text: That thou appear not unto men to fast , but unto thy Father which is in secret : and thy Father , which seeth in secret , shall reward thee openly .
text2: Guiçoney barur aicela agueri ezaquiençát , baina eure Aita secretuan denari : eta eure Aita secretuan dacussanac rendaturen drauc aguerrian .

text: Lay not up for yourselves treasures upon earth , where moth and rust doth corrupt , and where thieves break through and steal :
text2: Eztitzaçuela eguin çuen thesaurac lurrean , non cerrenac eta herdoillác goastatzen baititu , eta non ohoinéc çulhatzen eta ebaisten baitituzté .

text: But lay up for yourselves treasures in heaven , where neither moth nor rust doth corrupt , and where thieves do not break through nor steal :
text2: Baina eguin itzaçue çuen thesaurac ceruän , non ez cerrenec ez herdoillac ezpaitu goastatzen , eta non ohoinéc ezpaitute çulhatzen ez ebaisten .

text: For where your treasure is , there will your heart be also .
text2: Ecen non baita çuen thesaura , han içanen da çuen bihotza - ere .

text: The light of the body is the eye : if therefore thine eye be single , thy whole body shall be full of light .
text2: Gorputzaren arguia da beguia , beraz baldin hire beguia simple bada , hire gorputz gucia argui datec :

text: But if thine eye be evil , thy whole body shall be full of darkness . If therefore the light that is in thee be darkness , how great is that darkness !
text2: Baina baldin hire beguia gaichto bada hire gorputz gucia ilhun datec : beraz baldin hitan den arguia ilhumbe bada , ilhumbe hura cein handi date ?

text: No man can serve two masters : for either he will hate the one , and love the other ; or else he will hold to the one , and despise the other . Ye cannot serve God and mammon .
text2: Nehorc bi nabussi ecin cerbitza ditzaque : ecen edo batari gaitz eritziren drauca , eta berceari on : edo batarequin eduquiren du eta bercea menospreciaturen . Ecin cerbitza ditzaqueçue Iainçoa eta abrastassunac .

text: Therefore I say unto you , Take no thought for your life , what ye shall eat , or what ye shall drink ; nor yet for your body , what ye shall put on . Is not the life more than meat , and the body than raiment ?
text2: Halacotz erraiten drauçuet , eztuçuen artharic çuen vicitzeaz , cer ianen duçuen eta cer edanen : ezeta çuen gorputzaz , cerçaz veztituren çareten : ezta vicia viandá baino guehiago , eta abillamendua baino gorputza ?

text: Behold the fowls of the air : for they sow not , neither do they reap , nor gather into barns ; yet your heavenly Father feedeth them . Are ye not much better than they ?
text2: Confideraitzaçue ceruco choriac , ecen eztute ereiten , ez errequeitatzen , ezeta graneretara biltzen , eta çuen Aita cerucoac hatzen ditu hec : etzarete çuec anhitzez hec baino excellentago ?

text: Which of you by taking thought can add one cubit unto his stature ?
text2: Eta norc çuetaric artha vkanez eratchequi , ahal dieçaqueo bessobat bere handitassunari ?

text: And why take ye thought for raiment ? Consider the lilies of the field , how they grow ; they toil not , neither do they spin :
text2: Eta veztiduráz cergatic çarete arthatsu ? ikas eçaçue nola landaco floreac handitzen diraden : ez nekatzen dirade , ez iruten duté .

text: And yet I say unto you , That even Solomon in all his glory was not arrayed like one of these .
text2: Baina erraiten drauçuet are Salomon - ere bere gloria guciarequin eztela veztitu içan hetaric bat beçala .

text: Wherefore , if God so clothe the grass of the field , which to day is , and to morrow is cast into the oven , shall he not much more clothe you , O ye of little faith ?
text2: Bada baldin landaco egun belhar dena , eta bihar labean eçarten dena , Iaincoac hala inguru veztitzen badu : eza çuec anhitzez areago , fede chipitacoac ?

text: Therefore take no thought , saying , What shall we eat ? or , What shall we drink ? or , Wherewithal shall we be clothed ?
text2: Eztuçuela beraz artharic erraiten duçuela , Cer ianen dugu , edo cer edanen dugu , edo cerçaz veztituren gara ?

text: ( For after all these things do the Gentiles seek : ) for your heavenly Father knoweth that ye have need of all these things .
text2: ( Ecen gauça hauc guciac Paganoéc bilhatzen dituzté ) ecen badaqui çuen Aita cerucoac , ecen gauça hauen gución beharra baduçuela .

text: But seek ye first the kingdom of God , and his righteousness ; and all these things shall be added unto you .
text2: Baina bilha eçaçue lehenic Iaincoaren resumá eta haren iustitiá , eta gauça hauc guciac emanen çaizquiçue gaineraco .

text: Take therefore no thought for the morrow : for the morrow shall take thought for the things of itself . Sufficient unto the day is the evil thereof .
text2: Etzaretela bada arthatsu biharamunaz : ecen biharamunac beretaco artha vkanen du : egunac asco du bere afflictioneaz .

text: Judge not , that ye be not judged .
text2: Ezteçaçuela iudica , iudica etzaiteztençát .

text: For with what judgment ye judge , ye shall be judged : and with what measure ye mete , it shall be measured to you again .
text2: Ecen cer iugemenduz iudicaturen baituçue , iudicaturen çarete : eta cer neurriz neurthuren baituçue , aldiz neurthuren çaiçue .

text: And why beholdest thou the mote that is in thy brother ' s eye , but considerest not the beam that is in thine own eye ?
text2: Eta cergatic behatzen duc eure anayeren beguico fitsera , eta eure beguico gapirioari ezatzayo ohartzen ?

text: Or how wilt thou say to thy brother , Let me pull out the mote out of thine eye ; and , behold , a beam is in thine own eye ?
text2: Edo , nola diotsóc eure anayeri , Vztac idoqui deçadan fitsa hire beguitic , eta horrá , gapirioa hire beguian ?

text: Thou hypocrite , first cast out the beam out of thine own eye ; and then shalt thou see clearly to cast out the mote out of thy brother ' s eye .
text2: Hypocritá , idocac lehenic gapirioa eure beguitic , eta orduan behaturen duc , idoqui deçán fitsa eure anayeren beguitic .

text: Give not that which is holy unto the dogs , neither cast ye your pearls before swine , lest they trample them under their feet , and turn again and rend you .
text2: Ezteyeçuela gauça saindua orey , eta eztitzaçuela egotz , çuen perlác vrdén aitzinera : bere oinéz ohondica eztitzaten , eta itzuliric çathica etzaitzaten çuec .

text: Ask , and it shall be given you ; seek , and ye shall find ; knock , and it shall be opened unto you :
text2: Esca çaitezte eta emanen çaiçue : bilha eçaçue , eta eridenen duçue : bulka eçaçue , eta irequiren çaiçue .

text: For every one that asketh receiveth ; and he that seeketh findeth ; and to him that knocketh it shall be opened .
text2: Ecen escatzen den guciac , recebitzen du : eta bilhatzen duenac , erideiten du : eta bulkatzen duenari , irequiren çayó .

text: Or what man is there of you , whom if his son ask bread , will he give him a stone ?
text2: Ecen nor da çuetaric guiçona , baldin bere semea ogui esca badaquió , harri emanen draucana ?

text: Or if he ask a fish , will he give him a serpent ?
text2: Eta , baldin arrain esca badaquió , ala suguebat emanen drauca ?

text: If ye then , being evil , know how to give good gifts unto your children , how much more shall your Father which is in heaven give good things to them that ask him ?
text2: Beraz çuec gaichto çaretelaric baldin badaquiçue gauça onén çuen haourrey emaiten : cembatez areago çuen Aita ceruètan denac emanen drauzte gauça onac escatzen çaizquioney ?

text: Therefore all things whatsoever ye would that men should do to you , do ye even so to them : for this is the law and the prophets .
text2: Bada guiçonéc çuey eguin dietzaçuen nahi dituçuen gauça guciac , eguin ietzeçue çuec - ere hæy halaber : ecen haur da Leguea eta Prophetác .

text: Enter ye in at the strait gate : for wide is the gate , and broad is the way , that leadeth to destruction , and many there be which go in thereat :
text2: Sar çaitezte bortha herssitic : ecen bortha largoa eta bide çabala da perditionetara irioiten duena , eta anhitz dirade hartaric sartzen diradenac .

text: Because strait is the gate , and narrow is the way , which leadeth unto life , and few there be that find it .
text2: Ecen bortha herssia da eta bide herssia vicitzera eramaiten duena : eta guti dirade hura erideiten dutenac .

text: Beware of false prophets , which come to you in sheep ' s clothing , but inwardly they are ravening wolves .
text2: Beguirauçue bada propheta falsuetaric , cein ethorten baitirade çuetara ardi abiturequin : baina barnean otso harrapari dirade .

text: Ye shall know them by their fruits . Do men gather grapes of thorns , or figs of thistles ?
text2: Bere fructuetaric eçaguturen dituçue hec . Ala biltzen duté elhorrietaric mahatsic , edo karduetaric ficoric ?

text: Even so every good tree bringeth forth good fruit ; but a corrupt tree bringeth forth evil fruit .
text2: Hala arbore on guciac fructu onac eguiten ditu , eta arbore gaichtoac fructu gaichtoac eguiten ditu .

text: A good tree cannot bring forth evil fruit , neither can a corrupt tree bring forth good fruit .
text2: Arbore onac fructu gaichtoric ecin daidi , eta arbore gaichtoac fructu onic ecin daidi .

text: Every tree that bringeth not forth good fruit is hewn down , and cast into the fire .
text2: Fructu onic eguiten eztuen arbore gucia piccatzen da eta sura egoizten .

text: Wherefore by their fruits ye shall know them .
text2: Bere fructuetaric beraz eçaguturen dituçue hec .

text: Not every one that saith unto me , Lord , Lord , shall enter into the kingdom of heaven ; but he that doeth the will of my Father which is in heaven .
text2: Niri Iauna , Iauna , erraiten drautan gucia ezta sarthuren ceruètaco resumán , baina ene Aita ceruètan denaren vorondatea eguiten duena .

text: Many will say to me in that day , Lord , Lord , have we not prophesied in thy name ? and in thy name have cast out devils ? and in thy name done many wonderful works ?
text2: Anhitzec erranen draut egun hartan , Iauna , Iauna , eztugu hire icenean prophetizatu , eta eztitugu hire icenean deabruac egotzi campora , eta eztugu hire icenean verthute anhitz eguin ?

text: And then will I profess unto them , I never knew you : depart from me , ye that work iniquity .
text2: Eta orduan erranen drauet claroqui , Egundano etzaituztet eçagutu : parti çaitezte eneganic iniquitate eguiten duçuenóc .

text: Therefore whosoever heareth these sayings of mine , and doeth them , I will liken him unto a wise man , which built his house upon a rock :
text2: Norc - ere bada ençuten baititu ene hitz hauc , eta hec eguiten , hura dut comparaturen guiçon çuhur bere etchea arroca gain batetan edificatu duenarequin :

text: And the rain descended , and the floods came , and the winds blew , and beat upon that house ; and it fell not : for it was founded upon a rock .
text2: Eta erori içan da vria , eta ethorri içan dirade vr sobernác , eta eraunsi vkan duté haicéc , eta io vkan duté etchearen contra : eta ezta erori içan : ecen arroca gainean fundatua cen .

text: And every one that heareth these sayings of mine , and doeth them not , shall be likened unto a foolish man , which built his house upon the sand :
text2: Eta norc - ere ençuten baititu ene hitz hauc , eta ezpaititu eguiten , comparaturen da guiçon erho bere etchea sable gainean edificatu duenarequin .

text: And the rain descended , and the floods came , and the winds blew , and beat upon that house ; and it fell : and great was the fall of it .
text2: Eta erori içan da vria , eta ethorri içan dirade vr sobernác , eta haicéc eraunsi vkan duté , eta io vkan duté etche haren contra , eta erori içan da , eta haren deseguitea handi içan da .

text: And it came to pass , when Jesus had ended these sayings , the people were astonished at his doctrine :
text2: Eta guerta cedin propos hauc acabatu cituenean Iesusec , populua miraz baitzegoen haren doctrináz .

text: For he taught them as one having authority , and not as the scribes .
text2: Ecen iracasten cituen authoritate çuenac beçala , eta ez Scribéc beçala .

text: When he was come down from the mountain , great multitudes followed him .
text2: Eta menditic iautsi cenean gendetze handi iarreiqui cequión .

text: And , behold , there came a leper and worshipped him , saying , Lord , if thou wilt , thou canst make me clean .
text2: Eta huná , sorhayo batec ethorriric adora ceçan hura , cioela , Iauna , baldin nahi baduc , chahu ahal niroc .

text: And Jesus put forth his hand , and touched him , saying , I will ; be thou clean . And immediately his leprosy was cleansed .
text2: Eta escua hedaturic hunqui ceçan hura Iesusec , cioela , Nahi diat , aicén chahu . Eta bertan chahu cedin haren sorhayotassuna .

text: And Jesus saith unto him , See thou tell no man ; but go thy way , shew thyself to the priest , and offer the gift that Moses commanded , for a testimony unto them .
text2: Orduan diotsó Iesusec , Beguirauc nehori ezterroán : baina habil , eta eracuts ieçoc eure buruä Sacrificadoreari , eta presenta eçac Moysesec ordenatu duen oblationea , hæy testimoniagetan dençát .

text: And when Jesus was entered into Capernaum , there came unto him a centurion , beseeching him ,
text2: Eta sarthu cenean Iesus Capernaumen , ethor cedin harengana Centenerbat othoitz eguiten ceraucala ,

text: And saying , Lord , my servant lieth at home sick of the palsy , grievously tormented .
text2: Eta cioela , Iauna , ene muthilla diatzac etchean paralytico , gaizqui tormentatua .

text: And Jesus saith unto him , I will come and heal him .
text2: Eta diotsó Iesusec , Nic ethorriric sendaturen diat hura .

text: The centurion answered and said , Lord , I am not worthy that thou shouldest come under my roof : but speak the word only , and my servant shall be healed .
text2: Eta ihardesten çuela Centenerac erran ceçan , Iauna , eznauc digne ene atharbean sar adin : baina errac solament hitza , eta sendaturen baita ene muthilla .

text: For I am a man under authority , having soldiers under me : and I say to this man , Go , and he goeth ; and to another , Come , and he cometh ; and to my servant , Do this , and he doeth it .
text2: Ecen ni - ere guiçon nauc berceren meneco , ditudalaric neure azpico gendarmesac , eta erraiten diarocat huni , Oha , eta ioaiten duc : eta berceari , Athor , eta ethorten duc : eta neure cerbitzariari , Eguic haur , eta eguiten dic .

text: When Jesus heard it , he marvelled , and said to them that followed , Verily I say unto you , I have not found so great faith , no , not in Israel .
text2: Eta haur ençunic Iesusec mirets ceçan : eta dioste çarreizconey , Eguiaz erraiten drauçuet , eztudala Israelen - ere hain fede handiric eriden .

text: And I say unto you , That many shall come from the east and west , and shall sit down with Abraham , and Isaac , and Jacob , in the kingdom of heaven .
text2: Baina badiotsuet ecen anhitz Orientetic eta Occidentetic ethorriren diradela , eta iarriren diradela Abrahamequin Isaac - equin eta Iacob - equin ceruètaco resumán :

text: But the children of the kingdom shall be cast out into outer darkness : there shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth .
text2: Eta resumaco semeac egotziren diradela campoco ilhumbera : han içanen da nigar eta hortz garrascots .

text: And Jesus said unto the centurion , Go thy way ; and as thou hast believed , so be it done unto thee . And his servant was healed in the selfsame hour .
text2: Eta erran cieçón Iesusec Centenerari , Ohá eta sinhetsi duán beçala eguin bequic . Eta senda cedin haren muthilla ordu hartan berean .

text: And when Jesus was come into Peter ' s house , he saw his wife ' s mother laid , and sick of a fever .
text2: Eta Iesusec Pierrisen etchera ethorriric , ikus ceçan haren ama - guinharreba ohean cetzala , eta helgaitzac çaducala .

text: And he touched her hand , and the fever left her : and she arose , and ministered unto them .
text2: Eta hunqui ceçan haren escua , eta vtzi ceçan helgaitzac , eta iaiqui cedin , eta cerbitza citzan .

text: When the even was come , they brought unto him many that were possessed with devils : and he cast out the spirits with his word , and healed all that were sick :
text2: Eta arratsa ethorri cenean , presenta cieçoten anhitz demoniatu : eta egotz cietzen campora spirituac hitzaz , eta gaizqui ceuden guciac senda citzan :

text: That it might be fulfilled which was spoken by Esaias the prophet , saying , Himself took our infirmities , and bare our sicknesses .
text2: Compli ledinçát Esaias prophetáz erran içan cena , cioela , Harc gure langoreac hartu vkan ditu , eta gure eritassunac ekarri vkan ditu .

text: Now when Jesus saw great multitudes about him , he gave commandment to depart unto the other side .
text2: Eta ikussiric Iesusec gendetze handi bere inguruän , mana citzan discipuluac ioan litecen berce aldera .

text: And a certain scribe came , and said unto him , Master , I will follow thee whithersoever thou goest .
text2: Eta hurbilduric Scriba batec erran cieçon , Magistruá , iarreiquiren natzaic hiri , norat - ere ioanen baitaiz .

text: And Jesus saith unto him , The foxes have holes , and the birds of the air have nests ; but the Son of man hath not where to lay his head .
text2: Eta diotsó Iesusec , Aceriec çulhoac citié eta ceruco choriéc ohatzeac , baina guiçonaren Semeac eztic non bere buruä reposa deçan .

text: And another of his disciples said unto him , Lord , suffer me first to go and bury my father .
text2: Guero bere discipuluetaric , berce batec erran cieçon , Iauna , permetti ieçadac behin ioan nadin neure aitaren ohorztera .

text: But Jesus said unto him , Follow me ; and let the dead bury their dead .
text2: Eta Iesusec erran cieçon , Arreit niri , eta vzquic hilac bere hilén ohorztera .

text: And when he was entered into a ship , his disciples followed him .
text2: Eta vncian sarthu cenean iarreiqui içan çaizcan bere discipuluac .

text: And , behold , there arose a great tempest in the sea , insomuch that the ship was covered with the waves : but he was asleep .
text2: Eta huná , tormenta handibat altcha cedin itsassoan , hambat non vncia bagaz estaltzen baitzen : baina bera lo cetzan .

text: And his disciples came to him , and awoke him , saying , Lord , save us : we perish .
text2: Eta hurbilduric bere discipuluéc iratzar ceçaten , ciotela , Iauna , beguira gaitzac , galdu guihoaçac .

text: And he saith unto them , Why are ye fearful , O ye of little faith ? Then he arose , and rebuked the winds and the sea ; and there was a great calm .
text2: Eta dioste , Cergatic çarete ici fede chipitacoac ? Orduan iaiquiric mehatcha citzan haiceac eta itsassoa : eta sossagu handia eguin cedin .

text: But the men marvelled , saying , What manner of man is this , that even the winds and the sea obey him !
text2: Orduan gendéc mirets ceçaten , ciotela , Ceric da haur , non haicec - ere eta itsassoac obeditzen baitute ?

text: And when he was come to the other side into the country of the Gergesenes , there met him two possessed with devils , coming out of the tombs , exceeding fierce , so that no man might pass by that way .
text2: Eta iragan cenean berce aldera , Gergesenén regionera , aitzinera ethorri içan çaizcan bi demoniatu thumbetaric ilkiric , gucizco terribleac , hambat non nehor ecin iragan baitzaiten bide hartaríc .

text: And , behold , they cried out , saying , What have we to do with thee , Jesus , thou Son of God ? art thou come hither to torment us before the time ?
text2: Eta huná , heyagora eguin ceçaten , cioitela , Cer da gure eta hire artean , Iesus Iaincoaren Semea ? ethorri aiz huna ordu baino lehen gure tormentatzera ?

text: And there was a good way off from them an herd of many swine feeding .
text2: Eta cen hetaric vrrun vrdalde handibat alha cenic :

text: So the devils besought him , saying , If thou cast us out , suffer us to go away into the herd of swine .
text2: Eta deabruäc othoiztez çaizcan , cioitela , Baldin campora egoizten bagaituc , permetti ieçaguc vrdalde hartara ioaitera .

text: And he said unto them , Go . And when they were come out , they went into the herd of swine : and , behold , the whole herd of swine ran violently down a steep place into the sea , and perished in the waters .
text2: Eta dioste , Çoazte . Hec bada ilkiric ioan citecen vrdaldera : eta huná , vrdalde hura gucia oldar cedin garaitic behera itsassora , eta hil citecen vretan .

text: And they that kept them fled , and went their ways into the city , and told every thing , and what was befallen to the possessed of the devils .
text2: Orduan vrdainéc ihes eguin ceçaten : eta ethorriric hirira , conta citzaten gauça guciac , eta cer demoniatuey heldu içan çayen .

text: And , behold , the whole city came out to meet Jesus : and when they saw him , they besought him that he would depart out of their coasts .
text2: Eta huná , hiri gucia ilki cequión Iesusi aitzinera : eta ikussi çutenean hura , othoitz eguin cieçoten retira ledin hayen comarquetaric .

text: And he entered into a ship , and passed over , and came into his own city .
text2: Orduan sarthuric vncira iragan cedin berce aldera , eta ethor cedin bere hirira .

text: And , behold , they brought to him a man sick of the palsy , lying on a bed : and Jesus seeing their faith said unto the sick of the palsy ; Son , be of good cheer ; thy sins be forgiven thee .
text2: Eta huná , presenta cieçoten paralyticobat ohean cetzanic : eta ikussiric Iesusec hayén fedea , erran cieçón paralyticoari , Auc bihotz on , semé , barkatu çaizquic eure bekatuac .

text: And , behold , certain of the scribes said within themselves , This man blasphemeth .
text2: Eta huná , Scribetaric batzuc erraiten çuten bere baithan , Hunec blasphematzen du .

text: And Jesus knowing their thoughts said , Wherefore think ye evil in your hearts ?
text2: Eta ikussiric Iesusec hayén pensamenduac , erran ceçan , Cergatic gaichtoqui pensatzen duçue çuen bihotzetan ?

text: For whether is easier , to say , Thy sins be forgiven thee ; or to say , Arise , and walk ?
text2: Ecen cein da erratchago , erraitea , Barkatu çaizquic eure bekatuac : ala erraitea , Iaiqui adi eta ebil adi ?

text: But that ye may know that the Son of man hath power on earth to forgive sins , ( then saith he to the sick of the palsy , ) Arise , take up thy bed , and go unto thine house .
text2: Daquiçuençat bada ecen guiçonaren Semeac baduela authoritate lurrean bekatuén barkatzeco ( orduan diotsó paralyticoari ) Iaiqui adi , har eçac eure ohea , eta habil eure etcherát .

text: And he arose , and departed to his house .
text2: Orduan iaiquiric ioan cedin bere etcherát .

text: But when the multitudes saw it , they marvelled , and glorified God , which had given such power unto men .
text2: Eta gendetzéc hori ikussiric mirets ceçaten , eta glorifica ceçaten Iaincoa , ceinec eman vkan baitraue halaco authoritatea guiçoney .

text: And as Jesus passed forth from thence , he saw a man , named Matthew , sitting at the receipt of custom : and he saith unto him , Follow me . And he arose , and followed him .
text2: Eta handic iragaiten cela Iesusec ikus ceçan guiçombat peage lekuan iarria Mattheu deitzen cenic , eta diotsó , Arreit niri . Eta iaiquiric iarreiqui cequión :

text: And it came to pass , as Jesus sat at meat in the house , behold , many publicans and sinners came and sat down with him and his disciples .
text2: Eta guertha cedin Iesus haren etchean mahainean iarriric cegoela , huná , anhitz publicano eta vicitze gaichtotacoric ethorriric , iar baitzitecen mahainean Iesusequin eta haren discipuluequin .

text: And when the Pharisees saw it , they said unto his disciples , Why eateth your Master with publicans and sinners ?
text2: Eta hori ikussiric Phariseuéc erran cieçén haren discipuluey , Cergatic publicanoequin eta vicitze gaichtotacoequin iaten du çuen magistruac ?

text: But when Jesus heard that , he said unto them , They that be whole need not a physician , but they that are sick .
text2: Orduan Iesusec hori ençunic erran ciecén , Osso diradenéc eztute medicuren beharric , baina eri diradenéc .

text: But go ye and learn what that meaneth , I will have mercy , and not sacrifice : for I am not come to call the righteous , but sinners to repentance .
text2: Baina çoazte , eta ikas eçaçue cer den , Misericordia nahi dut eta ez sacrificio . Ecen eznaiz ethorri iustoén deitzera , baina bekatorén , emendamendutara .

text: Then came to him the disciples of John , saying , Why do we and the Pharisees fast oft , but thy disciples fast not ?
text2: Orduan ethor citecen harengana Ioannesen discipuluac , cioitela , Cergatic guc eta Phariseuéc barur eguiten dugu maiz , eta hire discipuluéc ezpaitute baruric eguiten ?

text: And Jesus said unto them , Can the children of the bridechamber mourn , as long as the bridegroom is with them ? but the days will come , when the bridegroom shall be taken from them , and then shall they fast .
text2: Eta erran ciecen Iesusec , Ezconduaren gamberaco gendéc doluric ekar ahal dirote , ezcondua hequin deno ? Baina ethorriren dirade egunac edequiren baitzaye ezcondua eta orduan barur eguinen baituqueite .

text: No man putteth a piece of new cloth unto an old garment , for that which is put in to fill it up taketh from the garment , and the rent is made worse .
text2: Halaber nehorc eztrauca eratchequiten oihal pedaçu latzbat abillamendu çar bati : ecen compligarri eratchequiac edequiten du abillamendutic , eta gaizquitzenago da ethendurá .

text: Neither do men put new wine into old bottles : else the bottles break , and the wine runneth out , and the bottles perish : but they put new wine into new bottles , and both are preserved .
text2: Eta eztute eçarten mahatsarno berria çahagui çarretan : ezpere lehertzen dirade çahaguiac , eta mahatsarnoa issurten , eta çahaguiac galtzen : baina mahatsarno berria çahagui berrietan eçarten duté , eta biac beguiratzen dirade .

text: While he spake these things unto them , behold , there came a certain ruler , and worshipped him , saying , My daughter is even now dead : but come and lay thy hand upon her , and she shall live .
text2: Gauça hauc hæy erraiten cerauztela , huná , iaun batec ethorriric adora ceçan hura , cioela , Ene alaba orain hil içan duc : baina ethorriric eçarrac eure escua haren gainean , eta vicico baita .

text: And Jesus arose , and followed him , and so did his disciples .
text2: Eta iaiquiric Iesus iarreiqui cequión , eta haren discipuluac .

text: And , behold , a woman , which was diseased with an issue of blood twelve years , came behind him , and touched the hem of his garment :
text2: ( Eta huná , hamabi vrthez odol iariatzez eri cen emazte batec guibeletic ethorriric hunqui ceçan haren abillamendu ezpaina .

text: For she said within herself , If I may but touch his garment , I shall be whole .
text2: Ecen erraiten çuen bere baithan , Baldin solament hunqui badeçat haren abillamendua , sendaturen naiz .

text: But Jesus turned him about , and when he saw her , he said , Daughter , be of good comfort ; thy faith hath made thee whole . And the woman was made whole from that hour .
text2: Orduan Iesusec itzuliric eta hura ikussiric erran ceçan , Aun bihotz on , alabá , eure fedeac saluatu au . Eta senda cedin emaztea ordu berean ) .

text: And when Jesus came into the ruler ' s house , and saw the minstrels and the people making a noise ,
text2: Eta Iesusec ethorriric iaun haren etchera eta ikussiric soinulariac , eta gendetzea tumultu ari cela ,

text: He said unto them , Give place : for the maid is not dead , but sleepeth . And they laughed him to scorn .
text2: Dioste , Retira çaitezte , ecen ezta hil nescatchá : baina lo datza . Eta truffatzen ciraden harçaz .

text: But when the people were put forth , he went in , and took her by the hand , and the maid arose .
text2: Eta idoqui içan cenean gendetzea , sarthuric , har ceçan haren escua : eta iaiqui cedin nescatchá .

text: And the fame hereof went abroad into all that land .
text2: Eta laster ceguian fama hunec lur hartan gucian .

text: And when Jesus departed thence , two blind men followed him , crying , and saying , Thou Son of David , have mercy on us .
text2: Eta Iesus handic iragaiten cela , iarreiqui içan çaizcan bi itsu oihuz ceudela , eta cioitela , Auc pietate guçaz , Dauid - en semeá .

text: And when he was come into the house , the blind men came to him : and Jesus saith unto them , Believe ye that I am able to do this ? They said unto him , Yea , Lord .
text2: Eta ethorri cenean etchera , ethor citecen harengana itsuoc , eta dioste Iesusec , Sinhesten duçue hori ahal daididala ? Diotsote , bay Iauna .

text: Then touched he their eyes , saying , According to your faith be it unto you .
text2: Orduan hunqui citzan hayén beguiac , cioela , Çuen fedearen araura eguin bequiçue .

text: And their eyes were opened ; and Jesus straitly charged them , saying , See that no man know it .
text2: Eta irequi citecen hayén beguiac , eta debeta citzan mehatchurequin Iesusec , cioela , Beguirauçue nehorc eztaquian .

text: But they , when they were departed , spread abroad his fame in all that country .
text2: Baina hec ilkiric barreya ceçaten haren famá herri hartan gucian .

text: As they went out , behold , they brought to him a dumb man possessed with a devil .
text2: Eta hec ilkiten ciradela , huná , presenta cieçoten guiçon mutu demoniatubat .

text: And when the devil was cast out , the dumb spake : and the multitudes marvelled , saying , It was never so seen in Israel .
text2: Eta deabrua campora egotzi içan cenean , minça cedin mutua : eta mirets ceçaten gendetzéc , cioitela , Egundano ezta aguertu hunelaco gauçaric Israelen .

text: But the Pharisees said , He casteth out devils through the prince of the devils .
text2: Baina Phariseuéc erraiten çuten , Deabruén princearen partez campora egoizten ditu deabruac .

text: And Jesus went about all the cities and villages , teaching in their synagogues , and preaching the gospel of the kingdom , and healing every sickness and every disease among the people .
text2: Eta inguratzen cituen Iesusec hiri eta burgu guciac , iracasten ari cela hayén synagoguetan , eta predicatzen çuela resumaco Euangelioa eta sendatzen çuela eritassun mota gucia eta langore mota gucia populuan .

text: But when he saw the multitudes , he was moved with compassion on them , because they fainted , and were scattered abroad , as sheep having no shepherd .
text2: Eta ikussiric Iesusec gendetzeac , compassione har ceçan heçaz , ceren baitziraden errebelatuac eta barreyatuac ardi artzainic eztutenac beçala .

text: Then saith he unto his disciples , The harvest truly is plenteous , but the labourers are few ;
text2: Orduan dioste bere discipuluey , Segur vztá handi da , baina languile guti .

text: Pray ye therefore the Lord of the harvest , that he will send forth labourers into his harvest .
text2: Othoitz eguioçue bada vzta Iabeari , irion ditzan languileac bere vztara .

text: And when he had called unto him his twelve disciples , he gave them power against unclean spirits , to cast them out , and to heal all manner of sickness and all manner of disease .
text2: Orduan bere hamabi discipuluac beregana deithuric , eman ciecen bothere spiritu satsuén contra , hayén campora egoizteco , eta eritassun mota guciaren eta langore mota guciaren sendatzeco .

text: Now the names of the twelve apostles are these ; The first , Simon , who is called Peter , and Andrew his brother ; James the son of Zebedee , and John his brother ;
text2: Bada hamabi Apostoluén icenac dirade hauc : lehena , Simon erraiten dena Pierris , eta Andriu haren anayea : Iacques Zebedeoren semea , eta Ioannes haren anayea .

text: Philip , and Bartholomew ; Thomas , and Matthew the publican ; James the son of Alphaeus , and Lebbaeus , whose surname was Thaddaeus ;
text2: Philippe eta Bartholomeo : Thomas eta Mattheu publicanoa : Iacques Alpheoren semea eta Lebeo , icen goiticoz Thaddeo .

text: Simon the Canaanite , and Judas Iscariot , who also betrayed him .
text2: Simon Cananeoa , eta Iudas Iscariot , hura traditu - ere çuena .

text: These twelve Jesus sent forth , and commanded them , saying , Go not into the way of the Gentiles , and into any city of the Samaritans enter ye not :
text2: Hamabi hauc igor citzan Iesusec , eta eman ciecén manamendu , cioela , Gentiletarát etzoaztela , eta Samaritanoén hiritan etzaiteztela sar :

text: But go rather to the lost sheep of the house of Israel .
text2: Bainaitzitic çoazte Israeleco etcheco ardi galduetara .

text: And as ye go , preach , saying , The kingdom of heaven is at hand .
text2: Bada partitu eta , predica eçaçue , erraiten duçuela , Ceruètaco resumá hurbil da .

text: Heal the sick , cleanse the lepers , raise the dead , cast out devils : freely ye have received , freely give .
text2: Eriac senda itzaçue , sorhayoac chahu itzaçue , hilac resuscita itzaçue , deabruac campora egotz itzaçue : dohainic recebitu duçue , eta dohainic emaçue .

text: Provide neither gold , nor silver , nor brass in your purses ,
text2: Eztaguiçuela prouisioneric vrrhez , ez cilharrez , ez cobrez çuen guerricoetan :

text: Nor scrip for your journey , neither two coats , neither shoes , nor yet staves : for the workman is worthy of his meat .
text2: Ezeta maletaz bidecotzát , ez birá arropaz , ez çapataz , ez vhez , ecen languilea bere viciaren digne da .

text: And into whatsoever city or town ye shall enter , inquire who in it is worthy ; and there abide till ye go thence .
text2: Eta cein - ere hiritan edo burgutan sarthuren baitzarete , informa çaitezte nor den hartan digneric , eta çaudete han parti çaitezteno .

text: And when ye come into an house , salute it .
text2: Eta cembeit etchetan sarthuren çaretenean , saluta eçaçue hura .

text: And if the house be worthy , let your peace come upon it : but if it be not worthy , let your peace return to you .
text2: Eta baldin etchea digne bada , ethor bedi çuen baquea haren gainera : baina baldin digne ezpada , çuen baquea çuetara itzul bedi .

text: And whosoever shall not receive you , nor hear your words , when ye depart out of that house or city , shake off the dust of your feet .
text2: Eta norc - ere recebituren ezpaitzaituzte , eta ez çuen hitzey behaturen , etche edo hiri hartaric ilkitean iharros albeitzineçate çuen oinetaco errhautsa .

text: Verily I say unto you , It shall be more tolerable for the land of Sodom and Gomorrha in the day of judgment , than for that city .
text2: Eguiaz erraiten drauçuet , emequiago tractaturen diradela Sodomaco eta Gomorrhaco lurrecoac iudicioco egunean , ecen ez hiri hura .

text: Behold , I send you forth as sheep in the midst of wolves : be ye therefore wise as serpents , and harmless as doves .
text2: Huná , nic igorten çaituztet çuec , ardiac otsoén artera beçala : çareten bada çuhur sugueac beçala , eta simple vsso columbác beçala .

text: But beware of men : for they will deliver you up to the councils , and they will scourge you in their synagogues ;
text2: Eta beguira çaitezte guiçonetaric : ecen liuraturen çaituzte consistorioetara , eta bere synagoguetan açotaturen çaituzte .

text: And ye shall be brought before governors and kings for my sake , for a testimony against them and the Gentiles .
text2: Eta gobernadoretara eta reguetara eramanen çarete ene causaz , hec eta Gentiléc testimoniage haur dutençat .

text: But when they deliver you up , take no thought how or what ye shall speak : for it shall be given you in that same hour what ye shall speak .
text2: Baina liura çaiteztenean , eztuçuela artharic nola edo cer minçaturen çareten : ecen ordu hartan berean emanen çaiçue cer minça çaitezqueten .

text: For it is not ye that speak , but the Spirit of your Father which speaketh in you .
text2: Ecen etzarete çuec minço çaretenac , baina çuen Aitaren Spiritu çuetan minço dena .

text: And the brother shall deliver up the brother to death , and the father the child : and the children shall rise up against their parents , and cause them to be put to death .
text2: Eta liuraturen du anayeac anayea heriotara , eta aitác haourra : eta altchaturen dirade haourrac aita - amén contra , eta hil eraciren dituzté .

text: And ye shall be hated of all men for my name ' s sake : but he that endureth to the end shall be saved .
text2: Eta guciéz gaitzetsiac içanen çarete , ene icenagatic : baina norc - ere perseueraturen baitu finerano hura saluaturen da .

text: But when they persecute you in this city , flee ye into another : for verily I say unto you , Ye shall not have gone over the cities of Israel , till the Son of man be come .
text2: Eta persecutaturen çaituztenean hiri hartan , ihes eguiçue berce batetara : ecen eguiaz erraiten drauçuet , eztituçue inguraturen Israeleco hiri guciac , non ethor eztadin guiçonaren Semea .

text: The disciple is not above his master , nor the servant above his lord .
text2: Ezta discipulua magistruaren gaineco , ezeta cerbitzaria bere iaunaren gaineco .

text: It is enough for the disciple that he be as his master , and the servant as his lord . If they have called the master of the house Beelzebub , how much more shall they call them of his household ?
text2: Asco du discipuluac bere magistrua beçala den : eta cerbitzariac , bere iauna beçala : baldin Aitafamiliá bera Beelzebub deithu baduté , cembatez guehiago haren domesticoac ?

text: Fear them not therefore : for there is nothing covered , that shall not be revealed ; and hid , that shall not be known .
text2: Etzaretela beraz hayén beldur : ecen ezta deus estaliric aguerturen eztenic , ezeta deus secreturic iaquinen eztenic .

text: What I tell you in darkness , that speak ye in light : and what ye hear in the ear , that preach ye upon the housetops .
text2: Ilhumbean erraiten drauçuedana , erraçue arguian : eta beharrira ençuten duçuena , predica eçaçue etche gainetan .

text: And fear not them which kill the body , but are not able to kill the soul : but rather fear him which is able to destroy both soul and body in hell .
text2: Eta etzaretela beldur gorputza hiltzen dutenén , eta arimá ecin hil deçaquetenen : bainaitzitic çareten beldur arimá eta gorputza gehennán gal ahal ditzaquenaren .

text: Are not two sparrows sold for a farthing ? and one of them shall not fall on the ground without your Father .
text2: Bi parra - chori eztirade dirutcho batetan saltzen ? eta hetaric bat ezta lurrera eroriren , çuen Aita gabe .

text: But the very hairs of your head are all numbered .
text2: Etare çuen buruco bilo guciac contatuac dirade .

text: Fear ye not therefore , ye are of more value than many sparrows .
text2: Etzaretela beraz beldur : parra - choriéc baino çuec guehiago valio duçue .
