text: Whosoever therefore shall confess me before men , him will I confess also before my Father which is in heaven .
text2: Bada norc - ere aboaturen bainau guiçonén aitzinean , aboaturen dut nic - ere hura ene Aita ceruètan denaren aitzinean .

text: But whosoever shall deny me before men , him will I also deny before my Father which is in heaven .
text2: Baina norc - ere vkaturen bainau guiçonén aitzinean , vkaturen dut nic - ere hura ene Aita ceruètan denaren aitzinean .

text: Think not that I am come to send peace on earth : I came not to send peace , but a sword .
text2: Eztuçuela vste ecen baquearen eçartera , ethorri naicela lurrera : eznaiz ethorri baquearen eçartera , baina ezpataren .

text: For I am come to set a man at variance against his father , and the daughter against her mother , and the daughter in law against her mother in law .
text2: Ecen ethorri naiz guiçonaren bere aitaren contra gudutan eçartera , eta alabáren bere amaren contra , eta errenaren bere ama - guinharrebaren contra .

text: And a man ' s foes shall be they of his own household .
text2: Eta guiçonaren etsay beraren domesticoac içanen dirade .

text: He that loveth father or mother more than me is not worthy of me : and he that loveth son or daughter more than me is not worthy of me .
text2: Aita edo ama ni baino maiteago duena , ezta ene digne : eta semea edo alabá ni baino maiteago duena , ezta ene digne .

text: And he that taketh not his cross , and followeth after me , is not worthy of me .
text2: Eta bere crutzea hartzen eztuena , eta niri ondotic eztarreitana , ezta ene digne .

text: He that findeth his life shall lose it : and he that loseth his life for my sake shall find it .
text2: Bere vicia beguiraturen duenac , galduren du hura : eta bere vicia galduren duenac ene causaz , beguiraturen du hura .

text: He that receiveth you receiveth me , and he that receiveth me receiveth him that sent me .
text2: Çuec recebitzen çaituztenac , ni recebitzen nau : eta ni recebitzen nauenac , ni igorri nauena recebitzen du .

text: He that receiveth a prophet in the name of a prophet shall receive a prophet ' s reward ; and he that receiveth a righteous man in the name of a righteous man shall receive a righteous man ' s reward .
text2: Prophetaren icenean Prophetabat recebitzen duenac , Prophetaren saria recebituren du : eta iustoaren icenean iustobat recebitzen duenac , iustoren saria recebituren du .

text: And whosoever shall give to drink unto one of these little ones a cup of cold water only in the name of a disciple , verily I say unto you , he shall in no wise lose his reward .
text2: Eta norc - ere edatera emanen baitrauca beirebat vr hotz huts chipi hautaric bati discipuluren icenean : eguiaz diotsuet , eztuela bere saria galduren .

text: And it came to pass , when Jesus had made an end of commanding his twelve disciples , he departed thence to teach and to preach in their cities .
text2: Guero guertha cedin Iesusec bere hamabi discipuluey manamendu emaitea acabatu çuenean , parti baitzedin handic iracats eta predica leçançat hayén hirietan .

text: Now when John had heard in the prison the works of Christ , he sent two of his disciples ,
text2: Eta Ioannesec presoindeguian ençunic Christen obrác , igorriric bere discipuluetaric biga ,

text: And said unto him , Art thou he that should come , or do we look for another ?
text2: Erran cieçon , Hi aiz ethorteco cen hura , ala berce baten beguira gaude ?

text: Jesus answered and said unto them , Go and shew John again those things which ye do hear and see :
text2: Eta ihardesten çuela Iesusec erran ciecén , Çoazte eta conta ietzoçue Ioannesi , ençuten eta ikusten dituçuen gauçác :

text: The blind receive their sight , and the lame walk , the lepers are cleansed , and the deaf hear , the dead are raised up , and the poor have the gospel preached to them .
text2: Itsuéc ikustea recrubatzen duté , eta mainguäc badabiltza , sorhayoac chahutzen dirade , eta gorréc ençuten duté , hilac resuscitatzen dirade , eta Euangelioa paubrey denuntiatzen çaye .

text: And blessed is he , whosoever shall not be offended in me .
text2: Eta dohatsu da scandalizaturen eztena nitan .

text: And as they departed , Jesus began to say unto the multitudes concerning John , What went ye out into the wilderness to see ? A reed shaken with the wind ?
text2: Eta hec ioaiten ciraden beçala , has cedin Iesus erraiten populuari Ioannesez , Ceren ikustera ilki içan çarete desertura ? haiceaz erabilten den canabera baten ?

text: But what went ye out for to see ? A man clothed in soft raiment ? behold , they that wear soft clothing are in kings ' houses .
text2: Baina ceren ikustera ilki içan çarete ? guiçon abillamendu preciosoz veztitu baten ? huná , abillamendu preciosoac ekarten dituztenac , reguén etchetan dirade .

text: But what went ye out for to see ? A prophet ? yea , I say unto you , and more than a prophet .
text2: Baina ceren ikustera ilki içan çarete ? Propheta baten ? bay diotsuet eta Propheta bainoagoaren .

text: For this is he , of whom it is written , Behold , I send my messenger before thy face , which shall prepare thy way before thee .
text2: Ecen haur da ceinez scribatua baita , Huná , nic igorten diat neure mandataria hire beguitharte aitzinean , ceinec hire bidea appainduren baitu hire aitzinean .

text: Verily I say unto you , Among them that are born of women there hath not risen a greater than John the Baptist : notwithstanding he that is least in the kingdom of heaven is greater than he .
text2: Eguiaz erraiten drauçuet , ezta ilki emaztetaric iayo diradenén artean nehor , Ioannes Baptista baino handiagoric : guciagatic - ere ceruètaco resumaco chipiena hura baino handiago da .

text: And from the days of John the Baptist until now the kingdom of heaven suffereth violence , and the violent take it by force .
text2: Eta Ioannes Baptistaren egunetaric oraindrano , ceruètaco resumari bortha eguiten çayo , eta keichuéc harrapatzen dute hura .

text: For all the prophets and the law prophesied until John .
text2: Ecen Propheta guciéc eta Legueac Ioannesganano prophetizatu vkan duté .

text: And if ye will receive it , this is Elias , which was for to come .
text2: Eta , baldin nahi baduçue recebitu , haur da Elias ethorteco cena .

text: He that hath ears to hear , let him hear .
text2: Ençuteco beharriric duenac , ençun beça .

text: But whereunto shall I liken this generation ? It is like unto children sitting in the markets , and calling unto their fellows ,
text2: Baina norequin comparaturen dut generatione haur ? Merkatuan iarriric dauden , eta bere laguney oihuz dagozten haourtchoac beçalaco da ,

text: And saying , We have piped unto you , and ye have not danced ; we have mourned unto you , and ye have not lamented .
text2: Ceinéc baitioite , Chirula soinu eguin drauçuegu , eta etzarete dançatu : eressiz cantatu drauçuegu , eta eztuçue deithoreric eguin .

text: For John came neither eating nor drinking , and they say , He hath a devil .
text2: Ecen ethorri da Ioannes iaten ez edaten eztuela , eta erraiten duté , Deabrua du .

text: The Son of man came eating and drinking , and they say , Behold a man gluttonous , and a winebibber , a friend of publicans and sinners . But wisdom is justified of her children .
text2: Ethorri da guiçonaren Semea iaten eta edaten duela , eta dioite , Horra , guiçon gormanta eta hordia , publicanoén eta vicitze gaichtotacoén adisquidea . Baina iustificatu içan da sapientiá bere haourréz .

text: Then began he to upbraid the cities wherein most of his mighty works were done , because they repented not :
text2: Orduan has cequién hunela reprochatzen haren verthuteric anhitz eguin içan cen hiriey , ceren emendatu etziraden :

text: Woe unto thee , Chorazin ! woe unto thee , Bethsaida ! for if the mighty works , which were done in you , had been done in Tyre and Sidon , they would have repented long ago in sackcloth and ashes .
text2: Maledictione hiri Corazin , maledictione hiri Bethsaida : ecen baldin Tyren eta Sidonen eguin içan balirade çuec baithan eguin içan diraden verthuteac , aspaldi çacurequin eta hautsequin emendatu ciratequeen .

text: But I say unto you , It shall be more tolerable for Tyre and Sidon at the day of judgment , than for you .
text2: Etare diotsuet , Tyr eta Sidon iudicioco egunean çuec baino emequiago tractatuac içanen diradela .

text: And thou , Capernaum , which art exalted unto heaven , shalt be brought down to hell : for if the mighty works , which have been done in thee , had been done in Sodom , it would have remained until this day .
text2: Eta hi Capernaum cerurano altchatu içan aicena iffernurano beheraturen aiz : ecen baldin Sodoman eguin içan balirade hi baithan eguin içan diraden verthuteac , egungo egunerano egon çateán .

text: But I say unto you , That it shall be more tolerable for the land of Sodom in the day of judgment , than for thee .
text2: Etare badiotsuet , ecen Sodomacoac hi baino emequiago tractatuac içanen diradela iudicioco egunean .

text: At that time Jesus answered and said , I thank thee , O Father , Lord of heaven and earth , because thou hast hid these things from the wise and prudent , and hast revealed them unto babes .
text2: Dembora hartan ihardesten çuela Iesusec erran ceçan , Aitá , ceruco eta lurreco Iauná , esquerrac rendatzen drauzquiát , ceren estali baitrauztec gauça hauc çuhurréy eta adituey , eta manifestatu baitrauztec haour chipiey .

text: Even so , Father : for so it seemed good in thy sight .
text2: Bay Aitá , ceren hala içan baita hire placer ona .

text: All things are delivered unto me of my Father : and no man knoweth the Son , but the Father ; neither knoweth any man the Father , save the Son , and he to whomsoever the Son will reveal him .
text2: Gauça guciac niri neure Aitaz eman çaizquit : eta nehorc eztu eçagutzen Semea Aitác baicen : ezeta Aita nehorc eztu eçagutzen Semeac baicen , eta nori - ere Semeac manifestatu nahi vkanen baitrauca .

text: Come unto me , all ye that labour and are heavy laden , and I will give you rest .
text2: Çatozte enegana fatigatuac eta cargatuac çareten guciác , eta nic paussu emanen drauçuet çuey .

text: Take my yoke upon you , and learn of me ; for I am meek and lowly in heart : and ye shall find rest unto your souls .
text2: Har eçaçue ene vztarria çuen gainera , eta ikas eçaçue eneganic ecen eme naicela eta bihotzez humil : eta çuen arimençát paussu eridenen duçue .

text: For my yoke is easy , and my burden is light .
text2: Ecen ene vztarria aisit da , eta ene cargá arin .

text: At that time Jesus went on the sabbath day through the corn ; and his disciples were an hungred , and began to pluck the ears of corn , and to eat .
text2: Dembora hartan ioaiten cen Iesus ereincetan gaindi Sabbath egun batez : eta haren discipuluac ciraden gosse , eta has citecen buruca idoquiten , eta iaten .

text: But when the Pharisees saw it , they said unto him , Behold , thy disciples do that which is not lawful to do upon the sabbath day .
text2: Eta Phariseuec ikussiric erran cieçoten , Horrá , hire discipuluéc eguiten dié Sabbathoan eguin sori eztena .

text: But he said unto them , Have ye not read what David did , when he was an hungred , and they that were with him ;
text2: Baina harc erran ciecén , Eztuçue iracurri Dauid - ec gossez eguin çuena eta harequin ciradenec ?

text: How he entered into the house of God , and did eat the shewbread , which was not lawful for him to eat , neither for them which were with him , but only for the priests ?
text2: Nola sarthu içan cen Iaincoaren etchean , eta propositionezco oguiac ian cituen : hetaric iatea ez haren , ez harequin ciradenén , Sacrificadorén baicen sori etzelaric ?

text: Or have ye not read in the law , how that on the sabbath days the priests in the temple profane the sabbath , and are blameless ?
text2: Edo eztuçue iracurri Leguean , nola Sabbath egunetan Sacrificadoréc templean Sabbath eguna hausten dutén , eta hoguen - gabe diraden ?

text: But I say unto you , That in this place is one greater than the temple .
text2: Bada erraiten drauçuet , ecen templea baino handiagobat hemen dela .

text: But if ye had known what this meaneth , I will have mercy , and not sacrifice , ye would not have condemned the guiltless .
text2: Eta baldin bacinaquite cer den , Misericordia nahi dut eta ez sacrificio , etzintuquezten condemnatu hoguen - gabeac .

text: For the Son of man is Lord even of the sabbath day .
text2: Ecen Sabbathoaren - ere Iaun da guiçonaren Semea .

text: And when he was departed thence , he went into their synagogue :
text2: Eta handic partituric hayén synagogara ethor cedin .

text: And , behold , there was a man which had his hand withered . And they asked him , saying , Is it lawful to heal on the sabbath days ? that they might accuse him .
text2: Eta huná , cen han guiçombat escua eyhar çuenic : eta interroga ceçaten , ciotela , Sori da Sabbath egunean sendatzea ? haur cioiten , hura accusa leçatençat .

text: And he said unto them , What man shall there be among you , that shall have one sheep , and if it fall into a pit on the sabbath day , will he not lay hold on it , and lift it out ?
text2: Eta harc erran ciecén , Nor içanen da çuetaric guiçona , ardibat duenic : eta , baldin hura Sabbathoan lecera eror badadi , harturen eta altchaturen eztuena ?

text: How much then is a man better than a sheep ? Wherefore it is lawful to do well on the sabbath days .
text2: Eta cembatez da guiçona ardia baino guehiago ? Beraz sori da Sabbathoetan vngui eguitea .

text: Then saith he to the man , Stretch forth thine hand . And he stretched it forth ; and it was restored whole , like as the other .
text2: Orduan diotsó guiçon hari , Heda eçac eure escua . Eta heda ceçan , eta bercea beçain senda cedin .

text: Then the Pharisees went out , and held a council against him , how they might destroy him .
text2: Eta Phariseuéc ilkiric har ceçaten conseillu , haren contra , nolatan hura hil leçaqueten .

text: But when Jesus knew it , he withdrew himself from thence : and great multitudes followed him , and he healed them all ;
text2: Baina Iesusec hori eçaguturic leku eguin ceçan handic : eta iarreiqui cequión gendalde handia , eta hec guciac senda citzan .

text: And charged them that they should not make him known :
text2: Eta mehatchurequin debeta citzan ezleçaten manifesta .

text: That it might be fulfilled which was spoken by Esaias the prophet , saying ,
text2: Compli ledinçát Esaias prophetáz erran içan cena , cioela ,

text: Behold my servant , whom I have chosen ; my beloved , in whom my soul is well pleased : I will put my spirit upon him , and he shall shew judgment to the Gentiles .
text2: Huná , ene cerbitzari elegitu dudana , ene maitea , ceinetan hartzen baitu bere atseguin ona ene arimác : eçarriren dut neure Spiritua haren gainean , eta iugemendu Gentiley predicaturen draue .

text: He shall not strive , nor cry ; neither shall any man hear his voice in the streets .
text2: Eztu iharduquiren , ezeta oihuric eguinen , eta nehorc eztu carriquetan haren voza ençunen .

text: A bruised reed shall he not break , and smoking flax shall he not quench , till he send forth judgment unto victory .
text2: Canabera çarthatua eztu chehaturen , eta kea darión lihoa eztu iraunguiren : iugemendua victoriatan ilki eraci diroeno .

text: And in his name shall the Gentiles trust .
text2: Eta haren icenean Gentiléc sperança vkanen dute .

text: Then was brought unto him one possessed with a devil , blind , and dumb : and he healed him , insomuch that the blind and dumb both spake and saw .
text2: Orduan presentatu içan çayó demoniatu itsu eta mutubat : eta senda ceçan hura , halaco maneraz non itsu eta mutu cena minço baitzen eta ikusten baitzuen .

text: And all the people were amazed , and said , Is not this the son of David ?
text2: Eta spanta cedin populu gucia , eta erraiten çuen , Ezta haur Dauid - en semea ?

text: But when the Pharisees heard it , they said , This fellow doth not cast out devils , but by Beelzebub the prince of the devils .
text2: Baina Phariseuéc hori ençunic , erraiten çuten : Hunec eztitu deabruac campora egoizten Beelzebub deabruén princearen partez baicen .

text: And Jesus knew their thoughts , and said unto them , Every kingdom divided against itself is brought to desolation ; and every city or house divided against itself shall not stand :
text2: Baina Iesusec eçaguturic hayén pensamenduac , erran ciecén , Bere contra partitua den resuma gucia , deseguinen da : eta bere contra partitua den hiric edo etchec , eztu iraunen .

text: And if Satan cast out Satan , he is divided against himself ; how shall then his kingdom stand ?
text2: Eta baldin Satanec Satan campora egoizten badu , bere contra partitua da : nolatan beraz iraunen du haren resumác ?

text: And if I by Beelzebub cast out devils , by whom do your children cast them out ? therefore they shall be your judges .
text2: Eta baldin nic Beelzebub - en partez campora egoizten baditut deabruac , çuen seméc noren partez campora egoizten dituzte ? Halacotz hec çuen iuge içanen dirade .

text: But if I cast out devils by the Spirit of God , then the kingdom of God is come unto you .
text2: Baina baldin nic Iaincoaren Spirituaz campora egoizten baditut deabruac , beraz ethorri da çuetara Iaincoaren resumá .

text: Or else how can one enter into a strong man ' s house , and spoil his goods , except he first bind the strong man ? and then he will spoil his house .
text2: Ezpa nolatan nehor sar ahal daite borthitz baten etchera , eta haren ostillamendua pilla , baldin lehen esteca ezpadeça borthitza ? eta orduan haren etchea pillaturen duque .

text: He that is not with me is against me ; and he that gathereth not with me scattereth abroad .
text2: Enequin eztena ene contra da , eta enequin biltzen ari eztena barreyatzen ari da .

text: Wherefore I say unto you , All manner of sin and blasphemy shall be forgiven unto men : but the blasphemy against the Holy Ghost shall not be forgiven unto men .
text2: Halacotz erraiten drauçuet , bekatu eta blasphemio gucia barkaturen çaye guiçoney : baina Spirituaren contretaco blasphemioa barkaturen etzaye guiçoney .

text: And whosoever speaketh a word against the Son of man , it shall be forgiven him : but whosoever speaketh against the Holy Ghost , it shall not be forgiven him , neither in this world , neither in the world to come .
text2: Eta nor - ere minçaturen baita guiçonaren Semearen contra , barkaturen çayo hari : baina nor - ere minçaturen baita Spiritu sainduaren contra , etzayo barkaturen hari ez secula hunetan , ez ethorteco denean :

text: Either make the tree good , and his fruit good ; or else make the tree corrupt , and his fruit corrupt : for the tree is known by his fruit .
text2: Edo eguiçue arbore ona , eta haren fructua on : edo eguiçue arbore vstela , eta haren fructua vstel : ecen fructutic arborea eçagutzen da .

text: O generation of vipers , how can ye , being evil , speak good things ? for out of the abundance of the heart the mouth speaketh .
text2: Viperén castá , nolatan vngui minça ahal çaitezquete gaichto çaretelaric ? ecen bihotzeco abundantiatic ahoa minço da .

text: A good man out of the good treasure of the heart bringeth forth good things : and an evil man out of the evil treasure bringeth forth evil things .
text2: Guiçon onac bihotzeco thesaur onetic idoquiten ditu gauça onac : eta guiçon gaichtoac thesaur gaichtotic idoquiten ditu gauça gaichtoac .

text: But I say unto you , That every idle word that men shall speak , they shall give account thereof in the day of judgment .
text2: Baina badiotsuet , eçen guiçonéc erran duqueiten hitz alfer guciaz , contu rendaturen dutela iudicioco egunean .

text: For by thy words thou shalt be justified , and by thy words thou shalt be condemned .
text2: Ecen eure hitzetaric iustificaturen aiz , eta eure hitzetaric condemnaturen aiz .

text: Then certain of the scribes and of the Pharisees answered , saying , Master , we would see a sign from thee .
text2: Orduan ihardets ceçaten Scribetaric eta Phariseuetaric batzuc , cioitela , Magistruá , nahi guendiquec hireganic cembeit signo ikussi .

text: But he answered and said unto them , An evil and adulterous generation seeketh after a sign ; and there shall no sign be given to it , but the sign of the prophet Jonas :
text2: Baina harc ihardesten çuela erran ciecén , Natione gaichtoa eta adulteroa signo esquez dago : baina signoric etzayo emanen , Ionas prophetaren signoa baicen .

text: For as Jonas was three days and three nights in the whale ' s belly ; so shall the Son of man be three days and three nights in the heart of the earth .
text2: Ecen hala nola Ionas balenaren sabelean hirur egun eta hirur gau içan baitzén : hala içanen da guiçonaren Semea lurraren bihotzean , hirur egun eta hirur gau .

text: The men of Nineveh shall rise in judgment with this generation , and shall condemn it : because they repented at the preaching of Jonas ; and , behold , a greater than Jonas is here .
text2: Niniuaco guiçonac iaiquiren dirade iudicioan natione hunequin , eta condemnaturen dute haur : ceren hec emendatu baitziraden Ionasen predicationera , eta huna , Ionas bainoagoa hemen .

text: The queen of the south shall rise up in the judgment with this generation , and shall condemn it : for she came from the uttermost parts of the earth to hear the wisdom of Solomon ; and , behold , a greater than Solomon is here .
text2: Egu - erdico reguiná iaiquiren da iudicioan natione hunequin , eta harc condemnaturen du haur : ceren ethor baitzedin lurraren bazterretic Salomonen sapientiaren ençutera , eta huná , Salomon bainoagoa hemen .

text: When the unclean spirit is gone out of a man , he walketh through dry places , seeking rest , and findeth none .
text2: Bada spiritu satsua ilki denean guiçonaganic , leku leihorréz dabila , paussu bilha , eta eztu erideiten .

text: Then he saith , I will return into my house from whence I came out ; and when he is come , he findeth it empty , swept , and garnished .
text2: Orduan erraiten du , Itzuliren naiz neure ilki naicen etchera . Eta ethorri denean , erideiten du hutsa , escobaturic eta appainduric .

text: Then goeth he , and taketh with himself seven other spirits more wicked than himself , and they enter in and dwell there : and the last state of that man is worse than the first . Even so shall it be also unto this wicked generation .
text2: Orduan ioaiten da , eta hartzen ditu berequin berceric çazpi spiritu bera baino gaichtoagoac , eta sarthuric habitatzen dirade han , eta guiçon haren fina hatsea baino gaichtoago da : hala natione gaichto huni - ere helduren çayó .

text: While he yet talked to the people , behold , his mother and his brethren stood without , desiring to speak with him .
text2: Eta hura oraino populuari minço çayola , huná , haren ama eta anayeac ceuden lekorean , harequin minçatu nahiz .

text: Then one said unto him , Behold , thy mother and thy brethren stand without , desiring to speak with thee .
text2: Eta cembeitec erran cieçón , Hará , hire ama eta hire anayeac lekorean diaudec , hirequin minçatu nahiz .

text: But he answered and said unto him that told him , Who is my mother ? and who are my brethren ?
text2: Baina harc ihardesten çuela erran cieçón hura erran cionari , Nor da ene ama , eta nor dirade ene anayeac ?

text: And he stretched forth his hand toward his disciples , and said , Behold my mother and my brethren !
text2: Eta hedaturic bere escua bere discipuluén gainera , erran ceçan , Huná ene ama eta ene anayeac .

text: For whosoever shall do the will of my Father which is in heaven , the same is my brother , and sister , and mother .
text2: Ecen norc - ere eguinen baitu ene Aita ceruètan denaren vorondatea , hura da ene anaye , eta arreba , eta ama .

text: The same day went Jesus out of the house , and sat by the sea side .
text2: Egun hartan berean Iesus etchetic ilkiric , iar cedin itsas costán .

text: And great multitudes were gathered together unto him , so that he went into a ship , and sat ; and the whole multitude stood on the shore .
text2: Eta bil cedin harengana gendetze anhitz , hambat non vnci batetara sarthuric iar baitzedin : eta gendetze gucia itsas costán cegoen .

text: And he spake many things unto them in parables , saying , Behold , a sower went forth to sow ;
text2: Eta erran cieçén anhitz gauça comparationez , cioela , Huná , ereillebat ilki cedin ereitera .

text: And when he sowed , some seeds fell by the way side , and the fowls came and devoured them up :
text2: Eta ereitean hacitic batzu eror citecen bide bazterrera : eta choriac ethorri içan dirade , eta iretsi vkan dituzte hec .

text: Some fell upon stony places , where they had not much earth : and forthwith they sprung up , because they had no deepness of earth :
text2: Eta batzu erori içan dirade leku harriçuetara , non ezpaitzuten heuragui lurric : eta bertan ilki citecen , ceren ezpaitzuten lur barneric .

text: And when the sun was up , they were scorched ; and because they had no root , they withered away .
text2: Guero iguzquia goratu eta , erre içan dirade , eta ceren ezpaitzuten erroric , eyarthu içan dirade .

text: And some fell among thorns ; and the thorns sprung up , and choked them :
text2: Eta batzu erori içan dirade elhorri artera : eta handitu içan dirade elhorriac , eta itho vkan dituzte hec .

text: But other fell into good ground , and brought forth fruit , some an hundredfold , some sixtyfold , some thirtyfold .
text2: Eta batzu erori içan dirade lur onera : eta fructu renda ceçaten , batac ehun , berceac hiruroguey , eta berceac hoguey eta hamar .

text: Who hath ears to hear , let him hear .
text2: Ençuteco beharriric duenac , ençun beça .

text: And the disciples came , and said unto him , Why speakest thou unto them in parables ?
text2: Orduan hurbilduric discipuluéc erran cieçoten , Cergatic comparationez minço atzaye ?

text: He answered and said unto them , Because it is given unto you to know the mysteries of the kingdom of heaven , but to them it is not given .
text2: Eta harc ihardesten çuela , erran ciecén , Ceren çuey eman baitzaiçue ceruètaco resumaco secretuén eçagutzea , baina hæy etzaye eman .

text: For whosoever hath , to him shall be given , and he shall have more abundance : but whosoever hath not , from him shall be taken away even that he hath .
text2: Ecen norc - ere baitu , hari emanen çayó , eta hambatez guehiago vkanen du : baina norc - ere ezpaitu , hari duena - ere edequiren çayó .

text: Therefore speak I to them in parables : because they seeing see not ; and hearing they hear not , neither do they understand .
text2: Halacotz comparationez minço natzaye : ceren dacussatelaric ezpaitute ikusten , eta ençuten dutelaric ezpaitute ençuten , ez aditzen .

text: And in them is fulfilled the prophecy of Esaias , which saith , By hearing ye shall hear , and shall not understand ; and seeing ye shall see , and shall not perceive :
text2: Hala complitzen da hetan Esaiasen prophetiá , ceinec baitio , Ençutez ençunen duçue , eta ez adituren : eta dacussaçuela ikussiren duçue eta etzaizquiote oharturen .

text: For this people ' s heart is waxed gross , and their ears are dull of hearing , and their eyes they have closed ; lest at any time they should see with their eyes , and hear with their ears , and should understand with their heart , and should be converted , and I should heal them .
text2: Ecen guicendua da populu hunen bihotza , eta beharriéz gogorqui ençun vkan duté , eta beguiac ertsi vkan dituzté : beguiez ikus , eta beharriéz ençun , eta bihotzaz adi ezteçaten , eta conuerti eztitecen , eta senda eztitzadan .

text: But blessed are your eyes , for they see : and your ears , for they hear .
text2: Bada dohatsu dirade çuen beguiac , ecen ikusten duté : eta çuen beharriac , ecen ençuten duté .

text: For verily I say unto you , That many prophets and righteous men have desired to see those things which ye see , and have not seen them ; and to hear those things which ye hear , and have not heard them .
text2: Ecen eguiaz erraiten drauçuet , anhitz Prophetac eta iustoc desiratu vkan dutela ikustera çuec ikusten dituçuen gaucén , eta ezpaitituzte ikussi : eta ençutera , ençuten dituçuen gaucén , eta ezpaitituzte ençun .

text: Hear ye therefore the parable of the sower .
text2: Çuec bada ençuçue ereillearen comparationea .

text: When any one heareth the word of the kingdom , and understandeth it not , then cometh the wicked one , and catcheth away that which was sown in his heart . This is he which received seed by the way side .
text2: Noiz - ere nehorc ençuten baitu resuma hartaco hitza , eta ez aditzen , ethorten da Gaichto hura , eta harrapatzen du haren bihotzean erein cena : haur da bide bazterrean hacia recebitu duena .

text: But he that received the seed into stony places , the same is he that heareth the word , and anon with joy receiveth it ;
text2: Eta leku harriçuetara hacia recebitu duena , haur da , hitza ençuten , eta hura bertan bozcariorequin recebitzen duena :

text: Yet hath he not root in himself , but dureth for a while : for when tribulation or persecution ariseth because of the word , by and by he is offended .
text2: Baina eztu erroric bere baithan , halacotz da iraute gutitaco : eta tribulationeric edo persecutioneric hitzagatic heltzen denean , bertan scandalizatzen da .

text: He also that received seed among the thorns is he that heareth the word ; and the care of this world , and the deceitfulness of riches , choke the word , and he becometh unfruitful .
text2: Eta elhorri artera hacia recebitu duena , haur da hitza ençuten duena , baina mundu hunetaco arthác , eta abrastassunezco enganioac ithotzen duté hitza , eta fructuric eztu eguiten .

text: But he that received seed into the good ground is he that heareth the word , and understandeth it ; which also beareth fruit , and bringeth forth , some an hundredfold , some sixty , some thirty .
text2: Baina lur onera hacia recebitu duena , haur da hitza ençuten eta aditzen duena , ceinec fructu ekarten baitu eta eguiten , batac ehun , eta berceac hiruroguey , eta berceac hoguey eta hamar .

text: Another parable put he forth unto them , saying , The kingdom of heaven is likened unto a man which sowed good seed in his field :
text2: Berce comparationebat proposa ciecén , cioela , Comparatu da ceruètaco resumá haci ona bere landán erein duen guiçonarequin .

text: But while men slept , his enemy came and sowed tares among the wheat , and went his way .
text2: Baina guiçonac lo ceunçala , ethor cedin haren etsaya , eta erein ceçan hiraca , ogui artean : eta ioan cedin .

text: But when the blade was sprung up , and brought forth fruit , then appeared the tares also .
text2: Eta handitu cenean belharra , eta fructu eguin çuenean , orduan aguer cedin hiraca - ere .

text: So the servants of the householder came and said unto him , Sir , didst not thou sow good seed in thy field ? from whence then hath it tares ?
text2: Orduan ethorriric aitafamiliaren cerbitzariéc erran cieçoten , Iauna , eztuc haci ona erein eure landan ? nondic du beraz hiraca ?

text: He said unto them , An enemy hath done this . The servants said unto him , Wilt thou then that we go and gather them up ?
text2: Eta harc erran ciecén , Guiçon etsayac hori eguin du . Eta cerbitzariéc erran cieçoten , Nahi duc bada goacen eta bil deçagun hura ?

text: But he said , Nay ; lest while ye gather up the tares , ye root up also the wheat with them .
text2: Eta harc erran ciecén , Ez : hiracaren biltzean oguia - ere idoqui ezteçaçuen harequin batean .

text: Let both grow together until the harvest : and in the time of harvest I will say to the reapers , Gather ye together first the tares , and bind them in bundles to burn them : but gather the wheat into my barn .
text2: Vtzitzaçue biac elkarrequin handitzera vzta - arterano : eta vzta demborán , erranen drauet biltzaley , Bil eçaçue lehenic hiracá , eta hers eçaçue açautoz erratzecotzat : baina oguia bil eçaçue ene granerera .

text: Another parable put he forth unto them , saying , The kingdom of heaven is like to a grain of mustard seed , which a man took , and sowed in his field :
text2: Berce comparationebat proposa ciecén , cioela , Comparatu da ceruètaco resumá , mustarda bihi guiçon batec harturic bere landán erein duenarequin .

text: Which indeed is the least of all seeds : but when it is grown , it is the greatest among herbs , and becometh a tree , so that the birds of the air come and lodge in the branches thereof .
text2: Cein baita haci gucietaco chipiena , baina handitu denean , berce belharrac baino handiago da : eta arbore bilhatzen da , hambat non ethorten baitirade ceruco choriac , eta ohatzeac eguiten baitituzte haren adarretan .

text: Another parable spake he unto them ; The kingdom of heaven is like unto leaven , which a woman took , and hid in three measures of meal , till the whole was leavened .
text2: Berce comparationebat erran ciecén , cioela , Comparatu da ceruètaco resumá altchagarriarequin , cein emazte batec harturic hirur neurri irinen barnean gorde vkan baitu , gucia altcha dadin arterano .

text: All these things spake Jesus unto the multitude in parables ; and without a parable spake he not unto them :
text2: Gauça hauc guciac erran cietzén Iesusec comparationez gendetzey , eta comparatione gabe etzayen minçatzen .

text: That it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the prophet , saying , I will open my mouth in parables ; I will utter things which have been kept secret from the foundation of the world .
text2: Compli ledinçát Prophetáz erran içan dena , cioela , Irequiren dut comparationez neure ahoa : declaraturen ditut munduaren fundatzetic gorderic egon içan diraden gauçác .

text: Then Jesus sent the multitude away , and went into the house : and his disciples came unto him , saying , Declare unto us the parable of the tares of the field .
text2: Orduan vtziric populua ethor cedin etchera Iesus : eta ethorri içan çaizcan bere discipuluac , cioitela , Declara ieçaguc landaco hiracaren comparationea .

text: He answered and said unto them , He that soweth the good seed is the Son of man ;
text2: Eta harc ihardesten çuela érran ciecén , Haci ona ereiten duena da guiçonaren Semea .

text: The field is the world ; the good seed are the children of the kingdom ; but the tares are the children of the wicked one ;
text2: Eta landá da mundua : eta haci ona , resumaco haourrac dirade : eta hiracá , Gaichtoaren haourrac dirade :

text: The enemy that sowed them is the devil ; the harvest is the end of the world ; and the reapers are the angels .
text2: Eta hura erein duen etsaya , da deabrua : eta vztá , munduaren fina da : eta vzta biltzaleac , Aingueruäc dirade .

text: As therefore the tares are gathered and burned in the fire ; so shall it be in the end of this world .
text2: Bada hala nola biltzen baitute hiracá , eta suan erratzen , hala içanen da mundu hunen finean .

text: The Son of man shall send forth his angels , and they shall gather out of his kingdom all things that offend , and them which do iniquity ;
text2: Igorriren ditu guiçonaren Semeac bere Aingueruäc , eta bilduren dituzte haren resumatic scandalo guciac , eta iniquitate eguiten dutenac .

text: And shall cast them into a furnace of fire : there shall be wailing and gnashing of teeth .
text2: Eta egotziren dituzte labe daichecanera : han içanen da nigar eta hortz garrascots .

text: Then shall the righteous shine forth as the sun in the kingdom of their Father . Who hath ears to hear , let him hear .
text2: Orduan iustoéc arguituren duqueite iguzquiac beçala , bere Aitaren resumán . Ençuteco beharriric duenac ençun beça .

text: Again , the kingdom of heaven is like unto treasure hid in a field ; the which when a man hath found , he hideth , and for joy thereof goeth and selleth all that he hath , and buyeth that field .
text2: Berriz comparatu da ceruètaco resumá thesaur landa batetan gorderic dagoenarequin , hura eridenic guiçon batec estali vkan du : eta harçazco bozcarióz ioaiten da , eta duen gucia saltzen du , eta landa hura erosten .

text: Again , the kingdom of heaven is like unto a merchant man , seeking goodly pearls :
text2: Berriz comparatu da ceruètaco resumá guiçon marchant perla ederrén bilha dabilanarequin

text: Who , when he had found one pearl of great price , went and sold all that he had , and bought it .
text2: Ceinec precio handitaco perlabat eriden çuenean , ioanic sal baitzeçan çuen gucia , eta eros baitzeçan hura .

text: Again , the kingdom of heaven is like unto a net , that was cast into the sea , and gathered of every kind :
text2: Berriz comparatu da ceruètaco resumá sare itsassora egotzi batequin , eta gauça mota gucietaric biltzen duenarequin :

text: Which , when it was full , they drew to shore , and sat down , and gathered the good into vessels , but cast the bad away .
text2: Cein bethe içan cenean idoqui baitzeçaten vr ezpondara : eta iarriric bil citzaten onac vncietara , eta gaichtoac camporát iraitz citzaten .

text: So shall it be at the end of the world : the angels shall come forth , and sever the wicked from among the just ,
text2: Hala içanen da munduaren finean : ethorriren dirade Aingueruäc , eta separaturen dituqueizte gaichtoac iustoén artetic .

text: And shall cast them into the furnace of fire : there shall be wailing and gnashing of teeth .
text2: Eta egotziren dituqueizte labe daichecanera : han içanen da nigar eta hortz garrascots .

text: Jesus saith unto them , Have ye understood all these things ? They say unto him , Yea , Lord .
text2: Erraiten draue Iesusec , Aditu dituçue gauça hauc guciac ? Diotsate , Bay Iauna .

text: Then said he unto them , Therefore every scribe which is instructed unto the kingdom of heaven is like unto a man that is an householder , which bringeth forth out of his treasure things new and old .
text2: Eta harc erran ciecén , Halacotz Scriba ceruètaco resumán iracatsia den gucia , comparatu da cembeit aitafamilia bere thesauretic gauça berriric eta çaharric idoquiten duen batequin .

text: And it came to pass , that when Jesus had finished these parables , he departed thence .
text2: Eta guertha cedin comparatione hauc acabatu cituenean , Iesus iragan baitzedin handic .

text: And when he was come into his own country , he taught them in their synagogue , insomuch that they were astonished , and said , Whence hath this man this wisdom , and these mighty works ?
text2: Eta ethorri cenean bere herrira , iracasten cituen hec berén synagoguetan : hámbat non spantatuac baitzeuden , eta erraiten baitzuten , Nondic huni sapientia haur eta verthuteac ?

text: Is not this the carpenter ' s son ? is not his mother called Mary ? and his brethren , James , and Joses , and Simon , and Judas ?
text2: Ezta haur charpanter - seme ? ezta horren ama Maria deitzen , eta horren anayeac Iacques eta Ioses eta Simon eta Iuda ?

text: And his sisters , are they not all with us ? Whence then hath this man all these things ?
text2: Eta horren arrebác eztirade guciac gu baithan ? nondic bada huni gauça hauc gucioc ?

text: And they were offended in him . But Jesus said unto them , A prophet is not without honour , save in his own country , and in his own house .
text2: Eta scandalizatzen ciraden hartan . Eta Iesusec erran ciecén , Ezta Prophetaric ohore gabe bere herrian eta bere etchean baicen .

text: And he did not many mighty works there because of their unbelief .
text2: Eta etzeçan eguin han verthute anhitzic , hayén incredulitatearen causaz .

text: At that time Herod the tetrarch heard of the fame of Jesus ,
text2: Dembora hartan ençun ceçan Herodes Tetrarchac Iesusen famá :

text: And said unto his servants , This is John the Baptist ; he is risen from the dead ; and therefore mighty works do shew forth themselves in him .
text2: Eta erran ciecen bere cerbitzariey , Haur Ioannes Baptistá da , hura resuscitatu içan da hiletaric , eta halacotz verthutéc obratzen duté hunetan .

text: For Herod had laid hold on John , and bound him , and put him in prison for Herodias ' sake , his brother Philip ' s wife .
text2: Ecen Herodesec hatzamanic Ioannes esteca ceçan , eta presoindeguian eçar , Herodias haren anaye Philipperen emaztearen causaz .

text: For John said unto him , It is not lawful for thee to have her .
text2: Ecen erraiten ceraucan hari Ioannesec , Eztuc sori hori duán .

text: And when he would have put him to death , he feared the multitude , because they counted him as a prophet .
text2: Eta hura hil nahi çuelaric populuaren beldur cen , ceren Propheta beçala baitzaducaten hura .

text: But when Herod ' s birthday was kept , the daughter of Herodias danced before them , and pleased Herod .
text2: Bada Herodesen sor eguneco bestá eguiten cenean , dança cedin Herodiasen alabá artean : eta Herodesen gogara eguin ceçan .

text: Whereupon he promised with an oath to give her whatsoever she would ask .
text2: Nondic iuramendurequin prometta baitzieçon , emanen ceraucala cer - ere esca bailedi .

text: And she , being before instructed of her mother , said , Give me here John Baptist ' s head in a charger .
text2: Harc bada aitzinetic amáz instruitu içanic , Indac ( dio ) hemen platean Ioannes Baptistaren buruä .

text: And the king was sorry : nevertheless for the oath ' s sake , and them which sat with him at meat , he commanded it to be given her .
text2: Eta triste cedin regue : baina cinaren , eta harequin mahainean iarriric ceudenén causaz , mana ceçan eman lequión .

text: And he sent , and beheaded John in the prison .
text2: Eta igor ceçan Ioannesi presoindeguian buruären edequi eracitera .

text: And his head was brought in a charger , and given to the damsel : and she brought it to her mother .
text2: Eta ekarri içan da haren buruä platean , eta eman cequión nescatchari , eta harc presenta cieçón bere amari .

text: And his disciples came , and took up the body , and buried it , and went and told Jesus .
text2: Guero ethor citecen haren discipuluac , eta eraman ceçaten haren gorputza , eta ohortz ceçaten : eta ioanic conta cieçoten Iesusi .

text: When Jesus heard of it , he departed thence by ship into a desert place apart : and when the people had heard thereof , they followed him on foot out of the cities .
text2: Eta hori ençunic Iesus parti cedin handic vnci batetan leku desertu batetara appart : eta ençunic gendetzeac oinez iarreiqui içan çaizcan hirietaric .

text: And Jesus went forth , and saw a great multitude , and was moved with compassion toward them , and he healed their sick .
text2: Eta ilkiric Iesusec ikus ceçan gendetze handibat eta compassione har ceçan heçaz , eta hayén arteco eriac senda citzan .

text: And when it was evening , his disciples came to him , saying , This is a desert place , and the time is now past ; send the multitude away , that they may go into the villages , and buy themselves victuals .
text2: Eta arrats aldean ethorri içan çaizcan bere discipuluac , cioitela , Leku desertua duc haur , eta ordua ia iragan , eyec congit gendetzey , burguètarát ioanic iateco eros deçatençat .

text: But Jesus said unto them , They need not depart ; give ye them to eat .
text2: Baina Iesusec erran ciecén , Eztute ioaiteco mengoaric , eyeçue ceuroc iatera .

text: And they say unto him , We have here but five loaves , and two fishes .
text2: Eta hec diotsote , Eztiagu hemen borz ogui eta bi arrain baicen .

text: He said , Bring them hither to me .
text2: Eta harc erran ciecen , Ekaztaçue huna .

text: And he commanded the multitude to sit down on the grass , and took the five loaves , and the two fishes , and looking up to heaven , he blessed , and brake , and gave the loaves to his disciples , and the disciples to the multitude .
text2: Eta populua belhar gainean iartera manaturic , eta borz oguiac eta bi arrainac harturic , beguiac cerurat goitituric , gratiác renda citzan , eta hautsiric eman cietzen discipuluey oguiac , eta discipuluéc gendetzey .

text: And they did all eat , and were filled : and they took up of the fragments that remained twelve baskets full .
text2: Eta ian ceçaten guciéc , eta ressasia citecen : eta goiti citzaten çathi soberatuetaric hamabi sasqui betheric .

text: And they that had eaten were about five thousand men , beside women and children .
text2: Eta ian çutenac ciraden borz milla guiçonen inguruä , emazteac eta haourrac gabe .

text: And straightway Jesus constrained his disciples to get into a ship , and to go before him unto the other side , while he sent the multitudes away .
text2: Eta bertan Iesusec bortcha citzan bere discipuluac vncian sartzera , eta haren aitzinean berce aldera iragaitera : populuari congit lemon bizquitartean .

text: And when he had sent the multitudes away , he went up into a mountain apart to pray : and when the evening was come , he was there alone .
text2: Eta congit emanic populuari , igan cedin mendira bereciqui , othoitz eguin leçançát . Eta arrastu cenean ber - bera cen han .

text: But the ship was now in the midst of the sea , tossed with waves : for the wind was contrary .
text2: Eta vncia ia itsassoaren artean cen , baguéz tormentatua : ecen haice contra cen .

text: And in the fourth watch of the night Jesus went unto them , walking on the sea .
text2: Eta gauären laurgarren veillán ioan cedin hetara Iesus , itsas gainez çabilala .

text: And when the disciples saw him walking on the sea , they were troubled , saying , It is a spirit ; and they cried out for fear .
text2: Eta hura ikussiric itsas gainez çabilala , discipuluac trubla citecen , erraiten çutela , Fantosmabat da , eta beldurtiz oihu eguin ceçaten .

text: But straightway Jesus spake unto them , saying , Be of good cheer ; it is I ; be not afraid .
text2: Baina bertan minça cequién Iesus , cioela , Sporça çaitezte : ni naiz etzaretela beldur .

text: And Peter answered him and said , Lord , if it be thou , bid me come unto thee on the water .
text2: Eta ihardesten ceraucala Pierrisec erran ceçan , Iauna , baldin hi bahaiz , mana neçac hiregana ethortera vr gainez .

text: And he said , Come . And when Peter was come down out of the ship , he walked on the water , to go to Jesus .
text2: Bada harc erran ceçan , Athor . Eta iautsiric vncitic Pierris ioan cedin vr gainez , Iesusgana ethor ledinçát .

text: But when he saw the wind boisterous , he was afraid ; and beginning to sink , he cried , saying , Lord , save me .
text2: Baina haicea sendo ikussiric , icit cedin : eta hundatzen hassi cenean oihu eguin ceçan , cioela , Iauna , salua neçac .

text: And immediately Jesus stretched forth his hand , and caught him , and said unto him , O thou of little faith , wherefore didst thou doubt ?
text2: Eta bertan Iesus escua hedaturic lot cequión , eta diotsó , O fede chipitacoá , cergatic dudatu duc ?

text: And when they were come into the ship , the wind ceased .
text2: Eta sarthu ciradenean vncira , sossega cedin haicea .

text: Then they that were in the ship came and worshipped him , saying , Of a truth thou art the Son of God .
text2: Orduan vncian ciradenéc ethorriric adora ceçaten hura , cioitela , Eguiazqui Iaincoaren Seme aiz .

text: And when they were gone over , they came into the land of Gennesaret .
text2: Eta berce aldera iraganic ethor citecen Genesaretco lurrera .

text: And when the men of that place had knowledge of him , they sent out into all that country round about , and brought unto him all that were diseased ;
text2: Eta hura eçagutu vkan çutenean leku hartaco guiçonéc , igor ceçaten inguruco aldiri gucietara , eta presenta cietzoten eri ciraden guciac .

text: And besought him that they might only touch the hem of his garment : and as many as touched were made perfectly whole .
text2: Eta othoitz eguiten ceraucaten solament hunqui leçaten haren abillamendu ezpaina , eta hunqui vkan çuten guciac , senda citecen .

text: Then came to Jesus scribes and Pharisees , which were of Jerusalem , saying ,
text2: Orduan ethorten dirade Iesusgana Ierusalemetar Scriba eta Phariseu batzu , dioitela ,

text: Why do thy disciples transgress the tradition of the elders ? for they wash not their hands when they eat bread .
text2: Cergatic hire discipuluéc iragaiten dute aitzinecoen ordenança ? ecen eztitie ikutzen bere escuac oguia iaten dutenean .

text: But he answered and said unto them , Why do ye also transgress the commandment of God by your tradition ?
text2: Eta harc ihardesten çuela erran ciecén , Eta çuec cergatic iragaiten duçue Iaincoaren manamendua çuen ordenançaz ?

text: For God commanded , saying , Honour thy father and mother : and , He that curseth father or mother , let him die the death .
text2: Ecen Iaincoac manatu vkan du , dioela , Ohoraitzac eure aita eta ama . Eta , Aita edo ama maradicaturen duena , herioz hil bedi .

text: But ye say , Whosoever shall say to his father or his mother , It is a gift , by whatsoever thou mightest be profited by me ;
text2: Baina çuec dioçue , Norc - ere erranen baitrauca aitari edo amari , Eneganic den dono gucia probetchaturen çaic : ohora ezpadeça - ere bere aita edo bere ama hoguen gabe date .

text: And honour not his father or his mother , he shall be free . Thus have ye made the commandment of God of none effect by your tradition .
text2: Eta ezdeustu vkan duçue Iaincoaren manamendua çuen ordenançáz .

text: Ye hypocrites , well did Esaias prophesy of you , saying ,
text2: Hypocritác , vngui prophetizatu vkan du çueçaz Esaiasec , dioela ,

text: This people draweth nigh unto me with their mouth , and honoureth me with their lips ; but their heart is far from me .
text2: Populu haur ahoz hurbiltzen çait , eta ezpainéz ohoratzen nau : baina hauén bihotza vrrun da eneganic .

text: But in vain they do worship me , teaching for doctrines the commandments of men .
text2: Baina alferretan ohoratzen naute , iracasten dituztela doctrinatzát guiçonén manamenduac .

text: And he called the multitude , and said unto them , Hear , and understand :
text2: Eta populua beregana deithuric erran ciecén , Ençun eçaçue eta adi eçaçue .

text: Not that which goeth into the mouth defileth a man ; but that which cometh out of the mouth , this defileth a man .
text2: Eztu ahoan sartzen denac satsutzen guiçona : baina ahotic ilkiten denac satsutzen du guiçona .

text: Then came his disciples , and said unto him , Knowest thou that the Pharisees were offended , after they heard this saying ?
text2: Orduan hurbilduric bere discipuluéc erran cieçoten , Eçagutu duc nola Phariseuac propos hori ençunic scandalizatu içan diraden ?

text: But he answered and said , Every plant , which my heavenly Father hath not planted , shall be rooted up .
text2: Eta harc ihardesten çuela erran ceçan , Ene Aita ceruètacoac landatu eztuen landare gucia erroetaric idoquiren da .

text: Let them alone : they be blind leaders of the blind . And if the blind lead the blind , both shall fall into the ditch .
text2: Vtzitzaçue , itsuric itsuén guidari dirade : baldin itsuac itsua guida badeça , biac hobira eroriren dirade .

text: Then answered Peter and said unto him , Declare unto us this parable .
text2: Orduan ihardesten çuela Pierrisec erran cieçon , Declara ieçaguc comparatione hori .

text: And Jesus said , Are ye also yet without understanding ?
text2: Eta Iesusec erran ceçan , Oraino çuec - ere adimendu gabe çarete ?

text: Do not ye yet understand , that whatsoever entereth in at the mouth goeth into the belly , and is cast out into the draught ?
text2: Oraino eztuçue aditzen ecen ahoan sartzen den gucia , sabelera ioaiten dela , eta retreitera egoizten dela ?

text: But those things which proceed out of the mouth come forth from the heart ; and they defile the man .
text2: Baina ahotic ilkiten diradenac , bihotzetic partitzen dirade , eta hec satsutzen dute guiçona .

text: For out of the heart proceed evil thoughts , murders , adulteries , fornications , thefts , false witness , blasphemies :
text2: Ecen bihotzetic partitzen dirade pensamendu gaichtoac , hiltzecác , adulterioac , paillardiçác , ohoinqueriác , testimoniage falsuac , gaitzerraitecác .

text: These are the things which defile a man : but to eat with unwashen hands defileth not a man .
text2: Hauc dirade guiçona satsutzen dutenac : baina escuac ikuci gaberico iateac , eztu guiçona satsutzen .

text: Then Jesus went thence , and departed into the coasts of Tyre and Sidon .
text2: Eta ilkiric handic Iesus ioan cedin Tyreco eta Sidongo comarquetarat .

text: And , behold , a woman of Canaan came out of the same coasts , and cried unto him , saying , Have mercy on me , O Lord , thou Son of David ; my daughter is grievously vexed with a devil .
text2: Eta huná , emazte Chananeabat aldiri hetaric ilkiric , oihuz iar cedin , ciotsola , Auc pietate niçaz Dauid - en seme Iauná , ene alaba duc deabruaz gaizqui tormentatua .

text: But he answered her not a word . And his disciples came and besought him , saying , Send her away ; for she crieth after us .
text2: Baina harc etzieçon ihardets hitzic . Orduan hurbilduric bere discipuluéc othoitz ceguioten , cioitela , Emóc congit : ecen oihuz diaoc gure ondoan .

text: But he answered and said , I am not sent but unto the lost sheep of the house of Israel .
text2: Eta harc ihardesten çuela erran ceçan , Eznaiz igorri Israeleco etcheco ardi galduetara baicen .

text: Then came she and worshipped him , saying , Lord , help me .
text2: Eta harc ethorriric adora ceçan hura , cioela , Iauna , aiuta neçac .

text: But he answered and said , It is not meet to take the children ' s bread , and to cast it to dogs .
text2: Eta harc ihardesten çuela erran ceçan , Eztun gauça bidezcoa haourrén oguiaren hartzea , eta chakurrey egoiztea .

text: And she said , Truth , Lord : yet the dogs eat of the crumbs which fall from their masters ' table .
text2: Baina harc erran ceçan , Hala duc , Iauna , baina chakurrec - ere bere nabussién mahainetic erorten diraden appurretaric iaten dié .

text: Then Jesus answered and said unto her , O woman , great is thy faith : be it unto thee even as thou wilt . And her daughter was made whole from that very hour .
text2: Orduan ihardesten çuela Iesusec erran cieçón , O emaztea , handi dun hire fedea : eguin bequin nahi dunán beçala . Eta senda cedin haren alabá orduandanic .

text: And Jesus departed from thence , and came nigh unto the sea of Galilee ; and went up into a mountain , and sat down there .
text2: Eta partituric handic Iesus ethor cedin . Galileaco itsas aldera : eta iganic mendira , iar cedin han .

text: And great multitudes came unto him , having with them those that were lame , blind , dumb , maimed , and many others , and cast them down at Jesus ' feet ; and he healed them :
text2: Orduan ethor cedin harengana anhitz gendetze , çutela berequin mainguric , itsuric , muturic , hebainic eta anhitz berceric : eta eçar citzaten Iesusen oinetara , eta senda citzan .

text: Insomuch that the multitude wondered , when they saw the dumb to speak , the maimed to be whole , the lame to walk , and the blind to see : and they glorified the God of Israel .
text2: Hala non populuac mirets baitzeçan çacusquianean mutuac minçatzen , hebainac sendaturic , mainguäc çabiltzala , itsuéc ikusten çutela : eta glorifica ceçaten Israeleco Iaincoa .

text: Then Jesus called his disciples unto him , and said , I have compassion on the multitude , because they continue with me now three days , and have nothing to eat : and I will not send them away fasting , lest they faint in the way .
text2: Orduan Iesusec beregana deithuric bere discipuluac erran ceçan , Compassione dut populu huneçaz : ecen ia hirur egun du enequin dagoela , eta eztute cer ian deçaten : eta eztitut baruric igorri nahi , bidean flaca eztitecençat .

text: And his disciples say unto him , Whence should we have so much bread in the wilderness , as to fill so great a multitude ?
text2: Eta bere discipuluéc diotsote , Nondic guri hambat ogui desertuan hunambat genderen ressasiatzeco ?

text: And Jesus saith unto them , How many loaves have ye ? And they said , Seven , and a few little fishes .
text2: Eta dioste Iesusec , Cembat ogui dituçue ? Eta hec erran cieçoten , Çazpi , eta arraintcho batzu .

text: And he commanded the multitude to sit down on the ground .
text2: Orduan mana ceçan populua lurrean iartera .

text: And he took the seven loaves and the fishes , and gave thanks , and brake them , and gave to his disciples , and the disciples to the multitude .
text2: Eta harturic çazpi oguiac eta arrainac , gratiac rendaturic hauts citzan , eta eman cietzén bere discipuluey : eta discipuluéc populuari .

text: And they did all eat , and were filled : and they took up of the broken meat that was left seven baskets full .
text2: Eta ian ceçaten guciéc , eta ressasia citecen : eta goiti citzaten çathi soberatuetaric çazpi sasqui betheric .

text: And they that did eat were four thousand men , beside women and children .
text2: Eta ian çutenac ciraden , laur milla guiçon , emazteac eta haourrac gabe .

text: And he sent away the multitude , and took ship , and came into the coasts of Magdala ,
text2: Orduan congit emanic gendetzeari , igan cedin vnci batetara : eta ethor cedin Magdaleco bazterretara .

text: The Pharisees also with the Sadducees came , and tempting desired him that he would shew them a sign from heaven .
text2: Eta ethorriric Phariseuéc eta Sadduceuéc , tentatzen çutela requiri ceçaten cembeit signo cerutic eracuts liecén .

text: He answered and said unto them , When it is evening , ye say , It will be fair weather : for the sky is red .
text2: Baina harc ihardesten çuela erran ciecén , Arratsean , erraitten duçue , Dembora eder eguinen du : ecen gorri da ceruä .

text: And in the morning , It will be foul weather to day : for the sky is red and lowring . O ye hypocrites , ye can discern the face of the sky ; but can ye not discern the signs of the times ?
text2: Eta goicean dioçue , Egun tempestate eguinen du : ecen ceruä orzgorri gaitz da . Hypocritác , ceruären irudiaz , iugeatzen daquiçue , eta demboretaco signoéz ecin diroçue ?

text: A wicked and adulterous generation seeketh after a sign ; and there shall no sign be given unto it , but the sign of the prophet Jonas . And he left them , and departed .
text2: Generatione gaichtoa edo adulteroa signo esquez dago , eta signoric etzayo hari emanen Ionas prophetaren signoa baicen . Eta hec vtziric ioan cedin .

text: And when his disciples were come to the other side , they had forgotten to take bread .
text2: Eta ethorri ciradenean haren discipuluac berce aldera , ahanz cequién ogui hartzera .

text: Then Jesus said unto them , Take heed and beware of the leaven of the Pharisees and of the Sadducees .
text2: Eta Iesusec erran ciecen , Gogoauçue eta beguira çaitezte Phariseuén eta Sadduceuén altchagarritic .

text: And they reasoned among themselves , saying , It is because we have taken no bread .
text2: Eta hec iharduquiten çutén bere artean , cioitela , Hori dio , ceren oguiric hartu eztugun .

text: Which when Jesus perceived , he said unto them , O ye of little faith , why reason ye among yourselves , because ye have brought no bread ?
text2: Eta Iesusec eçaguturic erran ciecén , Cer diharducaçue ceurón artean , fede chipitacoác , ceren oguiric hartu eztuçuen ?

text: Do ye not yet understand , neither remember the five loaves of the five thousand , and how many baskets ye took up ?
text2: Oraino eztuçue aditzen , eta etzarete guehiagóric orhoit borz milla guiçonén borz oguiéz , eta cembat sasqui goititu cintuzten ?

text: Neither the seven loaves of the four thousand , and how many baskets ye took up ?
text2: Ezeta laur milla guiçonén çazpi oguiéz , eta cembat sasqui goititu cintuzten ?

text: How is it that ye do not understand that I spake it not to you concerning bread , that ye should beware of the leaven of the Pharisees and of the Sadducees ?
text2: Nola eztuçue aditzen ecen eztrauçuedala oguiz erran , beguira cindeizten Phariseuén eta Sadduceuén altchagarritic ?

text: Then understood they how that he bade them not beware of the leaven of bread , but of the doctrine of the Pharisees and of the Sadducees .
text2: Orduan adi ceçaten ecen etzuela erran , beguira litecen ogui altchagarritic , baina Phariseuén eta Sadduceuén doctrinatic .

text: When Jesus came into the coasts of Caesarea Philippi , he asked his disciples , saying , Whom do men say that I the Son of man am ?
text2: Eta ethorri cenean Iesus Cesareaco bazter Philipperenetara , interroga citzan bere discipuluac , erraiten çuela , Ni nor naicela dioite guiçonéc , guiçonaren Semea ?

text: And they said , Some say that thou art John the Baptist : some , Elias ; and others , Jeremias , or one of the prophets .
text2: Eta hec erran ceçaten , Batzuc , Ioannes Baptista : eta bercéc , Elias : eta bercéc , Hieremias , edo Prophetetaric bat .

text: He saith unto them , But whom say ye that I am ?
text2: Dioste , Eta çuec nor naicela dioçue ?

text: And Simon Peter answered and said , Thou art the Christ , the Son of the living God .
text2: Ihardesten çuela Simon Pierrisec erran ceçan , Hi aiz Christ Iainco viciaren Semea .

text: And Jesus answered and said unto him , Blessed art thou , Simon Barjona : for flesh and blood hath not revealed it unto thee , but my Father which is in heaven .
text2: Eta ihardesten çuela Iesusec erran cieçón hari , Dohatsu aiz Simon Ionaren semeá : ecen haraguiac ez odolac eztrauc hori reuelatu , baina ene Aita ceruètan denac .

text: And I say also unto thee , That thou art Peter , and upon this rock I will build my church ; and the gates of hell shall not prevail against it .
text2: Baina are nic erraiten drauat , ecen hi aicela Pierris , eta Harri hunen gainean edificaturen dudala neure Eliçá : eta iffernuco borthác etzaizcala hari garaithuren .

text: And I will give unto thee the keys of the kingdom of heaven : and whatsoever thou shalt bind on earth shall be bound in heaven : and whatsoever thou shalt loose on earth shall be loosed in heaven .
text2: Eta hiri emanen drauzquiat ceruètaco resumaren gakoac , eta cer - ere lothuren baituc lurrean , lothua içanen duc ceruètan : eta cer - ere lachaturen baituc lurrean , lachatua içanen duc ceruètan .

text: Then charged he his disciples that they should tell no man that he was Jesus the Christ .
text2: Orduan mana citzan expressuqui bere discipuluac nehori ezlerroten , hura cela IESVS CHRIST .

text: From that time forth began Jesus to shew unto his disciples , how that he must go unto Jerusalem , and suffer many things of the elders and chief priests and scribes , and be killed , and be raised again the third day .
text2: Orduandanic has cedin Iesus bere discipuluey declaratzen , ecen behar çuela ioan Ierusalemera , eta anhitz suffritu Ancianoetaric eta Sacrificadore principaletaric , eta Scribetaric , eta heriotara eman behar cela , eta hereneco egunean , resuscitatu .

text: Then Peter took him , and began to rebuke him , saying , Be it far from thee , Lord : this shall not be unto thee .
text2: Eta hura appartaturic has cequión Pierris reprotchatzen , cioela , Eurorçaz auc pietate , Iauna : etzaic hiri hori helduren .

text: But he turned , and said unto Peter , Get thee behind me , Satan : thou art an offence unto me : for thou savourest not the things that be of God , but those that be of men .
text2: Eta harc itzuliric erran cieçón Pierrisi , Guibelerat adi eneganic Satan , empatchu atzait : ecen eztituc aditzen Iaincoaren diraden gauçác , baina guiçonén diradenac .

text: Then said Jesus unto his disciples , If any man will come after me , let him deny himself , and take up his cross , and follow me .
text2: Orduan Iesusec erran ciecén bere discipuluey , Baldin nehor ene ondoan ethorri nahi bada , renuntia beça bere buruäz , eta har beça bere crutzea , eta berrait niri .

text: For whosoever will save his life shall lose it : and whosoever will lose his life for my sake shall find it .
text2: Ecen norc - ere nahi vkanen baitu saluatu bere vicia , galduren du hura : eta norc - ere galduren baitu bere vicia ene causaz , eridenen du hura .

text: For what is a man profited , if he shall gain the whole world , and lose his own soul ? or what shall a man give in exchange for his soul ?
text2: Ecen cer probetchu du guiçonac baldin mundu gucia irabaz badeça , eta bere arima gal badeça ? edo cer emanen du guiçonac bere arimaren recompensamendutan ?

text: For the Son of man shall come in the glory of his Father with his angels ; and then he shall reward every man according to his works .
text2: Ecen guiçonaren Semea ethorriren da bere Aitaren glorián bere Aingueruèquin : eta orduan rendaturen drauca batbederari bere obrén araura .

text: Verily I say unto you , There be some standing here , which shall not taste of death , till they see the Son of man coming in his kingdom .
text2: Eguiaz diotsuet , badirade hemen present diradenetaric batzu , herioa dastaturen eztutenic , guiçonaren Semea bere resumara ethorten ikus diroiteno .

text: And after six days Jesus taketh Peter , James , and John his brother , and bringeth them up into an high mountain apart ,
text2: Eta sey egunen buruän , har citzan Iesusec Pierris eta Iacques eta Ioannes haren anayea , eta eraman citzan appart mendi gora batetara .

text: And was transfigured before them : and his face did shine as the sun , and his raiment was white as the light .
text2: Eta transfigura cedin hayén aitzinean , eta argui cedin haren beguithartea iguzquia beçala , eta haren abillamenduac churi citecen arguia beçala .

text: And , behold , there appeared unto them Moses and Elias talking with him .
text2: Eta huná , ikus citzaten Moyses eta Elias harequin minço ciradela .

text: Then answered Peter , and said unto Jesus , Lord , it is good for us to be here : if thou wilt , let us make here three tabernacles ; one for thee , and one for Moses , and one for Elias .
text2: Eta ihardesten çuela Pierrisec erran cieçón Iesusi , Iauna , on duc gu hemen garén : nahi baduc , eguin ditzagun hemen hirur tabernacle , bat hire , eta bat Moysesen , eta bat Eliasen .

text: While he yet spake , behold , a bright cloud overshadowed them : and behold a voice out of the cloud , which said , This is my beloved Son , in whom I am well pleased ; hear ye him .
text2: Oraino hura minço cela , huná , hodey argui batec estal citzan hec : eta huná vozbat hodeyetic , cioela , Haur da ene Seme maitea , ceinetan neure atseguin ona hartzen baitut : huni beha çaquizquiote :

text: And when the disciples heard it , they fell on their face , and were sore afraid .
text2: Eta hori ençunic discipuluac eror citeçen , bere beguithartén gainera , eta icit citecen haguitz .

text: And Jesus came and touched them , and said , Arise , and be not afraid .
text2: Orduan ethorriric Iesusec hunqui citzan hec , eta erran ciecén , Iaiqui çaitezte , eta etzaretela beldur .

text: And when they had lifted up their eyes , they saw no man , save Jesus only .
text2: Eta goitituric bere beguiac nehor etzeçaten ikus Iesus bera baicen .

text: And as they came down from the mountain , Jesus charged them , saying , Tell the vision to no man , until the Son of man be risen again from the dead .
text2: Eta menditic iausten ciradela , mana citzan Iesusec , cioela , Nehori ezterroçuela visionea , guiçonaren Semea hiletaric resuscita daiteno .

text: And his disciples asked him , saying , Why then say the scribes that Elias must first come ?
text2: Eta interroga ceçaten bere discipuluéc , cioitela , Cergatic beraz Scribéc erraiten dute ecen Elias behar dela lehen ethorri ?

text: And Jesus answered and said unto them , Elias truly shall first come , and restore all things .
text2: Eta ihardesten çuela Iesusec erran ciecén , Elias ethorriren bada lehen , eta bere staturaco ditu gauça guciac :

text: But I say unto you , That Elias is come already , and they knew him not , but have done unto him whatsoever they listed . Likewise shall also the Son of man suffer of them .
text2: Baina erraiten drauçuet ecen Elias ia ethorri dela , eta hura eztute eçagutu vkan , baina eguin dute harçaz nahi vkan duten gucia : hala guiçonaren Semeac - ere suffrituren du hetaric .

text: Then the disciples understood that he spake unto them of John the Baptist .
text2: Orduan adi ceçaten discipuluéc ecen Ioannes Baptistáz erran cerauela .

text: And when they were come to the multitude , there came to him a certain man , kneeling down to him , and saying ,
text2: Eta ethorri ciradenean populuagana , ethor cedin harengana guiçombat , haren aitzinean belhauricatzen cela ,

text: Lord , have mercy on my son : for he is lunatick , and sore vexed : for ofttimes he falleth into the fire , and oft into the water .
text2: Eta cioela , Iauna , auc pietate ene semeaz , ecen lunatico duc eta gaizqui tormentatzen : ecen maiz erorten duc sura , eta maiz vrera .

text: And I brought him to thy disciples , and they could not cure him .
text2: Eta presentatu diraueat hura hire discipuluey , eta ecin sendatu dié .

text: Then Jesus answered and said , O faithless and perverse generation , how long shall I be with you ? how long shall I suffer you ? bring him hither to me .
text2: Eta ihardesten çuela Iesusec erran ceçan , O natione sinheste gabea eta bihurriá , noizdrano finean çuequin içanen naiz ? noizdrano finean suportaturen çaituztet ? ekardaçue hura huna .

text: And Jesus rebuked the devil ; and he departed out of him : and the child was cured from that very hour .
text2: Eta mehatcha ceçan deabrua Iesusec , eta ilki cedin harenganic : eta senda cedin muthilla orduandanic .

text: Then came the disciples to Jesus apart , and said , Why could not we cast him out ?
text2: Orduan ethorriric Iesusgana appart discipuluéc erran cieçoten , Cergatic guc ecin campora egotzi vkan dugu hura ?

text: And Jesus said unto them , Because of your unbelief : for verily I say unto you , If ye have faith as a grain of mustard seed , ye shall say unto this mountain , Remove hence to yonder place ; and it shall remove ; and nothing shall be impossible unto you .
text2: Eta Iesusec erran ciecen , Çuen sinheste gabeagatic : ecen eguiaz diotsuet , baldin mustarda bihibat den becembat fede baduçue , erranen draucaçue mendi huni , Iregan adi hemendic hara : eta iraganen da , eta etzaiçue deus impossibleric içanen .

text: Howbeit this kind goeth not out but by prayer and fasting .
text2: Baina deabru mota haur ezta ilkiten orationez eta barurez baicen .

text: And while they abode in Galilee , Jesus said unto them , The Son of man shall be betrayed into the hands of men :
text2: Eta hec Galilean vsatzen çutela , erran ciecén Iesusec , Içanen da , guiçonaren Semea liuraturen baita guiçonen escuetara :

text: And they shall kill him , and the third day he shall be raised again . And they were exceeding sorry .
text2: Eta hilen dute hura : baina hereneco egunean resuscitaturen da : eta triste citecen haguitz .

text: And when they were come to Capernaum , they that received tribute money came to Peter , and said , Doth not your master pay tribute ?
text2: Eta ethorri içan ciradenean Capernaumera , ethor citecen Pierrisgana didrachmác recebitzen cituztenac , eta erran cieçoten , Çuen magistruac didrachmác eztitu pagatzen ?

text: He saith , Yes . And when he was come into the house , Jesus prevented him , saying , What thinkest thou , Simon ? of whom do the kings of the earth take custom or tribute ? of their own children , or of strangers ?
text2: Dio , Bay . Eta etchean sarthu içan cenean , aitzin cequión IESVS , cioela , Simon , cer irudi çaic ? Lurreco reguéc norenganic hartzen dituzté tributac eta taillac ? beré haourretaric , ala bercetacoetaric ?

text: Peter saith unto him , Of strangers . Jesus saith unto him , Then are the children free .
text2: Diotsa Pierrisec , Bercetacoetaric . Diotsa Iesusec , Beraz libre dituc haourrac .

text: Notwithstanding , lest we should offend them , go thou to the sea , and cast an hook , and take up the fish that first cometh up ; and when thou hast opened his mouth , thou shalt find a piece of money : that take , and give unto them for me and thee .
text2: Baina scandaliza eztitzagunçát , itsassora ioanic , egotzac amuä : eta lehen iganen den arraina har eçac , eta haren ahoa irequiric eridenen baituc staterabat : harturic hura eman iecéc enegatic eta hiregatic .

text: At the same time came the disciples unto Jesus , saying , Who is the greatest in the kingdom of heaven ?
text2: Ordu hartan berean ethor citecen Iesusgana discipuluac , cioitela , Nor da handiena ceruètaco resuman ?

text: And Jesus called a little child unto him , and set him in the midst of them ,
text2: Eta deithuric haourtchobat beregana Iesusec , eçar ceçan hura hayén artean .

text: And said , Verily I say unto you , Except ye be converted , and become as little children , ye shall not enter into the kingdom of heaven .
text2: Eta erran ceçan , Eguiaz erraiten drauçuet , baldin conuerti ezpaçaitezte , eta haourtchoac beçalaca ezpaçaitezte , etzarete sarthuren ceruètaco resumán .

text: Whosoever therefore shall humble himself as this little child , the same is greatest in the kingdom of heaven .
text2: Norc - ere bada bere buruä humiliaturen baitu haourtcho haur den beçala , hura da handiena ceruètaco resumán ?

text: And whoso shall receive one such little child in my name receiveth me .
text2: Eta norc - ere recebituren baitu hunelaco haourtchobat ene icenean , ni recebitzen nau .

text: But whoso shall offend one of these little ones which believe in me , it were better for him that a millstone were hanged about his neck , and that he were drowned in the depth of the sea .
text2: Baina norc - ere scandalizaturen baitu ni baithan sinhesten duten chipi hautaric bat , harc hobe luque vrka lequión bere leppoan asto - errota harribat , eta hunda ledin itsas hundarrean .

text: Woe unto the world because of offences ! for it must needs be that offences come ; but woe to that man by whom the offence cometh !
text2: Maledictione munduari scandaloén causaz : ecen necessario da scandaloac datocen , badaric - ere maledictione guiçon hari , ceinez scandalo ethorten baita .

text: Wherefore if thy hand or thy foot offend thee , cut them off , and cast them from thee : it is better for thee to enter into life halt or maimed , rather than having two hands or two feet to be cast into everlasting fire .
text2: Baldineta eure escuac edo eure oinac trebuca eraciten bahau trenca eçac hura eta iraitzac eureganic , hobe duc hire , mainguric edo escubakoitzdun vicitzean sar adin , ecen ez bi escuac edo bi oinac dituála suco gehennara iraitz adin .

text: And if thine eye offend thee , pluck it out , and cast it from thee : it is better for thee to enter into life with one eye , rather than having two eyes to be cast into hell fire .
text2: Eta baldin eure beguiac trebuca eraciten bahau , idocac hura , eta iraitzac eureganic : hobe duc hire , begui batarequin vicitzean sar adin , ecen ez bi beguiac dituala suco gehennara iraitz adin .

text: Take heed that ye despise not one of these little ones ; for I say unto you , That in heaven their angels do always behold the face of my Father which is in heaven .
text2: Beguirauçue menosprecia ezteçaçuen chipi hautaric bat : ecen erraiten drauçuet hauen Aingueruèc bethiere dacussatela ene Aita ceruetan denaren beguithartea .

text: For the Son of man is come to save that which was lost .
text2: Ecen ethorri içan da guiçonaren Semea galdu cenaren saluatzera .

text: How think ye ? if a man have an hundred sheep , and one of them be gone astray , doth he not leave the ninety and nine , and goeth into the mountains , and seeketh that which is gone astray ?
text2: Cer irudi çaiçue ? baldin guiçon batec ehun ardi baditu , eta hetaric bat errebela badadi , eztitu lauroguey eta hemeretziac vtziten , eta mendietara ioanic eztu errebelatu cena bilhatzen ?

text: And if so be that he find it , verily I say unto you , he rejoiceth more of that sheep , than of the ninety and nine which went not astray .
text2: Eta baldin guertha badadi eriden deçan hura , eguiaz erraiten drauçuet ecen bozcario guehiago duela harçaz , ecen ez lauroguey eta hemeretzi errebelatu etziradenez .

text: Even so it is not the will of your Father which is in heaven , that one of these little ones should perish .
text2: Halaber ezta çuen Aita ceruètan denaren vorondatea chipi hautaric bat gal dadin .

text: Moreover if thy brother shall trespass against thee , go and tell him his fault between thee and him alone : if he shall hear thee , thou hast gained thy brother .
text2: Eta baldin hire anayec hire contra faltatu badu , oha eta reprehendi eçac hura , hire eta haren beraren artean : baldin behatzen baçaic , irabaci duc eure anayea .

text: But if he will not hear thee , then take with thee one or two more , that in the mouth of two or three witnesses every word may be established .
text2: Baina baldin behatzen ezpaçaic , har itzac eurequin oraino bat edo biga : biga edo hirur testimonioren ahoan hitz gucia fermu dençat .

text: And if he shall neglect to hear them , tell it unto the church : but if he neglect to hear the church , let him be unto thee as an heathen man and a publican .
text2: Eta baldin hæy behatzen ezpaçaye , erróc Eliçari : eta baldin Eliçari behatzen ezpaçayó , albeiheduca pagano eta publicano beçala .

text: Verily I say unto you , Whatsoever ye shall bind on earth shall be bound in heaven : and whatsoever ye shall loose on earth shall be loosed in heaven .
text2: Eguiaz erraiten drauçuet , cer - ere lothuren baituçue lurrean , lothua içanen da ceruän : eta cer - ere lachaturen baituçue lurrean , lachatua içanen da ceruän .

text: Again I say unto you , That if two of you shall agree on earth as touching any thing that they shall ask , it shall be done for them of my Father which is in heaven .
text2: Berriz diotsuet ecen baldin çuetaric biguec consenti badeçate lurraren gainean , esca ditecen gauça gucia eguinen çayela ene Aita ceruetan denaz .

text: For where two or three are gathered together in my name , there am I in the midst of them .
text2: Ecen non baitirade biga edo hirur bilduric ene icenean , han naiz hayén artean .

text: Then came Peter to him , and said , Lord , how oft shall my brother sin against me , and I forgive him ? till seven times ?
text2: Orduan harengana hurbilduric Pierrisec erran ceçan , Iauna , cembatetarano bekatu eguinen du ene contra ene anayec , eta barkaturen draucat ? ala çazpitarano ?

text: Jesus saith unto him , I say not unto thee , Until seven times : but , Until seventy times seven .
text2: Diotsó IESVSEC , Eztiossát çazpitarano , baina çazpitan hiruroguey eta hamarretarano .

text: Therefore is the kingdom of heaven likened unto a certain king , which would take account of his servants .
text2: Halacotz da comparatu ceruètaco resumá beré cerbitzariequin contu eguin nahi vkan duen regue batequin .

text: And when he had begun to reckon , one was brought unto him , which owed him ten thousand talents .
text2: Eta contu eguiten hassi cenean , presenta cequión bat , hamar - milla talent hari çor ceraucanic .

text: But forasmuch as he had not to pay , his lord commanded him to be sold , and his wife , and children , and all that he had , and payment to be made .
text2: Eta ceren harc ezpaitzuen nondic paga , mana ceçan haren iaunac sal ledin hura , eta haren emaztea , eta haourrac , eta cituen gauça guciac : eta çorra paga ledin .

text: The servant therefore fell down , and worshipped him , saying , Lord , have patience with me , and I will pay thee all .
text2: Halacotz cerbitzari hunec bere buruä lurrera egotziric supplicatzen çuen hura , cioela , Iauna , auc patientia enegana , eta gucia pagaturen drauát .

text: Then the lord of that servant was moved with compassion , and loosed him , and forgave him the debt .
