text2: Orduan compassione harturic cerbitzari haren iaunac , vtzi ceçan , eta çorra quitta cieçon .

text: But the same servant went out , and found one of his fellowservants , which owed him an hundred pence : and he laid hands on him , and took him by the throat , saying , Pay me that thou owest .
text2: Baina ilkiric cerbitzari hunec eriden ceçan bere cerbitzari quidetaric bat , ehun dinero çor ceraucanic : eta hura hatzamanic ithotzen çuen , cioela , Paga neçac çor duanaz .

text: And his fellowservant fell down at his feet , and besought him , saying , Have patience with me , and I will pay thee all .
text2: Eta bere cerbitzari - quideac haren oinetara bere buruä egotziric othoitz eguiten ceraucan , cioela , Auc patientia enegana , eta gucia pagaturen drauat .

text: And he would not : but went and cast him into prison , till he should pay the debt .
text2: Baina harc etzuen eguin nahi vkan , aitzitic ioanic eçar ceçan hura presoinean , çorra paga liroeno .

text: So when his fellowservants saw what was done , they were very sorry , and came and told unto their lord all that was done .
text2: Bada ikussiric haren cerbitzari - quidéc cer eguin içan cen , triste citecen haguitz : eta ethorriric declara cieçoten bere iaunari eguin içan cen gucia .

text: Then his lord , after that he had called him , said unto him , O thou wicked servant , I forgave thee all that debt , because thou desiredst me :
text2: Orduan hura deithuric bere iaunac diotsa , Cerbitzari gaichtoá , çor hura gucia quittatu drauat , ceren othoitz eguin baitrautac :

text: Shouldest not thou also have had compassion on thy fellowservant , even as I had pity on thee ?
text2: Ez - auena hic - ere eure cerbitzari - quideaz pietate vkan behar , nic - ere hiçaz pietate vkan dudan beçala ?

text: And his lord was wroth , and delivered him to the tormentors , till he should pay all that was due unto him .
text2: Orduan asserreturic bere iaunac sargeantey hura eman ciecén , hari çor ceraucan gucia paga lieçaqueono .

text: So likewise shall my heavenly Father do also unto you , if ye from your hearts forgive not every one his brother their trespasses .
text2: Hala ene Aita ceruètan denac - ere eguinen drauçue çuey , baldin batbederac bere anayeri gogotic faltác barka ezpadietzoçue .

text: And it came to pass , that when Jesus had finished these sayings , he departed from Galilee , and came into the coasts of Judaea beyond Jordan ;
text2: Eta guertha cedin , Iesus propos hauc acabaturic parti baitzedin Galileatic , eta ethor baitzedin Iudeaco bazterretara , Iordanaren berce aldeaz .

text: And great multitudes followed him ; and he healed them there .
text2: Eta iarreiqui cequión gendetze handi , eta senda citzan han .

text: The Pharisees also came unto him , tempting him , and saying unto him , Is it lawful for a man to put away his wife for every cause ?
text2: Orduan ethor citecen harengana Phariseuac tentatzen çutela , eta ciotsatela , Vtzi ahal diro guiçonac bere emaztea eceinere causagatic ?

text: And he answered and said unto them , Have ye not read , that he which made them at the beginning made them male and female ,
text2: Baina harc ihardesten çuela erran ciecén , Eztuçue iracurri ecen Creaçaleac hatsetic eguin cituela arra eta emea ?

text: And said , For this cause shall a man leave father and mother , and shall cleave to his wife : and they twain shall be one flesh ?
text2: Eta erran çuela , Halacotz vtziren ditu guiçonac aita eta ama , eta iunctaturen çayó bere emazteari , eta içanen dirade biac haraguibat .

text: Wherefore they are no more twain , but one flesh . What therefore God hath joined together , let not man put asunder .
text2: Bada guehiagoric eztirade biga , baina haraguibat . Beraz Iaincoac iunctatu duena , guiçonac ezteçala separa .

text: They say unto him , Why did Moses then command to give a writing of divorcement , and to put her away ?
text2: Diotsate , Cergatic beraz Moysesec manatu vkan du separationeco letraren emaitera , eta haren vtzitera ?

text: He saith unto them , Moses because of the hardness of your hearts suffered you to put away your wives : but from the beginning it was not so .
text2: Dioste , Moysesec çuen bihotzeco gogortassunagatic permettitu drauçue çuen emaztén vtzitera : baina hatsetic etzén hala .

text: And I say unto you , Whosoever shall put away his wife , except it be for fornication , and shall marry another , committeth adultery : and whoso marrieth her which is put away doth commit adultery .
text2: Eta erraiten drauçuet ecen norc - ere vtziren baitu bere emaztea , paillardiçagatic baicen , eta berce batequin ezconduren baita , adulterio iauquiten duela : eta vtzi denarequin ezconduren datenac adulterio iauquiten duqueela .

text: His disciples say unto him , If the case of the man be so with his wife , it is not good to marry .
text2: Diotsate bere discipuluéc , Baldin horlaco bada guiçonaren emaztearequilaco beharquia , eztuc on ezconcea .

text: But he said unto them , All men cannot receive this saying , save they to whom it is given .
text2: Baina harc erran ciecén , Eztute guciéc ardiesten hitz haur , baina eman içan çayenéc .

text: For there are some eunuchs , which were so born from their mother ' s womb : and there are some eunuchs , which were made eunuchs of men : and there be eunuchs , which have made themselves eunuchs for the kingdom of heaven ' s sake . He that is able to receive it , let him receive it .
text2: Ecen badirade chikiratuac amaren sabeletic hala iayo içan diradenac : eta badirade chikiratuac , guiçonéz chilkiratu içan diradenac : eta badirade chikiratuac ceruétaco resumagatic bere buruäc chikiratu vkan dituztenac . Har ahal deçanac , har beça .

text: Then were there brought unto him little children , that he should put his hands on them , and pray : and the disciples rebuked them .
text2: Orduan haourtchoac presentatu içan çaizcan escuac gainean eçar lietzençat eta othoitz leguiançat : eta discipuluec mehatcha citzaten .

text: But Jesus said , Suffer little children , and forbid them not , to come unto me : for of such is the kingdom of heaven .
text2: Baina Iesusec dioste , Vtzitzaçue haourtchoac , eta enegana ethortetic eztitzaçuela empatcha : ecen hunelacoén da ceruètaco resumá .

text: And he laid his hands on them , and departed thence .
text2: Eta escuac gainean eçarri cerauztenean , parti cedin handic .

text: And , behold , one came and said unto him , Good Master , what good thing shall I do , that I may have eternal life ?
text2: Eta huná , cembeitec hurbilduric erran cieçón , Magistru oná , cer vngui eguinen dut vicitzé eternala dudançat ?

text: And he said unto him , Why callest thou me good ? there is none good but one , that is , God : but if thou wilt enter into life , keep the commandments .
text2: Eta harc erran cieçón , Cergatic deitzen nauc on ? eztuc nehor onic bat baicen , eta hura , Iaincoa : baldin vicitzean sarthu nahi bahaiz , beguiraitzac manamenduac .

text: He saith unto him , Which ? Jesus said , Thou shalt do no murder , Thou shalt not commit adultery , Thou shalt not steal , Thou shalt not bear false witness ,
text2: Diotsó , Cein ? Eta Iesusec erran ceçan Eztuc hilen , Eztuc adulteraturen , Eztuc ebatsiren , Eztuc testimoniage falsuric erranen .

text: Honour thy father and thy mother : and , Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself .
text2: Ohoraitzac aita eta ama . Eta , Onhetsiren duc eure hurcoa eure buruä beçala .

text: The young man saith unto him , All these things have I kept from my youth up : what lack I yet ?
text2: Diotsó guiçon gazteorrec , Horiac guciac beguiratu citiat neure gaztetassunetic : cer oraino falta çait ?

text: Jesus said unto him , If thou wilt be perfect , go and sell that thou hast , and give to the poor , and thou shalt have treasure in heaven : and come and follow me .
text2: Diotsó Iesusec , Baldin perfect içan nahi bahaiz , oha , sal eçac duana , eta eman iecéc paubrey : eta vkanen duc thesaurbat ceruän : eta athor , arreit niri .

text: But when the young man heard that saying , he went away sorrowful : for he had great possessions .
text2: Eta ençun çuenean guiçon gazteorrec hitz hori , ioan cedin tristeric : ecen on handiac cituen .

text: Then said Jesus unto his disciples , Verily I say unto you , That a rich man shall hardly enter into the kingdom of heaven .
text2: Orduan Iesusec erran ciecén bere discipuluey , Eguiaz erraiten drauçuet , ecen abratsa nequez sarthuren dela ceruètaco resumán .

text: And again I say unto you , It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle , than for a rich man to enter into the kingdom of God .
text2: Eta berriz diotsuet , errachago dela cablebat orratzaren chulhotic iragan dadin , ecen ez abratsa Iaincoaren resumán sar dadin .

text: When his disciples heard it , they were exceedingly amazed , saying , Who then can be saved ?
text2: Gauça hauc ençunic haren discipuluac spanta citecen haguitz , cioitela , Nor da beraz salua ahal daitenic ?

text: But Jesus beheld them , and said unto them , With men this is impossible ; but with God all things are possible .
text2: Eta Iesusec hetarat behaturic , erran ciecén , Guiçonac baithan hori impossible da : baina Iaincoa baithan gauça guciac possible dirade .

text: Then answered Peter and said unto him , Behold , we have forsaken all , and followed thee ; what shall we have therefore ?
text2: Orduan ihardesten çuela Pierrisec erran cieçón , Huná , guc vtzi citiagu gauça guciac , eta iarreiqui gaitzaizquic hiri : cer içanen da beraz gure ?

text: And Jesus said unto them , Verily I say unto you , That ye which have followed me , in the regeneration when the Son of man shall sit in the throne of his glory , ye also shall sit upon twelve thrones , judging the twelve tribes of Israel .
text2: Eta Iesusec erran ciecén , Eguiaz diotsuet , ecen çuec niri iarreiqui çaizquidatenóc , regenerationean iarriren denean guiçonaren Semea bere maiestatearen thronoan , iarriren çaretela çuec - ere hamabi thronoén gainean , iugeatzen dituçuela Israeleco hamabi leinnuac .

text: And every one that hath forsaken houses , or brethren , or sisters , or father , or mother , or wife , or children , or lands , for my name ' s sake , shall receive an hundredfold , and shall inherit everlasting life .
text2: Eta norc - ere vtzi baituque etcheric , edo anayeric , edo arrebaric , edo aita , edo ama , edo emaztea , edo haourric , edo landaric ene icenaren causaz , ehunetan hambat recebituren duela , eta vicitze eternala heretaturen .

text: But many that are first shall be last ; and the last shall be first .
text2: Baina anhitz lehen diradenac , içanen dirade azquen : eta azquenac , lehen .

text: For the kingdom of heaven is like unto a man that is an householder , which went out early in the morning to hire labourers into his vineyard .
text2: Ecen , comparatu da ceruètaco resumá aitafamilia batequin , cein ilki içan baita arguiaren beguian languile alocatzera bere mahasticotzat .

text: And when he had agreed with the labourers for a penny a day , he sent them into his vineyard .
text2: Eta languilequin accordaturic dinero batetan eguneco , igor citzan bere mahastira .

text: And he went out about the third hour , and saw others standing idle in the marketplace ,
text2: Eta ilkiric hirur orenén inguruän , ikus citzan berce alfer ceuden batzu plaçán .

text: And said unto them ; Go ye also into the vineyard , and whatsoever is right I will give you . And they went their way .
text2: Eta erran ciecén , Çoazte çuec - ere ene mahastira , eta bide datena emanen drauçuet .

text: Again he went out about the sixth and ninth hour , and did likewise .
text2: Eta hec ioan citecen . Berriz ilkiric sey eta bedratzi orenén inguruän , eguin ceçan molde berean .

text: And about the eleventh hour he went out , and found others standing idle , and saith unto them , Why stand ye here all the day idle ?
text2: Eta hameca orenen inguruän ilkiric , eriden citzan berce alfer ceuden batzu , eta dioste , Cergatic hemen çaudete egun gucian alfer ?

text: They say unto him , Because no man hath hired us . He saith unto them , Go ye also into the vineyard ; and whatsoever is right , that shall ye receive .
text2: Diotsate , Ceren nehorc ezpaiquaitu alocatu . Dioste , Çoazte çuec - ere ene mahastira , eta bide datena recebituren duçue .

text: So when even was come , the lord of the vineyard saith unto his steward , Call the labourers , and give them their hire , beginning from the last unto the first .
text2: Eta arrastu cenean , erran cieçón mahasti iabeac bere recebidoreari . Dei itzac languileac , eta paga iecéc alocairuä , hassiric azquenetaric lehenetarano .

text: And when they came that were hired about the eleventh hour , they received every man a penny .
text2: Eta ethorri ciradenean hameca orenen inguruän alocatuac recebi ceçaten dinero bana .

text: But when the first came , they supposed that they should have received more ; and they likewise received every man a penny .
text2: Eta ethorriric lehenéc - ere , vste vkan dute guehiago recebituren çutela : baina recebi ceçaten hec - ere dinero baná .

text: And when they had received it , they murmured against the goodman of the house ,
text2: Eta recebitu çutenean , murmuratzen çuten aitafamiliaren contra ,

text: Saying , These last have wrought but one hour , and thou hast made them equal unto us , which have borne the burden and heat of the day .
text2: Cioitela , Azquen hauc orembat eguin dié lanean , eta gure bardin eguin dituc , ekarri baitugu egunaren cargá , eta beroa .

text: But he answered one of them , and said , Friend , I do thee no wrong : didst not thou agree with me for a penny ?
text2: Eta harc ihardesten çuela hetaric bati erran cieçón , Adisquideá , eztrauät hiri bidegaberic eguiten : ez aiz dinero batetan enequin accordatu ?

text: Take that thine is , and go thy way : I will give unto this last , even as unto thee .
text2: Har eçac hire dena , eta habil : baina nahi diarocat azquen huni eman , hiri bay becembat .

text: Is it not lawful for me to do what I will with mine own ? Is thine eye evil , because I am good ?
text2: Ala eznaiz haiçu nahi dudanaren eguitera neure onéz ? ala hire beguia gaichto da , ceren ni on bainaiz ?

text: So the last shall be first , and the first last : for many be called , but few chosen .
text2: Hala içanen dirade azquenac , lehen : eta lehenac , azquen : ecen anhitz dirade deithuac , baina guti elegituac .

text: And Jesus going up to Jerusalem took the twelve disciples apart in the way , and said unto them ,
text2: Eta Iesusec Ierusalemera igaitean , har citzan hamabi discipuluac appart bidean , eta erran ciecén ,

text: Behold , we go up to Jerusalem ; and the Son of man shall be betrayed unto the chief priests and unto the scribes , and they shall condemn him to death ,
text2: Huná , igaiten gara Ierusalemera , eta guiçonaren Semea liuraturen çaye Sacrificadore principaley eta Scribey , eta hura condemnaturen dute hiltzera :

text: And shall deliver him to the Gentiles to mock , and to scourge , and to crucify him : and the third day he shall rise again .
text2: Eta hura dute liuraturen Gentiley , escarnia , eta açota , eta crucifica deçatençat : baina hereneco egunean resuscitaturen da .

text: Then came to him the mother of Zebedee ' s children with her sons , worshipping him , and desiring a certain thing of him .
text2: Orduan ethor cedin harengana Zebedeoren semen amá bere semequin , gurtzen , eta cerbait escatzen çayola .

text: And he said unto her , What wilt thou ? She saith unto him , Grant that these my two sons may sit , the one on thy right hand , and the other on the left , in thy kingdom .
text2: Eta harc erran cieçón , Cer nahi dun ? Diotsó , Ordena eçac iar ditecen ene bi seme hauc , bata hire escuinean , eta bercea ezquerrean , hire resumán .

text: But Jesus answered and said , Ye know not what ye ask . Are ye able to drink of the cup that I shall drink of , and to be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with ? They say unto him , We are able .
text2: Eta ihardesten çuela Iesusec erran ceçan , Eztaquiçue ceren esquez çaudeten : edan ahal diroçue nic edateco dudan copa ? Eta batheya ahal çaitezquete ni batheyaturen naicen baptismoaz ? Diotsote , Bay .

text: And he saith unto them , Ye shall drink indeed of my cup , and be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with : but to sit on my right hand , and on my left , is not mine to give , but it shall be given to them for whom it is prepared of my Father .
text2: Orduan dioste , Ene copá edanen baduçue , eta ni batheyaturen naicén baptismoaz batheyaturen baçarete : baina ene escuinean edo ezquerrean iartea , ezta ene emaiteco , baina emanen çaye ene Aitaz appainduric dauèney .

text: And when the ten heard it , they were moved with indignation against the two brethren .
text2: Eta hura ençunic berce hamarrac bekaitz citecen bi anayéz .

text: But Jesus called them unto him , and said , Ye know that the princes of the Gentiles exercise dominion over them , and they that are great exercise authority upon them .
text2: Iesusec bada hec beregana deithuric , dio , Badaquiçue ecen nationetaco princiéc seignoriatzen dutela hayen gainean : eta handiéc authoritatez vsatzen dutela hayén gaynean .

text: But it shall not be so among you : but whosoever will be great among you , let him be your minister ;
text2: Ordea ezta hala içanen çuen artean : baina nor - ere handi nahi içanen baita çuen artean , biz çuen muthil :

text: And whosoever will be chief among you , let him be your servant :
text2: Eta nor - ere nahi içanen baita çuen artean lehen içan , biz çuen cerbitzari .

text: Even as the Son of man came not to be ministered unto , but to minister , and to give his life a ransom for many .
text2: Hala nola guiçonaren Semea ezpaita ethorri cerbitzatu içatera , baina cerbitzatzera , eta bere viciaren rançoinetan anhitzengatic emaitera .

text: And as they departed from Jericho , a great multitude followed him .
text2: Eta hec Iericotic partitzen ciradela , gendetze handi iarreiqui cequión .

text: And , behold , two blind men sitting by the way side , when they heard that Jesus passed by , cried out , saying , Have mercy on us , O Lord , thou Son of David .
text2: Eta huná , bi itsu bide bazterrean ceudenec , ençunic ecen Iesus iragaiten cela , oihu eguin ceçaten , cioitela , Auc pietate guçaz Dauid - en seme Iauná .

text: And the multitude rebuked them , because they should hold their peace : but they cried the more , saying , Have mercy on us , O Lord , thou Son of David .
text2: Eta gendetzeac mehatchatzen cituen hec ichil litecençát , baina hec oihu guehiago eguiten çuten , cioitela , Auc pietate guçaz Dauid - en seme Iauná .

text: And Jesus stood still , and called them , and said , What will ye that I shall do unto you ?
text2: Eta gueldituric Iesusec dei citzan , eta erran ceçan , Cer nahi duçue daguiçuedan ?

text: They say unto him , Lord , that our eyes may be opened .
text2: Diotsote , Iauna , gure beguiac irequi ditecen .

text: So Jesus had compassion on them , and touched their eyes : and immediately their eyes received sight , and they followed him .
text2: Eta compassione harturic Iesusec hunqui citzan hayén beguiac : eta bertan ikustea recebi ceçaten hayén beguiéc , eta hari iarreiqui cequizquión .

text: And when they drew nigh unto Jerusalem , and were come to Bethphage , unto the mount of Olives , then sent Jesus two disciples ,
text2: Eta Ierusaleme aldera ciradenean , eta ethor citecenean Bethphagera , Oliuatzetaco mendi aldera , orduan Iesusec igor citzan bi discipulu ,

text: Saying unto them , Go into the village over against you , and straightway ye shall find an ass tied , and a colt with her : loose them , and bring them unto me .
text2: Erraiten cerauela , Çoazte çuen aurkaco burgura , eta bertan eridenen duçue asto emebat estecatua , eta vmebat harequin : lachaturic ekar ietzadaçue .

text: And if any man say ought unto you , ye shall say , The Lord hath need of them ; and straightway he will send them .
text2: Eta baldin nehorc deus badarraçue , erraçue ecen Iaunac behar dituela : ecen bertan igorriren ditu hec .

text: All this was done , that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the prophet , saying ,
text2: Bada haur gucia eguin içan da Prophetáz erran cena compli ledinçát , cioela ,

text: Tell ye the daughter of Sion , Behold , thy King cometh unto thee , meek , and sitting upon an ass , and a colt the foal of an ass .
text2: Erroçue Siongo alabari , Huná , eure reguea ethorten çain mansoric , eta asto emearen , eta vztarricoaren vme arraren gainean iarria .

text: And the disciples went , and did as Jesus commanded them ,
text2: Discipuluac bada ioan citecen , eta eguin ceçaten Iesusec ordenatu cerauèn beçala .

text: And brought the ass , and the colt , and put on them their clothes , and they set him thereon .
text2: Eta ekar citzaten astoa eta vmea , eta eçar citzaten hayén gainean bere abillamenduac , eta iar eraci ceçaten hayén gainean .

text: And a very great multitude spread their garments in the way ; others cut down branches from the trees , and strawed them in the way .
text2: Eta gendetze handic heda citzaten bere abillamenduac bidean , eta bercéc adarrac piccatzen cituzten arboretaric , eta bidean hedatzen .

text: And the multitudes that went before , and that followed , cried , saying , Hosanna to the Son of David : Blessed is he that cometh in the name of the Lord ; Hosanna in the highest .
text2: Eta aitzinean ioaiten eta iarreiquiten cen populua oihuz cegoen , cioela , Hosanna Dauid - en semeá : benedicatu dela Iaunaren icenean ethorten dena , Hosanna leku gorenetan aicená .

text: And when he was come into Jerusalem , all the city was moved , saying , Who is this ?
text2: Eta sarthu cenean hura Ierusalemen , ciuitate gucia moui cedin , cioela , Nor da haur ?

text: And the multitude said , This is Jesus the prophet of Nazareth of Galilee .
text2: Eta populuac erraiten çuen , Haur da Iesus Prophetá Galilean den Nazareteco .

text: And Jesus went into the temple of God , and cast out all them that sold and bought in the temple , and overthrew the tables of the moneychangers , and the seats of them that sold doves ,
text2: Eta sar cedin Iesus Iaincoaren templean , eta egotz citzan campora templean saltzen eta erosten ari ciraden guciac : eta cambiadorén mahainac itzul citzan , eta vsso colombác saltzen cituztenen cadirác .

text: And said unto them , It is written , My house shall be called the house of prayer ; but ye have made it a den of thieves .
text2: Eta dioste , Scribatua da , Ene etchea , orationetaco etche deithuren da : baina çuec hura gaichtaguin lece eguin duçue .

text: And the blind and the lame came to him in the temple ; and he healed them .
text2: Orduan ethor citecen harengana itsuac eta mainguäc templean : eta senda citzan hec .

text: And when the chief priests and scribes saw the wonderful things that he did , and the children crying in the temple , and saying , Hosanna to the Son of David ; they were sore displeased ,
text2: Baina ikussiric Sacrificadore principaléc eta Scribéc harc eguin cituen miraculuac , eta haourraco oihuz ceudela templean , eta erraiten çutela , Hosanna Dauid - en semeá : gaitzi cequién .

text: And said unto him , Hearest thou what these say ? And Jesus saith unto them , Yea ; have ye never read , Out of the mouth of babes and sucklings thou hast perfected praise ?
text2: Eta erran cieçoten , Badançuc hauc cer dioitén ? Eta Iesusec erran ciecén , Bay : eztuçue egundano iracurri , Haourrén eta edosquiten dutenén ahotic complitu vkan duc laudorioa .

text: And he left them , and went out of the city into Bethany ; and he lodged there .
text2: Eta hec vtziric , ilki cedin hiritic campora Bethaniarat : eta ostatu har ceçan han .

text: Now in the morning as he returned into the city , he hungered .
text2: Eta goicean hirirát itzultzen cela , gosse cedin .

text: And when he saw a fig tree in the way , he came to it , and found nothing thereon , but leaves only , and said unto it , Let no fruit grow on thee henceforward for ever . And presently the fig tree withered away .
text2: Eta ikussiric ficotzebat bidearen gainean , ethor cedin hartara , eta etzeçan deus hartan eriden hostoric baicen : eta diotsa , Guehiago fructuric hireganic sor eztadila seculan . Eta eyhar cedin bertan ficotzea .

text: And when the disciples saw it , they marvelled , saying , How soon is the fig tree withered away !
text2: Eta hori ikussiric discipuluéc mirets ceçaten , cioitela , Nolatan bertan eyhartu içan da ficotzea ?

text: Jesus answered and said unto them , Verily I say unto you , If ye have faith , and doubt not , ye shall not only do this which is done to the fig tree , but also if ye shall say unto this mountain , Be thou removed , and be thou cast into the sea ; it shall be done .
text2: Eta ihardesten çuela Iesusec erran ciecén , Eguiaz erraiten drauçuet , baldin fede baduçue , eta duda ezpadeçaçue , ez solament ficotzeari eguin içan çayona eguinen duçue , baina are baldin mendi huni badarroçue , Khen adi , eta iraitz adi itsassora eguinen da .

text: And all things , whatsoever ye shall ask in prayer , believing , ye shall receive .
text2: Eta cerere galde eguinen baituçue orationean sinhesten duçuela , recebituren duçue .

text: And when he was come into the temple , the chief priests and the elders of the people came unto him as he was teaching , and said , By what authority doest thou these things ? and who gave thee this authority ?
text2: Eta ethorri cenean templera , Sacrificadore principalac eta populuco Ancianoac , hura iracasten ari cela , ethor citecen harengana , cioitela , Cer authoritatez gauça horiac eguiten dituc ? eta norc hiri eman drauc authoritate hori ?

text: And Jesus answered and said unto them , I also will ask you one thing , which if ye tell me , I in like wise will tell you by what authority I do these things .
text2: Ihardesten çuela Iesusec erran ciecén , Interrogaturen çaituztet nic - ere çuec gauça batez , cein badarradaçue nic - ere erranen drauçuet , cer authoritatez gauça hauc eguiten ditudan .

text: The baptism of John , whence was it ? from heaven , or of men ? And they reasoned with themselves , saying , If we shall say , From heaven ; he will say unto us , Why did ye not then believe him ?
text2: Ioannesen Baptismoa nondic cen ? cerutic ala guiçonetaric ? Eta hec baciharducaten berac baithan , cioitela , Baldin erran badeçagu , Cerutic : erranen draucu , Cergatic bada hura eztucue sinhetsi ?

text: But if we shall say , Of men ; we fear the people ; for all hold John as a prophet .
text2: Eta baldin badarragu , Guiçonetaric : beldur gara communaren : ecen guciéc daducate Ioannes Prophetatan .

text: And they answered Jesus , and said , We cannot tell . And he said unto them , Neither tell I you by what authority I do these things .
text2: Eta ihardesten ceraucotela Iesusi , erran ceçaten , Etzeaquiagu . Erran ciecén harc - ere , Eztrauçuet nic - ere erraiten cer authoritatez gauça hauc eguiten ditudan .

text: But what think ye ? A certain man had two sons ; and he came to the first , and said , Son , go work to day in my vineyard .
text2: Baina cer irudi çaiçue , Guiçon batec cituen bi seme : eta hurbilduric lehenagana , erran ceçan , Semé habil , egun trabailla adi ene mahastian :

text: He answered and said , I will not : but afterward he repented , and went .
text2: Harc ihardesten çuela erran ceçan , Eztiat nahi : baina guero vrriquituric , ioan cedin .

text: And he came to the second , and said likewise . And he answered and said , I go , sir : and went not .
text2: Guero hurbilduric berceagana , erran cieçón halaber . Eta harc ihardesten çuela erran ceçan , Ni nihoac iauna , Eta etzedin ioan .

text: Whether of them twain did the will of his father ? They say unto him , The first . Jesus saith unto them , Verily I say unto you , That the publicans and the harlots go into the kingdom of God before you .
text2: Bi hautaric ceinec eguin çuen bere aitaren vorondatea ? Diotsate , Lehenac . Dioste Iesusec , Eguiaz erraiten drauçuet ecen publicanoac eta paillardác aitzincen çaizquiçuela Iaincoaren resumara .

text: For John came unto you in the way of righteousness , and ye believed him not : but the publicans and the harlots believed him : and ye , when ye had seen it , repented not afterward , that ye might believe him .
text2: Ecen ethorri da Ioannes çuetara iustitiazco bideaz , eta eztuçue hura sinhetsi : baina publicanoéc eta paillardéc sinhetsi vkan dute : eta çuec hori ikussiric , etzarete emendatu guero , haren sinhestera .

text: Hear another parable : There was a certain householder , which planted a vineyard , and hedged it round about , and digged a winepress in it , and built a tower , and let it out to husbandmen , and went into a far country :
text2: Berce comparationebat ençuçue . Cen aitafamiliabat , ceinec landa baitzeçan mahastibat , eta hura hessiz ingura baitzeçan , eta hartan hobibat eguin ceçan lacotzát , eta edifica ceçan dorrebat , eta aloca ciecén laborariey : eta camporat ioan cedin .

text: And when the time of the fruit drew near , he sent his servants to the husbandmen , that they might receive the fruits of it .
text2: Bada fructuén sasoina hurbildu cenean , igor citzan bere cerbitzariac laborarietara , fructuén recebitzera .

text: And the husbandmen took his servants , and beat one , and killed another , and stoned another .
text2: Eta laborariéc harturic haren cerbitzariac , bata çaurt ceçaten , eta bercea hil , eta bercea lapida .

text: Again , he sent other servants more than the first : and they did unto them likewise .
text2: Berriz igor ceçan berce cerbitzariric lehenac baino guehiago , eta hæi halaber eguin ciecén .

text: But last of all he sent unto them his son , saying , They will reverence my son .
text2: Azquenean igor ceçan hetara bere semea , erraiten çuela , Ondraturen dute ene semea .

text: But when the husbandmen saw the son , they said among themselves , This is the heir ; come , let us kill him , and let us seize on his inheritance .
text2: Baina laborariéc ikussiric semea erran ceçaten bere artean , Haur da primua , çatozte , hil deçagun haur , eta gatchetzan hunen heretageari .

text: And they caught him , and cast him out of the vineyard , and slew him .
text2: Eta harturic hura iraitz ceçaten mahastitic campora , eta hil ceçaten .

text: When the lord therefore of the vineyard cometh , what will he do unto those husbandmen ?
text2: Dathorrenean bada mahasti iabeac cer eguinen drauè laborari hæy ?

text: They say unto him , He will miserably destroy those wicked men , and will let out his vineyard unto other husbandmen , which shall render him the fruits in their seasons .
text2: Diotsate , Gaichto hec gaizqui deseguinen : eta bere sasoinean fructuac renda dietzoyoten berce laborariri bere mahastia alocaturen .

text: Jesus saith unto them , Did ye never read in the scriptures , The stone which the builders rejected , the same is become the head of the corner : this is the Lord ' s doing , and it is marvellous in our eyes ?
text2: Dioste Iesusec , Egundano eztuçue iracurri Scripturetan , Edificaçaléc arbuyatu duten harria cantoin buru eguin içan da : Haur Iaunaz eguin içan da , eta da gauça miragarria gure beguién aitzinean ?

text: Therefore say I unto you , The kingdom of God shall be taken from you , and given to a nation bringing forth the fruits thereof .
text2: Halacotz diotsuet ecen edequiren çaiçuela Iaincoaren resumá , eta emanen çayola , hartaco fructuac eguinen dituen populuari .

text: And whosoever shall fall on this stone shall be broken : but on whomsoever it shall fall , it will grind him to powder .
text2: Eta harri haren gainera eroriren dena , çathicaturen da : eta noren gainera eroriren baita , hura du chehaturen .

text: And when the chief priests and Pharisees had heard his parables , they perceived that he spake of them .
text2: Eta ençun citzatenean Sacrificadore principaléc , eta Phariseuéc haren comparationeac , eçagut ceçaten ecen heçaz minço cela .

text: But when they sought to lay hands on him , they feared the multitude , because they took him for a prophet .
text2: Eta hatzaman nahi çutelaric , populuaren beldur içan ciraden , ceren Propheta beçala hura baitzaducaten .

text: And Jesus answered and spake unto them again by parables , and said ,
text2: Orduan Iesus ihardesten çuela , berriz minça cequién comparationez , cioela .

text: The kingdom of heaven is like unto a certain king , which made a marriage for his son ,
text2: Comparatu da ceruètaco resumá , bere semearen ezteyac eguin cituen regue batequin .

text: And sent forth his servants to call them that were bidden to the wedding : and they would not come .
text2: Eta igor citzan bere cerbitzariac ezteyetara gomitatuén deitzera : baina etziraden ethorri nahi içan .

text: Again , he sent forth other servants , saying , Tell them which are bidden , Behold , I have prepared my dinner : my oxen and my fatlings are killed , and all things are ready : come unto the marriage .
text2: Berriz igor ceçan berce cerbitzariric , cioela , Erreçue gomitatuey , Huná , apprestatu dut neure barazcaria , ene cecenac eta haraquey guicenduac haraqueitatu dirade , eta gucia prest da : çatozte ezteyetara .

text: But they made light of it , and went their ways , one to his farm , another to his merchandise :
text2: Baina hec conturic eguin gabe ioan citecen : bata bere bordarat , eta bercea bere merkatalgoarát .

text: And the remnant took his servants , and entreated them spitefully , and slew them .
text2: Eta bercéc hatzamanic haren cerbitzariac iniuria eta hil citzaten .

text: But when the king heard thereof , he was wroth : and he sent forth his armies , and destroyed those murderers , and burned up their city .
text2: Eta regue ençunic hori asserré cedin : eta igorriric bere gendarmesac , deseguin citzan guicerhaile hec , eta hayen hiria erra ceçan .

text: Then saith he to his servants , The wedding is ready , but they which were bidden were not worthy .
text2: Orduan dioste bere cerbitzariey , Ezteyac prest badirade , baina gomitatu ciradenac , eztirade digne içan .

text: Go ye therefore into the highways , and as many as ye shall find , bid to the marriage .
text2: Çoazte bada bide cantoinetara , eta eridenen dituçuen guciac dei itzaçue ezteyetara .

text: So those servants went out into the highways , and gathered together all as many as they found , both bad and good : and the wedding was furnished with guests .
text2: Eta cerbitzari hec ilkiric bidetara , bil citzaten eriden cituzten guciac , hambat gaichtoac nola onac : eta bethe cedin ezteyén lekua , mahainean iarriric ceudenéz .

text: And when the king came in to see the guests , he saw there a man which had not on a wedding garment :
text2: Eta sarthu cenean regue mahainean iarriric ceudenén ikustera , ikus ceçan han guiçombat eztey arropaz veztitua etzenic .

text: And he saith unto him , Friend , how camest thou in hither not having a wedding garment ? And he was speechless .
text2: Orduan diotsa , Adisquideá , nola huna sarthu aiz eztey arropá eztuala ? Eta ahoa boça cequión .

text: Then said the king to the servants , Bind him hand and foot , and take him away , and cast him into outer darkness ; there shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth .
text2: Orduan erran ciecén reguec cerbitzariey , Oinetan eta escuetan estecaturic , ken eçaçue , eta egotzaçue campoco ilhumbera : han içanen da nigar eta hortz garrascots .

text: For many are called , but few are chosen .
text2: Ecen anhitz dirade deithuac , eta guti elegituac .

text: Then went the Pharisees , and took counsel how they might entangle him in his talk .
text2: Orduan appartaturic Phariseuéc conseillu har ceçaten nola hura hatzaman liroiten hitzean .

text: And they sent out unto him their disciples with the Herodians , saying , Master , we know that thou art true , and teachest the way of God in truth , neither carest thou for any man : for thou regardest not the person of men .
text2: Eta igorten dituzte harengana bere discipuluac Herodianoequin , dioitela , Magistruá , baceaquiagu eguiati aicela , eta Iaincoaren bidea eguiazqui iracasten duála , eta nehoren ansiaric eztuála : ecen ezago guiçonén apparentiara behá :

text: Tell us therefore , What thinkest thou ? Is it lawful to give tribute unto Caesar , or not ?
text2: Erraguc bada , cer irudi çaic ? bidezco da Cesari tributaren emaitea , ala ez ?

text: But Jesus perceived their wickedness , and said , Why tempt ye me , ye hypocrites ?
text2: Eta eçaguturic Iesusec hayen malitiá , dio , Cergatic tentatzen nauçue hypocritac ?

text: Shew me the tribute money . And they brought unto him a penny .
text2: Eracustaçue tributeco monedá . Eta hec presenta cieçoten dinerobat .

text: And he saith unto them , Whose is this image and superscription ?
text2: Eta erraiten draue , Norena da imagina haur eta scribua ?

text: They say unto him , Caesar ' s . Then saith he unto them , Render therefore unto Caesar the things which are Caesar ' s ; and unto God the things that are God ' s .
text2: Diotsate , Cesarena . Orduan erraten draue , Renda ietzoçue beraz Cesaren diradenac , Cesari : eta Iaincoaren diradenac , Iaincoari .

text: When they had heard these words , they marvelled , and left him , and went their way .
text2: Eta hori ençunic , mirets ceçaten : eta hura vtziric ioan citecen .

text: The same day came to him the Sadducees , which say that there is no resurrection , and asked him ,
text2: Egun hartan ethor citecen harengana Sadduceuac , resurrectioneric eztela dioitenac , eta interroga ceçaten ,

text: Saying , Master , Moses said , If a man die , having no children , his brother shall marry his wife , and raise up seed unto his brother .
text2: Cioitela , Magistruá , Moysesec erran dic , Baldin norbeit hil bada haourric vkan gabe , haren anayeac aliançagatic harturen du haren emaztea , eta leinu eguinen drauca bere anayeri .

text: Now there were with us seven brethren : and the first , when he had married a wife , deceased , and , having no issue , left his wife unto his brother :
text2: Eta cituán gure artean çazpi anaye : eta lehena ezconduric hil ciedián : eta leinuric etzuenaren gainean , vtzi cieçoan bere emaztea bere anayeri .

text: Likewise the second also , and the third , unto the seventh .
text2: Eta halaber bigarrenac eta hirurgarrenac , çazpigarrenerano .

text: And last of all the woman died also .
text2: Eta gucién ondoan hil ciedián emaztea - ere .

text: Therefore in the resurrection whose wife shall she be of the seven ? for they all had her .
text2: Resurrectionean bada , çazpietaric ceinen emazte içanen da ? ecen guciéc vkan dié hura .

text: Jesus answered and said unto them , Ye do err , not knowing the scriptures , nor the power of God .
text2: Eta ihardesten duela Iesusec dioste , Huts eguiten duçue Scripturác eta Iaincoaren verthutea iaquin gabez .

text: For in the resurrection they neither marry , nor are given in marriage , but are as the angels of God in heaven .
text2: Ecen resurrectionean eztu nehorc emazteric hartzen ez emaiten ezconçaz : baina dirade Iaincoaren Aingueruäc ceruän beçala .

text: But as touching the resurrection of the dead , have ye not read that which was spoken unto you by God , saying ,
text2: Eta hilén resurrectioneaz den becembatean , eztuçue iracurri cer Iaincoaz erran içan çaiçuen , dioela ,

text: I am the God of Abraham , and the God of Isaac , and the God of Jacob ? God is not the God of the dead , but of the living .
text2: Ni naiz Abrahamen Iaincoa , eta Isaac - en Iaincoa , eta Iacob - en Iaincoa ? Iaincoa , ezta hilén Iaincoa , baina viciena .

text: And when the multitude heard this , they were astonished at his doctrine .
text2: Eta hori ençunic gendetzeac spanta citecen haren doctrináz .

text: But when the Pharisees had heard that he had put the Sadducees to silence , they were gathered together .
text2: Phariseuac bada , ençunic ecen Sadduceuac ichildu cituela , bil citecen elkargana .

text: Then one of them , which was a lawyer , asked him a question , tempting him , and saying ,
text2: Eta interroga ceçan hetaric batec , Legueco doctorac , tentatzen çuela hura , eta cioela ,

text: Master , which is the great commandment in the law ?
text2: Magistruá , cein da manamendu handia Leguean ?

text: Jesus said unto him , Thou shalt love the Lord thy God with all thy heart , and with all thy soul , and with all thy mind .
text2: Eta Iesusec erran cieçón , Onhetsiren duc eure Iainco Iauna eure bihotz guciaz , eta eure arima guciaz , eta eure pensamendu guciaz .

text: This is the first and great commandment .
text2: Haur duc manamendu lehena eta handia .

text: And the second is like unto it , Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself .
text2: Eta bigarrenac hura irudi dic , Onhetsiren duc eure hurcoa eure buruä beçala .

text: On these two commandments hang all the law and the prophets .
text2: Bi manamendu hautaric Legue gucia eta Prophetác dependitzen dituc .

text: While the Pharisees were gathered together , Jesus asked them ,
text2: Eta bildu ciradenean Phariseuac , interroga citzan Iesusec ,

text: Saying , What think ye of Christ ? whose son is he ? They say unto him , The Son of David .
text2: Cioela , Cer irudi çaiçue Christez ? noren seme da ? Diotsate , Dauid - en .

text: He saith unto them , How then doth David in spirit call him Lord , saying ,
text2: Eta dioste , Nola beraz Dauid - ec Spirituz deitzen du hura Iaun ? dioela ,

text: The LORD said unto my Lord , Sit thou on my right hand , till I make thine enemies thy footstool ?
text2: Erran drauca , Iaunac ene Iaunari , Iar adi ene escuinean , eçar ditzaquedano hire etsayac hire oinén scabella .

text: If David then call him Lord , how is he his son ?
text2: Beraz baldin Dauid - ec deitzen badu hura Iaun , nola da haren seme ?

text: And no man was able to answer him a word , neither durst any man from that day forth ask him any more questions .
text2: Eta nehorc ecin ihardets cieçoyon hitzic : ez nehor etzequión ventura guehiagoric egun harçaz harat interrogatzera .

text: Then spake Jesus to the multitude , and to his disciples ,
text2: Orduan Iesus minça cequien gendetzey eta bere discipuluey .

text: Saying , The scribes and the Pharisees sit in Moses ' seat :
text2: Cioela , Moysesen cadirán iarten dirade Scribác eta Phariseuac :

text: All therefore whatsoever they bid you observe , that observe and do ; but do not ye after their works : for they say , and do not .
text2: Cerere bada erranen baitrauçue beguira deçaçuen , beguira eçaçue eta eguiçue : baina hayén obrén araura eztaguiçuela : ecen erraiten duté , eta ez eguiten .

text: For they bind heavy burdens and grievous to be borne , and lay them on men ' s shoulders ; but they themselves will not move them with one of their fingers .
text2: Ecen carga piçuac eta iassan ecin daitezquenac biltzen dituzté , eta eçarten guiçonén soinetara : baina bere erhiaz hunqui nahi eztituzté .

text: But all their works they do for to be seen of men : they make broad their phylacteries , and enlarge the borders of their garments ,
text2: Eta bere obra guciac eguiten dituzté guiçonéz ikus ditecençát : ecen çabaltzen dituzté bere philacterioac , eta luçatzen dituzté bere veztimendetaco bazterrac .

text: And love the uppermost rooms at feasts , and the chief seats in the synagogues ,
text2: Eta on darizté lehen placey banquetetan , eta lehen cadirey synagoguetan ,

text: And greetings in the markets , and to be called of men , Rabbi , Rabbi .
text2: Eta salutationey merkatuetan , eta guiçonéz deithu içateari Magistruá , Magistruá .

text: But be not ye called Rabbi : for one is your Master , even Christ ; and all ye are brethren .
text2: Baina çuec etzaiteztela dei Magistru : ecen bat da çuen doctora , Christ : eta çuec gucioc , anaye çarete .

text: And call no man your father upon the earth : for one is your Father , which is in heaven .
text2: Eta çuen aita ezteçaçuela nehor dei lurrean : ecen bat da çuen Aita , ceruètan dena .

text: Neither be ye called masters : for one is your Master , even Christ .
text2: Eta etzaiteztela dei doctor : ecen bat da çuen doctora , Christ .

text: But he that is greatest among you shall be your servant .
text2: Baina çuen artean handién dena , biz çuen cerbitzari .

text: And whosoever shall exalt himself shall be abased ; and he that shall humble himself shall be exalted .
text2: Ecen bere buruä goraturen duena , beheraturen da : eta bere buruä beheraturen duena , goraturen da .

text: But woe unto you , scribes and Pharisees , hypocrites ! for ye shut up the kingdom of heaven against men : for ye neither go in yourselves , neither suffer ye them that are entering to go in .
text2: Baina maledictione çuen gainean Scriba eta Phariseu hypocritác : ceren ersten baituçue ceruètaco resumá guiçonén aitzinean : ecen çuec etzarete sartzen , eta sartzen diradenac eztituçue vtziten sartzera .

text: Woe unto you , scribes and Pharisees , hypocrites ! for ye devour widows ' houses , and for a pretence make long prayer : therefore ye shall receive the greater damnation .
text2: Maledictione çuen gainean Scriba eta Phariseu hypocritác , ecen iresten dituçue ema alhargunén etcheac , are luçaqui othoitz eguin irudiz : halacotz duçue condemnatione handiagoa recebituren .

text: Woe unto you , scribes and Pharisees , hypocrites ! for ye compass sea and land to make one proselyte , and when he is made , ye make him twofold more the child of hell than yourselves .
text2: Maledictione çuen gainean Scriba eta Phariseu hypocritác , ecen itsassoa eta leihorra inguratzen dituçue , proselytobat daguiçuençát , eta eguin denean , gehennaco seme eguiten duçue dobláz ceuroc baino areago .

text: Woe unto you , ye blind guides , which say , Whosoever shall swear by the temple , it is nothing ; but whosoever shall swear by the gold of the temple , he is a debtor !
text2: Maledictione çuen gainean guidari itsuác , ceinéc baitioçue , Norc - ere iuraturen baitu templeaz , ezta deus : baina norc - ere iuraturen baitu templeco vrrheaz , çordun da .

text: Ye fools and blind : for whether is greater , the gold , or the temple that sanctifieth the gold ?
text2: Erhoác eta itsuác , cein da handiago vrrhea , ala vrrhea sanctificatzen duen templea ?

text: And , Whosoever shall swear by the altar , it is nothing ; but whosoever sweareth by the gift that is upon it , he is guilty .
text2: Eta erraiten duçue , norc - ere iuraturen baitu aldareaz , ezta deus : baina norc - ere iuraturen baitu haren gainean den oblationeaz , çordun da .

text: Ye fools and blind : for whether is greater , the gift , or the altar that sanctifieth the gift ?
text2: Erhoác eta itsuác , cein da handiago oblationea , ala oblationea sanctificatzen duen aldarea ?

text: Whoso therefore shall swear by the altar , sweareth by it , and by all things thereon .
text2: Beraz aldareaz iuratzen duenac , iuratzen du harçaz , eta haren gainean diraden gauça guciéz .

text: And whoso shall swear by the temple , sweareth by it , and by him that dwelleth therein .
text2: Eta norc - ere iuratzen baitu templeaz , iuratzen du harçaz , eta hartan habitatzen denaz .

text: And he that shall swear by heaven , sweareth by the throne of God , and by him that sitteth thereon .
text2: Eta iuratzen duenac ceruäz , iuratzen du Iaincoaren thronoaz eta haren gainean iarriric dagoenaz .

text: Woe unto you , scribes and Pharisees , hypocrites ! for ye pay tithe of mint and anise and cummin , and have omitted the weightier matters of the law , judgment , mercy , and faith : these ought ye to have done , and not to leave the other undone .
text2: Maledictione çuen gainean Scriba eta Phariseu hypocritác : ecen detchematzen dituçue menta eta anisa eta cuminoa , eta vtziten dituçue Legueco gauça piçuagoac , hala nola , iugemendua eta misericordia eta leyaltatea : gauça hauc eguin behar ciraden , eta hec ez vtzi .

text: Ye blind guides , which strain at a gnat , and swallow a camel .
text2: Guidari itsuác , eltzoa irazten duçue : eta camelua iresten .

text: Woe unto you , scribes and Pharisees , hypocrites ! for ye make clean the outside of the cup and of the platter , but within they are full of extortion and excess .
text2: Maledictione çuen gainean Scriba eta Phariseu hypocritác : ecen coparen eta plataren campoco aldea chahutzen duçue : baina barnetic dirade arrauberiaz , eta eccessez betheac .

text: Thou blind Pharisee , cleanse first that which is within the cup and platter , that the outside of them may be clean also .
text2: Phariseu itsuá , chahu eçac lehenic coparen eta plataren barnecoa , hayén campocoa - ere chahu dadinçát .

text: Woe unto you , scribes and Pharisees , hypocrites ! for ye are like unto whited sepulchres , which indeed appear beautiful outward , but are within full of dead men ' s bones , and of all uncleanness .
text2: Maledictione çuen gainean Scriba eta Phariseu hypocritác : ecen sepulchre churituac irudi duçue , hec campotic eder eracusten dirade : baina barnetic hilén heçurrez eta satsutassun oroz betheac dirade .

text: Even so ye also outwardly appear righteous unto men , but within ye are full of hypocrisy and iniquity .
text2: Halaber çuec - ere campotic guiçoney eracusten çarete iusto , baina barnean hypocrisiaz eta iniquitatez betheac çarete .

text: Woe unto you , scribes and Pharisees , hypocrites ! because ye build the tombs of the prophets , and garnish the sepulchres of the righteous ,
text2: Maledictione çuen gainean Scriba eta Phariseu hypocritác : ecen Prophetén sepulchreac edificatzen dituçue , eta iustoén monumentac ornatzen .

text: And say , If we had been in the days of our fathers , we would not have been partakers with them in the blood of the prophets .
text2: Eta dioçue , Baldin gure aitén egunetan içan baguina , ezquinén hayén lagun içanen Prophetén odolean .

text: Wherefore ye be witnesses unto yourselves , that ye are the children of them which killed the prophets .
text2: Halatan testificatzen duçue ceurón buruén contra , ecen Prophetác hil dituztenén seme çaretela .

text: Fill ye up then the measure of your fathers .
text2: Çuec - ere betha eçaçue çuen aitén neurria .

text: Ye serpents , ye generation of vipers , how can ye escape the damnation of hell ?
text2: Sugueác , vipera castác , nola itzuriren çaizquiote gehennaco iugemenduari ?

text: Wherefore , behold , I send unto you prophets , and wise men , and scribes : and some of them ye shall kill and crucify ; and some of them shall ye scourge in your synagogues , and persecute them from city to city :
text2: Halacotz huná , nic igorten ditut çuetara Prophetác eta Çuhurrac eta Scribác eta hetaric batzu hilen dituçue eta crucificaturen : eta hetaric batzu açotaturen dituçue çuen synagoguetan , eta persecutaturen hiritic hirira :

text: That upon you may come all the righteous blood shed upon the earth , from the blood of righteous Abel unto the blood of Zacharias son of Barachias , whom ye slew between the temple and the altar .
text2: Dathorrençát çuén gainera lurraren gainean issuri içan den odol iusto guçia , Abel iustoaren odoletic , Zacharia Barachiaren semearen odoleranocoa , cein hil vkan baituçue templearen eta aldarearen artean .

text: Verily I say unto you , All these things shall come upon this generation .
text2: Eguiaz diotsuet , ethorrico dirade gauça hauc guciac natione hunen gainera .

text: O Jerusalem , Jerusalem , thou that killest the prophets , and stonest them which are sent unto thee , how often would I have gathered thy children together , even as a hen gathereth her chickens under her wings , and ye would not !
text2: Ierusalem , Ierusalem , Prophetác hiltzen eta hiregana igorriac lapidatzen dituaná , cembatetan bildu nahi vkan ditut hire haourrac , oilloac bere chitoac hegalen azpira biltzen dituen beçala , eta ezpaituc nahi vkan ?

text: Behold , your house is left unto you desolate .
text2: Horrá , guelditzen çaiçue çuen etchea desert .

text: For I say unto you , Ye shall not see me henceforth , till ye shall say , Blessed is he that cometh in the name of the Lord .
text2: Ecen badiotsuet , eznauçue ikussiren hemendic harát derraqueçueno , Benedicatu dela Iaunaren icenean ethorten dena .

text: And Jesus went out , and departed from the temple : and his disciples came to him for to shew him the buildings of the temple .
text2: Eta templetic ilkiric Iesus retiratzen cen : eta hurbildu içan çaizcan bere discipuluac templeco edificioén hari eracustera .

text: And Jesus said unto them , See ye not all these things ? verily I say unto you , There shall not be left here one stone upon another , that shall not be thrown down .
text2: Eta Iesusec erran ciecén , Eztacusquiçue gauça hauc guciac ? eguiaz erraiten drauçuet , ezta gueldituren hemen harria harriaren gainean , deseguin eztadin .

text: And as he sat upon the mount of Olives , the disciples came unto him privately , saying , Tell us , when shall these things be ? and what shall be the sign of thy coming , and of the end of the world ?
text2: Eta hura iarriric cegoela Oliuatzetaco mendi gainean , ethor cequizquión discipuluac appart , cioitela , Erraguc , noiz gauça hauc içanen dirade ? eta cer signo hire ethortearenic eta munduaren finarenic içanen da ?

text: And Jesus answered and said unto them , Take heed that no man deceive you .
text2: Eta ihardesten çuela Iesusec erran ciecén , Beguirauçue nehorc seduci etzaitzaten .

text: For many shall come in my name , saying , I am Christ ; and shall deceive many .
text2: Ecen anhitz ethorriren dirade ene icenean , erraiten dutela , Ni naiz Christ : eta anhitz seducituren duté .

text: And ye shall hear of wars and rumours of wars : see that ye be not troubled : for all these things must come to pass , but the end is not yet .
text2: Eta ençunen dituçue guerlác eta guerla hotsac : beguirauçue trubla etzaitezten : ecen gauça hauc guciac eguin behar dirade , baina ezta oraino içanen fina .

text: For nation shall rise against nation , and kingdom against kingdom : and there shall be famines , and pestilences , and earthquakes , in divers places .
text2: Ecen altchaturen da nationea nationearen contra , eta resumá resumaren contra : eta içanen dirade içurriteac , eta gosseteac , eta lur ikaratzeac lekutic lekura .

text: All these are the beginning of sorrows .
text2: Baina hauc guciac dolore hatseac dirade .

text: Then shall they deliver you up to be afflicted , and shall kill you : and ye shall be hated of all nations for my name ' s sake .
text2: Orduan liuraturen çaituzte afflictionetara , eta hilen çaituzte , eta gende guciéz gaitz etsiac içanen çarete ene icenagatic .

text: And then shall many be offended , and shall betray one another , and shall hate one another .
text2: Eta orduan scandalizaturen dirade anhitz , eta batac bercea tradituren du , eta batac bercea gaitzetsiren du .

text: And many false prophets shall rise , and shall deceive many .
text2: Eta anhitz propheta falsu altchaturen dirade eta seducituren dute anhitz .

text: And because iniquity shall abound , the love of many shall wax cold .
text2: Eta ceren multiplicaturen baita iniquitatea , hozturen da anhitzen charitatea .

text: But he that shall endure unto the end , the same shall be saved .
text2: Baina norc perseueraturen baitu finerano , hura saluaturen da .

text: And this gospel of the kingdom shall be preached in all the world for a witness unto all nations ; and then shall the end come .
text2: Eta resumaco Euangelio haur predicaturen da mundu vniuersoan , natione guciey testimoniagetan : eta orduan ethorrico da fina .

text: When ye therefore shall see the abomination of desolation , spoken of by Daniel the prophet , stand in the holy place , ( whoso readeth , let him understand : )
text2: Dacussaçuenean bada desolationearen abominationea , Daniel prophetáz erran içan dena , leku sainduan dagoela ( iracutzen duenac adi beça )

text: Then let them which be in Judaea flee into the mountains :
text2: Orduan Iudean diratenéc , ihes albeileguite mendietarát :

text: Let him which is on the housetop not come down to take any thing out of his house :
text2: Eta etche gainean datena , ezalbeiledi iauts deusen bere etchetic eramaitera :

text: Neither let him which is in the field return back to take his clothes .
text2: Eta landán datena , ezalbeiledi guibelerat itzul bere abillamenduén hartzera .

text: And woe unto them that are with child , and to them that give suck in those days !
text2: Dohain - gaitz emazte içorrén eta eredosquiten duqueitenén egun hetan .

text: But pray ye that your flight be not in the winter , neither on the sabbath day :
text2: Othoitz eguiçue bada çuen ihes eguitea eztén neguän , ezeta Sabbath egunean .

text: For then shall be great tribulation , such as was not since the beginning of the world to this time , no , nor ever shall be .
text2: Ecen tribulatione handia orduan içanen da , nolacoric ezpaita içan munduarén hatsetic oraindrano , ez içanen .

text: And except those days should be shortened , there should no flesh be saved : but for the elect ' s sake those days shall be shortened .
text2: Eta baldin laburtu içan ezpalirade egun hec nehor salua ezlaite , baina elegituacgatic , egun hec laburturen dirade .

text: Then if any man shall say unto you , Lo , here is Christ , or there ; believe it not .
text2: Orduan baldin nehorc badarraçue , Huná hemen Christ , edo han : ezalbeitzineçate sinhets .

text: For there shall arise false Christs , and false prophets , and shall shew great signs and wonders ; insomuch that , if it were possible , they shall deceive the very elect .
text2: Ecen altchaturen dirade christ falsuac , eta propheta falsuac , eta eguinen duté signo handi eta miraculu : bay possible baliz , eleguituen - ere seducigarri .

text: Behold , I have told you before .
text2: Huná , aitzinetic erran drauçuet .

text: Wherefore if they shall say unto you , Behold , he is in the desert ; go not forth : behold , he is in the secret chambers ; believe it not .
text2: Beraz baldin nehorc erran badieçaçue , Hará , desertuan da , etzaiteztela ilki , Hará , gambratchoetan da : ezteçaçuela sinhets .

text: For as the lightning cometh out of the east , and shineth even unto the west ; so shall also the coming of the Son of man be .
text2: Ecen hala nola chistmista ilkiten baita Orientetic , eta eracusten Occidenterano : hala içanen da guiçonaren Semearen ethortea - ere .

text: For wheresoever the carcase is , there will the eagles be gathered together .
text2: Ecen non - ere içanen baita sarrasquia , hara bilduren dirade arranoac - ere .

text: Immediately after the tribulation of those days shall the sun be darkened , and the moon shall not give her light , and the stars shall fall from heaven , and the powers of the heavens shall be shaken :
text2: Eta bertan egun hetaco tribulationearen ondoan , iguzquia ilhunduren da , eta eztu emanen ilharguiac bere erguia , eta içarrac eroriren dirade cerutic , eta ceruètaco verthuteac ikaraturen dirade .

text: And then shall appear the sign of the Son of man in heaven : and then shall all the tribes of the earth mourn , and they shall see the Son of man coming in the clouds of heaven with power and great glory .
text2: Eta orduan aguerturen da guiçonaren Semearen signoa ceruän : eta orduan plaignituren dirade lurreco leinu guciac , eta ikussiren dute guiçonaren Semea datorquela ceruco hodeyetan bothere eta gloria handirequin .

text: And he shall send his angels with a great sound of a trumpet , and they shall gather together his elect from the four winds , from one end of heaven to the other .
text2: Eta igorriren ditu bere Aingueruäc trompetta soinu handirequin , eta bilduren dituzte haren elegituac laur haicetaric , ceruèn bazter batetic hayén berce bazterrererano .

text: Now learn a parable of the fig tree ; When his branch is yet tender , and putteth forth leaves , ye know that summer is nigh :
text2: Bada ficotzétic ikas eçaçue comparationea , ia haren adarra ninicatzen denean eta hostatzen , badaquiçue vdá hurbil dela .

text: So likewise ye , when ye shall see all these things , know that it is near , even at the doors .
text2: Hala çuec - ere dacusquiçuenean gauça hauc guciac , albeitzinequite écen borthan hurbil datela .

text: Verily I say unto you , This generation shall not pass , till all these things be fulfilled .
text2: Eguiaz erraiten drauçuet , eztela iraganen mende haur , gauça hauc gucioc eguin daitezqueno .

text: Heaven and earth shall pass away , but my words shall not pass away .
text2: Ceruä eta lurra iraganen dirade , baina ene hitzac eztirade iraganen .

text: But of that day and hour knoweth no man , no , not the angels of heaven , but my Father only .
text2: Baina egun harçaz eta orenaz den becembatean , nehorc eztaqui , ez ceruètaco Aingueruèc - ere , ene Aitac berac baicen .

text: But as the days of Noe were , so shall also the coming of the Son of man be .
text2: Baina nola baitziraden Noeren egunac , hala içanen da guiçonaren Semearen ethortea - ere .

text: For as in the days that were before the flood they were eating and drinking , marrying and giving in marriage , until the day that Noe entered into the ark ,
text2: Ecen hala nola dilubioaren aitzineco egunetan iaten baitzuten eta edaten , ezconcen baitziraden eta ezconçaz emaiten , Noe arkán sar cedin egunerano .

text: And knew not until the flood came , and took them all away ; so shall also the coming of the Son of man be .
text2: Eta ezpaitzeçaten eçagut dilubioa ethor cedino , eta guciac eraman citzaqueeno : hala içanen da guiçonaren Semearen ethortea - ere .

text: Then shall two be in the field ; the one shall be taken , and the other left .
text2: Orduan biga içanen dirade landán : bata recebituren da , eta bercea vtziren .

text: Two women shall be grinding at the mill ; the one shall be taken , and the other left .
text2: Biguec ehoren dute errotán : bata recebituren da , eta bercea vtziren .

text: Watch therefore : for ye know not what hour your Lord doth come .
text2: Veilla eçaçue bada , ecen eztaquiçue cer orduz çuen Iauna ethorteco den .

text: But know this , that if the goodman of the house had known in what watch the thief would come , he would have watched , and would not have suffered his house to be broken up .
text2: Eta hura iaquiçue , ecen baldin baleaqui aitafamiliác cein goait aldiz ohoina ethor leiten , veilla liroela , eta ezliroela bere etchea çulhatzera vtzi .

text: Therefore be ye also ready : for in such an hour as ye think not the Son of man cometh .
text2: Halacotz çuec - ere çaudete prest : ecen vste eztuçuen orduan guiçonaren Semea ethorriren da .

text: Who then is a faithful and wise servant , whom his lord hath made ruler over his household , to give them meat in due season ?
text2: Eta cein da cerbitzari leyala eta çuhurra , nabussiac muthillén compainiaren gaineco eçarri duena , hæy demborán vitança deyençat ?

text: Blessed is that servant , whom his lord when he cometh shall find so doing .
text2: Dohatsu da cerbitzari hura bere nabussiac dathorrenean , hala eguiten eridenen duena .

text: Verily I say unto you , That he shall make him ruler over all his goods .
text2: Eguiaz erraiten drauçuet , ecen bere on gucién gaineco hura eçarriren duela .

text: But and if that evil servant shall say in his heart , My lord delayeth his coming ;
text2: Bada baldin erran badeça cerbitzari gaichto harc bere bihotzean , Luçatzen du ene nabussiac ethortera :

text: And shall begin to smite his fellowservants , and to eat and drink with the drunken ;
text2: Eta has badadi cerbitzari lagunén cehatzen , eta iaten eta edaten hordiequin :

text: The lord of that servant shall come in a day when he looketh not for him , and in an hour that he is not aware of ,
text2: Cerbitzari haren nabussia ethorriren da harc vste eztuen egunean , eta eztaquian orenean :

text: And shall cut him asunder , and appoint him his portion with the hypocrites : there shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth .
text2: Eta bereciren du hura , eta hypocriten contuan eçarriren : han içanen da nigar eta hortz garrascots .

text: Then shall the kingdom of heaven be likened unto ten virgins , which took their lamps , and went forth to meet the bridegroom .
text2: Orduan comparaturen da ceruètaco resumá hamar virgina bere lampác harturic sposoaren aitzinera ilki diradenequin :

text: And five of them were wise , and five were foolish .
text2: Eta hetaric borçac ciraden çuhur , eta borçac erho .

text: They that were foolish took their lamps , and took no oil with them :
text2: Erhoéc , bere lampén hartzean , etzeçaten har olioric berequin .

text: But the wise took oil in their vessels with their lamps .
text2: Baina çuhurréc har ceçaten olio bere vncietan bere lampequin .

text: While the bridegroom tarried , they all slumbered and slept .
text2: Eta nola sposoac ethortera berancen baitzuen , guciac logale citecen , eta loac har citzan .

text: And at midnight there was a cry made , Behold , the bridegroom cometh ; go ye out to meet him .
text2: Eta gau - herditan oihu eguin cedin , Huná , sposoa heldu da , ilki çaitezte haren aitzinera .

text: Then all those virgins arose , and trimmed their lamps .
text2: Orduan iaiqui citecen virgina hec guciac , eta appain citzaten bere lampác .

text: And the foolish said unto the wise , Give us of your oil ; for our lamps are gone out .
text2: Eta erhoéc çuhurrey erran ciecén , Iguçue çuen oliotic : ecen gure lampác iraunguiten dirade .

text: But the wise answered , saying , Not so ; lest there be not enough for us and you : but go ye rather to them that sell , and buy for yourselves .
text2: Baina ihardets ceçaten çuhurrec , cioitela , Ez , beldurrez asco eztugun gure eta çuen : baina aitzitic çoazte saltzen dutenetara , eta erossaçue ceurondaco .

text: And while they went to buy , the bridegroom came ; and they that were ready went in with him to the marriage : and the door was shut .
text2: Eta hec erostera ioaiten ciradela , ethor cedin sposoa : eta prest ciradenac sar citecen harequin ezteyetara , eta erts cedin borthá .

text: Afterward came also the other virgins , saying , Lord , Lord , open to us .
text2: Guero bada ethorten dirade berce virginac - ere dioitela , Iauna , iauna , irequi ieçaguc .

text: But he answered and said , Verily I say unto you , I know you not .
text2: Baina harc ihardesten duela , dio , Eguiaz diotsuet , etzaituztet eçagutzen .

text: Watch therefore , for ye know neither the day nor the hour wherein the Son of man cometh .
text2: Veilla eçaçue bada : ecen eztaquiçue guiçonaren Semea ethorriren den eguna ez orena .

text: For the kingdom of heaven is as a man travelling into a far country , who called his own servants , and delivered unto them his goods .
text2: Ecen gauça haur guiçombat beçala da , ceinec lekorerat ioaitean dei baitzitzan bere cerbitzariac , eta bere onac eman baitzietzén .

text: And unto one he gave five talents , to another two , and to another one ; to every man according to his several ability ; and straightway took his journey .
text2: Eta batari eman cietzón borz talent , eta berceari biga , eta berceari bat : batbederari bere anciaren araura : eta ioan cedin lekorrerat bertan .

text: Then he that had received the five talents went and traded with the same , and made them other five talents .
text2: Eta ioan cedin borz talentac recebitu cituena , eta traffica ceçan heçaz , eta eguin citzan berce borz talent .

text: And likewise he that had received two , he also gained other two .
text2: Halaber biga recebitu cituenac - ere , irabaz citzan berce biga .

text: But he that had received one went and digged in the earth , and hid his lord ' s money .
text2: Baina bat recebitu çuenac ioanic aitzur ceçan lurrean , eta gorde ceçan bere nabussiaren diruä .

text: After a long time the lord of those servants cometh , and reckoneth with them .
text2: Eta dembora handiaren buruän ethorten da cerbitzari hayén nabussia , eta contu eguiten du hequin .

text: And so he that had received five talents came and brought other five talents , saying , Lord , thou deliveredst unto me five talents : behold , I have gained beside them five talents more .
text2: Orduan ethorriric borz talentac recebitu cituenac presenta cietzón berce borz talent , cioela , Nabussiá , borz talent eman drauzquidac , huná , berce borz talent irabaci citiat heçaz .

text: His lord said unto him , Well done , thou good and faithful servant : thou hast been faithful over a few things , I will make thee ruler over many things : enter thou into the joy of thy lord .
text2: Erran cieçón bere nabussiac , Vngui , cerbitzari oná eta leyalá : gauça gutian içan aiz leyal , anhitzaren gaineco eçarriren aut : sar adi eure nabussiaren alegrançan .

text: He also that had received two talents came and said , Lord , thou deliveredst unto me two talents : behold , I have gained two other talents beside them .
text2: Guero ethorriric bi talentac recebitu cituenac - ere diotsa , Nabussiá , bi talent eman drauzquidac , huná , berce biga irabaci citiat heçaz .

text: His lord said unto him , Well done , good and faithful servant ; thou hast been faithful over a few things , I will make thee ruler over many things : enter thou into the joy of thy lord .
text2: Erran cieçón bere nabussiac , Vngui , cerbitzari oná eta leyalá , gutiaren gainean içan aiz leyal , anhitzaren gaineco eçarriren aut : sar adi eure nabussiaren alegrançán .

text: Then he which had received the one talent came and said , Lord , I knew thee that thou art an hard man , reaping where thou hast not sown , and gathering where thou hast not strawed :
text2: Baina ethorriric talentbat recebitu çuenac - ere diotsa , Nabussiá , eçagutzen nián ecen guiçon gogorra incela , erein eztuán lekuan biltzen duala , eta barreyatu eztuán lekuan elkarganatzen duala .

text: And I was afraid , and went and hid thy talent in the earth : lo , there thou hast that is thine .
text2: Hunegatic beldurrez ioanic gorde diát hire talenta lurrean : huná , baduc eurea .

text: His lord answered and said unto him , Thou wicked and slothful servant , thou knewest that I reap where I sowed not , and gather where I have not strawed :
text2: Eta ihardesten çuela bere nabussiac erran cieçón , Cerbitzari gaichtoá eta lachoá , bahaquian ecen biltzen dudala erein eztudan lekuan : eta elkarganatzen dudala barreyatu eztudan lekuan .

text: Thou oughtest therefore to have put my money to the exchangers , and then at my coming I should have received mine own with usury .
text2: Beraz behar erauèn eman ene diruä cambiadorey , eta ethorriric nic recebitu bainuqueen neurea lucururequin .

text: Take therefore the talent from him , and give it unto him which hath ten talents .
text2: Edequi eçoçue bada huni talenta , eta emoçue hamar talentac dituenari .

text: For unto every one that hath shall be given , and he shall have abundance : but from him that hath not shall be taken away even that which he hath .
text2: Ecen duen guciari emanen çayó , eta hambat guehiago vkanen du : baina deus eztuenari , duena - ere edequiren çayó .

text: And cast ye the unprofitable servant into outer darkness : there shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth .
text2: Eta cerbitzari alferra egotzaçue lekoreco ilhunbera : han içanen da nigar eta hortz garrascots .

text: When the Son of man shall come in his glory , and all the holy angels with him , then shall he sit upon the throne of his glory :
text2: Bada guiçonaren Semea dathorrenean bere glorián , eta Aingueru saindu guciac harequin , orduan iarriren da bere gloriaren thronoan .

text: And before him shall be gathered all nations : and he shall separate them one from another , as a shepherd divideth his sheep from the goats :
text2: Eta bilduren dirade haren aitzinera natione guciac , eta bereciren ditu batac bercetaric , artzainac ardiac akerretaric beretzen dituen beçala .

text: And he shall set the sheep on his right hand , but the goats on the left .
text2: Eta eçarriren ditu ardiac bere escuinean , eta akerrac bere ezquerrean .

text: Then shall the King say unto them on his right hand , Come , ye blessed of my Father , inherit the kingdom prepared for you from the foundation of the world :
text2: Orduan erranen draue Reguec bere escuinecoey Çatozte ene Aitaren benedicatuác , hereta eçaçue munduaren fundationetic preparatu çaiçuen resumá .

text: For I was an hungred , and ye gave me meat : I was thirsty , and ye gave me drink : I was a stranger , and ye took me in :
text2: Ecen gosse içan naiz eta eman drautaçue iatera : egarri içan naiz , eta eman drautaçue edatera : arrotz nincen , eta recebitu nauçue ,

text: Naked , and ye clothed me : I was sick , and ye visited me : I was in prison , and ye came unto me .
text2: Billuci , eta veztitu nauçue : eri , eta visitatu nauçue : presoindeguian nincén , eta enegana ethorri içan çarete .

text: Then shall the righteous answer him , saying , Lord , when saw we thee an hungred , and fed thee ? or thirsty , and gave thee drink ?
text2: Orduan ihardetsiren draucate iustoéc , dioitela , Iauna , noiz ikussi augu gosseric , eta bazcatu augu : edo egarriric eta edatera eman drauagu ?

text: When saw we thee a stranger , and took thee in ? or naked , and clothed thee ?
text2: Eta noiz ikussi augu arrotz , eta recebitu augu ? edo billuci , eta veztitu augu ?

text: Or when saw we thee sick , or in prison , and came unto thee ?
text2: Edo noiz ikussi augu eri , edo presoindeguian eta ethorri gara hiregana ?

text: And the King shall answer and say unto them , Verily I say unto you , Inasmuch as ye have done it unto one of the least of these my brethren , ye have done it unto me .
text2: Eta ihardesten duela Reguec erranen draue , Eguiaz diotsuet , ene anaye chipién hautaric bati eguin draucaçuen becembatean niri eguin drautaçue :

text: Then shall he say also unto them on the left hand , Depart from me , ye cursed , into everlasting fire , prepared for the devil and his angels :
text2: Orduan erranen draue ezquerrecoy - ere , Maradicatuác , parti çaitezte eneganic seculaco sura , deabruari eta haren aingueruèy preparaturic dauenera .

text: For I was an hungred , and ye gave me no meat : I was thirsty , and ye gave me no drink :
text2: Ecen gosse içan naiz , eta eztrautaçue eman iatera : egarri içan naiz , eta eztrautaçue eman edatera .

text: I was a stranger , and ye took me not in : naked , and ye clothed me not : sick , and in prison , and ye visited me not .
text2: Arrotz nincén , eta eznauçue recebitu : billuci , eta eznauçue veztitu : eri eta presoindeguian , eta eznauçue visitatu .

text: Then shall they also answer him , saying , Lord , when saw we thee an hungred , or athirst , or a stranger , or naked , or sick , or in prison , and did not minister unto thee ?
text2: Orduan hec - ere ihardetsiren draucate , erraiten dutela , Iauna , noiz ikussi augu gosse edo egarri , edo arrotz , edo billuci , edo eri , edo presoindeguian , eta ezaugu cerbitzatu ?

text: Then shall he answer them , saying , Verily I say unto you , Inasmuch as ye did it not to one of the least of these , ye did it not to me .
text2: Orduan ihardetsiren draue , erraiten duela , Eguiaz diotsuet chipien hautaric bati eguin eztraucaçuen becembatean , niri - ere eztrautaçue eguin .

text: And these shall go away into everlasting punishment : but the righteous into life eternal .
text2: Eta ioanen dirade hauc tormenta eternalera : baina iustoac vicitze eternalera .

text: And it came to pass , when Jesus had finished all these sayings , he said unto his disciples ,
text2: Eta guertha cedin acabatu cituenean Iesusec propos hauc guciac , erran baitziecén bere discipuluey .

text: Ye know that after two days is the feast of the passover , and the Son of man is betrayed to be crucified .
text2: Badaquiçue ecen bi egunen buruän Bazco eguiten dela , eta guiçonaren Semea tradituren dela crucifica dadinçat .

text: Then assembled together the chief priests , and the scribes , and the elders of the people , unto the palace of the high priest , who was called Caiaphas ,
text2: Orduan bildu içan dirade Sacrificadore principalac eta Scribác eta populuco Ancianoac Sacrificadore principal Caiphas deitzen denaren salara .

text: And consulted that they might take Jesus by subtilty , and kill him .
text2: Eta conseillu eduqui ceçaten fineciaz Iesusen hatzamaiteco eta hiltzeco .

text: But they said , Not on the feast day , lest there be an uproar among the people .
text2: Baina erraiten çuten , Ez bestán , tumultoric eztençát populuaren artean .

text: Now when Jesus was in Bethany , in the house of Simon the leper ,
text2: Eta Iesus Bethanian Simon sorhayoaren etchean cela ,

text: There came unto him a woman having an alabaster box of very precious ointment , and poured it on his head , as he sat at meat .
text2: Ethor cedin harengana emaztebat , boeytabat vnguentu precio handitacoric çuela , eta huts ceçan , hura iarriric egon eta , haren buru gainera .

text: But when his disciples saw it , they had indignation , saying , To what purpose is this waste ?
text2: Eta hori ikussiric , haren discipuluey gaitzi cequién cioitela , Certaco da goastu haur ?

text: For this ointment might have been sold for much , and given to the poor .
text2: Ecen vnguentu haur precio handitan saldu ahal çatequeen , eta eman paubrey .

text: When Jesus understood it , he said unto them , Why trouble ye the woman ? for she hath wrought a good work upon me .
text2: Eta hori eçaguturic Iesusec dioste , Cergatic fatigatzen duçue emazte haur ? ecen obra ombat enegana obratu du .

text: For ye have the poor always with you ; but me ye have not always .
text2: Ecen bethiere paubreac vkanen dituçue çuequin : baina ni eznauçue bethi vkanen .

text: For in that she hath poured this ointment on my body , she did it for my burial .
text2: Ecen hunec vnguentu hunen ene corputz gainera hustea ene ohorztecotzát eguin du .

text: Verily I say unto you , Wheresoever this gospel shall be preached in the whole world , there shall also this , that this woman hath done , be told for a memorial of her .
text2: Eguiaz erraiten drauçuet , non - ere predicaturen baita Euangelio haur mundu gucian , hunec eguin duena - ere contaturen da hunen memoriotan .

text: Then one of the twelve , called Judas Iscariot , went unto the chief priests ,
text2: Orduan ioan içan da hamabietaric bat Iudas Iscariot deitzen cena , Sacrificadore principaletara .

text: And said unto them , What will ye give me , and I will deliver him unto you ? And they covenanted with him for thirty pieces of silver .
text2: Eta dioste , Cer eman nahi drautaçue , eta nic hura çuey liuraturen baitrauçuet ? Eta hec assigna cietzóten hoguey eta hamar diru peça .

text: And from that time he sought opportunity to betray him .
text2: Eta gueroztic aicina bilha çabilan , hura tradi leçançat .

text: Now the first day of the feast of unleavened bread the disciples came to Jesus , saying unto him , Where wilt thou that we prepare for thee to eat the passover ?
text2: Eta altchagarri gaberico oguién bestaco lehen egunean ethor citecen discipuluac Iesusgana , ciotsatela , Non nahi duc appain diaçágun iatera Bazcoa ?

text: And he said , Go into the city to such a man , and say unto him , The Master saith , My time is at hand ; I will keep the passover at thy house with my disciples .
text2: Eta harc erran ciecen , Çoazte hirira edoceingana , eta erroçue , Magistruac cioc , Ene demborá hurbil duc , hi baithan eguinen diat Bazcoa neure discipuluequin ,

text: And the disciples did as Jesus had appointed them ; and they made ready the passover .
text2: Eta discipuluéc eguin ceçaten Iesusec ordenatu cerauen beçala , eta appain ceçaten Bazcoa .

text: Now when the even was come , he sat down with the twelve .
