text2: Bada arrastu cenean , iar cedin mahainean hamabiequin .

text: And as they did eat , he said , Verily I say unto you , that one of you shall betray me .
text2: Eta hec alha ciradela , erran ceçan , Eguiaz erraiten drauçuet , ecen çuetaric batec tradituren nauela .

text: And they were exceeding sorrowful , and began every one of them to say unto him , Lord , is it I ?
text2: Orduan triste citecen haguitz , eta has cequión hetaric batbedera erraiten , Ala ni naiz , Iauna ?

text: And he answered and said , He that dippeth his hand with me in the dish , the same shall betray me .
text2: Baina harc ihardesten çuela erran ceçan , Norc eçarten baitu enequin escua trempatzeco platean , harc tradituren nau .

text: The Son of man goeth as it is written of him : but woe unto that man by whom the Son of man is betrayed ! it had been good for that man if he had not been born .
text2: Segur , guiçonaren Semea badoa harçaz scribatua den beçala : baina maledictione guiçon haren gainean ceinez guiçonaren Semea traditzen baita : on çuqueen guiçon harc baldin sorthu içan ezpaliz .

text: Then Judas , which betrayed him , answered and said , Master , is it I ? He said unto him , Thou hast said .
text2: Eta ihardesten çuela Iudasec , ceinec hura traditzen baitzuen , erran ceçan , Magistruá , ni naiz ? Diotsa , Hic erran duc .

text: And as they were eating , Jesus took bread , and blessed it , and brake it , and gave it to the disciples , and said , Take , eat ; this is my body .
text2: Eta hec alha ciradela har ceçan Iesusec oguia , eta gratiác rendaturic , hauts ceçan , eta eman ciecén bere discipuluey , eta erran , Har eçaçue , ian eçaçue , haur da ene gorputza .

text: And he took the cup , and gave thanks , and gave it to them , saying , Drink ye all of it ;
text2: Eta harturic copá , eta gratiac rendaturic , eman ciecén , erraiten çuela , Edan eçaçue hunetaric gucióc .

text: For this is my blood of the new testament , which is shed for many for the remission of sins .
text2: Ecen haur da ene odol Testamentu berricoa anhitzengatic issurten dena bekatuén barkamendutan .

text: But I say unto you , I will not drink henceforth of this fruit of the vine , until that day when I drink it new with you in my Father ' s kingdom .
text2: Eta badiotsuet , ecen eztudala edanen hemendic harát aihen fructu hunetaric , çuequin berriric neure Aitaren resumán hura edanen dudan egunerano .

text: And when they had sung an hymn , they went out into the mount of Olives .
text2: Eta canticoa erranic ioan citecen Oliuatzetaco mendirát .

text: Then saith Jesus unto them , All ye shall be offended because of me this night : for it is written , I will smite the shepherd , and the sheep of the flock shall be scattered abroad .
text2: Orduan dioste Iesusec , Çuec gucióc gau hunetan scandalizaturen çarete nitan : ecen scribatua da , Ioren dut artzaina , eta barreyaturen dirade arthaldeco ardiac .

text: But after I am risen again , I will go before you into Galilee .
text2: Baina resuscita nadin ondoan , çuen aitzinean ioanen naiz Galileara .

text: Peter answered and said unto him , Though all men shall be offended because of thee , yet will I never be offended .
text2: Eta ihardesten duela Pierrisec diotsa , Guciac hitan scandaliza baditez - ere , ni iagoitic ezniaitec scandaliza .

text: Jesus said unto him , Verily I say unto thee , That this night , before the cock crow , thou shalt deny me thrice .
text2: Diotsa Iesusec , Eguiaz erraiten drauat , ecen gau hunetan oillarrac io deçan baino lehen hiruretan vkaturen nauäla .

text: Peter said unto him , Though I should die with thee , yet will I not deny thee . Likewise also said all the disciples .
text2: Diotsa Pierrisec , Are baldin hirequin hiltzera behar badaquit - ere , ez aut vkaturen . Halaber discipulu guciec - ere erran ceçaten .

text: Then cometh Jesus with them unto a place called Gethsemane , and saith unto the disciples , Sit ye here , while I go and pray yonder .
text2: Orduan ethor cedin Iesus hequin Gethsemane deitzen den leku batetara : eta dioste discipuluey , Iar çaitezte hemen , harache ioanic othoitz daididano .

text: And he took with him Peter and the two sons of Zebedee , and began to be sorrowful and very heavy .
text2: Eta harturic Pierris eta Zebedeoren bi semeac , has cedin tristetzen eta guciz keichatzen .

text: Then saith he unto them , My soul is exceeding sorrowful , even unto death : tarry ye here , and watch with me .
text2: Orduan dioste Iesusec , Alde gucietaric triste da ene arima heriorano : çaudete hemen , eta veilla eçaçue enequin .

text: And he went a little further , and fell on his face , and prayed , saying , O my Father , if it be possible , let this cup pass from me : nevertheless not as I will , but as thou wilt .
text2: Eta aitzinachiago ioanic , ahozpez iar cedin , othoitz eguiten çuela , eta cioela , Ene Aitá , baldin possible bada , iragan bedi eneganic copa haur : guciagatic - ere ez nola nic nahi baitut , baina nola hic .

text: And he cometh unto the disciples , and findeth them asleep , and saith unto Peter , What , could ye not watch with me one hour ?
text2: Guero ethorten da discipuluetara , eta erideiten ditu lo daunçala : eta diotsa Pierrisi , Horrela orembat ecin veillatu duçue enequin ?

text: Watch and pray , that ye enter not into temptation : the spirit indeed is willing , but the flesh is weak .
text2: Veilla eçaçue eta othoitz eguiçue , sar etzaitezten tentationetan : ecen spiritua prompto da , baina haraguia flacu .

text: He went away again the second time , and prayed , saying , O my Father , if this cup may not pass away from me , except I drink it , thy will be done .
text2: Berriz bigarren aldian ioan cedin , eta othoitz eguin ceçan , erraiten çuela , Ene Aitá , baldin possible ezpada copa haur iragan dadin eneganic , hura edaten dudala baicen : eguin bedi hire vorondatea .

text: And he came and found them asleep again : for their eyes were heavy .
text2: Guero itzuliric erideiten ditu berriz lo daunçala : ecen hayen beguiac sorthatuac ciraden .

text: And he left them , and went away again , and prayed the third time , saying the same words .
text2: Eta vtziric hec , berriz ioan cedin , eta othoitz eguin ceçan heren aldian , hitz berac erraiten cituela .

text: Then cometh he to his disciples , and saith unto them , Sleep on now , and take your rest : behold , the hour is at hand , and the Son of man is betrayed into the hands of sinners .
text2: Orduan ethorten da bere discipuluetara , eta dioste , Lo eguiçue gaurguero , eta reposa çaitezte : huná , hurbildu da orena , eta guiçonaren Semea liuratzen da gaichtoén escuetara .

text: Rise , let us be going : behold , he is at hand that doth betray me .
text2: Iaiqui çaitezte , goacen : huná , hurbildu da ni traditzen nauena .

text: And while he yet spake , lo , Judas , one of the twelve , came , and with him a great multitude with swords and staves , from the chief priests and elders of the people .
text2: Eta hura oraino minço cela , huná , Iudas hamabietaric bat , ethor cedin , eta harequin gendetze handia ezpatequin eta vhequin , Sacrificadore principalén eta populuco Ancianoén partez .

text: Now he that betrayed him gave them a sign , saying , Whomsoever I shall kiss , that same is he : hold him fast .
text2: Eta hura traditzen çuenac , eman cerauen seignale , cioela , Nori - ere pot eguinen baitraucat , hura da : çatchetzate hari .

text: And forthwith he came to Jesus , and said , Hail , master ; and kissed him .
text2: Eta bertan hurbilduric Iesusgana , erran ceçan , Magistruá , Vngui hel daquiala . Eta pot eguin cieçón .

text: And Jesus said unto him , Friend , wherefore art thou come ? Then came they , and laid hands on Jesus , and took him .
text2: Orduan Iesusec erran cieçón Adisquideá , certan aiz hemen ? Orduan hurbilduric eçar citzaten escuac Iesusen gainean , eta lot cequizquión .

text: And , behold , one of them which were with Jesus stretched out his hand , and drew his sword , and struck a servant of the high priest ' s , and smote off his ear .
text2: Eta huná , Iesusequin ciradenetaric batec , auançaturic escua , idoqui ceçan bere ezpatá , eta ioric Sacrificadore principalaren cerbitzaria , edequi cieçón beharria .

text: Then said Jesus unto him , Put up again thy sword into his place : for all they that take the sword shall perish with the sword .
text2: Orduan diotsa Iesusec , Itzul eçac eure ezpatá bere lekura : ecen ezpata harturen duten guciac , ezpataz hilen dituc .

text: Thinkest thou that I cannot now pray to my Father , and he shall presently give me more than twelve legions of angels ?
text2: Vste duc ecin othoitz daidiodala orain neure Aitari , eta baitinguzquet bertan hamabi legione baino guehiago Aingueru ?

text: But how then shall the scriptures be fulfilled , that thus it must be ?
text2: Nolatan beraz compli litezque Scripturác , diotenean , ecen hunela behar dela eguin ?

text: In that same hour said Jesus to the multitudes , Are ye come out as against a thief with swords and staves for to take me ? I sat daily with you teaching in the temple , and ye laid no hold on me .
text2: Ordu hartan berean erran ciecén Iesusec gendetzey , Gaichtaguin baten ondoan beçala ilki içan çarete ezpatequin eta vhequin , ene hatzamaitera : egun oroz çuen artean iarten nincén , iracasten ari nincela templean , eta eznauçue hatzaman .

text: But all this was done , that the scriptures of the prophets might be fulfilled . Then all the disciples forsook him , and fled .
text2: Baina haur gucia eguin içan da , compli litecençat Prophetén Scripturác . Orduan discipulu guciéc , hura abandonnaturic , ihes eguin ceçaten .

text: And they that had laid hold on Jesus led him away to Caiaphas the high priest , where the scribes and the elders were assembled .
text2: Baina Iesus , hatzaman çutenéc , eraman ceçaten Caiphas Sacrificadore subiranoagana , non Scribác eta Ancianoac bilduac baitziraden .

text: But Peter followed him afar off unto the high priest ' s palace , and went in , and sat with the servants , to see the end .
text2: Eta Pierris iarreiquiten çayón vrrundanic Sacrificadore subiranoaren salarano , eta barnera sarthuric , iar cedin cerbitzariequin , fina ikus leçançát .

text: Now the chief priests , and elders , and all the council , sought false witness against Jesus , to put him to death ;
text2: Eta Sacrificadore principalac eta Ancianoac eta conseillu gucia testimoniage falsu bilha çabiltzan Iesusen contra , hil eraci leçatençát :

text: But found none : yea , though many false witnesses came , yet found they none . At the last came two false witnesses ,
text2: Eta etzeçaten eriden : eta anhitz testimonio falsu ethorri bacen - ere etzeçaten eriden moldezcoric . Baina finean ethorriric bi testimonio falsuc erran ceçaten ,

text: And said , This fellow said , I am able to destroy the temple of God , and to build it in three days .
text2: Hunec erran du , Deseguin ahal dirot Iaincoaren templea , eta hirur egunez hura reedifica .

text: And the high priest arose , and said unto him , Answerest thou nothing ? what is it which these witness against thee ?
text2: Orduan iaiquiric Sacrificadore subiranoac erran cieçón , Eztuc deus ihardesten ? cer da hauc hire contra testificatzen dutena ?

text: But Jesus held his peace . And the high priest answered and said unto him , I adjure thee by the living God , that thou tell us whether thou be the Christ , the Son of God .
text2: Eta Iesus ichilic cegoen . Orduan ihardesten duela Sacrificadore subiranoac diotsa , Adiuratzen aut Iainco viciaren partez , erran dieçaguán , eya hi aicenez Christ Iaincoaren Semea .

text: Jesus saith unto him , Thou hast said : nevertheless I say unto you , Hereafter shall ye see the Son of man sitting on the right hand of power , and coming in the clouds of heaven .
text2: Diotsa Iesusec , Hic erran duc : baina are diotsuet , Hemendic harat ikussiren duçue guiçonaren Semea iarriric dagoela Iaincoaren botherearen escuinean , eta ceruco hodeyetan ethorten dela .

text: Then the high priest rent his clothes , saying , He hath spoken blasphemy ; what further need have we of witnesses ? behold , now ye have heard his blasphemy .
text2: Orduan Sacrificadore subiranoac erdira citzan bere abillamenduac , erraiten çuela , Blasphematu du , cer guehiago testimonio behar dugu ? huná , orain ençun vkan duçue hunen blasphemioa .

text: What think ye ? They answered and said , He is guilty of death .
text2: Cer irudi çaiçue ? Eta hec ihardesten çutela , erran ceçaten . Hil mereci du .

text: Then did they spit in his face , and buffeted him ; and others smote him with the palms of their hands ,
text2: Orduan thu eguin cieçoten beguithartera , eta buffeta ceçaten , eta bercéc cihorréz vkaldi eman cieçoten ,

text: Saying , Prophesy unto us , thou Christ , Who is he that smote thee ?
text2: Cioitela , Christ , prophetiza ieçaguc , nor den io auena .

text: Now Peter sat without in the palace : and a damsel came unto him , saying , Thou also wast with Jesus of Galilee .
text2: Eta Pierris iarriric cegoén lekorean salán : eta ethor cequión nescatobat , cioela , Hi - ere Iesus Galileanoarequin incén .

text: But he denied before them all , saying , I know not what thou sayest .
text2: Baina harc vka ceçan gucién aitzinean , cioela , Etzeaquinat cer dionán .

text: And when he was gone out into the porch , another maid saw him , and said unto them that were there , This fellow was also with Jesus of Nazareth .
text2: Eta hura corralerat ilkiten cela ikus ceçan berce nescato batec : eta erran ciecén han ciradeney , Haur - ere Iesus Nazarenorequin cen .

text: And again he denied with an oath , I do not know the man .
text2: Eta berriz vka ceçan iuramendurequin , cioela , Ezteçagut guiçona .

text: And after a while came unto him they that stood by , and said to Peter , Surely thou also art one of them ; for thy speech bewrayeth thee .
text2: Eta appur - baten buruän ethor citecen present içan ciradenac , eta erran cieçoten Pierrisi , Eguiazqui hi - ere hetaric aiz : ecen eure minçatzeac - ere declaratzen au .

text: Then began he to curse and to swear , saying , I know not the man . And immediately the cock crew .
text2: Orduan has cedin maradicatzen eta arnegatzen , cioela , Ezteçagut guiçona . Eta bertan oillarrac io ceçan .

text: And Peter remembered the word of Jesus , which said unto him , Before the cock crow , thou shalt deny me thrice . And he went out , and wept bitterly .
text2: Orduan orhoit cedin Pierris Iesusec erran ceraucan hitzaz , ceinec erran baitzeraucan , Oillarrac io deçan baino lehen , hiruretan vkaturen nauc . Eta camporat ilkiric nigar eguin ceçan mingui .

text: When the morning was come , all the chief priests and elders of the people took counsel against Jesus to put him to death :
text2: Guero goiça ethorri cenean , conseillu eduqui ceçaten Sacrificadore principal eta populuco Anciano guciéc Iesusen contra , hura heriotara eman leçatençat .

text: And when they had bound him , they led him away , and delivered him to Pontius Pilate the governor .
text2: Eta estecaturic eraman ceçaten , eta liura cieçoten Pontio Pilate gobernadoreari .

text: Then Judas , which had betrayed him , when he saw that he was condemned , repented himself , and brought again the thirty pieces of silver to the chief priests and elders ,
text2: Orduan Iudasec , hura traditu çuenac , çacussanean hura condemnatu cela vrriquituric , itzul cietzén hoguey eta hamar diruäc Sacrificadore principaley eta Ancianoey .

text: Saying , I have sinned in that I have betrayed the innocent blood . And they said , What is that to us ? see thou to that .
text2: Cioela , Bekatu eguin dut , odol innocentaren traditzeaz . Baina hec erran ceçaten , Cer dohacu guri ? hic dacussála .

text: And he cast down the pieces of silver in the temple , and departed , and went and hanged himself .
text2: Eta diruäc iraitziric templean , retira cedin , eta ioanic , vrka ceçan bere buruä .

text: And the chief priests took the silver pieces , and said , It is not lawful for to put them into the treasury , because it is the price of blood .
text2: Orduan Sacrificadore principalec diruäc harturic erran ceçaten , Ezta sori hauc thesaurean eçar ditecen , ecen odol precioa da .

text: And they took counsel , and bought with them the potter ' s field , to bury strangers in .
text2: Eta conseillu harturic , eros ceçaten heçaz topinaguile baten landá estrangeren ohortz leku .

text: Wherefore that field was called , The field of blood , unto this day .
text2: Halacotz deithu içan da landa hura , odol - landa , egungo egunerano .

text: Then was fulfilled that which was spoken by Jeremy the prophet , saying , And they took the thirty pieces of silver , the price of him that was valued , whom they of the children of Israel did value ;
text2: Orduan compli cedin Hieremias prophetáz erran içan cena , cioela , Eta hartu vkan dituzté hoguey eta hamar diruäc , estimatu içan denaren precioa , cein estimatu içan baita Israeleco haourréz :

text: And gave them for the potter ' s field , as the Lord appointed me .
text2: Eta eman dituzte hec tupinaguile baten landaren erosteco , Iaunac niri ordenatu cerautan beçala .

text: And Jesus stood before the governor : and the governor asked him , saying , Art thou the King of the Jews ? And Jesus said unto him , Thou sayest .
text2: Eta Iesus eraman cedin Gobernadorearen aitzinera , eta interroga ceçan Gobernadoreac , cioela , Hi aiz Iuduén Reguea ? Iesusec erran cieçón , Hic dioc .

text: And when he was accused of the chief priests and elders , he answered nothing .
text2: Eta accusatu içanic Sacrificadore principaléz eta Ancianoéz , deus etzeçan ihardets .

text: Then said Pilate unto him , Hearest thou not how many things they witness against thee ?
text2: Orduan diotsa Pilatec , Eztançuc cembat gauça hire contra testificatzen duten ?

text: And he answered him to never a word ; insomuch that the governor marvelled greatly .
text2: Eta etzieçón ihardets hitz batetara - ere : hala non miresten baitzuen Gobernadoreac haguitz .

text: Now at that feast the governor was wont to release unto the people a prisoner , whom they would .
text2: Bada bestán costumatu çuen Gobernadoreac populuari beréc nahi çutén presoner baten largatzera .

text: And they had then a notable prisoner , called Barabbas .
text2: Eta orduan baçutén presoner notablebat , Barabbas deitzen cenic .

text: Therefore when they were gathered together , Pilate said unto them , Whom will ye that I release unto you ? Barabbas , or Jesus which is called Christ ?
text2: Bildu ciradenean bada hec , erran ciecén Pilatec , Cein nahi duçue larga dieçaçuedan ? Barabbas , ala Iesus , deitzen dena Christ ?

text: For he knew that for envy they had delivered him .
text2: Ecen baceaquian inuidiaz hura liuratu çutela .

text: When he was set down on the judgment seat , his wife sent unto him , saying , Have thou nothing to do with that just man : for I have suffered many things this day in a dream because of him .
text2: Eta hura alki iudicialean iarriric cegoela , igor cieçón bere emazteac , cioela , Eztuála hic deus iusto horrequin , ecen anhitz iragan diat egun ametsetaric horrengatic .

text: But the chief priests and elders persuaded the multitude that they should ask Barabbas , and destroy Jesus .
text2: Orduan Sacrificadore principaléc eta Ancianoéc burutan eman cieçoten populuari Barabbasen esca litecen , eta Iesus hil eraci leçaten .

text: The governor answered and said unto them , Whether of the twain will ye that I release unto you ? They said , Barabbas .
text2: Eta ihardesten çuela Gobernadoreac erran ciecén , Biotaric cein nahi duçue larga dieçaçuedan ? Eta hec erran cieçoten , Barabbas .

text: Pilate saith unto them , What shall I do then with Jesus which is called Christ ? They all say unto him , Let him be crucified .
text2: Erran ciecén Pilatec , Cer eguinen dut beraz Iesusez Christ deitzen denaz ? Diotsate guciéc , Crucifica bedi .

text: And the governor said , Why , what evil hath he done ? But they cried out the more , saying , Let him be crucified .
text2: Eta Gobernadoreac dioste , Baina cer gaizqui eguin du ? Orduan hec ohiu guehiago eguiten çutén , erraiten çutela , Crucifica bedi .

text: When Pilate saw that he could prevail nothing , but that rather a tumult was made , he took water , and washed his hands before the multitude , saying , I am innocent of the blood of this just person : see ye to it .
text2: Eta ikussiric Pilatec ecen etzuela deus probetchatzen , baina tumultoa handitzenago cela , vr harturic ikuz citzan escuac populuaren aitzinean , cioela , Innocent naiz ni iusto hunen odoletic : çuec ikussaçue .

text: Then answered all the people , and said , His blood be on us , and on our children .
text2: Eta ihardesten çuela populu guciac erran ceçan , Horren odola dela gure gainean eta gure haourren gainean .

text: Then released he Barabbas unto them : and when he had scourged Jesus , he delivered him to be crucified .
text2: Orduan larga ciecén Barabbas : eta Iesus açotaturic liura ciecén crucifica ledinçát .

text: Then the soldiers of the governor took Jesus into the common hall , and gathered unto him the whole band of soldiers .
text2: Orduan gobernadorearen gendarmeséc eramanic Iesus pretoriora , bil ceçaten haren aitzinera banda gucia .

text: And they stripped him , and put on him a scarlet robe .
text2: Eta billuci çutenean eman cieçoten soinera escarlatazco mantobat .

text: And when they had platted a crown of thorns , they put it upon his head , and a reed in his right hand : and they bowed the knee before him , and mocked him , saying , Hail , King of the Jews !
text2: Eta elhorrizco coroabat plegaturic eçar ceçaten haren buru gainean , eta canaberabat haren escuinean : eta haren aitzinean belhauricatuz truffatzen ciraden harçaz erraiten çutela , Vngui hel daquiala , Iuduen Regueá .

text: And they spit upon him , and took the reed , and smote him on the head .
text2: Eta thu eguinic haren contra , har ceçaten canabera hura , eta haren buruäri ceraunsaten .

text: And after that they had mocked him , they took the robe off from him , and put his own raiment on him , and led him away to crucify him .
text2: Guero harçaz truffatu ciradenean , eraunz cieçoten mantoa , eta vezti ceçaten bere abillamenduez : eta eraman ceçaten crucificatzera .

text: And as they came out , they found a man of Cyrene , Simon by name : him they compelled to bear his cross .
text2: Eta ilki ciradenean eriden ceçaten guiçon Cyreniano Simon deitzen cembat : haur bortcha ceçaten haren crutzearen eramaitera .

text: And when they were come unto a place called Golgotha , that is to say , a place of a skull ,
text2: Eta ethorri ciradenean Golgotha deitzen den lekura ( cein erran nahi baita hambat nola bur - heçur lekua )

text: They gave him vinegar to drink mingled with gall : and when he had tasted thereof , he would not drink .
text2: Eman cieçoten vinagre edatera behaçunarequin nahastecaturic : eta dastatu çuenean etzuen edan nahi vkan .

text: And they crucified him , and parted his garments , casting lots : that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the prophet , They parted my garments among them , and upon my vesture did they cast lots .
text2: Eta crucificatu çutenean parti citzaten haren abillamenduac , çorthe egotziric : compli ledinçát Prophetáz erran cena , Partitu vkan dituzte ene abillamenduac , eta ene arroparen gainean çorthe egotzi vkan duté .

text: And sitting down they watched him there ;
text2: Eta iarriric ceudela beguiratzen çutén hurá han .

text: And set up over his head his accusation written , THIS IS JESUS THE KING OF THE JEWS .
text2: Eta eçar ceçaten haren buru garayan haren causá scribaturic , HAVR DA IESVS IVDVEN REGVEA .

text: Then were there two thieves crucified with him , one on the right hand , and another on the left .
text2: Orduan crucificatu içan dirade harequin bi gaichtaguin bata escuinetic eta bercea ezquerretic .

text: And they that passed by reviled him , wagging their heads ,
text2: Eta iragaiten ciradenéc iniuriatzen çuten hura , bere buruäc higuitzen cituztela ,

text: And saying , Thou that destroyest the temple , and buildest it in three days , save thyself . If thou be the Son of God , come down from the cross .
text2: Eta cioitela , Hic templea deseguiten duanorrec , eta hirur egunez edificatzen , empara eçac eure buruä : baldin Iaincoaren Semea bahaiz , iauts adi crutzetic .

text: Likewise also the chief priests mocking him , with the scribes and elders , said ,
text2: Halaber Sacrificadore principaléc - ere truffatzen ciradela Scribequin eta Ancianoequin , erraiten çutén .

text: He saved others ; himself he cannot save . If he be the King of Israel , let him now come down from the cross , and we will believe him .
text2: Berceac emparatu ditu , bere buruä ecin empara diro : baldin Israeleco Regue bada , iauts bedi orain crutzetic , eta sinhetsiren dugu hori .

text: He trusted in God ; let him deliver him now , if he will have him : for he said , I am the Son of God .
text2: Fida da Iaincoa baithan , empara beça orain , baldin haren gogaraco bada : ecen erran du , Iaincoaren Semea naiz .

text: The thieves also , which were crucified with him , cast the same in his teeth .
text2: Hura bera , harequin crucificatu ciraden gaichtaguinec - ere reprotchatzen ceraucaten .

text: Now from the sixth hour there was darkness over all the land unto the ninth hour .
text2: Baina sey orenetaric bedratzi orenetarano lur guciaren gainean ilhumbe eguin cedin .

text: And about the ninth hour Jesus cried with a loud voice , saying , Eli , Eli , lama sabachthani ? that is to say , My God , my God , why hast thou forsaken me ?
text2: Eta bedratzi orenén inguruän oihuz iar cedin Iesus ocengui , cioela , Eli , Eli , lama sabachthani ? erran nahi baita , Ene Iaincoa , Ene Iaincoa , ceren abandonnatu nauc ?

text: Some of them that stood there , when they heard that , said , This man calleth for Elias .
text2: Eta han present ciradenetaric batzuc hori ençunic , cioiten , Elias deitzen du hunec .

text: And straightway one of them ran , and took a spunge , and filled it with vinegar , and put it on a reed , and gave him to drink .
text2: Eta bertan laster eguinic hetaric batec , eta spongiabat harturic vinagrez betheric , eta eçarriric canabera baten inguruän , edatera eman cieçón .

text: The rest said , Let be , let us see whether Elias will come to save him .
text2: Eta bercéc erraiten çuten , Vtzac , dacussagun , eya ethorriren denez Elias horren emparatzera .

text: Jesus , when he had cried again with a loud voice , yielded up the ghost .
text2: Eta orduan Iesusec berriz ocengui oihu eguinic , spiritua renda ceçan .

text: And , behold , the veil of the temple was rent in twain from the top to the bottom ; and the earth did quake , and the rocks rent ;
text2: Eta huná , templeco velá erdira cedin bi çathitara , garaitic behererano , eta lurra ikara cedin , eta harriac , erdira citecen .

text: And the graves were opened ; and many bodies of the saints which slept arose ,
text2: Eta monumentac irequi citecen , eta anhitz Saindu lo ceunçanén gorputzac iaiqui citecen .

text: And came out of the graves after his resurrection , and went into the holy city , and appeared unto many .
text2: Eta monumentetaric ilkiric haren resurrectione ondoan , sar citecen ciuitate saindura , eta aguer cequizquien anhitzi .

text: Now when the centurion , and they that were with him , watching Jesus , saw the earthquake , and those things that were done , they feared greatly , saying , Truly this was the Son of God .
text2: Eta Centenera , eta harequin Iesusen beguirale ceudenac , lur ikaratzea eta eguin içan ciraden gauçác ikussiric , ici citecen haguitz , erraiten çutela , Eguiazqui Iaincoaren Semea cen haur .

text: And many women were there beholding afar off , which followed Jesus from Galilee , ministering unto him :
text2: Han ciraden halaber anhitz emazte vrrundanic beha ceudela , cein iarreiqui içan baitzaizcan Iesusi Galileatic , hura cerbitzatzen çutela .

text: Among which was Mary Magdalene , and Mary the mother of James and Joses , and the mother of Zebedee ' s children .
text2: Hetaric cen , Maria Magdalena , eta Maria Iacquesen eta Iosesen ama , eta Zebedeoren semen amá .

text: When the even was come , there came a rich man of Arimathaea , named Joseph , who also himself was Jesus ' disciple :
text2: Eta arrastu cenean , ethor cedin guiçon abratsbat Arimathiatic , Ioseph deitzen cenic , hura - ere Iesusen discipulu içan cen .

text: He went to Pilate , and begged the body of Jesus . Then Pilate commanded the body to be delivered .
text2: Haur ethor cedin Pilatgana , eta esca cequión Iesusen gorputzaren : orduan mana ceçan Pilatec renda ledin gorputza .

text: And when Joseph had taken the body , he wrapped it in a clean linen cloth ,
text2: Eta gorputza harturic Iosephec mihisse churi batetan barna eçar ceçan .

text: And laid it in his own new tomb , which he had hewn out in the rock : and he rolled a great stone to the door of the sepulchre , and departed .
text2: Eta eçar ceçan bere monument berri arroca batetan ebaquia çuenean : eta harri handibat monument borthara itzuliric , ioan cedin .

text: And there was Mary Magdalene , and the other Mary , sitting over against the sepulchre .
text2: Eta Maria Magdalena eta Maria bercea ciraden han iarriac sepulchre aurkán .

text: Now the next day , that followed the day of the preparation , the chief priests and Pharisees came together unto Pilate ,
text2: Eta biharamunean , cein baita Sabbathoaren preparatione ondoan , bil citecen Sacrificadore principalac , eta Phariseuac Pilatgana .

text: Saying , Sir , we remember that that deceiver said , while he was yet alive , After three days I will rise again .
text2: Erraiten çutela , Iauna , orhoitu gaituc nola abusari harc vici cela erran ceçan , Ondoco heren egunean resuscitaturen naiz .

text: Command therefore that the sepulchre be made sure until the third day , lest his disciples come by night , and steal him away , and say unto the people , He is risen from the dead : so the last error shall be worse than the first .
text2: Mana eçac bada beguira dadin sepulchrea heren egunerano , haren discipuluéc gauäz ethorriric , hura ebats ezteçaten , eta populuari derroten , Resuscitatu da hiletaric : eta halaz baitate azquen errorea lehena baino gaichtoago .

text: Pilate said unto them , Ye have a watch : go your way , make it as sure as ye can .
text2: Eta erran ciecén Pilatec , Badituçue goardac : çoazte , segura çaitezte daquiçuen beçala .

text: So they went , and made the sepulchre sure , sealing the stone , and setting a watch .
text2: Hec bada ioanic segura ceçaten sepulchrea , harria ciguilaturic , goardequin .

text: In the end of the sabbath , as it began to dawn toward the first day of the week , came Mary Magdalene and the other Mary to see the sepulchre .
text2: Eta Sabbath azquencean asteco lehen arguitu behar cen egunean , Maria Magdalena eta Maria bercea ethor citecen sepulchrearen ikustera .

text: And , behold , there was a great earthquake : for the angel of the Lord descended from heaven , and came and rolled back the stone from the door , and sat upon it .
text2: Eta huná , lur ikaratze handibat eguin cedin : ecen Iaunaren Aingueruä iauts cedin cerutic , eta ethorriric aldara ceçan harria borthatic , eta iarriric cegoen haren gainean .

text: His countenance was like lightning , and his raiment white as snow :
text2: Eta cen haren ikartzea chistmista beçala , eta haren abillamendua churi elhurra beçala .

text: And for fear of him the keepers did shake , and became as dead men .
text2: Eta haren beldurrez , ici citecen goardác , eta hilac beçalaca citecen .

text: And the angel answered and said unto the women , Fear not ye : for I know that ye seek Jesus , which was crucified .
text2: Baina ihardesten çuela Aingueruäc erran ciecén emaztey , Çuec eztuçuela beldurric : ecen badaquit Iesus crucificatu içan denaren bilha çabiltzatela :

text: He is not here : for he is risen , as he said . Come , see the place where the Lord lay .
text2: Ezta hemen : ecen resuscitatu içan da , erran çuen beçala : çatozte ikussaçue Iauna eçarri içan cen lekua .

text: And go quickly , and tell his disciples that he is risen from the dead ; and , behold , he goeth before you into Galilee ; there shall ye see him : lo , I have told you .
text2: Eta bertan ioanic erreçue haren discipuluey , ecen resuscitatu dela : eta huná , çuen aitzinean doa Galileara : han hura ikussiren duçue . Huná , erran drauçuet .

text: And they departed quickly from the sepulchre with fear and great joy ; and did run to bring his disciples word .
text2: Eta bertan partituric monumentetic iciapen eta bozcario handirequin , laster eguin ceçaten haren discipuluey declaratzera .

text: And as they went to tell his disciples , behold , Jesus met them , saying , All hail . And they came and held him by the feet , and worshipped him .
text2: Baina hec haren discipuluey declaratzera cioacela , huná , Iesus aitzinera ethor cequien , cioela , Vngui hel daquiçuela . Eta hec hurbilduric lot cequiztén haren oiney , eta adora ceçaten hura .

text: Then said Jesus unto them , Be not afraid : go tell my brethren that they go into Galilee , and there shall they see me .
text2: Orduan dioste Iesusec , Eztuçuela beldurric : çoazte , declara ieceçue ene anayey , doacen Galileara : eta han ikussiren nauté .

text: Now when they were going , behold , some of the watch came into the city , and shewed unto the chief priests all the things that were done .
text2: Hec partitu eta , huná , goardetaric batzu ethor citecen hirira , eta declara cietzén Sacrificadore principaley eguin içan ciraden gauça guciac .

text: And when they were assembled with the elders , and had taken counsel , they gave large money unto the soldiers ,
text2: Orduan bilduric Ancianoequin , eta conseillu harturic , diru somma ona eman ciecén gendarmesey :

text: Saying , Say ye , His disciples came by night , and stole him away while we slept .
text2: Cioitela , Erraçue , Haren discipuluéc gauaz ethorriric , hura ebatsi vkan duté gu lo gaunçala .

text: And if this come to the governor ' s ears , we will persuade him , and secure you .
text2: Eta baldin hori gobernadoreac ençun badeça , guc sinhets eraciren draucagu , eta eguitecotaric idoquiren çaituztegu .

text: So they took the money , and did as they were taught : and this saying is commonly reported among the Jews until this day .
text2: Eta hec diruä harturic eguin ceçaten iracatsi içan ciraden beçala : eta publicatu içan da propos haur Iuduén artean egungo egunerano .

text: Then the eleven disciples went away into Galilee , into a mountain where Jesus had appointed them .
text2: Baina hameca discipuluac ioan citecen Galilearát , mendira , non ordenatu baitzarauen Iesusec .

text: And when they saw him , they worshipped him : but some doubted .
text2: Eta hura ikussiric adora ceçaten : eta batzuc duda ceçaten .

text: And Jesus came and spake unto them , saying , All power is given unto me in heaven and in earth .
text2: Eta hurbilduric Iesus minça cequién , cioela , Eman içan çait niri bothere gucia ceruän eta lurrean .

text: Go ye therefore , and teach all nations , baptizing them in the name of the Father , and of the Son , and of the Holy Ghost :
text2: Çoazte bada eta iracats itzaçue gende guciac : batheyatzen dituçuela Aitaren eta Semearen eta Spiritu sainduaren icenean :

text: Teaching them to observe all things whatsoever I have commanded you : and , lo , I am with you alway , even unto the end of the world . Amen .
text2: Iracasten dituçuela nic manatu drauçuedan guciaren beguiratzen : eta huná , ni çuequin naiz bethiere munduaren finerano . Amen .

text: The beginning of the gospel of Jesus Christ , the Son of God ;
text2: IESVS CHRIST Iaincoaren Semearen Euangelio hatsea :

text: As it is written in the prophets , Behold , I send my messenger before thy face , which shall prepare thy way before thee .
text2: Scribatua den beçala Prophetetan , Huná , nic igorten diat neure mandataria hire beguitharte aitzinean , ceinec appainduren baitu hire bidea hire aitzinean

text: The voice of one crying in the wilderness , Prepare ye the way of the Lord , make his paths straight .
text2: Desertuan oihuz dagoenaren voza da , Appain eçaçue Iaunaren bidea , plana itzaçue haren bidescác .

text: John did baptize in the wilderness , and preach the baptism of repentance for the remission of sins .
text2: Batheyatzen ari cen Ioannes desertuan , eta predicatzen çuen emendamendutaco baptismoa bekatuén barkamendutan .

text: And there went out unto him all the land of Judaea , and they of Jerusalem , and were all baptized of him in the river of Jordan , confessing their sins .
text2: Eta ioaiten cen harengana Iudeaco herri gucia eta Ierusalemecoac : eta batheyatzen ciraden guciac harenganic Iordaneco fluuioan , bere bekatuac confessatzen cituztela .

text: And John was clothed with camel ' s hair , and with a girdle of a skin about his loins ; and he did eat locusts and wild honey ;
text2: Eta cen Ioannes veztitua camelu biloz , eta larruzco guerrico batez bere guerruncean inguru , eta othi eta bassezti iaten çuen .

text: And preached , saying , There cometh one mightier than I after me , the latchet of whose shoes I am not worthy to stoop down and unloose .
text2: Eta predicatzen çuen , cioela , Ethorten da ni baino borthitzago dena ene ondoan , ceinen çapatetaco hedearen beheitituric ezpainaiz lachatzeco digne .

text: I indeed have baptized you with water : but he shall baptize you with the Holy Ghost .
text2: Eguia da , nic batheyatzen çaituztet vrez , baina harc batheyaturen çaituzte Spiritu sainduaz .

text: And it came to pass in those days , that Jesus came from Nazareth of Galilee , and was baptized of John in Jordan .
text2: Eta guertha cedin egun hetan , Iesus ethor baitzedin Nazareth Galileacotic , eta batheya baitzedin Ioannesganic Iordanean .

text: And straightway coming up out of the water , he saw the heavens opened , and the Spirit like a dove descending upon him :
text2: Eta bertan ilkiten cela vretic , ikus citzan ceruäc erdiratzen , eta Spiritu saindua vsso columbabat beçala haren gainera iausten .

text: And there came a voice from heaven , saying , Thou art my beloved Son , in whom I am well pleased .
text2: Eta voz - bat eguin cedin ceruètaric , cioela , Hi aiz ene Seme maitea ceinetan hartzen baitut neure atseguin ona .

text: And immediately the Spirit driveth him into the wilderness .
text2: Eta bertan Spirituac irion ceçan hura desertura .

text: And he was there in the wilderness forty days , tempted of Satan ; and was with the wild beasts ; and the angels ministered unto him .
text2: Eta egon cedin han desertuan berroguey egun , tentatzen cela Satanez : eta cen bassa bestiequin , eta Aingueruèc cerbitzatzen çuten .

text: Now after that John was put in prison , Jesus came into Galilee , preaching the gospel of the kingdom of God ,
text2: Eta Ioannes hatzaman ican cenean , ethor cedin Iesus Galileara , predicatzen çuela Iaincoaren resumaren Euangelioa :

text: And saying , The time is fulfilled , and the kingdom of God is at hand : repent ye , and believe the gospel .
text2: Eta cioela , Complitu da demborá , eta hurbil da Iaincoaren resumá : emenda çaitezte , eta sinhets eçaçue Euangelioa .

text: Now as he walked by the sea of Galilee , he saw Simon and Andrew his brother casting a net into the sea : for they were fishers .
text2: Eta Galileaco itsas bazterrean çabilala ikus citzan Simon eta Andriu haren anayea , sareac itsassora egoizten cituztela ( ecen pescadore ciraden )

text: And Jesus said unto them , Come ye after me , and I will make you to become fishers of men .
text2: Eta erran ciecen Iesusec , Çatozte ene ondoan eta eguinen çaituztet guiça pescadore .

text: And straightway they forsook their nets , and followed him .
text2: Eta bertan vtziric bere sareac iarreiqui içan çaizcan .

text: And when he had gone a little further thence , he saw James the son of Zebedee , and John his brother , who also were in the ship mending their nets .
text2: Eta handic aitzinachiago ioanic , ikus citzan Iacques Zebedeoren semea eta Ioannes haren anayea , hec - ere vncian bere sareac adobatzen cituztela .

text: And straightway he called them : and they left their father Zebedee in the ship with the hired servants , and went after him .
text2: Eta bertan dei citzan hec : eta bere aita Zebedeo vncian vtziric languilequin , iarreiqui içan çaizcan .

text: And they went into Capernaum ; and straightway on the sabbath day he entered into the synagogue , and taught .
text2: Guero sartzen dirade Capernaum - en , eta bertan Sabbath egunean sarthuric synagogán , iracasten ari cen .

text: And they were astonished at his doctrine : for he taught them as one that had authority , and not as the scribes .
text2: Eta spantaturic ceuden haren doctrináz , ecen iracasten cituen authoritate çuenac beçala , eta ez Scribéc beçala .

text: And there was in their synagogue a man with an unclean spirit ; and he cried out ,
text2: Eta cen hayén synagogán guiçombat spiritu satsua çuenic , eta oihuz iar cedin ,

text: Saying , Let us alone ; what have we to do with thee , thou Jesus of Nazareth ? art thou come to destroy us ? I know thee who thou art , the Holy One of God .
text2: Cioela , Ah , Cer da hire eta gure artean Iesus Nazarenoa ? gure deseguitera ethorri aiz ? ba ceaquiat nor aicen , hi aiz Iaincoaren saindua .

text: And Jesus rebuked him , saying , Hold thy peace , and come out of him .
text2: Eta mehatcha ceçan hura Iesusec , cioela , Ichil adi , eta ilki adi horrenganic .

text: And when the unclean spirit had torn him , and cried with a loud voice , he came out of him .
text2: Eta spiritu satsua hura çathituric , eta ocengui oihuz iarriric , ilki cedin harenganic .

text: And they were all amazed , insomuch that they questioned among themselves , saying , What thing is this ? what new doctrine is this ? for with authority commandeth he even the unclean spirits , and they do obey him .
text2: Eta spanta citecen guciac , hala non bere artean galdez baitzeuden , cioitela , Cer da haur ? cer doctrina berri da haur ? authoritatez spiritu satsuac - ere manatzen baititu eta obeditzen baitute ?

text: And immediately his fame spread abroad throughout all the region round about Galilee .
text2: Eta io ceçan haren famác bertan Galilea inguruco comarca gucia .

text: And forthwith , when they were come out of the synagogue , they entered into the house of Simon and Andrew , with James and John .
text2: Eta bertan synagogatic ilkiric , ethor citecen Simonen eta Andriuen etchera Iacquesequin eta Ioannesequin .

text: But Simon ' s wife ' s mother lay sick of a fever , and anon they tell him of her .
text2: Eta Simonen ama - guinharreba cetzan helgaitzarequin : eta bertan minçatu içan çaizcan harçaz .

text: And he came and took her by the hand , and lifted her up ; and immediately the fever left her , and she ministered unto them .
text2: Orduan hurbilduric goiti ceçan hura escutic harturic , eta bertan vtzi ceçan helgaitzac : eta harc cerbitza citzan .

text: And at even , when the sun did set , they brought unto him all that were diseased , and them that were possessed with devils .
text2: Eta arratsean , iguzqui sartzean , ekarten cerautzaten gueizqui ceuden guciac eta demoniatuac .

text: And all the city was gathered together at the door .
text2: Eta hiri gucia borthara bildua cen .

text: And he healed many that were sick of divers diseases , and cast out many devils ; and suffered not the devils to speak , because they knew him .
text2: Eta senda citzan erharçun diuersez eri ciraden guciac : eta anhitz deabru campora egotz ceçan , eta etzituen deabruac minçatzera vtziten nola hura eçagutu vkan lutén .

text: And in the morning , rising up a great while before day , he went out , and departed into a solitary place , and there prayed .
text2: Guero goicean oraino ilhun handia cela iaiquiric ilki cedin , eta ioan cedin leku desertu batetara , eta han othoitz eguiten çuen .

text: And Simon and they that were with him followed after him .
text2: Eta iarreiqui içan çaizcan Simon eta harequin ciradenac .

text: And when they had found him , they said unto him , All men seek for thee .
text2: Eta eriden çutenean , erran cieçoten , Guciac hire bilha diabiltzac .

text: And he said unto them , Let us go into the next towns , that I may preach there also : for therefore came I forth .
text2: Orduan dioste Goacen hurbilengo burguètara : han - ere predica deçadançat : ecen hartacotzat ilki içan naiz .

text: And he preached in their synagogues throughout all Galilee , and cast out devils .
text2: Eta predicatzen çuen hayén synagoguetan , Galilea gucian : eta deabruac campora egoizten cituen .

text: And there came a leper to him , beseeching him , and kneeling down to him , and saying unto him , If thou wilt , thou canst make me clean .
text2: Eta ethor cedin harengana sorhayobat , othoitz eguiten ceraucala , eta hari belhauricaturic ciotsala , Baldin nahi baduc chahu ahal neçaquec .

text: And Jesus , moved with compassion , put forth his hand , and touched him , and saith unto him , I will ; be thou clean .
text2: Orduan Iesusec compassione harturic eta escua hedaturic , hunqui ceçan hura , eta erran cieçón , Nahi diat , aicén chahu ,

text: And as soon as he had spoken , immediately the leprosy departed from him , and he was cleansed .
text2: Eta hori erran çuenean , bertan ioan cedin harenganic sorhayotassuna , eta chahu cedin .

text: And he straitly charged him , and forthwith sent him away ;
text2: Eta hura mehatchaturic bertan igor ceçan camporát :

text: And saith unto him , See thou say nothing to any man : but go thy way , shew thyself to the priest , and offer for thy cleansing those things which Moses commanded , for a testimony unto them .
text2: Eta erran cieçón , Beguirauc nehori deus ezterroan : baina ohá , eta eracuts aquio Sacrificadoreari , eta presenta itzac eure garbitzeagatic Moysesec manatu dituen gauçác hæy testimoniagetan .

text: But he went out , and began to publish it much , and to blaze abroad the matter , insomuch that Jesus could no more openly enter into the city , but was without in desert places : and they came to him from every quarter .
text2: Baina hura ilkiric has cedin anhitz gauçaren publicatzen , eta beharquiaren manifestatzen , hala non guehiagoric aguerriz Iesus ecin sar baitzaiten hirira , baina lekorean leku desertuetan cen , eta ethorten ciraden harengana alde gucietaric .

text: And again he entered into Capernaum , after some days ; and it was noised that he was in the house .
text2: ETa berriz sar cedin Capernaumen cembeit egunen buruan , eta ençun içan da ecen etchean cela .

text: And straightway many were gathered together , insomuch that there was no room to receive them , no , not so much as about the door : and he preached the word unto them .
text2: Eta bertan anhitz bildu içan dirade hambat non bortha aldiriéc - ere ecin eduqui baitzitzaqueizten : eta declaratzen cerauen hitza .

text: And they come unto him , bringing one sick of the palsy , which was borne of four .
text2: Orduan ethor citecen batzu herengana , ekarten çutela laurez eramaiten cen paralyticobat .

text: And when they could not come nigh unto him for the press , they uncovered the roof where he was : and when they had broken it up , they let down the bed wherein the sick of the palsy lay .
text2: Eta ceren ecin hurbil baitzaquidizquion gendetzearen causaz , aguer ceçaten Iesus cen etche gaina , eta hura çulhaturic , erauts ceçaten paralyticoa cetzan ohea .

text: When Jesus saw their faith , he said unto the sick of the palsy , Son , thy sins be forgiven thee .
text2: Orduan Iesusec hayén fedea ikussiric , erran cieçón paralyticoari , Semé , barkatu çaizquic eure bekatuac .

text: But there were certain of the scribes sitting there , and reasoning in their hearts ,
text2: Eta Scribetaric batzu ciraden han iarriac , eta iharduquiten çuten bere bihotzetan , hunela ,

text: Why doth this man thus speak blasphemies ? who can forgive sins but God only ?
text2: Cergatic haur hunela blasphemio erraiten ari da ? Norc bekatuac barka ahal ditzaque Iaincoac berac baicen ?

text: And immediately when Jesus perceived in his spirit that they so reasoned within themselves , he said unto them , Why reason ye these things in your hearts ?
text2: Eta bertan eçaguturic Iesusec bere spirituaz , ecen hala ciharducatela berac baithan , erran ciecen , Cergatic horrelaco gaucez diharducaçue çuen bihotzetan .

text: Whether is it easier to say to the sick of the palsy , Thy sins be forgiven thee ; or to say , Arise , and take up thy bed , and walk ?
text2: Cein da erratchago , erraitea paralyticoari , Barkatu çaizquic bekatuac , ala erraitea , Iaiqui adi , eta har eçac eure ohea , eta ebil adi ?

text: But that ye may know that the Son of man hath power on earth to forgive sins , ( he saith to the sick of the palsy , )
text2: Daquiçuençat bada ecen guiçonaren Semeac baduela bothere bekatuén barkatzeco lurrean ( diotsa paralyticoari )

text: I say unto thee , Arise , and take up thy bed , and go thy way into thine house .
text2: Hiri diossat , Iaiqui adi , eta har eçac eure ohea , eta habil eure etcherát .

text: And immediately he arose , took up the bed , and went forth before them all ; insomuch that they were all amazed , and glorified God , saying , We never saw it on this fashion .
text2: Eta bertan iaiqui cedin , eta ohea harturic , ilki cedin gucién presentian : hala non guciac spantatuac baitzeuden , eta glorificatzen baitzuten Iaincoa , erraiten çutela , Egundano hunelaco gauçaric eztugu ikussi .

text: And he went forth again by the sea side ; and all the multitude resorted unto him , and he taught them .
text2: Eta ilki cedin berriz itsas alderat : eta populu gucia ethorten cen harengana , eta iracasten cituen hec .

text: And as he passed by , he saw Levi the son of Alphaeus sitting at the receipt of custom , and said unto him , Follow me . And he arose and followed him .
text2: Eta vrruti iragaiten cela , ikus ceçan , Leui Alpheoren semea peage lekuan iarriric , eta erran cieçón , Arreit niri . Eta iaiquiric iarreiqui cequión .

text: And it came to pass , that , as Jesus sat at meat in his house , many publicans and sinners sat also together with Jesus and his disciples : for there were many , and they followed him .
text2: Eta guertha cedin , Iesus haren etchean mahainean iarriric cegoela , anhitz publicano eta gende vicitze gaichtotaco iar baitzedin Iesusequin eta haren discipuluequin , ecén anhitz ciraden eta iarreiqui içan çaizcan .

text: And when the scribes and Pharisees saw him eat with publicans and sinners , they said unto his disciples , How is it that he eateth and drinketh with publicans and sinners ?
text2: Eta Scribéc eta Phariseuéc ikussiric publicanoequin eta gende vicitze gaichtotacoequin iaten çuela , erran ciecén haren discipuluey , Cergatic publicanoequin eta vicitze gaichtotacoequin iaten du eta edaten ?

text: When Jesus heard it , he saith unto them , They that are whole have no need of the physician , but they that are sick : I came not to call the righteous , but sinners to repentance .
text2: Eta haur ençunic Iesusec dioste , Osso diradenéc eztute medicuren beharric : baina eri diradenéc : ecen ez naiz ethorri iustoén deitzera : baina bekatoren , emendamendutara .

text: And the disciples of John and of the Pharisees used to fast : and they come and say unto him , Why do the disciples of John and of the Pharisees fast , but thy disciples fast not ?
text2: Eta Ioannesen eta Phariseuén discipuluéc barur eguiten çutén : eta hec ethorten dirade eta diotsate , Cergatic Ioannesen eta Phariseuen discipuluéc barur eguiten dute , eta hire discipuluéc ezpáitute baruric eguiten ?

text: And Jesus said unto them , Can the children of the bridechamber fast , while the bridegroom is with them ? as long as they have the bridegroom with them , they cannot fast .
text2: Eta erraiten draue Iesusec : Ezteyetaco gendéc baruric ahal daidite ezcondua hequin deno ? ezcondua berequin duteno baruric ecin daidite .

text: But the days will come , when the bridegroom shall be taken away from them , and then shall they fast in those days .
text2: Baina ethorriren dirade egunac edequiren baitzaye ezcondua , eta orduan barur eguinen duté egun hetan .

text: No man also seweth a piece of new cloth on an old garment : else the new piece that filled it up taketh away from the old , and the rent is made worse .
text2: Eta nehorc oihal pedaçu latz - bat eztu iosten abillamendu çar batetan , ezpere haren compligarri berri harc edequiten drauca çarrari , eta gaizcoatzenago da ethendurá .

text: And no man putteth new wine into old bottles : else the new wine doth burst the bottles , and the wine is spilled , and the bottles will be marred : but new wine must be put into new bottles .
text2: Halaber nehorc eztu eçarten mahatsarno berria çahagui çarretan : ezpere mahatsarno berriac lehertzen ditu çahaguiac eta mahatsarnoa issurten da , eta çahaguiac galtzen dirade baina mahatsarno berria çahagui berrietan eçarri behar da .

text: And it came to pass , that he went through the corn fields on the sabbath day ; and his disciples began , as they went , to pluck the ears of corn .
text2: Eta guertha cedin hura iragaiten baitzen Sabbath egun - batez ereincetan gaindi , eta has citecen haren discipuluac bidean cioacela buruca idoquiten .

text: And the Pharisees said unto him , Behold , why do they on the sabbath day that which is not lawful ?
text2: Eta Phariseuéc erran cieçoten , Horrá , cergatic eguiten duté Sabbathoan eguin sori eztena ?

text: And he said unto them , Have ye never read what David did , when he had need , and was an hungred , he , and they that were with him ?
text2: Eta harc erran ciecén , Eztuçue egundano iracurri vkan , cer eguin çuen Dauid - ec necessitate çuenean , eta gossetu cenean bera eta harequin ciradenac ?

text: How he went into the house of God in the days of Abiathar the high priest , and did eat the shewbread , which is not lawful to eat but for the priests , and gave also to them which were with him ?
text2: Nola sarthu içan cen Iaunaren etchean Abiathar Sacrificadore principalaren demborán : eta propositioneco oguiac ian vkan cituen , Sacrificadorén baicen iateco sori etziradenac , eta nola harequin ciradeney - ere eman cerauen ?

text: And he said unto them , The sabbath was made for man , and not man for the sabbath :
text2: Guero erran ciecén : Sabbathoa guiçonagatic eguin içan da , ez guiçona Sabbathoagatic .

text: Therefore the Son of man is Lord also of the sabbath .
text2: Bada guiçonaren Semea Sabbathoaren - ere iabe da .

text: And he entered again into the synagogue ; and there was a man there which had a withered hand .
text2: Guero sar cedin berriz synágogán , eta cen han guiçombat escua eyhartua çuenic .

text: And they watched him , whether he would heal him on the sabbath day ; that they might accuse him .
text2: Eta gogoatzen çutén eya Sabbathoan sendaturen çuenez accusa leçatençat .

text: And he saith unto the man which had the withered hand , Stand forth .
text2: Eta diotsa guiçon escu eyhartua çuenari , Iaiqui adi artera .

text: And he saith unto them , Is it lawful to do good on the sabbath days , or to do evil ? to save life , or to kill ? But they held their peace .
text2: Guero dioste , Sabbathoan vngui eguitea da sori , ala gaizqui eguitea ? persona baten emparatzea , ala hiltzea : baina hec ichilic ceuden .

text: And when he had looked round about on them with anger , being grieved for the hardness of their hearts , he saith unto the man , Stretch forth thine hand . And he stretched it out : and his hand was restored whole as the other .
text2: Eta hetarát inguru behaturic asserrerequin , eta hayén bihotzeco obstinationeaz contristaturic , diotsa guiçonari , Heda eçac eure escua : Eta heda çeçan , eta haren escua , bercea beçain senda cedin .

text: And the Pharisees went forth , and straightway took counsel with the Herodians against him , how they might destroy him .
text2: Orduan ilkiric Phariseuéc , bertan Herodianoequin conseillu eduqui ceçaten haren contra , hura hil lecatençat .

text: But Jesus withdrew himself with his disciples to the sea : and a great multitude from Galilee followed him , and from Judaea ,
text2: Baina Iesus bere discipuluequin retira cedin itsas alderát : eta iarrequi cequión gendetze handia Galileatic eta Iudeatic .

text: And from Jerusalem , and from Idumaea , and from beyond Jordan ; and they about Tyre and Sidon , a great multitude , when they had heard what great things he did , came unto him .
text2: Eta Ierusalemetic , eta Idumeatic , eta Iordanaz berce aldetic : eta Tyreco eta Sydoneco inguruètan habitatzen ciradenetaric gendetze handi , ençunic cein gauça handiac eguiten cituen , ethor citecen harengana .

text: And he spake to his disciples , that a small ship should wait on him because of the multitude , lest they should throng him .
text2: Eta erran ciecén bere discipuluey vncichobat bethi prest eduqui lequión , gendetzearen causaz , hers ezleçatençát .

text: For he had healed many ; insomuch that they pressed upon him for to touch him , as many as had plagues .
text2: Ecen anhitz sendatu vkan çuen , hala non afflictionetan ciraden guciac oldartzen baitziraden harengana hunqui lecatençat .

text: And unclean spirits , when they saw him , fell down before him , and cried , saying , Thou art the Son of God .
text2: Eta spiritu satsuéc hura ikusten çutenean , haren aitzinera bere buruäc egoizten cituztén , eta oihu eguiten çuten , cioitela , Hi aiz Iaincoaren Sem 12 Bain

text: And he straitly charged them that they should not make him known .
text2: Baina harc haguitz mehatchatzen cituen , manifesta ez leçatençat .

text: And he goeth up into a mountain , and calleth unto him whom he would : and they came unto him .
text2: Guero igan cedin mendi batetara , eta dei citzan beregana nahi cituenac : eta ethor citecen harengana .

text: And he ordained twelve , that they should be with him , and that he might send them forth to preach ,
text2: Eta ordena citzan hamabi harequin içateco , eta predicatzera igorteco :

text: And to have power to heal sicknesses , and to cast out devils :
text2: Eta lutén bothere eritassunén sendatzeco , eta deabruén campora egoizteco .

text: And Simon he surnamed Peter ;
text2: Lehenic Symon , ( ceini icen eman baitzieçon Pierris : )

text: And James the son of Zebedee , and John the brother of James ; and he surnamed them Boanerges , which is , The sons of thunder :
text2: Eta Iacques Zebedeoren semea , eta Ioannes Iacquesen anayea , ( eta hæy icen eman ciecén Boanerges , erran nahi baita , igorciri semeac )

text: And Andrew , and Philip , and Bartholomew , and Matthew , and Thomas , and James the son of Alphaeus , and Thaddaeus , and Simon the Canaanite ,
text2: Eta Andriu eta Philippe , eta Bartholomeo , eta Mattheu , eta Thomas , eta Iacques Alpheoren semea , eta Thaddeo , eta Simon Cananeoa ,

text: And Judas Iscariot , which also betrayed him : and they went into an house .
text2: Eta Iudas Iscariot , ceinec bera traditu - ere baitzuen .

text: And the multitude cometh together again , so that they could not so much as eat bread .
text2: Eta ethor citecen etchera : eta berriz gendetze handibat bil cedin , hala non oguiaren iateco artea - ere ecin har baitziroiten .

text: And when his friends heard of it , they went out to lay hold on him : for they said , He is beside himself .
text2: Eta haur ençun çutenean haren ahaideac ilki citecen hatzaman leçatençat : ecen erraiten çuten , çoratu cela .

text: And the scribes which came down from Jerusalem said , He hath Beelzebub , and by the prince of the devils casteth he out devils .
text2: Eta Ierusalemetic iautsi içan ciraden Scribéc erraiten çutén , ecen Beelzebub çuela , eta deabruén princearen partez deabruac campora egoizten cituela .

text: And he called them unto him , and said unto them in parables , How can Satan cast out Satan ?
text2: Eta hec beregana deithuric , erran ciecén comparationez , Nolatan Satanec Satan campora egotz ahal deçaque .

text: And if a kingdom be divided against itself , that kingdom cannot stand .
text2: Ecen baldin resumabat bere contra partitua bada , ecin dauque resuma hura .

text: And if a house be divided against itself , that house cannot stand .
text2: Eta baldin etchebat bere contra partitua bada , ecin dauque etche hura .

text: And if Satan rise up against himself , and be divided , he cannot stand , but hath an end .
text2: Hala baldin Satan - ere altcha badadi eta partitua bada bere contra , ecin dauque , baina fin du .

text: No man can enter into a strong man ' s house , and spoil his goods , except he will first bind the strong man ; and then he will spoil his house .
text2: Ecin nehorc borthitz baten ostillamenduac , haren etchera sarthuric , pilla ahal ditzaque , baldin lehen borthitza esteca ezpadeça : eta orduan haren etchea pillaturen du .

text: Verily I say unto you , All sins shall be forgiven unto the sons of men , and blasphemies wherewith soever they shall blaspheme :
text2: Eguiaz erraiten drauçuet , ecen bekatu guciac guiçonén seméy barkaturen çaiztela , eta blasphematu dituqueizten blasphemio guciac :

text: But he that shall blaspheme against the Holy Ghost hath never forgiveness , but is in danger of eternal damnation :
text2: Baina norc - ere blasphematuren baitu Spiritu sainduaren contra eztu barkamenduric vkanen seculan , baina içanen da condemnatione eternalaren hoguendun .

text: Because they said , He hath an unclean spirit .
text2: Ecen erraiten çuten , Spiritu satsua du .

text: There came then his brethren and his mother , and , standing without , sent unto him , calling him .
text2: Ethorten dirade bada haren anayeac eta haren ama : eta lekorean ceudela igor citzaten batzu harengana , haren deitzera .

text: And the multitude sat about him , and they said unto him , Behold , thy mother and thy brethren without seek for thee .
text2: Eta iarriric cegoen haren inguruän gendetzea , eta hec erran cieçoten , Huná , hire amac eta hire anayéc lekorean galdeguiten aute .

text: And he answered them , saying , Who is my mother , or my brethren ?
text2: Orduan ihardets ciecén , cioela , Nor da ene ama , edo ene anayeac ?

text: And he looked round about on them which sat about him , and said , Behold my mother and my brethren !
text2: Eta inguru behatu çuenean haren inguruän iarriric ceuden discipuluetara , dio , Huná ene ama , eta ene anayeac .

text: For whosoever shall do the will of God , the same is my brother , and my sister , and mother .
text2: Ecen norc - ere eguine baitu Iaincoare vorondatea , hura da ene anaye eta ene arreba , eta ama

text: And he began again to teach by the sea side : and there was gathered unto him a great multitude , so that he entered into a ship , and sat in the sea ; and the whole multitude was by the sea on the land .
text2: Guero berriz has cedin iracasten itsas bazterrean : eta bil cedin harengana gendetze handi , hala non bera vncira sarthuric , iarriric baitzegoen itsassoan : eta populu gucia itsas costan leihorrean cen .

text: And he taught them many things by parables , and said unto them in his doctrine ,
text2: Eta iracasten cerauen comparationez anhitz gauça , eta erraiten cerauen bere doctrinán ,

text: Hearken ; Behold , there went out a sower to sow :
text2: Ençun eçaçue , Huná , ereillebat ilki cedin ereitara .

text: And it came to pass , as he sowed , some fell by the way side , and the fowls of the air came and devoured it up .
text2: Eta guertha cedin ereitean , partebat eror baitzedin bide bazterrera , eta ethor citecen ceruco choriac , eta irets ceçaten hura .

text: And some fell on stony ground , where it had not much earth ; and immediately it sprang up , because it had no depth of earth :
text2: Eta berce partebat eror cedin leku harriçuetara , non ezpaitzuen lur anhitzic : eta bertan ilki cedin , ceren ezpaitzuen lur barnetassunic .

text: But when the sun was up , it was scorched ; and because it had no root , it withered away .
text2: Baina iguzquia goratu cenean , erre cedin : eta ceren erroric ezpaitzuen , eyhar cedin .

text: And some fell among thorns , and the thorns grew up , and choked it , and it yielded no fruit .
text2: Eta berce partebat eror cedin elhorri artera , eta elhorriac handi citecen , eta itho ceçaten hura , eta etzeçan fructuric eman .

text: And other fell on good ground , and did yield fruit that sprang up and increased ; and brought forth , some thirty , and some sixty , and some an hundred .
text2: Eta bercea eror cedin lur - onera , eta eman ceçan fructu goratzen eta handitzen cenic , eta ekar ceçan bihi batac hoguey eta hamar , eta berceac hiruroguey , eta berceac ehun .

text: And he said unto them , He that hath ears to hear , let him hear .
text2: Orduan erran ciecén , Ençuteco beharriric duenac , ençun beça .

text: And when he was alone , they that were about him with the twelve asked of him the parable .
text2: Eta bera cela , interroga ceçaten haren inguruän hamabiequin ciradenéc , comparationeaz .

text: And he said unto them , Unto you it is given to know the mystery of the kingdom of God : but unto them that are without , all these things are done in parables :
text2: Eta erran ciecén , Çuey eman çaiçue Iaincoaren resumaco secretuaren eçagutzea : baina lekorean diradeney comparationez gauça guciac tractatzen çaizte :

text: That seeing they may see , and not perceive ; and hearing they may hear , and not understand ; lest at any time they should be converted , and their sins should be forgiven them .
text2: Dacussatela ikus deçatençat , eta eztaquizquión ohart : eta dançutela ençun deçaten , eta adi ezteçaten : conuerti eztitecen eta bekatuac barka eztaquizquién .

text: And he said unto them , Know ye not this parable ? and how then will ye know all parables ?
text2: Eta erran ciecen , Eztaquiçue comparatione haur ? Eta nolatan comparatione guciac eçagutiren dituçue ?

text: The sower soweth the word .
text2: Ereilleac hitza ereiten du .

text: And these are they by the way side , where the word is sown ; but when they have heard , Satan cometh immediately , and taketh away the word that was sown in their hearts .
text2: Bada hauc dirade bide bazterrera hacia recebitzen dutenac , ceinétan ereiten baita hitza : baina ençun dutenean , bertan ethorten da Satan , eta kencen du hayen bihotzetan erein cen hitza .

text: And these are they likewise which are sown on stony ground ; who , when they have heard the word , immediately receive it with gladness ;
text2: Eta hauc dirade halaber leku harriçuetara hacia recebitzen dutenac : eta ençun dutenean hitza , bertan bozcariorequin recebitzen dute hura .

text: And have no root in themselves , and so endure but for a time : afterward , when affliction or persecution ariseth for the word ' s sake , immediately they are offended .
text2: Eta eztute erroric berac baithan , baina iraute gutitaco dirade : guero heltzen denean tribulationeric edo persecutioneric hitzagatic , bertan scandalizatzen dirade .

text: And these are they which are sown among thorns ; such as hear the word ,
text2: Eta hauc dirade elhorri artera hacia recebitzen dutenac , hauc dirade , diot , hacia ençuten dutenac :

text: And the cares of this world , and the deceitfulness of riches , and the lusts of other things entering in , choke the word , and it becometh unfruitful .
text2: Baina mundu hunetaco ansiéc , eta abrastassunezco enganioac , eta berce gaucetaco guthiciéc barneraric ithotzen dute hitza , eta fructu gabetzen da .

text: And these are they which are sown on good ground ; such as hear the word , and receive it , and bring forth fruit , some thirtyfold , some sixty , and some an hundred .
text2: Eta hauc dirade lur onera hacia recebitu dutenac , ceinéc hitza ençuten baitute , eta recebitzen , eta fructu ekarten , batac hoguey eta hamar , eta berceac hiruroguey , eta berceac ehun .

text: And he said unto them , Is a candle brought to be put under a bushel , or under a bed ? and not to be set on a candlestick ?
text2: Erran ciecén halaber , Ala candela ekarten da gaitzurupean , edo ohapean eçar dadinçat ? eza candelerean eçar dadinçat ?

text: For there is nothing hid , which shall not be manifested ; neither was any thing kept secret , but that it should come abroad .
text2: Ecen ezta deus secreturic aguerturen eztenic , edo estal ahal daitenic : baina campora ethorri behar da .

text: If any man have ears to hear , let him hear .
text2: Baldin nehorc ençuteco beharriric badu , ençun beça .

text: And he said unto them , Take heed what ye hear : with what measure ye mete , it shall be measured to you : and unto you that hear shall more be given .
text2: Guehiago erran ciecén , Gogoauçue cer ençuten duçuen : cer neurriz neurturen baituçue , neurturen çaiçue , eta emendaturen çaiçue , çuey ençuten duçuenoy .

text: For he that hath , to him shall be given : and he that hath not , from him shall be taken even that which he hath .
text2: Ecen duenari , emanen çayó : eta deusic eztuenari , duena - ere edequiren çayó .

text: And he said , So is the kingdom of God , as if a man should cast seed into the ground ;
text2: Guehiago erraiten çuen , Iaincoaren resumá da , guiçón hacia lurrera egotziric gau eta egun lo etzaten eta iaiquiten liçaten baten ançora .

text: And should sleep , and rise night and day , and the seed should spring and grow up , he knoweth not how .
text2: Eta hacia ilkiten eta hatzen licén , harc ezlaquiala nola ,

text: For the earth bringeth forth fruit of herself ; first the blade , then the ear , after that the full corn in the ear .
text2: Ecen bere buruz lurrac fructu ekarten du , behin belhar , guero buru , guero ogui bihi bethea buruän .

text: But when the fruit is brought forth , immediately he putteth in the sickle , because the harvest is come .
text2: Eta aguertu denean fructua , bertan guiçonac du eçarten iguiteyá : ceren prest baita vztá .

text: And he said , Whereunto shall we liken the kingdom of God ? or with what comparison shall we compare it ?
text2: Guero cioen , Cer irudi duela erranen dugu Iaincoaren resumác ? edo cer comparationez comparaturen dugu hura ?

text: It is like a grain of mustard seed , which , when it is sown in the earth , is less than all the seeds that be in the earth :
text2: Hura da mustarda haci bihibat beçala , cein lurrean ereiten denean , baita lurrean diraden haci gucietaco chipiena :

text: But when it is sown , it groweth up , and becometh greater than all herbs , and shooteth out great branches ; so that the fowls of the air may lodge under the shadow of it .
text2: Baina erein den ondoan , goratzen da , eta berce belhar gucietaco handiena eguiten da : eta adar handiac eguiten ditu hala non ceruco choriec ohatzeac eguin ahal baititzaqueizte haren itzalean .

text: And with many such parables spake he the word unto them , as they were able to hear it .
text2: Eta anhitz hunelaco comparationez tractatzen cerauen hitza , ençun ahal ciroitenaren araura .

text: But without a parable spake he not unto them : and when they were alone , he expounded all things to his disciples .
text2: Eta comparatione gabe etzayen minçatzen : baina appartean bere discipuluey declaratzen cerauzten gauça guciac .

text: And the same day , when the even was come , he saith unto them , Let us pass over unto the other side .
text2: Eta erran ciecén egun hartan , arrastu cenean , Iragan gáitecen vraren berce aldera .

text: And when they had sent away the multitude , they took him even as he was in the ship . And there were also with him other little ships .
text2: Eta populua vtziric har ceçaten hura vncian cen beçala : baina berce vncitchoac - ere baciraden harequin .

text: And there arose a great storm of wind , and the waves beat into the ship , so that it was now full .
text2: Orduan altcha cedin haice buhumba handibat , eta bagác sartzen ciraden vncira , hala non ia bethatzen baitzén .

text: And he was in the hinder part of the ship , asleep on a pillow : and they awake him , and say unto him , Master , carest thou not that we perish ?
text2: Eta hura vnciaren guibeleco aldean cetzan lo bururdi baten gainean : orduan iratzartzen dute , eta diotsate , Magistruá , eztuc ansiaric ceren galduac goacen ?

text: And he arose , and rebuked the wind , and said unto the sea , Peace , be still . And the wind ceased , and there was a great calm .
text2: Eta iratzarri cenean mehatcha ceçan haicea , eta erran cieçón itsassoari , Ichil adi , eta gueldi adi . Orduan cessa cedin haicea , eta tranquilitate handi eguin cedin .

text: And he said unto them , Why are ye so fearful ? how is it that ye have no faith ?
text2: Eta erran ciecén Cergatic çarete horrela icior ? nola eztuçue federic ?

text: And they feared exceedingly , and said one to another , What manner of man is this , that even the wind and the sea obey him ?
text2: Eta ici citecen icidura handiz : eta erraiten çuten elkarren artean , Baina nor da haur , haiceac eta itsassoac , ere obeditzen baitute ?

text: And they came over unto the other side of the sea , into the country of the Gadarenes .
text2: Eta ethor citecen itsassoaren berce aldera , Gadarenoén comarcara .

text: And when he was come out of the ship , immediately there met him out of the tombs a man with an unclean spirit ,
text2: Eta ilki cenean vncitic , bertan aitzinera ethor cequión thumbetaric spiritu satsua çuen guiçombat :

text: Who had his dwelling among the tombs ; and no man could bind him , no , not with chains :
text2: Ceinec bere egoitea baitzuen thumbetan , eta cadenaz - ere nehorc ecin esteca ciroen .

text: Because that he had been often bound with fetters and chains , and the chains had been plucked asunder by him , and the fetters broken in pieces : neither could any man tame him .
text2: Ceren anhitzetan cepoz eta cadenaz estecatu içan cenean hauts baitzitzan cadenác , eta çathica cepoac : eta nehorc ecin ceba ceçaqueen .

text: And always , night and day , he was in the mountains , and in the tombs , crying , and cutting himself with stones .
text2: Eta bethiere egun eta gau mendietan eta thumbetan cen oihuz cegoela , eta bere buruäri harriz ceraunsala .

text: But when he saw Jesus afar off , he ran and worshipped him ,
text2: Eta ikussi çuenean Iesus vrrundanic , laster eguin ceçan eta gur cequión :

text: And cried with a loud voice , and said , What have I to do with thee , Jesus , thou Son of the most high God ? I adjure thee by God , that thou torment me not .
text2: Eta oihuz voz goraz erran ceçan , Cer da hire eta ene artean , Iesus Iainco subiranoaren Semea ? adiuratzen aut Iaincoaren partez ezneçan tormenta .

text: For he said unto him , Come out of the man , thou unclean spirit .
text2: ( Ecen erraiten ceraucan , Ilki adi spiritu satsuá , guiçon horrenganic )

text: And he asked him , What is thy name ? And he answered , saying , My name is Legion : for we are many .
text2: Orduan interroga ceçan hura , Nola da hire icena ? Eta ihardets ceçan , cioela , Legio diat icen : ecen anhitz gaituc .

text: And he besought him much that he would not send them away out of the country .
text2: Eta othoitz handi eguiten çeraucan , ezlitzan igor comarca hartaric campora .

text: Now there was there nigh unto the mountains a great herd of swine feeding .
text2: Eta cen han mendi aldean vrdalde handibat alha cenic .

text: And all the devils besought him , saying , Send us into the swine , that we may enter into them .
text2: Eta othoitz eguin cieçoten deabru hec guciéc , cioitela , Igor gaitzac vrdetara , hetara sar gaitecençat .

text: And forthwith Jesus gave them leave . And the unclean spirits went out , and entered into the swine : and the herd ran violently down a steep place into the sea , ( they were about two thousand ; ) and were choked in the sea .
text2: Eta permetti ciecén bertan Iesusec . Eta ilkiric spiritu satsuac lar citecen vrdetara , eta oldar cedin vrdaldea gainetic behera itsassora ( eta baciraden bi millaren inguruä ) eta itho citecen itsassoan .

text: And they that fed the swine fled , and told it in the city , and in the country . And they went out to see what it was that was done .
text2: Eta vrdeac bazcatzen cituztenéc ihes eguin ceçaten , eta ekar citzaten berriac hirira eta campocoetara : Orduan ilki citecen ikustera cer eguin içan cen .

text: And they come to Jesus , and see him that was possessed with the devil , and had the legion , sitting , and clothed , and in his right mind : and they were afraid .
text2: Eta ethorten dirade Iesusgana , eta ikusten dute demoniatu içan cena iarriric eta veztituric eta cençaturic , legionea vkan çuena diot : eta ici citecen .

text: And they that saw it told them how it befell to him that was possessed with the devil , and also concerning the swine .
text2: Eta haur ikussi çutenéc erran ciecén hæy , nola demoniatuari heldu içan çayon , eta vrdéz .

text: And they began to pray him to depart out of their coasts .
text2: Orduan hec has cequizquión othoitz eguiten parti ledin hayén comarquetaric .

text: And when he was come into the ship , he that had been possessed with the devil prayed him that he might be with him .
text2: Eta hura sarthu cenean vncira , othoiztez çayon demoniatu içan cena harequin licén .

text: Howbeit Jesus suffered him not , but saith unto him , Go home to thy friends , and tell them how great things the Lord hath done for thee , and hath had compassion on thee .
text2: Baina Iesusec etzieçón permetti , aitzitic erran cieçón , Habil eure etcherát euretara , eta conta iecec cein gauça handiac Iaunac eguin drauzquián , eta nola hiçaz pietate vkan duen .

text: And he departed , and began to publish in Decapolis how great things Jesus had done for him : and all men did marvel .
text2: Ioan cedin bada , eta has cedin predicatzen Decapolisen cein gauça handiac eguin cerautzan Iesusec : eta guciéc miresten çuten .

text: And when Jesus was passed over again by ship unto the other side , much people gathered unto him : and he was nigh unto the sea .
text2: Eta iragan cenean Iesus vncian berriz berce aldera , populu handi bil cedin harengana , eta cen itsas bazterrean .

text: And , behold , there cometh one of the rulers of the synagogue , Jairus by name ; and when he saw him , he fell at his feet ,
text2: Eta huná , ethor cedin synagogaco principal Iairus deitzen cembat , eta ikussi çuenean hura , egotz ceçan bere burua haren oinetara .

text: And besought him greatly , saying , My little daughter lieth at the point of death : I pray thee , come and lay thy hands on her , that she may be healed ; and she shall live .
text2: Eta othoitz handi eguiten ceraucan , cioela , Ene alabatchoa hurrenean duc : othoitz eguiten drauat , ethor adin , eta eçar ditzán escuac haren gainean , senda dadinçát eta vici den .

text: And Jesus went with him ; and much people followed him , and thronged him .
text2: Eta ioan cedin Iesus harequin , eta populu handi çarreyón , eta hertsen çuten .

text: And a certain woman , which had an issue of blood twelve years ,
text2: Eta emaztebat cen odol iariatzea hamabi vrthe hetan çuenic :

text: And had suffered many things of many physicians , and had spent all that she had , and was nothing bettered , but rather grew worse ,
text2: Eta anhitz suffritu vkan çuen anhitz medicutaric , eta berea gucia despendatu çuen , eta etzén deus probetchatu , baina gaizcoatuago içan cen .

text: When she had heard of Jesus , came in the press behind , and touched his garment .
text2: Hura Iesusez minçatzen ençunic , ethor cedin gendetzean guibeletic , eta hunqui ceçan haren arropá .
