text: For she said , If I may touch but his clothes , I shall be whole .
text2: Ecen erraiten çuen , Baldin haren abillamenduac hunqui baditzat ber , sendaturen naiz

text: And straightway the fountain of her blood was dried up ; and she felt in her body that she was healed of that plague .
text2: Eta bertan agor cedin haren odol ithurria : eta sendi ceçan bere gorputzean sendatu cela plaga hartaric .

text: And Jesus , immediately knowing in himself that virtue had gone out of him , turned him about in the press , and said , Who touched my clothes ?
text2: Eta bertan Iesusec bere baithan eçaguturic harenganic ilki içan cen verthutea , itzuliric gendetzean , erran ceçan , Norc hunqui ditu ene abillamenduac ?

text: And his disciples said unto him , Thou seest the multitude thronging thee , and sayest thou , Who touched me ?
text2: Eta erran cieçoten bere discipuluec , Badacussac gendetzeac hertsen auela , eta dioc , Norc hunqui nau ?

text: And he looked round about to see her that had done this thing .
text2: Eta inguru behatzen çuen , haur eguin çuena ikus leçançat .

text: But the woman fearing and trembling , knowing what was done in her , came and fell down before him , and told him all the truth .
text2: Eta emaztea beldurric eta ikararic , nola baitzaquian hura baithan eguin içan cena , ethor cedin , eta egotz ceçan bere buruä haren aitzinera , eta erran cieçón eguia gucia .

text: And he said unto her , Daughter , thy faith hath made thee whole ; go in peace , and be whole of thy plague .
text2: Eta harc erran cieçón , Alabá , eure fedeac saluatu au , habil baquerequin , eta aicén sendo eure plagatic .

text: While he yet spake , there came from the ruler of the synagogue ' s house certain which said , Thy daughter is dead : why troublest thou the Master any further ?
text2: Oraino hura minço cela ethor citecen batzu synagogaco principalarenetic , cioitela , Hire alabá hil duc , cergatic fatigatzen duc Magistrua ?

text: As soon as Jesus heard the word that was spoken , he saith unto the ruler of the synagogue , Be not afraid , only believe .
text2: Eta Iesusec erraiten cen hitz haur ençun çuen beçain sarri , diotsa synagogaco principalari , Eztuála beldurric , sinhetsac solament .

text: And he suffered no man to follow him , save Peter , and James , and John the brother of James .
text2: Eta etzeçan permetti nehor iarreiqui lequión Pierris , eta Iacques , eta Ioannes Iacquesen anayea baicen .

text: And he cometh to the house of the ruler of the synagogue , and seeth the tumult , and them that wept and wailed greatly .
text2: Guero ethor cedin synagogaco principalaren etchera , eta ikus citzan tumultoa , eta nigarrez ceudenac , eta dolu handi ekarten çutenac .

text: And when he was come in , he saith unto them , Why make ye this ado , and weep ? the damsel is not dead , but sleepeth .
text2: Eta sarthuric dioste , Cergatic tormentatzen çarete , eta nigarrez çaudete ? nescatchá ezta hil , baina lo datza .

text: And they laughed him to scorn . But when he had put them all out , he taketh the father and the mother of the damsel , and them that were with him , and entereth in where the damsel was lying .
text2: Eta irriz ceuden harçaz : baina harc guciac idoquiric campora , har citzan nescatcharen aitá eta amá , eta harequin ciradenac , eta sartzen da nescatchá cetzan lekura .

text: And he took the damsel by the hand , and said unto her , Talitha cumi ; which is , being interpreted , Damsel , I say unto thee , arise .
text2: Eta harturic nescatcharen escua , diotsa , Talitha - cumi : erran nahi baita , Nescatchá ( hiri diosnat ) iaiqui adi .

text: And straightway the damsel arose , and walked ; for she was of the age of twelve years . And they were astonished with a great astonishment .
text2: Eta bertan iaiqui cedin nescatchá , eta baçabilan : ecen hamabi vrthetacoa cen : eta spantamendu handiz spanta citecen .

text: And he charged them straitly that no man should know it ; and commanded that something should be given her to eat .
text2: Eta haguitz manatu vkan ditu , nehorc haur ezlaquian : eta erran ceçan iatera nescatchari eman lequión .

text: And he went out from thence , and came into his own country ; and his disciples follow him .
text2: Guero parti cedin handic , eta ethor cedin bere herrira , eta baçarreitzan bere discipuluac .

text: And when the sabbath day was come , he began to teach in the synagogue : and many hearing him were astonished , saying , From whence hath this man these things ? and what wisdom is this which is given unto him , that even such mighty works are wrought by his hands ?
text2: Eta ethorri cenean Sabbathoa , has cedin synagogán iracasten , eta ençuten çutenetaric anhitzec miresten çuten , cioitela , Nondic huni gauça hauc ? eta ceric da huni eman içan çayon sapientia haur , eta are hunelaco verthuteac hunen escuz eguiten baitirade ?

text: Is not this the carpenter , the son of Mary , the brother of James , and Joses , and of Juda , and Simon ? and are not his sisters here with us ? And they were offended at him .
text2: Ezta haur charpanter ? Mariaren seme , Iacquesen eta Iosesen eta Iudaren eta Simonen anaye ? eztirade hunen arrebac - ere hemen gu baithan ? Eta scandalizatzen ciraden hartan .

text: But Jesus said unto them , A prophet is not without honour , but in his own country , and among his own kin , and in his own house .
text2: Eta erraiten cerauen Iesusec , Ezta Prophetabat desohoratzen bere herrian , eta ahaidén artean , eta bere etchean baicen .

text: And he could there do no mighty work , save that he laid his hands upon a few sick folk , and healed them .
text2: Eta ecin eguin çuen han verthuteric batre , cembeit eri bakoitz , escuac hayén gainean eçarriric , senda baitzitzan baicen .

text: And he marvelled because of their unbelief . And he went round about the villages , teaching .
text2: Eta miraz cegoén hayéc incredulitateagatic , eta inguratzen cituen burguäc inguru , iracasten ari cela .

text: And he called unto him the twelve , and began to send them forth by two and two ; and gave them power over unclean spirits ;
text2: Orduan dei citzan hamabiac , eta has cedin hayén igorten birá : eta eman ciecén bothere spiritu satsuén gainean .

text: And commanded them that they should take nothing for their journey , save a staff only ; no scrip , no bread , no money in their purse :
text2: Eta mana citzan ezleçaten deus har bidecotzat , makila hutsa baicen : ez maletaric , ez oguiric , ez diruric guerricoan .

text: But be shod with sandals ; and not put on two coats .
text2: Baina sandaleac iaunciac lituzten eta birá arropaz ezlitecen vezti .

text: And he said unto them , In what place soever ye enter into an house , there abide till ye depart from that place .
text2: Eta erraiten cerauen , Non - ere sarthuren baitzarete etche batetarra , çaudete han handic ilki arterano .

text: And whosoever shall not receive you , nor hear you , when ye depart thence , shake off the dust under your feet for a testimony against them . Verily I say unto you , It shall be more tolerable for Sodom and Gomorrha in the day of judgment , than for that city .
text2: Eta norc - ere recebituren ezpaitzaituzte , eta çuec ez ençunen , handic partitzean , iharros eçaçue çuen oinén azpico errhautsa , testimoniagetan hayén contra . Eguiaz diotsuet , emequiago tractatuac içanen diradela Sodomacoac eta Gomorrhacoac iudicioco egunean , ecen ez hiri hura .

text: And they went out , and preached that men should repent .
text2: Eta hec partituric predicatzen çuten batbedera emenda ledin .

text: And they cast out many devils , and anointed with oil many that were sick , and healed them .
text2: Eta deabru anhitz campora egoizten çutén : eta vnctatzen çutén olioz anhitz eri , eta sendatzen cituzten .

text: And king Herod heard of him ; ( for his name was spread abroad : ) and he said , That John the Baptist was risen from the dead , and therefore mighty works do shew forth themselves in him .
text2: Eta ençun ceçan regue Herodesec minçatzen ( ecen haren icena cen famatua ) eta erran ceçan , Ioannes batheyatzen ari cena , resuscitatu içan da hiletaric , eta halacotz verthutéc obratzen duté hartan .

text: Others said , That it is Elias . And others said , That it is a prophet , or as one of the prophets .
text2: Bercéc cioiten , Elias da : Eta bercéc cioiten , Prophetada , edo Prophetetaric bat beçalaco .

text: But when Herod heard thereof , he said , It is John , whom I beheaded : he is risen from the dead .
text2: Bada hori ençunic Herodesec dio , Haur da Ioannes nic buruä edequi draucadana , hura resuscitatu da hiletaric .

text: For Herod himself had sent forth and laid hold upon John , and bound him in prison for Herodias ' sake , his brother Philip ' s wife : for he had married her .
text2: Ecen Herodes hunec gende igorriric har ceçan Ioannes , eta esteca ceçan presoindeguian , Herodias bere anaye Philipperen emaztearen causaz , ceren hura emazte hartu baitzuen .

text: For John had said unto Herod , It is not lawful for thee to have thy brother ' s wife .
text2: Ecen erraiten ceraucan Ioannesec Herodesi , Eztuc sori euri anayeren emaztea duán .

text: Therefore Herodias had a quarrel against him , and would have killed him ; but she could not :
text2: Halacotz Herodias ayher çayón , eta hil eraci nahi çuen , baina ecin ceçaqueen .

text: For Herod feared John , knowing that he was a just man and an holy , and observed him ; and when he heard him , he did many things , and heard him gladly .
text2: Ecen Herodes beldur çayón Ioannesi , eçaguturic ecen hura cela guiçon iustoa eta saindua , eta ohore ekarten ceraucan : eta hura ençunic anhitz gauça eguiten çuen , eta gogotic hura ençuten çuen .

text: And when a convenient day was come , that Herod on his birthday made a supper to his lords , high captains , and chief estates of Galilee ;
text2: Bada egun carazcoa ethorri cenean , Herodesec bere sor eguneco banqueta eguiten cerauenean princiey eta capitainey eta Galileaco principaley :

text: And when the daughter of the said Herodias came in , and danced , and pleased Herod and them that sat with him , the king said unto the damsel , Ask of me whatsoever thou wilt , and I will give it thee .
text2: Eta sarthuric Herodiasen alabá dançatu cenean , eta Herodesi eta harequin mahainean iarriric ceudeney atseguin eguin cerauenean , Reguec diotsa nescatchari , Esca aquit cer - ere nahi baitun , eta emanen draunat .

text: And he sware unto her , Whatsoever thou shalt ask of me , I will give it thee , unto the half of my kingdom .
text2: Eta cin eguin cieçón : Escaturen aitzaitadan gucia emanen draunat , neure resumaren erdirano .

text: And she went forth , and said unto her mother , What shall I ask ? And she said , The head of John the Baptist .
text2: Eta harc ilkiric erran cieçón bere amari , Cer escaturen naiz ? Eta harc erran ceçan , Ioannes Baptistaren buruären .

text: And she came in straightway with haste unto the king , and asked , saying , I will that thou give me by and by in a charger the head of John the Baptist .
text2: Eta bertan sarthuric affectionatuqui Reguegana , esca cequión , cioela , Nahi diat orain bertan eman dieçadán platean Ioannes Baptistaren buruä .

text: And the king was exceeding sorry ; yet for his oath ' s sake , and for their sakes which sat with him , he would not reject her .
text2: Eta Reguec haguitz tristeturic , cinagatic eta harequin mahainean iarriric ceudenacgatic , eztu iraitzi nahi vkan .

text: And immediately the king sent an executioner , and commanded his head to be brought : and he went and beheaded him in the prison ,
text2: Eta bertan Reguec , igorriric borreroa , mana ceçan ekar ledin haren buruä : harc bada ioanic edequi cieçón buruä presoindeguian .

text: And brought his head in a charger , and gave it to the damsel : and the damsel gave it to her mother .
text2: Eta ekar ceçan haren buruä platean , eta eman cieçón hura nescatchari , eta nescachác eman cieçón bere amari .

text: And when his disciples heard of it , they came and took up his corpse , and laid it in a tomb .
text2: Eta hori ençunic haren discipuluac ethor citecen , eta eraman ceçaten haren gorputza , eta eçar ceçaten thumbán .

text: And the apostles gathered themselves together unto Jesus , and told him all things , both what they had done , and what they had taught .
text2: Eta bil citecen Apostoluac Iesusgana , eta conta cieçoten eguin eta iracatsi çuten gucia .

text: And he said unto them , Come ye yourselves apart into a desert place , and rest a while : for there were many coming and going , and they had no leisure so much as to eat .
text2: Eta erran ciecén , Çatozte ceuróc appart leku desertu batetara , eta reposa çaitezte gutibat : ecen anhitz ciraden ethorten eta ioaiten ciradenac : eta iateco aicinaric - ere etzutén .

text: And they departed into a desert place by ship privately .
text2: Ioan citecen bada leku desertu batetara vncian appart :

text: And the people saw them departing , and many knew him , and ran afoot thither out of all cities , and outwent them , and came together unto him .
text2: Baina ikus citzan populuac ioaiten , eta eçagut ceçaten hura anhitzec : eta oinez hiri gucietaric laster eguin ceçaten hara , eta aitzin cequizten hæy , eta bil citecen harengana .

text: And Jesus , when he came out , saw much people , and was moved with compassion toward them , because they were as sheep not having a shepherd : and he began to teach them many things .
text2: Orduan ilkiric ikus ceçan gendetze handia Iesusec , eta compassione har ceçan heçaz : ecen ardi artzain gabeac beçala ciraden : eta has cequién anhitz gauçaren iracasten .

text: And when the day was now far spent , his disciples came unto him , and said , This is a desert place , and now the time is far passed :
text2: Eta nola ia berandua baitzén , ethorri içan çaizcan bere discipuluac , erraiten çutela , Desertu duc leku haur , eta ia berandua duc :

text: Send them away , that they may go into the country round about , and into the villages , and buy themselves bread : for they have nothing to eat .
text2: Eyec congit , inguruco herrietarát eta burgüetarat ioanic , berén ogui eros deçatençát : ecen cer ian deçaten eztié .

text: He answered and said unto them , Give ye them to eat . And they say unto him , Shall we go and buy two hundred pennyworth of bread , and give them to eat ?
text2: Eta harc ihardesten çuela erran ciecén , Eyeçue çuec iatera . Orduan diotsate , Ala ioanic erossiren dugu ber - ehun dineroren oguia , eta emanen drauegu iatera ?

text: He saith unto them , How many loaves have ye ? go and see . And when they knew , they say , Five , and two fishes .
text2: Eta harc dioste , Cembat ogui dituçue ? çoazte eta ikar eçaçue . Eta iaquin dutenean dioite , Borz , eta bi arrain .

text: And he commanded them to make all sit down by companies upon the green grass .
text2: Orduan mana citzan , iar eraci litzaten guciac mahaintaraz belhar pherde gainean .

text: And they sat down in ranks , by hundreds , and by fifties .
text2: Eta iar citecen arencaz , ehuná , eta berroguey eta hamarná .

text: And when he had taken the five loaves and the two fishes , he looked up to heaven , and blessed , and brake the loaves , and gave them to his disciples to set before them ; and the two fishes divided he among them all .
text2: Eta borz oguiac eta bi arrainac hartu cituenean , beguiac cerurát altchaturic , gratiác renda citzan , eta hauts citzan oguiac : eta eman cietzén bere discipuluey , hæy aitzinera eçar lietzençat : eta bi arrainac parti cietzén guciey .

text: And they did all eat , and were filled .
text2: Eta ian ceçaten guciéc , eta ressasia citecen .

text: And they took up twelve baskets full of the fragments , and of the fishes .
text2: Eta goiti ceçaten çathietaric hamabi sasquitara , eta arrainetaric cerbait .

text: And they that did eat of the loaves were about five thousand men .
text2: Eta ian çutenac ciraden borz milla guiçonen inguruä .

text: And straightway he constrained his disciples to get into the ship , and to go to the other side before unto Bethsaida , while he sent away the people .
text2: Guero bertan bere discipuluac sar eraci citzan vncira , eta aitzinean ioan eraci itsassoaren berce aldera Bethsaida alderát , berac populuari congit lemon bizquitartean .

text: And when he had sent them away , he departed into a mountain to pray .
text2: Eta hec igorri cituenean , mendira ioan cedin othoitz eguitera .

text: And when even was come , the ship was in the midst of the sea , and he alone on the land .
text2: Eta arrastu cenean , vncia cen itsassoaren erdian , eta hura bera leihorrean .

text: And he saw them toiling in rowing ; for the wind was contrary unto them : and about the fourth watch of the night he cometh unto them , walking upon the sea , and would have passed by them .
text2: Eta ikus ceçan pena çutela , aurthiquiten : ( ecen haice - contra çutén ) eta gauären laurgarren veilla irian ethor cedin hetara , itsas gainez çabilala : eta nahi cituen hec iragan .

text: But when they saw him walking upon the sea , they supposed it had been a spirit , and cried out :
text2: Baina hec hura ikussiric itsas gainez çabilala , vste çuten fantosmabat cela : eta oihu eguin ceçaten ,

text: For they all saw him , and were troubled . And immediately he talked with them , and saith unto them , Be of good cheer : it is I ; be not afraid .
text2: Ecen guciéc ikusten çuten hura , eta trubla citecen : baina bertan minça cequién , eta erran ciecén , Sporça çaitezte , ni naiz , etzaretela beldur .

text: And he went up unto them into the ship ; and the wind ceased : and they were sore amazed in themselves beyond measure , and wondered .
text2: Orduan igan cedin hetara vncira : eta sossega cedin haicea : non are tinquetz spantago baitzitecen berac baithan , eta mirets ceçaten .

text: For they considered not the miracle of the loaves : for their heart was hardened .
text2: Ecen etzutén aditu oguiéz eguin içan cena : ceren hayén bihotza gogortua baitzén .

text: And when they had passed over , they came into the land of Gennesaret , and drew to the shore .
text2: Eta berce aldera iragan ciradenean , ethor citecen Genesarethco lurrera , eta portu har ceçaten .

text: And when they were come out of the ship , straightway they knew him ,
text2: Eta vncitic ilki ciradenean , bertan eçagut ceçaten hura .

text: And ran through that whole region round about , and began to carry about in beds those that were sick , where they heard he was .
text2: Eta laster eguin çutenean inguruco comarca hura gucia , has citecen ohetan erién ekarten , non cela hura ençuten baitzuten , hara .

text: And whithersoever he entered , into villages , or cities , or country , they laid the sick in the streets , and besought him that they might touch if it were but the border of his garment : and as many as touched him were made whole .
text2: Eta nora - ere sar baitzedin burguètara , edo hirietara , edo parropioetara , placetan eçarten cituzten eriac , eta othoitz eguiten ceraucaten haren arropa ezpaina berere hunqui leçaten : eta hunquitzen çutén guciac sendatzen ciraden .

text: Then came together unto him the Pharisees , and certain of the scribes , which came from Jerusalem .
text2: Orduan bil citecen harengana Phariseuac , eta Ierusalemetic ethorri içan ciraden Scriba batzu .

text: And when they saw some of his disciples eat bread with defiled , that is to say , with unwashen , hands , they found fault .
text2: Eta hec ikussi çutenean haren discipuluetaric batzuc escu communez ( erran nahi baita , ikuci gabéz ) iaten çutela oguia , arrangura citecen .

text: For the Pharisees , and all the Jews , except they wash their hands oft , eat not , holding the tradition of the elders .
text2: Ecen Phariseuéc eta Iudu guciéc , maiz escuac ikuciric baicen , eztute iaten , aitzinecoen ordenançác eduquiten dituztela .

text: And when they come from the market , except they wash , they eat not . And many other things there be , which they have received to hold , as the washing of cups , and pots , brasen vessels , and of tables .
text2: Eta merkatutic itzultzen , diradenean , ikuciac ezpadirade , eztuté iaten . Anhitz berce gauçaric - ere bada beguiratzeco hartu dutenic , nola baitirade goporrén ikutzeac , eta cubenac , eta cobrezco vncienac , eta ohenac .

text: Then the Pharisees and scribes asked him , Why walk not thy disciples according to the tradition of the elders , but eat bread with unwashen hands ?
text2: Guero interrogatzen dute Phariseuéc eta Scribéc , Cergatic hire discipuluac eztabiltza aitzinecoen ordenancén araura , baina escuac ikuci gabe iaten dute oguia ?

text: He answered and said unto them , Well hath Esaias prophesied of you hypocrites , as it is written , This people honoureth me with their lips , but their heart is far from me .
text2: Baina harc ihardesten çuela erran ciecén , Segurqui vngui prophetizatu vkan du Esaiasec çueçaz hypocritoz , scribatua den beçala , Populu hunec ezpainez ohoratzen nau , baina hayén bihotza vrrun da eneganic .

text: Howbeit in vain do they worship me , teaching for doctines the commandments of men .
text2: Baina alferretan cerbitzatzen naute , iracasten dituztela doctrinatzat guiçonén manamenduac .

text: For laying aside the commandment of God , ye hold the tradition of men , as the washing of pots and cups : and many other such like things ye do .
text2: Ecen Iaincoaren manamendua vtziric , guiçonen ordenançá eduquiten duçue , hala nola , cubén eta goporrén ikutzeac : eta hunelaco berce gauçaric anhitz eguiten duçue .

text: And he said unto them , Full well ye reject the commandment of God , that ye may keep your own tradition .
text2: Erraiten cerauen halaber , Vngui nombait iraizten duçue Iaincoaren manamendua , çuen ordenançá beguira deçacuençát .

text: For Moses said , Honour thy father and thy mother ; and , Whoso curseth father or mother , let him die the death :
text2: Ecen Moysesec erran du , Ohoraitzac eure aita eta eure ama : eta , Aita edo ama maradicaturen duena , herioz hil bedi .

text: But ye say , If a man shall say to his father or mother , It is Corban , that is to say , a gift , by whatsoever thou mightest be profited by me ; he shall be free .
text2: Baina çuec dioçue , Baldin norbeitec aitari edo amari baderró , Eneganic içanen den corbana ( erran nahi baita donoa ) probetchaturen çaic , hoguen gabe date hura .

text: And ye suffer him no more to do ought for his father or his mother ;
text2: Eta eztuçue permettitzen harc deus guehiagoric eguin dieçón bere aitari edo bere amari :

text: Making the word of God of none effect through your tradition , which ye have delivered : and many such like things do ye .
text2: Ezdeusten duçuela Iaincoaren hitza ceuroc ordenatu duçuen ordenançáz : eta hunelaco berce gauçaric anhitz eguiten duçue .

text: And when he had called all the people unto him , he said unto them , Hearken unto me every one of you , and understand :
text2: Guero deithuric populu gucia beregana , erran ciecén , Beha çaquizquidate guciac , eta adi eçaçue .

text: There is nothing from without a man , that entering into him can defile him : but the things which come out of him , those are they that defile the man .
text2: Ezta deus guiçonaren campotic , hura baithan sartzen denic , hura satsu ahal deçaquenic : baina harenganic ilkiten diraden gauçác dirade , guiçona satsutzen dutenac .

text: If any man have ears to hear , let him hear .
text2: Nehorc ençuteco beharriric badu ençun beça .

text: And when he was entered into the house from the people , his disciples asked him concerning the parable .
text2: Guero etchean sarthu cenean populutic retiraturic interroga ceçaten bere discipuluéc comparationeaz .

text: And he saith unto them , Are ye so without understanding also ? Do ye not perceive , that whatsoever thing from without entereth into the man , it cannot defile him ;
text2: Eta dioste , Horrela çuec - ere adimendu gabe çarete ? Eztuçue aditzen , ecen campotic guiçona baithan sartzen diradenetaric deusec , ecin hura satsu deçaquela ?

text: Because it entereth not into his heart , but into the belly , and goeth out into the draught , purging all meats ?
text2: Ecen ezta sartzen haren bihotzera , baina sabelera , eta ilkiten da campora retreitera , chahutzen dituela vianda guciac .

text: And he said , That which cometh out of the man , that defileth the man .
text2: Ciosten bada , Guiçonaganic ilkiten dena da , guiçona satsutzen duena .

text: For from within , out of the heart of men , proceed evil thoughts , adulteries , fornications , murders ,
text2: Ecen barnetic , guiçonén bihotzetic ilkiten dirade pensamendu gaichtoac , adulterioac , paillardiçác , hiltzecác ,

text: Thefts , covetousness , wickedness , deceit , lasciviousness , an evil eye , blasphemy , pride , foolishness :
text2: Ohoinqueriác , auaritiác , gaichtaqueriác , enganioa , insolentia , bekaizteria , gaitzerraitea , superbiá , erhotassuna :

text: All these evil things come from within , and defile the man .
text2: Gaichtaqueria hauc guciac barnetic ilkiten dirade , eta satsutzen dute guiçona .

text: And from thence he arose , and went into the borders of Tyre and Sidon , and entered into an house , and would have no man know it : but he could not be hid .
text2: Eta handic iaiquiric ioan cedin Tyreco eta Sidongo comarquetarát : eta etche batetan sarthuric , etzuen nahi nehorc iaquin leçan : baina ecin estali içan da .

text: For a certain woman , whose young daughter had an unclean spirit , heard of him , and came and fell at his feet :
text2: Ecen harçaz ençunic emaztebatec , ceinen alabatchoac baitzuen spiritu satsua , ethorriric egotz ceçan bere buruä haren oinetara ,

text: The woman was a Greek , a Syrophenician by nation ; and she besought him that he would cast forth the devil out of her daughter .
text2: ( Eta emaztea cen Grec , nationez Syrophenissiana ) eta othoitz eguiten ceraucan campora egotz leçan deabrua haren alabaganic .

text: But Jesus said unto her , Let the children first be filled : for it is not meet to take the children ' s bread , and to cast it unto the dogs .
text2: Eta Iesusec erran cieçón , Vtzan behin haourrac ressasia ditecen : ecen eztun gauça bidezcoa haourrén oguiaren hartzea , eta chakurrey egoiztea .

text: And she answered and said unto him , Yes , Lord : yet the dogs under the table eat of the children ' s crumbs .
text2: Eta harc ihardets ceçan , eta erran cieçón , Hala duc Iauna : badaric - ere chakurréc iaten dié mahain azpian haourrén appurretaric .

text: And he said unto her , For this saying go thy way ; the devil is gone out of thy daughter .
text2: Orduan erran cieçón , Hitz horrengatic ohá , ilki dun deabrua hire alabaganic .

text: And when she was come to her house , she found the devil gone out , and her daughter laid upon the bed .
text2: Eta ioan içan cenean bere etchera , eriden ceçan deabrua ilki cela , eta alabá ohe gainean cetzala .

text: And again , departing from the coasts of Tyre and Sidon , he came unto the sea of Galilee , through the midst of the coasts of Decapolis .
text2: Guero partituric Tyreco eta Sidongo quoarteretaric , ethor cedin Galileaco itsassora , Decapolisco comarquén arteaz .

text: And they bring unto him one that was deaf , and had an impediment in his speech ; and they beseech him to put his hand upon him .
text2: Orduan presentatzen draucate gor nequez minço cembat , eta othoitz eguiten escua gainean eçar lieçón .

text: And he took him aside from the multitude , and put his fingers into his ears , and he spit , and touched his tongue ;
text2: Eta hura gendetzetic appart harturic , eçar citzan bere erhiac haren beharrietan : eta thu eguinic , hunqui ceçan haren mihia .

text: And looking up to heaven , he sighed , and saith unto him , Ephphatha , that is , Be opened .
text2: Guero cerurat beguiac altchaturic suspirio eguin ceçan , eta erran cieçón Ephphata , erran nahi baita , Irequi adi .

text: And straightway his ears were opened , and the string of his tongue was loosed , and he spake plain .
text2: Eta bertan irequi citecen haren beharriac , eta lacha cedin haren mihico etchequidurá , eta minço cen claroqui .

text: And he charged them that they should tell no man : but the more he charged them , so much the more a great deal they published it ;
text2: Eta mana citzan nehori ezlerroten : baina cembat - ere harc defenda baitziecén , vnguiz guehiago publicatzen çutén .

text: And were beyond measure astonished , saying , He hath done all things well : he maketh both the deaf to hear , and the dumb to speak .
text2: Eta guciz miraculu esten çutén , cioitela , Vngui gauça guciac eguin ditu : gorrey ençun eraciten draue , eta mutuac minça eraciten ditu .

text: In those days the multitude being very great , and having nothing to eat , Jesus called his disciples unto him , and saith unto them ,
text2: Egun hetan , gucizco gendetze handia cen becala , eta ezpaitzuten cer ian leçaten , dei citzan beregana Iesusec bere discipuluac , eta erran ciecen ,

text: I have compassion on the multitude , because they have now been with me three days , and have nothing to eat :
text2: Compassione dut populuaz : ecen ia hirur egun du enequin daudela , eta eztuté cer ian deçaten .

text: And if I send them away fasting to their own houses , they will faint by the way : for divers of them came from far .
text2: Eta baldin igor baditzat baruric cein bere etcherat , flacaturen dirade bidean : ecen horietaric batzu vrrundanic ethorri içan dirade .

text: And his disciples answered him , From whence can a man satisfy these men with bread here in the wilderness ?
text2: Eta ihardets cieçoten bere discipuluéc , Nondic hauc hemen nehorc ressasia ahal litzaque oguiz desertuan ?

text: And he asked them , How many loaves have ye ? And they said , Seven .
text2: Eta interroga citzan , Cembat ogui dituçue ? Eta hec erran ceçaten , Çazpi .

text: And he commanded the people to sit down on the ground : and he took the seven loaves , and gave thanks , and brake , and gave to his disciples to set before them ; and they did set them before the people .
text2: Orduan mana ceçan populua iar ledin lurrean : eta harturic çazpi oguiac , gratiác rendatu eta , hauts citzan , eta eman cietzen bere discipuluey , presenta litzatençat : eta presentatu cituzten populuaren aitzinean .

text: And they had a few small fishes : and he blessed , and commanded to set them also before them .
text2: Bacituzten halaber arrain guti batzu , eta gratiác rendaturic , erran ceçan hec - ere presenta litzaten .

text: So they did eat , and were filled : and they took up of the broken meat that was left seven baskets .
text2: Ian ceçaten bada , eta ressasia citecen : eta altcha citzaten çathi soberatuetaric çazpi sasquitara .

text: And they that had eaten were about four thousand : and he sent them away .
text2: Eta ian çutenac ciraden laur millaren inguruä , guero eman ciecén congit .

text: And straightway he entered into a ship with his disciples , and came into the parts of Dalmanutha .
text2: Eta bertan uncira sarthuric bere discipuluequin , ethor cedin Dalmanutha bazterretara .

text: And the Pharisees came forth , and began to question with him , seeking of him a sign from heaven , tempting him .
text2: Eta ethor citecen Phariseuac , eta has citecen harequin iharduquiten , hari cembeit signoren cerutic galdez caizcala , hura tentatzen çutela .

text: And he sighed deeply in his spirit , and saith , Why doth this generation seek after a sign ? verily I say unto you , There shall no sign be given unto this generation .
text2: Orduan barnadanic bere spirituan suspirio eguinic , erran ceçan , Cergatic generatione haur signo galdez dago ? eguiaz diotsuet generatione huni signoric etzayola emanen .

text: And he left them , and entering into the ship again departed to the other side .
text2: Eta hec vtziric , vncian berriz sarthuric iragan cedin berce aldera .

text: Now the disciples had forgotten to take bread , neither had they in the ship with them more than one loaf .
text2: Eta ogui hartzera discipuluey ahanz cequién : eta oguibat baicen etzutén berequin vncian .

text: And he charged them , saying , Take heed , beware of the leaven of the Pharisees , and of the leaven of Herod .
text2: Eta mana citzan , cioela , Gogoauçue eta beguira çaitezte Phariseuén altchagarritic , eta Herodesen altchagarritic .

text: And they reasoned among themselves , saying , It is because we have no bread .
text2: Eta baciharducaten elkarren contra , cioitela , Ceren oguiric eztugun da hori .

text: And when Jesus knew it , he saith unto them , Why reason ye , because ye have no bread ? perceive ye not yet , neither understand ? have ye your heart yet hardened ?
text2: Eta hori eçagutu çuenean Iesusec , erran ciecen , Cer diharducaçue , ceren oguiric eztuçuen ? oraino eztuçue consideratzen ez aditzen ? oraino gogortua duçue çuen bihotza .

text: Having eyes , see ye not ? and having ears , hear ye not ? and do ye not remember ?
text2: Beguiac dituçuelaric , eztacussaçue ? eta beharriac dituçuelaric , eztançuçue ? eta etzarete orhoit ?

text: When I brake the five loaves among five thousand , how many baskets full of fragments took ye up ? They say unto him , Twelve .
text2: Borz oguiac hautsi nerauztenean borz milla guiçoney cembat sasqui çathiz beteric altchatu centuzten ? Diotsate , Hamabi .

text: And when the seven among four thousand , how many baskets full of fragments took ye up ? And they said , Seven .
text2: Eta çazpiac laur milla guiçoney hautsi nerauztenean cembat sasqui çathiz betheric altchatu centuzten ? Eta hec erran cieçoten , Çazpi .

text: And he said unto them , How is it that ye do not understand ?
text2: Eta erran ciecén , Nola eztuçue aditzen ?

text: And he cometh to Bethsaida ; and they bring a blind man unto him , and besought him to touch him .
text2: Eta ethor cedin Bethsaidara : eta presenta cieçoten itsubat , eta othoitz ceguioten , hura hunqui leçan .

text: And he took the blind man by the hand , and led him out of the town ; and when he had spit on his eyes , and put his hands upon him , he asked him if he saw ought .
text2: Orduan itsuaren escua harturic , eraman ceçan burgutic campora : eta haren beguietara thu eguinic , eta escuac haren gainean eçarriric , interroga ceçan , deus balacussanez .

text: And he looked up , and said , I see men as trees , walking .
text2: Eta harc beguiac altchaturic erran ceçan , Badiacusquiat guiçonac , ecen ohartzen nitziayec arboreac diruditela dabiltzala .

text: After that he put his hands again upon his eyes , and made him look up : and he was restored , and saw every man clearly .
text2: Guero berriz eçar citzan escuac haren beguién gainean , eta berriz goiti beha eraci cieçón : eta senda cedin , eta ikusten cituen vrrundanic - ere claroqui guciac .

text: And he sent him away to his house , saying , Neither go into the town , nor tell it to any in the town .
text2: Orduan Iesusec igor ceçan hura bere etcherát , cioela , Ezadila burgura sar , eta nehori ezterroala burguän .

text: And Jesus went out , and his disciples , into the towns of Caesarea Philippi : and by the way he asked his disciples , saying unto them , Whom do men say that I am ?
text2: Eta Iesus eta haren discipuluac handic ilkiric ethor citecen Philipperen Cesarea deitzen deneco burguètara : eta bidean interroga citzan bere discipuluac , ciostela , Nor naicela ni dioite guiçonéc ?

text: And they answered , John the Baptist : but some say , Elias ; and others , One of the prophets .
text2: Eta hec ihardets ceçaten , Ioannes Baptista , eta bercéc Elias , eta bercéc Prophetetaric bat .

text: And he saith unto them , But whom say ye that I am ? And Peter answereth and saith unto him , Thou art the Christ .
text2: Orduan harc dioste , Eta çuec ni nor naicela dioçue ? Eta ihardesten duela Pierrisec diotsa , Hi aiz Christ .

text: And he charged them that they should tell no man of him .
text2: Orduan debeta citzan mehatchurequin nehori hura ezlerroten harçaz .

text: And he began to teach them , that the Son of man must suffer many things , and be rejected of the elders , and of the chief priests , and scribes , and be killed , and after three days rise again .
text2: Eta has cedin hayén iracasten , ecen behar cela guiçonaren Semeac anhitz suffri leçan , eta reproba ledin Ancianoéz , eta Sacrificadore principaléz , eta Scribéz , eta hil ledin , eta hereneco egunean resuscita ledin .

text: And he spake that saying openly . And Peter took him , and began to rebuke him .
text2: Eta claroqui propos hunez minçatzen cen . Orduan apparta ceçan Pierrisec , eta has cequión reprotchatzen .

text: But when he had turned about and looked on his disciples , he rebuked Peter , saying , Get thee behind me , Satan : for thou savourest not the things that be of God , but the things that be of men .
text2: Eta harc itzuliric , eta bere discipuluetarat behaturic reprotcha ceçan Pierris , cioela , Guibelerat adi eneganic Satan : ecen eztituc aditzen Iaincoaren diraden gauçác , baina guiçonén diradenac .

text: And when he had called the people unto him with his disciples also , he said unto them , Whosoever will come after me , let him deny himself , and take up his cross , and follow me .
text2: Guero populua beregana deithuric bere discipuluequin , erran ciecén , Norc - ere nahi baitu ene ondoan ethorri , renuntia beça bere buruäz , eta har beça bere crutzea , eta berrait niri .

text: For whosoever will save his life shall lose it ; but whosoever shall lose his life for my sake and the gospel ' s , the same shall save it .
text2: Ecen norc - ere nahi vkanen baitu bere vicia saluatu , galduren du hura : baina norc - ere galduren baitu bere vicia enegatic eta Euangeliogatic , saluaturen du hura .

text: For what shall it profit a man , if he shall gain the whole world , and lose his own soul ?
text2: Ecen cer probetchu du guiçonac , baldin mundu gucia irabaz badeça , eta bere arimá gal badeça ?

text: Or what shall a man give in exchange for his soul ?
text2: Edo cer emanen du guiçonac bere arimaren recompensamendutan ?

text: Whosoever therefore shall be ashamed of me and of my words in this adulterous and sinful generation ; of him also shall the Son of man be ashamed , when he cometh in the glory of his Father with the holy angels .
text2: Ecen norc - ere ahalque içanen baita niçaz eta ene hitzéz generatione adultera eta bekatore hunetan , guiçonaren Semea - ere ahalque içanen da harçaz , dathorrenean bere Aitaren glorián Aingueru sainduequin .

text: And he said unto them , Verily I say unto you , That there be some of them that stand here , which shall not taste of death , till they have seen the kingdom of God come with power .
text2: Erraiten cerauen halaber , Eguiaz erraiten drauçuet , ecen badiradela hemen present diradenotaric batzu , herioa dastaturen eztutenic , Iaincoaren resumá bothererequin ethorriric dacusqueiteno .

text: And after six days Jesus taketh with him Peter , and James , and John , and leadeth them up into an high mountain apart by themselves : and he was transfigured before them .
text2: Eta sey egunen buruän har citzan Pierris , eta Iacques eta Ioannes , eta eraman citzan mendi gora batetara appart hec berac , eta transfigura cedin hayén aitzinean .

text: And his raiment became shining , exceeding white as snow ; so as no fuller on earth can white them .
text2: Eta haren abillamenduac argui citecen , eta haguitz churit elhurra beçala , halaca non bolaçalec lurraren gainean ecin hain churi eguin baileçaque .

text: And there appeared unto them Elias with Moses : and they were talking with Jesus .
text2: Guero aguer cequién Elies Moysesequin , eta minço ciraden Iesusequin .

text: And Peter answered and said to Jesus , Master , it is good for us to be here : and let us make three tabernacles ; one for thee , and one for Moses , and one for Elias .
text2: Orduan Pierrisec hitza harturic diotsa Iesusi , Magistruá , on duc gu hemen garén : eguin ditzagun bada hirur tabernacle , bat hire , eta bat Moysesen , eta bat Eliasen .

text: For he wist not what to say ; for they were sore afraid .
text2: Eta cer minço cen etzaquian : ecen icituac ciraden .

text: And there was a cloud that overshadowed them : and a voice came out of the cloud , saying , This is my beloved Son : hear him .
text2: Eta eguin cedin hodeybat hec estali cituenic : eta ethor cedin vozbat hodeyetic , cioela , Haur da ene Seme maitea : huni beha çaquizquiote .

text: And suddenly , when they had looked round about , they saw no man any more , save Jesus only with themselves .
text2: Eta bertan inguru behaturic , etzeçaten ikus nehor guehiagoric , Iesus bera baicen berequin

text: And as they came down from the mountain , he charged them that they should tell no man what things they had seen , till the Son of man were risen from the dead .
text2: Eta hec menditic iausten ciradela , mana citzan , nehori ezlietzoten erran ikussi cituzten gauçác , guiçonaren Semea hiletaric resuscitatu licenean baicen .

text: And they kept that saying with themselves , questioning one with another what the rising from the dead should mean .
text2: Eta hec erran haur eduqui ceçaten berac baithan , elkarri galde eguiten ceraucatela , cer erran nahi çuen , hiletaric resuscitatze harc .

text: And they asked him , saying , Why say the scribes that Elias must first come ?
text2: Guero interroga ceçaten , ciotela , Cergatic dioite Scribéc ecen Elias lehen ethorri behar dela ?

text: And he answered and told them , Elias verily cometh first , and restoreth all things ; and how it is written of the Son of man , that he must suffer many things , and be set at nought .
text2: Eta harc ihardesten çuela erran ciecen , Segur Eliasec lehen ethorriric bere staturaco ditu gauça guciac : eta scribatua den beçala guiçonaren Semeaz , behar da anhitz suffri deçan , eta ezdeusetan eduqui dadin .

text: But I say unto you , That Elias is indeed come , and they have done unto him whatsoever they listed , as it is written of him .
text2: Baina erraiten drauçuet ecen Elias ethorri içan dela , eta hari eguin nahi ceraucaten gucia , eguin draucatela , harçaz scribatua den beçala .

text: And when he came to his disciples , he saw a great multitude about them , and the scribes questioning with them .
text2: Eta discipuluetara ethorriric , ikus ceçan gendetze handibat hayén inguruän , eta Scribéc hequin ciharducatela .

text: And straightway all the people , when they beheld him , were greatly amazed , and running to him saluted him .
text2: Eta bertan gendetze gucia , hura ikussiric , spanta cedin : eta harengana laster eguinez saluta ceçaten .

text: And he asked the scribes , What question ye with them ?
text2: Orduan interroga citzan Scriba hec , Cer diharducaçue çuen artean ?

text: And one of the multitude answered and said , Master , I have brought unto thee my son , which hath a dumb spirit ;
text2: Eta ihardesten çuela gendetzecoetaric batec , erran ceçan , Magistruá , ekarri diat neure semea hiregana , ceinec baitu spiritu mutubat .

text: And wheresoever he taketh him , he teareth him : and he foameth , and gnasheth with his teeth , and pineth away : and I spake to thy disciples that they should cast him out ; and they could not .
text2: Eta non - ere har baiteça , çathicatzen dic : eta orduan haguna diarioc , eta garrascots bere hortzez eguiten dic , eta eyarthu dihoac : eta erran diraueat hire discipuluey egotz leçaten campora , eta ecin eguin dié .

text: He answereth him , and saith , O faithless generation , how long shall I be with you ? how long shall I suffer you ? bring him unto me .
text2: Eta harc ihardesten çuela erran ceçan , O natione sinheste gabea , noizdrano finean çuequin içanen naiz ? noizdrano finean supportaturen çaituztet ? ekarçue hura enegana .

text: And they brought him unto him : and when he saw him , straightway the spirit tare him ; and he fell on the ground , and wallowed foaming .
text2: Orduan ekar ceçaten harengana : eta ikussi çuenean , bertan spirituac çathica ceçan hura , eta lurrera eroriric iraulzcatzen cen haguna lariola .

text: And he asked his father , How long is it ago since this came unto him ? And he said , Of a child .
text2: Orduan interroga ceçan Iesusec haren aita , Cembat dembora du haur heldu çayola ? Eta harc diotsa , Haourra - danic .

text: And ofttimes it hath cast him into the fire , and into the waters , to destroy him : but if thou canst do any thing , have compassion on us , and help us .
text2: Eta anhitzetan sura egotzi dic eta vrera , deseguin leçançat : baina deus ahal badaguic , hel aquigu , guçaz compassione harturic .

text: Jesus said unto him , If thou canst believe , all things are possible to him that believeth .
text2: Eta Iesusec erran cieçón , Baldin hori sinhets ahal badeçac , gauça guciac dituc possible sinhesten duenaren .

text: And straightway the father of the child cried out , and said with tears , Lord , I believe ; help thou mine unbelief .
text2: Eta bertan haour aitác oihuz cegoela nigarrequin erran ceçan , Sinhesten diat , Iauna , hel aquio ene incredulitateari .

text: When Jesus saw that the people came running together , he rebuked the foul spirit , saying unto him , Thou dumb and deaf spirit , I charge thee , come out of him , and enter no more into him .
text2: Eta ikussiric Iesusec ecen populua lasterca elkarganatzen cela , mehatcha ceçan spiritu satsua , ciotsala , Spiritu mutuá eta gorrá , nic aut manatzen , Ilki adi horrenganic , eta guehiagoric ez adila sar hori baithan .

text: And the spirit cried , and rent him sore , and came out of him : and he was as one dead ; insomuch that many said , He is dead .
text2: Eta spiritua oihu eguinic eta hura gaizqui çathicaturic , ilki cedin : eta haourra hila beçalaca cedin , hala non anhitzec erraiten baitzuten ecen hil cela .

text: But Jesus took him by the hand , and lifted him up ; and he arose .
text2: Baina Iesusec harén escua harturic , chuchent ceçan hura , eta iaiqui cedin .

text: And when he was come into the house , his disciples asked him privately , Why could not we cast him out ?
text2: Eta etchean sarthu cenean , bere discipuluéc interroga ceçaten appart , Cergatic guc hura ecin campora egotzi dugu ?

text: And he said unto them , This kind can come forth by nothing , but by prayer and fasting .
text2: Eta erran ciecén , Deabru mota hura bercela ecin ilki daite orationez eta barurez baicen .

text: And they departed thence , and passed through Galilee ; and he would not that any man should know it .
text2: Eta handic ilkiric , elkarrequin çabiltzan Galilean gaindi : eta etzuen nahi nehorc iaquin leçan .

text: For he taught his disciples , and said unto them , The Son of man is delivered into the hands of men , and they shall kill him ; and after that he is killed , he shall rise the third day .
text2: Ecen iracasten cituen bere discipuluac , eta ciosten , Guiçonaren Semea liuraturen da guiçonén escuetara , eta hilen duté : baina hilic , hereneco egunean resuscitaturen da .

text: But they understood not that saying , and were afraid to ask him .
text2: Baina hec erran haur etzuten aditzen , eta beldur ciraden haren interrogatzera .

text: And he came to Capernaum : and being in the house he asked them , What was it that ye disputed among yourselves by the way ?
text2: Eta ethor cedin Capernaumera : eta etchera cenean , interroga citzan , Cer bidean iharduquiten cenduten elkarren artean ?

text: But they held their peace : for by the way they had disputed among themselves , who should be the greatest .
text2: Eta hec ichil citecen : ecen elkarren contra iharduqui çutén bidean , cein cen berceac baino handiagoa .

text: And he sat down , and called the twelve , and saith unto them , If any man desire to be first , the same shall be last of all , and servant of all .
text2: Eta iarri cenean , dei citzan hamabiac , eta erran ciecén , Baldin nehor lehen içan nahi bada , gucietaco azquenén içanen da , eta gucien cerbitzari .

text: And he took a child , and set him in the midst of them : and when he had taken him in his arms , he said unto them ,
text2: Eta haourtchobat harturic eçar ceçan hayen artean , eta hura bessoetara harturic , erran ciecén ,

text: Whosoever shall receive one of such children in my name , receiveth me : and whosoever shall receive me , receiveth not me , but him that sent me .
text2: Norc - ere hunelaco haourtchoetaric bat recebituren baitu ene icenean , ni recebitzen nau : eta norc - ere ni recebitzen bainau , eznau ni recebitzen , baina ni igorri nauena .

text: And John answered him , saying , Master , we saw one casting out devils in thy name , and he followeth not us : and we forbad him , because he followeth not us .
text2: Eta ihardets cieçón Ioannesec , cioela , Magistruá , ikussi diagu cembeit hire icenean deabruac campora egoizten cituenic , cein ezpeitarreicu guri : eta debetatu diagu hura , ceren ezpetarreicu guri .

text: But Jesus said , Forbid him not : for there is no man which shall do a miracle in my name , that can lightly speak evil of me .
text2: Eta Iesusec dio , Ezteçaçuela hura debeta : ecen ezta nehor ene icenean verthuteric eguiten duenic , eta bertan niçaz gaizqui minça ahal daitenic .

text: For he that is not against us is on our part .
text2: Ecen gure contra eztena , gure alde da .

text: For whosoever shall give you a cup of water to drink in my name , because ye belong to Christ , verily I say unto you , he shall not lose his reward .
text2: Ecen norc - ere edatera emanen baitrauçue beirebat vr ene icenean , ceren Christenac çareten , eguiaz diotsuet , eztuela galduren bere saria .

text: And whosoever shall offend one of these little ones that believe in me , it is better for him that a millstone were hanged about his neck , and he were cast into the sea .
text2: Eta norc - ere scandalizaturen baitu ni baithan sinhesten duten chipi hautaric bat , hobe luque errota harribat haren leppoaren inguruän eçar ledin , eta itsassora egotz ledin .

text: And if thy hand offend thee , cut it off : it is better for thee to enter into life maimed , than having two hands to go into hell , into the fire that never shall be quenched :
text2: Eta baldin eure escuac trebuca eraciten bahau , trenca eçac hura : hobe duc hire , escu bakoitzdun vicitzean sar adin , ecen ez bi escuac dituala : gehennara ioan adin , behin - ere iraunguiten ezten sura .

text: Where their worm dieth not , and the fire is not quenched .
text2: Non hayén harra ezpaita hiltzen , eta sua ez iraunguiten .

text: And if thy foot offend thee , cut it off : it is better for thee to enter halt into life , than having two feet to be cast into hell , into the fire that never shall be quenched :
text2: Eta baldin eure oinac trebuca eraciten , bahau , trenca eçac hura , hobe duc hire , mainguric vicitzean sar adin , ecen ez bi oinac dituala gehennara egotz adin , behin - ere iraunguiten ezten sura .

text: Where their worm dieth not , and the fire is not quenched .
text2: Non hayen harra ezpaita hiltzen , eta sua ez iraunguiten .

text: And if thine eye offend thee , pluck it out : it is better for thee to enter into the kingdom of God with one eye , than having two eyes to be cast into hell fire :
text2: Eta baldin eure beguiac trebuca eraciten bahau , idocac hura , hobe duc hire , begui bakoitzdun Iaincoaren resumán sar adin , ecen ez bi beguiac dituala suco gehennara egotz adin :

text: Where their worm dieth not , and the fire is not quenched .
text2: Non hayén harra ezpaita hiltzen , eta sua ez iraunguiten .

text: For every one shall be salted with fire , and every sacrifice shall be salted with salt .
text2: Ecen batbedera suz gacituren da : eta sacrificio gucia gatzez gacituren da .

text: Salt is good : but if the salt have lost his saltness , wherewith will ye season it ? Have salt in yourselves , and have peace one with another .
text2: Gauça ona da gatza , baina baldin gatza gueçat badadi cerçaz hura gacituren duçue ? Auçue ceuróc baithan gatz , eta baque auçue elkarren artean .

text: And he arose from thence , and cometh into the coasts of Judaea by the farther side of Jordan : and the people resort unto him again ; and , as he was wont , he taught them again .
text2: Guero handic partituric , ethor cedinIudeaco aldirietara Iordanaren berce aldeaz : eta berriz gendetze bil cedin harengana : eta ohi beçala berriz iracasten cituen .

text: And the Pharisees came to him , and asked him , Is it lawful for a man to put away his wife ? tempting him .
text2: Orduan ethorriric Phariseuéc interroga ceçaten tentatzen çutela , Sori da guiçonac bere emaztea vtzi deçan ?

text: And he answered and said unto them , What did Moses command you ?
text2: Baina harc ihardesten çuela erran ceçan , Cer manatu drauçue Moysesec ?

text: And they said , Moses suffered to write a bill of divorcement , and to put her away .
text2: Eta hec erran ceçaten , Moysesec permettitu dic separationeco letraren scribatzera , eta emaztearen vtzitera .

text: And Jesus answered and said unto them , For the hardness of your heart he wrote you this precept .
text2: Eta ihardiesten çuela Iesusec erran ciecén , Çuen bihotzeco gogortassunagatic scribatu drauçue manamendu hori .

text: But from the beginning of the creation God made them male and female .
text2: Baina creatione hatsetic , arra eta emea eguin cituen Iaincoac .

text: For this cause shall a man leave his father and mother , and cleave to his wife ;
text2: Hunegatic , vtziren ditu guiçonac bere aita eta ama , eta iunctaturen çayó bere emazteari .

text: And they twain shall be one flesh : so then they are no more twain , but one flesh .
text2: Eta biac içanen dirade haraguibat . Beraz guehiagoric eztirade biga , baina haraguibat .

text: What therefore God hath joined together , let not man put asunder .
text2: Bada Iaincoac iunctatu duena guiçonac ezteçala separa .

text: And in the house his disciples asked him again of the same matter .
text2: Eta etchean berriz discipuluéc gauçá harçaz beraz interroga ceçaten .

text: And he saith unto them , Whosoever shall put away his wife , and marry another , committeth adultery against her .
text2: Eta harc erran cieçen , Norc - ere vtziren baitu bere emaztea , eta bercebat emazte harturen , adulterio iauquiten du haren contra .

text: And if a woman shall put away her husband , and be married to another , she committeth adultery .
text2: Eta baldin emazteac vtzi badeça bere senharra , eta berce batequin ezcon badadi , adulterio iauquiten du .

text: And they brought young children to him , that he should touch them : and his disciples rebuked those that brought them .
text2: Orduan presenta cietzoten haourtcho batzu , hec hunqui litzançat : baina discipuluéc mehatchatzen cituzten , hec presentatzen cituztenac .

text: But when Jesus saw it , he was much displeased , and said unto them , Suffer the little children to come unto me , and forbid them not : for of such is the kingdom of God .
text2: Eta hori ikus ceçanean Iesusec , fascha cedin eta erran ciecén , vtzitzaçue haourtchoac enegana ethortera , eta eztitzaçuela empatcha : ecen horlacoén da Iaincoaren resumá .

text: Verily I say unto you , Whosoever shall not receive the kingdom of God as a little child , he shall not enter therein .
text2: Eguiaz erraiten drauçuet , norc - ere ezpaitu recebituren Iaincoaren resumá haourtcho anço , ezta hartan sarthuren .

text: And he took them up in his arms , put his hands upon them , and blessed them .
text2: Eta hec bessoetara harturic , escuac hayén gainean eçarriric , benedica citzan .

text: And when he was gone forth into the way , there came one running , and kneeled to him , and asked him , Good Master , what shall I do that I may inherit eternal life ?
text2: Eta hura ilkiten cela bideari lequionçat , norbeitec harengana laster eguinic , eta haren aitzinean belhauricaturic , interroga ceçan , Magistru oná , cer eguinen dut vicitze eternala hereta deçadançat ?

text: And Jesus said unto him , Why callest thou me good ? there is none good but one , that is , God .
text2: Eta Iesusec erran cieçon , Cergatic deitzen nauc on ? eztuc nehor onic bat baicen , eta hura , Iaincoa .

text: Thou knowest the commandments , Do not commit adultery , Do not kill , Do not steal , Do not bear false witness , Defraud not , Honour thy father and mother .
text2: Manamenduac badaquizquic , Ezteçala adultera , Ezteçala hil , Ezteçala ebats , Ezteçala testimoniage falsuric erran , Damuric eztaguioala nehori , Ohoraitzac eure aita eta ama :

text: And he answered and said unto him , Master , all these have I observed from my youth .
text2: Eta harc ihardesten çuela erran cieçon , Magistruá , horiac guciac beguiratu citiat neure gaztetassunetic .

text: Then Jesus beholding him loved him , and said unto him , One thing thou lackest : go thy way , sell whatsoever thou hast , and give to the poor , and thou shalt have treasure in heaven : and come , take up the cross , and follow me .
text2: Eta Iesusec harenganat behaturic , onhets ceçan , eta erran cieçón , Gauça baten peitu aiz , habil , dituanac sal itzac , eta eman ietzéc paubrey : eta vkanen duc thesaurbat ceruän : eta athor , arreit niri , crutzea harturic .

text: And he was sad at that saying , and went away grieved : for he had great possessions .
text2: Eta hura faschaturic hitz hunez , ioan cedin tristeric : ecen on handiac cituen .

text: And Jesus looked round about , and saith unto his disciples , How hardly shall they that have riches enter into the kingdom of God !
text2: Orduan inguru behaturic Iesusec dioste bere discipuluey , O cein nequez onhassundunac , Iaincoaren resumán sarthuren diraden !

text: And the disciples were astonished at his words . But Jesus answereth again , and saith unto them , Children , how hard is it for them that trust in riches to enter into the kingdom of God !
text2: Eta discipuluac spanta citecen hitz hauçaz . Baina Iesusec berriz ihardesten çuela erran ciecén , Haourrác , cein gaitz den abrastassunetan fida diradenac , Iaincoaren resumán sar ditecen .

text: It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle , than for a rich man to enter into the kingdom of God .
text2: Errachago da cablebat orratzaren çulhotic iragan dadin , ecen ez abratsa Iaincoaren resumán sar dadin .

text: And they were astonished out of measure , saying among themselves , Who then can be saved ?
text2: Baina hec are spantago citecen , bere artean cioitela , Eta nor salua ahal daite ?

text: And Jesus looking upon them saith , With men it is impossible , but not with God : for with God all things are possible .
text2: Baina hetarat behaturic Iesusec dio , Guiçonac baithan impossible da , baina ez Iaincoa baithan : ecen gauça guciac possible dirade Iaincoa baithan .

text: Then Peter began to say unto him , Lo , we have left all , and have followed thee .
text2: Orduan Pierris has cedin hari erraiten , Huná , guc vtzi citiagu gauça guciac , eta iarreiqui gaitzaizquic hiri .

text: And Jesus answered and said , Verily I say unto you , There is no man that hath left house , or brethren , or sisters , or father , or mother , or wife , or children , or lands , for my sake , and the gospel ' s ,
text2: Eta ihardesten duela Iesusec dio . Eguiaz diotsuet , nehor ezta vtzi duenic etchea , edo anayeac , edo arrebác , edo aita , edo ama , edo emaztea , edo haourrac , edo landác , ene eta Euangelioaren amorecatic .

text: But he shall receive an hundredfold now in this time , houses , and brethren , and sisters , and mothers , and children , and lands , with persecutions ; and in the world to come eternal life .
text2: Recebi ezteçan orain demborá hunetan ehunetan hambát , etche eta anaye , eta arreba , eta ama , eta haour , eta landa , persecutionequin , eta secula ethortecoan vicitze eternala .

text: But many that are first shall be last ; and the last first .
text2: Baina anhitz lehen diradenac , içanen dirade azquen : eta azquenac lehen .

text: And they were in the way going up to Jerusalem ; and Jesus went before them : and they were amazed ; and as they followed , they were afraid . And he took again the twelve , and began to tell them what things should happen unto him ,
text2: Eta ciraden bidean igaiten ciradela Ierusalemera : eta hayén aitzinean ioiten cen Iesus , eta spantatzen ciraden , eta çarreitzola ciraden beldur . Eta harturic berriz hamabiac , has cequien ethorri behar çaizcan gaucén erraiten :

text: Saying , Behold , we go up to Jerusalem ; and the Son of man shall be delivered unto the chief priests , and unto the scribes ; and they shall condemn him to death , and shall deliver him to the Gentiles :
text2: Cioela , huná , igaiten gara Ierusalemera : eta guiçonaren Semea liuraturen da Sacrificadore principalén eta Scribén escuetara , eta hiltzera condemnaturen duté , eta Gentilén escuetaraco duté :

text: And they shall mock him , and shall scourge him , and shall spit upon him , and shall kill him : and the third day he shall rise again .
text2: Eta hec escarniaturen dute hura , eta açotaturen , eta thu eguinen draucate , eta hilen duté : baina hereneco egunean resuscitaturen da .

text: And James and John , the sons of Zebedee , come unto him , saying , Master , we would that thou shouldest do for us whatsoever we shall desire .
text2: Orduan ethorten dirade haregana Iacques eta Ioannes Zebedeoren semeac , dioitela , Magistruá , nahi guendiquec cer - ere escaturen baicara , eguin ieçagun .

text: And he said unto them , What would ye that I should do for you ?
text2: Eta harc erran ciecén , Cer nahi duçue daguiçuedan ?

text: They said unto him , Grant unto us that we may sit , one on thy right hand , and the other on thy left hand , in thy glory .
text2: Eta hec erran cieçoten , Eman ieçaguc , bata hire escuinean , eta bercea hire ezquerrean iar gaitecen hire glorián .

text: But Jesus said unto them , Ye know not what ye ask : can ye drink of the cup that I drink of ? and be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with ?
text2: Eta Iesusec erran ciecén , Eztaquiçue ceren esquez çaudeten : edan ahal diroçue nic edaten dudan copá , eta ni batheyatzen naicen baptismoaz batheya ahal çaitezquete ?

text: And they said unto him , We can . And Jesus said unto them , Ye shall indeed drink of the cup that I drink of ; and with the baptism that I am baptized withal shall ye be baptized :
text2: Eta hec erran cieçoten , Bay . Eta Iesusec erran ciecén , Nic edaten dudan copá edanen baduçue , eta ni batheyatzen naicen baptismoaz batheyaturen baçarete :

text: But to sit on my right hand and on my left hand is not mine to give ; but it shall be given to them for whom it is prepared .
text2: Baina ene escuinean edo ene ezquerrean iartea , ezta ene emaiteco , baina emanen çaye preparatu içan çayeney .

text: And when the ten heard it , they began to be much displeased with James and John .
text2: Eta hori ençunic hamarrac has citecen faschatzen Iacquesez eta Ioannesez .

text: But Jesus called them to him , and saith unto them , Ye know that they which are accounted to rule over the Gentiles exercise lordship over them ; and their great ones exercise authority upon them .
text2: Baina Iesusec hec beregana deithuric dioste Badaquiçue ecen nationén gainean seignoriatzea laket çayenéc , hayén gainean seignoriatzen dutela , eta hayén artean handi diradenéc authoritatez vsatzen dutela hayen gainean .

text: But so shall it not be among you : but whosoever will be great among you , shall be your minister :
text2: Baina ezta hala içanen çuen artean : aitzitic nor - ere nahi içanen baita handiena içan çuen artean , içanen da çuen cerbitzari .

text: And whosoever of you will be the chiefest , shall be servant of all .
text2: Eta nor - ere nahi içanen baita çuen artean içan ehen , içanen da gucién cerbitzari .

text: For even the Son of man came not to be ministered unto , but to minister , and to give his life a ransom for many .
text2: Ecen guiçonaren Semea - ere ezta ethorri cerbitzatu içatera , baina cerbitzatzera , eta bere viciaren anhitzengatic rançoinetan emaitera .

text: And they came to Jericho : and as he went out of Jericho with his disciples and a great number of people , blind Bartimaeus , the son of Timaeus , sat by the highway side begging .
text2: Orduan ethorten dirade Iericora : eta hura Iericotic ilkiten cela , eta haren discipuluac eta gendetze handia , Bartimeo Timeoren seme itsua cegoen iarriric , bide bazterrean , esquez :

text: And when he heard that it was Jesus of Nazareth , he began to cry out , and say , Jesus , thou Son of David , have mercy on me .
text2: Eta ençunic ecen Iesus Nazareno cela , has cedin oihu eguiten eta erraiten , Iesus Dauid - en semeá , auc pietate niçaz .

text: And many charged him that he should hold his peace : but he cried the more a great deal , Thou Son of David , have mercy on me .
text2: Eta mehatchatzen çuten anhitzec ichil ledin : baina harc vnguiz oihu guehiago eguiten çuen , Dauid - en semeá , auc pietate niçaz .

text: And Jesus stood still , and commanded him to be called . And they call the blind man , saying unto him , Be of good comfort , rise ; he calleth thee .
text2: Orduan Iesusec gueldituric , mana ceçan , dei ledin . Eta dei ceçaten itsua , ciotsatela , Sporça adi , iaiqui adi : deitzen au .

text: And he , casting away his garment , rose , and came to Jesus .
text2: Eta hura , bere mantoa egotzi çuenean , iaiquiric ethor cedin Iesusgana .

text: And Jesus answered and said unto him , What wilt thou that I should do unto thee ? The blind man said unto him , Lord , that I might receive my sight .
text2: Eta ihardesten çuela erran cieçón Iesusec , Cer nahi duc daguiadan ? Eta itsuac diotsa , Magistruá , ikustea recebi deçadan .

text: And Jesus said unto him , Go thy way ; thy faith hath made thee whole . And immediately he received his sight , and followed Jesus in the way .
text2: Eta Iesusec erran cieçón , Oha , eure fedeac saluatu au . Eta bertan recebi ceçan ikustea , eta iairreiquiten çayón Iesusi bidean .

text: And when they came nigh to Jerusalem , unto Bethphage and Bethany , at the mount of Olives , he sendeth forth two of his disciples ,
text2: Eta Ierusalemera , Bethphage eta Bethania Oliuatzetaco mendi aldecoetara hurbiltzen ciradenean , igor citzan bere discipuluetaric biga ,

text: And saith unto them , Go your way into the village over against you : and as soon as ye be entered into it , ye shall find a colt tied , whereon never man sat ; loose him , and bring him .
text2: Eta erran ciecén , Çoazte çuen aurkán den burgura : eta hartan sarthuren çareten beçain sarri , eridenen duçue asto vmebat estecatua , nehor oraino gainean iarri içan etzayonic : lachaturic hura ekardaçue .

text: And if any man say unto you , Why do ye this ? say ye that the Lord hath need of him ; and straightway he will send him hither .
text2: Eta baldin nehorc badarraçue , Cergatic hori eguiten duçue ? erraçue ecen Iaunac duela haren beharra : eta bertan hura igorriren du huna .

text: And they went their way , and found the colt tied by the door without in a place where two ways met ; and they loose him .
text2: Parti citecen bada , eta eriden ceçaten asto vmea estecaturic , bortha aldean campotic bi bideren artean : eta lacha ceçaten hura .

text: And certain of them that stood there said unto them , What do ye , loosing the colt ?
text2: Eta han ceudenetaric batzuc erran ciecén , Cer ari çarete , lachatzen baituçue asto - vmea ?

text: And they said unto them even as Jesus had commanded : and they let them go .
text2: Eta hec erran ciecén , Iesusec manatu cituen beçala : eta ioaitera vtzi citzaten .

text: And they brought the colt to Jesus , and cast their garments on him ; and he sat upon him .
text2: Eta ekar ceçaten asto - vmea Iesusgana , eta eçar cietzoten berén abillamenduac gainean , eta iar cedin haren gainean .

text: And many spread their garments in the way : and others cut down branches off the trees , and strawed them in the way .
text2: Eta anhitzec berén abillamenduac heda citzaten bidean : eta bercéc adarrac ebaquiten cituzten arboretaric eta bidean hedatzen .

text: And they that went before , and they that followed , cried , saying , Hosanna ; Blessed is he that cometh in the name of the Lord :
text2: Eta aitzinean cioacenéc , eta iarreiquiten ciradenéc , oihu eguiten çuten , cioitela , Hosanna , benedicatu dela Iaunaren icenean ethorten dena .

text: Blessed be the kingdom of our father David , that cometh in the name of the Lord : Hosanna in the highest .
text2: Benedicatu dela gure aita Dauid - en resuma Iaunaren icenean ethorten dena : Hosanna leku gorenetan aicená .

text: And Jesus entered into Jerusalem , and into the temple : and when he had looked round about upon all things , and now the eventide was come , he went out unto Bethany with the twelve .
text2: Eta sar cedin Ierusalemen Iesus , eta templean : eta gauça gucietara inguru behaturic , eta ia berandua cela ilki cedin Bethaniarát hamabiequin .

text: And on the morrow , when they were come from Bethany , he was hungry :
text2: Eta biharamunean ilki içan ciradenean Bethaniatic , gosse cedin .

text: And seeing a fig tree afar off having leaves , he came , if haply he might find any thing thereon : and when he came to it , he found nothing but leaves ; for the time of figs was not yet .
text2: Eta vrrundanic ikussiric ficotze hostodunbat , ethor cedin eya deus hartan eriden ceçaquenez : eta hartara ethorriric , etzeçan deus eriden hostoric baicen : ecen etzén fico demborá .

text: And Jesus answered and said unto it , No man eat fruit of thee hereafter for ever . And his disciples heard it .
text2: Orduan ihardesten çuela Iesusec erran cieçón ficotzeari , Hemendic harát hireganic seculan fructuric nehorc ian ezteçala . Eta haur ençun ceçaten haren discipuluéc .

text: And they come to Jerusalem : and Jesus went into the temple , and began to cast out them that sold and bought in the temple , and overthrew the tables of the moneychangers , and the seats of them that sold doves ;
text2: Eta ethorten dirade Ierusalemera : eta Iesus templean sarthuric , has cedin saltzen eta erosten ari ciradenén campora egoizten , eta cambiadoren mahainac , eta vsso columba saltzalen cadirác itzul citzan .

text: And would not suffer that any man should carry any vessel through the temple .
text2: Eta etzuen permettitzen nehorc vnciric erabil leçan templetic .

text: And he taught , saying unto them , Is it not written , My house shall be called of all nations the house of prayer ? but ye have made it a den of thieves .
text2: Eta iracasten ari cen , ciostéla . Ezta scribatua , ecen Ene etchea orationetaco etche deithuren dela natione gucietan ? baina çuec hura gaichtaguin lece eguin duçue .

text: And the scribes and chief priests heard it , and sought how they might destroy him : for they feared him , because all the people was astonished at his doctrine .
text2: Eta haur ençun ceçaten Scribéc eta Sacrificadore principaléc , eta bilha çabiltzan nolatan hura hil leçaqueten : ecen beldur çaizcan , ceren populu gucia miraculuz baitzegoen haren doctrináz .

text: And when even was come , he went out of the city .
text2: Eta arratsa ethorri cenean , ilki cedin Iesus hiritic .

text: And in the morning , as they passed by , they saw the fig tree dried up from the roots .
text2: Eta goicean aldetic iragaiten ciradela ikus ceçaten ficotzea erroetarano eyhartua .

text: And Peter calling to remembrance saith unto him , Master , behold , the fig tree which thou cursedst is withered away .
text2: Orduan orhoituric Pierrisec erran cieçón , Magistruá , huná , hic maradicatu duán ficotzea eyhartu duc .

text: And Jesus answering saith unto them , Have faith in God .
text2: Eta ihardesten çuela Iesusec erran ciecén , Auçue Iaincoaren fedea .

text: For verily I say unto you , That whosoever shall say unto this mountain , Be thou removed , and be thou cast into the sea ; and shall not doubt in his heart , but shall believe that those things which he saith shall come to pass ; he shall have whatsoever he saith .
text2: Eguiaz erraiten drauçuet , norc - eré erranen baitrauca mendi huni , Ken adi , eta iraitz adi itsassora : eta ezpaitu dudaric eguinen bere bihotzean , baina sinhetsiren baitu ecen erraiten duena eguinen dela , cer - ere erranen baituque eguinen çayó .

text: Therefore I say unto you , What things soever ye desire , when ye pray , believe that ye receive them , and ye shall have them .
text2: Halacotz erraiten drauçuet , ceren - ere othoitz eguiten duçuela escaturen baitzarete , sinhetsaçue ecen recebituren duçuela : eta eguinen çaiçue .

text: And when ye stand praying , forgive , if ye have ought against any : that your Father also which is in heaven may forgive you your trespasses .
text2: Baina othoitz eguiten iar çaiteztenean , barka eçaçue baldin deus baduçue nehoren contra : çuen Aita ceruètacoac - ere , çuey barka dietzaçuen çuen faltác .

text: But if ye do not forgive , neither will your Father which is in heaven forgive your trespasses .
text2: Ecen baldin çuec barka ezpadeçaçue : çuen Aita ceruètan denac - ere eztrauzquiçue barkaturen çuen faltác .

text: And they come again to Jerusalem : and as he was walking in the temple , there come to him the chief priests , and the scribes , and the elders ,
text2: Orduan ethorten dirade berriz Ierusalemera : eta templean çabilala , ethor citecen harengana Sacrificadore principalac , eta scribác , eta Ancianoac

text: And say unto him , By what authority doest thou these things ? and who gave thee this authority to do these things ?
text2: Eta erran cieçoten , Cer authoritatez gauça horiac eguiten dituc ? eta norc eman drauc authoritate hori gauça horiac eguin ditzán ?

text: And Jesus answered and said unto them , I will also ask of you one question , and answer me , and I will tell you by what authority I do these things .
text2: Eta Iesusec ihardesten çuela erran ciecén , Interrogaturen çaituztet nic - ere çuec gauça batez : eta ihardestaçue , eta erranen drauçuet cer authoritatez gauça hauc eguiten ditudan .

text: The baptism of John , was it from heaven , or of men ? answer me .
text2: Ioannesen baptismoa cerutic cen , ala guiçonetaric ? ihardestaçue .

text: And they reasoned with themselves , saying , If we shall say , From heaven ; he will say , Why then did ye not believe him ?
text2: Eta baciharducaten elkarren artean , cioitela , Baldin erran badeçagu , Cerutic : erranen du Cergatic beraz eztuçue sinhetsi hura ?

text: But if we shall say , Of men ; they feared the people : for all men counted John , that he was a prophet indeed .
text2: Baina baldin erran badeçagu , Guiçonetaric populuaren beldur gara : ecen guciéc çaducaten Ioannes eguiazco Propheta içan cela .

text: And they answered and said unto Jesus , We cannot tell . And Jesus answering saith unto them , Neither do I tell you by what authority I do these things .
text2: Eta ihardesten çutela erran cieçoten Iesusi , Etzeaquiagu . Eta Iesusec ihardesten duela dioste , Nic - ere eztrauçuet erranen cer authoritatez gauça hauc eguiten ditudan .

text: And he began to speak unto them by parables . A certain man planted a vineyard , and set an hedge about it , and digged a place for the winefat , and built a tower , and let it out to husbandmen , and went into a far country .
text2: Guero has cequién comparationez erraiten , Mahastibat landa ceçan guiçon - batec , eta ingura ceçan hessiz , eta eguin ceçan hobibat lacotaco , eta edifica ceçan dorrebat , eta aloca ciecén laborariey , eta camporat ioan cedin .

text: And at the season he sent to the husbandmen a servant , that he might receive from the husbandmen of the fruit of the vineyard .
text2: Eta igor ceçan laborarietara sasoinean cerbitzaria , laborarietaric recebi leçançát mahastico fructutic .

text: And they caught him , and beat him , and sent him away empty .
text2: Baina hec hura harturic çaurt ceçaten , eta igor ceçaten hutsic .

text: And again he sent unto them another servant ; and at him they cast stones , and wounded him in the head , and sent him away shamefully handled .
text2: Eta berriz igor ceçan hetara berce cerbitzaribat eta harri vkaldiz hauts cieçoten buruä , eta igor ceçaten desonestqui tractaturic .

text: And again he sent another ; and him they killed , and many others ; beating some , and killing some .
text2: Eta berriz bercebat igor ciecén , eta hura hil ceçaten : eta anhitz berceric , batzu cehatzen eta berceac hiltzen cituztela .

text: Having yet therefore one son , his wellbeloved , he sent him also last unto them , saying , They will reverence my son .
text2: Oraino bada bere seme maitebat vkan eta , hura - ere igorri vkan du hetara azquenic , cioela , Ahalque içanen dirade ene semearen .

text: But those husbandmen said among themselves , This is the heir ; come , let us kill him , and the inheritance shall be ours .
text2: Baina laborari hec erran ceçaten bere artean , Haur da primua : çatozte hil deçagun haur , eta gure içanen da heretagea .

text: And they took him , and killed him , and cast him out of the vineyard .
text2: Eta harturic hura hil ceçaten , eta iraitz ceçaten mahastitic campora .

text: What shall therefore the lord of the vineyard do ? he will come and destroy the husbandmen , and will give the vineyard unto others .
text2: Cer eguinen du bada mahasti iabeac ? Ethorriren da , eta deseguinen ditu laborariac , eta emanen du mahastia berceri .

text: And have ye not read this scripture ; The stone which the builders rejected is become the head of the corner :
text2: Eta Scriptura haur - ere eztuçue iracurri ? Edificaçaléc arbuyatu duten harria , cantoin buru eguin içan da :

text: This was the Lord ' s doing , and it is marvellous in our eyes ?
text2: Iaunaz eguin içan da haur , eta da gauça miragarria gure beguién aitzinean ?

text: And they sought to lay hold on him , but feared the people : for they knew that he had spoken the parable against them : and they left him , and went their way .
text2: Ayher ciraden bada haren hatzamaitera , baina populuaren beldur ciraden : ecen eçagutu çuten hayén contra comparatione haur erran çuela : eta hura vtziric ioan citecen .

text: And they send unto him certain of the Pharisees and of the Herodians , to catch him in his words .
text2: Guero igor citzaten harengana Phariseuetaric eta Herodianoetaric batzu , hura hatzaman leçatençát hitzean .

text: And when they were come , they say unto him , Master , we know that thou art true , and carest for no man : for thou regardest not the person of men , but teachest the way of God in truth : Is it lawful to give tribute to Caesar , or not ?
text2: Eta hec ethorriric diotsate , Magistruá , bacequiagu ecen eguiati aicela , eta nehoren ansiaric eztuála : ecen ezago guiçonén apparentiara beha , baina eguiazqui Iaincoaren bidea iracasten duc : Bidezco da tributaren Cesari emaitea , ala ez ? emanen dugu , ala eztugu emanen ?

text: Shall we give , or shall we not give ? But he , knowing their hypocrisy , said unto them , Why tempt ye me ? bring me a penny , that I may see it .
text2: Eta harc , eçaguturic hayén hypocrisiá , erran ciecén , Cergatic tentatzen nauçue ? ekardaçue dinerobat , ikus deçadançat .

text: And they brought it . And he saith unto them , Whose is this image and superscription ? And they said unto him , Caesar ' s .
text2: Eta hec presenta cieçoten : orduan dioste , Norena da imagina haur eta scribua ? Eta hec erran cieçoten , Cesarena .

text: And Jesus answering said unto them , Render to Caesar the things that are Caesar ' s , and to God the things that are God ' s . And they marvelled at him .
text2: Eta ihardesten çuela Iesusec erran ciecén , Renda ietzoçue Cesarenac Cesari : eta Iaincoarenac Iaincoari . Eta mirets ceçaten haren gainean .

text: Then come unto him the Sadducees , which say there is no resurrection ; and they asked him , saying ,
