text2: Orduan ethor citecen harengana Sadduceuac , ceinéc erraiten baitute eztela resurrectioneric , eta interroga ceçaten , cioitela ,

text: Master , Moses wrote unto us , If a man ' s brother die , and leave his wife behind him , and leave no children , that his brother should take his wife , and raise up seed unto his brother .
text2: Magistruá , Moysesec scribatu vkan diraucuc , baldin cembeiten anayea hil bada , eta vtzi badu emaztea , eta haourric vtzi ezpadu , har deçan haren anayac haren emaztea , eta eguin dieçón leinu bere anayeri .

text: Now there were seven brethren : and the first took a wife , and dying left no seed .
text2: Cituán bada çazpi anaye : eta lehenac har cieçán emazte , eta hiltzean etzieçán leinuric vtzi .

text: And the second took her , and died , neither left he any seed : and the third likewise .
text2: Eta bigarrenac har cieçán hura , eta hil ciedián , eta harc - ere etzieçán leinuric vtzi : eta hirurgarrenac halaber .

text: And the seven had her , and left no seed : last of all the woman died also .
text2: Eta har cieçateán hura çazpiéc , eta leinuric etzieçateán vtzi : gucietaco azquenenic hil ciedián emaztea - ere .

text: In the resurrection therefore , when they shall rise , whose wife shall she be of them ? for the seven had her to wife .
text2: Resurrectionean bada , resuscitatu diratenean hetaric ceinen emazte içanen da ? Ecen çazpiéc hura emazte vkan dié .

text: And Jesus answering said unto them , Do ye not therefore err , because ye know not the scriptures , neither the power of God ?
text2: Orduan ihardesten çuela Iesusec erran ciecén , Eztuçue halacotz huts eguiten ceren ezpaitaquizquiçue Scripturác , ezeta Iaincoaren verthutea ?

text: For when they shall rise from the dead , they neither marry , nor are given in marriage ; but are as the angels which are in heaven .
text2: Ecen hiletaric resuscitatu diratenean , eztu nehorc emazteric harturen , ez emanen ezconçaz : baina içanen dirade ceruètaco Aingueruäc beçala .

text: And as touching the dead , that they rise : have ye not read in the book of Moses , how in the bush God spake unto him , saying , I am the God of Abraham , and the God of Isaac , and the God of Jacob ?
text2: Eta hiléz den becembatean , ecen resuscitatzen diradela , eztuçue iracurri Moysesen liburuan , nola berroan hari minçatu içan çayón Iaincoa , cioela , Ni naiz Abrahamen Iaincoa , eta Isaac - en Iaincoa , eta Iacob - en Iaincoa ?

text: He is not the God of the dead , but the God of the living : ye therefore do greatly err .
text2: Ezta hilén Iaincoa , baina vicién Iaincoa : çuec beraz haguitz enganatzen çarete .

text: And one of the scribes came , and having heard them reasoning together , and perceiving that he had answered them well , asked him , Which is the first commandment of all ?
text2: Eta ethor cedin Scribetaric cembeit , hec disputatzen ençunic , eta ikussiric ecen vngui ihardetsi cerauela , harc interroga ceçan , Cein da manamendu gucietaco lehena ?

text: And Jesus answered him , The first of all the commandments is , Hear , O Israel ; The Lord our God is one Lord :
text2: Eta Iesusec ihardets cieçón . Manamendu gucietaco lehena duc , Behadi Israel , gure Iainco Iauna , Iaun bakoitzbat duc .

text: And thou shalt love the Lord thy God with all thy heart , and with all thy soul , and with all thy mind , and with all thy strength : this is the first commandment .
text2: Onhetsiren duc bada eure Iainco Iauna , eure bihotz guciaz , eta eure arima guciaz , eta eure pensamendu guciaz , eta eure ahal guciaz : haur duc lehen manamendua .

text: And the second is like , namely this , Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself . There is none other commandment greater than these .
text2: Eta bigarrenac hura irudi dic , Onhetsiren duc eure hurcoa eure buruä beçala : hauc baino berce manamendu handiagoric eztuc .

text: And the scribe said unto him , Well , Master , thou hast said the truth : for there is one God ; and there is none other but he :
text2: Orduan erran cieçón Scriba harc , Vngui , Magistruá , eguiazqui erran duc , ecen Iaincobat dela eta harçaz berceric eztela :

text: And to love him with all the heart , and with all the understanding , and with all the soul , and with all the strength , and to love his neighbour as himself , is more than all whole burnt offerings and sacrifices .
text2: Eta haren onhestea bihotz guciaz , eta adimendu guciaz , eta arima guciaz , eta indar guciaz : eta hurcoaren onhestea bere buruä beçala , guehiago dela ecen ez holocausta eta sacrificio guciac .

text: And when Jesus saw that he answered discreetly , he said unto him , Thou art not far from the kingdom of God . And no man after that durst ask him any question .
text2: Eta Iesusec ikussi çuenean ecen harc çuhurqui ihardetsi çuela , erran cieçón , Ezaiz vrrun Iaincoaren resumatic . Eta nehor guehiagoric etzayón ausart interrogatzera .

text: And Jesus answered and said , while he taught in the temple , How say the scribes that Christ is the Son of David ?
text2: Eta ihardesten çuela Iesusec erraiten çuen , templean iracasten ari cela , Nola dioite Scribéc ecen Christ Dauid - en seme dela ?

text: For David himself said by the Holy Ghost , The Lord said to my Lord , Sit thou on my right hand , till I make thine enemies thy footstool .
text2: Ecen Dauid - ec berac erran du Spiritu sainduaren inspirationez , Erran drauca Iaunac ene Iaunari , Iar - adi ene escuinean , eçar ditzaquedano hire etsayac hire oinén scabella .

text: David therefore himself calleth him Lord ; and whence is he then his son ? And the common people heard him gladly .
text2: Beraz Dauid - ec berac deitzen du hura Iaun : nondic da beraz haren seme ? Eta gendetze anhitzec ençuten çuen hura gogotic .

text: And he said unto them in his doctrine , Beware of the scribes , which love to go in long clothing , and love salutations in the marketplaces ,
text2: Eta erraiten cerauen bere doctrinán , Beguirauçue Scriba arropa lucequin ebili nahi diradenetaric , eta salutationey merkatuetan on dariztenetaric ,

text: And the chief seats in the synagogues , and the uppermost rooms at feasts :
text2: Eta lehen cadirey synagoguetan , eta lehen placey banquetetan :

text: Which devour widows ' houses , and for a pretence make long prayers : these shall receive greater damnation .
text2: Iresten dituztela ema alhargunén etcheac , are luçaqui othoitz eguin irudiz : hauc recebituren duté condemnatione handiagoa .

text: And Jesus sat over against the treasury , and beheld how the people cast money into the treasury : and many that were rich cast in much .
text2: Eta Iesusec truncoaren aurkán iarriric cegoela , gogoatzen çuen nola populuac diru emaiten çuen truncora , eta anhitz abratsec emaiten çutén anhitz .

text: And there came a certain poor widow , and she threw in two mites , which make a farthing .
text2: Eta ethorriric emazte alhargun paubre batec eman citzan bi peça chipi , baitziraden quadrantbat .

text: And he called unto him his disciples , and saith unto them , Verily I say unto you , That this poor widow hath cast more in , than all they which have cast into the treasury :
text2: Orduan bere discipuluac beregana deithuric erran ciecén , Eguiaz diotsuet , ecen alhargun paubre hunec guehiago eman duela ecen ez truncora eman duten guciéc .

text: For all they did cast in of their abundance ; but she of her want did cast in all that she had , even all her living .
text2: Ecen guciéc soberaturic çutenetic eman vkan duté , baina hunec eman du bere paubreciatic çuen gucia bayeta , bere sustantia gucia .

text: And as he went out of the temple , one of his disciples saith unto him , Master , see what manner of stones and what buildings are here !
text2: Eta ilkiten cela templetic , erran cieçón bere discipuluetaric batec , Magistruá , ikusquic cer harriac eta cer edificioac diraden hauc .

text: And Jesus answering said unto him , Seest thou these great buildings ? there shall not be left one stone upon another , that shall not be thrown down .
text2: Orduan Iesusec ihardesten çuela erran cieçón , Badacusquic edificio handi hauc ? eztuc gueldituren harria harriaren gainean deseguin eztadin .

text: And as he sat upon the mount of Olives over against the temple , Peter and James and John and Andrew asked him privately ,
text2: Eta iarriric cegoela Oliuatzetaco mendian templearen aurkán , interroga ceçaten appart Pierrisec eta Iacquesec , Ioannesec eta Andriuec ,

text: Tell us , when shall these things be ? and what shall be the sign when all these things shall be fulfilled ?
text2: Cioitela , Erraguc noiz gauça horiac içanen diraden , eta cer signo içanen den gauça horiac guciac complituren diradenean .

text: And Jesus answering them began to say , Take heed lest any man deceive you :
text2: Eta Iesus , ihardesten cerauela , has cedin erraiten , Beguirauçue nehorc seduci etzaitzaten :

text: For many shall come in my name , saying , I am Christ ; and shall deceive many .
text2: Ecen anhitz ethorriren dirade ene icenean , dioitela , Ni naiz Christ : eta anhitz seducituren duté .

text: And when ye shall hear of wars and rumours of wars , be ye not troubled : for such things must needs be ; but the end shall not be yet .
text2: Baina dançuzquiçuenean guerlác eta guerla famác , etzaiteztela trubla : ecen gauça hauc eguin behar dirade : baina ezta oraino içanen fina .

text: For nation shall rise against nation , and kingdom against kingdom : and there shall be earthquakes in divers places , and there shall be famines and troubles : these are the beginnings of sorrows .
text2: Ecen altchaturen da nationea nationearen contra , eta resumá resumaren contra : eta içanen dirade lur ikaratzeac lekutic lekura , eta gosseteac eta nahastecamenduac : dolorén hatseac , hauc .

text: But take heed to yourselves : for they shall deliver you up to councils ; and in the synagogues ye shall be beaten : and ye shall be brought before rulers and kings for my sake , for a testimony against them .
text2: Baina beguira eieçue çuec ceuron buruèy : ecen liuraturen çaituzte consistorioetara eta synagoguetara : açotaturen çarete , eta gobernadorén eta reguén aitzinera eramanen çarete ene causaz , hæy testimoniagetan .

text: And the gospel must first be published among all nations .
text2: Eta natione gucietan behar da lehenic predicatu Euangelioa .

text: But when they shall lead you , and deliver you up , take no thought beforehand what ye shall speak , neither do ye premeditate : but whatsoever shall be given you in that hour , that speak ye : for it is not ye that speak , but the Holy Ghost .
text2: Eta hatzamanic eramanen çaituztenean etzaretela aitzinetic ansiatan cer erranen duçuen , eta ezalbeitzineçate medita : baina cer - ere emanen baitzaiçue ordu hartan , hura albeitzinarrate : ecen etzarete çuec minço çaretenac , baina Spiritu saindua .

text: Now the brother shall betray the brother to death , and the father the son ; and children shall rise up against their parents , and shall cause them to be put to death .
text2: Orduan liuraturen du anayeac anayea heriotara , eta aitác haourra : eta altchaturen dirade haourrac aita - amén contra , eta hil eraciren dituzté .

text: And ye shall be hated of all men for my name ' s sake : but he that shall endure unto the end , the same shall be saved .
text2: Eta gaitzetsiac içanen çarete guciéz , ene icenagatic : baina norc - ere perseueraturen baitu finerano , hura saluaturen da .

text: But when ye shall see the abomination of desolation , spoken of by Daniel the prophet , standing where it ought not , ( let him that readeth understand , ) then let them that be in Judaea flee to the mountains :
text2: Dacussaçuenean bada desolationearen abominationea , Daniel Prophetáz erran içan dena , behar eztén lekuan dagoela ( iracurtzen duenac adi beça ) orduan Iudean diratenéc , ihes albeileguite mendietarát :

text: And let him that is on the housetop not go down into the house , neither enter therein , to take any thing out of his house :
text2: Eta etche gainean datena , ezalbeiledi iauts etcherát , eta ezalbeiledi sar deusen bere etchetic eramaitera .

text: And let him that is in the field not turn back again for to take up his garment .
text2: Eta landán datena ezalbeiledi guibelerat itzul , bere abillamenduaren hartzera .

text: But woe to them that are with child , and to them that give suck in those days !
text2: Baina dohaingaitz emazte içorrén eta eredosquiten duqueitenén egun hetan .

text: And pray ye that your flight be not in the winter .
text2: Othoitz eguiçue bada çuen ihes eguitea eztén neguän .

text: For in those days shall be affliction , such as was not from the beginning of the creation which God created unto this time , neither shall be .
text2: Ecen içanen dirade egun hec halaco tribulatione , nolacoric ezpaita içan Iaincoac creatu dituen gaucén creatze hatsetic oraindrano , eta ezpaita içanen .

text: And except that the Lord had shortened those days , no flesh should be saved : but for the elect ' s sake , whom he hath chosen , he hath shortened the days .
text2: Eta baldin Iaunac laburtu ezpalitu egun hec , nehor ezlaite salua : baina elegitu dituen elegituacgatic , laburtu ditu egun hec .

text: And then if any man shall say to you , Lo , here is Christ ; or , lo , he is there ; believe him not :
text2: Eta orduan baldin nehorc badarraçue , Huná hemen Christ , edo , Hará han : ezalbeitzineçate sinhets .

text: For false Christs and false prophets shall rise , and shall shew signs and wonders , to seduce , if it were possible , even the elect .
text2: Ecen altchaturen dirade Christ falsuac , eta propheta falsuac : eta eguinen dituzte signoac eta miraculuac seducitzeco , baldin possible baliz , elegituen - ere .

text: But take ye heed : behold , I have foretold you all things .
text2: Baina çuec beguirauçue . Huná , aitzinetic erran drauzquiçuet gauça guciac .

text: But in those days , after that tribulation , the sun shall be darkened , and the moon shall not give her light ,
text2: Halaber egun hetan tribulatione haren ondoan , iguzquia ilhunduren da : eta ilharguiac eztu bere arguia emanen .

text: And the stars of heaven shall fall , and the powers that are in heaven shall be shaken .
text2: Eta ceruco içarrac eroriren dirade , eta ceruètan diraden verthuteac ikaraturen dirade .

text: And then shall they see the Son of man coming in the clouds with great power and glory .
text2: Eta orduan ikussiren duté guiçonaren Semea datorquela hodeyetan bothere eta gloria handirequin .

text: And then shall he send his angels , and shall gather together his elect from the four winds , from the uttermost part of the earth to the uttermost part of heaven .
text2: Eta orduan igorriren ditu bere Aingueruäc , eta bilduren ditu bere elegituac laur haicetaric , lur bazterretic ceru bazterrerano .

text: Now learn a parable of the fig tree ; When her branch is yet tender , and putteth forth leaves , ye know that summer is near :
text2: Bada ficotzetic ikas eçaçue comparationea . Haren adarra ia vstertzen eta hostatzen denean , badaquiçue ecen vdá hurbil dela .

text: So ye in like manner , when ye shall see these things come to pass , know that it is nigh , even at the doors .
text2: Hala çuec - ere ikus deçaçuenean gauça hauc eguiten diradela , iaquiçue ecen hurbil datela borthán .

text: Verily I say unto you , that this generation shall not pass , till all these things be done .
text2: Eguiaz erraiten drauçuet , ecen eztela iraganen mende haur , gauça hauc guciac eguin diteno .

text: Heaven and earth shall pass away : but my words shall not pass away .
text2: Ceruä eta lurra iraganen dirade , baina ene hitzac eztirade iraganen .

text: But of that day and that hour knoweth no man , no , not the angels which are in heaven , neither the Son , but the Father .
text2: Baina egun harçaz eta orenaz nehorc eztaqui , ez eta ceruän diraden Aingueruèc - ere , ez eta Semeac - ere , Aitac berac baicen .

text: Take ye heed , watch and pray : for ye know not when the time is .
text2: Beguirauçue , veilla eçaçue eta othoitz eguiçue , ecen eztaquiçue demborá noiz daten .

text: For the Son of man is as a man taking a far journey , who left his house , and gave authority to his servants , and to every man his work , and commanded the porter to watch .
text2: Hala da nola camporat ioan licén guiçon batec , bere etchea vtziric , eta emanic bere cerbitzariey authoritate : eta ceini bere lana , borthal - çainari veilla leçan manatu balerauca .

text: Watch ye therefore : for ye know not when the master of the house cometh , at even , or at midnight , or at the cockcrowing , or in the morning :
text2: Veilla eçaçue beraz : ecen eztaquiçue noiz etzcheco iauna ethorriren den , arratsean , ala gauherditan , ala oillaritean , ala goicean :

text: Lest coming suddenly he find you sleeping .
text2: Vstegaberic dathorrenean , lo çaunçatela eriden etzaitzaten .

text: And what I say unto you I say unto all , Watch .
text2: Eta çuey erraiten drauçuedana , guciey erraiten drauet , Veilla eçaçue .

text: After two days was the feast of the passover , and of unleavened bread : and the chief priests and the scribes sought how they might take him by craft , and put him to death .
text2: Cen bada Bazcoaren eta ogui altchagarri gabecoen bestá bi egunen buruän : eta Sacrificadore principalac eta Scribác çabiltzan bilha nolatan hura fineciaz hatzamanic hil leçaqueten .

text: But they said , Not on the feast day , lest there be an uproar of the people .
text2: Eta cioiten , Ez bestán , populuan tumultoric eztençát .

text: And being in Bethany in the house of Simon the leper , as he sat at meat , there came a woman having an alabaster box of ointment of spikenard very precious ; and she brake the box , and poured it on his head .
text2: Eta Iesus Bethanian Simon sorhayoaren etchean cela eta mahainean iarriric cegoela , ethor cedin emaztebat aspic garbizco vnguentu precio handitaco boeitabat çuela : eta hautsiric boeitá , huts ceçan haren buru gainera .

text: And there were some that had indignation within themselves , and said , Why was this waste of the ointment made ?
text2: Eta ciraden batzu berac baithan gaitzi çayenic , eta erraiten çutenic , Certaco vnguentu goastatze haur eguin içan da ?

text: For it might have been sold for more than three hundred pence , and have been given to the poor . And they murmured against her .
text2: Ecen haur hirur - ehun dinero baino guehiagotan saldu ahal çaten , eta eman paubrey . Eta baçadassaten haren contra .

text: And Jesus said , Let her alone ; why trouble ye her ? she hath wrought a good work on me .
text2: Baina Iesusec dio , Vtzaçue hori , cergatic faschatzen duçue ? obra ombat enegana eguin du .

text: For ye have the poor with you always , and whensoever ye will ye may do them good : but me ye have not always .
text2: Ecen paubreac bethiere vkanen dituçue çuequin , eta noiz - ere nahi vkanen baituçue , hæy vngui ahal daidieçue : baina ni eznauçue bethi vkanen .

text: She hath done what she could : she is come aforehand to anoint my body to the burying .
text2: Hunec ahal duena eguin du : auançatu da ene gorputzaren vnctatzera ene ohorztecotzat .

text: Verily I say unto you , Wheresoever this gospel shall be preached throughout the whole world , this also that she hath done shall be spoken of for a memorial of her .
text2: Eguiaz erraiten drauçuet , non - ere predicaturen baita Euangelio haur mundu gucian , hunec eguin duena - ere contaturen da hunen memoriotan .

text: And Judas Iscariot , one of the twelve , went unto the chief priests , to betray him unto them .
text2: Orduan Iudas Iscariot hamabietaric bat ethor cedin Sacrificadore principaletara , hura liura liecençat .

text: And when they heard it , they were glad , and promised to give him money . And he sought how he might conveniently betray him .
text2: Eta hec hori ençunic aleguera citecen , eta prometta cieçoten diru emaitera : eta bilha çabilan nolatán hura dembora moldezcoz tradi leçaqueen .

text: And the first day of unleavened bread , when they killed the passover , his disciples said unto him , Where wilt thou that we go and prepare that thou mayest eat the passover ?
text2: Eta altchagarri gabeco oguién lehen egunean , Bazcoa sacrificatu behar çutenean , erran cieçoten bere discipuluéc , Non nahi duc ioanic appain deçagun ian deçánçat Bazcoa ?

text: And he sendeth forth two of his disciples , and saith unto them , Go ye into the city , and there shall meet you a man bearing a pitcher of water : follow him .
text2: Orduan igor citzan bere discipuluetaric biga , eta erran ciecén , Çoazte hirira , non bathuren baitzaiçue guiçombat , pegar - bat vr daramala : çarrcitzate hari .

text: And wheresoever he shall go in , say ye to the goodman of the house , The Master saith , Where is the guestchamber , where I shall eat the passover with my disciples ?
text2: Eta nora - ere sarthuren baita , erroçue aitafamiliari : Magistruac cioc , Non da neure discipuluequin Bazcoa ianen dudan ostatua ?

text: And he will shew you a large upper room furnished and prepared : there make ready for us .
text2: Eta harc eracutsiren drauçue gambera handibat paratua eta appaindua : han appain ieçaguçue .

text: And his disciples went forth , and came into the city , and found as he had said unto them : and they made ready the passover .
text2: Parti citecen bada haren discipuluac , eta ethor citecen hirira : eta eriden ceçaten erran cerauen beçala , eta appain ceçaten Bazcoa .

text: And in the evening he cometh with the twelve .
text2: Eta arrastu cenean , ethor cedin hamabiequin .

text: And as they sat and did eat , Jesus said , Verily I say unto you , One of you which eateth with me shall betray me .
text2: Eta hec mahainean iarriric ceudela , eta alha ciradela , dio Iesusec , Eguiaz erraiten drauçuet , çuetaric batec tradituren nau , ceinec iaten baitu enequin .

text: And they began to be sorrowful , and to say unto him one by one , Is it I ? and another said , Is it I ?
text2: Eta hec has citecen tristetzen : eta hari erraiten bata bercearen ondoan , Ni naiz ? eta berceac , Ni naiz ?

text: And he answered and said unto them , It is one of the twelve , that dippeth with me in the dish .
text2: Eta harc ihardesten çuela erran ciecén , Hamabietaric batec , enequin platean trempatzen duenec tradituren nau .

text: The Son of man indeed goeth , as it is written of him : but woe to that man by whom the Son of man is betrayed ! good were it for that man if he had never been born .
text2: Segur guiçonaren Semea badoa , harçaz scribatu den beçala : baina maledictione guiçon haren gainean , ceinez guiçonaren Semea tradituren baita : on çuqueen guiçon harc baldin iayo ezpaliz .

text: And as they did eat , Jesus took bread , and blessed , and brake it , and gave to them , and said , Take , eat : this is my body .
text2: Eta hec alha ciradela , har ceçan Iesusec oguia eta gratiác rendaturic hauts ceçan : eta eman cieçén , eta dio , Har eçaçue , ian eçaçue : haur da ene gorputza .

text: And he took the cup , and when he had given thanks , he gave it to them : and they all drank of it .
text2: Eta copá hartu çuenean , gratiác rendaturic , eman ciecén : eta edan ceçaten hartaric guciéc .

text: And he said unto them , This is my blood of the new testament , which is shed for many .
text2: Eta dioste , Haur da ene odol Testamentu berricoa , anhitzengatic issurten dena .

text: Verily I say unto you , I will drink no more of the fruit of the vine , until that day that I drink it new in the kingdom of God .
text2: Eguiaz diotsuet , ecen eztudala edanen hemendic harat aihenaren fructutic , hura berriric Iaincoaren resumán edanen dudan egunerano .

text: And when they had sung an hymn , they went out into the mount of Olives .
text2: Eta canticoa erranic ioan citecen Oliuatzetaco mendirát .

text: And Jesus saith unto them , All ye shall be offended because of me this night : for it is written , I will smite the shepherd , and the sheep shall be scattered .
text2: Orduan dioste Iesusec , Guciac scandalizaturen çarete nitan gau hunetan : ecen scribatua da , Ioren dut artzaina , eta barreyaturen dirade ardiac .

text: But after that I am risen , I will go before you into Galilee .
text2: Baina resuscita nadinean aitzinduren natzaiçue Galileara .

text: But Peter said unto him , Although all shall be offended , yet will not I .
text2: Eta Pierrisec erran cieçón , Baldin guciac scandaliza baditez - ere , ni ez ordea .

text: And Jesus saith unto him , Verily I say unto thee , That this day , even in this night , before the cock crow twice , thou shalt deny me thrice .
text2: Orduan diotsa Iesusec , Eguiaz erraiten drauat ecen egun , gau hunetan biguetan oillarrac io deçan baino lehen , hiruretan vkaturen nauála .

text: But he spake the more vehemently , If I should die with thee , I will not deny thee in any wise . Likewise also said they all .
text2: Baina harc vnguiz haguitzago erraiten çuen , Baldin hirequin hil behar banu - ere , ezaut vkaturen . Eta halaber guciec - ere erraiten çutén .

text: And they came to a place which was named Gethsemane : and he saith to his disciples , Sit ye here , while I shall pray .
text2: Guero ethorten dirade Gethsemane deitzen den leku batetara : eta dioste bere discipuluey , Iar çaitezte hemen , othoitz daididano .

text: And he taketh with him Peter and James and John , and began to be sore amazed , and to be very heavy ;
text2: Eta hartzen ditu Pierris eta Iacques eta Ioannes berequin , eta has cedin icitzen , eta guciz keichatzen .

text: And saith unto them , My soul is exceeding sorrowful unto death : tarry ye here , and watch .
text2: Eta dioste , Alde gucietaric triste da ene arimá heriorano : çaudete hemen , eta veilla eçaçue .

text: And he went forward a little , and fell on the ground , and prayed that , if it were possible , the hour might pass from him .
text2: Eta aitzinachiago ioanic , bere buruä lurrera egotz ceçan , eta othoitz eguin ceçan , baldin possible baliz iragan ledin harenganic oren hura :

text: And he said , Abba , Father , all things are possible unto thee ; take away this cup from me : nevertheless not what I will , but what thou wilt .
text2: Eta erran ceçan , Abba , Aitá , gauça guçiac possible dituc hire : transporta eçac eneganic copa haur : badaric - ere ez nic nahi dudana , baina hic nahi duana .

text: And he cometh , and findeth them sleeping , and saith unto Peter , Simon , sleepest thou ? couldest not thou watch one hour ?
text2: Guero ethor cedin , eta eriden citzan lo ceunçala : eta diotsa Pierrisi , Simón lo atza ? orembat ecin veillatu duc ?

text: Watch ye and pray , lest ye enter into temptation . The spirit truly is ready , but the flesh is weak .
text2: Veilla eçaçue , eta othoitz eguiçue , sar etzaitezten tentationetan : spiritua prompto da , baina haraguia flacu .

text: And again he went away , and prayed , and spake the same words .
text2: Eta berriz ioanic othoitz eguin ceçan , eta propos bera erran ceçan .

text: And when he returned , he found them asleep again , ( for their eyes were heavy , ) neither wist they what to answer him .
text2: Guero itzuliric eriden citzan berriz lo ceunçala : ecen hayén beguiac cargatuac ciraden , eta etzaquiten cer ihardets ceçaqueoten .

text: And he cometh the third time , and saith unto them , Sleep on now , and take your rest : it is enough , the hour is come ; behold , the Son of man is betrayed into the hands of sinners .
text2: Eta ethor cedin herén aldian , eta dioste , Lo eguiçue gaurguero , eta reposa çaitezte : asco da , ethorri da orena : huná , liuratzen da guiçonaren Semea gaichtoén escuetara .

text: Rise up , let us go ; lo , he that betrayeth me is at hand .
text2: Iaiqui çaitezte , goacen : huná , ni traditzen nauena hurbildu da .

text: And immediately , while he yet spake , cometh Judas , one of the twelve , and with him a great multitude with swords and staves , from the chief priests and the scribes and the elders .
text2: Eta bertan , hura oraino minço cela , ethor cedin Iudas , baitzén hamabietaric bat , eta harequin gendetze handia ezpatequin eta vhequin , Sacrificadore principalén , eta Scribén , eta Ancianoén partez .

text: And he that betrayed him had given them a token , saying , Whomsoever I shall kiss , that same is he ; take him , and lead him away safely .
text2: Eta eman cerauen , hura traditzen çuenac elkarren artean seignale , cioela , Nori - ere pot eguinen baitraucat , hura da , hari çatchetzate , eta eramaçue segurqui .

text: And as soon as he was come , he goeth straightway to him , and saith , Master , master ; and kissed him .
text2: Eta ethorri cenean , bertan harengana hurbilduric diotsá , Magistruá , Magistruá , eta pot eguin cieçón .

text: And they laid their hands on him , and took him .
text2: Orduan hec eçar citzaten bere escuac haren gainean , eta hatzaman ceçaten .

text: And one of them that stood by drew a sword , and smote a servant of the high priest , and cut off his ear .
text2: Eta han ciradenetaric cembeitec , ezpatá idoquiric io ceçan Sacrificadore principalaren cerbitzaria , eta edequi cieçón beharria .

text: And Jesus answered and said unto them , Are ye come out , as against a thief , with swords and with staves to take me ?
text2: Eta ihardesten çuela Iesusec erran ciecén , Gaichtaguin baten ondoan beçala ilki çarete ezpatequin eta vhequin ene hatzamaitera ?

text: I was daily with you in the temple teaching , and ye took me not : but the scriptures must be fulfilled .
text2: Egun oroz çuen artean nincén templean iracasten ari nincela , eta ez nauçue hartu . Baina behar da compli ditecen Scripturác .

text: And they all forsook him , and fled .
text2: Orduan hura vtziric haren discipulu guciéc ihes ceguitén .

text: And there followed him a certain young man , having a linen cloth cast about his naked body ; and the young men laid hold on him :
text2: Eta guiçón gaztebat iarreiqui içan çayón gorputz billuciaren gainean inguru mihisse batez estaliric , eta hatzaman ceçaten hura guiçon gazte batzuc .

text: And he left the linen cloth , and fled from them naked .
text2: Baina hura , vtziric mihissea , billuzgorriric itzur cequién .

text: And they led Jesus away to the high priest : and with him were assembled all the chief priests and the elders and the scribes .
text2: Orduan eraman ceçaten Iesus Sacrificadore subiranoagana : eta bil citecen harequin . Sacrificadore principal guciac , eta Ancianoac , eta Scribác .

text: And Peter followed him afar off , even into the palace of the high priest : and he sat with the servants , and warmed himself at the fire .
text2: Eta Pierris vrrundanic iarreiqui cequión Sacrificadore subiranoaren sala barnerano : eta cegoen iarriric cerbitzariequin , berotzen cela su bazterrean .

text: And the chief priests and all the council sought for witness against Jesus to put him to death ; and found none .
text2: Eta Sacrificadore principalac , eta consistorio gucia Iesusen contra testimoniage bilha çabiltzan , hura hil eraci leçatençát : eta etzutén erideiten .

text: For many bare false witness against him , but their witness agreed not together .
text2: Ecen anhitzec falsuqui testificatzen çutén haren contra : baina etziraden conforme hayén testimoniageac .

text: And there arose certain , and bare false witness against him , saying ,
text2: Orduan batzuc iaiquiric falsuqui testifica ceçaten haren contra , cioitela ,

text: We heard him say , I will destroy this temple that is made with hands , and within three days I will build another made without hands .
text2: Guc ençun dugu hori erraiten , Nic deseguinen dut temple escuz eguin haur , eta hirur egunez berce escuz eguin eztembat edificaturen dut .

text: But neither so did their witness agree together .
text2: Baina hala - ere hayén testimoniagea etzén conforme .

text: And the high priest stood up in the midst , and asked Jesus , saying , Answerest thou nothing ? what is it which these witness against thee ?
text2: Orduan Sacrificadore subiranoac artera iaiquiric interroga ceçan Iesus , cioela , Eztuc deus ihardesten ? cer da hauc hire contra testificatzen dutena ?

text: But he held his peace , and answered nothing . Again the high priest asked him , and said unto him , Art thou the Christ , the Son of the Blessed ?
text2: Baina hura ichilic cegoen , eta etzeçan deus ihardets . Berriz Sacrificadore subiranoac interroga ceçan hura , eta erran cieçón , Hi aiz Christ Iainco Benedicatuaren Semea ?

text: And Jesus said , I am : and ye shall see the Son of man sitting on the right hand of power , and coming in the clouds of heaven .
text2: Eta Iesusec erran cieçón , Ni nauc , eta ikussiren duçue guiçonaren Semea iarriric dagoela Iaincoaren botherearen escunean , eta ethorten dela ceruco hodeyetan .

text: Then the high priest rent his clothes , and saith , What need we any further witnesses ?
text2: Orduan Sacrificadore subiranoac bere arropác erdiraturic erran ceçan , Cer guehiago testimonio behar dugu ?

text: Ye have heard the blasphemy : what think ye ? And they all condemned him to be guilty of death .
text2: Ençun duçue blasphemioa : cer irudi çaiçue ? Eta hec guciéc haren contra iugea ceçaten , hil mereci cuela .

text: And some began to spit on him , and to cover his face , and to buffet him , and to say unto him , Prophesy : and the servants did strike him with the palms of their hands .
text2: Eta has citecen batzu haren contra thu eguiten : eta haren beguithartearen estaltzen , eta haren buffetatzen : eta hari erraiten , Prophetiza eçac . Eta officieréc cihor vkaldi emaiten ceraucaten .

text: And as Peter was beneath in the palace , there cometh one of the maids of the high priest :
text2: Eta Pierris behereco salán cegoela , ethor cedin Sacrificadore subiranoaren nescatoetaric bat :

text: And when she saw Peter warming himself , she looked upon him , and said , And thou also wast with Jesus of Nazareth .
text2: Eta ikussi çuenean Pierris berotzen cegoela , hari beguira iarriric erran ceçan , Eta hi Iesus Nazarenorequin incén .

text: But he denied , saying , I know not , neither understand I what thou sayest . And he went out into the porch ; and the cock crew .
text2: Baina harc vka ceçan , cioela , Eztinát eçagutzen , ez etzeaquinat hic cer dionán . Eta ilki cedin corralerat , eta oillarrac io ceçan .

text: And a maid saw him again , and began to say to them that stood by , This is one of them .
text2: Eta nescatoa berriz hura ikussiric , has cedin han ciradeney erraiten , Haur hetaric da .

text: And he denied it again . And a little after , they that stood by said again to Peter , Surely thou art one of them : for thou art a Galilaean , and thy speech agreeth thereto .
text2: Baina harc berriz vka ceçan . Eta appurbaten buruän berriz han ciradenéc erran cieçoten Pierrisi , Eguiazqui hetaric aiz , ecen Galileano aiz , eta hire lengoageac irudi dic .

text: But he began to curse and to swear , saying , I know not this man of whom ye speak .
text2: Orduan hura has cedin maradicatzen eta arnegatzen , cioela , Eztut eçagutzen çuec dioçuen guiçon hori .

text: And the second time the cock crew . And Peter called to mind the word that Jesus said unto him , Before the cock crow twice , thou shalt deny me thrice . And when he thought thereon , he wept .
text2: Eta berriz oillarrac io ceçan : eta orhoit cedin Pierris Iesusec erran ceraucan hitzaz , Oillarrac biguetan io deçan baino lehen , hiruretan vkaturen nauc . Eta camporat ilkiric nigar eguin ceçan .

text: And straightway in the morning the chief priests held a consultation with the elders and scribes and the whole council , and bound Jesus , and carried him away , and delivered him to Pilate .
text2: Eta bertan goicean conseillu eduquiric Sacrificadore principaléc Ancianoequin eta Scribequin eta consistorio guciarequin , estecaturic Iesus eraman ceçaten , eta liura cieçoten Pilati .

text: And Pilate asked him , Art thou the King of the Jews ? And he answering said unto him , Thou sayest it .
text2: Orduan interroga ceçan , hura Pilatec , Hi aiz Iuduen Reguea ? Eta harc ihardesten çuela erran cieçón , Hic dioc .

text: And the chief priests accused him of many things : but he answered nothing .
text2: Eta anhitz gauçaz accusatzen çutén hura Sacrificadore principaléc .

text: And Pilate asked him again , saying , Answerest thou nothing ? behold how many things they witness against thee .
text2: Eta Pilatec berriz interroga ceçan , cioela , Eztuc deus ihardesten ? huná , cembat gauçaz hire contra testificatzen dutén .

text: But Jesus yet answered nothing ; so that Pilate marvelled .
text2: Baina Iesusec deus etzeçan guehiagoric ihardets : hala non miresten baitzuen Pilatec .

text: Now at that feast he released unto them one prisoner , whomsoever they desired .
text2: Eta bestan largatzen ohi cerauen presonerbat , ceinen - ere esca bailitez .

text: And there was one named Barabbas , which lay bound with them that had made insurrection with him , who had committed murder in the insurrection .
text2: Eta cen Barabbas deitzen cembat presonér seditioneco lagunequin , heriotze mutinationez eguin çuenic .

text: And the multitude crying aloud began to desire him to do as he had ever done unto them .
text2: Eta oihuz iarriric populua has cedin escatzen eguin liecén bethiere eguin vkan cerauen beçala .

text: But Pilate answered them , saying , Will ye that I release unto you the King of the Jews ?
text2: Eta Pilatec ihardetsi cerauen , cioela , Nahi duçue larga dieçaçuedan Iuduén Regueá ?

text: For he knew that the chief priests had delivered him for envy .
text2: ( Ecen baceaquian nola hura inuidiaz liuratu çutén Sacrificadore principaléc )

text: But the chief priests moved the people , that he should rather release Barabbas unto them .
text2: Eta Sacrificadore principaléc incita ceçaten populua lehen Barabbas larga liecén .

text: And Pilate answered and said again unto them , What will ye then that I shall do unto him whom ye call the King of the Jews ?
text2: Eta Pilatec ihardesten çuela , berriz erran ciecén , Cer bada nahi duçue daguiodan Iuduén Regue deitzen duçuen huni ?

text: And they cried out again , Crucify him .
text2: Eta hec berriz oihu eguin ceçaten , Crucifica eçac .

text: Then Pilate said unto them , Why , what evil hath he done ? And they cried out the more exceedingly , Crucify him .
text2: Eta Pilatec erraiten cerauen , Baina cer gaizqui eguin du ? Eta hec hambat oihu guehiago eguin ceçaten , Crucifica eçac .

text: And so Pilate , willing to content the people , released Barabbas unto them , and delivered Jesus , when he had scourged him , to be crucified .
text2: Pilatec bada populuaren gogara eguin nahiz , larga ciecen Barabbas , eta Iesus açotaturic liura ciecén crucifica ledinçat .

text: And the soldiers led him away into the hall , called Praetorium ; and they call together the whole band .
text2: Orduan gendarmesec eraman ceçaten hura sala barnera , cein baita pretorioa , eta dei ceçaten banda gucia .

text: And they clothed him with purple , and platted a crown of thorns , and put it about his head ,
text2: Eta vezti ceçaten hura escarlataz , eta inguru eçar cieçoten buruan elhorri plegatuzco coroabat .

text: And began to salute him , Hail , King of the Jews !
text2: Eta has citecen haren salutatzen , cioitela , Vngui hel daquiala , Iuduen Regueá .

text: And they smote him on the head with a reed , and did spit upon him , and bowing their knees worshipped him .
text2: Eta baceraunsaten haren buruäri canabera batez , eta thu eguiten çuten haren contra , eta belhauricaturic reuerentia eguiten ceraucaten .

text: And when they had mocked him , they took off the purple from him , and put his own clothes on him , and led him out to crucify him .
text2: Guero harçaz truffatu ciradenean , eraunz cieçoten escarlatazcoa , eta vezti ceçaten bere abillamenduéz : eta camporat eraman ceçaten crucifica leçatençat .

text: And they compel one Simon a Cyrenian , who passed by , coming out of the country , the father of Alexander and Rufus , to bear his cross .
text2: Eta bortcha ceçaten bideazco Simon Cyreniano deitzen cembat , landetaric heldu cela , ( cein baitzén Alexandreren eta Ruforen aita ) haren crutzea eraman leçançat .

text: And they bring him unto the place Golgotha , which is , being interpreted , The place of a skull .
text2: Guero eraman ceçaten Golgothaco lekura , cein erran nahi baita , Bur - heçur lekua .

text: And they gave him to drink wine mingled with myrrh : but he received it not .
text2: Guero eman cieçoten edatera mahatsarno myrrharequin nahasteca , baina harc etzeçan har

text: And when they had crucified him , they parted his garments , casting lots upon them , what every man should take .
text2: Eta crucificatu çutenean , parti citzaten haren abillamenduac , çorthe egotziric hayén gainean , norc cer ioan leçaqueen .

text: And it was the third hour , and they crucified him .
text2: Ciraden bada hirur orenac hura crucificatu çutenean .

text: And the superscription of his accusation was written over , THE KING OF THE JEWS .
text2: Eta cen haren causaren inscriptionea hunela scribatua , IVDVEN REGVEA .

text: And with him they crucify two thieves ; the one on his right hand , and the other on his left .
text2: Eta harequin crucifica citzaten bi gaichtaguin : bata haren escuinean , eta bercea ezquerrean .

text: And the scripture was fulfilled , which saith , And he was numbered with the transgressors .
text2: Eta compli cedin Scriptura dioena , Eta gaizquiguilequin estimatu içan da .

text: And they that passed by railed on him , wagging their heads , and saying , Ah , thou that destroyest the temple , and buildest it in three days ,
text2: Eta iragaiten ciradenéc iniuriatzen çuten bere buruac higuitzen cituztela , eta cioitela , He , templea deseguiten eta hirur egunez edificatzen duaná .

text: Save thyself , and come down from the cross .
text2: Empara eçac eure buruä , eta iautsi adi crutzetic .

text: Likewise also the chief priests mocking said among themselves with the scribes , He saved others ; himself he cannot save .
text2: Halaber Sacrificadore principalec - ere escarnioz elkarri erraiten ceraucaten Scribequin , Berceac emparatu ditu , bere buruä ecin empara deçaque .

text: Let Christ the King of Israel descend now from the cross , that we may see and believe . And they that were crucified with him reviled him .
text2: Christ Israeleco Reguea iauts bedi orain crutzetic , ikus eta sinhets deçagunçat . Harequin crucificatu içan ciradenec - ere iniuriatzen çutén .

text: And when the sixth hour was come , there was darkness over the whole land until the ninth hour .
text2: Baina sey orenac ciradenean , ilhumbe eguin cedin lur guciaren gainean bedratzi orenetarano

text: And at the ninth hour Jesus cried with a loud voice , saying , Eloi , Eloi , lama sabachthani ? which is , being interpreted , My God , my God , why hast thou forsaken me ?
text2: Eta bedratzi orenetan oihu eguin ceçan Iesusec ocengui , Eloi , Eloi , lammasabachthani ? erran nahi baita , Ene Iaincoa , Ene Iaincoa , ceren abandonnatu nauc ?

text: And some of them that stood by , when they heard it , said , Behold , he calleth Elias .
text2: Eta han ciradenetaric batzuc ençun çutenean , cioiten , Huná , Elias deitzen du .

text: And one ran and filled a spunge full of vinegar , and put it on a reed , and gave him to drink , saying , Let alone ; let us see whether Elias will come to take him down .
text2: Laster eguin ceçan bada batec , eta spongiabat betheric vinagrez , eta eçarriric canabera baten inguruän , eman cieçón edatera , cioela , Vtzaçue : dacussagun eya ethorriren denez Elias horren kencera .

text: And Jesus cried with a loud voice , and gave up the ghost .
text2: Eta Iesusec oihu handibat eguinic , spiritua renda ceçan .

text: And the veil of the temple was rent in twain from the top to the bottom .
text2: Eta templeco velá erdira cedin bi çathitara garaitic behererano .

text: And when the centurion , which stood over against him , saw that he so cried out , and gave up the ghost , he said , Truly this man was the Son of God .
text2: Eta ikus ceçanean haren aurkan cegoen Centenerac , ecen hala oihu eguinic spiritua rendatu çuela , erran ceçan , Eguiazqui guiçon haur Iaincoaren Semea cen .

text: There were also women looking on afar off : among whom was Mary Magdalene , and Mary the mother of James the less and of Joses , and Salome ;
text2: Eta baciraden emazteac - ere vrrundanic beha ceudela , ceinén artean baitzen Maria Magdalena , eta Maria Iacques chipiaren eta Iosesen amá , eta Salome .

text: ( Who also , when he was in Galilee , followed him , and ministered unto him ; ) and many other women which came up with him unto Jerusalem .
text2: Eta hec , Galilean cenaz gueroztic iarreiqui içan çaizcan eta cerbitzatu vkan çuten : eta anhitz berce emazte harequin batean Ierusalemera igan içan ciradenic .

text: And now when the even was come , because it was the preparation , that is , the day before the sabbath ,
text2: Eta arrastu cenean ( ceren Sabbathoaren aitzinetic den preparationeco eguna baitzén )

text: Joseph of Arimathaea , and honourable counseller , which also waited for the kingdom of God , came , and went in boldly unto Pilate , and craved the body of Jesus .
text2: Ethorriric Ioseph Arimatheacoa , conseillér ohoratua , hura - ere Iaincoaren resumaren beguira cegoena , ausart cedin Pilatgana sartzera , eta esca cequión Iesusen gorputzaren .

text: And Pilate marvelled if he were already dead : and calling unto him the centurion , he asked him whether he had been any while dead .
text2: Eta Pilatec miresten çuen baldin ia hil baliz : eta Centenera deithuric , interroga ceçan hura , eya baçuenez heuraguiric hil cela .

text: And when he knew it of the centurion , he gave the body to Joseph .
text2: Eta gauçá eçaguturic Centeneraganic , eman cieçón gorputza Iosephi .

text: And he bought fine linen , and took him down , and wrapped him in the linen , and laid him in a sepulchre which was hewn out of a rock , and rolled a stone unto the door of the sepulchre .
text2: Eta harc mihissebat erossiric , eta hura erautsiric estal ceçan mihisseaz : eta eçar ceçan arroca batetan ebaquia cen monumentean : eta itzuliz eçar ceçan harribat monument borthán .

text: And Mary Magdalene and Mary the mother of Joses beheld where he was laid .
text2: Eta Maria Magdalena eta Maria Iosesen ama , beha ceuden non eçarten cen .

text: And when the sabbath was past , Mary Magdalene , and Mary the mother of James , and Salome , had bought sweet spices , that they might come and anoint him .
text2: Eta Sabbathoa iragan cenean , Maria Magdalenac eta Maria Iacquesen amác eta Salomec eros citzaten vnguentu aromaticoac , ethorriric hura embauma leçatençat .

text: And very early in the morning the first day of the week , they came unto the sepulchre at the rising of the sun .
text2: Eta guciz goiz astearen lehen egunean ethorten dirade monumentera , iguzquia ia ilki cenean

text: And they said among themselves , Who shall roll us away the stone from the door of the sepulchre ?
text2: Eta erraiten çuten elkarren artean , Norc aldaraturen draucu harria monument borthatic ?

text: And when they looked , they saw that the stone was rolled away : for it was very great .
text2: Eta miratu çutenean , ikus ceçaten harria aldaratua cela : ecen guciz handia cen .

text: And entering into the sepulchre , they saw a young man sitting on the right side , clothed in a long white garment ; and they were affrighted .
text2: Guero monumentera sarthuric , ikus ceçaten lagun gaztebat escuineco aldean iarria , abillamendu churi luce batez veztitua : eta ici citecen

text: And he saith unto them , Be not affrighted : Ye seek Jesus of Nazareth , which was crucified : he is risen ; he is not here : behold the place where they laid him .
text2: Baina harc dioste , Etzaiteztela ici : Iesus Nazareth crucificatu içan denaren bilha çabiltzate , resuscitatu da : ezta hemen , huná lekua non eçarri vkan çutén .

text: But go your way , tell his disciples and Peter that he goeth before you into Galilee : there shall ye see him , as he said unto you .
text2: Baina çoazte , erran ieceçue haren discipuluey eta Pierrisi , ecen çuen aitzinean ioaiten dela Galileara : han hura ikussiren duçue , erran drauçuen beçala .

text: And they went out quickly , and fled from the sepulchre ; for they trembled and were amazed : neither said they any thing to any man ; for they were afraid .
text2: Eta hec bertan partituric ihes eguin ceçaten monumentetic : ecen ikarac eta iciapenec har citzan : eta nehori deus etzeraucaten erraiten : ecen beldur ciraden .

text: Now when Jesus was risen early the first day of the week , he appeared first to Mary Magdalene , out of whom he had cast seven devils .
text2: Eta Iesus resuscitatu cenean , asteco lehen egun goicean , aguer cequión lehenic Maria Magdalenari , ceinetaric çazpi deabru campora egotzi baitzituen .

text: And she went and told them that had been with him , as they mourned and wept .
text2: Harc ioanic conta ciecén , Iesusequin içan ciradeney , ceinéc dolu ekarten baitzuten eta nigar eguiten .

text: And they , when they had heard that he was alive , and had been seen of her , believed not .
text2: Eta hec ençun ceçatenean ecen vici cela , eta harc ikussi cuela , etzeçaten sinhets .

text: After that he appeared in another form unto two of them , as they walked , and went into the country .
text2: Guero gauça hauén ondoan hetaric bi ioaiten ciradeni aguer cequién berce formatan , camporat partitzen ciradela .

text: And they went and told it unto the residue : neither believed they them .
text2: Eta hec itzuli ciradenean conta ciecen bercéy : baina etzitzaten hec - ere sinhets .

text: Afterward he appeared unto the eleven as they sat at meat , and upbraided them with their unbelief and hardness of heart , because they believed not them which had seen him after he was risen .
text2: Azquenic , elkarrequin iarriric ceudela hamequey aguer cequién , eta reprotcha ciecen hayén incredulitatea , eta bihotz gogortassuna : ceren hura resuscitaturic ikussi vkan çutenac ezpaitzituzten sinhetsi .

text: And he said unto them , Go ye into all the world , and preach the gospel to every creature .
text2: Eta erran ciecén , Çoazte mundu orotara , eta predica ieçoçue Euangelioa creatura guciari

text: He that believeth and is baptized shall be saved ; but he that believeth not shall be damned .
text2: Sinhetsiren duena eta batheyaturen dena saluaturen da : baina sinhetsiren eztuena condemnaturen da

text: And these signs shall follow them that believe ; In my name shall they cast out devils ; they shall speak with new tongues ;
text2: Eta signo hauc sinhetsi duqueiteney iarreiquiren caizté Ene icenean deabruac campora egotziren dituzté , lengoage berriz minçaturen dirade :

text: They shall take up serpents ; and if they drink any deadly thing , it shall not hurt them ; they shall lay hands on the sick , and they shall recover .
text2: Sugueac kenduren dituzté : eta baldin cerbait heriotaracoric edan badeçate , eztraue calteric eguinen : erien gainean escuac eçarriren dituzté , eta sendaturen dirade .

text: So then after the Lord had spoken unto them , he was received up into heaven , and sat on the right hand of God .
text2: Eta Iauna gauça hauçaz hæy minçatu içan çayenean , goiti cerurát altcha cedin , eta iar cedin Iaincoaren escuinean .

text: And they went forth , and preached everywhere , the Lord working with them , and confirming the word with signs following . Amen .
text2: Hec - ere partituric predica ceçaten leku gucietan , Iaunac hequin obratzen çuela , eta hitza confirmatzen çuela iarreiquiten ciraden signoéz .

text: Forasmuch as many have taken in hand to set forth in order a declaration of those things which are most surely believed among us ,
text2: CEREN anhitzec escu eçarri baitu narratione baten scribatzera complituqui gure artean certificatu içan diraden gaucéz ,

text: Even as they delivered them unto us , which from the beginning were eyewitnesses , and ministers of the word ;
text2: Eçagutzera eman draucuten beçala lehen hatsetic ikussi dituztenéc eta hitzaren ministre içan diradenéc .

text: It seemed good to me also , having had perfect understanding of all things from the very first , to write unto thee in order , most excellent Theophilus ,
text2: Niri - ere on iruditu içan ciaitadac gucia hatsetic finerano diligentqui comprehendituric , hiri punctuz punctu heçaz scribatzera , o Theophile gucizco excellenteá :

text: That thou mightest know the certainty of those things , wherein thou hast been instructed .
text2: Hobequi eçagut deçánçat ikassi dituán gaucén eguiá .

text: There was in the days of Herod , the king of Judaea , a certain priest named Zacharias , of the course of Abia : and his wife was of the daughters of Aaron , and her name was Elisabeth .
text2: HERODES Iudeaco regueren egunetan cen Zacharias deitzen cen Sacrificadorebat , Abiaren araldetic : eta haren emaztea cen Aaronen alabetaric , eta haren icena Elisabeth .

text: And they were both righteous before God , walking in all the commandments and ordinances of the Lord blameless .
text2: Biac ciraden iusto Iaincoaren aitzinean , Iaunaren , manamendu eta ordenança gucietan reprochuric gabe çabiltzanac .

text: And they had no child , because that Elisabeth was barren , and they both were now well stricken in years .
text2: Eta haourric etzutén , ceren Elisabeth steril baitzen , eta biac baitziraden adinez aitzinaratuac .

text: And it came to pass , that while he executed the priest ' s office before God in the order of his course ,
text2: Guertha cedin bada , harc Iaincoaren aitzinean bere aldian sacrificadoregoa exercitzen çuenean ,

text: According to the custom of the priest ' s office , his lot was to burn incense when he went into the temple of the Lord .
text2: Sacrificadoregoaren officioco costumaren araura , çorthea eror baitzequión Iaunaren templean sarthuric encensamenduaren eguiteco .

text: And the whole multitude of the people were praying without at the time of incense .
text2: Eta populu guciac campoan othoitz eguiten çuen encensamendua eguiten cen orduan .

text: And there appeared unto him an angel of the Lord standing on the right side of the altar of incense .
text2: Eta aguer cequión Iaunaren Aingueruä , cegoela encensamenduco aldarearen escuinean .

text: And when Zacharias saw him , he was troubled , and fear fell upon him .
text2: Eta Zacharias trubla cedin hura ikussiric , eta icidurabat eror cedin haren gainera .

text: But the angel said unto him , Fear not , Zacharias : for thy prayer is heard ; and thy wife Elisabeth shall bear thee a son , and thou shalt call his name John .
text2: Orduan erran ciecón Aingueruäc , Eztuala beldurric Zacharias : ecen ençun içan duc hire othoitzá , eta Elisabeth eure emaztea erdiren çaic seme batez : eta hari icen emanen draucac Ioannes

text: And thou shalt have joy and gladness ; and many shall rejoice at his birth .
text2: Eta bozcario eta alegrança vkanen duc , eta anhitz haren sortzearen gainean alegueraturen dituc ,

text: For he shall be great in the sight of the Lord , and shall drink neither wine nor strong drink ; and he shall be filled with the Holy Ghost , even from his mother ' s womb .
text2: Ecen handi içanen duc Iaunaren aitzinean , eta mahatsarnoric ez berce arnoric eztic edanen : eta Spiritu sainduaz betheren datec bere amaren sabeleandanic .

text: And many of the children of Israel shall he turn to the Lord their God .
text2: Eta anhitz Israeleco haourretaric conuertituren dic berén Iainco Iaunagana .

text: And he shall go before him in the spirit and power of Elias , to turn the hearts of the fathers to the children , and the disobedient to the wisdom of the just ; to make ready a people prepared for the Lord .
text2: Eta hura ioanen duc haren aitzinean Eliasen spiriturequin eta verthuterequin , conuerti ditzançat aitén bihotzac semetara eta desobedientac iustoén çuhurtassunera : Iaunari populu vngui instruitubat appain dieçonçat .

text: And Zacharias said unto the angel , Whereby shall I know this ? for I am an old man , and my wife well stricken in years .
text2: Orduan erran cieçon Zachariasec Aingueruäri , Nolatán hori eçaguturen dut ? ecen ni nauc çahar , eta ene emaztea duc bere egunetan aitzinaratua .

text: And the angel answering said unto him , I am Gabriel , that stand in the presence of God ; and am sent to speak unto thee , and to shew thee these glad tidings .
text2: Eta ihardesten çuela Aingueruäc erran cieçon , Ni nauc Gabriel Iaincoaren aitzinean assistitzen naicena , eta igorri içan nauc hirequin minçatzera , eta berri on hauen hiri declaratzera .

text: And , behold , thou shalt be dumb , and not able to speak , until the day that these things shall be performed , because thou believest not my words , which shall be fulfilled in their season .
text2: Eta horrá , mutu içanen aiz eta ecin minçaturen aiz , gauça hauc eguin ditecen egunerano : ceren ezpaitituc sinhetsi ene hitz bere demborán complituren diradenac .

text: And the people waited for Zacharias , and marvelled that he tarried so long in the temple .
text2: Eta populua cegoen Zachariasen beguira , eta miresten çuen nola harc hambat berancen çuen templean .

text: And when he came out , he could not speak unto them : and they perceived that he had seen a vision in the temple : for he beckoned unto them , and remained speechless .
text2: Eta ilki cenean ecin minça cequidien , eta eçagut ceçaten ecen cembeit visione ikussi çuela templean : ecen keinuz aditzera emaiten cerauen , eta mutu guelditu ican cen .

text: And it came to pass , that , as soon as the days of his ministration were accomplished , he departed to his own house .
text2: Eta guertha cedin , haren officioco egunac acabatu ciradenean , bere etcherát itzul baitzedin .

text: And after those days his wife Elisabeth conceived , and hid herself five months , saying ,
text2: Eta egun hayén ondoan haren emazte Elisabethec concebi ceçan : eta estal cedin borz hilebethez , cioela ,

text: Thus hath the Lord dealt with me in the days wherein he looked on me , to take away my reproach among men .
text2: Segur , hunela eguin vkan draut Iaunac , visitatu nauen egunetan , ene laidoa guiçonén artetic ken leçançat .

text: And in the sixth month the angel Gabriel was sent from God unto a city of Galilee , named Nazareth ,
text2: Eta seigarren hilebethean igor cedin Gabriel Aingueruä Iaincoaz Galileaco hiri Nazareth deitzen denera :

text: To a virgin espoused to a man whose name was Joseph , of the house of David ; and the virgin ' s name was Mary .
text2: Dauid - en etchetico Ioseph deitzen cen guiçon - batequin fedatua cen virgina batgana : eta virginaren icena cen Maria .

text: And the angel came in unto her , and said , Hail , thou that art highly favoured , the Lord is with thee : blessed art thou among women .
text2: Eta Aingueruäc hura baithara sarthuric , erran ceçan , Salutatzen aut gratia eguin çainaná : Iauna dun hirequin , benedicatua hi emaztén artean .

text: And when she saw him , she was troubled at his saying , and cast in her mind what manner of salutation this should be .
text2: Eta hura , Ainguerua ikussiric trubla cedin haren erranaren gainean , eta pensatzen çuen ceric licén salutatione hura .

text: And the angel said unto her , Fear not , Mary : for thou hast found favour with God .
text2: Orduan diotsa Aingueruäc , Mariá , eztunala beldurric , ecen eriden dun gratia Iaincoa baithan .

text: And , behold , thou shalt conceive in thy womb , and bring forth a son , and shalt call his name JESUS .
text2: Eta horrá , concebituren dun eure sabelean , eta erdiren aiz seme batez eta deithuren dun haren icena Iesus .

text: He shall be great , and shall be called the Son of the Highest : and the Lord God shall give unto him the throne of his father David :
text2: Hura içanen dun handi , eta eritziren ciayón Subiranoaren Semé : eta emanen diraucan Iainco Iaunac bere aita Dauid - en thronoa .

text: And he shall reign over the house of Jacob for ever ; and of his kingdom there shall be no end .
text2: Eta regnaturen din Iacob - en etchearen gainean eternalqui , eta haren resumaren finic eztun içanen .

text: Then said Mary unto the angel , How shall this be , seeing I know not a man ?
text2: Erran ciecón orduan Mariac Aingueruäri , Nola içanen da hori , guiçonic eçagutzen eztudanaz gueroz .

text: And the angel answered and said unto her , The Holy Ghost shall come upon thee , and the power of the Highest shall overshadow thee : therefore also that holy thing which shall be born of thee shall be called the Son of God .
text2: Eta ihardesten çuela Aingueruäc erran cieçón , Spiritu saindua hire gainera ethorriren dun eta Subiranoaren verthuteac itzal eguinen draun eta halacotz hitaric sorthuren den saindua , Iaincoaren Seme deithuren dun .

text: And , behold , thy cousin Elisabeth , she hath also conceived a son in her old age : and this is the sixth month with her , who was called barren .
text2: Eta hará , Elisabeth hire lehen gussua , harc - ere concebitu din semebat bere çahartzean , eta hil haur din seigarrena steril deitzen cenac .

text: For with God nothing shall be impossible .
text2: Ecen eztun deus impossibleric içanen Iaincoa baithan .

text: And Mary said , Behold the handmaid of the Lord ; be it unto me according to thy word . And the angel departed from her .
text2: Eta erran ceçan Mariac , Huná Iaunaren nescatoa : eguin bequit hire hitzaren araura . Eta parti cedin harenganic Aingueruä .

text: And Mary arose in those days , and went into the hill country with haste , into a city of Juda ;
text2: Eta iaiquiric Maria egun hetan ioan cedin mendietara lehiatuqui Iudaco hiri batetara .

text: And entered into the house of Zacharias , and saluted Elisabeth .
text2: Eta sar cedin Zachariasen etchera , eta saluta ceçan Elisabeth .

text: And it came to pass , that , when Elisabeth heard the salutation of Mary , the babe leaped in her womb ; and Elisabeth was filled with the Holy Ghost :
text2: Eta guertha cedin , ençun ceçanean Elisabethec Mariaren salutationea , iauz baitzedin haourra haren sabelean , eta bethe cedin Spiritu sainduaz Elisabeth :

text: And she spake out with a loud voice , and said , Blessed art thou among women , and blessed is the fruit of thy womb .
text2: Eta oihuz iar cedin voz handiz , eta erran ceçan , Benedicatua hi emaztén artean , ecen benedicatua dun hire sabeleco fructua .

text: And whence is this to me , that the mother of my Lord should come to me ?
text2: Eta nondic haur niri , ethor dadin ene Iaunaren ama enegana ?

text: For , lo , as soon as the voice of thy salutation sounded in mine ears , the babe leaped in my womb for joy .
text2: Ecen huná , hire salutationearen voza ene beharrietara heldu içan den beçain sarri , iauci içan dun bozcarioz haourra ene sabelean .

text: And blessed is she that believed : for there shall be a performance of those things which were told her from the Lord .
text2: Eta dohatsu aiz sinhetsi baitun , ceren complituren baitirade Iaunaz erran çaizquinan gauçác

text: And Mary said , My soul doth magnify the Lord ,
text2: Eta dio Mariac , Magnificatzen du ene arimác Iauna .

text: And my spirit hath rejoiced in God my Saviour .
text2: Eta alegueratu da ene spiritua Iainco ene Saluadorea baithan .

text: For he hath regarded the low estate of his handmaiden : for , behold , from henceforth all generations shall call me blessed .
text2: Ceren behatu vkan baitu bere nescatoaren beheratassunera : ecen huná , hemendic harat dohatsu erranen naute generatione guciéc .

text: For he that is mighty hath done to me great things ; and holy is his name .
text2: Ecen gauça handiac eguin drauzquit botheretsu denac : eta haren icena saindu da :

text: And his mercy is on them that fear him from generation to generation .
text2: Eta haren misericordia da generationetaric generationetara haren beldurra dutenetara .

text: He hath shewed strength with his arm ; he hath scattered the proud in the imagination of their hearts .
text2: Botheretsuqui eguin vkan du bere bessoaz : deseguin ditu superboac berén bihotzeco pensamenduan .

text: He hath put down the mighty from their seats , and exalted them of low degree .
text2: Egotzi ditu botheretsuac thronoetaric , eta goratu ditu chipiac .

text: He hath filled the hungry with good things ; and the rich he hath sent empty away .
text2: Gosse ciradenac bethe ditu onez : eta abratsac igorri ditu hutsic

text: He hath holpen his servant Israel , in remembrance of his mercy ;
text2: Sustengatu vkan du Israel bere haourra , bere misericordiáz orhoit içanez .

text: As he spake to our fathers , to Abraham , and to his seed for ever .
text2: Gure aitey minçatu çayen beçala , Abrahami eta haren haciari iagoiticotz .

text: And Mary abode with her about three months , and returned to her own house .
text2: Eta egon cedin Maria harequin hirur hilebetheren inguruä : guero itzul cedin bere etcherát .

text: Now Elisabeth ' s full time came that she should be delivered ; and she brought forth a son .
text2: Eta compli cedin Elisabethen ertzeco demborá : eta erdi cedin seme batez .

text: And her neighbours and her cousins heard how the Lord had shewed great mercy upon her ; and they rejoiced with her .
text2: Eta ençun ceçaten haren auçoéc eta ahaidéc , nola frangoqui Iaunac bere misericordia declaratu çuen harengana , eta alegueratzen ciraden harequin .

text: And it came to pass , that on the eighth day they came to circumcise the child ; and they called him Zacharias , after the name of his father .
text2: Eta guertha cedin , çortzigarreneco egunean ethor baitzitecen haourtchoaren circonciditzera , eta deitzen çuten hura bere aitaren icenaz , Zacharias .

text: And his mother answered and said , Not so ; but he shall be called John .
text2: Baina ihardesten çuela haren amac erran ceçan , Ez , baina deithuren da Ioannes .

text: And they said unto her , There is none of thy kindred that is called by this name .
text2: Eta erran cieçoten , Eztun nehor hire ahaidetan icen horrez deitzen denic .

text: And they made signs to his father , how he would have him called .
text2: Orduan keinu eguin cieçoten haren aitari , nola nahi luen hura dei ledin .

text: And he asked for a writing table , and wrote , saying , His name is John . And they marvelled all .
text2: Eta harc tableta batzuren escaturic scriba ceçan , cioela , Ioannes da horren icena . Eta mirets ceçaten guciéc .

text: And his mouth was opened immediately , and his tongue loosed , and he spake , and praised God .
text2: Eta irequi cedin bertan haren ahoa , eta haren mihia lacha cedin : eta minço cen laudatzen çuela Iaincoa .

text: And fear came on all that dwelt round about them : and all these sayings were noised abroad throughout all the hill country of Judaea .
text2: Eta icidura ethor cedin aldiri hetaco gucién gainera , eta Iudaco herri mendiçu orotan publica citecen hitz hauc guciac .

text: And all they that heard them laid them up in their hearts , saying , What manner of child shall this be ! And the hand of the Lord was with him .
text2: Eta ençun cituzten guciéc , eçar citzaten bere bihotzean , erraiten çutela , Nor haourtcho haur içanen da ? Eta Iaunaren escua cen harequin .

text: And his father Zacharias was filled with the Holy Ghost , and prophesied , saying ,
text2: Orduan haren aita Zacharias bethe cedin Spiritu sainduaz : eta prophetiza ceçan , cioela ,

text: Blessed be the Lord God of Israel ; for he hath visited and redeemed his people ,
text2: Laudatu dela Israeleco Iainco Iauna , ceren visitatu eta redemitu baitu bere populua .

text: And hath raised up an horn of salvation for us in the house of his servant David ;
text2: Eta alchatu baitraucu saluamendutaco adarra Dauid bere cerbitzariaren etchean .

text: As he spake by the mouth of his holy prophets , which have been since the world began :
text2: Nola minçatu içan baita bere Propheta saindu bethidanic içan diradenen ahoz .

text: That we should be saved from our enemies , and from the hand of all that hate us ;
text2: Salbu içanen guinela gure etsayetaric eta guri gaitz çarizcuten gucién escutic .

text: To perform the mercy promised to our fathers , and to remember his holy covenant ;
text2: Gure aitey misericordia leguiençat , eta orhoit licén bere alliança sainduaz :

text: The oath which he sware to our father Abraham ,
text2: Eta gure Aita Abrahami eguin ceraucan iuramenduaz :

text: That he would grant unto us , that we being delivered out of the hand of our enemies might serve him without fear ,
text2: Ecen emanen ceraucula , beldur gabe gure etsayén escuetaric deliuraturic , hura cerbitza guineçan ,

text: In holiness and righteousness before him , all the days of our life .
text2: Saindutassunetan eta iustitiatan haren aitzinean , gure vicico egun gucietan .

text: And thou , child , shalt be called the prophet of the Highest : for thou shalt go before the face of the Lord to prepare his ways ;
text2: Eta hi haourtchoá , Subiranoaren Propheta deithuren aiz : ecen ioanen aiz Iaunaren beguitharte aitzinean , haren bideac appain ditzançat ,

text: To give knowledge of salvation unto his people by the remission of their sins ,
text2: Eta eman dieçoançat saluamenduco eçagutzea haren populuari , hayén bekatuén barkamenduaz .

text: Through the tender mercy of our God ; whereby the dayspring from on high hath visited us ,
text2: Gure Iaincoaren affectione misericordiosoaz , ceinez visitatu vkan baiquaitu , Orientac garaitic :

text: To give light to them that sit in darkness and in the shadow of death , to guide our feet into the way of peace .
text2: Argui daguiençat ilhumbean eta herioaren itzalean iarriric daudeney , gure oinen baquezco bidera chuchenceagatic .

text: And the child grew , and waxed strong in spirit , and was in the deserts till the day of his shewing unto Israel .
text2: Eta haourtchoa handitzen eta spirituz fortificatzen cen : eta egon cedin desertuetan Israeli manifestatu behar içan çayón egunerano .

text: And it came to pass in those days , that there went out a decree from Caesar Augustus , that all the world should be taxed .
text2: Eta guerta cedin egun hetan ethor baitzedin ordenança - bat Cesar Augustoren partez , scribuz iar ledin mundua oro .

text: ( And this taxing was first made when Cyrenius was governor of Syria . )
text2: ( Lehen descriptione haur eguin cedin Cyrenius Syriaco gobernadore cenean )

text: And all went to be taxed , every one into his own city .
text2: Eta ioaiten ciraden guciac scributan iartera , batbedera cein bere hirirát .

text: And Joseph also went up from Galilee , out of the city of Nazareth , into Judaea , unto the city of David , which is called Bethlehem ; ( because he was of the house and lineage of David : )
text2: Igan cedin bada Ioseph - ere Galileatic , Nazaretheco hiritic , Iudeara , Dauid - en ciuitate Bethlehem deitzen denera ( ceren baitzén Dauid - en etchetic eta arraçatic )

text: To be taxed with Mary his espoused wife , being great with child .
text2: Scributan iar ledinçát Maria emaztetan eman içan çayonarequin , cein baitzén içorra .

text: And so it was , that , while they were there , the days were accomplished that she should be delivered .
text2: Eta guertha cedin hec han ciradela , compli baitzitecen haren ertzeco egunac .

text: And she brought forth her firstborn son , and wrapped him in swaddling clothes , and laid him in a manger ; because there was no room for them in the inn .
text2: Eta erdi cedin bere seme lehen iayoaz , eta bandatoz trocha ceçan hura , eta eçar ceçan mangederán , ceren ezpaitzén hayendaco lekuric ostalerián .

text: And there were in the same country shepherds abiding in the field , keeping watch over their flock by night .
text2: Eta ciraden comarca berean artzain campoetan ceunçanac , eta gauazco veillác bere arthaldearen gainean beguiratzen cituztenac .

text: And , lo , the angel of the Lord came upon them , and the glory of the Lord shone round about them : and they were sore afraid .
text2: Eta huná , Iaunaren Aingueruä vstegaberic ethor cequién , eta Iaunaren gloriác argui ceçan hayén inguruän , eta icidura handiz ici citecen .

text: And the angel said unto them , Fear not : for , behold , I bring you good tidings of great joy , which shall be to all people .
text2: Orduan erran ciecén Aingueruäc , Etzaretela beldur : ecen huná , euangelizatzen drauçuet bozcario handi populu guciaren içanen dena :

text: For unto you is born this day in the city of David a Saviour , which is Christ the Lord .
text2: Ecen Dauid - en ciuitatean iayo çaiçuela Saluadorea , cein baita Christ Iauna .

text: And this shall be a sign unto you ; Ye shall find the babe wrapped in swaddling clothes , lying in a manger .
text2: Eta haur vkanen duçue seignale , eridenen baituçue haourra bandatoz trochatua , mangederán eçarria .

text: And suddenly there was with the angel a multitude of the heavenly host praising God , and saying ,
text2: Eta bertan Aingueruärequin eguin cedin armada celestial multzobat , laudatzen çutela Iaincoa , eta cioitela ,

text: Glory to God in the highest , and on earth peace , good will toward men .
text2: Gloria ceru guciz goretan Iaincoari , eta lurrean baque , guiçonac baithara vorondate ona .

text: And it came to pass , as the angels were gone away from them into heaven , the shepherds said one to another , Let us now go even unto Bethlehem , and see this thing which is come to pass , which the Lord hath made known unto us .
text2: Eta guertha cedin , hetaric Aingueruäc cerurat ioan ciradenean , erran baitzeçaten artzainec elkarren artean , Goacen bada Bethlehemerano , eta dacussagun eguin içan den gauça haur , cein Iaunac iaquin eraci baitraucu .

text: And they came with haste , and found Mary , and Joseph , and the babe lying in a manger .
text2: Eta ethor citecen lehiatuqui , eta eriden citzaten Maria eta Ioseph , eta haourtchoa mangederán eçarria .

text: And when they had seen it , they made known abroad the saying which was told them concerning this child .
text2: Eta ikussi vkan çutenean , publica ceçaten haourtchoaz erran içan çayena .

text: And all they that heard it wondered at those things which were told them by the shepherds .
text2: Eta ençun vkan cituzten guciéc mirets ceçaten hæy artzainéz erran içan çaizten gaucén gainean .

text: But Mary kept all these things , and pondered them in her heart .
text2: Eta Mariac beguiratzen cituen gauça hauc guciac , bere bihotzean ehaiten cituela .

text: And the shepherds returned , glorifying and praising God for all the things that they had heard and seen , as it was told unto them .
text2: Eta itzul citecen artzainac , glorificatzen eta laudatzen çutela Iaincoa , ençun eta ikussi vkan cituzten gauça guciéz , erran içan cayen beçala .

text: And when eight days were accomplished for the circumcising of the child , his name was called JESUS , which was so named of the angel before he was conceived in the womb .
text2: Eta complitu içan ciradenean haourtchoaren circonciditzeco çortzi egunac , orduan deithu içan da haren icena Iesus , nola deithu içan baitzén Aingueruäz , sabelean concebi cedin baino lehen .

text: And when the days of her purification according to the law of Moses were accomplished , they brought him to Jerusalem , to present him to the Lord ;
text2: Eta complitu içan ciradenean Mariaren purificationeco egunac Moysesen leguearen arauez , eraman ceçaten haourtchoa , Ierusalemera , Iaunari presenta lieçotençát .

text: ( As it is written in the law of the Lord , Every male that openeth the womb shall be called holy to the Lord ; )
text2: ( Nola baita scribatua Iaunaren Leguean , Ar vme - vncia irequiten duen gucia , saindu Iaunari deithuren çayó )

text: And to offer a sacrifice according to that which is said in the law of the Lord , A pair of turtledoves , or two young pigeons .
text2: Eta eman leçatençát oblationea , Iaunaren Leguean erran denaren araura , turturela pare - bat , edo bi vsso columba vme .

text: And , behold , there was a man in Jerusalem , whose name was Simeon ; and the same man was just and devout , waiting for the consolation of Israel : and the Holy Ghost was upon him .
text2: Eta huná , cen guiçombat Ierusalemen Simeon deitzen cenic : eta cen guiçon haur iusto eta Iaincoaren beldur , Israeleco consolationearen beguira cegoena : eta Spiritu saindua cen haren gainean .

text: And it was revealed unto him by the Holy Ghost , that he should not see death , before he had seen the Lord ' s Christ .
text2: Eta denuntiatu içan çayón diuinoqui Spiritu sainduaz , etzuela herioric ikussiren , non lehen ikus ezleçan Christ Iaunarena .

text: And he came by the Spirit into the temple : and when the parents brought in the child Jesus , to do for him after the custom of the law ,
text2: Hura bada ethor cedin Spirituaz mouituric templera : eta sartzen çutela Iesus haourra bere aita - améc , haren causaz eguin leçatencát Legueco costumaren araura :

text: Then took he him up in his arms , and blessed God , and said ,
text2: Harc orduan har ceçan hura bere bessoetara , eta lauda ceçan Iaincoa , eta erran ceçan ,

text: Lord , now lettest thou thy servant depart in peace , according to thy word :
text2: Iauna , orain vtziten duc eure cerbitzaria , eure hitzaren araura baquez .

text: For mine eyes have seen thy salvation ,
text2: Ecen ikussi dié ene beguiéc hire saluagarria ,

text: Which thou hast prepared before the face of all people ;
text2: Cein preparatu baituc populu gucién beguitharte aitzinean .

text: A light to lighten the Gentiles , and the glory of thy people Israel .
text2: Argui Gentiley arguitzecoa , eta Israeléco hire populuaren gloriá .

text: And Joseph and his mother marvelled at those things which were spoken of him .
text2: Eta haren aita eta ama miraz ceuden harçaz erraiten ciraden gaucéz .

text: And Simeon blessed them , and said unto Mary his mother , Behold , this child is set for the fall and rising again of many in Israel ; and for a sign which shall be spoken against ;
text2: Eta benedica citzan Simeonec , eta erran cieçón haren ama Mariari , Huná , eçarri içan dun haur anhitzen destructionetan , eta anhitzen resurrectionetan Israelen , eta signotan ceini nehor contrastaturen baitzayo :

text: ( Yea , a sword shall pierce through thy own soul also , ) that the thoughts of many hearts may be revealed .
text2: Are eurorren arima - ere iraganen din ezpata batec , aguer ditecençát anhitz bihotzetaco pensamenduac .

text: And there was one Anna , a prophetess , the daughter of Phanuel , of the tribe of Aser : she was of a great age , and had lived with an husband seven years from her virginity ;
text2: Bacén prophetessabat - ere Anna deitzen cenic Phanuel - en alaba , Aser - en leinuco , cein baitzén ia adin handitacoa , eta vici içan cen senharrarequin çazpi vrthez bere virginitateaz gueroztic .

text: And she was a widow of about fourscore and four years , which departed not from the temple , but served God with fastings and prayers night and day .
text2: Eta lauroguey eta laur vrtheren inguruco alharguna celaric , etzen partitzen templetic , barurez eta orationez cerbitzatzen çuela Iaincoa gau eta egun .

text: And she coming in that instant gave thanks likewise unto the Lord , and spake of him to all them that looked for redemption in Jerusalem .
text2: Hunec - ere bada ordu berean ethorriric , laudatzen çuen Iauna , eta harçaz minço çayen redemptionearen beguira Ierusalemen ceuden guciey .

text: And when they had performed all things according to the law of the Lord , they returned into Galilee , to their own city Nazareth .
text2: Eta acabatu çutenean gucia Iaunaren Leguearen araura , itzul citecen Galileara , bere Nazaretheco hirira .
