text2: Eta nigarrez ceuden guciac , eta lamentatzen çutén : baina harc erran ceçan , Eztaguiçuela nigarric : ezta hil , baina lo datza .

text: And they laughed him to scorn , knowing that she was dead .
text2: Eta truffatzen ciraden harçaz , hil cela iaquinez .

text: And he put them all out , and took her by the hand , and called , saying , Maid , arise .
text2: Eta harc , guciac campora iraitziric , eta haren escua harturic , oihu eguin ceçan , cioela , Nescatchá , iaiqui adi .

text: And her spirit came again , and she arose straightway : and he commanded to give her meat .
text2: Eta itzul cedin haren spiritua , eta iaiqui cedin bertan : eta mana ceçan eman lequión iatera .

text: And her parents were astonished : but he charged them that they should tell no man what was done .
text2: Eta spanta citecen haren aita - amác : baina harc mana citzan nehori ezlerroten eguin içan cena .

text: Then he called his twelve disciples together , and gave them power and authority over all devils , and to cure diseases .
text2: Guero deithuric elkarrequin bere hamabi discipuluac , eman ciecén bothere eta authoritate deabru gucién gainean , eta eritassunén sendatzeco .

text: And he sent them to preach the kingdom of God , and to heal the sick .
text2: Eta igor citzan hec Iaincoaren resumaren predicatzera , eta erién sendatzera .

text: And he said unto them , Take nothing for your journey , neither staves , nor scrip , neither bread , neither money ; neither have two coats apiece .
text2: Eta erran ciecén , Ezteçaçuela deus eraman bidecotzát , ez vheric , ez maletaric , ez oguiric , ez diruric , eta eztuçuela birá arropa .

text: And whatsoever house ye enter into , there abide , and thence depart .
text2: Eta cein - ere etchetan sarthuren baitzarete , han çaudete , eta handic ilki albaitzindezte .

text: And whosoever will not receive you , when ye go out of that city , shake off the very dust from your feet for a testimony against them .
text2: Eta norc - ere recebituren ezpaitzaituzte , ilkiric hiri hartaric , çuen oinetaco errhautsa - ere iharros eçaçue testimoniagetan hayén contra .

text: And they departed , and went through the towns , preaching the gospel , and healing every where .
text2: Hec bada ilkiric ioaiten ciraden burguz burgu , euangelizatzen eta sendatzen çutela leku gucietan .

text: Now Herod the tetrarch heard of all that was done by him : and he was perplexed , because that it was said of some , that John was risen from the dead ;
text2: Eta ençun citzan Herodes tetrarchac , harc eguiten cituen gauça guciac : eta dudatzen çuen , ceren batzuc erraiten baitzutén , ecen Ioannes hiletaric resuscitatu cela .

text: And of some , that Elias had appeared ; and of others , that one of the old prophets was risen again .
text2: Eta batzuc Elias aguertu cela : eta bercéc , cembeit lehenagoco Prophetaric resuscitatu cela .

text: And Herod said , John have I beheaded : but who is this , of whom I hear such things ? And he desired to see him .
text2: Orduan dio Herodesec , Ioannesi nic buruä edequi draucat : nor da bada haur , ceinez nic baitançuzquit hunelaco gauçac ? Eta hura ikussi nahiz çabilan .

text: And the apostles , when they were returned , told him all that they had done . And he took them , and went aside privately into a desert place belonging to the city called Bethsaida .
text2: Eta itzuliric Apostoluéc conta cietzoten Iesusi , eguin cituzten gauça guciac . Orduan hec harturic retira cedin Iesus appart . Bethsaida deitzen den hirico leku desertu batetara .

text: And the people , when they knew it , followed him : and he received them , and spake unto them of the kingdom of God , and healed them that had need of healing .
text2: Eta gendetzeac hori iaquinic , iarreiqui çaizcan , eta recebitu cituenean , minçatzen çayen Iaincoaren resumáz : eta sendatu behar çutenac , sendatzen cituen .

text: And when the day began to wear away , then came the twelve , and said unto him , Send the multitude away , that they may go into the towns and country round about , and lodge , and get victuals : for we are here in a desert place .
text2: Eta eguna has cedin beheratzen : eta hurbilduric hamabiéc erran cieçoten , Eyéc congit gendetzey , ioanic inguruco burguètara eta parropioetara , retira ditecen , eta eriden deçaten iateco , ecen hemen leku desertuan gaituc .

text: But he said unto them , Give ye them to eat . And they said , We have no more but five loaves and two fishes ; except we should go and buy meat for all this people .
text2: Baina erran ciecén , Eyeçue çuec iatera . Eta hec erran ceçaten , Eztitiagu borz ogui eta bi arrain baina guehiago : Baldin guc ioanic populu hunen guciaren eros ezpadeçagu iateco .

text: For they were about five thousand men . And he said to his disciples , Make them sit down by fifties in a company .
text2: Ecen baciraden borz milla guiçonetarano . Orduan dioste bere discipuluey , Iar eraci itzaçue mahaindaraz berroguey eta hamarná .

text: And they did so , and made them all sit down .
text2: Eta hala eguin ceçaten , eta iar citecen guciac .

text: Then he took the five loaves and the two fishes , and looking up to heaven , he blessed them , and brake , and gave to the disciples to set before the multitude .
text2: Orduan harturic borz oguiac eta bi arrainac , cerurat beha cegoela benedica citzan hec : eta hauts citzan , eta eman cietzén discipuluey , populuaren aitzinean eçar litzatençát .

text: And they did eat , and were all filled : and there was taken up of fragments that remained to them twelve baskets .
text2: Ian ceçaten bada guciéc , eta ressasia citecen : eta goititu içan dirade soberatu içan çaizten çathietaric hamabi sasquitara .

text: And it came to pass , as he was alone praying , his disciples were with him : and he asked them , saying , Whom say the people that I am ?
text2: Eta guertha cedin , hura appart othoitz eguiten cegoela , discipuluac harequin baitziraden eta interroga baitzitzan hec , cioela , Ni nor naicela dioite gendec ?

text: They answering said , John the Baptist ; but some say , Elias ; and others say , that one of the old prophets is risen again .
text2: Eta hec ihardesten çutela erran ceçaten , Ioannes Baptista : eta bercéc , Elias : eta bercéc , ecen cembeit Propheta lehenagocoetaric resuscitatu içan dela .

text: He said unto them , But whom say ye that I am ? Peter answering said , The Christ of God .
text2: Eta erran ciecén , Eta çuec nor naicela ni dioçue ? Ihardesten çuela Simon Pierrisec erran ceçan , Christ Iaincoarena .

text: And he straitly charged them , and commanded them to tell no man that thing ;
text2: Orduan harc mehatchatzen cituelaric mana citzan nehori haur ezlerroten :

text: Saying , The Son of man must suffer many things , and be rejected of the elders and chief priests and scribes , and be slain , and be raised the third day .
text2: Cioela , Behar da guiçonaren Semeac anhitz suffri deçan , eta reproba dadin Ancianoéz eta Sacrificadore principaléz , eta Scribez , eta hil dadin , eta hereneco egunean resuscita dadin .

text: And he said to them all , If any man will come after me , let him deny himself , and take up his cross daily , and follow me .
text2: Guero erraiten cerauen guciey . Baldin nehor hor ene ondoan ethorri nahi bada , renuntia beça bere buruaz , eta har beça bere crutzea egun oroz , eta berrait niri .

text: For whosoever will save his life shall lose it : but whosoever will lose his life for my sake , the same shall save it .
text2: Ecen norc - ere nahi vkanen baitu saluatu bere vicia : galduren du hura : baina norc - ere galduren baitu bere vicia ene causaz , saluaturen du hura .

text: For what is a man advantaged , if he gain the whole world , and lose himself , or be cast away ?
text2: Ecen cer probetchu du guiçonac baldin mundu gucia irabaz badeça , eta bere buruä destrui deçan , eta gal dadin ?

text: For whosoever shall be ashamed of me and of my words , of him shall the Son of man be ashamed , when he shall come in his own glory , and in his Father ' s , and of the holy angels .
text2: Ecen nor - ere ahalque içanen baita niçaz eta ene hitzéz , harçaz ahalque içanen da guiçonaren Semea , dathorrenean bere maiestatean , eta Aitarenean eta Aingueru sainduenean .

text: But I tell you of a truth , there be some standing here , which shall not taste of death , till they see the kingdom of God .
text2: Eta erraiten drauçuet eguiaz , badirade hemen present diradenotaric batzu , herioa dastaturen eztutenic Iaincoaren resumá ikus deçaqueteno .

text: And it came to pass about an eight days after these sayings , he took Peter and John and James , and went up into a mountain to pray .
text2: Eta guertha cedin , hitz hauçaz gueroztic quasi çortzi egunen buruän , har baitzitzan Pierris eta Ioannes eta Iacques , eta igan baitzedin mendi batetara othoitz eguitera .

text: And as he prayed , the fashion of his countenance was altered , and his raiment was white and glistering .
text2: Eta othoitz eguiten cegoela , haren beguitharteco formá mutha cedin , eta haren abillamendua churit eta chist - mista beçain arguit .

text: And , behold , there talked with him two men , which were Moses and Elias :
text2: Eta huná , bi guiçon minço ciraden harequin , cein baitziraden Moyses eta Elias :

text: Who appeared in glory , and spake of his decease which he should accomplish at Jerusalem .
text2: Hauc aguerturic gloriarequin , erraiten çutén , harc Ierusalemen complitzeco çuen fina .

text: But Peter and they that were with him were heavy with sleep : and when they were awake , they saw his glory , and the two men that stood with him .
text2: Eta Pierris , eta harequin ciradenac , ciraden logalez cargatuac : eta iratzartu ciradenean , ikus ceçaten haren maiestatea , eta harequin ceuden bi guiçonac .

text: And it came to pass , as they departed from him , Peter said unto Jesus , Master , it is good for us to be here : and let us make three tabernacles ; one for thee , and one for Moses , and one for Elias : not knowing what he said .
text2: Eta guertha cedin , hec partitu ciradenean harenganic : Pierrisec erran baitzieçón Iesusi , Magistruá , on duc gu hemen garen , eguin ditzagun bada hirur tabernacle , bat hire , eta bat Moysesen , eta bat Eliasen : Etzaquiala cer minço cen .

text: While he thus spake , there came a cloud , and overshadowed them : and they feared as they entered into the cloud .
text2: Eta harc gauça hauc erraiten cituela , eguin cedin hodeybat , eta estal citzan hec : eta ici citecen hodeyean sartzen ciradenean .

text: And there came a voice out of the cloud , saying , This is my beloved Son : hear him .
text2: Orduan vozbat eguin cedin hodeyetic , cioela , Haur da ene Seme maitea , huni beha çaquizquiote .

text: And when the voice was past , Jesus was found alone . And they kept it close , and told no man in those days any of those things which they had seen .
text2: Eta voz hura eguiten cela , eriden cedin Iesus bera : eta hec ichilic egon citecen , eta egun hetan etzieçoten nehori deus erran ikussi cituzten gaucetaric .

text: And it came to pass , that on the next day , when they were come down from the hill , much people met him .
text2: Eta guertha cedin ondoco egunean , hec menditic iautsi ciradenean , gendetze handibat encontrura ilki baitzequion hari .

text: And , behold , a man of the company cried out , saying , Master , I beseech thee , look upon my son : for he is mine only child .
text2: Eta huná , compainiaco guiçombat oihuz iar cedin , cioela , Magistruá , othoitz eguiten drauat beha - eçac ene semeaganát : ecen haur bera baicen eztiat .

text: And , lo , a spirit taketh him , and he suddenly crieth out ; and it teareth him that he foameth again , and bruising him hardly departeth from him .
text2: Eta huná , spirituac hartzen dic , eta bertan heyagoraz iarten duc , eta çathicatzen dic haguna dariola , eta huneganic nequez partitzen duc , haur hausten duela .

text: And I besought thy disciples to cast him out ; and they could not .
text2: Eta othoitz eguin diraueat hire discipuluey , egotz leçaten hura campora : baina ecin eguin dié .

text: And Jesus answering said , O faithless and perverse generation , how long shall I be with you , and suffer you ? Bring thy son hither .
text2: Eta ihardesten duela Iesusec dio , O natione incredula eta gaichtoá , noizdrano finean çuequin içanen naiz eta supportaturen çaituztet ? Ekarrac huna eure semea .

text: And as he was yet a coming , the devil threw him down , and tare him . And Jesus rebuked the unclean spirit , and healed the child , and delivered him again to his father .
text2: Eta oraino hurbiltzen cela hauts ceçan hura deabruac eta çathica : eta mehatcha ceçan Iesusec spiritu satsua , eta senda ceçan haourra , eta renda cieçón bere aitari .

text: And they were all amazed at the mighty power of God . But while they wondered every one at all things which Jesus did , he said unto his disciples ,
text2: Eta spanta citecen guciac Iaincoaren verthute gucizco handiaren gainean . Eta guciac miraculuz ceudela , eguiten cituen gauça gucién gainean , erran ciecén bere discipuluey ,

text: Let these sayings sink down into your ears : for the Son of man shall be delivered into the hands of men .
text2: Eçar itzaçue çuec hitz hauc çuen beharrietan : ecen içanen da guiçonaren Semea liuraturen baita guiçonén escuetara .

text: But they understood not this saying , and it was hid from them , that they perceived it not : and they feared to ask him of that saying .
text2: Baina hec hitz haur etzuten aditzen , eta hetaric estalia cen , hala non ezpaitzutén hura senditzen : eta beldur ciraden haren interrogatzera hitz huneçaz .

text: Then there arose a reasoning among them , which of them should be greatest .
text2: Guero sar citecen elkarrequin dispután , eya hetaric cein cen handiena .

text: And Jesus , perceiving the thought of their heart , took a child , and set him by him ,
text2: Eta Iesusec hayén bihotzeco pensamendua ikussi çuenean , haourtchobat harturic eçar ceçan bere aldean :

text: And said unto them , Whosoever shall receive this child in my name receiveth me : and whosoever shall receive me receiveth him that sent me : for he that is least among you all , the same shall be great .
text2: Eta erran ciecén , Norc - ere recebituren baitu haourtcho haur ene icenean , ni recebitzen nau : eta norc - ere ni recebituren bainau , ni igorri nauena recebitzen du : ecen nor baita chipiena çuen gucion artean , hura içanen da handi .

text: And John answered and said , Master , we saw one casting out devils in thy name ; and we forbad him , because he followeth not with us .
text2: Eta ihardesten çuela Ioannesec erran ceçan , Magistruá , ikussi diagu norbeit hire icenean deabruac campora egoizten cituenic : eta debetatu diagu hura , ceren ezpaitarreic gurequin hiri .

text: And Jesus said unto him , Forbid him not : for he that is not against us is for us .
text2: Orduan erran cieçón Iesusec , Ezteçaçuela debeta , ecen gure contra eztena gure alde da .

text: And it came to pass , when the time was come that he should be received up , he stedfastly set his face to go to Jerusalem ,
text2: Eta guertha cedin , haren goiti altchatzeco egunac complitzen ciradenean , orduan chuchent baitzeçan bere beguithartea gogo eguinic Ierusalemera ioaitera .

text: And sent messengers before his face : and they went , and entered into a village of the Samaritans , to make ready for him .
text2: Eta igor citzan mandatariac bere aitzinean , eta ioanic sar citecen Samaritanoén burgu batetan , ostatu appain lieçotençát :

text: And they did not receive him , because his face was as though he would go to Jerusalem .
text2: Baina etzeçaten recebi , ceren haren beguithartea baitzén Ierusalemerat ioiten cenarena .

text: And when his disciples James and John saw this , they said , Lord , wilt thou that we command fire to come down from heaven , and consume them , even as Elias did ?
text2: Eta hori ikussiric haren discipulu Iacquesec eta Ioannesec erran ceçaten , Iauna , nahi duc derragun sua iauts dadin cerutic , eta deseguin ditzan , Eliasec - ere eguin çuen beçala ?

text: But he turned , and rebuked them , and said , Ye know not what manner of spirit ye are of .
text2: Baina itzuliric Iesusec mehatcha citzan hec , cioela , Eztaquiçue cer spiritutaco çareten .

text: For the Son of man is not come to destroy men ' s lives , but to save them . And they went to another village .
text2: Ecen guiçonaren Semea ezta ethorri guiçonén vicién galtzera , baina saluatzera . Eta ioan citecen berce burgu batetara .

text: And it came to pass , that , as they went in the way , a certain man said unto him , Lord , I will follow thee whithersoever thou goest .
text2: Guero guertha cedin , hec bideaz ioaiten ciradela , erran baitzieçón norbeitec , Iauna , iarreiquiren natzaic norat - ere ioanen baitaiz .

text: And Jesus said unto him , Foxes have holes , and birds of the air have nests ; but the Son of man hath not where to lay his head .
text2: Eta Iesusec erran cieçon . Aceriéc çulhoac citié , eta ceruco choriéc ohatzeac : baina guiçonaren Semeac eztic non bere buruä paussa deçan .

text: And he said unto another , Follow me . But he said , Lord , suffer me first to go and bury my father .
text2: Baina erran cieçón berce bati , Arreit niri . Eta harc erran ceçan , Iauna , permetti ieçadac behin ioan nadin neure aitaren ohorztera .

text: Jesus said unto him , Let the dead bury their dead : but go thou and preach the kingdom of God .
text2: Eta erran cieçón Iesusec , Vtzitzac , hilac bere hilén ohorztera : baina hi habil eta denuntia eçac Iaincoaren resumá .

text: And another also said , Lord , I will follow thee ; but let me first go bid them farewell , which are at home at my house .
text2: Orduan erran ceçan berce batec - ere , Iauna , Iarreiquiren natzaic hiri : baina permetti ieçadac behin etchecoetaric congit har deçadan .

text: And Jesus said unto him , No man , having put his hand to the plough , and looking back , is fit for the kingdom of God .
text2: Eta erran cieçón Iesusec , Eztuc nehor bere escua goldean eçarten eta guibelerat behatzen duenic propio denic Iaincoaren resumacotzat .

text: After these things the Lord appointed other seventy also , and sent them two and two before his face into every city and place , whither he himself would come .
text2: Gauça hauen ondoan ordena citzan Iaunac berce hiruroguey eta hamar - ere , eta igor citzan hec birá bere beguitharte aitzinean , bera ethorteco cen hiri eta leku gucietara .

text: Therefore said he unto them , The harvest truly is great , but the labourers are few : pray ye therefore the Lord of the harvest , that he would send forth labourers into his harvest .
text2: Eta erraiten cerauen , Vztá handi da , baina languile guti : othoitz eguioçue bada vzta Iabeari , irion ditzan languileac bere vztara .

text: Go your ways : behold , I send you forth as lambs among wolves .
text2: Çoazte , huná nic igorten çaituztet çuec bildotsac otsoén artera beçala .

text: Carry neither purse , nor scrip , nor shoes : and salute no man by the way .
text2: Eztramaçuela ez mulsaric , ez maletaric , ez çapataric : eta nehor bidean ezteçaçuela saluta .

text: And into whatsoever house ye enter , first say , Peace be to this house .
text2: Cein - ere etchetan sarthuren baitzarete , lehenic erraçue , Baquea dela etche hunetan .

text: And if the son of peace be there , your peace shall rest upon it : if not , it shall turn to you again .
text2: Eta baldin han baquezco semeric batre bada , paussaturen da çuen baquea haren gainean : ezpere çuetara itzuliren da .

text: And in the same house remain , eating and drinking such things as they give : for the labourer is worthy of his hire . Go not from house to house .
text2: Eta etche hartan berean çaudete , iaten eta edaten duçuela aitzinera emanen çaiçuenetic : ecen languilea bere sariaren digne da . Etzaiteztela iragan etchetic etchera .

text: And into whatsoever city ye enter , and they receive you , eat such things as are set before you :
text2: Baina are cein - ere hiritan sarthuren baitzarete , eta recebituren baitzaituzte , ian eçaçue aitzinera eçarten çaizquiçuenetaric :

text: And heal the sick that are therein , and say unto them , The kingdom of God is come nigh unto you .
text2: Eta sendaitzaçue hartan diraten eriac , eta erreçue , Hurbildu da çuetara Iaincoaren resumá .

text: But into whatsoever city ye enter , and they receive you not , go your ways out into the streets of the same , and say ,
text2: Baina cein - ere hiritan sarthuren baitzarete , eta ezpaitzaituzte recebituren , ilkiric hango carriquetara , erraçue ,

text: Even the very dust of your city , which cleaveth on us , we do wipe off against you : notwithstanding be ye sure of this , that the kingdom of God is come nigh unto you .
text2: Çuen hiritic lothu çaicun errhautsa - ere iharrosten dugu çuen contra : guciagatic - ere haur iaquiçue , ecen hurbildu dela çuetara Iaincoaren resumá .

text: But I say unto you , that it shall be more tolerable in that day for Sodom , than for that city .
text2: Baina badiotsuet ecen Sodomacoac egun hartan hiri hura baino emequiago tractatuac içanen diradela .

text: Woe unto thee , Chorazin ! woe unto thee , Bethsaida ! for if the mighty works had been done in Tyre and Sidon , which have been done in you , they had a great while ago repented , sitting in sackcloth and ashes .
text2: Maledictione hiri Chorazin , maledictione hiri Bethsaida , ecen baldin Tyren eta Sidonen eguin içan balirade çuec baithan eguin içan diraden verthuteac , aspaldi çacurequin eta hautsequin iarriric emendatu ciratequeen .

text: But it shall be more tolerable for Tyre and Sidon at the judgment , than for you .
text2: Halacotz Tyr eta Sidon emequiago tractatuac içanen dirade iudicioan ecen ez çuec .

text: And thou , Capernaum , which art exalted to heaven , shalt be thrust down to hell .
text2: Eta hi Capernaum cerurano altchatu içan aicena , iffernurano beheraturen aiz .

text: He that heareth you heareth me ; and he that despiseth you despiseth me ; and he that despiseth me despiseth him that sent me .
text2: Çuec ençuten çaituztenac , ni ençuten nau : eta çuec iraizten çaituztenac , ni iraizten nau : eta ni iraizten nauenac , ni igorri nauena iraizten du .

text: And the seventy returned again with joy , saying , Lord , even the devils are subject unto us through thy name .
text2: Eta itzuli içan dirade hiruroguey eta hamarrac bozcariorequin , cioitela , Iauna , deabruac - ere suiet eguiten ciaizquiguc hire icenean :

text: And he said unto them , I beheld Satan as lightning fall from heaven .
text2: Eta erran ciecén , Ikusten nuen Satan chistmista beçala cerutic erorten .

text: Behold , I give unto you power to tread on serpents and scorpions , and over all the power of the enemy : and nothing shall by any means hurt you .
text2: Huná , badrauçuet bothere suguén eta scorpionén gainean ebilteco , eta etsayaren puissança guciaren gainean : eta deussec eztrauçue calteric eguinen .

text: Notwithstanding in this rejoice not , that the spirits are subject unto you ; but rather rejoice , because your names are written in heaven .
text2: Ordea harçaz etzaiteztela aleguera , ceren spirituac suiet eguiten çaizquiçuen : baina aitzitic aleguera çaitezte , ceren çuen icenac scribatuac baitirade ceruètan .

text: In that hour Jesus rejoiced in spirit , and said , I thank thee , O Father , Lord of heaven and earth , that thou hast hid these things from the wise and prudent , and hast revealed them unto babes : even so , Father ; for so it seemed good in thy sight .
text2: Ordu hartan berean aleguera cedin Iesus spirituz , eta erran ceçan , Aitá , ceruco eta lurreco Iauná , esquerrac rendatzen drauzquiat , ceren estali baitrauztec gauça hauc çuhurréy eta adituey , eta manifestatu baitrauztec haour chipiey : bay Aitá , ceren hala içan baita hire placer ona .

text: All things are delivered to me of my Father : and no man knoweth who the Son is , but the Father ; and who the Father is , but the Son , and he to whom the Son will reveal him .
text2: Orduan discipuluetarat itzuliric erran ceçan , Gauça guciac niri neure Aitaz eman çaizquit , eta nehorc eztaqui nor den Semea , Aitác baicen : eta nor den Aita , Semeac baicen , eta nori - ere Semeac manifestatu nahi vkanen baitrauca .

text: And he turned him unto his disciples , and said privately , Blessed are the eyes which see the things that ye see :
text2: Eta discipuluetarat itzuliric , appart erran ciecén , Dohatsu dirade çuec dacusquiçuen gauçac dacusquiten beguiac .

text: For I tell you , that many prophets and kings have desired to see those things which ye see , and have not seen them ; and to hear those things which ye hear , and have not heard them .
text2: Ecen erraiten drauçuet , anhitz Prophetac eta reguec desiratu vkan dutela çuec ikusten dituçuen gaucén ikustera , eta ezpaitituzte ikussi : eta ençuten dituçuen gaucén ençutera , eta ezpaitituzte ençun .

text: And , behold , a certain lawyer stood up , and tempted him , saying , Master , what shall I do to inherit eternal life ?
text2: Orduan huná , Legueco doctorbat iaiqui cedin , hura tentatzen çuela , eta cioela , Magistruá , cer eguinez vicitze eternala heretaturen dut ?

text: He said unto him , What is written in the law ? how readest thou ?
text2: Eta harc erran cieçón , Leguean cer da scribatua ? nola iracurtzen duc ?

text: And he answering said , Thou shalt love the Lord thy God with all thy heart , and with all thy soul , and with all thy strength , and with all thy mind ; and thy neighbour as thyself .
text2: Eta harc ihardesten çuela erran ceçan , Onhetsiren duc eure Iainco Iauna eure bihotz guciaz , eta eure arima guciaz , eta eure indar guciaz , eta eure pensamendu guciaz : eta eure hurcoa eure buruä beçala .

text: And he said unto him , Thou hast answered right : this do , and thou shalt live .
text2: Orduan erran cieçón , Vngui ihardetsi duc : hori eguic eta vicico aiz .

text: But he , willing to justify himself , said unto Jesus , And who is my neighbour ?
text2: Baina harc bere buruä iustificatu nahiz , erran cieçón Iesusi , Eta nor da ene hurcoa ?

text: And Jesus answering said , A certain man went down from Jerusalem to Jericho , and fell among thieves , which stripped him of his raiment , and wounded him , and departed , leaving him half dead .
text2: Eta ihardesten çuela Iesusec erran ceçan , Guiçombat iausten cen Ierusalemetic Iericora , eta eror cedin gaichtaguinén artera , eta hec hura billuciric , eta çaurthuric ioan citecen , hura erdi hilic vtziric .

text: And by chance there came down a certain priest that way : and when he saw him , he passed by on the other side .
text2: Eta encontruz Sacrificadorebat iauts cedin bide harçaz beraz : eta hura ikussiric berce aldetic iragan cedin .

text: And likewise a Levite , when he was at the place , came and looked on him , and passed by on the other side .
text2: Halaber Leuitabat - ere leku hartara helduric eta hura ikussiric , berce aldetic iragan cedin .

text: But a certain Samaritan , as he journeyed , came where he was : and when he saw him , he had compassion on him ,
text2: Baina Samaritanobat bere bidea iragaiten çuela , ethor cedin harengana , eta hura ikussiric compassione har ceçan .

text: And went to him , and bound up his wounds , pouring in oil and wine , and set him on his own beast , and brought him to an inn , and took care of him .
text2: Eta hurbilduric lot citzan haren çauriac , emanic olio eta mahatsarno , eta hura eçarriric bere abrearen gainean , eraman ceçan ostaleriara , eta pensa ceçan .

text: And on the morrow when he departed , he took out two pence , and gave them to the host , and said unto him , Take care of him ; and whatsoever thou spendest more , when I come again , I will repay thee .
text2: Biharamunean partitzean idoquiric bi dinero eman cietzón ostatuari , eta erran cieçón , Errequeitu emóc huni , eta cer - ere guehiago despendaturen baituc , nic itzul nadinean rendaturen drauat .

text: Which now of these three , thinkest thou , was neighbour unto him that fell among the thieves ?
text2: Cein bada hirur hautaric irudi çaic gaichtaguinetara erori içan denaren hurco içan dela ?

text: And he said , He that shewed mercy on him . Then said Jesus unto him , Go , and do thou likewise .
text2: Eta harc erran cieçón , Hari misericordia eguin vkan draucana . Diotsa bada Iesusec , Oha , hic - ere eguic halaber .

text: Now it came to pass , as they went , that he entered into a certain village : and a certain woman named Martha received him into her house .
text2: Eta guertha cedin hec ioaiten ciradela , hura sar baitzedin burgu batetan : eta emazte , Martha deitzen cen batec recebi ceçan hura bere etchera .

text: And she had a sister called Mary , which also sat at Jesus ' feet , and heard his word .
text2: Eta hunec çuen ahizpabat Maria deitzen cenic , harc - ere Iesusen oinetara iarriric cegoela , haren hitza ençuten çuen .

text: But Martha was cumbered about much serving , and came to him , and said , Lord , dost thou not care that my sister hath left me to serve alone ? bid her therefore that she help me .
text2: Baina Martha eguitecotan cen anhitz cerbitzuren eguiten : eta gueldituric erran ceçan , Iauna , eztuc hic ansiaric ceren neure ahizpác neuror cerbitzatzera vtziten nauen ? erroc bada ni aldiz aiuta neçan .

text: And Jesus answered and said unto her , Martha , Martha , thou art careful and troubled about many things :
text2: Eta ihardesten çuela erran cieçón Iesusec , Martha , Martha , arrangura dun , eta tormentatzen aiz anhitz gauçaren ondoan :

text: But one thing is needful : and Mary hath chosen that good part , which shall not be taken away from her .
text2: Ordea gauçabat dun necessarió . Baina Mariac parte ona hautatu din , cein ezpaitzayo edequiren .

text: And it came to pass , that , as he was praying in a certain place , when he ceased , one of his disciples said unto him , Lord , teach us to pray , as John also taught his disciples .
text2: Guertha cedin halaber leku batetan othoitz eguiten cegoela , cessatu cenean , erran baitzieçón bere discipuluetaric batec , Iauna , iracats ieçaguc othoitz eguiten , Ioannesec - ere bere discipuluey iracatsi drauen beçala .

text: And he said unto them , When ye pray , say , Our Father which art in heaven , Hallowed be thy name . Thy kingdom come . Thy will be done , as in heaven , so in earth .
text2: Eta erran ciecén , Othoitz eguiten duçuenean , erran eçaçue , Gure Aita ceruètan aicena , Sanctifica bedi hire icena , Ethor bedi hire resumá , Eguin bedi hire vorondatea , ceruän beçala , lurrean - ere .

text: Give us day by day our daily bread .
text2: Gure eguneco oguia iguc egunecotzat .

text: And forgive us our sins ; for we also forgive every one that is indebted to us . And lead us not into temptation ; but deliver us from evil .
text2: Eta barka ietzaguc gure bekatuac : ecen guc - ere barkatzen dirauèagu guri çor draucuten guciey . Eta ezgaitzala sar eraci tentacionetan , baina deliura gaitzac gaichtotic .

text: And he said unto them , Which of you shall have a friend , and shall go unto him at midnight , and say unto him , Friend , lend me three loaves ;
text2: Eta erran ciecén , Cein da çuetaric vkanen duena adisquidebat , eta ioanen dena harengana gau - erditan eta erranen draucana , Adisquideá , presta ietzadac hirur ogui :

text: For a friend of mine in his journey is come to me , and I have nothing to set before him ?
text2: Ecen ene adisquidebat ethorri içan duc bidetic enegana , eta eztiát cer aitzinean eçar dieçodan .

text: And he from within shall answer and say , Trouble me not : the door is now shut , and my children are with me in bed ; I cannot rise and give thee .
text2: Eta harc barnetic ihardesten duela erran deçan , Ezneçála fascha : ia borthá ertsia duc , eta ene haourtchoac enequila dituc ohean : ecin iaiqui niaitec hiri emaitera .

text: I say unto you , Though he will not rise and give him , because he is his friend , yet because of his importunity he will rise and give him as many as he needeth .
text2: Erraiten drauçuet , baldin iaiquiric eman ezpadieço - ere , ceren haren adisquide den : halere haren muthiritassunagatic iaiquiric emanén drauca cembat - ere behar baitu .

text: And I say unto you , Ask , and it shall be given you ; seek , and ye shall find ; knock , and it shall be opened unto you .
text2: Eta nic erraiten drauçuet , Esca çaitezte , eta emanen çaiçue : bilhaeçaçue , eta eridenen duçue : bulka eçaçue eta irequiren çaiçue .

text: For every one that asketh receiveth ; and he that seeketh findeth ; and to him that knocketh it shall be opened .
text2: Ecen escatzen den guciac recebitzen du : eta bilhatzen duenac erideiten du : eta bulkatzen duenari , irequiren çayo .

text: If a son shall ask bread of any of you that is a father , will he give him a stone ? or if he ask a fish , will he for a fish give him a serpent ?
text2: Eta cein da çuetaric aitá , semea ogui esca badaquió , harribat emanen draucana ? edo baldin arrain esca badaquio , ala arrainaren lekuan suguebat emanen drauca ?

text: Or if he shall ask an egg , will he offer him a scorpion ?
text2: Edo baldin arraultze baten esca badadi , ala scorpiona emanen drauca ?

text: If ye then , being evil , know how to give good gifts unto your children : how much more shall your heavenly Father give the Holy Spirit to them that ask him ?
text2: Beraz çuec baldin gaichto çaretelaric , badaquiçue gauça onén çuen haourrey emaiten , cembatez guehiago çuen Aita celestialac emanen draue Spiritu saindua escaturen çaizconey .

text: And he was casting out a devil , and it was dumb . And it came to pass , when the devil was gone out , the dumb spake ; and the people wondered .
text2: Orduan egotz ceçan campora deabrubat , eta hura cen mutu : eta guertha cedin , deabrua ilki cenean , minça baitzedin mutua : eta mirets ceçaten gendetzéc .

text: But some of them said , He casteth out devils through Beelzebub the chief of the devils .
text2: Eta hetaric batzuc erran ceçaten , Beelzebub deabruén princearen partez egoizten ditu campora deabruac .

text: And others , tempting him , sought of him a sign from heaven .
text2: Eta berceac tentatzen çutela , signo cerutic esquez çaizcan .

text: But he , knowing their thoughts , said unto them , Every kingdom divided against itself is brought to desolation ; and a house divided against a house falleth .
text2: Baina harc nola baitzequizquian hayén pensamenduac , erran ciecén , Bere contra partitua den resuma gucia , deseguiten da : eta etche bere contra partitua erorten da .

text: If Satan also be divided against himself , how shall his kingdom stand ? because ye say that I cast out devils through Beelzebub .
text2: Eta baldin Satan - ere bere contra partitua bada , nolatan haren resumá egonen da ? ecen badioçue Beelzebub - en partez campora egoizten ditudala nic deabruac .

text: And if I by Beelzebub cast out devils , by whom do your sons cast them out ? therefore shall they be your judges .
text2: Eta baldin nic Beelzebub - en partez campora egoizten baditut deabruac , çuen seméc noren partez campora egoizten dituzte ? halacotz hec içanen dirade çuen iuge .

text: But if I with the finger of God cast out devils , no doubt the kingdom of God is come upon you .
text2: Baina baldin Iaincoaren erhiaz campora egoizten baditut deabruac , segur heldu içan da çuetara Iaincoaren resumá .

text: When a strong man armed keepeth his palace , his goods are in peace :
text2: Guiçon borthiz harmatu batec beguiratzen duenean bere iaureguia , baquean dirade harc dituen gauçác .

text: But when a stronger than he shall come upon him , and overcome him , he taketh from him all his armour wherein he trusted , and divideth his spoils .
text2: Baina bera baino borhitzago batec acomettaturic garait badeça , haren harmadura gucia , ceinetan fida baitzén , edequiten du , eta haren ostillamendua distribuitzen .

text: He that is not with me is against me : and he that gathereth not with me scattereth .
text2: Enequin eztena ene contra da : eta enequin biltzen ari eztena barreyatzen ari da ,

text: When the unclean spirit is gone out of a man , he walketh through dry places , seeking rest ; and finding none , he saith , I will return unto my house whence I came out .
text2: Spiritu satsua ilki denean cembeit guiçonaganic leku leihorréz dabila , paussu bilha : eta erideiten eztuenean , dio , Itzuliren naiz neure etchera nondic ilki içan bainaiz .

text: And when he cometh , he findeth it swept and garnished .
text2: Eta ethorriric erideiten du hura escobatua eta appaindua .

text: Then goeth he , and taketh to him seven other spirits more wicked than himself ; and they enter in , and dwell there : and the last state of that man is worse than the first .
text2: Eta orduan ioaiten da , eta hartzen ditu berceric çazpi spiritu bera baino gaichtoagoac : eta sarthuric habitatzen dirade han : eta eguiten da guiçon haren azquen conditionea lehena baino gaichtoago .

text: And it came to pass , as he spake these things , a certain woman of the company lifted up her voice , and said unto him , Blessed is the womb that bare thee , and the paps which thou hast sucked .
text2: Eta guertha cedin gauça hauc erraiten cituela , altchaturic voza emazte batec populuaren artetic , erran baitzieçón , Dohatsu dituc hi egari auen sabela , eta hic edosqui dituán vgatzac .

text: But he said , Yea rather , blessed are they that hear the word of God , and keep it .
text2: Eta harc erran ceçan , Baina aitzitic dohatsu dirade Iaincoaren hitza ençuten , eta hura beguiratzen dutenac .

text: And when the people were gathered thick together , he began to say , This is an evil generation : they seek a sign ; and there shall no sign be given it , but the sign of Jonas the prophet .
text2: Eta gendetzeac biltzen ciradela , has cedin erraiten , Generatione haur gaichtoa da : signo esquez dago : baina signoric etzayó emanen Ionas prophetaren signoa baicen .

text: For as Jonas was a sign unto the Ninevites , so shall also the Son of man be to this generation .
text2: Ecen nola Ionas Niniuacoey signo içan baitzayen , hala içanen çayó guiçonaren Semea - ere generatione huni .

text: The queen of the south shall rise up in the judgment with the men of this generation , and condemn them : for she came from the utmost parts of the earth to hear the wisdom of Solomon ; and , behold , a greater than Solomon is here .
text2: Egu - erdi aldeco reguina iaiquiren da iudicioan generatione hunetaco guiçonequin , eta condenaturen ditu : ceren ethor baitzedin lurraren bazterretic Salomonen sapientiaren ençutera : eta huná , Salomon bainoagoa leku hunetan :

text: The men of Nineve shall rise up in the judgment with this generation , and shall condemn it : for they repented at the preaching of Jonas ; and , behold , a greater than Jonas is here .
text2: Niniuaco guiçonac iaiquiren dirade iudicioan generatione hunequin , eta condemnaturen duté : ceren Ionasen predicationera emenda baitzitecen : eta huná , Ionas bainoagoa leku hunetan .

text: No man , when he hath lighted a candle , putteth it in a secret place , neither under a bushel , but on a candlestick , that they which come in may see the light .
text2: Eta nehorc candela irachequia eztu leku estalian eçarten , ez gaitzurupean : baina candelerean , sartzen diradenéc arguia ikus deçatençat .

text: The light of the body is the eye : therefore when thine eye is single , thy whole body also is full of light ; but when thine eye is evil , thy body also is full of darkness .
text2: Gorputzaren candelá , beguia da : beraz baldin hire beguia simple bada , hire gorputz gucia ere argui duquec : baina gaichto bada , hire gorputza - ere ilhun duquec .

text: Take heed therefore that the light which is in thee be not darkness .
text2: Considera eçac bada hitan den arguia ilhumbe eztén .

text: If thy whole body therefore be full of light , having no part dark , the whole shall be full of light , as when the bright shining of a candle doth give thee light .
text2: Beraz baldin hire gorputz gucia argui bada , parteric batre ilhunic eztuela : argui içanen duc gucia , candelác bere claretateaz arguitzen auènean beçala .

text: And as he spake , a certain Pharisee besought him to dine with him : and he went in , and sat down to meat .
text2: Eta minçatu cenean , othoitz eguin cieçon Phariseu batec barazcal ledin hura baithan , eta Iesus sarthuric iar cedin mahainean .

text: And when the Pharisee saw it , he marvelled that he had not first washed before dinner .
text2: Baita Phariseuac hori ikussiric mirets ceçan ceren lehenic ezpaitzedin ikuz barazcal aitzinean .

text: And the Lord said unto him , Now do ye Pharisees make clean the outside of the cup and the platter ; but your inward part is full of ravening and wickedness .
text2: Eta erran cieçón Iaunac , Baina çuec Phariseuoc coparen eta plataren campoco aldea chahutzen duçue : baina çuen barnean dena , bethea da harrapaqueriaz eta gaichtaqueriaz .

text: Ye fools , did not he that made that which is without make that which is within also ?
text2: Adimendu gabeác , campocoa eguin duenac eztu barnecoa ere eguin ?

text: But rather give alms of such things as ye have ; and , behold , all things are clean unto you .
text2: Aitzitic duçuenetic emaçue elemosynatan : eta huna , gauça guciac chahu dituqueçue .

text: But woe unto you , Pharisees ! for ye tithe mint and rue and all manner of herbs , and pass over judgment and the love of God : these ought ye to have done , and not to leave the other undone .
text2: Baina maledictione çuen gainean Phariseuác : ecen detchematzen dituçue menthá eta rutá , eta baratze belhar gucia , baina vtziten dituçue guibelera Iaincoaren iugemendua eta charitatea : hauc eguin behar ciraden , eta hec ez vtzi .

text: Woe unto you , Pharisees ! for ye love the uppermost seats in the synagogues , and greetings in the markets .
text2: Maledictione çuen gainean Phariseuác : ecen on darizteçue lehen iar lekuey synagoguetan , eta salutationey merkatuetan .

text: Woe unto you , scribes and Pharisees , hypocrites ! for ye are as graves which appear not , and the men that walk over them are not aware of them .
text2: Maledictione çuen gainean Scriba eta Phariseu hypocritác : ecen monument agueri eztiradenac beçala çarete , eta hayén gainean dabiltzan guiçonéc ezpaitaquizquite .

text: Then answered one of the lawyers , and said unto him , Master , thus saying thou reproachest us also .
text2: Orduan ihardesten duela Legueco doctoretaric batec diotsa , Magistrua , gauça horién erraitean gu - ere iniuriatzen gaituc .

text: And he said , Woe unto you also , ye lawyers ! for ye lade men with burdens grievous to be borne , and ye yourselves touch not the burdens with one of your fingers .
text2: Eta harc dio , Maledictione çuen gainean - ere Legueco doctorác , ecen cargatzen dituçue guiçonac carga iassaiteco nequezcoez : baina ceuroc çuen erhietaric batez eztituçue cargác hunquitzen .

text: Woe unto you ! for ye build the sepulchres of the prophets , and your fathers killed them .
text2: Maledictione çuen gainean , ecen edificatzen dituçue Prophetén thumbác , eta çuen aitéc hil vkan dituzte hec .

text: Truly ye bear witness that ye allow the deeds of your fathers : for they indeed killed them , and ye build their sepulchres .
text2: Segurqui testificatzen duçue ceuroc çuen aiten obretan consentitzen duçuela : ecen hec hil dituzte , eta çuec edificatzen dituçue hayén thumbác .

text: Therefore also said the wisdom of God , I will send them prophets and apostles , and some of them they shall slay and persecute :
text2: Halacotz Iaincoaren sapientiac - ere erran du , Igorriren ditut hetara Prophetác eta Apostoluac , eta hetaric hilen duté eta persecutaturen .

text: That the blood of all the prophets , which was shed from the foundation of the world , may be required of this generation ;
text2: Natione huni galdeguin daquionçat , munduaren creationeaz gueroztic issuri den Propheta gucién odola :

text: From the blood of Abel unto the blood of Zacharias , which perished between the altar and the temple : verily I say unto you , It shall be required of this generation .
text2: Abelen odoletic Zachariasen odolerano , cein hil vkan baitzutén aldareari eta templeari artean : are diotsuet , galde eguinen çayola natione huni .

text: Woe unto you , lawyers ! for ye have taken away the key of knowledge : ye entered not in yourselves , and them that were entering in ye hindered .
text2: Maledictione çuen gainean Legueco doctorác : ecen eçagutzearen gakoa kendu duçue : ceuroc etzarete sarthu içan , eta sartzen ciradenac beguiratu dituçue .

text: And as he said these things unto them , the scribes and the Pharisees began to urge him vehemently , and to provoke him to speak of many things :
text2: Eta gauça hauc hæy erraiten cerauztenean , has cequitzon Scribác eta Phariseuac haguitz hertsen , eta propos iradoquiten anhitz gauçaz .

text: Laying wait for him , and seeking to catch something out of his mouth , that they might accuse him .
text2: Celatan ceudela , eta cerbait haren ahotic hatzaman aiherrez çabiltzala , accusa leçatençat .

text: In the mean time , when there were gathered together an innumerable multitude of people , insomuch that they trode one upon another , he began to say unto his disciples first of all , Beware ye of the leaven of the Pharisees , which is hypocrisy .
text2: Bizquitartean bildu içanic gendetze mulço handiac hambat non elkar aurizquiten baitzutén , has cequién erraiten bere discipuluey , Lehenic beguira çaitezte Phariseuén altchagarritic , cein baita hypocrisiá .

text: For there is nothing covered , that shall not be revealed ; neither hid , that shall not be known .
text2: Ecen ezta deus estaliric aguerturen eztenic : ezeta deus secreturic iaquinen eztenic .

text: Therefore whatsoever ye have spoken in darkness shall be heard in the light ; and that which ye have spoken in the ear in closets shall be proclaimed upon the housetops .
text2: Halacotz ilhumbean erran dituçuen gauçác , arguian ençunen dirade : eta beharrira gamberetan erran duçuena , predicaturen da etche gainetan .

text: And I say unto you my friends , Be not afraid of them that kill the body , and after that have no more that they can do .
text2: Eta diotsuet çuey neure adisquideoy , Etzaretela beldur gorputza hiltzen dutenén , eta guero ezpaitute cer guehiagoric eguin deçaten .

text: But I will forewarn you whom ye shall fear : Fear him , which after he hath killed hath power to cast into hell ; yea , I say unto you , Fear him .
text2: Baina eracutsiren drauçuet noren beldur behar çareten : çareten beldur , hil duqueenean gehennara egoiztecó authoritatea duenarén : are diotsuet , haren beldur çareten .

text: Are not five sparrows sold for two farthings , and not one of them is forgotten before God ?
text2: Eztira borz parra - chori bi dirutchotan saltzen , eta hetaric bat ezpaita ahanciric Iaincoaren aitzinean ?

text: But even the very hairs of your head are all numbered . Fear not therefore : ye are of more value than many sparrows .
text2: Baina çuen buruco bilo guciac - ere contatuac dirade etzaretela beraz beldur : parra - chori araldeac baino guehiago balio duçue çuec .

text: Also I say unto you , Whosoever shall confess me before men , him shall the Son of man also confess before the angels of God :
text2: Badiotsuet bada , Norc - ere ni aithorturen bainau guiçonen aitzinean , guiçonaren Semeac - ere aithorturen du hura Iaincoaren Aingueruén aitzinean .

text: But he that denieth me before men shall be denied before the angels of God .
text2: Baina ni guiçonén aitzinean vkaturen nauena , vkatua içanen da Iaincoaren Aingueruén aitzinean .

text: And whosoever shall speak a word against the Son of man , it shall be forgiven him : but unto him that blasphemeth against the Holy Ghost it shall not be forgiven .
text2: Eta norc - ere erranen baitu hitzic guiçonaren Semearen contra barkaturen çayó hari : baina Spiritu sainduaren contra blasphematuren duenari , etzayó barkaturen .

text: And when they bring you unto the synagogues , and unto magistrates , and powers , take ye no thought how or what thing ye shall answer , or what ye shall say :
text2: Eta eramanen çaituztenean synagoguetara , eta magistratuetara , eta potestatetara , eztuçuela ansiaric , nola edo cer ihardetsiren duçuen edo cer erranen .

text: For the Holy Ghost shall teach you in the same hour what ye ought to say .
text2: Ecen Spiritu sainduac iracatsiren çaituzte ordu hartan berean , cer erran behar daten .

text: And one of the company said unto him , Master , speak to my brother , that he divide the inheritance with me .
text2: Eta erran cieçón gendetzecoetaric batec , Magistruá , erróc ene anayeri parti deçan enequin heretagea .

text: And he said unto him , Man , who made me a judge or a divider over you ?
text2: Baina harc erran cieçón , Guiçoná , norc eçarri nau ni iuge , edo partitzale çuen gainean ?

text: And he said unto them , Take heed , and beware of covetousness : for a man ' s life consisteth not in the abundance of the things which he possesseth .
text2: Guero erran cieçón , Ikussaçue , eta beguira çaitezte auaritiatic : ecen cembeitec onhassunez abundantia badu - ere , bere vicia eztu bere onetaric .

text: And he spake a parable unto them , saying , The ground of a certain rich man brought forth plentifully :
text2: Eta erran ciecén comparationebat , cioela , Guiçon abrats baten landéc abundantqui fructu ekarri vkan duté :

text: And he thought within himself , saying , What shall I do , because I have no room where to bestow my fruits ?
text2: Eta gogueta eguiten çuen bere baithan , cioela , Cer eguinen dut ? ecen eztut nora bil ditzadan neure fructuac .

text: And he said , This will I do : I will pull down my barns , and build greater ; and there will I bestow all my fruits and my goods .
text2: Eta erran ceçan , Haur eguinen dut : deseguinen ditut neure granerac , eta handiagoac eguinen ditut : eta hara bilduren ditut neure fructu guciac , eta neure onac .

text: And I will say to my soul , Soul , thou hast much goods laid up for many years ; take thine ease , eat , drink , and be merry .
text2: Eta erranen draucat neure arimari , Arimá , badituc on handiac anhitz vrthetacozat bilduac : reposa adi , ian eçac , edan eçac , eta atseguin har eçac .

text: But God said unto him , Thou fool , this night thy soul shall be required of thee : then whose shall those things be , which thou hast provided ?
text2: Baina erran cieçón Iaincoac , Erhoá , gaurco gauèan eure arimá edequiren çaic : eta dituán gauçác , noren içanen dirade ?

text: So is he that layeth up treasure for himself , and is not rich toward God .
text2: Hala da onhassun handiac beretaco biltzen dituena , eta Iaincoa baithan abrats eztena .

text: And he said unto his disciples , Therefore I say unto you , Take no thought for your life , what ye shall eat ; neither for the body , what ye shall put on .
text2: Orduan erran ciecén bere discipuluey , Halacotz diotsuet , eztuçuen artharic çuen vicitzeaz , cer ianen duçuen : ez eta gorputzaz cerçaz veztituren çareten .

text: The life is more than meat , and the body is more than raiment .
text2: Vicia vianda baino guehiago da , eta gorputza abillamendua baino .

text: Consider the ravens : for they neither sow nor reap ; which neither have storehouse nor barn ; and God feedeth them : how much more are ye better than the fowls ?
text2: Considera itzaçue beleac , ecen eztutela ereiten ez biltzen , eta hec eztuté sotoric ez graneric , eta Iaincoac hatzen ditu hec , cembatez çuec choriéc baino guehiago balio duçue ?

text: And which of you with taking thought can add to his stature one cubit ?
text2: Eta norc çuetaric artha vkanez eratchequi ahal dieçaqueo bessobat bere handitassunari ?

text: If ye then be not able to do that thing which is least , why take ye thought for the rest ?
text2: Bada baldin chipién dena - ere ecin badaguiçue , cer goiticoéz arthatsu çarete ?

text: Consider the lilies how they grow : they toil not , they spin not ; and yet I say unto you , that Solomon in all his glory was not arrayed like one of these .
text2: Consideraitzaçue floreac , nola handitzen diraden : eztirade nekatzen , eta eztute iruten : baina badiotsuet , are Salomon - ere bere gloria guciarequin eztela veztitu içan hetaric bat beçala .

text: If then God so clothe the grass , which is to day in the field , and to morrow is cast into the oven ; how much more will he clothe you , O ye of little faith ?
text2: Bada baldin egun landán belhar dena , eta bihar labean eçarten dena Iaincoac hala inguru veztitzen badu , cembatez areago çuec fede chipitacoac

text: And seek not ye what ye shall eat , or what ye shall drink , neither be ye of doubtful mind .
text2: Çuec beraz eztaguiçuela galderic cer ianen duçuen edo cer edanen : eta etzaiteztela dudán iar

text: For all these things do the nations of the world seek after : and your Father knoweth that ye have need of these things .
text2: Ecen gauça hauc guciac munduco gendéc bilhatzen dituzté : baina çuen Aitac badaqui , ecen hauèn beharra baduçuela .

text: But rather seek ye the kingdom of God ; and all these things shall be added unto you .
text2: Bainaitzitic bilha eçaçue Iaincoaren resumá , eta gauça hauc guciac emanen çaizquiçue gaineraco .

text: Fear not , little flock ; for it is your Father ' s good pleasure to give you the kingdom .
text2: Ezaicela beldur tropel chipiá , ecen çuen Aitaren placer ona içan da çuey resumaren emaitera .

text: Sell that ye have , and give alms ; provide yourselves bags which wax not old , a treasure in the heavens that faileth not , where no thief approacheth , neither moth corrupteth .
text2: Sal itzaçue çuen onac , eta eman itzaçue elemosynatan . Eguin itzaçue ceurondaco çahartzen eztiraden mulsác , ceruètan thesaur nehoiz - ere falta eztaitembat : nora ohoinic ezpaita hurbiltzen , eta non cerrenec ezpaitu deseguiten .

text: For where your treasure is , there will your heart be also .
text2: Ecen non baita çuen thesaura , han içanen da çuen bihotza - ere .

text: Let your loins be girded about , and your lights burning ;
text2: Bira çuen guerrunceac guerricatuac , eta çuen candelác irachequiac .

text: And ye yourselves like unto men that wait for their lord , when he will return from the wedding ; that when he cometh and knocketh , they may open unto him immediately .
text2: Eta çuec çareten noiz hayén nabussia ezteyetaric itzul daiten beguira dauden guiçonetarát irudi : dathorrenean , eta borthá bulka deçanean , bertan irequi deçotençát .

text: Blessed are those servants , whom the lord when he cometh shall find watching : verily I say unto you , that he shall gird himself , and make them to sit down to meat , and will come forth and serve them .
text2: Dohatsu dirade cerbitzari hec , cein dathorrenean nabussiac eridenen baititu iratzarriac : eguiaz diotsuet guerricaturen dela bera , eta mahainean iar eraciren dituela , eta aitzinaraturic cerbitzaturen dituela .

text: And if he shall come in the second watch , or come in the third watch , and find them so , blessed are those servants .
text2: Eta baldin badathor bigarren veillán , eta heren veillán badathor , eta hala eriden ditzan : dohatsu dirade cerbitzari hec .

text: And this know , that if the goodman of the house had known what hour the thief would come , he would have watched , and not have suffered his house to be broken through .
text2: Eta haur iaquiçue , ecen baldin baleaqui aitafamiliác cer orduz ohoina ethorteco licén , veilla leçaqueela , eta ezleçaqueela vtzi çulhatzera bere etchea .

text: Be ye therefore ready also : for the Son of man cometh at an hour when ye think not .
text2: Çuec - ere bada çareten prest , ecen vste eztuçuen orduan guiçonaren Semea ethorriren da .

text: Then Peter said unto him , Lord , speakest thou this parable unto us , or even to all ?
text2: Orduan erran cieçón Pierrisec , Iauna , guri erraiten draucuc comparatione hori ala bay guciey - ere ?

text: And the Lord said , Who then is that faithful and wise steward , whom his lord shall make ruler over his household , to give them their portion of meat in due season ?
text2: Eta erran ceçan Iaunac , Cein da despensér leyala eta çuhurra , nabussiac bere familiaren gaineco ordenatu duena , demborán ordinarioa deyençát ?

text: Blessed is that servant , whom his lord when he cometh shall find so doing .
text2: Dohatsu da cerbitzari hura , dathorrinean nabussiac hala eguiten eridenen duena .

text: Of a truth I say unto you , that he will make him ruler over all that he hath .
text2: Eguiazqui erraiten drauçuet , ecen duen guciaren gaineco eçarriren duela hura .

text: But and if that servant say in his heart , My lord delayeth his coming ; and shall begin to beat the menservants and maidens , and to eat and drink , and to be drunken ;
text2: Eta baldin erran badeça cerbitzari harc bere bihotzean , Berancen du ene nabussiac ethortera : eta has badadi cehatzen muthillén eta nescatoén , eta iaten eta edaten eta horditzen :

text: The lord of that servant will come in a day when he looketh not for him , and at an hour when he is not aware , and will cut him in sunder , and will appoint him his portion with the unbelievers .
text2: Ethorriren da cerbitzari haren nabussia , harc vste eztuen egunean , eta eztaquian orenean : eta bereciren du hura , eta haren partea infidelequin eçarriren .

text: And that servant , which knew his lord ' s will , and prepared not himself , neither did according to his will , shall be beaten with many stripes .
text2: Eta bere nabussiaren vorondatea eçagutu duen cerbitzaria , eta ezpaita preparatu , eta ezpaitu haren vorondatearen araura eguin , cehaturen da anhitz vkaldiz :

text: But he that knew not , and did commit things worthy of stripes , shall be beaten with few stripes . For unto whomsoever much is given , of him shall be much required : and to whom men have committed much , of him they will ask the more .
text2: Baina eçagutu eztuena , eta cehatu içateco mereci duqueen gauçac eguin dituena , cehaturen da vkaldi gutiz . Bada anhitz eman içan çayon guciari , anhitz galde eguinen çayó : eta beguiratzera anhitz eman içan çayonari , hambat guehiago galde eguinen çayó .

text: I am come to send fire on the earth ; and what will I if it be already kindled ?
text2: Suaren emaitera ethorri naiz lurrera : eta cer nahi dut guehiago baldin ia irachequia bada ?

text: But I have a baptism to be baptized with ; and how am I straitened till it be accomplished !
text2: Baina baptismo batez batheyatzeco naiz , eta nola hertsen naiz haur compli daiten artean ?

text: Suppose ye that I am come to give peace on earth ? I tell you , Nay ; but rather division :
text2: Vste duçue ecen lurrean baquearen eçartera ethorri naicela ? ez , diotsuet , baina diuisionearen .

text: For from henceforth there shall be five in one house divided , three against two , and two against three .
text2: Ecen hemendic harát içanen dirade borz etche batetan diuisionetan diratenic , hirurac bién contra , eta biac hirurén contra .

text: The father shall be divided against the son , and the son against the father ; the mother against the daughter , and the daughter against the mother ; the mother in law against her daughter in law , and the daughter in law against her mother in law .
text2: Diuisionetan içanen da aitá semearen contra , eta semea aitaren contra : amá alabaren contra , eta alabá amaren contra : ama - guinharrebá bere errenaren contra , eta errena bere ama - guinharrebaren contra .

text: And he said also to the people , When ye see a cloud rise out of the west , straightway ye say , There cometh a shower ; and so it is .
text2: Guero erraiten cerauen gendetzey - ere , Ikus deçaçuenean hodeybat altchatzen dela Occidentetic , bertan dioçue , vria heldu da : eta hala guerthatzen da .

text: And when ye see the south wind blow , ye say , There will be heat ; and it cometh to pass .
text2: Eta hegoác draunsanean , erraiten duçue , ecen bero eguinen duela : eta hala guerthatzen da .

text: Ye hypocrites , ye can discern the face of the sky and of the earth ; but how is it that ye do not discern this time ?
text2: Hypocritác , ceruären eta lurraren itchuraren iugeatzen daquiçue : eta dembora hunez nola eztuçue iugeatzen ?

text: Yea , and why even of yourselves judge ye not what is right ?
text2: Eta nola ceuron buruz - ere eztuçue iugeatzen bide dena ?

text: When thou goest with thine adversary to the magistrate , as thou art in the way , give diligence that thou mayest be delivered from him ; lest he hale thee to the judge , and the judge deliver thee to the officer , and the officer cast thee into prison .
text2: Bada ioaiten aicenean eure partida contrastarequin magistratuagana , enseya adi bidean haren menetic ilkiten : tira ezeçançat iugeagana , eta iugeac eman ieçon sargeantari , eta sargeantac eçar ezeçan presoindeguian .

text: I tell thee , thou shalt not depart thence , till thou hast paid the very last mite .
text2: Erraiten drauat , ezaiz ilkiren handic azquen pelata - ere renda diroqueano .

text: There were present at that season some that told him of the Galilaeans , whose blood Pilate had mingled with their sacrifices .
text2: Eta baciraden batzu dembora hartan berean hari contatzen ceraucatenic Galileanoéz , ceinén odola Pilatec nahassi vkan baitzuen hayén sacrificioequin .

text: And Jesus answering said unto them , Suppose ye that these Galilaeans were sinners above all the Galilaeans , because they suffered such things ?
text2: Eta ihardesten çuela Iesusec erran ciecén , Vste duçue ecen Galileano hauc berce Galileano guciac baino bekatoreago ciradela , ceren halaco gauçác suffritu baitituzte ?

text: I tell you , Nay : but , except ye repent , ye shall all likewise perish .
text2: Ezetz diotsuet : aitzitic baldin emenda ezpaçaitezte guciac halaber galduren çarete .

text: Or those eighteen , upon whom the tower in Siloam fell , and slew them , think ye that they were sinners above all men that dwelt in Jerusalem ?
text2: Ezpa , Siloeco dorreac gainera eroriric hil vkan cituen hemeçortzi hec , vste duçue Ierusalemeco habitant guciac baino hoguendunago ciradela ?

text: I tell you , Nay : but , except ye repent , ye shall all likewise perish .
text2: Ezetz diotsuet : aitzitic baldin emenda ezpaçaitezte , guciac halaber galduren çarete .

text: He spake also this parable ; A certain man had a fig tree planted in his vineyard ; and he came and sought fruit thereon , and found none .
text2: Erraiten çuen comparatione haur - ere , ficotzebat çuen edocein - batec landatua bere mahastian : eta fructu bilha ethor cedin hartara : eta etzeçan eriden .

text: Then said he unto the dresser of his vineyard , Behold , these three years I come seeking fruit on this fig tree , and find none : cut it down ; why cumbereth it the ground ?
text2: Eta erran cieçón mahasti çainari , Huná , hirur vrthe dic ethorten naicela fructu bilha ficotze hunetara , eta eztiat erideiten : picca eçac : certaco lurra - ere empatchatzen du ?

text: And he answering said unto him , Lord , let it alone this year also , till I shall dig about it , and dung it :
text2: Eta harc ihardesten çuela erran cieçón , Iauna , vtzi eçac are vrthe hunetan , inguru aitzurtu duquedano , eta vngarri eman deçaqueodano .

text: And if it bear fruit , well : and if not , then after that thou shalt cut it down .
text2: Eta baldin ekar badeça fructuric , vngui , ezpere , guero piccaturen duquec .

text: And he was teaching in one of the synagogues on the sabbath .
text2: Eta iracasten ari cen synagoga batetan Sabbathoan .

text: And , behold , there was a woman which had a spirit of infirmity eighteen years , and was bowed together , and could in no wise lift up herself .
text2: Eta huná , emaztebat ethor cedin eritassunezco spiritua çuenic ia hemeçortzi vrthez : eta cen crocatua , eta neholetan - ere ecin chuchent ceiten .

text: And when Jesus saw her , he called her to him , and said unto her , Woman , thou art loosed from thine infirmity .
text2: Eta hura ikussi çuenean Iesusec dei ceçan beregana , eta erran cieçón , Emaztea , lachatu aiz eure eritassunetic .

text: And he laid his hands on her : and immediately she was made straight , and glorified God .
text2: Eta gainean eçar cietzón escuac , eta bertan chuchent cedin , eta glorificatzen çuen Iaincoa .

text: And the ruler of the synagogue answered with indignation , because that Jesus had healed on the sabbath day , and said unto the people , There are six days in which men ought to work : in them therefore come and be healed , and not on the sabbath day .
text2: Baina ihardesten çuela synagogaco principalac , gaitzituric ceren Sabbathoan sendatu çuen Iesusec , erran cieçon populuari , Sey egun dirade ceinetan lan eguin behar baita , hetan badaçatozte eta senda çaitezte , eta ez Sabbath egunean .

text: The Lord then answered him , and said , Thou hypocrite , doth not each one of you on the sabbath loose his ox or his ass from the stall , and lead him away to watering ?
text2: lhardets cieçón bada Iaunac , eta erran ceçan , Hypocritá , çuetaric batbederac Sabbathoan eztu lachatzen bere idia edo bere astoa mangederatic , eta eramaiten ederatera ?

text: And ought not this woman , being a daughter of Abraham , whom Satan hath bound , lo , these eighteen years , be loosed from this bond on the sabbath day ?
text2: Eta Abrahamen alaba haur , cein estecatu baitzuen Satanec , huná , hemeçortzi vrthe duela , etzén estecadura hunetaric lachatu behar Sabbath egunean ?

text: And when he had said these things , all his adversaries were ashamed : and all the people rejoiced for all the glorious things that were done by him .
text2: Eta gauça hauc harc erraiten cituenean , confunditzen ciraden hari contrastatzen çaizquion guciac : baina populu gucia alegueratzen cen harçaz eguiten ciraden gauça glorioso guciéz .

text: Then said he , Unto what is the kingdom of God like ? and whereunto shall I resemble it ?
text2: Orduan erraiten çuen Iesusec , Cer irudi du Iaincoaren resumác ? eta cerequin comparaturen dut hura ?

text: It is like a grain of mustard seed , which a man took , and cast into his garden ; and it grew , and waxed a great tree ; and the fowls of the air lodged in the branches of it .
text2: Mustarda bihia irudi du , cein harturic guiçon batec eçar baitzeçan bere baratzean , eta haz cedin eta arbore handia eguin cedin eta ceruco choriéc ohatzeac eguin dituzte haren adarretan .

text: And again he said , Whereunto shall I liken the kingdom of God ?
text2: Eta berriz erran ceçan , Cerequin comparaturen dut Iaincoaren resumá ?

text: It is like leaven , which a woman took and hid in three measures of meal , till the whole was leavened .
text2: Altchagarria irudi du , cein harturic emazte batec eçar baitzeçan hirur neurri irinetan , gucia altchatu liçateno .

text: And he went through the cities and villages , teaching , and journeying toward Jerusalem .
text2: Guero iragaiten cen hirietan eta burguètan , iracasten çuela , eta Ierusalemeratco bidea eguiten çuela .

text: Then said one unto him , Lord , are there few that be saved ? And he said unto them ,
text2: Eta erran cieçón norbeitec , Iauna , gutiac dira saluatzen diradenac ? Eta harc erran ciecén ,

text: Strive to enter in at the strait gate : for many , I say unto you , will seek to enter in , and shall not be able .
text2: Enseya çaitezte sartzen bortha herssitic : ecen anhitz , erraiten drauçuet , sarthu nahiz ebiliren diradela , eta ecin sarthuren baitirade .

text: When once the master of the house is risen up , and hath shut to the door , and ye begin to stand without , and to knock at the door , saying , Lord , Lord , open unto us ; and he shall answer and say unto you , I know you not whence ye are :
text2: Eta aitafamilia iaiqui datenean , eta borthá ertsi duqueenean , eta has çaiteztenean campoan egoiten , eta bortharen bulkatzen , erraiten duçuela , Iauna , Iauna , irequi eçaguc : eta ihasderten duela erranen drauçue , Eztaquit çuec nongo çareten .

text: Then shall ye begin to say , We have eaten and drunk in thy presence , and thou hast taught in our streets .
text2: Orduan hassiren çarete erraiten , Ian diagu hire presentián , eta edan diagu , eta gure carriquetan iracatsi duc hic .

text: But he shall say , I tell you , I know you not whence ye are ; depart from me , all ye workers of iniquity .
text2: Eta erranen du , Erraiten drauçuet eztaquit çuec nongo çareten : parti çaitezte eneganic iniquitate eguiten duçuen guciác .

text: There shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth , when ye shall see Abraham , and Isaac , and Jacob , and all the prophets , in the kingdom of God , and you yourselves thrust out .
text2: Han içanen da nigar eta hortz garrascots : ikus ditzaçuenean Abraham , eta Isaac , eta Iacob eta Propheta guciac Iaincoaren resumán , eta çuec campora iraizten çaretela .

text: And they shall come from the east , and from the west , and from the north , and from the south , and shall sit down in the kingdom of God .
text2: Orduan ethorriren dirade Orientetic , eta Occidentetic : Aquilonetic , eta Egu - erditic : eta iarriren dirade mahainean Iaincoaren resumán .

text: And , behold , there are last which shall be first , and there are first which shall be last .
text2: Eta huná , dirade azquen , lehen içanen diradenac : eta dirade lehen , azquen içanen diradenac .

text: The same day there came certain of the Pharisees , saying unto him , Get thee out , and depart hence : for Herod will kill thee .
text2: Egun hartan berean hurbil citecen Phariseuetaric batzu , erraiten ceraucatela , Ilki adi , eta oha hemendic : ecen Herodesec hil nahi au .

text: And he said unto them , Go ye , and tell that fox , Behold , I cast out devils , and I do cures to day and to morrow , and the third day I shall be perfected .
text2: Eta erran ciecén , Çoazte eta erroçue aceri hari , Huná , egoizten citiát deabruac campora , eta sendatzea acabatzen diát egun eta bihar , eta hereneco egunean fin hartzen diat .

text: Nevertheless I must walk to day , and to morrow , and the day following : for it cannot be that a prophet perish out of Jerusalem .
text2: Baina bide eguin behar diat egun eta bihar eta etzi : ecen eztuc guerthatzen Prophetaric batre hil dadin Ierusalemetic lekora .

text: O Jerusalem , Jerusalem , which killest the prophets , and stonest them that are sent unto thee ; how often would I have gathered thy children together , as a hen doth gather her brood under her wings , and ye would not !
text2: Ierusaleme , Ierusaleme , ceinec hiltzen baitituc Prophetác , eta lapidatzen hiregana igorri diradenac , cembat aldiz nahi vkan ditut bildu hire haourrac , oilloac bere chito aldea bere hegalén azpira beçala , eta ezpaituçue nahi vkan ?

text: Behold , your house is left unto you desolate : and verily I say unto you , Ye shall not see me , until the time come when ye shall say , Blessed is he that cometh in the name of the Lord .
text2: Horrá vtziten çaiçue çuen etchea desert . Baina eguiaz diotsuet , ecen eznauçuela ikussiren , guertha daiteno darraçuen , Benedicatu dela Iaunaren icenean ethorten dena .

text: And it came to pass , as he went into the house of one of the chief Pharisees to eat bread on the sabbath day , that they watched him .
text2: Guertha cedin halaber hura ethorri cenean Phariseuetaco principal baten etchera Sabbathoan bere refectionearen hartzera , hec gogoa emaiten baitzeraucaten .

text: And , behold , there was a certain man before him which had the dropsy .
text2: Eta huná , guiçon hydropicobat cen haren aitzinean .

text: And Jesus answering spake unto the lawyers and Pharisees , saying , Is it lawful to heal on the sabbath day ?
text2: Orduan ihardesten çuela Iesusec erran ciecén Legueco doctorey eta Phariseuey , cioela , Sori da Sabbathoan sendatzea ?

text: And they held their peace . And he took him , and healed him , and let him go ;
text2: Eta hec ichilic egon citecen , Eta harc hura harturic senda ceçan , eta igor ceçan .

text: And answered them , saying , Which of you shall have an ass or an ox fallen into a pit , and will not straightway pull him out on the sabbath day ?
text2: Eta ihardesten cerauela , erran ceçan , Ceinec çuetaric astoa edo idia putzura eror badaquió , eztu bertan hura idoquiren Sabbath egunean ?

text: And they could not answer him again to these things .
text2: Eta ecin gauça hauén gainean ihardets ceçaqueoten .

text: And he put forth a parable to those which were bidden , when he marked how they chose out the chief rooms ; saying unto them ,
text2: Erraiten cerauen halaber gomitatu içan ciradeney comparationebat , gogoatzen çuela nola lehen iarlekuéz hautatzen ciraden , ciostela ,

text: When thou art bidden of any man to a wedding , sit not down in the highest room ; lest a more honourable man than thou be bidden of him ;
text2: Norbeitec dei açanean ezteyetara , ezadila iar lehen lekuan , guertha eztadin , hi baino ohoratuagobat harc deithu duen :

text: And he that bade thee and him come and say to thee , Give this man place ; and thou begin with shame to take the lowest room .
text2: Eta ethorriric hura eta hi deithu çaituztenac erran dieçán , Emóc huni lekua : eta orduan has ezadin ahalquerequin azquen lekuaren eduquiten .

text: But when thou art bidden , go and sit down in the lowest room ; that when he that bade thee cometh , he may say unto thee , Friend , go up higher : then shalt thou have worship in the presence of them that sit at meat with thee .
text2: Baina gomitatu aicenean , habil , iar adi azquen lekuan : dathorrenean hi gomitatu auenac erran dieçançat , Adisquideá , igan adi gorago : orduan duquec ohore hirequin mahainean iarriric daudenén aitzinean .

text: For whosoever exalteth himself shall be abased ; and he that humbleth himself shall be exalted .
text2: Ecen bere buruä goratzen duen gucia , beheraturen da : eta bere buruä beheratzen duena , goraturen da .

text: Then said he also to him that bade him , When thou makest a dinner or a supper , call not thy friends , nor thy brethren , neither thy kinsmen , nor thy rich neighbours ; lest they also bid thee again , and a recompence be made thee .
text2: Eta bera gomitatu çuenari - ere erraiten ceraucan , Eguiten duanean barazcaribat edo affaribat , eztitzala dei eure adisquideac , ez eure anayeac , ez eure ahaideac , ez auço abratsac , hec ere aldiz bere aldetic gomita ezeçatençát , eta ordaina renda eztaquián .

text: But when thou makest a feast , call the poor , the maimed , the lame , the blind :
text2: Baina eguiten duanean banquetbat , dei itzac paubreac , impotentac , mainguäc , itsuac :

text: And thou shalt be blessed ; for they cannot recompense thee : for thou shalt be recompensed at the resurrection of the just .
text2: Eta dohatsu içanen aiz : ceren ezpaitute nondic hiri ordaina renda : ecen hiri rendaturen çaic ordaina iustoén resurrectionean .

text: And when one of them that sat at meat with him heard these things , he said unto him , Blessed is he that shall eat bread in the kingdom of God .
text2: Eta gauça hauc ençunic harequin mahainean iarriric ceudenetaric batec erran cieçón , Dohatsu duc Iaincoaren resumán ogui ianen duena .

text: Then said he unto him , A certain man made a great supper , and bade many :
text2: Eta harc erran cieçón , Guiçon batec eguin ceçan affari handibat , eta dei ceçan anhitz :

text: And sent his servant at supper time to say to them that were bidden , Come ; for all things are now ready .
text2: Eta igor ceçan bere cerbitzaria affal ordutan , gomitatuey erraitera , Çatozte , ecen gauça guciac prest dirade .

text: And they all with one consent began to make excuse . The first said unto him , I have bought a piece of ground , and I must needs go and see it : I pray thee have me excused .
text2: Baina guciac has citecen consentimendu batez excusatzen . Lehenac erran cieçón , Possessionebat erossi diat , eta haren ikustera ilki behar diat : othoitz eguiten drauat , eduqui neçac excusatutan .

text: And another said , I have bought five yoke of oxen , and I go to prove them : I pray thee have me excused .
text2: Eta berceac erran ceçan , Borz idi vztarri erossi citiat , eta banihoac hayén phorogatzera : othoitz eguiten drauat eduqui neçac excusatutan .

text: And another said , I have married a wife , and therefore I cannot come .
text2: Eta berceac erran ceçan , Emazte hartu diat , eta halacotz ecin niathorrec .

text: So that servant came , and shewed his lord these things . Then the master of the house being angry said to his servant , Go out quickly into the streets and lanes of the city , and bring in hither the poor , and the maimed , and the halt , and the blind .
text2: Eta itzuliric cerbitzari harc conta cietzón gauça hauc bere nabussiari . Orduan asserreturic aitafamiliác erran cieçón bere cerbitzariari , Habil fitetz placetara , eta hirico carriquetara , eta paubreac eta impotentac , eta mainguäc eta itsuac huna barnera erekar itzac .

text: And the servant said , Lord , it is done as thou hast commanded , and yet there is room .
text2: Eta erran ceçan cerbitzariac , Nabussiá , eguin içan duc , manatu duán beçala eta oraino baduc leku .

text: And the lord said unto the servant , Go out into the highways and hedges , and compel them to come in , that my house may be filled .
text2: Orduan erran cieçón nabussiac cerbitzariari , Oha bidetara eta berroetara , eta bortchaitzac , sartzera bethe dadinçát ene etchea .

text: For I say unto you , That none of those men which were bidden shall taste of my supper .
text2: Ecen erraiten drauçuet , guiçon deithu içan ciraden hetaric batec - ere eztuela ene affaritic dastaturen .

text: And there went great multitudes with him : and he turned , and said unto them ,
text2: Eta gendetze handiac ioaiten ciraden harequin : eta itzuliric erran ciecén .

text: If any man come to me , and hate not his father , and mother , and wife , and children , and brethren , and sisters , yea , and his own life also , he cannot be my disciple .
text2: Baldin nehor enegana ethorten bada eta gaitzesten ezpaditu bere aita eta amá , eta emaztea eta haourrac , eta anayeac eta arrebác , etare guehiago bere arima - ere , ecin date ene discipulu .

text: And whosoever doth not bear his cross , and come after me , cannot be my disciple .
text2: Eta norc - ere ezpaitacarque bere crutzea , eta ene ondoan ethorten ezpaita , ecin date ene discipulu .

text: For which of you , intending to build a tower , sitteth not down first , and counteth the cost , whether he have sufficient to finish it ?
text2: Ecen cein da çuetaric dorrebat edificatu nahi duenic , lehen iarriric gostuac contatzen eztituena , eya acabatzeco baduenez ?

text: Lest haply , after he hath laid the foundation , and is not able to finish it , all that behold it begin to mock him ,
text2: Fundamenta eçarri duqueen ondoan , eta ecin acabatu duqueenean , ikussiren duten guciac harçaz truffatzen has eztitecençát , dioitela ,

text: Saying , This man began to build , and was not able to finish .
text2: Guiçon hunec hassi du edificatzen eta ecin acabatu du .

text: Or what king , going to make war against another king , sitteth not down first , and consulteth whether he be able with ten thousand to meet him that cometh against him with twenty thousand ?
text2: Edo cein da reguea berce regue baten contra batailla emaitera abiatzen dena , lehen iarriric consultatzen eztuen , eya hamar millarequin aitzinera ilki ahal daquidionez , hoguey millarequin haren contra ethorten denari ?

text: Or else , while the other is yet a great way off , he sendeth an ambassage , and desireth conditions of peace .
text2: Bercela hura oraino vrrun deno , embachadore igorriric baque esquez iarten da .
