text: So likewise , whosoever he be of you that forsaketh not all that he hath , he cannot be my disciple .
text2: Hala beraz , norc - ere çuetaric bere on guciac ezpaititu renuntiatzen hura ecin date ene discipulu .

text: Salt is good : but if the salt have lost his savour , wherewith shall it be seasoned ?
text2: On da gatza : baina baldin gatza gueçat badadi , cerçaz gacituren da ?

text: It is neither fit for the land , nor yet for the dunghill ; but men cast it out . He that hath ears to hear , let him hear .
text2: Ezta lurrecotzat , ez ongarricotzat deusgay : baina camporat egoizten da hura . Ençuteco beharriric duenac , ençun beca .

text: Then drew near unto him all the publicans and sinners for to hear him .
text2: Eta hurbiltzen ciraden harengana publicano eta gende vicitze gaichtotaco guciac , hura ençun leçatençát .

text: And the Pharisees and scribes murmured , saying , This man receiveth sinners , and eateth with them .
text2: Eta murmuratzen çutén Phariseuéc eta Scribéc , cioitela , hunec gende vicitze gaichtotacoac recebitzen ditu , eta iaten du hequin .

text: And he spake this parable unto them , saying ,
text2: Baina harc erran ciecén comparatione haur , cioela ,

text: What man of you , having an hundred sheep , if he lose one of them , doth not leave the ninety and nine in the wilderness , and go after that which is lost , until he find it ?
text2: Cein guiçonec çuetaric ehun ardi dituela eta hetaric bat galtzen duela , eztitu vtziten lauroguey eta hemeretziac desertuan eta ezta ioaiten galduaren ondoan , hura eriden deçaqueno ?

text: And when he hath found it , he layeth it on his shoulders , rejoicing .
text2: Eta eriden duenean eçarten du bere sorbaldén gainean alegueraric .

text: And when he cometh home , he calleth together his friends and neighbours , saying unto them , Rejoice with me ; for I have found my sheep which was lost .
text2: Guero ethorriric etchera , deitzen ditu adisquideac eta auçoac , diostela , Aleguera çaitezte enequin : ecen eriden dut neure ardi galdua .

text: I say unto you , that likewise joy shall be in heaven over one sinner that repenteth , more than over ninety and nine just persons , which need no repentance .
text2: Erraiten drauçuet ecen hala bozcario içanen dela ceruän bekatore emendatzen den baten

text: Either what woman having ten pieces of silver , if she lose one piece , doth not light a candle , and sweep the house , and seek diligently till she find it ?
text2: Edo cein emazte hamar drachma dituenec , baldin gal badeça drachmabat , eztu arguia vizten eta etchea escobatzen , eta bilhatzen diligentqui hura eriden deçaqueno ?

text: And when she hath found it , she calleth her friends and her neighbours together , saying , Rejoice with me ; for I have found the piece which I had lost .
text2: Eta eriden duenean , deitzen ditu emazte adisquideac eta auçoac , dioela , Aleguera çaitezte enequin : ecen eriden dut galdu nuen drachmá .

text: Likewise , I say unto you , there is joy in the presence of the angels of God over one sinner that repenteth .
text2: Hala , diotsuet , bozcario içanen dela Iaincoaren Aingueruén aitzinean , bekatore emendatzen den baten gainean .

text: And he said , A certain man had two sons :
text2: Halaber erran ceçan , Guiçon batec cituen bi seme :

text: And the younger of them said to his father , Father , give me the portion of goods that falleth to me . And he divided unto them his living .
text2: Eta hetaric gaztenac erran cieçón aitári , Aitá , indac onhassunetic niri heltzen çaitadan partea . Eta parti cietzén onac .

text: And not many days after the younger son gathered all together , and took his journey into a far country , and there wasted his substance with riotous living .
text2: Eta egun gutiren buruän , guciac bilduric seme gaztenor ioan cedin herri vrrun batetara : eta han irion ceçan bere onhassuna , prodigoqui vici içanez .

text: And when he had spent all , there arose a mighty famine in that land ; and he began to be in want .
text2: Gucia despendatu vkan çuenean , eguin içan cen gossete gogorbat herri hartan , eta hura has cedin behar içaten :

text: And he went and joined himself to a citizen of that country ; and he sent him into his fields to feed swine .
text2: Eta ioanic leku hartaco burgés batequin iar cedin , eta harc igor ceçan bere possessionetara vrdén bazcatzera .

text: And he would fain have filled his belly with the husks that the swine did eat : and no man gave unto him .
text2: Eta desir çuen vrdéc iaten çuten maguinchetaric bere sabelaren bethatzera : eta nehorc etzeraucan emaiten .

text: And when he came to himself , he said , How many hired servants of my father ' s have bread enough and to spare , and I perish with hunger !
text2: Eta bere buruäri ohart cequionean , erran ceçan , Cembat alocacer diraden ene aitaren etchean oguia frango dutenic , eta ni gossez hiltzen bainaiz !

text: I will arise and go to my father , and will say unto him , Father , I have sinned against heaven , and before thee ,
text2: Iaiquiric ioanen naiz neure aitagana , eta erranen draucat , Aitá , huts eguin diat ceruären contra , eta hire aitzinean .

text: And am no more worthy to be called thy son : make me as one of thy hired servants .
text2: Eta guehiagoric eznauc digne hire seme deitzeco : eguin neçac eure alocaceretaric bat beçala .

text: And he arose , and came to his father . But when he was yet a great way off , his father saw him , and had compassion , and ran , and fell on his neck , and kissed him .
text2: Iaiquiric bada ethor cedin bere aitagana . Eta hura oraino vrrun cela , ikus ceçan bere aitac , eta compassione har ceçan , eta laster eguinic egotz ceçan bere buruä haren leppora , eta pot eguin cieçon .

text: And the son said unto him , Father , I have sinned against heaven , and in thy sight , and am no more worthy to be called thy son .
text2: Eta erran cieçón semeac , Aitá , huts eguin diat ceruären contra , eta hire aitzinean , eta guehiagoric eznauc digne hire seme deitzeco .

text: But the father said to his servants , Bring forth the best robe , and put it on him ; and put a ring on his hand , and shoes on his feet :
text2: Orduan erran ciecén aitác bere cerbitzariey , Ekarçue arropa principalena , eta iaunz eçoçue : eta emoçue erhaztumbat bere escura , eta çapatac oinetara :

text: And bring hither the fatted calf , and kill it ; and let us eat , and be merry :
text2: Eta ekarriric aretze guicena , hil eçaçue : eta iaten dugula atseguin har deçagun .

text: For this my son was dead , and is alive again ; he was lost , and is found . And they began to be merry .
text2: Ecen ene seme haur hil cen , eta harçara viztu da : galdu cen , eta eriden da . Eta has citecen atseguin hartzen .

text: Now his elder son was in the field : and as he came and drew nigh to the house , he heard musick and dancing .
text2: Eta cen haren seme çaharrena landán , eta ethorten cela etcheari hurbildu çayonean , ençun citzan melodiá eta dançác .

text: And he called one of the servants , and asked what these things meant .
text2: Eta deithuric cerbitzarietaric bat , interroga ceçan hura cer cen .

text: And he said unto him , Thy brother is come ; and thy father hath killed the fatted calf , because he hath received him safe and sound .
text2: Eta harc erran cieçón , hire anaye ethorri içan duc , eta hil vkan dic hire aitac aretze guicembat , ceren ossoric hura recebitu duen .

text: And he was angry , and would not go in : therefore came his father out , and intreated him .
text2: Eta asserre cedin : eta etzén sarthu nahi içan : bere aitác bada ilkiric othoitz eguin cieçon .

text: And he answering said to his father , Lo , these many years do I serve thee , neither transgressed I at any time thy commandment : and yet thou never gavest me a kid , that I might make merry with my friends :
text2: Baina harc ihardesten çuela erran cieçón bere aitari , Huná , hambat vrthe dic cerbitzatzen audala , eta egundano hire manuric eztiat iragan , eta egundano pitinabat eztrautac eman neure adisquidequin atseguin hartzeco .

text: But as soon as this thy son was come , which hath devoured thy living with harlots , thou hast killed for him the fatted calf .
text2: Baina hire seme haur , ceinec iretsi vkan baitu hire onhassun gucia putéquin , ethorri içan denean , hil vkan draucac huni aretze guicena .

text: And he said unto him , Son , thou art ever with me , and all that I have is thine .
text2: Eta harc erran cieçón , Semé , hi bethi enequin aiz , eta ene gucia hire duc :

text: It was meet that we should make merry , and be glad : for this thy brother was dead , and is alive again ; and was lost , and is found .
text2: Eta atseguin hartu behar çuán eta alegueratu , ceren hire anaye haur hil baitzén , eta viztu baita , galdu baitzén , eta eriden baita .

text: And he said also unto his disciples , There was a certain rich man , which had a steward ; and the same was accused unto him that he had wasted his goods .
text2: Eta erran ciecén bere discipuluey - ere , Guiçon abratsbat cen despenserbat çuenic , haur accusa cedin hura baithan , haren onén irioile beçala :

text: And he called him , and said unto him , How is it that I hear this of thee ? give an account of thy stewardship ; for thou mayest be no longer steward .
text2: Eta hura deithuric erran cieçón , Cer dançut haur hiçaz ? renda eçac eure despensaren contua : ecen guehiagoric ecin aiçate despensér .

text: Then the steward said within himself , What shall I do ? for my lord taketh away from me the stewardship : I cannot dig ; to beg I am ashamed .
text2: Orduan erran ceçan bere baithan despenserac , Cer eguinen dut , neure nabussiac despensaren carguä edequiten drautanaz gueroz ? aitzurreric ecin daidit , esque ebiltera ahalque naiz .

text: I am resolved what to do , that , when I am put out of the stewardship , they may receive me into their houses .
text2: Badaquit cer eguinen dudan , despensergoatic kendu naicenean recebi neçatençát batzuc bere etchetara .

text: So he called every one of his lord ' s debtors unto him , and said unto the first , How much owest thou unto my lord ?
text2: Orduan deithuric bere nabussiaren çordunetaric batbedera , erran cieçón lehenari , Cembat çor draucac ene nabussiari ?

text: And he said , An hundred measures of oil . And he said unto him , Take thy bill , and sit down quickly , and write fifty .
text2: Eta hunec erran ceçan , Ehun barril olio : eta harc erran cieçón , Har eçac eure cedulá , eta iarriric fitetz , scriba eçac berroguey eta hamar

text: Then said he to another , And how much owest thou ? And he said , An hundred measures of wheat . And he said unto him , Take thy bill , and write fourscore .
text2: Guero berce bati erran cieçón , Eta hic cembat çorduc ? eta harc erran ceçan , Ehun neurri ogui . Orduan harc erran cieçón , Har eçac eure cedulá , eta scriba eçac lauroguey .

text: And the lord commended the unjust steward , because he had done wisely : for the children of this world are in their generation wiser than the children of light .
text2: Eta lauda ceçan nabussiac despenser gaichtoa , ceren çuhurqui eguin vkan baitzuen : hunegatic mundu hunetaco haourrac çuhurrago dirade , ecen ez arguico haourrac bere generationean

text: And I say unto you , Make to yourselves friends of the mammon of unrighteousness ; that , when ye fail , they may receive you into everlasting habitations .
text2: Eta nic erraiten drauçuet , Eguin itzaçue çuendaco adisquideac abrastassun iniquoéz falta çaiteztenean recebi çaitzatençat tabernacle eternaletara .

text: He that is faithful in that which is least is faithful also in much : and he that is unjust in the least is unjust also in much .
text2: Gauça chipienetan leyal dena , handian - ere leyal da : eta gauça chipian iniusto dena , handian - ere iniusto da .

text: If therefore ye have not been faithful in the unrighteous mammon , who will commit to your trust the true riches ?
text2: Bada baldin abrastassun iniquoetan leyal içan ezpaçarete , abrastassun eguiazcoetan nor fidaturen çaiçue ?

text: And if ye have not been faithful in that which is another man ' s , who shall give you that which is your own ?
text2: Eta baldin berceren gauçán leyal içan ezpaçarete , çuen dena norc emanen drauçue ?

text: No servant can serve two masters : for either he will hate the one , and love the other ; or else he will hold to the one , and despise the other . Ye cannot serve God and mammon .
text2: Cerbitzaric batec - ere ecin bi nabussi cerbitza ditzaque : ecen edo batari gaitz eritziren drauca , eta berceari on : edo batarequin eduquiren du eta bercea menospreciaturen . Ecin cerbitza ditzaqueçue Iaincoa , eta abrastassunac

text: And the Pharisees also , who were covetous , heard all these things : and they derided him .
text2: Eta gauça hauc guciac ençuten cituzten Phariseuec - ere , cein baitziraden auaritioso : eta harçaz truffatzen ciraden

text: And he said unto them , Ye are they which justify yourselves before men ; but God knoweth your hearts : for that which is highly esteemed among men is abomination in the sight of God .
text2: Eta erran ciecén , Çuec çarete çuen buruäc iustificatzen dituçuenac guiçonén aitzinean : baina Iaincoac badaçaguzqui çuen bihotzac : ecen guiçoney gora çayena , abominatione da Iaincoaren aitzinean .

text: The law and the prophets were until John : since that time the kingdom of God is preached , and every man presseth into it .
text2: Legueac eta Prophetéc iraun duté Ioannesganano : dembora harçaz gueroztic Iaincoaren resumá euangelizatzen da , eta batbederac hura du bortchatzen .

text: And it is easier for heaven and earth to pass , than one tittle of the law to fail .
text2: Errachago da ceruä eta lurra iragan ditecen , ecen ez Leguearen punctu hutsbat eror dadin .

text: Whosoever putteth away his wife , and marrieth another , committeth adultery : and whosoever marrieth her that is put away from her husband committeth adultery .
text2: Norc - ere vtziten baitu bere emaztea , eta berce batequin ezconcen baita , adulterio iauquiten du : eta senharrac vtzi duenarequin ezconcen denac , adulterio iauquiten du .

text: There was a certain rich man , which was clothed in purple and fine linen , and fared sumptuously every day :
text2: Cen bada guiçon abratsbat , eta veztitzen cen escarlataz eta cetaz , eta egun oroz tractatzen cen vngui eta magnificoqui .

text: And there was a certain beggar named Lazarus , which was laid at his gate , full of sores ,
text2: Cen halaber paubrebat Lazaro deitzen cenic , cein baitzetzan haren borthán , çauriz bethea :

text: And desiring to be fed with the crumbs which fell from the rich man ' s table : moreover the dogs came and licked his sores .
text2: Eta çuen desir abratsaren mahainetic erorten ciraden appurretaric assetzeco , baina are orac ethorten ciraden eta haren çauriac limicatzen cituztén .

text: And it came to pass , that the beggar died , and was carried by the angels into Abraham ' s bosom : the rich man also died , and was buried ;
text2: Guertha cedin bada hil baitzedin paubrea , eta eraman baitzedin Aingueruéz Abrahamen bulharrera : hil cedin bada abrats hura - ere , eta ohortze içan cen .

text: And in hell he lift up his eyes , being in torments , and seeth Abraham afar off , and Lazarus in his bosom .
text2: Eta iffernuetan bere beguiac goiti altchaturic tormentetan cela , ikus ceçan Abraham vrrundanic , eta Lazaro haren bulharrean :

text: And he cried and said , Father Abraham , have mercy on me , and send Lazarus , that he may dip the tip of his finger in water , and cool my tongue ; for I am tormented in this flame .
text2: Orduan harc oihuz cegoela erran ceçan , Aita Abrahám , auc misericordia niçaz , eta igor eçac Lazaro , busta deçan bere erhi mocoa vrean , eta refresca dieçadan mihia , ecen tormentatzen nauc gar hunetan .

text: But Abraham said , Son , remember that thou in thy lifetime receivedst thy good things , and likewise Lazarus evil things : but now he is comforted , and thou art tormented .
text2: Eta erran ceçan Abrahamec , Semé , orhoit adi ecen eure onac eure vician recebitu dituala , eta Lazaroc halaber gaitzac : eta orain haur consolatzen duc , eta hi tormentatzen aiz .

text: And beside all this , between us and you there is a great gulf fixed : so that they which would pass from hence to you cannot ; neither can they pass to us , that would come from thence .
text2: Eta berce alde , gure eta çuen artean abysmo handibat duc : hala non hemendic çuetarát iragan nahi diradenac , ecin baititezque , ezeta hortic hunát iragan .

text: Then he said , I pray thee therefore , father , that thou wouldest send him to my father ' s house :
text2: Eta erran ceçan harc , Othoitz eguiten drauat beraz , Aitá , igor deçán hori ene aitaren etchera .

text: For I have five brethren ; that he may testify unto them , lest they also come into this place of torment .
text2: Ecen bacitiat borz anaye , hæy testifica diecençát , hec - ere eztatocençat tormentazco leku hunetara .

text: Abraham saith unto him , They have Moses and the prophets ; let them hear them .
text2: Diotsa Abrahamec , Bacitié Moyses eta Prophetác : ençun bitzate hec .

text: And he said , Nay , father Abraham : but if one went unto them from the dead , they will repent .
text2: Baina harc erran ceçan , Ez , aita Abrahám : baina baldin hiletaric cembeit ioan badadi hetara , emendaturen dituc .

text: And he said unto him , If they hear not Moses and the prophets , neither will they be persuaded , though one rose from the dead .
text2: Eta Abrahamec erran cieçón , Baldin Moyses eta Prophetác ençuten ezpadituzte , ezeta baldin cembeit hiletaric resuscita badadi - ere , eztié sinhetsiren .

text: Then said he unto the disciples , It is impossible but that offences will come : but woe unto him , through whom they come !
text2: Guehiago dioste bere discipuluey , Impossible da scandaloac eztatocen : baina maledictione hari , norçaz ethorten baitirade .

text: It were better for him that a millstone were hanged about his neck , and he cast into the sea , than that he should offend one of these little ones .
text2: Harc hobe luque baldin errota harribat haren leppoaren inguruan eçar baledi , eta egotz ledin itsassora , ecen ez chipi hautaric bat scandaliza deçan .

text: Take heed to yourselves : If thy brother trespass against thee , rebuke him ; and if he repent , forgive him .
text2: Beguira çaitezte , Baldin hire anayec hire contra faltatu badu , reprehendi eçac hura , eta baldin emenda badadi barka ieçóc .

text: And if he trespass against thee seven times in a day , and seven times in a day turn again to thee , saying , I repent ; thou shalt forgive him .
text2: Eta baldin çazpitan egunean faltatzen badu hire contra , eta çazpitan egunean itzultzen bada hiregana , dioela , Dolu diát : barkaturen draucac .

text: And the apostles said unto the Lord , Increase our faith .
text2: Orduan erran cieçoten Apostoluéc Iaunari , Augmenta ieçaguc fedea .

text: And the Lord said , If ye had faith as a grain of mustard seed , ye might say unto this sycamine tree , Be thou plucked up by the root , and be thou planted in the sea ; and it should obey you .
text2: Eta erran ceçan Iaunac , Baldin fede bacindute mustarda bihibat den becembat , erran ahal cineçaqueote marçucér huni , Erroetaric ilki adi , eta landa adi itsassoan : eta obedi cinçaqueizte .

text: But which of you , having a servant plowing or feeding cattle , will say unto him by and by , when he is come from the field , Go and sit down to meat ?
text2: Baina ceinec çuetaric , cerbitzaribat duenean laboratzen edo abrén bazcatzen ari denic , landatic itzuli denean erraiten drauca bertan , Auançadi , eta iar adi mahainean .

text: And will not rather say unto him , Make ready wherewith I may sup , and gird thyself , and serve me , till I have eaten and drunken ; and afterward thou shalt eat and drink ?
text2: Bainaitzitic eztrauca erraiten , Appain ieçadac affaria , eta guerricaturic cerbitza neçac , ian eta edan duquedano : eta guero ian eta edan eçac hic ?

text: Doth he thank that servant because he did the things that were commanded him ? I trow not .
text2: Esquerric othe drauca cerbitzari hari , ceren eguin baititu manatu içan çaizcan gauçác ? Eztut vste .

text: So likewise ye , when ye shall have done all those things which are commanded you , say , We are unprofitable servants : we have done that which was our duty to do .
text2: Hala çuec - ere , eguin dituqueçuenean manatu içan çaizquiçuen gauça guciac , erraçue , Cerbitzari inutilac gara : eguin behar guenduena eguin vkan dugu .

text: And it came to pass , as he went to Jerusalem , that he passed through the midst of Samaria and Galilee .
text2: Eta guertha cedin hura Ierusalemerat ioaitean iragaiten baitzen Samariaco eta Galileaco artetic .

text: And as he entered into a certain village , there met him ten men that were lepers , which stood afar off :
text2: Eta hura burgu batetan sartzen cela , bathu içan çaizcan hamar guiçon sorhayo , eta gueldi citecen vrrun :

text: And they lifted up their voices , and said , Jesus , Master , have mercy on us .
text2: Eta altcha ceçaten voza , cioitela , Iesus magistruá , auc misericordia guçaz .

text: And when he saw them , he said unto them , Go shew yourselves unto the priests . And it came to pass , that , as they went , they were cleansed .
text2: Eta ikussi citunean erran ciecén , Çoazte , eracuts ietzeçue çuen buruäc Sacrificadorey . Eta guertha cedin , ioaiten ciradela chahu baitzitecen .

text: And one of them , when he saw that he was healed , turned back , and with a loud voice glorified God ,
text2: Eta hetaric batec ikussi çuenean , ecen sendatu cela , itzul cedin , glorificatzen çuela Iaincoa ocengui :

text: And fell down on his face at his feet , giving him thanks : and he was a Samaritan .
text2: Eta egotz ceçan bere buruä ahozpez haren oinetara , esquerrac emaiten cerauzcala , eta haur cen Samaritano .

text: And Jesus answering said , Were there not ten cleansed ? but where are the nine ?
text2: Eta ihardesten çuela Iesusec erran ceçan , Eztirade hamarrac chahutu içan ? Bedratziac bada non dirade ?

text: There are not found that returned to give glory to God , save this stranger .
text2: Batre ezta eriden içan itzuli denic , Iaincoari gloria emaitera , arrotz haur baicen .

text: And he said unto him , Arise , go thy way : thy faith hath made thee whole .
text2: Eta erran cieçón hari , Iaiquiric oha , eure fedeac saluatu au .

text: And when he was demanded of the Pharisees , when the kingdom of God should come , he answered them and said , The kingdom of God cometh not with observation :
text2: Eta interrogatu içanic Phariseuéz noiz ethorteco cen Iaincoaren resumá : ihardets ciecén , eta erran , Ezta ethorriren Iaincoaren resumá paradarequin :

text: Neither shall they say , Lo here ! or , lo there ! for , behold , the kingdom of God is within you .
text2: Eta eztute erranen , Huná hemen , edo , hará han : ecen huná , Iaincoaren resumá barnean duçue .

text: And he said unto the disciples , The days will come , when ye shall desire to see one of the days of the Son of man , and ye shall not see it .
text2: Halaber erran ciecén discipuluey , Ethorriren dirade egunac desiraturen baituçue guiçonaren Semearen egunetaric baten ikustera , eta ezpaituçue ikussiren .

text: And they shall say to you , See here ; or , see there : go not after them , nor follow them .
text2: Eta erranen çaiçue çuey , Huna hemen , edo , hara han : baina etzoaztela , eta etzarreiztela .

text: For as the lightning , that lighteneth out of the one part under heaven , shineth unto the other part under heaven ; so shall also the Son of man be in his day .
text2: Ecen nola chistmistac argui eguiten baitu ceruären azpian den bazter batetic , eta arguitzen berce bazter ceruären azpian denerano : hala içanen da guiçonaren Semea - ere bere egunean .

text: But first must he suffer many things , and be rejected of this generation .
text2: Baina lehen behar da anhitz suffri deçan harc , eta reproba dadin natione hunez .

text: And as it was in the days of Noe , so shall it be also in the days of the Son of man .
text2: Eta nola eguin baitzedin Noeren egunetan , hala içanen da guiçonaren Semearen egunetan - ere .

text: They did eat , they drank , they married wives , they were given in marriage , until the day that Noe entered into the ark , and the flood came , and destroyed them all .
text2: Iaten çutén , edaten çutén , emazte hartzen çutén eta ezconçaz emaiten , Noe arkán sar cedin egunerano : eta ethor cedin dilubioa , eta gal citzan guciac .

text: Likewise also as it was in the days of Lot ; they did eat , they drank , they bought , they sold , they planted , they builded ;
text2: Halaber Lot - en egunetan - ere eguin içan cen beçala : iaten çutén , edaten çutén , erosten çutén , saltzen çutén , landatzen çutén , edificatzen çutén :

text: But the same day that Lot went out of Sodom it rained fire and brimstone from heaven , and destroyed them all .
text2: Baina Lot Sodomatic ilki cen egunean , suz eta suphrez vri eguin ceçan cerutic , eta guciac deseguin citzan :

text: Even thus shall it be in the day when the Son of man is revealed .
text2: Halaber içanen da guiçonaren Semea declaraturen den egunean .

text: In that day , he which shall be upon the housetop , and his stuff in the house , let him not come down to take it away : and he that is in the field , let him likewise not return back .
text2: Egun hartan etche gainean datena , eta bere ostillamendua etchean badu , ezalbeiledi iauts haren eramaitera : eta landán dena , halaber ezalbeiledi itzul guibelecoetara .

text: Remember Lot ' s wife .
text2: Orhoit çaitezte Lot - en emazteaz .

text: Whosoever shall seek to save his life shall lose it ; and whosoever shall lose his life shall preserve it .
text2: Nor - ere enseyaturen baita bere viciaren saluatzen , harc du galduren hura : eta norc - ere galduren baitu , viuificaturen du hura .

text: I tell you , in that night there shall be two men in one bed ; the one shall be taken , and the other shall be left .
text2: Erraiten drauçuet , gau hartan biga içanen dirade ohe batetan : bata harturen da , eta bercea vtziren .

text: Two women shall be grinding together ; the one shall be taken , and the other left .
text2: Biga içanen dirade elkarrequin errotan ehaiten duqueitenic : bata harturen da , eta bercea vtziren .

text: Two men shall be in the field ; the one shall be taken , and the other left .
text2: Biga içanen dirade landán : bata harturen da , eta bercea vtziren .

text: And they answered and said unto him , Where , Lord ? And he said unto them , Wheresoever the body is , thither will the eagles be gathered together .
text2: Orduan ihardesten dutela , erraiten draucate , Non Iauna ? Eta harc erran ciecén , Non - ere içanen baita gorputza , hara bilduren dirade arranoac - ere .

text: And he spake a parable unto them to this end , that men ought always to pray , and not to faint ;
text2: Eta erran ciecen comparationebat - ere fin hunetaracotz ecen bethi othoitz eguin behar dela , enoyatu gabe :

text: Saying , There was in a city a judge , which feared not God , neither regarded man :
text2: Cioela , Iugebat cen hiri batetan Iaincoaren beldur etzenic , eta nehorçaz conturic eguiten etzuenic :

text: And there was a widow in that city ; and she came unto him , saying , Avenge me of mine adversary .
text2: Eta cen hiri hartan emazte alhargumbat , eta ethor cedin harengana , cioela , Eguidac iustitia neure partida contrastaz .

text: And he would not for a while : but afterward he said within himself , Though I fear not God , nor regard man ;
text2: Eta harc etzuen deus eguin nahi vkan dembora lucez : baina guero erran ceçan bere baithan , Iaincoaren beldur ezpanaiz - ere eta nehorçaz conturic ez eguitenagatic :

text: Yet because this widow troubleth me , I will avenge her , lest by her continual coming she weary me .
text2: Badaric - ere ceren fascheria emaiten baitraut alhargun hunec , iustitia eguinen draucat , finean - ere ethorriz buruä hauts eztieçadan .

text: And the Lord said , Hear what the unjust judge saith .
text2: Eta dio Iaunac , Ençuçue cer iuge gaichto harc erraiten duen :

text: And shall not God avenge his own elect , which cry day and night unto him , though he bear long with them ?
text2: Bada Iaincoac eztraue iustitia eguinen bere elegitu gau eta egun hari oihuz dagozcaney , hayén alde asserretzera luçatzen badu - ere ?

text: I tell you that he will avenge them speedily . Nevertheless when the Son of man cometh , shall he find faith on the earth ?
text2: Erraiten drauçuet , ecen hayén mendequioa eguinen duela sarri . Baina guiçonaren Semea dathorrenean , eridenen othe du federic lurrean ?

text: And he spake this parable unto certain which trusted in themselves that they were righteous , and despised others :
text2: Eta erran ciecén bere buruètan iusto ciradela fida ciraden batzuey , eta berceac deus - ere estimatzen etzituzteney , comparatione haur :

text: Two men went up into the temple to pray ; the one a Pharisee , and the other a publican .
text2: Bi guiçon igan içan ciraden templera othoitz eguitera , bata Phariseu eta bercea publicano :

text: The Pharisee stood and prayed thus with himself , God , I thank thee , that I am not as other men are , extortioners , unjust , adulterers , or even as this publican .
text2: Phariseuac cegoela gauça hauçaz bere baithan othoitz eguiten çuen , Iaincoá , esquerrac emaiten drauzquiat ceren ezpainaiz berce guiçon harrapariac , iniustoac , adulteroac beçala : edo publicano haur beçala - ere .

text: I fast twice in the week , I give tithes of all that I possess .
text2: Astean biguetan eguiten diat barur , posseditzen ditudan gauça guçietaric hamarrenac emaiten citiát .

text: And the publican , standing afar off , would not lift up so much as his eyes unto heaven , but smote upon his breast , saying , God be merciful to me a sinner .
text2: Eta publicanoac vrrun cegoela , etzituen are beguiac - ere cerurat altchatu nahi : baina bere bulharrari ceraunsón , cioela , Iauna , amatiga aquit , othoi niri bekatoreoni .

text: I tell you , this man went down to his house justified rather than the other : for every one that exalteth himself shall be abased ; and he that humbleth himself shall be exalted .
text2: Badiotsuet , iautsi içan dela haur iustificaturic bere etcherat , eta ez bercea : ecen bere buruä goratzen duen gucia , beheraturen da : eta bere buruä beheratzen duena , goraturen da .

text: And they brought unto him also infants , that he would touch them : but when his disciples saw it , they rebuked them .
text2: Eta ekarten cituzten harengana haour chipiac - ere , hec hunqui litzançat : eta hori ikus ceçatenean discipuluéc , mehatcha citzaten .

text: But Jesus called them unto him , and said , Suffer little children to come unto me , and forbid them not : for of such is the kingdom of God .
text2: Baina Iesusec haourtchoac beregana deithuric , erran ceçan , Vtzitzaçue haourtchoac enegana ethortera , eta eztitzaçuela empatcha : ecen hunelacoén da Iaincoaren resumá .

text: Verily I say unto you , Whosoever shall not receive the kingdom of God as a little child shall in no wise enter therein .
text2: Eguiaz erraiten drauçuet , norc - ere ezpaitu recebituren Iaincoaren resumá haourtchoac beçala , eztela sarthuren hartan .

text: And a certain ruler asked him , saying , Good Master , what shall I do to inherit eternal life ?
text2: Orduan interroga ceçan cembeit iaunec , cioela , Magistru oná , cer eguinez , vicitze eternala possedituren dut ?

text: And Jesus said unto him , Why callest thou me good ? none is good , save one , that is , God .
text2: Eta erran cieçon Iesusec , Cergatic deitzen nauc ni on ? nehor eztuc onic bat baicen , eta hura , Iaincoa .

text: Thou knowest the commandments , Do not commit adultery , Do not kill , Do not steal , Do not bear false witness , Honour thy father and thy mother .
text2: Manamenduac badaquizquic , Eztuc adulteraturen , Eztuc hilen , Eztuc ebatsiren , Eztuc testimoniage falsuric erranen , Ohoraitzac eure aita eta eure ama .

text: And he said , All these have I kept from my youth up .
text2: Eta harc erran ceçan , Horiac guciac beguiratu citiát neure gaztetassunetic .

text: Now when Jesus heard these things , he said unto him , Yet lackest thou one thing : sell all that thou hast , and distribute unto the poor , and thou shalt have treasure in heaven : and come , follow me .
text2: Eta Iesusec hori ençunic erran cieçón , Oraino gauçabat falta çaic : duán gucia sal eçac eta eman iecec paubrey : eta vkanen duc thesaurbat ceruän : eta athor , arreit niri .

text: And when he heard this , he was very sorrowful : for he was very rich .
text2: Eta hura gauça horiac ençunic , triste cedin : ecen guciz abratsa cen .

text: And when Jesus saw that he was very sorrowful , he said , How hardly shall they that have riches enter into the kingdom of God !
text2: Eta ikussiric Iesusec hura haguitz tristetu cela , erran ceçan , Cein gaitz den onhassundunac Iaincoaren resumán sar ditecen !

text: For it is easier for a camel to go through a needle ' s eye , than for a rich man to enter into the kingdom of God .
text2: Ecen errachago da cablebat sar dadin orratzaren çulhotic , ecen ez abratsa sar dadin Iaincoaren resumán .

text: And they that heard it said , Who then can be saved ?
text2: Eta haur ençun vkan çutenéc erran ceçaten , Eta nor salua ahal daite ?

text: And he said , The things which are impossible with men are possible with God .
text2: Eta harc erran ceçan , Guiçonac baithan impossible diraden gauçác , possible dirade Iaincoa baithan .

text: Then Peter said , Lo , we have left all , and followed thee .
text2: Eta erran ceçan Pierrisec , Huná , guc vtzi citiagu gauça guciác , eta iarreiqui gaitzaizquic hiri .

text: And he said unto them , Verily I say unto you , There is no man that hath left house , or parents , or brethren , or wife , or children , for the kingdom of God ' s sake ,
text2: Eta harc erran ciecén , Eguiaz erraiten drauçuet , nehor eztela vtzi duenic etchea , edo aitamác , edo anayeac , edo emaztea , edo haourrac Iaincoaren resumaren causaz ,

text: Who shall not receive manifold more in this present time , and in the world to come life everlasting .
text2: Non vnguiz guehiago recebi ezteçan dembora hunetan , eta ethorteco den seculán vicitze eternala .

text: Then he took unto him the twelve , and said unto them , Behold , we go up to Jerusalem , and all things that are written by the prophets concerning the Son of man shall be accomplished .
text2: Eta harturic hamabiac erran ciecen , Huná , igaiten gara Ierusalemera , eta complituren çaizquió , guiçonaren Semeari Prophetéz scribatu içan diraden gauça guciac .

text: For he shall be delivered unto the Gentiles , and shall be mocked , and spitefully entreated , and spitted on :
text2: Ecen Gentiley liuraturen çaye , eta escarniaturen eta iniuriaturen eta thustaturen da .

text: And they shall scourge him , and put him to death : and the third day he shall rise again .
text2: Eta açotatu duqueitenean , hilen duté : baina hereneco egunean resuscitaturen da .

text: And they understood none of these things : and this saying was hid from them , neither knew they the things which were spoken .
text2: Eta hec gauça hautaric etzeçaten deus adi : eta ciraden hitz hauc hetaric estaliac , eta erraiten ciradenac etzituzten aditzen .

text: And it came to pass , that as he was come nigh unto Jericho , a certain blind man sat by the way side begging :
text2: Eta guertha cedin hura Iericorát hurbiltzen cela , itsubat baitzén iarria bide bazterrean esque cegoela .

text: And hearing the multitude pass by , he asked what it meant .
text2: Eta harc ençun ceçanean populua iragaiten , galde eguin ceçan , hura cer cen .

text: And they told him , that Jesus of Nazareth passeth by .
text2: Eta erran cieçoten ecen Iesus Nazareno iragaiten cela .

text: And he cried , saying , Jesus , thou Son of David , have mercy on me .
text2: Orduan oihu eguin ceçan , cioela , Iesus Dauid - en semeá , auc pietate niçaz .

text: And they which went before rebuked him , that he should hold his peace : but he cried so much the more , Thou Son of David , have mercy on me .
text2: Eta aitzinean ioaiten ciradenéc mehatchatzen çutén ichil ledinçát : baina harc vnguiz oihu guehiago eguiten çuen , Dauid - en semea , auc pietate niçaz .

text: And Jesus stood , and commanded him to be brought unto him : and when he was come near , he asked him ,
text2: Eta Iesusec gueldituric mana ceçan ekar lequion beregana , eta hura hurbildu içan cenean , interroga ceçan ,

text: Saying , What wilt thou that I shall do unto thee ? And he said , Lord , that I may receive my sight .
text2: Cioela , Cer nahi duc daguiadan ? Eta harc erran ceçan , Iauna , vistá recebi deçadan .

text: And Jesus said unto him , Receive thy sight : thy faith hath saved thee .
text2: Eta Iesusec erran cieçón , recebi eçac vistá : eure fedeac saluatu au .

text: And immediately he received his sight , and followed him , glorifying God : and all the people , when they saw it , gave praise unto God .
text2: Eta bertan ikus ceçan , eta hari iarreiquiten çayón , glorificatzen çuela Iaincoa : Eta populu guciac hori ikussiric eman cieçon laudorio Iaincoari .

text: And Jesus entered and passed through Jericho .
text2: Eta sarthuric Iericon , iragaiten cen .

text: And , behold , there was a man named Zacchaeus , which was the chief among the publicans , and he was rich .
text2: Eta huná , Zaccheo deitzen cen guiçombat , eta hura cen publicano principal , eta abrats :

text: And he sought to see Jesus who he was ; and could not for the press , because he was little of stature .
text2: Eta ikussi nahiz çabilan , cein cen Iesus : eta ecin ceçaqueen gendetzearen causaz : ecen thaillu chipitaco cen .

text: And he ran before , and climbed up into a sycomore tree to see him : for he was to pass that way .
text2: Eta aitzinera laster eguinic igan cedin bassa ficotze batetara , hura ikus leçançat : ecen handic iragan behar çuen .

text: And when Jesus came to the place , he looked up , and saw him , and said unto him , Zacchaeus , make haste , and come down ; for to day I must abide at thy house .
text2: Eta leku hartara ethor cedin beçala goiti behaturic Iesusec ikus ceçan hura : eta erran cieçon , Zaccheo , haitsa lehiatuqui : ecen egun hire etchean egon behar diat .

text: And he made haste , and came down , and received him joyfully .
text2: Orduan haur iauts cedin lehiatuqui , eta recebi ceçan hura alegueraqui .

text: And when they saw it , they all murmured , saying , That he was gone to be guest with a man that is a sinner .
text2: Eta hori ikussiric guciéc murmuratzen çuten , cioitela , Ecen guiçon vicitze gaichtotaco batenean sarthu cela , alogea ledinçát .

text: And Zacchaeus stood , and said unto the Lord ; Behold , Lord , the half of my goods I give to the poor ; and if I have taken any thing from any man by false accusation , I restore him fourfold .
text2: Eta han cegoela Zaccheoc erran cieçón Iaunari , Huná , neure onén erdiac , Iauna , emaiten diraizteat paubrey : eta baldin deus nehori bidegabequi edequi badraucat , rendatzen diat halaco laur .

text: And Jesus said unto him , This day is salvation come to this house , forsomuch as he also is a son of Abraham .
text2: Orduan Iesusec erran cieçón , Egun saluamendua etche huni eguin içan ciayóc , ceren haur - ere Abrahamen seme baita .

text: For the Son of man is come to seek and to save that which was lost .
text2: Ecen ethorri içan da guiçonaren Semea galdu içan cena bilha eta salua leçançat .

text: And as they heard these things , he added and spake a parable , because he was nigh to Jerusalem , and because they thought that the kingdom of God should immediately appear .
text2: Eta hec gauça hauc ençuten cituztela , continuatzen çuen , eta erran ceçan comparationebat , ceren baitzén Ierusalemeco aldean , eta ceren vste baitzutén bertan Iaincoaren resumá manifestaturen cela .

text: He said therefore , A certain nobleman went into a far country to receive for himself a kingdom , and to return .
text2: Erran ceçan bada , Guiçon noblebat parti cedin leku vrrun batetara , resuma baten conquestatzera , guero itzultzecotán .

text: And he called his ten servants , and delivered them ten pounds , and said unto them , Occupy till I come .
text2: Eta deithuric hamar cerbitzari bereric , eman cietzén hamar marco , eta erran ciecén , Traffica eçaçue nathorren artean .

text: But his citizens hated him , and sent a message after him , saying , We will not have this man to reign over us .
text2: Eta bere ciuitatecoéc çaritzoten gaitz , eta igor cieçoten embachadorebat guibeletic , cioitela , Eztugu nahi horrec regna deçan gure gainean .

text: And it came to pass , that when he was returned , having received the kingdom , then he commanded these servants to be called unto him , to whom he had given the money , that he might know how much every man had gained by trading .
text2: Eta guertha cedin itzuli cenean resumá conquestaturic , mana baitzeçan dei lequizquion diruä eman cerauen cerbitzariac , laquiançat norc cer traffica eguin çuen .

text: Then came the first , saying , Lord , thy pound hath gained ten pounds .
text2: Ethor cedin bada lehena , cioela , Iauna , hire marcoac hamar marco irabaci citic .

text: And he said unto him , Well , thou good servant : because thou hast been faithful in a very little , have thou authority over ten cities .
text2: Eta harc erran cieçón , Vngui duc cerbitzari oná : ceren gauça chipian leyal içan baitaiz , auc bothere , hamar hiriren gainean .

text: And the second came , saying , Lord , thy pound hath gained five pounds .
text2: Eta bercea ethor cedin , cioela , Iauna , hire marcoac eguin citic borz marco .

text: And he said likewise to him , Be thou also over five cities .
text2: Eta harc huni - ere erran cieçón , Hi - ere aicén borz hiriren gaineco .

text: And another came , saying , Lord , behold , here is thy pound , which I have kept laid up in a napkin :
text2: Eta bercea ethor cedin , cioela , Iauna , huná hire marcoa , cein eduqui baitut gorderic oihal batetan :

text: For I feared thee , because thou art an austere man : thou takest up that thou layedst not down , and reapest that thou didst not sow .
text2: Ecen hire beldur içan nauc , ceren baitaiz guiçon gogorra : hartzen duc eçarri eztuana , eta biltzen duc erein eztuana .

text: And he saith unto him , Out of thine own mouth will I judge thee , thou wicked servant . Thou knewest that I was an austere man , taking up that I laid not down , and reaping that I did not sow :
text2: Orduan harc erran cieçón , Eure ahotic iugeaturen aut , cerbitzari gaichtoá : bahaquian ecen guiçon gogorra naicela , hartzen dudala eçarri eztudana , eta biltzen dudala erein eztudana :

text: Wherefore then gavest not thou my money into the bank , that at my coming I might have required mine own with usury ?
text2: Nola beraz eztuc ene diruä banquean eman , eta nic hura lucuruarequin erekarri bainuqueen ?

text: And he said unto them that stood by , Take from him the pound , and give it to him that hath ten pounds .
text2: Eta present ciradeney erran ciecen , Edequi eçoçue marcoa , eta emoçue hamar dituenari .

text: ( And they said unto him , Lord , he hath ten pounds . )
text2: Eta hec erran cieçoten , Iauna , bacitic hamar marco .

text: For I say unto you , That unto every one which hath shall be given ; and from him that hath not , even that he hath shall be taken away from him .
text2: Hala diotsuet , ecen duen guciari emanen çayola , eta eztuenari , duena - ere edequiren çayola .

text: But those mine enemies , which would not that I should reign over them , bring hither , and slay them before me .
text2: Guehiago , ene etsay nic hayén gainean regna neçan nahi vkan eztuten hec , ekatzue huna eta hil itzaçue ene aitzinean .

text: And when he had thus spoken , he went before , ascending up to Jerusalem .
text2: Eta gauça hauc erranic , aitzinean ioaiten cen Ierusalemerat igaiten cela .

text: And it came to pass , when he was come nigh to Bethphage and Bethany , at the mount called the mount of Olives , he sent two of his disciples ,
text2: Eta guertha cedin , hurbildu cenean Bethphagera eta Bethaniara , Oliuatzetaco deitzen den mendi aldera , igor baitzitzan bere discipuluetaric biga ,

text: Saying , Go ye into the village over against you ; in the which at your entering ye shall find a colt tied , whereon yet never man sat : loose him , and bring him hither .
text2: Erraiten çuela , Çoazte çuen aurkaco burgura : hartan sarthu eta , eridenen duçue asto - vme arbat estecatua , egundano nehor gainean iarri etzayonic : hura lachaturic ekardaçue .

text: And if any man ask you , Why do ye loose him ? thus shall ye say unto him , Because the Lord hath need of him .
text2: Eta baldin nehorc galde badaguiçue , Cergatic lachatzen duçue ? Hunela erranen draucaçue , Ceren Iaunac hunen beharra baitu .

text: And they that were sent went their way , and found even as he had said unto them .
text2: Eta ioanic igorri içan ciradenec eriden çuten erran cerauen beçala .

text: And as they were loosing the colt , the owners thereof said unto them , Why loose ye the colt ?
text2: Eta hec asto - vmea lachatzen çutela , erran ciecen haren iabéc , Cergatic lachatzen duçue asto - vmea ?

text: And they said , The Lord hath need of him .
text2: Eta hec erran ceçaten , Ceren Iaunac hunen beharra baitu .

text: And they brought him to Jesus : and they cast their garments upon the colt , and they set Jesus thereon .
text2: Eta eraman ceçaten hura Iesusgana , eta eçarriric berén abillamenduac asto - vme gainean , eçar ceçaten gainean Iesus .

text: And as he went , they spread their clothes in the way .
text2: Eta hura cioala , hedatzen cituzten berén abillamenduac bidean .

text: And when he was come nigh , even now at the descent of the mount of Olives , the whole multitude of the disciples began to rejoice and praise God with a loud voice for all the mighty works that they had seen ;
text2: Eta ia Oliuatzetaco mendi ondora hurbiltzen cela , has cedin discipulutze gucia alegueraz Iaincoaren laudatzen ocengui , ikussi vkan cituzten verthute guciacgatic ,

text: Saying , Blessed be the King that cometh in the name of the Lord : peace in heaven , and glory in the highest .
text2: Erraiten çutela , Benedicatu dela Iaunaren icenean ethorten den Reguea : baquea dela ceruän eta gloria leku gorenetan .

text: And some of the Pharisees from among the multitude said unto him , Master , rebuke thy disciples .
text2: Orduan gendetzeco Phariseuetaric batzuc erran cieçóten , Magistruá , mehatcha itzac eure discipuluac .

text: And he answered and said unto them , I tell you that , if these should hold their peace , the stones would immediately cry out .
text2: Eta harc ihardesten cuela erran ciecén , Erraiten drauçuet , baldin ichil baditez hauc , bertan harriéc oihu eguinen dutela .

text: And when he was come near , he beheld the city , and wept over it ,
text2: Eta hurbildu cenean , ikussiric hiria , nigar eguin ceçan haren gainean , cioela ,

text: Saying , If thou hadst known , even thou , at least in this thy day , the things which belong unto thy peace ! but now they are hid from thine eyes .
text2: O baldin hic berere eçagutu vkan bahitu eure iornata hunetan berere , eure baquearen gauçác ! Baina orain estaliac diaudec hire beguietaric

text: For the days shall come upon thee , that thine enemies shall cast a trench about thee , and compass thee round , and keep thee in on every side ,
text2: Ecen ethorriren dituc egunac hire gainera , eta eure etsayéc assetiaturen auté trancheaz , eta inguraturen , eta hersturen alde gucietaric .

text: And shall lay thee even with the ground , and thy children within thee ; and they shall not leave in thee one stone upon another ; because thou knewest not the time of thy visitation .
text2: Eta arrasaturen auté hi , eta hire haour hitan barna diradenac : eta eztié vtziren hitan harria harriaren gainean : ceren ezpaituc eçagutu eure visitationearen demborá .

text: And he went into the temple , and began to cast out them that sold therein , and them that bought ;
text2: Eta sarthuric templean , has cedin , hartan saltzen eta erosten ari ciradenén campora egoizten .

text: Saying unto them , It is written , My house is the house of prayer : but ye have made it a den of thieves .
text2: Ciostela , Scribatua da , Ene etchea orationetaco etchea da , eta çuec hura gaichtaguin lece eguin duçue .

text: And he taught daily in the temple . But the chief priests and the scribes and the chief of the people sought to destroy him ,
text2: Eta iracasten ari cen egun oroz templean : eta Sacrificadore principalac eta Scribác eta populuco principalac hura hil eraci nahiz çabiltzan .

text: And could not find what they might do : for all the people were very attentive to hear him .
text2: Baina etzutén erideiten cer eguin ahal leçaqueoten : ecen populu gucia cen attento haren ençutera .

text: And it came to pass , that on one of those days , as he taught the people in the temple , and preached the gospel , the chief priests and the scribes came upon him with the elders ,
text2: Eta guertha cedin egun hetataric batez , harc populua iracasten çuela templean , eta euangelizatzen cegoela , ethor baitzitecen Sacrificadore principalac eta Scribác , Ancianoequin ,

text: And spake unto him , saying , Tell us , by what authority doest thou these things ? or who is he that gave thee this authority ?
text2: Eta erran cieçoten , Erraguc cer authoritatez gauça horiac eguiten dituán , edo nor den hiri authoritate hori eman drauana .

text: And he answered and said unto them , I will also ask you one thing ; and answer me :
text2: Eta ihardesten çuela Iesusec erran ciecén , Interrogaturen çaituztet nic - ere çuec gauça batez : erradaçue bada niri ,

text: The baptism of John , was it from heaven , or of men ?
text2: Ioannesen baptismoa cerutic cen , ala guiçonetaric ?

text: And they reasoned with themselves , saying , If we shall say , From heaven ; he will say , Why then believed ye him not ?
text2: Eta hec baciharducaten berén artean , cioitela , Baldin erran badeçagu , Cerutic : erranen du , Cergatic beraz eztuçue sinhetsi hura ?

text: But and if we say , Of men ; all the people will stone us : for they be persuaded that John was a prophet .
text2: Eta baldin badarragu , Guiçonetaric : populu guciac lapidaturen gaitu : ecen segur daducate , Ioannes Propheta cela .

text: And they answered , that they could not tell whence it was .
text2: Ihardets ceçaten bada , etzaquitela nondic cen .

text: And Jesus said unto them , Neither tell I you by what authority I do these things .
text2: Orduan Iesusec erran ciecén , Nic - ere eztrauçuet erranen cer authoritatez gauça hauc eguiten ditudan .

text: Then began he to speak to the people this parable ; A certain man planted a vineyard , and let it forth to husbandmen , and went into a far country for a long time .
text2: Orduán has cedin populuari comparatione hunen erraiten , Guiçon batec landa ceçan mahastibat , eta aloca ciecén hura laborariey , eta dembora lucez campoan egon cedin .

text: And at the season he sent a servant to the husbandmen , that they should give him of the fruit of the vineyard : but the husbandmen beat him , and sent him away empty .
text2: Eta sasoinean igor ceçan laborari hetara cerbitzaribat , mahastico fructutic lemotençat : baina hec hura cehaturic igor ceçaten hutsic .

text: And again he sent another servant : and they beat him also , and entreated him shamefully , and sent him away empty .
text2: Eta continua ceçan berce cerbitzari baten igortera : baina hec haur - ere cehaturic eta gaizqui tractaturic igor ceçaten hutsic .

text: And again he sent a third : and they wounded him also , and cast him out .
text2: Eta continua ceçan herenaren igortera : baina hec haur - ere çaurthuric egotz ceçaten campora .

text: Then said the lord of the vineyard , What shall I do ? I will send my beloved son : it may be they will reverence him when they see him .
text2: Orduan erran ceçan mahasti iabeac , Cer eguinen dut ? igorriren dut neure seme maitea : aguian haur dacussatenean ohoraturen duté :

text: But when the husbandmen saw him , they reasoned among themselves , saying , This is the heir : come , let us kill him , that the inheritance may be ours .
text2: Baina hura ikussiric laborariéc propos eduqui ceçaten , cioitela , Haur da primua : çatozte , hil deçagun haur , heretagea gure dençat .

text: So they cast him out of the vineyard , and killed him . What therefore shall the lord of the vineyard do unto them ?
text2: Eta egotziric hura mahastitic campora , hil ceçaten . Cer bada eguinen draue hæy mahasti iabeac ?

text: He shall come and destroy these husbandmen , and shall give the vineyard to others . And when they heard it , they said , God forbid .
text2: Ethorriren da eta deseguinen ditu laborari hec , eta emanen draue mahastia berce batzuey . Eta haur ençun çutenean erran ceçaten , Hala guertha eztadila .

text: And he beheld them , and said , What is this then that is written , The stone which the builders rejected , the same is become the head of the corner ?
text2: Harc orduan hetarat behaturic dio , Cer da bada scribatua den hura , Edificaçaléc arbuyatu duten harria cantoin buru eguin içan da ?

text: Whosoever shall fall upon that stone shall be broken ; but on whomsoever it shall fall , it will grind him to powder .
text2: Harri haren gainera eroriren den gucia , çathicaturen da : eta noren gainera eroriren baita , hura du chehecaturen .

text: And the chief priests and the scribes the same hour sought to lay hands on him ; and they feared the people : for they perceived that he had spoken this parable against them .
text2: Orduan aiher ciraden Sacrificadore principalac eta Scribac haren gainean escuén eçartera ordu hartan berean : baina populuaren beldur citecen : ecen eçagutu vkan çutén hayén contra erran çuela comparatione haur .

text: And they watched him , and sent forth spies , which should feign themselves just men , that they might take hold of his words , that so they might deliver him unto the power and authority of the governor .
text2: Eta hura gogoatzen çutela , igor citzaten espiác iusto ciradela irudi eguiten çutela , hura hitzean hatzaman leçatençat , Gobernadorearen seignorián eta botherean eçar leçatençat .

text: And they asked him , saying , Master , we know that thou sayest and teachest rightly , neither acceptest thou the person of any , but teachest the way of God truly :
text2: Eta hec interroga ceçaten hura , cioitela , Magistruá , baceaquiagu vngui erraiten eta iracasten duala , eta ezagoela personara behá , baina Iaincoaren bidea eguiazqui iracasten duala .

text: Is it lawful for us to give tribute unto Caesar , or no ?
text2: Bide dugu eman tributic Cesari , ala ez ?

text: But he perceived their craftiness , and said unto them , Why tempt ye me ?
text2: Eta adituric hayén fineciá , erran ciecén , Cergatic tentatzen nauçue ?

text: Shew me a penny . Whose image and superscription hath it ? They answered and said , Caesar ' s .
text2: Eracustaçue dinerobat : norenac ditu imagina eta scribua ? Eta ihardesten çutela erran ceçaten , Cesarenac .

text: And he said unto them , Render therefore unto Caesar the things which be Caesar ' s , and unto God the things which be God ' s .
text2: Orduan erran ciecén , Renda ietzoçue beraz Cesaren diradenac , Cesari : eta Iaincoaren diradenac , Iaincoari .

text: And they could not take hold of his words before the people : and they marvelled at his answer , and held their peace .
text2: Eta ecin haren hitza reprehenditu vkan duté populuaren aitzinean : eta miraz iarriric haren repostaren gainean ichil citecen .

text: Then came to him certain of the Sadducees , which deny that there is any resurrection ; and they asked him ,
text2: Orduan hurbil cequizquion Sadduceu batzu ( ceinéc vkatzen baituté resurrectionea ) eta interroga ceçaten .

text: Saying , Master , Moses wrote unto us , If any man ' s brother die , having a wife , and he die without children , that his brother should take his wife , and raise up seed unto his brother .
text2: Cioitela , Magistruá , Moysesec scribatu diraucuc , Baldin cembeiten anayea hil badadi emazte duelaric , eta haourric gabe hil badadi , har deçan haren anayeac haren emaztea , eta eguin dieçón leinu bere anayeri .

text: There were therefore seven brethren : and the first took a wife , and died without children .
text2: Bada çazpi anaye içan dituc , eta hetaric lehena emazte harturic hil içan duc , haourric gabe .

text: And the second took her to wife , and he died childless .
text2: Eta har ciecán hura bigarrenac , hura - ere hil cidian haourric gabe .

text: And the third took her ; and in like manner the seven also : and they left no children , and died .
text2: Guero herenac har cieçán hura , eta halaber çazpiec - ere : eta etzeçatean haourric vtzi , eta hil cituán .

text: Last of all the woman died also .
text2: Eta gucién ondoan hil ciedián emaztea - ere .

text: Therefore in the resurrection whose wife of them is she ? for seven had her to wife .
text2: Resurrectionean bada hetaric ceinen emazte içanen da ? ecen çazpiéc vkan dié hura emazte

text: And Jesus answering said unto them , The children of this world marry , and are given in marriage :
text2: Orduan ihardesten çuela erran ciecén Iesusec , Mundu hunetaco haourréc hartzen duté ezconçaz eta hartzen dirade .

text: But they which shall be accounted worthy to obtain that world , and the resurrection from the dead , neither marry , nor are given in marriage :
text2: Baina secula haren , eta hiletaco resurrectionaren vkaiteco digne eridenen diradenéc , eztuté harturen ezconçaz , ez eztirade harturen .

text: Neither can they die any more : for they are equal unto the angels ; and are the children of God , being the children of the resurrection .
text2: Ecen guehiagoric ecin hil daitezque : ecen Aingueruèn pare dirade : eta Iaincoaren seme dirade , resurrectionezco seme diradenaz gueroz .

text: Now that the dead are raised , even Moses shewed at the bush , when he calleth the Lord the God of Abraham , and the God of Isaac , and the God of Jacob .
text2: Eta hilac resuscitatzen diradela , Moysesec - ere eracutsi vkan du berro aldean , dioenean Iauna dela Abrahamen Iaincoa , eta Isaac - en Iaincoa , eta Iacob - en Iaincoa .

text: For he is not a God of the dead , but of the living : for all live unto him .
text2: Bada Iaincoa ezta hilena , baina viciena : ecen guciac hari vici çaizquio .

text: Then certain of the scribes answering said , Master , thou hast well said .
text2: Eta ihardesten çutela Scribetaric batzuc erran ceçaten , Magistruá , vngui erran duc .

text: And after that they durst not ask him any question at all .
text2: Eta guehiagoric etziraden ausartzen deusez haren interrogatzera .

text: And he said unto them , How say they that Christ is David ' s son ?
text2: Eta erran ciecén , Nola erraiten duté Christ Dauid - en seme dela ?

text: And David himself saith in the book of Psalms , The LORD said unto my Lord , Sit thou on my right hand ,
text2: Ikussiric ecen Dauid - ec berac dioela Psalmuén liburuän , Erran drauca Iaunac ene Iaunari , Iar adi ene escuinean ,

text: Till I make thine enemies thy footstool .
text2: Eçar ditzaquedano hiré etsayac hire oinén scabella .

text: David therefore calleth him Lord , how is he then his son ?
text2: Dauid - ec beraz Iaun hura deitzen du , eta nola da haren semé ?

text: Then in the audience of all the people he said unto his disciples ,
text2: Eta populu guciac ençuten çuela , erran ciecén bere discipuluey .

text: Beware of the scribes , which desire to walk in long robes , and love greetings in the markets , and the highest seats in the synagogues , and the chief rooms at feasts ;
text2: Beguirauçue Scriba arropa lucequin ebili nahi diradenetaric , eta on dariztenetaric salutationey merkatuetan , eta lehen cadirey synagoguetan , eta lehen placey banquetetan .

text: Which devour widows ' houses , and for a shew make long prayers : the same shall receive greater damnation .
text2: Ceinéc iresten baitituzte ema alhargunén etcheac , are luçaqui othoitz eguin irudiz : hec recebituren duté damnatione handiagoa .

text: And he looked up , and saw the rich men casting their gifts into the treasury .
text2: Eta behatu çuenean ikus citzan abratsac eçarten cituztela bere donoac truncora .

text: And he saw also a certain poor widow casting in thither two mites .
text2: Eta ikus ceçan emazte alhargun paubrebat ere bi peça chipi eçarten cituela .

text: And he said , Of a truth I say unto you , that this poor widow hath cast in more than they all :
text2: Eta erran ceçan , Eguiazqui diotsuet , ecen alhargun paubre hunec berce guciéc baino guehiago eçarri vkan duela .

text: For all these have of their abundance cast in unto the offerings of God : but she of her penury hath cast in all the living that she had .
text2: Ecen hauc guciéc soberaturic dutenetic eçarri vkan duté Iaincoaren oblationetara : baina hunec bere paubreciatic bere sustantia çuen gucia eçarri vkan du .

text: And as some spake of the temple , how it was adorned with goodly stones and gifts , he said ,
text2: Eta batzuc erraiten çutenean templeaz , ecen harri ederrez eta emaitzaz ornatua cela , erran ceçan .

text: As for these things which ye behold , the days will come , in the which there shall not be left one stone upon another , that shall not be thrown down .
text2: Hauc dirade miratzen dituçuenac ? ethorriren dirade egunac ceinetan ezpaita gueldituren harria harriaren gainean deseguin eztadin .

text: And they asked him , saying , Master , but when shall these things be ? and what sign will there be when these things shall come to pass ?
text2: Orduan interroga ceçaten hura , cioitela , Magistruá , noiz bada horiac içanen dirade ? eta cer signo içanen da horiac ethorri behar diradenean ?

text: And he said , Take heed that ye be not deceived : for many shall come in my name , saying , I am Christ ; and the time draweth near : go ye not therefore after them .
text2: Eta harc erran ceçan , Beguirauçue seduci etzaitezten : ecen anhitz ethorriren dirade ene icenean , dioitela , Ni naiz Christ : eta dembora hure hurbiltzen da : etzoaztela bada hayén ondoan .

text: But when ye shall hear of wars and commotions , be not terrified : for these things must first come to pass ; but the end is not by and by .
text2: Eta ençun ditzaçuenean guerlác eta seditioneac ezalbeitzinteizte icit : ecen gauça hauc lehen ethorri behar dirade : baina ezta bertan fina içanen .

text: Then said he unto them , Nation shall rise against nation , and kingdom against kingdom :
text2: Orduan erran ciecén , Altchaturen da nationea nationearen contra , eta resumá resumaren contra :

text: And great earthquakes shall be in divers places , and famines , and pestilences ; and fearful sights and great signs shall there be from heaven .
text2: Eta lur ikaratze handiac içanen dirade lekutic lekura , eta gosseteac eta içurriteac , eta icidurác : eta signo handiac içanen dirade , cerutic .

text: But before all these , they shall lay their hands on you , and persecute you , delivering you up to the synagogues , and into prisons , being brought before kings and rulers for my name ' s sake .
text2: Baina gauça hauen gucion aitzinetic bere escuac eçarriren dituzte çuen gainean , eta persecutaturen çaituzte , liuratzen çaituztela synagoguetara eta presoindeguietara , eramanic Reguetara eta Gobernadoretara , ene icenagatic .

text: And it shall turn to you for a testimony .
text2: Eta horiac helduren çaizquiçue testimoniagetan .

text: Settle it therefore in your hearts , not to meditate before what ye shall answer :
text2: Eçarçue bada çuen bihotzetan , aitzinetic ez pensatzera nola ihardetsiren duçuen .

text: For I will give you a mouth and wisdom , which all your adversaries shall not be able to gainsay nor resist .
text2: Ecen nic emanen drauçuet aho , eta iaquite ceini ecin contrastaturen baitzaizquio , ezeta resistituren çuey contrastaturen çaizquiçuen guciéc .

text: And ye shall be betrayed both by parents , and brethren , and kinsfolks , and friends ; and some of you shall they cause to be put to death .
text2: Halaber liuraturen çarete aitéz eta améz eta anayéz eta ahaidéz eta adisquidéz : eta çuetaric hil eraciren duté :

text: And ye shall be hated of all men for my name ' s sake .
text2: Eta guciéz gaitzetsiac içanen çarete ene icenaren causaz .

text: But there shall not an hair of your head perish .
text2: Baina çuen buruco bilobat ezta galduren .

text: In your patience possess ye your souls .
text2: Çuen patientiáz posseditzaçue çuen arimác .

text: And when ye shall see Jerusalem compassed with armies , then know that the desolation thereof is nigh .
text2: Eta ikus deçaçuenean Ierusaleme gendarmeriaz inguratua , orduan albeitzinequite ecen hurbil datela haren destructionea .

text: Then let them which are in Judaea flee to the mountains ; and let them which are in the midst of it depart out ; and let not them that are in the countries enter thereinto .
text2: Orduan Iudean diradenéc ihes albeileguite mendietarát : eta haren artecoac retira albeilitez : eta campoetan diradenac ezalbeilitez hartan sar .

text: For these be the days of vengeance , that all things which are written may be fulfilled .
text2: Ecen mendequiozco egunac dirade hauc , scribatuac diraden gauça guciac compli ditecençat

text: But woe unto them that are with child , and to them that give suck , in those days ! for there shall be great distress in the land , and wrath upon this people .
text2: Eta dohain gaiz emazte içorrén eta eredosquiten duqueitenén egun hetan , ecen necessitate handia içanen da lur haren gainean , eta hira populu hartan .

text: And they shall fall by the edge of the sword , and shall be led away captive into all nations : and Jerusalem shall be trodden down of the Gentiles , until the times of the Gentiles be fulfilled .
text2: Eta eroriren dirade ezpataren ahoz , eta captiuo eramanen dirade natione gucietara , eta Ierusaleme aurizquia içanen da Gentiléz , Gentilén demborác compli daitezqueno .

text: And there shall be signs in the sun , and in the moon , and in the stars ; and upon the earth distress of nations , with perplexity ; the sea and the waves roaring ;
text2: Orduan içanen dirade signoac iguzquian eta ilharguian eta içarretan : eta lurrean afflictione nationetan ez iaquinez cer eguin , orroaz daudela itsassoa eta bagác :

text: Men ' s hearts failing them for fear , and for looking after those things which are coming on the earth : for the powers of heaven shall be shaken .
text2: Hala non guiçonac hilac beçalacaturen baitirade iciduraren handiz , eta mundura ethorriren diraden gaitzén beguira egoitez : ecen ceruètaco verthuteac ikaraturen dirade .

text: And then shall they see the Son of man coming in a cloud with power and great glory .
text2: Eta orduan ikussiren duté guiçonaren Semea ethorten dela hodey batetan bothere eta gloria handirequin .

text: And when these things begin to come to pass , then look up , and lift up your heads ; for your redemption draweth nigh .
text2: Eta gauça hauc eguiten has ditecenean , chuchent albeitzinteizte , eta goiti albeitzinçate çuen buruäc , ecen hurbiltzen da çuen redemptionea .

text: And he spake to them a parable ; Behold the fig tree , and all the trees ;
text2: Eta erran ciecén comparatione haur , Ikusquiçue ficotzea eta arbore guciac .

text: When they now shoot forth , ye see and know of your own selves that summer is now nigh at hand .
text2: Ia hostatzen diradela dacussaçuenean , ceuron buruz eçagutzen duçue ecen ia hurbil dela vdá .

text: So likewise ye , when ye see these things come to pass , know ye that the kingdom of God is nigh at hand .
text2: Halaber çuec - ere ikussiren duqueçuenean gauça hauc eguiten diradela , eçagut albeitzineçate ecen hurbil dela Iaincoaren resumá .

text: Verily I say unto you , This generation shall not pass away , till all be fulfilled .
text2: Eguiaz erraiten drauçuet ecen eztela iraganen mende haur , gauça hauc gucioc eguin daitezqueno .

text: Heaven and earth shall pass away : but my words shall not pass away .
text2: Ceruä eta lurra iraganen dirade , baina ene hitzac eztirade iraganen .

text: And take heed to yourselves , lest at any time your hearts be overcharged with surfeiting , and drunkenness , and cares of this life , and so that day come upon you unawares .
text2: Gogoa eyeçue bada çuen buruèy , çuen bihotzac sortha eztitecen gormandiçaz , eta hordiqueriaz , eta vicitze hunetaco ansiéz : eta subitoqui gainera ethor eztaquiçuen egun hura .

text: For as a snare shall it come on all them that dwell on the face of the whole earth .
text2: Ecen laço batec beçala attrapaturen ditu lur guciaren gainean habitatzen diraden guciac .

text: Watch ye therefore , and pray always , that ye may be accounted worthy to escape all these things that shall come to pass , and to stand before the Son of man .
text2: Veilla eçaçue bada , dembora gucian othoitz eguiten duçuela , ethorteco diraden gauça guciey itzurteco digne eguin çaiteztençat , eta guiçonaren Semearen aitzinean egon ahal çaiteztençat .

text: And in the day time he was teaching in the temple ; and at night he went out , and abode in the mount that is called the mount of Olives .
text2: Eta egunáz templean iracasten ari cen , eta gauaz Oliuatzetaco deitzen den mendian egoiten cen .

text: And all the people came early in the morning to him in the temple , for to hear him .
text2: Eta populu gucia goicean ethorten cen harengana , templean hura ençun leçançat .

text: Now the feast of unleavened bread drew nigh , which is called the Passover .
text2: Eta cen hurbiltzen altchagarri gaberico oguién bestá , Bazco erraiten dena :

text: And the chief priests and scribes sought how they might kill him ; for they feared the people .
text2: Eta çabiltzan Sacrificadore principalac eta Scribác nolatan hura hil ahal leçaqueten : ecen populuaren beldur ciraden .

text: Then entered Satan into Judas surnamed Iscariot , being of the number of the twelve .
text2: Baina Satan sar cedin Iudas icen goiticoz Iscariot deitzen cenera cein baitzén hamabién contuco .

text: And he went his way , and communed with the chief priests and captains , how he might betray him unto them .
text2: Eta hura ioanic minça cedin Sacrificadore principalequin eta capitainequin nola hura liura lieçaqueen .

text: And they were glad , and covenanted to give him money .
text2: Eta aleguera citecen , eta accorda citecen hari diru emaitera .

text: And he promised , and sought opportunity to betray him unto them in the absence of the multitude .
text2: Eta harc prometta ceçan : eta gendetzeric ezlicenean haren hæy liuratzeco dembora propiren bilha çabilan .

text: Then came the day of unleavened bread , when the passover must be killed .
text2: Ethor cedin bada altchagarri gaberico oguién eguna , ceinetan hil behar baitzen Bazcoa .

text: And he sent Peter and John , saying , Go and prepare us the passover , that we may eat .
text2: Eta igor citzan Pierris eta Ioannes , cioela , Ioanic appain ieçaguçue Bazcoa ian deçagunçat .

text: And they said unto him , Where wilt thou that we prepare ?
text2: Eta hec erran cieçoten , Non nahi duc appain deçagun ?

text: And he said unto them , Behold , when ye are entered into the city , there shall a man meet you , bearing a pitcher of water ; follow him into the house where he entereth in .
text2: Harc erran ciecén , Huná , hirian sarthu eta , bathuren çaiçue guiçombat , pegarbat vr daramala : hari çarreitzate sarthuren den etchera :

text: And ye shall say unto the goodman of the house , The Master saith unto thee , Where is the guestchamber , where I shall eat the passover with my disciples ?
text2: Eta erroçue etcheco aitafamiliari , Magistruac erraiten drauc , Non da neure discipuluequin Bazcoa ianen dudan ostatua ?

text: And he shall shew you a large upper room furnished : there make ready .
text2: Eta harc eracutsiren drauçue gambera handibat apprestatua : han appain eçaçue Bazcoa .

text: And they went , and found as he had said unto them : and they made ready the passover .
text2: Orduan ioanic eriden citzaten gauça guçiac erran cerauen beçala : eta appain ceçaten Bazcoa .

text: And when the hour was come , he sat down , and the twelve apostles with him .
text2: Bada ordu hura ethorri eta , iar cedin mahainean , eta hamabi Apostoluac harequin .

text: And he said unto them , With desire I have desired to eat this passover with you before I suffer :
text2: Eta erran ciecén , Desirez desiratu vkan dut Bazco hunen çuequin iatera , nic suffri deçadan baino lehen .

text: For I say unto you , I will not any more eat thereof , until it be fulfilled in the kingdom of God .
text2: Ecen erraiten drauçuet , guehiagoric eztudala ianen hunetaric , compli daiteno Iaincoaren resumán .

text: And he took the cup , and gave thanks , and said , Take this , and divide it among yourselves :
text2: Eta copa harturic gratiác rendatu cituenean erran ceçan , Har eçaçue haur , eta parti eçaçue çuen artean .

text: For I say unto you , I will not drink of the fruit of the vine , until the kingdom of God shall come .
text2: Ecen erraiten drauçuet eztudala edanen aihenaren fructutic , Iaincoaren resumá ethor daiteno .

text: And he took bread , and gave thanks , and brake it , and gave unto them , saying , This is my body which is given for you : this do in remembrance of me .
text2: Eta harturic oguia , gratiác rendatu cituenean , hauts ceçan : eta eman ciecén , cioela , Haur da ene gorputza çuengatic emaiten dena : haur eguiçue ene memoriotan .

text: Likewise also the cup after supper , saying , This cup is the new testament in my blood , which is shed for you .
text2: Halaber copa - ere eman ciecén , affal ondoan cioela , Copa haur da Testamentu berria ene odolean , cein çuengatic issurten baita .

text: But , behold , the hand of him that betrayeth me is with me on the table .
text2: Badaric - ere huná , ni traditzen nauenaren escua , enequin da mahainean .

text: And truly the Son of man goeth , as it was determined : but woe unto that man by whom he is betrayed !
text2: Eta segur guiçonaren Semea , ordenatu içan den beçala badoa : guciagatic - ere maledictione guiçon hari , ceinez traditzen baita .

text: And they began to inquire among themselves , which of them it was that should do this thing .
text2: Orduan hec has cequizquión bata berceari galde eguiten elkarren artean , eya cein cen hetaric hura eguinen luena .

text: And there was also a strife among them , which of them should be accounted the greatest .
text2: Eta guertha cedin contentionebat - ere hayén artean , cein hetaric estimaturen cen guehien .

text: And he said unto them , The kings of the Gentiles exercise lordship over them ; and they that exercise authority upon them are called benefactors .
text2: Baina harc erran ciecén , Nationén reguéc seignoriatzen dute hayén gainean , eta hayén gainean authoritate dutenac , vnguiguile deitzen dirade .

text: But ye shall not be so : but he that is greatest among you , let him be as the younger ; and he that is chief , as he that doth serve .
text2: Baina çueçaz ezta hala : aitzitic çuen arteco handiena biz chipién beçala : eta gobernatzen duena , cerbitzatzen duena beçala .

text: For whether is greater , he that sitteth at meat , or he that serveth ? is not he that sitteth at meat ? but I am among you as he that serveth .
text2: Ecen cein da handiago , mahainean iarriric dagoena , ala cerbitzun ari dena ? eza mahainean iarriric dagoena ? Bada ni naiz çuen artean cerbitzatzen ari dena beçala .

text: Ye are they which have continued with me in my temptations .
text2: Eta çuec çarete enequin iraun duçuenac ene tentationétan .

text: And I appoint unto you a kingdom , as my Father hath appointed unto me ;
text2: Nic bada disposatzen drauçuet resumá , niri neure Aitac disposatu vkan drautan beçala .

text: That ye may eat and drink at my table in my kingdom , and sit on thrones judging the twelve tribes of Israel .
text2: Ian deçaçuençat eta edan ene mahainean ene resumán , eta iar çaitezten thronoén gainean iugeatzen dituçuela Israeleco hamabi leinuac .

text: And the Lord said , Simon , Simon , behold , Satan hath desired to have you , that he may sift you as wheat :
text2: Erran ceçan halaber Iaunac , Simon , Simon , huná , Satanec bihiaren ançora çuen bahatzeco desira dic :

text: But I have prayed for thee , that thy faith fail not : and when thou art converted , strengthen thy brethren .
text2: Baina nic othoitze eguin diat hiregatic , falta eztadin hire fedea : hic bada noizpait conuertituric confirmaitzac eure anayeac .

text: And he said unto him , Lord , I am ready to go with thee , both into prison , and to death .
text2: Eta harc erran cieçón , Iauna , prest nauc hirequin eta presoindeguira eta heriora ioaitera :

text: And he said , I tell thee , Peter , the cock shall not crow this day , before that thou shalt thrice deny that thou knowest me .
text2: Baina Iesusec erran ceçan , Hiri diossat Pierris , eztic ioren egun oillarrac , hiruretan ni neçaguála vka deçaqueán baino lehen .

text: And he said unto them , When I sent you without purse , and scrip , and shoes , lacked ye any thing ? And they said , Nothing .
text2: Guero erran ciecén , Çuec igorri çaituztedanean mulsa eta maleta eta çapata gabe , deusen falta içan çarete ? Eta hec erran ceçaten , Deusen - ere .

text: Then said he unto them , But now , he that hath a purse , let him take it , and likewise his scrip : and he that hath no sword , let him sell his garment , and buy one .
text2: Erran ciecén bada , Baina orain mulsa duenac , har beça , halaber maleta - ere : eta eztuenac , sal beça bere arropá , eta eros beça ezpatabat .

text: For I say unto you , that this that is written must yet be accomplished in me , And he was reckoned among the transgressors : for the things concerning me have an end .
text2: Ecen erraiten drauçuet oraino behar dela nitan complitu scribaturic dagoen haur , Eta gaichtoequin contatu içan da . Ecen segur niçazco gaucéc fin hartzen duté .

text: And they said , Lord , behold , here are two swords . And he said unto them , It is enough .
text2: Eta hec erran ceçaten , Iauna , huná bi ezpata hemen . Eta harc erran ciecén , Asco da .

text: And he came out , and went , as he was wont , to the mount of Olives ; and his disciples also followed him .
text2: Guero ilkiric parti cedin costumatu beçala Oliuatzetaco mendirát : eta iarreiqui içan çaizcan bere discipuluac - ere .

text: And when he was at the place , he said unto them , Pray that ye enter not into temptation .
text2: Eta leku hartara ethorri cenean , erran ciecén , Othoitz eguiçue sar etzaitezten tentationetan .

text: And he was withdrawn from them about a stone ' s cast , and kneeled down , and prayed ,
text2: Orduan hura vrrund cedin hetaric harri iraitzi baten inguruä , eta belhauricaturic othoitz eguiten çuen ,

text: Saying , Father , if thou be willing , remove this cup from me : nevertheless not my will , but thine , be done .
text2: Cioela , Aitá , baldin nahi baduc iragan eçac copa haur eneganic : badaric - ere ez ene vorondatea baina hirea eguin bedi .

text: And there appeared an angel unto him from heaven , strengthening him .
text2: Eta aguer cequión Aingueruä cerutic hura confortatzen çuela .

text: And being in an agony he prayed more earnestly : and his sweat was as it were great drops of blood falling down to the ground .
