text2: Eta hersturatan iarriric othoitze eguiten çuen cineçago , eta cen haren icerdia odol chorta gatzatu lurrera erorten diradenac beçala .

text: And when he rose up from prayer , and was come to his disciples , he found them sleeping for sorrow ,
text2: Guero orationetic iaiquiric ethor cedin bere discipuluetara , eta eriden citzan tristez lo ceunçala .

text: And said unto them , Why sleep ye ? rise and pray , lest ye enter into temptation .
text2: Eta erran ciecén , Cergatic lo çaunçate ? iaiqui çaitezte , eta othoitz eguiçue sar etzaitezten tentationetan .

text: And while he yet spake , behold a multitude , and he that was called Judas , one of the twelve , went before them , and drew near unto Jesus to kiss him .
text2: Eta hura oraino minço cela , huná , compainiabat , eta Iudas deitzen cena , hamabietaric bat , hayén aitzinean ethorten cen , eta hurbil cequion Iesusi pot leguionçát .

text: But Jesus said unto him , Judas , betrayest thou the Son of man with a kiss ?
text2: Eta Iesusec erran ciecón , Iudas , pot batez guiçonaren Semea traditzen duc ?

text: When they which were about him saw what would follow , they said unto him , Lord , shall we smite with the sword ?
text2: Orduan haren aldean ciradenéc ikussiric cer ethorteco cen , erran cieçoten , Iauna , ioren dugu ezpataz ?

text: And one of them smote the servant of the high priest , and cut off his right ear .
text2: Eta io ceçan hetaric batec Sacrificadore principalaren cerbitzaria , eta edequi cieçon escuineco beharria .

text: And Jesus answered and said , Suffer ye thus far . And he touched his ear , and healed him .
text2: Baina ihardesten çuela Iesusec erran ceçan , Vtzitzaçue eguitera hunadrano . Eta haren beharria hunquiric , senda ceçan hura .

text: Then Jesus said unto the chief priests , and captains of the temple , and the elders , which were come to him , Be ye come out , as against a thief , with swords and staves ?
text2: Guero erran ciecén Iesusec harengana ethorri ciraden Sacrificadore principaley , eta templeco capitainey , eta Ancianoey , Gaichtaguin baten ondoan beçala ilki içan çarete ezpatequin eta vhequin ?

text: When I was daily with you in the temple , ye stretched forth no hands against me : but this is your hour , and the power of darkness .
text2: Egun oroz çuequin nincela templean , eztituçue escuac hedatu ene gainera : baina haur da çuen oren hura , eta ilhumbearen botherea .

text: Then took they him , and led him , and brought him into the high priest ' s house . And Peter followed afar off .
text2: Orduan hatzamanic hura eraman ceçaten , eta sar eraci ceçaten Sacrificadore subiranoaren etchean . Eta Pierris iarreiquiten çayón vrrundanic .

text: And when they had kindled a fire in the midst of the hall , and were set down together , Peter sat down among them .
text2: Eta sua viztu çutenean salaren erdian , eta elkarrequin iarri ciradenean , iar cedin Pierris - ere hayén artean .

text: But a certain maid beheld him as he sat by the fire , and earnestly looked upon him , and said , This man was also with him .
text2: Eta ikussi çuenean hura nescato batec su bazterrean iarria , hari begui eratchequiric erran ceçan , Haur - ere harequin cen :

text: And he denied him , saying , Woman , I know him not .
text2: Baina vka ceçan harçaz , cioela , Emazteá , eztinat eçagutzen hura .

text: And after a little while another saw him , and said , Thou art also of them . And Peter said , Man , I am not .
text2: Eta appur baten buruän bercebatec hura ikussiric erran ceçan , Hi - ere hetaric aiz . Baina Pierrisec diotsa , Guiçoná , ez nauc .

text: And about the space of one hour after another confidently affirmed , saying , Of a truth this fellow also was with him : for he is a Galilaean .
text2: Eta quasi oren baten buruän , berce batec seguratzen çuen , cioela , Segurqui haur - ere harequin cen : ecen Galileano da .

text: And Peter said , Man , I know not what thou sayest . And immediately , while he yet spake , the cock crew .
text2: Eta Pierrisec dio , Guiçoná , etzeaquiat cer erraiten duán . Eta bertan oraino hura minço cela , io ceçan oillarrac .

text: And the Lord turned , and looked upon Peter . And Peter remembered the word of the Lord , how he had said unto him , Before the cock crow , thou shalt deny me thrice .
text2: Orduan itzuliric Iaunac Pierrisganat beha ceçan : eta orhoit cedin Pierris Iaunaren hitzaz , nola erran vkan ceraucan , Oillarrac io deçan baino lehen hiruretan vkaturen nauc .

text: And Peter went out , and wept bitterly .
text2: Eta camporat ilkiric Pierrisec nigar eguin ceçan mingui .

text: And the men that held Jesus mocked him , and smote him .
text2: Eta Iesus çaducaten guiçonac , truffatzen ciraden harçaz , eta cehatzen çutén :

text: And when they had blindfolded him , they struck him on the face , and asked him , saying , Prophesy , who is it that smote thee ?
text2: Eta hura inguru estaliric haren beguitharteari ceraunsaten , eta interrogatzen çuten , cioitela , Prophetiza eçac nor den hi io auena .

text: And many other things blasphemously spake they against him .
text2: Eta anhitz berce gauçaric erraiten çutén haren contra desondratzen çutela .

text: And as soon as it was day , the elders of the people and the chief priests and the scribes came together , and led him into their council , saying ,
text2: Eta arguitu cenean bil citecen populuco Ancianoac , eta Sacrificadore principalac , eta Scribác , eta eraman ceçaten hura bere conseillu barnera

text: Art thou the Christ ? tell us . And he said unto them , If I tell you , ye will not believe :
text2: Cioitela , Hi aiz Christ ? erran ieçaguc . Eta erran ciecén , Baldin erran badieçaçuet , eztuçue sinhetsiren :

text: And if I also ask you , ye will not answer me , nor let me go .
text2: Eta baldin interroga baçaitzatet - ere , eznauçue ihardetsiren , ezeta ioaitera vtziren .

text: Hereafter shall the Son of man sit on the right hand of the power of God .
text2: Hemendic harát guiçonaren Semea iarria içanen da Iaincoaren verthutearen escuinean .

text: Then said they all , Art thou then the Son of God ? And he said unto them , Ye say that I am .
text2: Orduan erran cieçoten guciéc , Hi aiz bada Iaincoaren Semea ? Eta harc erran ciecén , Çuec dioçue ecen ni naicela .

text: And they said , What need we any further witness ? for we ourselves have heard of his own mouth .
text2: Eta hec erran ceçaten , Cer guehiago testimoniage falta gara ? ecen gueuroc ençun dugu beraren ahotic .

text: And the whole multitude of them arose , and led him unto Pilate .
text2: Guero altcha cedin hayén gendetze gucia , eta eraman ceçaten hura Pilatgana .

text: And they began to accuse him , saying , We found this fellow perverting the nation , and forbidding to give tribute to Caesar , saying that he himself is Christ a King .
text2: Eta has citecen haren accusatzen , cioitela , Eriden vkan dugu haur populuaren corrumpitzen , eta tributén Cesari emaitetic debetatzen ari dela , dioela , bera dela Christ Reguea .

text: And Pilate asked him , saying , Art thou the King of the Jews ? And he answered him and said , Thou sayest it .
text2: Orduan Pilatec interroga ceçan hura , cioela , Hi aiz Iuduén Reguea ? Eta harc ihardesten ceraucala , erran ceçan , Hic dioc .

text: Then said Pilate to the chief priests and to the people , I find no fault in this man .
text2: Eta erran ciecén Pilatec Sacrificadore principaley eta gendetzey , Hoguenic batre eztut erideiten guiçon hunetan .

text: And they were the more fierce , saying , He stirreth up the people , teaching throughout all Jewry , beginning from Galilee to this place .
text2: Eta hec hambat gortzenago ciraden , cioitela , Mouitzen dic populua , iracasten ari dela Iudea gucian , Galilean hassiric hunadrano .

text: When Pilate heard of Galilee , he asked whether the man were a Galilaean .
text2: Eta Pilatec Galileaz minçatzen ençun çuenean , interroga ceçan , eya Galileano cenez guiçona .

text: And as soon as he knew that he belonged unto Herod ' s jurisdiction , he sent him to Herod , who himself also was at Jerusalem at that time .
text2: Eta eçaguturic ecen hura Herodesen iurisdictioneco cela , igor ceçan Herodesgana , hura - ere Ierusalemen cen egun hetan .

text: And when Herod saw Jesus , he was exceeding glad : for he was desirous to see him of a long season , because he had heard many things of him ; and he hoped to have seen some miracle done by him .
text2: Eta Herodes Iesus ikussiric aleguera cedin haguitz : ecen aspaldi çuela , haren ikusteco desira çuen , ceren anhitz gauça ençuten baitzuen harçaz : eta sperança çuen cembeit signo ikussiren çuela harçaz eguiten .

text: Then he questioned with him in many words ; but he answered him nothing .
text2: Eta interroga ceçan anhitz hitzez : baina harc etzieçon deus ihardets .

text: And the chief priests and scribes stood and vehemently accused him .
text2: Eta Sacrificadore principalac eta Scribác ceuden han arrogantqui hura accusatzen çutela .

text: And Herod with his men of war set him at nought , and mocked him , and arrayed him in a gorgeous robe , and sent him again to Pilate .
text2: Baina Herodesec bere gendearequin hura menospreciaturic , eta escarniaturic , abillamendu churi batez veztituric , harçara igor ceçan Pilatgana .

text: And the same day Pilate and Herod were made friends together : for before they were at enmity between themselves .
text2: Eta egun hartan berean adiquisde citecen elkarren artean Pilate eta Herodes : ecen lehen etsay ciraden elkarren artean .

text: And Pilate , when he had called together the chief priests and the rulers and the people ,
text2: Orduan Pilatec , deithuric Sacrificadore prinpalac , eta Gobernadoreac , eta populua , erran ciecén ,

text: Said unto them , Ye have brought this man unto me , as one that perverteth the people : and , behold , I , having examined him before you , have found no fault in this man touching those things whereof ye accuse him :
text2: Presentatu drautaçue guiçon haur populuaren nahatsale beçala : eta huná , nic çuen aitzinean interrogaturic , hoguenic batre eztut eriden guiçon hunetan , çuec accusatzen duçuenetaric :

text: No , nor yet Herod : for I sent you to him ; and , lo , nothing worthy of death is done unto him .
text2: Baina ez Herodesec - ere : ecen igorri vkan çaituztet harengana , eta huná , herio mereci duen gauçaric eztrauca eguin .

text: I will therefore chastise him , and release him .
text2: Beraz gaztigatu eta , largaturen dut .

text: ( For of necessity he must release one unto them at the feast . )
text2: Eta behar cerauen bat largatu bestán .

text: And they cried out all at once , saying , Away with this man , and release unto us Barabbas :
text2: Bada iar cedin oihuz elkarrequin gendetze gucia , cioela , Ken ieçaguc haur , eta larga ieçaguc Barabbas ,

text: ( Who for a certain sedition made in the city , and for murder , was cast into prison . )
text2: Cein baitzén , hirian eguin içan cen cembeit mutinationegatic eta heriotzegatic presoindeguian eçarria .

text: Pilate therefore , willing to release Jesus , spake again to them .
text2: Berriz bada Pilate minça cequién , Iesus largatu nahiz .

text: But they cried , saying , Crucify him , crucify him .
text2: Baina hec heyagoraz iarten ciraden , erraiten çutela , Crucifica eçac , crucifica eçac hori .

text: And he said unto them the third time , Why , what evil hath he done ? I have found no cause of death in him : I will therefore chastise him , and let him go .
text2: Eta harc heren aldian erran ciecén , Baina cer gaizqui eguin du hunec ? hiltzeco hoguenic eztut erideiten haur baithan : gaztigaturic beraz largaturen dut .

text: And they were instant with loud voices , requiring that he might be crucified . And the voices of them and of the chief priests prevailed .
text2: Baina hec hertsen çutén oihu handiz requeritzen çutela , crucifica ledin : eta hayén heyagorác eta Sacrificadore principalenac renforçatzen ciraden .

text: And Pilate gave sentence that it should be as they required .
text2: Orduan Pilatec iugea ceçan eguin lequién galde eguiten çutena .

text: And he released unto them him that for sedition and murder was cast into prison , whom they had desired ; but he delivered Jesus to their will .
text2: Eta larga ciecén mutinationeagatic eta heriotzeagatic presoindeguian eçarri içan cena , ceinen escatu içan baitziraden : eta eman ciecén Iesus , nahi lutena leguiten .

text: And as they led him away , they laid hold upon one Simon , a Cyrenian , coming out of the country , and on him they laid the cross , that he might bear it after Jesus .
text2: Eta hura eramaiten çutela , harturic Simon Cyreneano landetaric heldu cen - bat , hari crutzea gainean eçar cieçoten Iesusen ondoan eramaiteco .

text: And there followed him a great company of people , and of women , which also bewailed and lamented him .
text2: Eta iarreiquiten çayón gendetze handia populutic eta emaztetaric , hura plaignitzen eta lamentatzen çutela .

text: But Jesus turning unto them said , Daughters of Jerusalem , weep not for me , but weep for yourselves , and for your children .
text2: Baina itzuliric hetarát Iesusec erran ceçan , Ierusalemeco alabác , eztaguiçuela nigarric ene gainean : baina ceuron buruén gainean eguiçue nigar , eta çuen haourrén gainean .

text: For , behold , the days are coming , in the which they shall say , Blessed are the barren , and the wombs that never bare , and the paps which never gave suck .
text2: Ecen huná , ethorriren dirade egunac ceinétan erranen baitute , dohatsu dirade sterilac , eta engendratu eztuten sabelac , eta eredosqui eztuten vgatzac .

text: Then shall they begin to say to the mountains , Fall on us ; and to the hills , Cover us .
text2: Orduan hassiren dirade erraiten mendiey , Eror çaitezte gure gainera : eta mendisquey , estal gaitzaçue .

text: For if they do these things in a green tree , what shall be done in the dry ?
text2: Ecen baldin egur hecean gauça hauc eguiten badituzte , eyharrean cer eguinen da ?

text: And there were also two other , malefactors , led with him to be put to death .
text2: Eta eramaiten ciraden berceric bi gaizquiguile - ere harequin hil eraciteco .

text: And when they were come to the place , which is called Calvary , there they crucified him , and the malefactors , one on the right hand , and the other on the left .
text2: Ethorri içan ciradenean bada Bur - heçur deitzen den lekura , han crucifica ceçaten hura , eta gaizquiguileac : bata escuinean eta bercea ezquerrean .

text: Then said Jesus , Father , forgive them ; for they know not what they do . And they parted his raiment , and cast lots .
text2: Eta Iesusec erraiten çuen , Aitá , barka iecec : ecen etzeaquie cer eguiten dutén . Guero haren abillamenduac partituric , çorte egotz ceçaten .

text: And the people stood beholding . And the rulers also with them derided him , saying , He saved others ; let him save himself , if he be Christ , the chosen of God .
text2: Eta populua han egoiten cen beha cegoela : eta truffatzen ciraden harçaz Gobernadoreac - ere hequin , cioitela , Berceac emparatu vkan ditu , empara beça bere burua , baldin haur bada Christ Iaincoaren elegitua .

text: And the soldiers also mocked him , coming to him , and offering him vinegar ,
text2: Eta truffatzen ciraden harçaz gendarmesac - ere , hurbiltzen çaizcala eta vinagre presentatzen ceraucatela :

text: And saying , If thou be the king of the Jews , save thyself .
text2: Eta erraiten çutela , Baldin hi bahaiz Iuduén Reguea empara eçac eure buruä .

text: And a superscription also was written over him in letters of Greek , and Latin , and Hebrew , THIS IS THE KING OF THE JEWS .
text2: Eta cen scributobat - ere haren garayan , letra Grec - ez eta Latinez eta Hebraicoz scribatua , hitz hautan , HAVR DA IVDVEN REGVEA .

text: And one of the malefactors which were hanged railed on him , saying , If thou be Christ , save thyself and us .
text2: Eta gaizquiguile vrkatuetaric batac blasphematzen çuen hura , cioela , Baldin hi bahaiz Christ , empara eçac eure buruä eta gu .

text: But the other answering rebuked him , saying , Dost not thou fear God , seeing thou art in the same condemnation ?
text2: Baina ihardesten çuela berceac reprotcha ceçan hura , cioela , Ezaiz Iaincoaren berere beldur , ikussiric ecen condemnatione berean aicela ?

text: And we indeed justly ; for we receive the due reward of our deeds : but this man hath done nothing amiss .
text2: Eta gu behinçat iustoqui : ecen eguin ditugunén merecituac recebitzen citiagu : baina hunec eztic deus gaizquiric eguin .

text: And he said unto Jesus , Lord , remember me when thou comest into thy kingdom .
text2: Eta erran cieçón Iesusi , Orhoit albeitendi niçaz , Iauna , ethor adinean eure resumara .

text: And Jesus said unto him , Verily I say unto thee , To day shalt thou be with me in paradise .
text2: Orduan erran cieçón Iesusec , Eguiaz erraiten drauat , egun enequin içanen aicela paradisoan .

text: And it was about the sixth hour , and there was a darkness over all the earth until the ninth hour .
text2: Eta cen sey orenen inguruä , eta ilhumbe eguin cedin lur guciaren gainean bedratzi orenetarano .

text: And the sun was darkened , and the veil of the temple was rent in the midst .
text2: Iguzquia - ere ilhund cedin , eta templeco velá erdira cedin artetic .

text: And when Jesus had cried with a loud voice , he said , Father , into thy hands I commend my spirit : and having said thus , he gave up the ghost .
text2: Eta oihu eguinic voz handiz Iesusec dio , Aitá , hire escuetan eçarten diat neure spiritua . Eta haur erranic renda ceçan spiritua .

text: Now when the centurion saw what was done , he glorified God , saying , Certainly this was a righteous man .
text2: Eta ikussiric Centenerac cer eguin içan cen , glorifica ceçan Iaincoa , cioela , Eguiazqui guiçon haur iusto cen .

text: And all the people that came together to that sight , beholding the things which were done , smote their breasts , and returned .
text2: Eta spectacle hartara bildu içan ciraden gendetze guciac , ikussiric eguin içan ciraden gauçác bere bulharrey ceraunstela itzultzen ciraden .

text: And all his acquaintance , and the women that followed him from Galilee , stood afar off , beholding these things .
text2: Eta ceuden haren eçagunac guciac vrrun , eta emazte elkarrequin hari Galileatic iarreiqui içan çaizcanac , gauça hauc ikusten cituztela .

text: And , behold , there was a man named Joseph , a counseller ; and he was a good man , and a just :
text2: Eta huna , Ioseph çaritzan guiçombat , conseiller , guiçon ona eta iustoa :

text: ( The same had not consented to the counsel and deed of them ; ) he was of Arimathaea , a city of the Jews : who also himself waited for the kingdom of God .
text2: ( Hunec etzuen consentitu hayén conseilluan ez eguitatean ) Iuduén Arimathea hirico , eta hura - ere Iaincoaren resumaren beguira cegoen :

text: This man went unto Pilate , and begged the body of Jesus .
text2: Hura ethorriric Pilatgana , esca cedin Iesusen gorputzaren .

text: And he took it down , and wrapped it in linen , and laid it in a sepulchre that was hewn in stone , wherein never man before was laid .
text2: Eta hura erautsiric estal ceçan mihisse batez , eta eçar ceçan monument batetan cein baitzén arroca batetan ebaquia , ceinetan oraino nehor ezpaitzén eçarri içan .

text: And that day was the preparation , and the sabbath drew on .
text2: Eta cen preparationeco eguna , eta Sabbath eguna haren ondoan heldu cen .

text: And the women also , which came with him from Galilee , followed after , and beheld the sepulchre , and how his body was laid .
text2: Eta iarreiquiric harequin Galileatic ethorri içan ciraden emaztec - ere mira ceçaten monumenta , eta nola eçarri içan cen haren gorputza .

text: And they returned , and prepared spices and ointments ; and rested the sabbath day according to the commandment .
text2: Guero itzuli ciradenean appresta citzaten vssainac eta vnguentuac , eta Sabbathoan reposa citecen , manamenduaren araura .

text: Now upon the first day of the week , very early in the morning , they came unto the sepulchre , bringing the spices which they had prepared , and certain others with them .
text2: Baina asteco lehen egunean , guciz goiz ethor citecen monumentera , ekarten cituztela appaindu cituztén vssain onac : eta cembeit emazte hequin .

text: And they found the stone rolled away from the sepulchre .
text2: Eta eriden ceçaten harria monumentetic aldaratua .

text: And they entered in , and found not the body of the Lord Jesus .
text2: Eta sarthu ciradenean etzeçaten eriden Iesus Iaunaren gorputza .

text: And it came to pass , as they were much perplexed thereabout , behold , two men stood by them in shining garments :
text2: Eta guertha cedin hec halacotz duda handitan ciradela , huná bi guiçon eriden baitzitecen han , chistmist ançora arguitzen çuten abillamendutan .

text: And as they were afraid , and bowed down their faces to the earth , they said unto them , Why seek ye the living among the dead ?
text2: Eta nola icituac baitziraden , eta beheititzen baitziraden beguithartez lurrera guicon hec erran ciecén , Cergatic hilén artean bilhatzen duçue vici dena ?

text: He is not here , but is risen : remember how he spake unto you when he was yet in Galilee ,
text2: Ezta hemen , baina resuscitatu da : orhoit çaitezte nola erran cerauçuen oraino Galilean cela ,

text: Saying , The Son of man must be delivered into the hands of sinful men , and be crucified , and the third day rise again .
text2: Cioela , Behar da guiçonaren Semea liura dadin vicitze gaichtotacoen escuetara , eta crucifica dadin : eta hereneco egunean resuscita dadin .

text: And they remembered his words ,
text2: Eta orhoit citecen haren hitzéz .

text: And returned from the sepulchre , and told all these things unto the eleven , and to all the rest .
text2: Eta monumentetic itzuli ciradenean , conta cietzén gauça hauc guciac hamequey , eta berce guciey .

text: It was Mary Magdalene , and Joanna , and Mary the mother of James , and other women that were with them , which told these things unto the apostles .
text2: Eta ciraden Maria Magdalena eta Ioanna eta Maria Iacquesen ama , eta berce hequin ciradenac , gauça hauén Apostoluey erraileac .

text: And their words seemed to them as idle tales , and they believed them not .
text2: Eta irudi cequiztén erguelqueria beçala hayén hitzac , eta etzitzaten sinhets .

text: Then arose Peter , and ran unto the sepulchre ; and stooping down , he beheld the linen clothes laid by themselves , and departed , wondering in himself at that which was come to pass .
text2: Baina Pierrisec iaiquiric laster ceguian monumentera , eta ikartzera beheitituric ikus citzan mihisse hutsac bere gain eçarriac : guero ioan cedin bere baithan miresten çuela eguin içan cenaz .

text: And , behold , two of them went that same day to a village called Emmaus , which was from Jerusalem about threescore furlongs .
text2: Eta huná , hetaric biga ioaiten ciraden egun hartan berean burgu batetara hiruroguey stadio Ierusalemetic vrrun , Emaus deitzen cenera :

text: And they talked together of all these things which had happened .
text2: Eta minço ciraden elkarren artean heldu içan ciraden gauça hauçaz guciéz .

text: And it came to pass , that , while they communed together and reasoned , Jesus himself drew near , and went with them .
text2: Guertha cedin bada hec minço ciradela eta ciharducatela , Iesus - ere hæy hurbilduric ioan baitzedin hequin batean .

text: But their eyes were holden that they should not know him .
text2: Baina hayen beguiac luluratuac ceuden hura eçagut ezleçatençát .

text: And he said unto them , What manner of communications are these that ye have one to another , as ye walk , and are sad ?
text2: Eta erran ciecén , Ceric dirade ioaiten çaretela çuen artean compartitzen dituçuen hitz horiac , eta cergatic çarete triste ?

text: And the one of them , whose name was Cleopas , answering said unto him , Art thou only a stranger in Jerusalem , and hast not known the things which are come to pass therein these days ?
text2: Eta ihardesten çuela batac Cleopas deitzen cenac , erran cieçón , Hi euror aiz Ierusalemen arrotz , eta eztaquizquic hartan egun hautan eguin içan diraden gauçac ?

text: And he said unto them , What things ? And they said unto him , Concerning Jesus of Nazareth , which was a prophet mighty in deed and word before God and all the people :
text2: Eta harc erran ciecén , Cer gauça ? Eta erran cieçoten , Iesus Nazarenoaz , cein içan baita guiçon Propheta , eguinez eta erranez botheretsua , Iaincoaren eta populu guciaren aitzinean .

text: And how the chief priests and our rulers delivered him to be condemned to death , and have crucified him .
text2: Eta nola hura liuratu vkan dutén Sacrificadore principaléc eta gure Gobernadoréc herioaren condemnationera , eta crucificatu vkan dutén .

text: But we trusted that it had been he which should have redeemed Israel : and beside all this , to day is the third day since these things were done .
text2: Eta guc sperança guendián hura cela Israel redemitu behar çuena : badaric - ere horién gucion gainera , egun duc herén eguna gauça hauc eguin içan diradela .

text: Yea , and certain women also of our company made us astonished , which were early at the sepulchre ;
text2: Baina gure arteco emazte batzuc - ere icitu guiaitié , cein guciz goiz monumentean içan baitirade :

text: And when they found not his body , they came , saying , that they had also seen a vision of angels , which said that he was alive .
text2: Eta eriden eztutenean haren gorputza , ethorri içan dituc , dioitela visionebat - ere Aingueruènic ikussi vkan dutela , hura vici dela dioitenenic

text: And certain of them which were with us went to the sepulchre , and found it even so as the women had said : but him they saw not .
text2: Eta ioan içan dituc gurequin ciradenetaric batzu monumentera , eta hala eriden dié nola emaztéc erran baitzuten : baina bera eztié ikussi .

text: Then he said unto them , O fools , and slow of heart to believe all that the prophets have spoken :
text2: Orduan harc erran ciecen , O adimendu gabeac , eta Prophetéc erran dituzten gauça gucién sinhestera bihotz berantcorretacoac !

text: Ought not Christ to have suffered these things , and to enter into his glory ?
text2: Etzena behar Christec gauça horiac suffri citzan , eta bere glorian sar ledin ?

text: And beginning at Moses and all the prophets , he expounded unto them in all the scriptures the things concerning himself .
text2: Guero hassiric Moyses baitharic eta Propheta gucietaric , declaratzen cerauzten Scriptura gucietan harçaz beraz ciraden gauçác .

text: And they drew nigh unto the village , whither they went : and he made as though he would have gone further .
text2: Eta hurbil citecen ioaiten ciraden burgura , eta harc vrrunago ioaitera irudi eguiten çuen .

text: But they constrained him , saying , Abide with us : for it is toward evening , and the day is far spent . And he went in to tarry with them .
text2: Baina bortcha ceçaten , cioitela , Ago gurequin : ecen arratsa duc , eta eguna duc beheratu . Sar cedin bada hequin egoitera .

text: And it came to pass , as he sat at meat with them , he took bread , and blessed it , and brake , and gave to them .
text2: Eta guertha cedin hequin mahainean iarriric cegoela , oguia harturic gratiác renda baitzitzan , eta hautsiric eman baitziecén .

text: And their eyes were opened , and they knew him ; and he vanished out of their sight .
text2: Orduan irequi citecen hayén beguiac , eta eçagut ceçaten hura : baina hura ken cedin hayén aguerritic .

text: And they said one to another , Did not our heart burn within us , while he talked with us by the way , and while he opened to us the scriptures ?
text2: Eta erran ceçaten elkarren artean , Etzena gure bihotza erratzen gutan , minço çaicunean bidean , eta declaratzen cerauzquigunean Scripturác ?

text: And they rose up the same hour , and returned to Jerusalem , and found the eleven gathered together , and them that were with them ,
text2: Eta iaiquiric ordu hartan berean itzul citecen Ierusalemera , eta eriden citzaten elkargana bilduac hamecác , eta hequin ciradenac :

text: Saying , The Lord is risen indeed , and hath appeared to Simon .
text2: Erraiten çutela , Resuscitatu da Iauna eguiazqui , eta aguertu içan çayó Simoni .

text: And they told what things were done in the way , and how he was known of them in breaking of bread .
text2: Hec - ere conta citzaten bideco gauçác , eta nola heçaz eçagutu içan cen oguiaren haustean .

text: And as they thus spake , Jesus himself stood in the midst of them , and saith unto them , Peace be unto you .
text2: Eta gauça hauçaz minço ciradela , presenta cedin Iesus bera hayén artean , eta erran ciecén , Baquea dela çuequin .

text: But they were terrified and affrighted , and supposed that they had seen a spirit .
text2: Baina hec trublaturic eta icituric , vste çutén spiritubat çacussatela .

text: And he said unto them , Why are ye troubled ? and why do thoughts arise in your hearts ?
text2: Orduan erran ciecén , Cergatic trublatu çarete , eta cergatic pensamenduac igaiten dirade çuen bihotzetara ?

text: Behold my hands and my feet , that it is I myself : handle me , and see ; for a spirit hath not flesh and bones , as ye see me have .
text2: Ikus itzaçue ene escuac eta ene oinac : ecen hura bera naiz ni , hazta neçaçue , eta mira : ecen spirituac haraguiric ez heçurric eztu , nola nic dudala baitacussaçue .

text: And when he had thus spoken , he shewed them his hands and his feet .
text2: Eta gauça hauc erran cituenean , eracuts cietzén escuac eta oinac .

text: And while they yet believed not for joy , and wondered , he said unto them , Have ye here any meat ?
text2: Baina oraino hec alegueraz sinhesten etzutela , eta miraz ceudela , erran ciecén , Baduçue hemen deus iatecoric ?

text: And they gave him a piece of a broiled fish , and of an honeycomb .
text2: Orduan hec presenta cieçoten arrain erre çathibat , eta ezti orrace batetaric .

text: And he took it , and did eat before them .
text2: Eta harturic hayén aitzinean ian ceçan .

text: And he said unto them , These are the words which I spake unto you , while I was yet with you , that all things must be fulfilled , which were written in the law of Moses , and in the prophets , and in the psalms , concerning me .
text2: Eta erran ciecén , Hauc dirade erraiten nerauzquiçuen hitzac , oraino çuequin nincela , ecen behar ciradela complitu niçaz Moysesen Leguean , eta Prophetetan , eta Psalmuetan scribaturic dauden gauça guciac .

text: Then opened he their understanding , that they might understand the scriptures ,
text2: Orduan irequi ceçan hayén adimendua , Scripturén aditzeco .

text: And said unto them , Thus it is written , and thus it behoved Christ to suffer , and to rise from the dead the third day :
text2: Eta erran ciecén , Hala da scribatua eta hala behar cen Christec suffri leçan , eta resuscita ledin hiletaric hereneco egunean .

text: And that repentance and remission of sins should be preached in his name among all nations , beginning at Jerusalem .
text2: Eta predica ledin haren icenean penitentiá eta bekatuén barkamendua natione gucietan , hassiric Ierusalemetic .

text: And ye are witnesses of these things .
text2: Eta çuec çarete testimonio gauça hauçaz : eta huná nic igorriren dut neure Aitaren promessa çuen gainera :

text: And , behold , I send the promise of my Father upon you : but tarry ye in the city of Jerusalem , until ye be endued with power from on high .
text2: Baina çuec çaudete Ierusalemeco hirian verthutez garaitic vezti çaitezqueteno .

text: And he led them out as far as to Bethany , and he lifted up his hands , and blessed them .
text2: Guero eraman citzan camporát Bethaniarano eta bere escuac altchaturic , benedica citzan .

text: And it came to pass , while he blessed them , he was parted from them , and carried up into heaven .
text2: Eta guertha cedin hec benedicatzen cituela , appartaturic hetaric , goiti altcha baitzedin cerurát .

text: And they worshipped him , and returned to Jerusalem with great joy :
text2: Eta hec hura adoraturic itzul citecen Ierusalemera , bozcario handirequin .

text: And were continually in the temple , praising and blessing God . Amen .
text2: Eta ciraden bethi templean , laudatzen eta benedicatzen çutela Iaincoa . Amen .

text: In the beginning was the Word , and the Word was with God , and the Word was God .
text2: HATSEAN cen Hitza , eta Hitza cen Iaincoa baithan , eta Iainco cen Hitza .

text: The same was in the beginning with God .
text2: Hitz haur cen hatsean Iaincoa baithan .

text: All things were made by him ; and without him was not any thing made that was made .
text2: Gauça guciac Hitz harçaz eguin içan dirade : eta hura gabe deus ezta eguin , eguin denic .

text: In him was life ; and the life was the light of men .
text2: Hartan cen vicitzea , eta vicitzea cen guiçonén Arguia :

text: And the light shineth in darkness ; and the darkness comprehended it not .
text2: Eta Argui hunec ilhumbean arguitzen du : eta ilhumbeac hura eztu comprehenditu .

text: There was a man sent from God , whose name was John .
text2: Içan da guiçon - bat Iaincoaz igorria , Ioannes deitzen cenic .

text: The same came for a witness , to bear witness of the Light , that all men through him might believe .
text2: Haur ethor cedin testimoniage ekartera Arguiaz testifica leçançat , guciéc harçaz sinhets leçatençat .

text: He was not that Light , but was sent to bear witness of that Light .
text2: Etzén hura Arguia , baina igorri cen Arguiaz testifica leçançát .

text: That was the true Light , which lighteth every man that cometh into the world .
text2: Haur cen Argui eguiazcoa , mundura ethorten den guiçon gucia arguitzen duena .

text: He was in the world , and the world was made by him , and the world knew him not .
text2: Munduan cen , eta mundua harçaz eguin içan da , eta munduac eztu hura eçagutu .

text: He came unto his own , and his own received him not .
text2: Beretara ethorri içan da , eta beréc eztute hura , recebitu .

text: But as many as received him , to them gave he power to become the sons of God , even to them that believe on his name :
text2: Baina hura recebitu duten guciey , eman draue priuilegio Iaincoaren haour içateco , haren icenean sinhesten duteney :

text: Which were born , not of blood , nor of the will of the flesh , nor of the will of man , but of God .
text2: Cein ezpaitirade iayo odoletaric , ez haraguiaren vorondatetic , ez guiçonaren vorondatetic : baina Iaincoaganic .

text: And the Word was made flesh , and dwelt among us , ( and we beheld his glory , the glory as of the only begotten of the Father , ) full of grace and truth .
text2: Eta Hitza haragui eguin içan da , eta habitatu içan da gure artean , ( eta contemplatu vkan dugu haren gloriá , gloriá diot Aitaganic engendratu bakoitzarena beçala ) gratiaz eta eguiaz bethea

text: John bare witness of him , and cried , saying , This was he of whom I spake , He that cometh after me is preferred before me : for he was before me .
text2: Ioannesec testificatu vkan du harçaz , eta oihu eguin , cioela , Haur da ceinez erraiten - bainuen , Ene ondoan ethorten dena , ni baino aitzinecoago da : ecen ni baino lehen cen .

text: And of his fulness have all we received , and grace for grace .
text2: Eta haren abundantiatic guciéc recebitu v kan dugu , eta gratia gratiagatic .

text: For the law was given by Moses , but grace and truth came by Jesus Christ .
text2: Ecen Leguea Moysesez eman içan da , baina gratiá eta eguiá Iesus Christez eguin içan da .

text: No man hath seen God at any time ; the only begotten Son , which is in the bosom of the Father , he hath declared him .
text2: Iaincoa nehorc eztu ikussi egundano , Aitaren bulharrean den seme bakoitzac berac declaratu draucu .

text: And this is the record of John , when the Jews sent priests and Levites from Jerusalem to ask him , Who art thou ?
text2: Eta haur da Ioannesen testimoniage , Iuduéc Ierusalemetic Sacrificadoreac eta Leuitác igorri cituztenecoa , hura interroga leçatençat , Hi nor aiz ?

text: And he confessed , and denied not ; but confessed , I am not the Christ .
text2: Eta aithor ceçan , eta etzeçan vka : eta aithor ceçan , cioela , Eznaiz ni Christ .

text: And they asked him , What then ? Art thou Elias ? And he saith , I am not . Art thou that prophet ? And he answered , No .
text2: Orduan interroga ceçaten , Cer beraz ? Elias aiz hi ? Eta erran ceçan , Eznaiz . Propheta aiz hi ? Eta ihardets ceçan , Ez .

text: Then said they unto him , Who art thou ? that we may give an answer to them that sent us . What sayest thou of thyself ?
text2: Erran cieçoten bada , Nor aiz ? respostu deyegunçát igorri gaituzteney : cer dioc eurorrez ?

text: He said , I am the voice of one crying in the wilderness , Make straight the way of the Lord , as said the prophet Esaias .
text2: Dio , Ni naiz desertuan oihuz dagoenaren voza , Plana eçaçue Iaunaren bidea , Esaias Prophetác erran çuen beçala .

text: And they which were sent were of the Pharisees .
text2: Eta igorri içan ciradenac Phariseu ciraden .

text: And they asked him , and said unto him , Why baptizest thou then , if thou be not that Christ , nor Elias , neither that prophet ?
text2: Eta interroga ceçaten hura , eta erran cieçoten . Cergatic beraz batheyatzen ari aiz , baldin hi Christ ezpahaiz , ez Elias , ez Propheta ?

text: John answered them , saying , I baptize with water : but there standeth one among you , whom ye know not ;
text2: Ihardets ciecén Ioannesec , cioela , Ni batheyatzen ari naiz vrez , baina çuen artean da bat çuec ecagutzen eztuçuenic :

text: He it is , who coming after me is preferred before me , whose shoe ' s latchet I am not worthy to unloose .
text2: Hura da ene ondoan ethorten dena , cein ni baino aitzinecoago baita , ceinen çapataco hedearen lachatzeco ezpainaiz ni digne .

text: These things were done in Bethabara beyond Jordan , where John was baptizing .
text2: Gauça hauc Bethabaran eguin içan ciraden Iordanaz berce aldean , non Ioannes batheyatzen ari baitzén .

text: The next day John seeth Jesus coming unto him , and saith , Behold the Lamb of God , which taketh away the sin of the world .
text2: Biharamunean ikusten du Ioannesec Iesus harengana ethorten dela , eta dio , Huná Iaincoaren Bildotsa munduaren bekatuac kencen dituena .

text: This is he of whom I said , After me cometh a man which is preferred before me : for he was before me .
text2: Haur da ceinez erraiten bainuen , Ene ondoan ethorten da guiçon - bat , cein ni baino aitzinecoago baita , ecen ni baino lehen cen .

text: And I knew him not : but that he should be made manifest to Israel , therefore am I come baptizing with water .
text2: Eta nic eznuen hura eçagutzen : baina Israeli manifesta daquionçát , halacotz ethorri naiz ni vrez batheyatzera .

text: And John bare record , saying , I saw the Spirit descending from heaven like a dove , and it abode upon him .
text2: Orduan bada testifica ceçan Ioannesec , cioela , Ikussi dut Spiritua iausten dela vsso columba baten guissán cerutic eta egon - ere bacedin haren gainean .

text: And I knew him not : but he that sent me to baptize with water , the same said unto me , Upon whom thou shalt see the Spirit descending , and remaining on him , the same is he which baptizeth with the Holy Ghost .
text2: Eta nic eznuen eçagutzen hura : baina vrez batheyatzera igorri nauenac , erran cerautan , Noren gainera ikussiren baituc Spiritua iausten , eta egoiten haren gainean , hura duc Spiritu sainduaz batheyatzen duena .

text: And I saw , and bare record that this is the Son of God .
text2: Eta nic dut ikussi , eta dut testificatu ecen haur dela Iaincoaren Semea .

text: Again the next day after John stood , and two of his disciples ;
text2: Biharamunean berriz bacegoen Ioannes , eta harenic bi discipulu :

text: And looking upon Jesus as he walked , he saith , Behold the Lamb of God !
text2: Eta ikussiric Iesus ebilten , erran ceçan , Hará Iaincoaren Bildotsa .

text: And the two disciples heard him speak , and they followed Jesus .
text2: Eta ençun ceçaten hura bi discipuluéc minçatzen , eta iarreiqui içan çaizcan Iesusi .

text: Then Jesus turned , and saw them following , and saith unto them , What seek ye ? They said unto him , Rabbi , ( which is to say , being interpreted , Master , ) where dwellest thou ?
text2: Eta itzuliric Iesusec , eta ikussiric hec çarreitzala , dioste hæy , Ceren bilha çabiltzate ? Eta hec erran cieçoten , Rabbi ( erran nahi baita hambat nola Magistrua ) non egoiten aiz ?

text: He saith unto them , Come and see . They came and saw where he dwelt , and abode with him that day : for it was about the tenth hour .
text2: Dioste , Çatozte eta ikussaçue . Ethor citecen eta ikus ceçaten non egoiten cen : eta hura baithan egon citecen egun hartan : ecen hamar orenén inguruä cen .

text: One of the two which heard John speak , and followed him , was Andrew , Simon Peter ' s brother .
text2: Cen Andriu Simon Pierrisen anayea , Ioannes minçatzen ençun çuten bietaric eta hari iarreiqui çaizconetaric bata .

text: He first findeth his own brother Simon , and saith unto him , We have found the Messias , which is , being interpreted , the Christ .
text2: Hunec eriden ceçan lehenic Simon bere anayea , eta erran cieçón , Eriden diagu Messias , ( erran nahi baita hambat nola Christ . )

text: And he brought him to Jesus . And when Jesus beheld him , he said , Thou art Simon the son of Jona : thou shalt be called Cephas , which is by interpretation , A stone .
text2: Eta eraman ceçan hura Iesusgana . Eta Iesusec harenganat behaturic erran ceçan , Hi aiz Simon Ionaren semea : hi deithuren aiz Cephas ( hambat erran nahi baita nola harria )

text: The day following Jesus would go forth into Galilee , and findeth Philip , and saith unto him , Follow me .
text2: Biharamunean Iesus ioan nahi içan cen Galileara eta eriden ceçan Philippe , eta erran cieçon , Arreit niri .

text: Now Philip was of Bethsaida , the city of Andrew and Peter .
text2: Eta Philippe cen Bethsaidaco , Andriuen eta Pierrisen hirico .

text: Philip findeth Nathanael , and saith unto him , We have found him , of whom Moses in the law , and the prophets , did write , Jesus of Nazareth , the son of Joseph .
text2: Erideiten du Philippec Nathanael , eta diotsa , Eriden diagu Iesus Nazarethecoa , Iosephen semea , ceinez scribatu baitu Moysesec Leguean eta Prophetéc .

text: And Nathanael said unto him , Can there any good thing come out of Nazareth ? Philip saith unto him , Come and see .
text2: Eta erran cieçón Nathanaelec , Nazarethetic deus onic ahal date ? Diotsa Philippec , Athor eta ikussac .

text: Jesus saw Nathanael coming to him , and saith of him , Behold an Israelite indeed , in whom is no guile !
text2: Ikus ceçan Iesusec Nathanael harengana ethorten cela , eta erran ceçan harçaz , Huná eguiazco Israelitabat ceinetan enganioric ezpaita .

text: Nathanael saith unto him , Whence knowest thou me ? Jesus answered and said unto him , Before that Philip called thee , when thou wast under the fig tree , I saw thee .
text2: Diotsa Nathanaelec , Nondic naçaguc ? Ihardets ceçan Iesusec eta erran cieçón , Philippec dei ençan baino lehen , ficotze azpian incenean ikusten indudan .

text: Nathanael answered and saith unto him , Rabbi , thou art the Son of God ; thou art the King of Israel .
text2: Ihardets ceçan Nathanaelec , eta erran cieçón , Magistruá , hi aiz Iaincoaren Semea : hi aiz Israeleco Reguea .

text: Jesus answered and said unto him , Because I said unto thee , I saw thee under the fig tree , believest thou ? thou shalt see greater things than these .
text2: Ihardets ceçan Iesusec , eta erran cieçón , Ceren erran drauadan , Ikussi aut ficotze azpian , sinhesten duc ? gauça hauc baino handiagoric ikussiren duc .

text: And he saith unto him , Verily , verily , I say unto you , Hereafter ye shall see heaven open , and the angels of God ascending and descending upon the Son of man .
text2: Halaber erran cieçón , Eguiaz eguiaz erraiten drauçuet , Hemendic harat ikussiren duçue ceruä irequiric , eta Iaincoaren Aingueruac igaiten eta iausten diradela guiçonaren Semearen gainera .

text: And the third day there was a marriage in Cana of Galilee ; and the mother of Jesus was there :
text2: Eta hereneco egunean ezteyac eguin citecen Cana Galileacoan : eta Iesusen ama cen han

text: And both Jesus was called , and his disciples , to the marriage .
text2: Eta deithu içan cen Iesus - ere , eta haren discipuluac ezteyetara .

text: And when they wanted wine , the mother of Jesus saith unto him , They have no wine .
text2: Eta faltatu cenean mahatsarnoa , bere amác diotsa , Iesusi , Mahatsarnoric eztié .

text: Jesus saith unto her , Woman , what have I to do with thee ? mine hour is not yet come .
text2: Diotsa Iesusec , Cer dut nic hirequin emaztea ? oraino eztun ethorri ene orena .

text: His mother saith unto the servants , Whatsoever he saith unto you , do it .
text2: Dioste haren amac cerbitzariey , Cer - ere erran baitieçaçue , eguiçue .

text: And there were set there six waterpots of stone , after the manner of the purifying of the Jews , containing two or three firkins apiece .
text2: Eta ciraden han sey kuba harrizcoric eçarriac Iuduén purificationearen araura , çaducatenic batbederac birá edo hirurná neurri .

text: Jesus saith unto them , Fill the waterpots with water . And they filled them up to the brim .
text2: Dioste Iesusec , Bethaitzaçue kubác vrez . Eta bethe citzaten garairano .

text: And he saith unto them , Draw out now , and bear unto the governor of the feast . And they bare it .
text2: Orduan dioste , Eraitsaçue orain , eta ekarroçue mestedostalari . Eta ekar cieçoten :

text: When the ruler of the feast had tasted the water that was made wine , and knew not whence it was : ( but the servants which drew the water knew ; ) the governor of the feast called the bridegroom ,
text2: Eta dastatu çuenean mestedostalac vr mahatsarno eguin içan cena ( eta etzaquian nondic cen : baina vra karreatu çuten cerbitzariéc baçaquiten ) deitzen du sposoa mestedostalac ,

text: And saith unto him , Every man at the beginning doth set forth good wine ; and when men have well drunk , then that which is worse : but thou hast kept the good wine until now .
text2: Eta diotsa , Guiçon guciac lehenic mahatsarno ona eçarten dic , guero vngui edan duqueiten orduan , gaichtoena : baina hic beguiratu vkan duc mahatsarno ona oraindrano .

text: This beginning of miracles did Jesus in Cana of Galilee , and manifested forth his glory ; and his disciples believed on him .
text2: Signo hatse haur eguin ceçan Iesusec Cana Galileacoan , eta manifesta ceçan bere gloriá : eta sinhets ceçaten hura baithan haren discipuluéc

text: After this he went down to Capernaum , he , and his mother , and his brethren , and his disciples : and they continued there not many days .
text2: Guero iauts cedin Capernaumera , bera eta haren amá eta haren anayeac eta haren discipuluac : eta egon citecen han , ez anhitz egun .

text: And the Jews ' passover was at hand , and Jesus went up to Jerusalem ,
text2: Ecen hurbil cen Iuduén Bazcoa . Igan cedin bada Iesus Ierusalemera .

text: And found in the temple those that sold oxen and sheep and doves , and the changers of money sitting :
text2: Eta eriden citzan templean idi eta ardi eta vsso columba salçaleac , eta cambiadoreac iarriric ceudela .

text: And when he had made a scourge of small cords , he drove them all out of the temple , and the sheep , and the oxen ; and poured out the changers ' money , and overthrew the tables ;
text2: Eta eguinic açotebat kordatoz , guciac egotz citzan templetic , eta ardiac eta idiac : eta cambiadorén monedá issur ceçan , eta mahainac itzul citzan .

text: And said unto them that sold doves , Take these things hence ; make not my Father ' s house an house of merchandise .
text2: Eta vsso columba salçaley erran ciecén , Ken itçaçue gauça hauc hemendic : eta eztaguiçuela ene Aitaren etcheaz merkatalgoataco etche .

text: And his disciples remembered that it was written , The zeal of thine house hath eaten me up .
text2: Orduan orhoit citecen haren discipuluac ecen scribatua dela , Hire etcheazco zeloac ni ian niauc .

text: Then answered the Jews and said unto him , What sign shewest thou unto us , seeing that thou doest these things ?
text2: Ihardets ceçaten bada Iuduéc eta erran cieçoten , Cer signo eracusten draucuc gauça horiac eguin ditzán ?

text: Jesus answered and said unto them , Destroy this temple , and in three days I will raise it up .
text2: Ihardets ceçan Iesusec , eta erran ciecén , Deseguin eçaçue temple haur , eta hirur egunez dut altchaturen :

text: Then said the Jews , Forty and six years was this temple in building , and wilt thou rear it up in three days ?
text2: Erran ceçaten bada Iuduéc , Berroguey , eta sey vrthez edificatu içan duc temple haur , eta eta hic hirur egunez altchaturen duc ?

text: But he spake of the temple of his body .
text2: Baina hura minço cen bere gorputzazco templeaz .

text: When therefore he was risen from the dead , his disciples remembered that he had said this unto them ; and they believed the scripture , and the word which Jesus had said .
text2: Bada resuscitatu cenean hiletaric , orhoit citecen haren discipuluac , nola haur erran vkan cerauen : eta sinhets ceçaten Scripturá , eta Iesusec erran çuen hitza .

text: Now when he was in Jerusalem at the passover , in the feast day , many believed in his name , when they saw the miracles which he did .
text2: Eta Ierusalemen cenean Bazco bestán , anhitzec sinhets ceçaten haren icenean , ikussiric harc eguiten cituen signoac .

text: But Jesus did not commit himself unto them , because he knew all men ,
text2: Baina Iesus bera etzayen fida , ceren harc eçagutzen baitzituen guciac :

text: And needed not that any should testify of man : for he knew what was in man .
text2: Eta ceren ezpaitzuen mengoaric nehorc testifica leçan guiçonaz : ecen berac baçaquian cer cen guiçonean .

text: There was a man of the Pharisees , named Nicodemus , a ruler of the Jews :
text2: Cen bada Phariseuetaric edoceimbat Nicodemo deitzen cenic , Iuduén arteco principaletaric bat :

text: The same came to Jesus by night , and said unto him , Rabbi , we know that thou art a teacher come from God : for no man can do these miracles that thou doest , except God be with him .
text2: Haur ethor cedin Iesusgana gauaz , eta erran cieçón , Magistruá , baceaquiagu ecen Iaincoaganic magistru ethorria aicela : ecen nehorc ecin eguin citzaquec hic eguiten dituán signo hauc , Iaincoa harequin ezpada .

text: Jesus answered and said unto him , Verily , verily , I say unto thee , Except a man be born again , he cannot see the kingdom of God .
text2: Ihardets ceçan Iesusec eta erran cieçón , Eguiaz eguiaz erraiten drauat , berriz iayo içanen eztenec , ecin ikus deçaquela Iaincoaren resumá

text: Nicodemus saith unto him , How can a man be born when he is old ? can he enter the second time into his mother ' s womb , and be born ?
text2: Erran cieçón Nicodemoc , Nolatan guiçona iayo ahal daite çahar denean ? ala berriz bere amaren sabelean sar eta iayo ahal daite ?

text: Jesus answered , Verily , verily , I say unto thee , Except a man be born of water and of the Spirit , he cannot enter into the kingdom of God .
text2: Ihardets ceçan Iesusec , Eguiaz eguiaz erraiten drauát , vrez eta Spirituz iayo eztena , ecin sar daitela Iaincoaren resumán .

text: That which is born of the flesh is flesh ; and that which is born of the Spirit is spirit .
text2: Haraguitic iayo dena haragui duc : eta Spiritutic iayo dena , spiritu duc .

text: Marvel not that I said unto thee , Ye must be born again .
text2: Ezteçála mirets ceren erran drauadan , Berriz iayo behar çarete .

text: The wind bloweth where it listeth , and thou hearest the sound thereof , but canst not tell whence it cometh , and whither it goeth : so is every one that is born of the Spirit .
text2: Haiceac nahi duen lekura diraunsac : eta haren hotsa ençuten duc : baina eztaquic nondic heldu den ez norat ioaiten den : hala duc spiritutic iayo den gucia .

text: Nicodemus answered and said unto him , How can these things be ?
text2: Ihardets ceçan Nicodemoc , eta erran cieçon , Nolatan gauça hauc eguin ahal daitezque ?

text: Jesus answered and said unto him , Art thou a master of Israel , and knowest not these things ?
text2: Ihardets ceçan Iesusec , eta erran cieçón , Hi aiz Israeleco doctor , eta gauça hauc eztituc eçagutzen ?

text: Verily , verily , I say unto thee , We speak that we do know , and testify that we have seen ; and ye receive not our witness .
text2: Eguiaz eguiaz erraiten drauat , ecen daquigun gauçá erraiten dugula , eta ikussi dugun gauçáz testificatzen dugula : baina gure testimoniagea eztuçue recebitzen .

text: If I have told you earthly things , and ye believe not , how shall ye believe , if I tell you of heavenly things ?
text2: Baldin lurreco gauçác erran badrauzquiçuet , eta sinhesten ezpadituçue ? nolatan baldin ceruco gauçác erran badietzaçuet sinhetsiren duçue ?

text: And no man hath ascended up to heaven , but he that came down from heaven , even the Son of man which is in heaven .
text2: Ecen nehor ezta igan cerura , cerutic iautsi dena baicen , cein baita guiçonaren Seme ceruän dena .

text: And as Moses lifted up the serpent in the wilderness , even so must the Son of man be lifted up :
text2: Eta nola Moysesec altcha baitzeçan suguea desertuan , hala altcha dadin behar da guiçonaren Semea :

text: That whosoever believeth in him should not perish , but have eternal life .
text2: Hura baithan sinheste duenic batre gal eztadin , baina vicitze eternala duençát .

text: For God so loved the world , that he gave his only begotten Son , that whosoever believeth in him should not perish , but have everlasting life .
text2: Ecen hala Iaincoac onhetsi vkan du mundua , non bere Seme bakoitza eman vkan baitu , hura baithan sinhesten duenic gal eztadin , baina vicitze eternala duençát .

text: For God sent not his Son into the world to condemn the world ; but that the world through him might be saved .
text2: Ecen eztu igorri Iaincoac bere Semea mundura , mundua condemna deçançát , baina mundua harçaz salua dadinçát .

text: He that believeth on him is not condemned : but he that believeth not is condemned already , because he hath not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God .
text2: Hura baithan sinhesten duenic , ezta condemnatzen : baina sinhesten eztuena ia condemnatua da : ecen eztu sinhetsi Iaincoaren Seme bakoitzaren icenean .

text: And this is the condemnation , that light is come into the world , and men loved darkness rather than light , because their deeds were evil .
text2: Haur da bada condemnationea , ecen Arguia ethorri da mundura , baina onhetsiago dute guizonéc ilhumbea ecen ez Arguia : ceren hayen obrác gaichtoac baitirade .

text: For every one that doeth evil hateth the light , neither cometh to the light , lest his deeds should be reproved .
text2: Ecen gaizqui ari den guciac , gaitz daritza arguiari : eta ezta arguira ethorten , haren obrác reprehendi eztitecençat .

text: But he that doeth truth cometh to the light , that his deeds may be made manifest , that they are wrought in God .
text2: Baina bidezqui ari dena , ethorten da arguira , haren obrác manifesta ditecençat : ceren Iaincoaren araura eguinac baitirade .

text: After these things came Jesus and his disciples into the land of Judaea ; and there he tarried with them , and baptized .
text2: Guero ethor cedin Iesus bere discipuluequin Iudeaco lurrera : eta han egoiten cen hequin , eta batheyatzen ari cen .

text: And John also was baptizing in Aenon near to Salim , because there was much water there : and they came , and were baptized .
text2: Eta Ioannes - ere batheyatzen ari cen Enonen Salimgo aldean , ceren anhitz vr baitzén han : eta ethorten ciradén gendeac eta batheyatzen ciraden .

text: For John was not yet cast into prison .
text2: Ecen oraino etzén eçarri içan Ioannes presoindeguian .

text: Then there arose a question between some of John ' s disciples and the Jews about purifying .
text2: Altcha cedin bada questionebat Ioannesen discipuluetaric Iuduequin purificationeaz .

text: And they came unto John , and said unto him , Rabbi , he that was with thee beyond Jordan , to whom thou barest witness , behold , the same baptizeth , and all men come to him .
text2: Eta ethor citecen Ioannesgana , eta erran cieçoten , Magistruá , Iordanaz berce aldean hirequin cena , ceinez hic testificatu baituc , hará , batheyatzen ari duc , eta guciac ethorten dituc harengana .

text: John answered and said , A man can receive nothing , except it be given him from heaven .
text2: Ihardets ceçan Ioannes - ec eta erran ceçan , Ecin guiçonac recebi deçaque deus , baldin eman ezpadaquio cerutic .

text: Ye yourselves bear me witness , that I said , I am not the Christ , but that I am sent before him .
text2: Çuec ceuroc çaituztet testimonio nola erran dudan , Ez naiz ni Christ , baina igorri içan naiz haren aitzinean .

text: He that hath the bride is the bridegroom : but the friend of the bridegroom , which standeth and heareth him , rejoiceth greatly because of the bridegroom ' s voice : this my joy therefore is fulfilled .
text2: Sposa duena sposo da : baina sposo denaren adisquide han dena eta hura ençuten duena , haguitz alegueratzen da sposoaren vozagatic : beraz ene alegrançá complitu da .

text: He must increase , but I must decrease .
text2: Harc behar du handitu , eta nic chipitu .

text: He that cometh from above is above all : he that is of the earth is earthly , and speaketh of the earth : he that cometh from heaven is above all .
text2: Garaitic ethorri dena , gucién gaineco da : lurretic dena , lurreco da , eta lurreco gaucéz minço da : cerutic ethorri dena gucién gaineco da .

text: And what he hath seen and heard , that he testifieth ; and no man receiveth his testimony .
text2: Eta cer ikussi eta ençun baitu hura testificatzen du : baina haren testimoniagea nehorc eztu recebitzen .

text: He that hath received his testimony hath set to his seal that God is true .
text2: Haren testimoniagea recebitu duenac ciguilatu du ecen Iaincoa eguiati dela .

text: For he whom God hath sent speaketh the words of God : for God giveth not the Spirit by measure unto him .
text2: Ecen Iaincoac igorri duena Iaincoaren hitzéz minçatzen da , ecen Iaincoac eztrauca neurriz emaiten Spiritua .

text: The Father loveth the Son , and hath given all things into his hand .
text2: Aitác maite du Semea , eta gauça guciac eman ditu haren escura .

text: He that believeth on the Son hath everlasting life : and he that believeth not the Son shall not see life ; but the wrath of God abideth on him .
text2: Sinhesten duenac Semea baithan , badu vicitze eternala : baina Semea obeditzen eztuenac , eztu ikussiren vicitzea , baina Iaincoaren hirá dago haren gainean .

text: When therefore the Lord knew how the Pharisees had heard that Jesus made and baptized more disciples than John ,
text2: Bada eçagutu çuenean Iaunac nola ençun çuten Phariseuéc ecen Iesusec discipulu guehiago eguiten çuela eta batheyatzen , ecen ez Ioannesec :

text: ( Though Jesus himself baptized not , but his disciples , )
text2: ( Iesus bera batheyatzen ari ezpacen - ere , baina haren discipuluac )

text: He left Judaea , and departed again into Galilee .
text2: Vtzi ceçan Iudea , eta ioan cedin berriz Galilearát .

text: And he must needs go through Samaria .
text2: Eta harc behar çuen iragan Samariatic .

text: Then cometh he to a city of Samaria , which is called Sychar , near to the parcel of ground that Jacob gave to his son Joseph .
text2: Ethorten da bada Samariaco hiri Sichar deitzen den batetara cein baita Iacob - ec bere seme Iosephi eman ceraucan possessionearen aldean .

text: Now Jacob ' s well was there . Jesus therefore , being wearied with his journey , sat thus on the well : and it was about the sixth hour .
text2: Eta cen han Iacob - en ithurria : Iesus bada bidean vnhatua berehala iar cedin ithur bazterrean : ecen bacén sey orenén inguruä .

text: There cometh a woman of Samaria to draw water : Jesus saith unto her , Give me to drink .
text2: Ethor cedin emazte Samaritanabat vr idoquitera : erran cieçón hari Iesusec , Indan edatera .

text: ( For his disciples were gone away unto the city to buy meat . )
text2: Ecen haren discipuluac ioan içan ciraden hirira iateco erostera .

text: Then saith the woman of Samaria unto him , How is it that thou , being a Jew , askest drink of me , which am a woman of Samaria ? for the Jews have no dealings with the Samaritans .
text2: Diotsa bada hari emazte Samaritana hunec , Nola hi Iudu aicelaric , edatera niri esquez aut , bainaiz emazte Samaritana ? ecen eztié conuersationeric Iuduéc Samaritanoequin .

text: Jesus answered and said unto her , If thou knewest the gift of God , and who it is that saith to thee , Give me to drink ; thou wouldest have asked of him , and he would have given thee living water .
text2: Ihardets ceçan Iesusec eta erran cieçon , Baldin bahaqui Iaincoaren dohaina , eta nor den hiri erraiten draunana , Indan edatera , hi escatu inçayqueon hari , eta eman baitzerauquenán vr vicitic .

text: The woman saith unto him , Sir , thou hast nothing to draw with , and the well is deep : from whence then hast thou that living water ?
text2: Diotsa emazteac , Iauna , eztuc cerçaz idoqui deçán , eta putzua duc barna : nondic duc beraz vr vici hori ?

text: Art thou greater than our father Jacob , which gave us the well , and drank thereof himself , and his children , and his cattle ?
text2: Ala gure aita Iacob baino handiago aiz hi , ceinec eman baitraucu putzu haur , eta berac hunetaric edan baitu , eta haren haourréc , eta haren abréc ?

text: Jesus answered and said unto her , Whosoever drinketh of this water shall thirst again :
text2: Ihardets ceçan Iesusec eta erran cieçon , Vr hunetaric edaten duen gucia egarrituren dun berriz :

text: But whosoever drinketh of the water that I shall give him shall never thirst ; but the water that I shall give him shall be in him a well of water springing up into everlasting life .
text2: Baina norc - ere edanen baitu nic emanen draucadan vretic , eztun egarrituren seculan : baina nic emanen draucadan vra , eguinen dun hura baithan vr iauzten denezco ithurri , vicitze eternalecotzat .

text: The woman saith unto him , Sir , give me this water , that I thirst not , neither come hither to draw .
text2: Diotsa emazteac , Iauna , indac vr horretaric , egarri eznadin , eta ethor eznadin huna idoquitera .

text: Jesus saith unto her , Go , call thy husband , and come hither .
text2: Diotsa Iesusec , Habil dei eçan eure senharra , eta athor huna .

text: The woman answered and said , I have no husband . Jesus said unto her , Thou hast well said , I have no husband :
text2: Ihardets ceçan emazteac eta erran cieçón , Eztiát senharric . Diotsa Iesusec , Vngui erran dun , Eztiát senharric .

text: For thou hast had five husbands ; and he whom thou now hast is not thy husband : in that saidst thou truly .
text2: Ecen borz senhar vkan ditun , eta orain dunana , eztun hire senhar : hori eguiaz erran dun .

text: The woman saith unto him , Sir , I perceive that thou art a prophet .
text2: Diotsa emazteac , Iauna , badiacussát ecen Propheta aicela hi .

text: Our fathers worshipped in this mountain ; and ye say , that in Jerusalem is the place where men ought to worship .
text2: Gure aitéc mendi hunetan adoratu vkan dié : eta çuec dioçue ecen Ierusalemen dela lekua non adoratu behar baita .

text: Jesus saith unto her , Woman , believe me , the hour cometh , when ye shall neither in this mountain , nor yet at Jerusalem , worship the Father .
text2: Diotsa Iesusec , Emazteá , sinhets neçan ni , ecen ethorten dela orena noiz ezpaituçue mendi hunetan ez Ierusalemen adoraturen Aita .

text: Ye worship ye know not what : we know what we worship : for salvation is of the Jews .
text2: Çuec adoratzen duçue eztaquiçuena , guc adoratzen dinagu daquiguna : ecen saluamendua Iuduetaric dun .

text: But the hour cometh , and now is , when the true worshippers shall worship the Father in spirit and in truth : for the Father seeketh such to worship him .
text2: Baina ethorten dun orena , eta orain dun , noiz adoraçale eguiazcoéc adoraturen baitute Aita spirituz eta eguiaz : ecen Aita - ere halaco adoraçalén galdez diagon .

text: God is a Spirit : and they that worship him must worship him in spirit and in truth .
text2: Iaincoa dun Spiritu : eta hura adoratzen dutenéc , spirituz eta eguiaz adoratu behar diné .

text: The woman saith unto him , I know that Messias cometh , which is called Christ : when he is come , he will tell us all things .
text2: Diotsa emazteac , Baceaquiat ecen Messiasa ethorteco dela , Christ deitzen dena , harc dathorrenean declaraturen dirauzquiguc gauça guciac .

text: Jesus saith unto her , I that speak unto thee am he .
text2: Diotsa Iesusec , Ni naun hura , hirequin minço naicena .

text: And upon this came his disciples , and marvelled that he talked with the woman : yet no man said , What seekest thou ? or , Why talkest thou with her ?
text2: Eta bizquitartean ethor citecen haren discipuluac , eta mirets ceçaten nola emazte batequin minço cen : badaric - ere nehorc etzieçón erran , Ceren galdez ago ? edo , Cer minço aiz horrequin ?

text: The woman then left her waterpot , and went her way into the city , and saith to the men ,
text2: Vtzi ceçan bada bere vncia emazteac , eta ioan cedin hirira , eta erran ciecén leku hartaco gendey .

text: Come , see a man , which told me all things that ever I did : is not this the Christ ?
text2: Çatozte , ikussaçue guiçon - bat ceinec erran baitrauzquit eguin ditudan gauça guciac : ezta haur Christ ?

text: Then they went out of the city , and came unto him .
text2: Ilki citecen bada hiritic , eta ethor citecen harengana .

text: In the mean while his disciples prayed him , saying , Master , eat .
text2: Eta bizquitartean othoitz eguiten ceraucaten discipuluéc , cioitela , Magistrua , ian eçac .

text: But he said unto them , I have meat to eat that ye know not of .
text2: Baina harc erran ciecén , Nic viandabat dut iateco , çuec eztaquiçuenic .

text: Therefore said the disciples one to another , Hath any man brought him ought to eat ?
text2: Erraiten çuten bada discipuluéc elkarren artean , Nehorc ekarri othe drauca iatera ?

text: Jesus saith unto them , My meat is to do the will of him that sent me , and to finish his work .
text2: Dioste Iesusec , Ene viandá da eguin deçadan ni igorri nauenaren vorondatea , eta acaba deçadan haren obrá .

text: Say not ye , There are yet four months , and then cometh harvest ? behold , I say unto you , Lift up your eyes , and look on the fields ; for they are white already to harvest .
text2: Eztuçue çuec erraiten , Oraino laur hilebethe dirade , eta vztá ethorriren da ? Huná , erraiten drauçuet , goititzaçue çuen beguiac , miraitzaçue bazterrac , ecen ia churitu dirade vztaren biltzeco .

text: And he that reapeth receiveth wages , and gathereth fruit unto life eternal : that both he that soweth and he that reapeth may rejoice together .
text2: Eta vztá biltzen duenac , sari recebitzen du , eta biltzen du fructua vicitze eternaleracotzát : ereiten duenac bozcario duençát , bayeta biltzen duenac - ere .

text: And herein is that saying true , One soweth , and another reapeth .
text2: Ecen hunetan erran haur eguiazco da , Bat da ereiten duena , eta bercebat biltzen duena .

text: I sent you to reap that whereon ye bestowed no labour : other men laboured , and ye are entered into their labours .
text2: Nic igorri çaituztet nekatu etzaretenaren biltzera : berceac nekatu içan dirade , eta çuec hayén trabailluan sarthu içan çarete .

text: And many of the Samaritans of that city believed on him for the saying of the woman , which testified , He told me all that ever I did .
text2: Eta hiri hartaco Samaritanoetaric anhitzec sinhets ceçaten hura baithan , emazte testificatu çuenaren erranagatic , cioela , Eguin dudan gucia erran draut .

text: So when the Samaritans were come unto him , they besought him that he would tarry with them : and he abode there two days .
text2: Ethorri ciradenean bada Samaritanoac , othoitz eguin cieçoten hequin egon ledin : eta egon cedin han bi egun .

text: And many more believed because of his own word ;
text2: Eta anhitzez guehiagoc sinhets ceçaten beraren hitzagatic .

text: And said unto the woman , Now we believe , not because of thy saying : for we have heard him ourselves , and know that this is indeed the Christ , the Saviour of the world .
text2: Eta emazteari erraiten ceraucaten , Eztinagu goitiric hire erranagatic sinhesten : ecen gueuroc ençun dinagu , eta baceaquinagu ecen haur dela eguiazqui Christ munduaren Saluadorea .

text: Now after two days he departed thence , and went into Galilee .
text2: Eta bi egunen buruän parti cedin handic , eta ioan cedin Galilearát .

text: For Jesus himself testified , that a prophet hath no honour in his own country .
text2: Ecen Iesusec berac testifica ceçan , ecen Propheta batec bere herrian ohoreric eztuela .

text: Then when he was come into Galilee , the Galilaeans received him , having seen all the things that he did at Jerusalem at the feast : for they also went unto the feast .
text2: Bada ethorri içan cenean Galileara , recebi ceçaten Galileanoec , bestán Ierusalemen eguin cituen gauça guciac ikussiric : ecen hec - ere ethorri içan ciraden bestara .

text: So Jesus came again into Cana of Galilee , where he made the water wine . And there was a certain nobleman , whose son was sick at Capernaum .
text2: Ethor cedin bada Iesus berriz Cana Galileaco hirira , non eguin vkan baitzuen vra mahatsarno . Eta cen gorte iaun - bat , ceinen semea baitzén eri Capernaumen .

text: When he heard that Jesus was come out of Judaea into Galilee , he went unto him , and besought him that he would come down , and heal his son : for he was at the point of death .
text2: Haur , encunic ecen Iesus ethorri cela Iudeatic Galileara , ioan cedin harengana , eta othoitz eguin cieçon iauts ledin , eta senda lieçón bere semea : ecen hiltzera cioan .

text: Then said Jesus unto him , Except ye see signs and wonders , ye will not believe .
text2: Erran cieçón orduan Iesusec , Signoac eta miraculuac ikus ezpaditzaçue , ezteçaqueçue sinhets .

text: The nobleman saith unto him , Sir , come down ere my child die .
text2: Diotsa gorte iaun harc , Iauna , iautsi adi ene semea hil dadin baino lehen .

text: Jesus saith unto him , Go thy way ; thy son liveth . And the man believed the word that Jesus had spoken unto him , and he went his way .
text2: Diotsa Iesusec , Habil : hire semea vici duc . Eta sinhets ceçan guiçonac Iesusec erran ceraucan hitza eta ioan cedin .

text: And as he was now going down , his servants met him , and told him , saying , Thy son liveth .
text2: Eta ia hura iausten cela bere cerbitzariac bat cequizquion , eta conta cieçoten , cioitela , Hire semea vici duc .

text: Then inquired he of them the hour when he began to amend . And they said unto him , Yesterday at the seventh hour the fever left him .
text2: Orduan galdeguin ciecén , cer orenez hobequi eriden içan cen : eta erran cieçoten , Atzo çazpi orenetan vtzi cian helgaitzac .

text: So the father knew that it was at the same hour , in the which Jesus said unto him , Thy son liveth : and himself believed , and his whole house .
text2: Eçagut ceçan bada aitác ecen oren hartan cela Iesusec erran ceraucana , Hire semea vici duc . Eta sinhets ceçan berac , eta haren etche guciac .

text: This is again the second miracle that Jesus did , when he was come out of Judaea into Galilee .
text2: Bigarren signo haur berriz eguin ceçan Iesusec ethorri içan cenean Iudeatic Galileara .

text: After this there was a feast of the Jews ; and Jesus went up to Jerusalem .
text2: Gauça hauen ondoan , Iuduén bestabat cen , eta igan cedin Iesus Ierusalemera .

text: Now there is at Jerusalem by the sheep market a pool , which is called in the Hebrew tongue Bethesda , having five porches .
text2: Eta da Ierusalemen ardi plaçán ikuzgarribat Hebraicoz Beth - esda deitzen denic , borz galeria dituenic .

text: In these lay a great multitude of impotent folk , of blind , halt , withered , waiting for the moving of the water .
text2: Hetan cetzan eri , itsu , maingu , membro eyhardun mulço handia , vraren higuitzearen beguira ceudela .

text: For an angel went down at a certain season into the pool , and troubled the water : whosoever then first after the troubling of the water stepped in was made whole of whatsoever disease he had .
text2: Ecen Ainguerubat iausten cen ordu iaquinez ikuzgarrira , eta vra vherritzen çuen : eta vraren vherritze ondoan lehen hartara iausten cena sendatzen cen , cer - ere eritassunec baitzaducan .

text: And a certain man was there , which had an infirmity thirty and eight years .
text2: Eta cen guiçon - bat han hoguey eta hemeçortzi vrthez erharçunac çaducanic .

text: When Jesus saw him lie , and knew that he had been now a long time in that case , he saith unto him , Wilt thou be made whole ?
text2: Haur ikus ceçanean Iesusec cetzala , eta eçaguturic ecen ia dembora lucea çuela , diotsá , Nahi aiz sendatu ?

text: The impotent man answered him , Sir , I have no man , when the water is troubled , to put me into the pool : but while I am coming , another steppeth down before me .
text2: Ihardets cieçón eriac , Iauna , eztiat norc , vra vherritu denean , eçar neçan ikuzgarrira : baina ni ethorten naicen bizquitartean , bercebat ene aitzinean iausten duc .

text: Jesus saith unto him , Rise , take up thy bed , and walk .
text2: Diotsa Iesusec , Iaiqui adi , altcha eçac eure ohea , eta ebil adi .

text: And immediately the man was made whole , and took up his bed , and walked : and on the same day was the sabbath .
text2: Eta bertan senda cedin guiçon hura : eta altcha ceçan bere ohea , eta baçabilan : eta cen Sabbathoa egun hartan .

text: The Jews therefore said unto him that was cured , It is the sabbath day : it is not lawful for thee to carry thy bed .
text2: Erran cieçoten bada Iuduéc sendatu içan cenari , Sabbathoa duc , eztuc sori ohea eraman deçán .

text: He answered them , He that made me whole , the same said unto me , Take up thy bed , and walk .
text2: Ihardets ciecén , Norc ni sendatu bainau , harc erran draut , Altcha eçac eure ohea eta ebil adi .

text: Then asked they him , What man is that which said unto thee , Take up thy bed , and walk ?
text2: Orduan interroga ceçaten , Nor da hiri erran drauan guiçon hura , Altcha eçac eure ohea eta ebil adi ?

text: And he that was healed wist not who it was : for Jesus had conveyed himself away , a multitude being in that place .
text2: Eta sendatu içan cenac , etzaquian nor cen : ecen Iesus apparta cedin leku hartan cen gendetzetic .

text: Afterward Jesus findeth him in the temple , and said unto him , Behold , thou art made whole : sin no more , lest a worse thing come unto thee .
text2: Guero eriden ceçan hura Iesusec templean , eta erran cieçón , Huná , sendatu aiz : guehiago bekaturic eztaguiala , cerbait gaizquiago hel eztaquián :

text: The man departed , and told the Jews that it was Jesus , which had made him whole .
text2: Ioan cedin guicon haur , eta conta ciecén Iuduey ecen Iesus cela hura sendatu vkan çuena .

text: And therefore did the Jews persecute Jesus , and sought to slay him , because he had done these things on the sabbath day .
text2: Eta halacotz persecutatzen çutén Iuduéc Iesus , eta hura hil nahiz çabiltzan , ceren gauça hauc eguin baitzituen Sabbathoan .

text: But Jesus answered them , My Father worketh hitherto , and I work .
text2: Baina Iesusec ihardets ciecén , Ene Aitac oraindrano obratzen du , eta nic - ere obratzen dut .

text: Therefore the Jews sought the more to kill him , because he not only had broken the sabbath , but said also that God was his Father , making himself equal with God .
text2: Halacotz bada Iuduac hura hil nahiz haguitzago çabiltzan , ez solament ceren Sabbathoa hautsi çuen , baina are ceren haren Aita Iaincoa cela erran baitzuen , bere buruä Iaincoaren bardin eguinez .

text: Then answered Jesus and said unto them , Verily , verily , I say unto you , The Son can do nothing of himself , but what he seeth the Father do : for what things soever he doeth , these also doeth the Son likewise .
text2: Ihardets ceçan bada Iesusec , eta erran ciecén , Eguiaz eguiaz erraiten drauçuet , ecin daidi Semeac bere buruz deus , erran nahi da , baldin ikussi ezpadu Aitá obratzen : ecen cer - ere harc eguiten baitu , hura Semeac - ere halaber eguiten du .

text: For the Father loveth the Son , and sheweth him all things that himself doeth : and he will shew him greater works than these , that ye may marvel .
text2: Ecen Aitác maite du Semea , eta berac eguiten dituen gauça guciac eracusten drauzca , eta hauc baino obra handiagoac eracutsiren drauzca hari , çuec mirets deçaçuençát .

text: For as the Father raiseth up the dead , and quickeneth them ; even so the Son quickeneth whom he will .
text2: Ecen nola Aitac resuscitatzen baititu hilac eta viuificatzen , halaber Semeac - ere nahi dituenac viuificatzen ditu .

text: For the Father judgeth no man , but hath committed all judgment unto the Son :
text2: Ecen Aitac eztu iugeatzen nehor , baina iugemendu gucia eman drauca Semeari :

text: That all men should honour the Son , even as they honour the Father . He that honoureth not the Son honoureth not the Father which hath sent him .
text2: Guciéc Semea ohora deçatençát , Aita ohoratzen duten beçala : Semea ohoratzen eztuenac , eztu ohoratzen Aita , ceinec igorri baitu hura .

text: Verily , verily , I say unto you , He that heareth my word , and believeth on him that sent me , hath everlasting life , and shall not come into condemnation ; but is passed from death unto life .
text2: Eguiaz eguiaz erraiten drauçuet , ecen ene hitza ençuten , eta ni igorri nauena sinhesten duenac , baduela vicitze eternala , eta haina ezta condemnationetara ethorriren : baina iragan da heriotic vicitzera .

text: Verily , verily , I say unto you , The hour is coming , and now is , when the dead shall hear the voice of the Son of God : and they that hear shall live .
text2: Eguiaz eguiaz erraiten drauçuet , ecen ethorten dela orena , eta orain dela , noiz hiléc ençunen baitute Iaincoaren Semearen voza , eta ençunen dutenac vicico dirade .

text: For as the Father hath life in himself ; so hath he given to the Son to have life in himself ;
text2: Ecen nola Aitac baitu vicitze bere baithan , hala eman drauca Semeari - ere bere baithan vicitzearen vkaitea .

text: And hath given him authority to execute judgment also , because he is the Son of man .
text2: Eta bothere eman drauca iugemendu - ere eguiteco , guiçonaren Seme den becembatean .

text: Marvel not at this : for the hour is coming , in the which all that are in the graves shall hear his voice ,
text2: Ezteçaçuela mirets haur : ecen ethorriren da orena ceinetan monumentetaco guciéc ençunen baitute haren voza .

text: And shall come forth ; they that have done good , unto the resurrection of life ; and they that have done evil , unto the resurrection of damnation .
text2: Eta ilkiren dirade vngui eguin duqueitenac , vicitzeco resurrectionera : baina gaizqui eguin duqueitenac , condemnationeco resurrectionera .

text: I can of mine own self do nothing : as I hear , I judge : and my judgment is just ; because I seek not mine own will , but the will of the Father which hath sent me .
