text2: Ecin daidit nic neure buruz deus : dançudan beçala iugeatzen dut : eta ene iugemendua iusto da : ecen eznabila neure vorondatearen ondoan : baina ni igorri nauen , Aitaren vorondatearen ondoan .

text: If I bear witness of myself , my witness is not true .
text2: Baldin nic testificatzen badut neure buruäz , ene testimoniagea ezta sinhesteco .

text: There is another that beareth witness of me ; and I know that the witness which he witnesseth of me is true .
text2: Bercebat da testificatzen duenic niçaz , eta badaquit ecen eguiazco dela niçaz testificatzen duen testimoniagea .

text: Ye sent unto John , and he bare witness unto the truth .
text2: Çuec igorri vkan duçue Ioannesgana , eta harc testimoniage eman drauca eguiari .

text: But I receive not testimony from man : but these things I say , that ye might be saved .
text2: Baina nic eztut guiçonaganic testimoniageric recebitzen : baina gauça hauc erraiten ditut çuec salua çaiteztençát .

text: He was a burning and a shining light : and ye were willing for a season to rejoice in his light .
text2: Hura cen candela çachecana eta argui eguiten çuena : eta çuec nahi içan çarete appur - batetacotz alegueratu haren arguian .

text: But I have greater witness than that of John : for the works which the Father hath given me to finish , the same works that I do , bear witness of me , that the Father hath sent me .
text2: Baina nic Ioannesena baino testimoniage handiagoa dut : ecen niri Aitac compli ditzadançat eman drauzquidan obréc , nic eguiten ditudan obra beréc testificatzen duté niçaz ecen Aitac igorri vkan nauela .

text: And the Father himself , which hath sent me , hath borne witness of me . Ye have neither heard his voice at any time , nor seen his shape .
text2: Eta ni igorri nauen Aitac berac testificatu du niçaz . Eztuçue haren voza egundano ençun , ezeta haren irudia ikussi .

text: And ye have not his word abiding in you : for whom he hath sent , him ye believe not .
text2: Eta eztuçue haren hitza çuec baithan egoiten dela : ecen nor harc igorri baitu , hura çuec eztuçue sinhesten .

text: Search the scriptures ; for in them ye think ye have eternal life : and they are they which testify of me .
text2: Informa çaitezte diligentqui Scripturetaric ; ecen çuec vste duçue hetan vicitze eternala duçuela : eta hec dirade niçaz testificatzen dutenac .

text: And ye will not come to me , that ye might have life .
text2: Eta etzarete ethorri nahi enegana , vicitzea duçuença .

text: I receive not honour from men .
text2: Gloriaric guiçonetaric eztut hartzen .

text: But I know you , that ye have not the love of God in you .
text2: Baina eçagutzen çaituztet ecen Iaincoaren amorioa eztuçuela çuec baithan .

text: I am come in my Father ' s name , and ye receive me not : if another shall come in his own name , him ye will receive .
text2: Ni ethorri naiz neure Aitaren icenean , eta eznauçue recebitzen : baldin bercebat ethor badadi bere icenean , hura recebituren duçue .

text: How can ye believe , which receive honour one of another , and seek not the honour that cometh from God only ?
text2: Nolatan çuec sinhets ahal deçaqueçue , batac berceaganic gloria recebitzen duçuelaric , eta Iaincoaganic beraganic heldu den gloriá ezpaituçue bilhatzen ?

text: Do not think that I will accuse you to the Father : there is one that accuseth you , even Moses , in whom ye trust .
text2: Eztuçuela vste ecen nic accusaturen çaituztedala çuec Aita baithan : bada norc accusa çaitzaten , Moyses , ceinetan çuec sperança baituçue .

text: For had ye believed Moses , ye would have believed me : for he wrote of me .
text2: Ecen baldin Moyses sinhesten bacindute , sinhetz nindiroqueçue ni : ecen niçaz harc scribatu vkan du .

text: But if ye believe not his writings , how shall ye believe my words ?
text2: Baina baldin haren scribatuac sinhesten ezpadituçue , nolatan ene hitzac sinhetsiren dituçue .

text: After these things Jesus went over the sea of Galilee , which is the sea of Tiberias .
text2: Guero ioan cedin Iesus Galileaco itsassoaz berce aldera , Tiberiacora .

text: And a great multitude followed him , because they saw his miracles which he did on them that were diseased .
text2: Eta iarreiquiten çayón gendetze handia , ceren ikusten baitzituzten harc erién gainean eguiten cituen signoac .

text: And Jesus went up into a mountain , and there he sat with his disciples .
text2: Orduan igan cedin mendi batetara Iesus , eta han iar cedin bere discipuluequin .

text: And the passover , a feast of the Jews , was nigh .
text2: Eta hurbil cen Bazco , Iuduen bestá .

text: When Jesus then lifted up his eyes , and saw a great company come unto him , he saith unto Philip , Whence shall we buy bread , that these may eat ?
text2: Bada beguiac altchatu cituenean Iesusec eta ikussi çuenean ecen gendetze handia ethorten cela harengana , diotsa Philipperi , Nondic erossiren dugu ogui , hauc ian deçatençat ?

text: And this he said to prove him : for he himself knew what he would do .
text2: ( Baina haur erraiten çuen haren enseyatzeagatic , ecen berac baçaquian , cer eguiteco çuen )

text: Philip answered him , Two hundred pennyworth of bread is not sufficient for them , that every one of them may take a little .
text2: Ihardets cieçón Philippec , Ber - ehun dineroren oguiaz ezliqueye asco , den gutiena batbederac har leçan .

text: One of his disciples , Andrew , Simon Peter ' s brother , saith unto him ,
text2: Diotsa bere discipuluetaric batec , Andriu Simon Pierrisen anayeac .

text: There is a lad here , which hath five barley loaves , and two small fishes : but what are they among so many ?
text2: Baduc hemen muthilcobat , dituenic borz ogui garagarrezcoric , eta bi arrain : baina hauc cer dirade hambaten arteco ?

text: And Jesus said , Make the men sit down . Now there was much grass in the place . So the men sat down , in number about five thousand .
text2: Eta erran ceçan Iesusec , Iar eraci eçaçue gendea . Eta cen belhar handi leku hartan . Iar citecen bada borz milla guiçonen contuaren inguruä .

text: And Jesus took the loaves ; and when he had given thanks , he distributed to the disciples , and the disciples to them that were set down ; and likewise of the fishes as much as they would .
text2: Eta har citzan Iesusec oguiac : eta gratiac rendaturic parti cietzén discipuluey : eta discipuluéc iarriric ceudeney : halaber arrainetaric - ere nahi çuten becembat .

text: When they were filled , he said unto his disciples , Gather up the fragments that remain , that nothing be lost .
text2: Eta ressasiatu içan ciradenean erran ciecén bere discipuluey , Bil itzaçue soberatu diraden çathiac , deus gal eztadin .

text: Therefore they gathered them together , and filled twelve baskets with the fragments of the five barley loaves , which remained over and above unto them that had eaten .
text2: Bil citzaten bada , eta bethe citzaten hamabi sasqui çathiz , borz ogui garagarrezcoetaric , ian çuteney soberaturic .

text: Then those men , when they had seen the miracle that Jesus did , said , This is of a truth that prophet that should come into the world .
text2: Gende hec bada ikussi çutenean Iesusec eguin çuen miraculua , erraiten çutén , Haur da eguiazqui mundura ethorteco cen Propheta hura .

text: When Jesus therefore perceived that they would come and take him by force , to make him a king , he departed again into a mountain himself alone .
text2: Iesusec bada eçaguturic ecen haren harrapatzera ethorteco ciradela hura regue eguin leçatençát , retira cedin berriz mendira ber - bera .

text: And when even was now come , his disciples went down unto the sea ,
text2: Eta arratsa ethor cedinean , iauts citecen haren discipuluac itsassora .

text: And entered into a ship , and went over the sea toward Capernaum . And it was now dark , and Jesus was not come to them .
text2: Eta sarthuric vncira , ioaiten ciraden itsassoaz berce aldera Capernaum alderát : eta ia ilhuna cen , eta etzén Iesus hetara ethorri .

text: And the sea arose by reason of a great wind that blew .
text2: Eta itsassoa , haice handic erauntsiz altchatzen cen .

text: So when they had rowed about five and twenty or thirty furlongs , they see Jesus walking on the sea , and drawing nigh unto the ship : and they were afraid .
text2: Bada hoguey eta borz , edo hoguey eta hamar stade beçala abiroina tiratu ondoan , ikusten dute Iesus itsas gainez dabilala , eta vnciari hurbiltzen çayola , eta ici citecen .

text: But he saith unto them , It is I ; be not afraid .
text2: Eta harc erran ciecén , Ni naiz , etzaretela beldur .

text: Then they willingly received him into the ship : and immediately the ship was at the land whither they went .
text2: Nahi vkan çutén bada hura vncira recebitu : eta bertan vncia arriba cedin ioaiten ciraden lekura .

text: The day following , when the people which stood on the other side of the sea saw that there was none other boat there , save that one whereinto his disciples were entered , and that Jesus went not with his disciples into the boat , but that his disciples were gone away alone ;
text2: Biharamunean itsassoaren berce aldetic gueldituric cegoen gendetzeac ikussi duenean ecen berce vncitchoric etzela han bat baicen , ceinetara haren discipuluac sarthu içan baitziraden , eta etzela sarthu bere discipuluequin Iesus vncitchora , baina haren discipuluac berac ioan içan ciradela :

text: ( Howbeit there came other boats from Tiberias nigh unto the place where they did eat bread , after that the Lord had given thanks : )
text2: Eta Tiberiadetic berce vncitchoric ethorri cela leku haren aldera non oguia ian vkan baitzutén , gratiac rendaturic Iaunac .

text: When the people therefore saw that Jesus was not there , neither his disciples , they also took shipping , and came to Capernaum , seeking for Jesus .
text2: Ikus ceçanean bada gendetzeac ecen Iesus etzela han , ez haren discipuluac , sar citecen hec - ere vncietara , eta ethor citecen Capernaumera , Iesus bilhatzen çutela .

text: And when they had found him on the other side of the sea , they said unto him , Rabbi , when camest thou hither ?
text2: Eta hura eridenic itsassoaren berce aldean , erran cieçoten , Magistruá , noiz huna ethorri aiz ?

text: Jesus answered them and said , Verily , verily , I say unto you , Ye seek me , not because ye saw the miracles , but because ye did eat of the loaves , and were filled .
text2: Ihardets ciecén Iesusec , eta erran ceçan , Eguiaz eguiaz erraiten drauçuet , ene bilha çabiltzate , ez ceren miraculuac ikussi dituçuen , baina ceren ian baituçue oguietaric , eta ressasiatu içan baitzarete .

text: Labour not for the meat which perisheth , but for that meat which endureth unto everlasting life , which the Son of man shall give unto you : for him hath God the Father sealed .
text2: Trabailla çaitezte ez vianda galtzen denagatic , baina vicitze eternalecotzat irauten duenagatic , cein guiçonaren Semeac emanen baitrauçue : ecen Seme haur Iainco Aitac ciguilatu vkan du .

text: Then said they unto him , What shall we do , that we might work the works of God ?
text2: Erran cieçoten bada , Cer eguinen dugu eguin ditzagunçat Iaincoaren obrác ?

text: Jesus answered and said unto them , This is the work of God , that ye believe on him whom he hath sent .
text2: Ihardets ceçan Iesusec , eta erran ciecén , Haur da Iaincoaren obrá , sinhets deçaçuen harc igorri duena baithan .

text: They said therefore unto him , What sign shewest thou then , that we may see , and believe thee ? what dost thou work ?
text2: Orduan erran cieçoten , Cer signo bada hic eguiten duc , dacussagunçát eta hi sinhets eçagun ? cer obra eguiten duc ?

text: Our fathers did eat manna in the desert ; as it is written , He gave them bread from heaven to eat .
text2: Gure aitéc ian vkan dié manná desertuan : scribatua den beçala , Cerutico oguia eman draue iatera .

text: Then Jesus said unto them , Verily , verily , I say unto you , Moses gave you not that bread from heaven ; but my Father giveth you the true bread from heaven .
text2: Erran ciecén bada Iesusec , Eguiaz eguiaz erraiten drauçuet , eztrauçue Moysesec eman cerutico oguia : baina ene Aitac emaiten drauçue cerutico ogui eguiazcoa .

text: For the bread of God is he which cometh down from heaven , and giveth life unto the world .
text2: Ecen Iaincoaren oguia da cerutic iautsi dena , eta munduari vicitze draucana .

text: Then said they unto him , Lord , evermore give us this bread .
text2: Erran cieçoten bada , Iauna , eman ieçaguc bethiere ogui hori .

text: And Jesus said unto them , I am the bread of life : he that cometh to me shall never hunger ; and he that believeth on me shall never thirst .
text2: Eta erran ciecén Iesusec , Ni naiz vicitzeco oguia : enegana ethorten dena , ezta gosseturen : eta ni baithan sinhesten duena , ezta egarrituren iagoitic .

text: But I said unto you , That ye also have seen me , and believe not .
text2: Baina erran drauçuet , ecen ikussi - ere banuçuela , eta eztuçue sinhesten .

text: All that the Father giveth me shall come to me ; and him that cometh to me I will in no wise cast out .
text2: Aitac emaiten drautan gucia , enegana ethorriren da , eta enegana ethorten dena , eztut campora iraitziren .

text: For I came down from heaven , not to do mine own will , but the will of him that sent me .
text2: Ecen cerutic iautsi içan naiz eguin deçadençát ez neure vorondatea , baina ni igorri naueuaren vorondatea .

text: And this is the Father ' s will which hath sent me , that of all which he hath given me I should lose nothing , but should raise it up again at the last day .
text2: Eta haur da ni igorri nauenaren vorondatea , Aitarena , cerere eman baitraut , ezteçadan gal hartaric , baina resuscita deçadan hura azquen egunean .

text: And this is the will of him that sent me , that every one which seeth the Son , and believeth on him , may have everlasting life : and I will raise him up at the last day .
text2: Halaber haur da ni igorri nauenaren vorondatea , Semea ikusten eta hura baithan sinhesten duen guciac , duen vicitze eternala , eta nic resuscitaturen dut hura azquen egunean .

text: The Jews then murmured at him , because he said , I am the bread which came down from heaven .
text2: Murmuratzen çutén bada Iuduéc harçaz , ceren erran baitzuen , Ni naiz cerutic iautsi naicen oguia .

text: And they said , Is not this Jesus , the son of Joseph , whose father and mother we know ? how is it then that he saith , I came down from heaven ?
text2: Eta erraiten çutén , Ezta haur Iesus , Iosephen semea , ceinen aita eta ama guc eçagutzen baititugu ? Nola dio bada hunec , Cerutic iautsi naiz ?

text: Jesus therefore answered and said unto them , Murmur not among yourselves .
text2: Ihardets ceçan bada Iesusec eta erran ciecén , Ezteçaçuela murmura çuen artean .

text: No man can come to me , except the Father which hath sent me draw him : and I will raise him up at the last day .
text2: Nehor ecin dathor enegana , baldin ni igorri nauen Aitac tira ezpadeça : eta nic resuscitaturen dut hura azquen egunean .

text: It is written in the prophets , And they shall be all taught of God . Every man therefore that hath heard , and hath learned of the Father , cometh unto me .
text2: Scribatua da Prophetetan , Eta içanen dirade guciac Iaincoaz iracatsiac . Norc - ere beraz ençun baitu Aitaganic eta ikassi , hura ethorten da enegana .

text: Not that any man hath seen the Father , save he which is of God , he hath seen the Father .
text2: Ez Aita ikussi duenez nehorc , Iaincoaganic denac baicen : harc ikussi du Aita .

text: Verily , verily , I say unto you , He that believeth on me hath everlasting life .
text2: Eguiaz eguiaz erraiten drauçuet , ni baithan sinhesten duen guciac badu vicitze eternala .

text: I am that bread of life .
text2: Ni naiz vicitzeco oguia .

text: Your fathers did eat manna in the wilderness , and are dead .
text2: Çuen aitéc ian vkan duté manná desertuan , eta hil içan dirade .

text: This is the bread which cometh down from heaven , that a man may eat thereof , and not die .
text2: Haur da oguia cerutic iautsi dena , hunetaric ianen duena hil eztadinçát .

text: I am the living bread which came down from heaven : if any man eat of this bread , he shall live for ever : and the bread that I will give is my flesh , which I will give for the life of the world .
text2: Ni naiz ogui vicia cerutic iautsi naicena : nehorc ian badeça ogui hunetaric , vicico da eternalqui , eta nic emanen dudan oguia , ene haraguia da , nic munduaren vicitzeagatic emanen dudana .

text: The Jews therefore strove among themselves , saying , How can this man give us his flesh to eat ?
text2: Baciharducaten bada Iuduéc elkarren artean , erraiten çutela , Nolatan hunec guri bere haraguia eman ahal dieçaquegu iatera ?

text: Then Jesus said unto them , Verily , verily , I say unto you , Except ye eat the flesh of the Son of man , and drink his blood , ye have no life in you .
text2: Orduan erran ciecén Iesusec , Eguiaz eguiaz erraiten drauçuet , baldin ian ezpadeçaçue guiçonaren Semearen haraguia , eta edan ezpadeçaçue haren odola , eztuçue vicitzeric çuec baithan .

text: Whoso eateth my flesh , and drinketh my blood , hath eternal life ; and I will raise him up at the last day .
text2: Iaten duenac ene haraguia , eta edaten ene odola , badu vicitze eternala : eta nic dut resuscitaturen hura azquen egunean .

text: For my flesh is meat indeed , and my blood is drink indeed .
text2: Ecen ene haraguia eguiazqui da vianda , eta ene odola eguiazqui da edari .

text: He that eateth my flesh , and drinketh my blood , dwelleth in me , and I in him .
text2: Ene haraguia iaten duena , eta ene odola edaten , nitan egoiten da , eta ni hartan .

text: As the living Father hath sent me , and I live by the Father : so he that eateth me , even he shall live by me .
text2: Nola ni igorri bainau Aita vici denac , eta ni vici bainaiz neure Aitaz : hala ni ianen nauena ere , vicico da hura - ere niçaz .

text: This is that bread which came down from heaven : not as your fathers did eat manna , and are dead : he that eateth of this bread shall live for ever .
text2: Haur da ogui cerutic iautsi içan dena : ez çuen aitéc manná ian duten beçala , eta hil içan dirade : ogui haur ianen duena vicico da eternalqui .

text: These things said he in the synagogue , as he taught in Capernaum .
text2: Gauça hauc erran citzan synagogán iracasten ari cela Capernaumen .

text: Many therefore of his disciples , when they had heard this , said , This is an hard saying ; who can hear it ?
text2: Haren discipuluetaric bada anhitzec gauça hauc ençunic erran ceçaten , Gogor da hitz haur : norc ençun ahal deçaque ?

text: When Jesus knew in himself that his disciples murmured at it , he said unto them , Doth this offend you ?
text2: Çaquialaric bada Iesusec bere baithan ecen haren discipuluec huneçaz murmuratze çutela , erran ciecén , Hunec scandalizatzen çaituzte ?

text: What and if ye shall see the Son of man ascend up where he was before ?
text2: Cer date bada baldin ikus badeçaçue guiçonaren Semea igaiten lehen cen lekura ?

text: It is the spirit that quickeneth ; the flesh profiteth nothing : the words that I speak unto you , they are spirit , and they are life .
text2: Spiritua da viuificatzen duena , haraguiac eztu deus probetchatzen : nic erraiten drauzquiçuedan hitzac spiritu dirade eta vicitze .

text: But there are some of you that believe not . For Jesus knew from the beginning who they were that believed not , and who should betray him .
text2: Baina badirade batzu çuetaric sinhesten eztutenic . Ecen baçaquian hatseandanic Iesusec cein ciraden sinhesten etzutenac , eta cein cen hura tradituren çuena .

text: And he said , Therefore said I unto you , that no man can come unto me , except it were given unto him of my Father .
text2: Eta erraiten çuen , Halacotz erran drauçuet ecen nehor ecin dathorrela enegana , baldin ene Aitaz eman ezpaçayo .

text: From that time many of his disciples went back , and walked no more with him .
text2: Orduandanic haren discipuluetaric anhitz guibelerat citecen : eta guehiagoric etzabiltzan harequin .

text: Then said Jesus unto the twelve , Will ye also go away ?
text2: Erran ciecén bada Iesusec hamabiey , Ala çuec - ere ioan nahi çarete ?

text: Then Simon Peter answered him , Lord , to whom shall we go ? thou hast the words of eternal life .
text2: Ihardets cieçón bada Simon Pierrisec , Iauna , norengana ioanen gara ? vicitze eternalezco hitzac dituc hic :

text: And we believe and are sure that thou art that Christ , the Son of the living God .
text2: Eta guc sinhetsi eta eçagutu diagu ecen , hi aicela Christ Iainco viciaren Semea .

text: Jesus answered them , Have not I chosen you twelve , and one of you is a devil ?
text2: Ihardets ciecén Iesusec , Etzaituztet nic hamabi elegitu , eta çuetaric bat deabru baita ?

text: He spake of Judas Iscariot the son of Simon : for he it was that should betray him , being one of the twelve .
text2: Eta haur erraiten çuen Iudas Iscariot Simonen semeaz : ecen haur cen hura traditu behar çuena , hamabietaric bat bacen - ere .

text: After these things Jesus walked in Galilee : for he would not walk in Jewry , because the Jews sought to kill him .
text2: Eta guero baçabilan Iesus Galilean : ecen etzén Iudean ebili nahi , ceren Iuduac baitzabiltzan hura hil nahiz .

text: Now the Jews ' feast of tabernacles was at hand .
text2: Eta hurbil cen Iuduén bestá tabernaclén deitzen cena .

text: His brethren therefore said unto him , Depart hence , and go into Judaea , that thy disciples also may see the works that thou doest .
text2: Erran cieçoten bada bere anayéc , Parti adi hemendic eta habil Iudearát , hire discipuluec - ere ikus ditzatençát hire obra eguiten dituanac .

text: For there is no man that doeth any thing in secret , and he himself seeketh to be known openly . If thou do these things , shew thyself to the world .
text2: Ecen nehorc eztic deus secretuan eguiten , estimationetan içan nahiz dabilanec , baldin gauça hauc eguiten badituc , manifesta ieçoc eure buruä munduari .

text: For neither did his brethren believe in him .
text2: Ecen are haren anayec - ere etzuten sinhesten hura baithan .

text: Then Jesus said unto them , My time is not yet come : but your time is alway ready .
text2: Dioste bada Iesusec , Ene demborá ezta oraino ethorri : baina çuen demborá bethi da prest .

text: The world cannot hate you ; but me it hateth , because I testify of it , that the works thereof are evil .
text2: Ecin munduac gaitzets çaitzaquezte çuec : baina niri gaitz darizt : ceren nic testificatzen baitut harçaz , ecen haren obrác gaichto diradela .

text: Go ye up unto this feast : I go not up yet unto this feast ; for my time is not yet full come .
text2: Çuec igan çaitezte besta hunetara : ni eznaiz oraino igaiten besta hunetara , ceren ene demborá ezpaita oraino bethe .

text: When he had said these words unto them , he abode still in Galilee .
text2: Eta gauça hauc erran cerauztenean egon cedin Galilean .

text: But when his brethren were gone up , then went he also up unto the feast , not openly , but as it were in secret .
text2: Eta igan ciradenean haren anayeac , orduan hura - ere igan cedin bestara , ez aguerriz , baina ichilic beçala .

text: Then the Jews sought him at the feast , and said , Where is he ?
text2: Iuduéc bada bilhatzen çuten hura bestán , eta erraiten çuten , Non da hura ?

text: And there was much murmuring among the people concerning him : for some said , He is a good man : others said , Nay ; but he deceiveth the people .
text2: Eta murmuratione handia cen populuaren artean harçaz : ecen batzuc erraiten çuten Guiçon ona da : eta bercéc erraiten çutén , Ezta : baina seducitzen du populua .

text: Howbeit no man spake openly of him for fear of the Jews .
text2: Badaric - ere nehor frangoqui etzén minço harçaz , Iuduén beldurrez .

text: Now about the midst of the feast Jesus went up into the temple , and taught .
text2: Eta besta ia erdi iragan cenean , igan cedin Iesus templera , eta iracasten ari cen .

text: And the Jews marvelled , saying , How knoweth this man letters , having never learned ?
text2: Eta miraz ceuden Iuduac , cioitela , Nolatan hunec letrác daquizqui , ikassi gabe ?

text: Jesus answered them , and said , My doctrine is not mine , but his that sent me .
text2: Ihardets ciecén Iesusec , eta erran ceçan , Ene doctriná ezta enea , baina ni igorri nauenarena .

text: If any man will do his will , he shall know of the doctrine , whether it be of God , or whether I speak of myself .
text2: Baldin nehorc nahi badu haren vorondatea eguin , eçaguturen du doctrináz , eya Iaincoaganic denez , ala ni neure buruz minço naicenez .

text: He that speaketh of himself seeketh his own glory : but he that seeketh his glory that sent him , the same is true , and no unrighteousness is in him .
text2: Bere buruz minço dena , bere gloriaren bilha dabila : baina bera igorri duenaren gloriaren bilha dabilana , da eguiati , eta iniustitiaric hura baithan ezta .

text: Did not Moses give you the law , and yet none of you keepeth the law ? Why go ye about to kill me ?
text2: Eztrauçue Moysesec eman Leguea ? eta ezpaitu çuetaric batec - ere obratan eçarten Leguea ? Cergatic çabiltzate ni hil nahiz ?

text: The people answered and said , Thou hast a devil : who goeth about to kill thee ?
text2: Ihardets ceçan populuac eta erran , Deabrua duc hic : nor dabila hi hil nahiz ?

text: Jesus answered and said unto them , I have done one work , and ye all marvel .
text2: Ihardets ceçan Iesusec eta erran ciecén , Obrabat eguin dut , eta guciac miraz çaudete .

text: Moses therefore gave unto you circumcision ; ( not because it is of Moses , but of the fathers ; ) and ye on the sabbath day circumcise a man .
text2: Baina halere Moysesec eman drauçue Circoncisionea , ( ez Moysesganic denez , baina Aitetaric ) eta Sabbathoan circonciditzen duçue guiçona .

text: If a man on the sabbath day receive circumcision , that the law of Moses should not be broken ; are ye angry at me , because I have made a man every whit whole on the sabbath day ?
text2: Baldin Circoncisionea recebitzen badu guiçonac Sabbathoan , Moysesen Leguea hauts eztadinçát : asserre çarete ene contra ceren guiçon - bat ossoqui sendatu dudan Sabbathoan ?

text: Judge not according to the appearance , but judge righteous judgment .
text2: Ezteçaçuela iugea apparentiaren araura , baina iugemendu bidezco batez iugea eçaçue .

text: Then said some of them of Jerusalem , Is not this he , whom they seek to kill ?
text2: Erraiten çutén bada Ierusalemetar batzuc , Ezta haur hiltzeco bilhatzen dutena ?

text: But , lo , he speaketh boldly , and they say nothing unto him . Do the rulers know indeed that this is the very Christ ?
text2: Eta huna , frangoqui minço da , eta eztraucate deus eguiten : ala eguiazqui eçagutu othe luqueite Gobernadoréc , ecen haur dela eguiazqui Christ ?

text: Howbeit we know this man whence he is : but when Christ cometh , no man knoweth whence he is .
text2: Baina haur badaquigu nondic den : baina Christ dathorrenean , nehorc eztu iaquinen nondic daten .

text: Then cried Jesus in the temple as he taught , saying , Ye both know me , and ye know whence I am : and I am not come of myself , but he that sent me is true , whom ye know not .
text2: Oihuz cegoen bada Iesus templean , iracasten çuela eta erraiten , Eta ni nauçue eçagutzen , eta nondic naicén badaquiçue , eta neure buruz eznaiz ethorri , baina da eguiati ni igorri nauena , cein ezpaituçue çuec eçagutzen .

text: But I know him : for I am from him , and he hath sent me .
text2: Baina nic eçagutzen dut hura , ceren harenganic bainaiz , eta harc igorri bainau .

text: Then they sought to take him : but no man laid hands on him , because his hour was not yet come .
text2: Orduan hura hatzaman nahiz çabiltzan : baina nehorc etzitzan escuac eçar haren gainean , ecen etzén oraino ethorri haren orena .

text: And many of the people believed on him , and said , When Christ cometh , will he do more miracles than these which this man hath done ?
text2: Eta gendetzecoataric anhitzec sinhets ceçaten hura baithan , eta erraiten çutén , Christec dathorrenean guehiago miraculu eguinen othe du , hunec eguiten dituenac baino ?

text: The Pharisees heard that the people murmured such things concerning him ; and the Pharisees and the chief priests sent officers to take him .
text2: Ençun ceçaten Phariseuéc gendetzea hauén gainean harçaz murmuratzen : eta igor citzaten Phariseuéc eta Sacrificadore principaléc officierac hura hatzaman leçatençát .

text: Then said Jesus unto them , Yet a little while am I with you , and then I go unto him that sent me .
text2: Erran ciecén bada Iesusec , Oraino dembora gutibatetacotz çuequin naiz , guero banoa igorri nauènaganát .

text: Ye shall seek me , and shall not find me : and where I am , thither ye cannot come .
text2: Bilhaturen nauçue eta ez eridenen : eta non ni içanen bainaiz , hara çuec ecin ethor çaitezquete .

text: Then said the Jews among themselves , Whither will he go , that we shall not find him ? will he go unto the dispersed among the Gentiles , and teach the Gentiles ?
text2: Erran ceçaten bada Iuduéc elkarren artean , Norat haur ioaiteco da , guc ezpaitugu eridenen ? ala Grecoén artean barreyatuac diradenetarat ioaiteco da , eta Grecoén iracastera ?

text: What manner of saying is this that he said , Ye shall seek me , and shall not find me : and where I am , thither ye cannot come ?
text2: Ceric da erran duen propos haur , Bilhaturen nauçue , eta ez eridenen : eta non ni içanen bainaiz , hara çuec ecin ethor çaitezquete ?

text: In the last day , that great day of the feast , Jesus stood and cried , saying , If any man thirst , let him come unto me , and drink .
text2: Eta bestaco azquen egun handian eriden cedin Iesus han , eta oihuz cegoen , cioela , Baldin nehor egarri bada , bethor enegana eta edan beça

text: He that believeth on me , as the scripture hath said , out of his belly shall flow rivers of living water .
text2: Ni baithan sinhesten duenari , Scripturác dioen beçala , vr vicizco fluuioac iariaturen çaizca bere sabeletic .

text: ( But this spake he of the Spirit , which they that believe on him should receive : for the Holy Ghost was not yet given ; because that Jesus was not yet glorified . )
text2: ( Eta haur erraiten çuen hura baithan sinhesten çutenéc recebitzeco çuten Spirituáz : ecer oraino Spiritu saindua etzén eman , ceren Iesus oraino ezpaitzén glorificatu )

text: Many of the people therefore , when they heard this saying , said , Of a truth this is the Prophet .
text2: Anhitzec bada gendetzecoetaric propos haur ençun çutenean , erraiten çuten , Haur da eguiazqui Propheta hura .

text: Others said , This is the Christ . But some said , Shall Christ come out of Galilee ?
text2: Bercéc erraiten çutén , Haur da Christ . Eta batzuc erraiten çutén , Alabaina Galileatic ethorriren da Christ ?

text: Hath not the scripture said , That Christ cometh of the seed of David , and out of the town of Bethlehem , where David was ?
text2: Eztu Scripturac erraiten , ecen Dauid - en hacitic , eta Bethlehemgo Dauid egoiten cen burgutic Christ ethorriren dela ?

text: So there was a division among the people because of him .
text2: Dissensione eguin cedin bada populuaren artean harengatic .

text: And some of them would have taken him ; but no man laid hands on him .
text2: Eta hetaric batzuc nahi çuten hatzaman , baina nehorc etzitzan eçar haren gainea escuac

text: Then came the officers to the chief priests and Pharisees ; and they said unto them , Why have ye not brought him ?
text2: Ethor citecen bada officierac Sacrificadore principaletara eta Phariseuetara , eta hec erran ciecén , Cergatic eztuçue hura ekarri ?

text: The officers answered , Never man spake like this man .
text2: Ihardets ceçaten officieréc , Egundano ezta hala minçatu guiçonic , nola guiçon haur .

text: Then answered them the Pharisees , Are ye also deceived ?
text2: Halacotz ihardets ciecen Phariseuéc , Ezothe cinatezte çuec - ere seducitu ?

text: Have any of the rulers or of the Pharisees believed on him ?
text2: Ala Gobernadoretaric edo Phariseuetaric batec - ere sinhetsi du hura baithan ?

text: But this people who knoweth not the law are cursed .
text2: Baina populu Leguea cer den eztaquian haur , maradicatua da .

text: Nicodemus saith unto them , ( he that came to Jesus by night , being one of them , )
text2: Dioste Nicodemo harengana gauaz ethorri içan cenac , cein baitzén hetaric bat ,

text: Doth our law judge any man , before it hear him , and know what he doeth ?
text2: Ala gure Legueac condemnatzen du nehor , bera behin ençun gabe , eta cer eguin duen eçagutu gabe ?

text: They answered and said unto him , Art thou also of Galilee ? Search , and look : for out of Galilee ariseth no prophet .
text2: Ihardets ceçaten eta erran cieçoten , Ezaiz hi - ere Galileaco ? informadi , eta iaquic ecen Galileatic Prophetaric eztela ilki .

text: And every man went unto his own house .
text2: Eta itzul cedin batbedera cein bere etcherát .

text: Jesus went unto the mount of Olives .
text2: Baina Iesus ioan cedin Oliuatzetaco mendirát .

text: And early in the morning he came again into the temple , and all the people came unto him ; and he sat down , and taught them .
text2: Eta arguiaren beguian berriz ethor cedin templera , eta populu gucia ethor cedin harengana : eta iarriric cegoela iracasten cituen hec .

text: And the scribes and Pharisees brought unto him a woman taken in adultery ; and when they had set her in the midst ,
text2: Orduan duté ekarten harengana Scribéc eta Phariseuéc emazte adulterioan hatzaman - bat : eta hura artean eçarriric ,

text: They say unto him , Master , this woman was taken in adultery , in the very act .
text2: Diotsate , Magistruá , emazte haur hatzaman içan duc adulterioco eguitate berean .

text: Now Moses in the law commanded us , that such should be stoned : but what sayest thou ?
text2: Eta Leguean Moysesec manatu diraucuc hunelacoac lapida ditecen : hic bada cer dioc ?

text: This they said , tempting him , that they might have to accuse him . But Jesus stooped down , and with his finger wrote on the ground , as though he heard them not .
text2: Eta haur erraiten çuten hura tentatzen çutela , hura cerçaz accusa lutençát . Baina Iesusec beheiti gurthuric erhiaz scribatzen çuen lurrean .

text: So when they continued asking him , he lifted up himself , and said unto them , He that is without sin among you , let him first cast a stone at her .
text2: Eta haren interrogatzez perseueratzen çutela , chuchenduric erran ciecén , Çuetaric bekatu gabe denac , lehenic horren contra harria aurdigui beça .

text: And again he stooped down , and wrote on the ground .
text2: Eta berriz gurthuric scribatzen çuen lurrean .

text: And they which heard it , being convicted by their own conscience , went out one by one , beginning at the eldest , even unto the last : and Jesus was left alone , and the woman standing in the midst .
text2: Bada hori ençun çutenean , conscientiac accusatzen cituela , bata bercearen ondoan ilkiten ciraden çaharrenetaric hassiric azquenetarano : eta Iesus bera gueldi cedin , eta artean cegoen emaztea

text: When Jesus had lifted up himself , and saw none but the woman , he said unto her , Woman , where are those thine accusers ? hath no man condemned thee ?
text2: Eta chuchendu cenean Iesusec nehor etzacussanean emaztea baicen , erran cieçón hari , Emazteá , non dirade hire accusaçaleac ? nehorc ezau condemnatu ?

text: She said , No man , Lord . And Jesus said unto her , Neither do I condemn thee : go , and sin no more .
text2: Eta harc erran ceçan , Ez nehorc , Iauna . Eta erran cieçón Iesusec , Ezaut nic - ere condemnatzen : oha , eta guehiago bekaturic eztaguinala .

text: Then spake Jesus again unto them , saying , I am the light of the world : he that followeth me shall not walk in darkness , but shall have the light of life .
text2: Berriz bada Iesus minça cequien , cioela , Ni naiz munduaren arguia : niri darreitana ezta ilhumbean ebiliren , baina vkanen du vicitzeco arguia .

text: The Pharisees therefore said unto him , Thou bearest record of thyself ; thy record is not true .
text2: Erran cieçoten bada Phariseuéc , Hic eure buruäz testificatzen duc , hire testimoniagea eztuc sinhesteco .

text: Jesus answered and said unto them , Though I bear record of myself , yet my record is true : for I know whence I came , and whither I go ; but ye cannot tell whence I come , and whither I go .
text2: Ihardets ceçan Iesusec eta erran ciecén , Nic neurorçaz testificatzenagatic sinhesteco da ene testimoniagea : ecen badaquit nondic ethorri naicén , eta norat ioaiten naicen : baina çuec eztaquiçue nondic ethorten naicen , ez norat ioaiten naicén

text: Ye judge after the flesh ; I judge no man .
text2: Çuec haraguiaren arauez iugeatzen duçue , nic eztut iugeatzen nehor .

text: And yet if I judge , my judgment is true : for I am not alone , but I and the Father that sent me .
text2: Eta baldin iugea badeçat - ere nic , ene iugemendua eguiazco da : ecen eznaiz neuror , baina ni eta ni igorri nauen Aita .

text: It is also written in your law , that the testimony of two men is true .
text2: Baina çuen Leguean - ere scribatua da , ecen bi guiçonen testimoniagea sinhesteco dela .

text: I am one that bear witness of myself , and the Father that sent me beareth witness of me .
text2: Ni naiz neurorçaz testificatzen dudana , eta testificatzen du niçaz ni igorri nauen Aitac .

text: Then said they unto him , Where is thy Father ? Jesus answered , Ye neither know me , nor my Father : if ye had known me , ye should have known my Father also .
text2: Erraiten ceraucaten bada , Non da hire Aita ? Ihardets ceçan Iesusec , Ez ni nauçue eçagutzen , ez ene Aita : baldin ni eçagutzen baninduçue , ene Aita - ere eçagut cindeçaquete .

text: These words spake Jesus in the treasury , as he taught in the temple : and no man laid hands on him ; for his hour was not yet come .
text2: Hitz hauc erran citzan Iesusec thesaurerian , iracasten ari cela templean : eta nehor etzaquión lot , ceren oraino ezpaitzén ethorri haren orena

text: Then said Jesus again unto them , I go my way , and ye shall seek me , and shall die in your sins : whither I go , ye cannot come .
text2: Erran ciecén bada berriz Iesusec , Ni banoa eta bilhaturen nauçue , eta çuen bekatuan hilen çarete : norat ni ioaiten bainaiz , çuec ecin çatozquete .

text: Then said the Jews , Will he kill himself ? because he saith , Whither I go , ye cannot come .
text2: Erraiten çuten bada Iuduéc , Berac hilen othe du bere buruä ? erraiten baitu , Norat ni ioaiten bainaiz , çuec ecin çatozquete .

text: And he said unto them , Ye are from beneath ; I am from above : ye are of this world ; I am not of this world .
text2: Orduan erran ciecén , çuec beheretic çarete , ni garaitic : çuec mundu hunetaric çarete , ni ez naiz mundu hunetaric .

text: I said therefore unto you , that ye shall die in your sins : for if ye believe not that I am he , ye shall die in your sins .
text2: Halacotz erran drauçuet ecen çuen bekatuetan hilen çaretela . Ecen baldin sinhets ezpadeçaçue ni naicela hura , çuen bekatuetan hilen çarete .

text: Then said they unto him , Who art thou ? And Jesus saith unto them , Even the same that I said unto you from the beginning .
text2: Erran cieçoten bada , Hi nor aiz ? Orduan erran ciecén Iesusec , Hatseandanicoa , badiotsuet .

text: I have many things to say and to judge of you : but he that sent me is true ; and I speak to the world those things which I have heard of him .
text2: Anhitz gauça dut çueçaz minçatzeco eta iugeatzeco : baina ni igorri nauena eguiati da : eta nic harenganic ençun ditudan gauçác munduari erraiten drauzquiot .

text: They understood not that he spake to them of the Father .
text2: Etzeçaten eçagut ecen Aitaz minço çayela .

text: Then said Jesus unto them , When ye have lifted up the Son of man , then shall ye know that I am he , and that I do nothing of myself ; but as my Father hath taught me , I speak these things .
text2: Erran ciecén bada Iesusec , Altchatu duqueçuenean guiçonaren Semea , orduan eçaguturen duçue ecen ni naicela hura , eta neure buruz eztudala deus eguiten , baina Aitac iracatsi nauen , beçala gauça hauc erraiten ditudala .

text: And he that sent me is with me : the Father hath not left me alone ; for I do always those things that please him .
text2: Ecen ni igorri nauena enequin da : eznau vtzi neuror Aitac , ceren nic haren gogaraco gauçác eguiten baititut bethiere .

text: As he spake these words , many believed on him .
text2: Gauça hauc harc erraiten cituela , anhitzec sinhets ceçaten hura baithan .

text: Then said Jesus to those Jews which believed on him , If ye continue in my word , then are ye my disciples indeed ;
text2: Orduan erraiten cerauen Iesusec hura sinhetsi vkan çuten Iuduey , Baldin çuec perseuera badeçaçue ene hitzean , eguiazqui ene discipulu içanen çarete .

text: And ye shall know the truth , and the truth shall make you free .
text2: Eta duçue eçaguturen Eguiá , eta Eguiác çuec libre eguinen çaituzte .

text: They answered him , We be Abraham ' s seed , and were never in bondage to any man : how sayest thou , Ye shall be made free ?
text2: Ihardets cieçoten , Abrahamen hacia gaituc , eta nehor eztiagu cerbitzatu egundano : nola dioc hic gu libre içanen garela ?

text: Jesus answered them , Verily , verily , I say unto you , Whosoever committeth sin is the servant of sin .
text2: Ihardets ciecén Iesusec , Eguiaz eguiaz erraiten drauçuet ecen bekatua eguiten duen gucia bekatuaren cerbitzari dela .

text: And the servant abideth not in the house for ever : but the Son abideth ever .
text2: Eta cerbitzaria ezta egoiten bethierecotz etchean , semea dago bethierecotz .

text: If the Son therefore shall make you free , ye shall be free indeed .
text2: Bada baldin Semeac çuec libre eguin baçaitzate , eguiazqui libre içanen çarete .

text: I know that ye are Abraham ' s seed ; but ye seek to kill me , because my word hath no place in you .
text2: Badaquit ecen çuec Abrahamen hacia çaretela : baina ni hil nahiz çabiltzate , ceren ene hitzac ezpaitu lekuric çuec baithan .

text: I speak that which I have seen with my Father : and ye do that which ye have seen with your father .
text2: Nic erraiten dut neure Aita baithan ikussi dudana : eta çuec eguiten duçue çuen aita baithan ikussi duçuena .

text: They answered and said unto him , Abraham is our father . Jesus saith unto them , If ye were Abraham ' s children , ye would do the works of Abraham .
text2: Ihardets ceçaten eta erran cieçoten , Gure aita , Abraham duc . Dioste Iesusec , Baldin Abrahamen haour bacinete , Abrahamen obrác eguin cinçaqueizte .

text: But now ye seek to kill me , a man that hath told you the truth , which I have heard of God : this did not Abraham .
text2: Orain bada ni hil nahiz çabiltzate , bainaiz , Iaincoaganic ençun dudan eguia erran drauçuedan guiçona : hori Abrahamec eztu eguin .

text: Ye do the deeds of your father . Then said they to him , We be not born of fornication ; we have one Father , even God .
text2: Çuec eguiten dituçue çuen aitaren obrác . Eta erran cieçoten , Gu ezgaituc paillardiçataric iayo : aitabat diagu , baita Iaincoa .

text: Jesus said unto them , If God were your Father , ye would love me : for I proceeded forth and came from God ; neither came I of myself , but he sent me .
text2: Erran ciecén bada Iesusec , Baldin Iaincoa çuen aita baliz , maite ninduqueçue ni : ecen ni Iaincoaganic partitu eta ethorri naiz : eta eznaiz neure buruz ethorri , baina harc igorri nau .

text: Why do ye not understand my speech ? even because ye cannot hear my word .
text2: Cergatic ene lengoagea eztuçue aditzen ? ceren ecin ençun baitiroqueçue ene hitza .

text: Ye are of your father the devil , and the lusts of your father ye will do . He was a murderer from the beginning , and abode not in the truth , because there is no truth in him . When he speaketh a lie , he speaketh of his own : for he is a liar , and the father of it .
text2: Çuec , aita deabruaganic çarete , eta çuen aitaren desirac eguin nahi dituçue : hura guicerhaile cen hatseandanic , eta eguián eztu perseueratu : ecen eguiaric ezta hartan . Noiz - ere erraiten baitu gueçurra , bere propritic minço da : ecen gueçurti da eta gueçurraren aita .

text: And because I tell you the truth , ye believe me not .
text2: Eta ceren nic eguia erraiten baitut , eznauçue sinhesten .

text: Which of you convinceth me of sin ? And if I say the truth , why do ye not believe me ?
text2: Norc çuetaric reprehenditzen nau ni bekatuz ? eta baldin eguiá erraiten badut , ceren çuec eznauçue sinhesten ?

text: He that is of God heareth God ' s words : ye therefore hear them not , because ye are not of God .
text2: Iaincoaganic denac , Iaincoaren hitzac ençuten ditu : halacotz çuec eztituçue ençuten , ceren ezpaitzarete Iaincoaganic .

text: Then answered the Jews , and said unto him , Say we not well that thou art a Samaritan , and hast a devil ?
text2: Ihardets ceçaten orduan Iuduéc eta erran cieçoten , Eztugu vngui erraiten guc , ecen Samaritano aicela hi , eta deabrua duala ?

text: Jesus answered , I have not a devil ; but I honour my Father , and ye do dishonour me .
text2: Ihardets ceçan Iesusec , Eztut nic deabrua : baina dut ohoratzen , neure Aita , eta çuec desohoratzen nauçue ni .

text: And I seek not mine own glory : there is one that seeketh and judgeth .
text2: Eta nic eztut neure gloriá bilhatzen : bada bilhatzen duenic , eta iugeatzen duenic .

text: Verily , verily , I say unto you , If a man keep my saying , he shall never see death .
text2: Eguiaz eguiaz erraiten drauçuet , baldin nehorc ene hitza beguira badeça , herioa eztu ikussiren seculan .

text: Then said the Jews unto him , Now we know that thou hast a devil . Abraham is dead , and the prophets ; and thou sayest , If a man keep my saying , he shall never taste of death .
text2: Orduan erran cieçoten Iuduéc , Orain eçagutu diagu ecen deabrua duala : Abraham hil içan duc eta Prophetác : eta hic dioc , Baldin nehorc ene hitza beguira badeça , eztu dastaturan herioa seculan .

text: Art thou greater than our father Abraham , which is dead ? and the prophets are dead : whom makest thou thyself ?
text2: Ala hi gure aita Abraham baino handiago aiz , cein hil içan baita ? Prophetac - ere hil içan dituc : nor hic eure buruä eguiten duc ?

text: Jesus answered , If I honour myself , my honour is nothing : it is my Father that honoureth me ; of whom ye say , that he is your God :
text2: Ihardets ceçan Iesusec , Baldin nic glorificatzen badut neure buruä , ene gloria ezta deus : ene Aita da ni glorificatzen nauena , ceinez erraiten baituçue çuec ecen çuen Iainco dela .

text: Yet ye have not known him ; but I know him : and if I should say , I know him not , I shall be a liar like unto you : but I know him , and keep his saying .
text2: Eta eztuçue eçagutzen hura : baina nic eçagutzen dut hura : eta baldin erran badeçat ecen eztudala hura eçagutzen , içanen naiz çuec irudi , gueçurti : baina badaçagut hura , eta haren hitza beguiratzen dut .

text: Your father Abraham rejoiced to see my day : and he saw it , and was glad .
text2: Abraham çuen aita aleguera cedin ikus leçançát ene egun haur : eta ikussi vkan du , eta alegueratu içan da .

text: Then said the Jews unto him , Thou art not yet fifty years old , and hast thou seen Abraham ?
text2: Erran cieçoten bada Iuduéc , Berroguey eta hamar vrthe oraino eztituc , eta Abraham ikussi duc ?

text: Jesus said unto them , Verily , verily , I say unto you , Before Abraham was , I am .
text2: Erran ciecén Iesusec , Eguiaz eguiaz erraiten drauçuet , Abraham cedin baino lehen , ni naiz .

text: Then took they up stones to cast at him : but Jesus hid himself , and went out of the temple , going through the midst of them , and so passed by .
text2: Har ceçaten orduan harri : haren contra aurthiteco : baina Iesus gorde cedin , eta ilki cedin templetic .

text: And as Jesus passed by , he saw a man which was blind from his birth .
text2: Eta iragaiten cela Iesusec ikus ceçan guiçon sortzetic itsubat .

text: And his disciples asked him , saying , Master , who did sin , this man , or his parents , that he was born blind ?
text2: Eta interroga ceçaten bere discipuluéc . erraiten cutela . Magistruá , Ceinec bekatu eguin du , hunec ala hunen aitaméc , hunela itsu sor ledin ?

text: Jesus answered , Neither hath this man sinned , nor his parents : but that the works of God should be made manifest in him .
text2: Ihardets ceçan Iesusec , Ez hunec bekatu eguin du , ez hunen aitaméc : baina itsu iayo da , Iaincoaren obrác manifesta litecençat hunetan .

text: I must work the works of him that sent me , while it is day : the night cometh , when no man can work .
text2: Ni igorri nauenaren obrác eguin behar ditut , eguna deno : badatorque gaua noiz nehorc ecin obraric baitaidi .

text: As long as I am in the world , I am the light of the world .
text2: Munduan naiceno , munduaren Arguia naiz .

text: When he had thus spoken , he spat on the ground , and made clay of the spittle , and he anointed the eyes of the blind man with the clay ,
text2: Haur erran çuenean thu eguin ceçan lurrera , eta eguin ceçan lohi thutic , eta lohi harçaz frota citzan itsuaren beguiac :

text: And said unto him , Go , wash in the pool of Siloam , ( which is by interpretation , Sent . ) He went his way therefore , and washed , and came seeing .
text2: Eta erran cieçon , Oha garbitzera Siloe , igorria erran nahi deneco ikuzgarrira . Ioan cedin bada , eta garbi cedin , eta itzul cedin ikusten çuela .

text: The neighbours therefore , and they which before had seen him that he was blind , said , Is not this he that sat and begged ?
text2: Bada auçoéc , eta lehen ikussi çutenéc ecen itsu cela , erraiten çutén , Ezta haur iarriric ohi cegoena eta escatzen cena ?

text: Some said , This is he : others said , He is like him : but he said , I am he .
text2: Batzuc erraiten çutén , Haur da : eta bercéc , Hura dirudi , Baina berac erraiten çuen , Ni naiz hura .

text: Therefore said they unto him , How were thine eyes opened ?
text2: Erran cieçoten bada , Nolatan irequi içan dirade hire beguiac ?

text: He answered and said , A man that is called Jesus made clay , and anointed mine eyes , and said unto me , Go to the pool of Siloam , and wash : and I went and washed , and I received sight .
text2: Ihardets ceçan harc , eta erran ceçan , Iesus deitzen den guiconac lohi eguin du , eta frotatu ditu ene beguiac , eta erran draut , Oha Siloeco ikuzgarrira , eta garbi adi . Bada ioanic eta garbituric ikustea recebitu dut .

text: Then said they unto him , Where is he ? He said , I know not .
text2: Orduan erran cieçoten , Non da hura ? Dio , Eztaquit .

text: They brought to the Pharisees him that aforetime was blind .
text2: Eramaiten dute itsu ohi cen hura Phariseuetara .

text: And it was the sabbath day when Jesus made the clay , and opened his eyes .
text2: Eta cen Sabbathoa Iesusec lohia eguin çuenean eta haren beguiac irequi cituenean .

text: Then again the Pharisees also asked him how he had received his sight . He said unto them , He put clay upon mine eyes , and I washed , and do see .
text2: Berriz bada interroga ceçaten hura Phariseuéc - ere nolatan ikustea recebitu çuen . Eta harc erran ciecén , Lohi eçarri vkan draut neure beguién gainera , eta garbitu naiz , eta ikusten dut .

text: Therefore said some of the Pharisees , This man is not of God , because he keepeth not the sabbath day . Others said , How can a man that is a sinner do such miracles ? And there was a division among them .
text2: Erraiten çuten bada Phariseuetaric batzuc , Guiçon haur ezta Iaincoaganic : ecen Sabbathoa eztu beguiratzen . Bercéc erraiten çuten , Nolatan guiçon vicitze gaichtotaco batec sign hauc eguin ahal ditzaque ? Eta dissensione cen hayén artean .

text: They say unto the blind man again , What sayest thou of him , that he hath opened thine eyes ? He said , He is a prophet .
text2: Erraiten draucate itsuari berriz , Hic cer dioc harçaz , ceren beguiac irequi drauzquian ? Eta harc erran ceçan , Propheta dela .

text: But the Jews did not believe concerning him , that he had been blind , and received his sight , until they called the parents of him that had received his sight .
text2: Baina etzeçaten sinhets Iuduéc harçaz , ecen itsu içan cela , eta ikustea recebitu çuela , ikustea recebitu çuenaren aitamác dei litzaqueteno :

text: And they asked them , saying , Is this your son , who ye say was born blind ? how then doth he now see ?
text2: Eta interroga citzaten hec , cioitela , Haur da çuen seme çuec itsu iayo cela dioçuena ? nolatan bada orain dacussa ?

text: His parents answered them and said , We know that this is our son , and that he was born blind :
text2: Ihardets ciecén haren aitaméc , eta erran ceçaten , Badaquigu ecen haur dela gure semea , eta itsu iayo içan dela :

text: But by what means he now seeth , we know not ; or who hath opened his eyes , we know not : he is of age ; ask him : he shall speak for himself .
text2: Baina nolatan orain dacussan , eztaquigu : edo norc irequi dituen hunen beguiac , guc eztaquigu : berac adin du : bera interroga eçaçue , bera bere buruäz minçaturen da .

text: These words spake his parents , because they feared the Jews : for the Jews had agreed already , that if any man did confess that he was Christ , he should be put out of the synagogue .
text2: Gauça hauc erran citzaten haren aitaméc , ceren beldur baitziraden Iuduén : ecen ia ordenatu çuten Iuduéc , baldin nehorc aithor baleça hura licela Christ , synagogatic iraitz ledin .

text: Therefore said his parents , He is of age ; ask him .
text2: Halacotz haren aitaméc erran ceçaten , Adin du , bera interroga eçaçue .

text: Then again called they the man that was blind , and said unto him , Give God the praise : we know that this man is a sinner .
text2: Dei ceçaten bada bigarren aldian guiçon itsu içana , eta erran cieçoten , Emóc gloria Iaincoari : guc bacequiagu ecen guiçon hori gaichtoa dela .

text: He answered and said , Whether he be a sinner or no , I know not : one thing I know , that , whereas I was blind , now I see .
text2: Ihardets ceçan bada harc , eta erran ceçan , Gaichto denez eztaquit : gauçabat badaquit , ecen itsu nincelaric orain badacussadala .

text: Then said they to him again , What did he to thee ? how opened he thine eyes ?
text2: Eta erran cieçoten berriz , Cer eguin drauc ? nolatan irequi ditu hire beguiac ?

text: He answered them , I have told you already , and ye did not hear : wherefore would ye hear it again ? will ye also be his disciples ?
text2: Ihardets ciecén , Ia erran drauçuet , eta eztuçue ençun : cergatic berriz ençun nahi duçue ? ala çuec - ere haren discipulu eguin nahi çarete ?

text: Then they reviled him , and said , Thou art his disciple ; but we are Moses ' disciples .
text2: Orduan iniuria ceçaten hura , eta erran ceçaten , Aicén hi haren discipulu : guçaz den becembatean , Moysesen discipulu gaituc .

text: We know that God spake unto Moses : as for this fellow , we know not from whence he is .
text2: Guc baceaquiagu ecen Moysesi minçatu içan çayola Iaincoa : baina haur nondic den etzeaquiagu .

text: The man answered and said unto them , Why herein is a marvellous thing , that ye know not from whence he is , and yet he hath opened mine eyes .
text2: Ihardets ceçan guiçonac eta erran ciecén , Segur , hunetan da miraculua , ceren çuec ezpaitaquiçue nondic den , eta irequi baititu ene beguiac .

text: Now we know that God heareth not sinners : but if any man be a worshipper of God , and doeth his will , him he heareth .
text2: Eta badaquigu ecen Iaincoac vicitze gaichtotacoac eztituela ençuten : baina baldin norbeit Iaincoaren cerbitzari bada , eta haren vorondatea eguiten badu , hura ençuten du .

text: Since the world began was it not heard that any man opened the eyes of one that was born blind .
text2: Egundano ençun içan ezta ecen nehorc irequi duela itsu sorthuren beguiric .

text: If this man were not of God , he could do nothing .
text2: Baldin ezpaliz haur Iaincoaganic , deus ecin laidi .

text: They answered and said unto him , Thou wast altogether born in sins , and dost thou teach us ? And they cast him out .
text2: Ihardets ceçaten eta erran cieçoten , Hi bekatutan sorthua aiz guciori , eta hic iracasten gaituc gu ? Eta iraitz ceçaten hura campora .

text: Jesus heard that they had cast him out ; and when he had found him , he said unto him , Dost thou believe on the Son of God ?
text2: Ençun ceçan Iesusec nola egotzi vkan çuten hura campora : eta eriden çuenean hura , erran cieçón , Sinhesten duc hic Iaincoaren Semea baithan ?

text: He answered and said , Who is he , Lord , that I might believe on him ?
text2: Ihardets ceçan harc eta erran ceçan , Eta nor da , Iauna , sinhets deçadan hura baithan ?

text: And Jesus said unto him , Thou hast both seen him , and it is he that talketh with thee .
text2: Eta erran cieçon Iesusec , Eta ikussi duc hura , eta hirequin minço dena duc hura .

text: And he said , Lord , I believe . And he worshipped him .
text2: Eta harc dio , Sinhesten diat , Iauna . Eta adora ceçan hura .

text: And Jesus said , For judgment I am come into this world , that they which see not might see ; and that they which see might be made blind .
text2: Eta erran ceçan Iesusec , Iugemendu eguitera ni mundu hunetara ethorri naiz : ikusten eztutenéc , ikus deçatençát : eta ikusten dutenac itsu ditecençat .

text: And some of the Pharisees which were with him heard these words , and said unto him , Are we blind also ?
text2: Eta ençun ceçaten hori , Phariseuetaric harequin ciraden batzuc , eta erran cieçoten , Ala gu - ere itsu gara ?

text: Jesus said unto them , If ye were blind , ye should have no sin : but now ye say , We see ; therefore your sin remaineth .
text2: Erran ciecén Iesusec , Baldin itsu bacinete , etzinduqueite bekaturic : baina orain erraiten duçue , Badacussagu : beraz çuen bekatua badago .

text: Verily , verily , I say unto you , He that entereth not by the door into the sheepfold , but climbeth up some other way , the same is a thief and a robber .
text2: Eguiaz eguiaz erraiten drauçuet , borthatic ardién artheguira sartzen eztena , baina da igaiten bercetaric , hura ohoin da eta gaichtaguin .

text: But he that entereth in by the door is the shepherd of the sheep .
text2: Baina borthatic sartzen dena , da ardien artzaina .

text: To him the porter openeth ; and the sheep hear his voice : and he calleth his own sheep by name , and leadeth them out .
text2: Huni borthalçainac irequiten drauca , eta ardiéc haren voza ençuten duté : eta bere ardiac deitzen ditu cein bere icenez , eta eramaiten ditu camporat .

text: And when he putteth forth his own sheep , he goeth before them , and the sheep follow him : for they know his voice .
text2: Eta bere ardiac idoqui dituenean , hayén aitzinean ioaiten da : eta ardiac hari iarreiquiten çaizca , ecen eçagutzen dute haren voza .

text: And a stranger will they not follow , but will flee from him : for they know not the voice of strangers .
text2: Eta arrotz bati etzaizca iarreiquiren , baina ihes eguinen draucate : ceren ezpaitute eçagutzen arrotzén voza .

text: This parable spake Jesus unto them : but they understood not what things they were which he spake unto them .
text2: Comparatione haur erran ciecén Iesusec : baina hec etzeçaten eçagut cer cen hæy erraiten cerauena .

text: Then said Jesus unto them again , Verily , verily , I say unto you , I am the door of the sheep .
text2: Erran ciecén bada berriz Iesusec , Eguiaz eguiaz erraiten drauçuet , ecen ni naicela ardién borthá .

text: All that ever came before me are thieves and robbers : but the sheep did not hear them .
text2: Guciac cembat - ere ene aitzinean ethorri baitirade ohoin dirade eta gaichtaguin : baina ardiéc eztituzte hec ençun vkan .

text: I am the door : by me if any man enter in , he shall be saved , and shall go in and out , and find pasture .
text2: Ni naiz borthá , nitaric baldin nehor sar badadi saluaturen da : eta sarthuren da eta ilkiren da , eta bazca eridenen du .

text: The thief cometh not , but for to steal , and to kill , and to destroy : I am come that they might have life , and that they might have it more abundantly .
text2: Ohoina ezta ethorten ardiac ebats eta hil eta deseguin ditzançat baicen : ni ethorri naiz vicitze dutençat , eta abundantia dutençát .

text: I am the good shepherd : the good shepherd giveth his life for the sheep .
text2: Ni naiz artzain ona : artzain onac bere vicia eçarten du bere ardiacgatic :

text: But he that is an hireling , and not the shepherd , whose own the sheep are not , seeth the wolf coming , and leaveth the sheep , and fleeth : and the wolf catcheth them , and scattereth the sheep .
text2: Baina mercenarioac , eta artzain eztenac , ceinenac ezpaitirade ardiac , dacussanean otsoa heldu dela , vtziten ditu ardiac , eta ihes eguiten du : eta otsoac harrapatzen eta barreyatzen ditu ardiac .

text: The hireling fleeth , because he is an hireling , and careth not for the sheep .
text2: Eta mercenarioac ihes eguiten du , ceren mercenario baita , eta ezpaitu ardién ansiaric .

text: I am the good shepherd , and know my sheep , and am known of mine .
text2: Ni naiz artzain ona , eta eçagutzen ditut neure ardiac , eta eçagutzen naiz neure ardiéz .

text: As the Father knoweth me , even so know I the Father : and I lay down my life for the sheep .
text2: Aitac ni eçagutzen nauen beçala , nic - ere eçagutzen dut Aita : eta neure vicia eçarten dut neure ardiacgatic .

text: And other sheep I have , which are not of this fold : them also I must bring , and they shall hear my voice ; and there shall be one fold , and one shepherd .
text2: Berce ardiric - ere badut cein ezpaitirade arthegui hunetaco : hec - ere ekarri behar ditut : ecen ene voza ençunen duté , eta eguinen da artheguibat eta artzaimbat .

text: Therefore doth my Father love me , because I lay down my life , that I might take it again .
text2: Halacotz maite nau ni Aitac , ceren nic eçarten baitut neure vicia , berriz hura har deçadançat .

text: No man taketh it from me , but I lay it down of myself . I have power to lay it down , and I have power to take it again . This commandment have I received of my Father .
text2: Nehorc eztraut hura edequiten , baina nic dut eçarten hura neure buruz : bothere dut haren eçarteco , eta bothere dut berriz haren hartzeco . Manamendu haur recebitu dut neure Aitaganic .

text: There was a division therefore again among the Jews for these sayings .
text2: Orduan berriz dissensione eguin cedin Iuduén artean propos haucgatic .

text: And many of them said , He hath a devil , and is mad ; why hear ye him ?
text2: Eta erraiten çuten hetaric anhitzec , Deabrua du , eta erhotu doa : cergatic horri behatzen çaizquiote ?

text: Others said , These are not the words of him that hath a devil . Can a devil open the eyes of the blind ?
text2: Bercéc erraiten çutén , Hitz hauc eztirade deabrua duenarenac : ala deabruac itsuén beguiac irequi ahal ditzaque ?

text: And it was at Jerusalem the feast of the dedication , and it was winter .
text2: Orduan Dedicationearen bestá eguin cedin Ierusalemen , eta neguä cen .

text: And Jesus walked in the temple in Solomon ' s porch .
text2: Eta passeatzen cen Iesus templean Salomonen galerian .

text: Then came the Jews round about him , and said unto him , How long dost thou make us to doubt ? If thou be the Christ , tell us plainly .
text2: Ingura ceçaten bada hura Iuduéc , eta erran cieçoten , Noizdrano gure arimá daducac dudatan ? baldin hi bahaiz Christ , erran ieçaguc frangoqui .

text: Jesus answered them , I told you , and ye believed not : the works that I do in my Father ' s name , they bear witness of me .
text2: Ihardets ciecén Iesusec , Erran drauçuet , eta eztuçue sinhesten : nic neure Aitaren icenean eguiten ditudan obréc niçaz testificatzen duté .

text: But ye believe not , because ye are not of my sheep , as I said unto you .
text2: Baina çuec eztuçue sinhesten : ecen etzarete ene ardietaric , nola erran baitrauçuet .

text: My sheep hear my voice , and I know them , and they follow me :
text2: Ene ardiéc ene voza ençuten duté , eta nic ecagutzen ditut hec , eta iarreiquiten çaizquit niri .

text: And I give unto them eternal life ; and they shall never perish , neither shall any man pluck them out of my hand .
text2: Eta nic vicitze eternala emaiten drauet hæy : eta eztirade galduren seculan : eta eztitu harrapaturen hec nehorc ene escutic .

text: My Father , which gave them me , is greater than all ; and no man is able to pluck them out of my Father ' s hand .
text2: Ene Aita niri hec eman drauzquidana , guciac baina handiago da , eta nehorc ecin harrapa ditzaque hec ene Aitaren escutic .

text: I and my Father are one .
text2: Ni eta Aita bat gara .

text: Then the Jews took up stones again to stone him .
text2: Har ceçaten bada berriz harri Iuduéc haren lapidatzeco .

text: Jesus answered them , Many good works have I shewed you from my Father ; for which of those works do ye stone me ?
text2: Ihardets ciecén Iesusec , Anhitz obra onic eracutsi vkan drauçuet neure Aitaganic : obra hetaric ceinagatic lapidatzen nauçue ?

text: The Jews answered him , saying , For a good work we stone thee not ; but for blasphemy ; and because that thou , being a man , makest thyself God .
text2: Ihardets cieçoten Iuduéc , cioitela , Obra onagatic ezaugu lapidatzen , baina blasphemioagatic , eta ceren hic guiçon aicelaric eguiten baituc eure buruä Iainco .

text: Jesus answered them , Is it not written in your law , I said , Ye are gods ?
text2: Ihardets ciecén Iesusec , Ezta scribatua çuen Leguean , Nic erran dut , Iainco çarete ?

text: If he called them gods , unto whom the word of God came , and the scripture cannot be broken ;
text2: Baldin hec deithu baditu Iainco , ceinetara Iaincoaren hitza eguin içan baita , eta ecin hauts baitaite Scripturá :

text: Say ye of him , whom the Father hath sanctified , and sent into the world , Thou blasphemest ; because I said , I am the Son of God ?
text2: Ni Aitac sanctificatu eta mundura igorri bainau , çuec dioçue ecen blasphematzen ari naicela , ceren erran dudan , ecen Iaincoaren Semea naicela ?

text: If I do not the works of my Father , believe me not .
text2: Baldin neure Aitaren obrác eguiten ezpaditut , ezneçaçuela sinhets :

text: But if I do , though ye believe not me , believe the works : that ye may know , and believe , that the Father is in me , and I in him .
text2: Baina baldin eguiten baditut , eta baldin ni sinhetsi nahi ezpanauçue , obrác sinhets itzaçue : eçagut eta sinhets deçaçuen ecen Aita nitan dela eta ni hartan .

text: Therefore they sought again to take him : but he escaped out of their hand ,
text2: Berriz bada hura hartu nahiz çabiltzan : baina itzur cedin hayén escuetaric .

text: And went away again beyond Jordan into the place where John at first baptized ; and there he abode .
text2: Eta ioan cedin berriz Iordanaz berce aldera , lehen Ioannes batheyatzen ari cen lekura : eta egon cedin han .

text: And many resorted unto him , and said , John did no miracle : but all things that John spake of this man were true .
text2: Eta anhitz ethor cedin harengana , eta erraiten çutén , Ioannesec eztu signoric batre eguin vkan : baina Ioannesec huneçaz erran dituen gauça guciac , eguiazcoac ciraden .

text: And many believed on him there .
text2: Eta anhitzec han sinhets ceçaten hura baithan .

text: Now a certain man was sick , named Lazarus , of Bethany , the town of Mary and her sister Martha .
text2: Cen bada Lazaro deitzen cen guiçombat eri , Bethaniaco , Mariaren eta Martha haren ahizparen burguco .

text: ( It was that Mary which anointed the Lord with ointment , and wiped his feet with her hair , whose brother Lazarus was sick . )
text2: ( Eta Maria haur cen Iauna vnguentuz vnctatu çuena , eta haren oinac bere adatseco biloez ichucatu cituena : ceinen anaye Lazaro baitzen eri )

text: Therefore his sisters sent unto him , saying , Lord , behold , he whom thou lovest is sick .
text2: Igor ceçaten bada hunen arrebéc harengana , cioitela , Iauna , huná , hic maite duana , eri duc .

text: When Jesus heard that , he said , This sickness is not unto death , but for the glory of God , that the Son of God might be glorified thereby .
text2: Eta hori ençunic Iesusec erran ceçan , Eritassun hori ezta heriotara , baina Iaincoaren gloriatan , eritassun harçaz Iaincoaren Semea glorifica dadinçat .

text: Now Jesus loved Martha , and her sister , and Lazarus .
text2: Eta cituen maite Iesusec Martha , eta haren ahizpá , eta Lazaro .

text: When he had heard therefore that he was sick , he abode two days still in the same place where he was .
text2: Bada ençun çuenean ecen eri cela , bi egun egon cedin , orduan non baitzén leku hartan .

text: Then after that saith he to his disciples , Let us go into Judaea again .
text2: Guero horren ondoan erran ciecén discipuluey , Goacen Iudearát berriz .

text: His disciples say unto him , Master , the Jews of late sought to stone thee ; and goest thou thither again ?
text2: Diotsate discipuluéc , Magistruá , orain ciabiltzan Iuduac hi lapidatu nahiz , eta berriz hara ioaiten aiz ?

text: Jesus answered , Are there not twelve hours in the day ? If any man walk in the day , he stumbleth not , because he seeth the light of this world .
text2: Ihardets ceçan Iesusec , Egunean eztira hamabi oren ? baldin nehor egunaz ebil badadi , ezta behaztopatzen : ecen mundu hunetaco arguia ikusten du .

text: But if a man walk in the night , he stumbleth , because there is no light in him .
text2: Baina baldin nehor ebil badadi gauaz , behaztopatzen da : ecen arguiric ezta hura baithan .

text: These things said he : and after that he saith unto them , Our friend Lazarus sleepeth ; but I go , that I may awake him out of sleep .
text2: Gauça hauc erraiten ditu , eta guero dioste , Lazaro gure adiquisdea lo datza , baina banoa iratzar deçadan .

text: Then said his disciples , Lord , if he sleep , he shall do well .
text2: Erran cieçoten bada bere discipuléc , Iauna , baldin lo badatza sendaturen duc .

text: Howbeit Jesus spake of his death : but they thought that he had spoken of taking of rest in sleep .
text2: Eta haur erran ceçan Iesusec haren herioaz : eta hec vste çuten lozco lokartzeaz erraiten çuela .

text: Then said Jesus unto them plainly , Lazarus is dead .
text2: Orduan bada erran ciecén Iesusec claroqui , Lazaro hil da :

text: And I am glad for your sakes that I was not there , to the intent ye may believe ; nevertheless let us go unto him .
text2: Eta aleguera naiz çuengatic ( sinhets deçaçuençat ) ceren ezpainincén han : baina goacen harengana .

text: Then said Thomas , which is called Didymus , unto his fellowdisciples , Let us also go , that we may die with him .
text2: Erran ciecén bada Thomas Didymus deitzen denac discipulu laguney , Goacen gu - ere horrequin hil gaitecençát .

text: Then when Jesus came , he found that he had lain in the grave four days already .
text2: Ethor cedin bada Iesus , eta eriden ceçan hura ia laur egun çuela monumentean cela .

text: Now Bethany was nigh unto Jerusalem , about fifteen furlongs off :
text2: Cen bada Bethania hurbil Ierusalemeren hamaborz stadioren inguruä :

text: And many of the Jews came to Martha and Mary , to comfort them concerning their brother .
text2: Eta Iuduetaric anhitz ethor citecen Marthagana eta Mariagana , hec consola litzatençát bere anayeaz .

text: Then Martha , as soon as she heard that Jesus was coming , went and met him : but Mary sat still in the house .
text2: Marthac bada ençun ceçanean Iesus ethorten cela , aitzinera ilki cequión : eta Maria etchean iarriric cegoen .

text: Then said Martha unto Jesus , Lord , if thou hadst been here , my brother had not died .
text2: Erran cieçón bada Marthac Iesusi , Iauna , baldin içan bahinz hemen , ene anaye etzuqueán hil :

text: But I know , that even now , whatsoever thou wilt ask of God , God will give it thee .
text2: Baina orain - ere baceaquiat ecen cer - ere galde eguinen baitraucac Iaincoari , emanen drauala hiri .

text: Jesus saith unto her , Thy brother shall rise again .
text2: Diotsa Iesusec , Resuscitaturen dun hire anaye .

text: Martha saith unto him , I know that he shall rise again in the resurrection at the last day .
text2: Diotsa Marthac , Baceaquiat ecen resuscitaturen dela resurrectionean , azquen egunean .

text: Jesus said unto her , I am the resurrection , and the life : he that believeth in me , though he were dead , yet shall he live :
text2: Erran cieçón Iesusec , Ni naun resurrectionea eta vicitzea : ni baithan sinhesten duena , baldin hil içan badere vicico dun :

text: And whosoever liveth and believeth in me shall never die . Believest thou this ?
text2: Eta nor - ere vici baita , eta sinhesten baitu ni baithan , seculan eztun hilen . Sinhesten dun haur ?

text: She saith unto him , Yea , Lord : I believe that thou art the Christ , the Son of God , which should come into the world .
text2: Erraiten drauca , Bay , Iauna , nic diat sinhesten ecen hi aicela Christ Iaincoaren Seme mundura ethorteco cena .

text: And when she had so said , she went her way , and called Mary her sister secretly , saying , The Master is come , and calleth for thee .
text2: Eta haur erranic , ioan cedin , eta secretuqui dei ceçan Maria bere ahizpá , cioela , Magistrua dun hemen , eta deitzen au .

text: As soon as she heard that , she arose quickly , and came unto him .
text2: Hura , hori ençun duenean , iaiquiten da fitetz , eta ethorten da harengana .

text: Now Jesus was not yet come into the town , but was in that place where Martha met him .
text2: Ecen oraino etzén ethorri Iesus burgura : baina cen Marthac encontratu çuen lekuan .

text: The Jews then which were with her in the house , and comforted her , when they saw Mary , that she rose up hastily and went out , followed her , saying , She goeth unto the grave to weep there .
text2: Orduan harequin etchean ciraden Iuduac , eta hura consolatzen çutenac , ikussiric ecen Maria hain fitetz iaiqui , eta ilki cela , iarreiqui cequizquion hari , cioitela , Monumentera ioaiten da , han nigar daguiançat .

text: Then when Mary was come where Jesus was , and saw him , she fell down at his feet , saying unto him , Lord , if thou hadst been here , my brother had not died .
text2: Bada Mariac , ethor cedinean Iesus cen lekura , hura ikussiric , egotz ceçan bere buruä haren oinetara , ciotsala , Iauna , baldin içan bahinz hemen , etzuqueán hil ene anaye .

text: When Jesus therefore saw her weeping , and the Jews also weeping which came with her , he groaned in the spirit , and was troubled ,
text2: Iesusec bada ikus ceçanean hura nigarrez legoela , eta harequin ethorri ciraden Iuduac nigarrez leudela , spirituz mouituric trubla ceçan bere buruä :

text: And said , Where have ye laid him ? They said unto him , Lord , come and see .
text2: Eta erran ceçan , Non eçarri duçue ? Erraiten draucate , Iauna , athor eta ikussac .

text: Jesus wept .
text2: Eta nigar eguin ceçan Iesusec .

text: Then said the Jews , Behold how he loved him !
text2: Erran ceçaten bada Iuduéc , Horra nola maite çuen .

text: And some of them said , Could not this man , which opened the eyes of the blind , have caused that even this man should not have died ?
text2: Eta hetaric batzuc erran ceçaten , Ecin eguin ciroqueen itsuaren beguiac irequi dituen hunec , haur - ere hil ezladin ?

text: Jesus therefore again groaning in himself cometh to the grave . It was a cave , and a stone lay upon it .
text2: Iesus bada berriz bere baithan mouitzen cela , ethorten da monumentera , eta lecea cen , eta harribat haren gainera , eçarria .

text: Jesus said , Take ye away the stone . Martha , the sister of him that was dead , saith unto him , Lord , by this time he stinketh : for he hath been dead four days .
text2: Dio Iesusec , Altcha eçaçue harria . Diotsa Marthac , hil içan cenaren arrebác , Iauna , kirestu duc gaurguero : ecen laur egunetacoa duc .

text: Jesus saith unto her , Said I not unto thee , that , if thou wouldest believe , thou shouldest see the glory of God ?
text2: Diotsa Iesusec , Eztraunat erran , ecen baldin sinhets badeçan ikussiren dunala Iaincoaren gloria ?

text: Then they took away the stone from the place where the dead was laid . And Jesus lifted up his eyes , and said , Father , I thank thee that thou hast heard me .
text2: Ken ceçaten bada harria , hila eçarri içan cen lekutic . Orduan Iesusec altchaturic goiti beguiac , erran ceçan , Aitá , esquerrac emaiten drauzquiat , ceren ençun bainauc :

text: And I knew that thou hearest me always : but because of the people which stand by I said it , that they may believe that thou hast sent me .
text2: Eta nic baniaquián ecen bethi ençuten nauala : baina inguru dagoen gendetzeagatic erran diát , sinhets deçatençat ecen hic igorri nauala .

text: And when he thus had spoken , he cried with a loud voice , Lazarus , come forth .
text2: Eta hauc erranic , voz goraz oihu eguin ceçan , Lazaro , athor campora .

text: And he that was dead came forth , bound hand and foot with graveclothes : and his face was bound about with a napkin . Jesus saith unto them , Loose him , and let him go .
text2: Eta hil içan cena ilki cedin , escuac eta oinac lothuraz lothuac cituela : eta haren beguithartea crobitchet batez cen estalia . Dioste Iesusec , Lacha eçaçue eta vtzi eçaçue ioaitera .

text: Then many of the Jews which came to Mary , and had seen the things which Jesus did , believed on him .
text2: Bada Iudu Mariagana ethorri ciradenetaric , eta Iesusec eguin cituen gauçác ikussi cituztenetaric anhitzec sinhets ceçaten hura baithan .

text: But some of them went their ways to the Pharisees , and told them what things Jesus had done .
text2: Baina hetaric batzu ioan citecen Phariseuetara , eta erran cietzen hæy Iesusec eguin cituen gauçác .

text: Then gathered the chief priests and the Pharisees a council , and said , What do we ? for this man doeth many miracles .
text2: Orduan bil ceçaten Sacrificadore principaléc eta Phariseuéc conseillua , eta erraiten çuten , Cer eguiten dugu , ecen guiçon hunec anhitz signo eguiten du .

text: If we let him thus alone , all men will believe on him : and the Romans shall come and take away both our place and nation .
text2: Baldin hunela vtzi badeçagu , guciéc sinhetsiren duté hori baithan : eta ethorriren dirade Romanoac , eta arrasaturen duté bay gure lekua , bay nationea .

text: And one of them , named Caiaphas , being the high priest that same year , said unto them , Ye know nothing at all ,
text2: Orduan hetaric batec , Caiphasec , cein baitzén vrthe hartaco Sacrificadore subirano , erran ciecén , Çuec eztaquiçue deus :

text: Nor consider that it is expedient for us , that one man should die for the people , and that the whole nation perish not .
text2: Eta eztuçue pensatzen ecen probetchu dugula , guiçombat hil dadin populuagatic , eta natione gucia gal eztadin .

text: And this spake he not of himself : but being high priest that year , he prophesied that Jesus should die for that nation ;
text2: Eta haur bere burutic etzeçan erran : baina nola baitzén vrthe hartaco Sacrificadore subirano , prophetiza ceçan ecen Iesusec hil behar luela nationeagatic .

text: And not for that nation only , but that also he should gather together in one the children of God that were scattered abroad .
text2: Eta ez solament natione harengatic , baina are Iaincoaren haour barreyatuac bil litzançát batetara

text: Then from that day forth they took counsel together for to put him to death .
