text: But Mary stood without at the sepulchre weeping : and as she wept , she stooped down , and looked into the sepulchre ,
text2: Baina Maria cegoen monumentaren aldean campotic , nigarrez : bada nigarrez cegoela , beheiti cedin monumentera :

text: And seeth two angels in white sitting , the one at the head , and the other at the feet , where the body of Jesus had lain .
text2: Eta ikus citzan bi Aingueru churiz veztituac , iarriric ceudela , bata burura eta bercea oinetara , Iesusen gorputza etzan içan cen lekuan .

text: And they say unto her , Woman , why weepest thou ? She saith unto them , Because they have taken away my Lord , and I know not where they have laid him .
text2: Eta hec erran cieçoten , Emazteá , cergatic nigarrez ago ? Dioste , Ceren kendu baitute ene Iauna , eta ezpaitaquit non eçarri dutén .

text: And when she had thus said , she turned herself back , and saw Jesus standing , and knew not that it was Jesus .
text2: Eta haur erran çuenean itzul cedin guibelerat , eta ikus ceçan Iesus han cegoela , eta etzaquian Iesus cela .

text: Jesus saith unto her , Woman , why weepest thou ? whom seekest thou ? She , supposing him to be the gardener , saith unto him , Sir , if thou have borne him hence , tell me where thou hast laid him , and I will take him away .
text2: Diotsa Iesusec , Emazteá , cergatic nigarrez ago ? noren bilha abila ? Harc vstez ecen baratzeçaina cela , diotsa , Iauna , baldin hic eraman baduc hura , erradac non eçarri duán : eta nic kenduren diat .

text: Jesus saith unto her , Mary . She turned herself , and saith unto him , Rabboni ; which is to say , Master .
text2: Diotsa Iesusec , Mariá : Itzuliric harc diotsa , Rabboni , erran nahi baita , Magistrua .

text: Jesus saith unto her , Touch me not ; for I am not yet ascended to my Father : but go to my brethren , and say unto them , I ascend unto my Father , and your Father ; and to my God , and your God .
text2: Diotsa Iesusec , Ezneçanala hunqui : ecen oraino eznaun igan neure Aitagana : baina habil ene anayetara , eta erran iecén , Igaiten naiz neure Aitagana , eta çuen Aitagana , eta neure Iaincoagana eta çuen Iaincoagana .

text: Mary Magdalene came and told the disciples that she had seen the Lord , and that he had spoken these things unto her .
text2: Ethor cedin Maria Magdalena contatzen cerauela discipuluey ecen ikussi çuela Iauna , eta harc gauça hec erran cerautzala .

text: Then the same day at evening , being the first day of the week , when the doors were shut where the disciples were assembled for fear of the Jews , came Jesus and stood in the midst , and saith unto them , Peace be unto you .
text2: Eta arrastu cenean Sabbathoén asteco lehen egun hartan , eta borthác ertsiac ceudela , non bilduac baitziraden discipuluac Iuduén beldurrez , ethor cedin Iesus eta gueldi cedin hayén artean , eta dioste , Baquea dela çuequin .

text: And when he had so said , he shewed unto them his hands and his side . Then were the disciples glad , when they saw the Lord .
text2: Eta haur erran çuenean , eracuts cietzén escuac eta bere seihetsa : eta aleguera citecen discipuluac ikussiric Iauna .

text: Then said Jesus to them again , Peace be unto you : as my Father hath sent me , even so send I you .
text2: Eta erran ciecén berriz , Baquea dela çuequin : ni Aitac igorri nauen beçala , nic - ere igorten çaituztet çuec .

text: And when he had said this , he breathed on them , and saith unto them , Receive ye the Holy Ghost :
text2: Eta haur erran çuenean , hats eman ciecén eta erran , Recebi eçaçue Spiritu saindua .

text: Whose soever sins ye remit , they are remitted unto them ; and whose soever sins ye retain , they are retained .
text2: Noren - ere bekatuac barkaturen baitituçue , barkatzen çaizte hæy : eta norenac - ere eduquiren baitituçue , eduquiac dirade .

text: But Thomas , one of the twelve , called Didymus , was not with them when Jesus came .
text2: Eta Thomas , hamabietaric bat , Didymus deitzen dena , etzén hequin Iesus ethorri cenean .

text: The other disciples therefore said unto him , We have seen the Lord . But he said unto them , Except I shall see in his hands the print of the nails , and put my finger into the print of the nails , and thrust my hand into his side , I will not believe .
text2: Erran cieçoten bada hari berce discipuluéc , Ikussi diagu Iauna . Eta harc erran ciecén , Baldin ikus ezpadeçat haren escuetan itzén seignalea , eta eçar ezpadeçat neure erhia itzén lekuan , eta eçar ezpadeçat neure escua haren seyhetsean , eztut sinhetsiren .

text: And after eight days again his disciples were within , and Thomas with them : then came Jesus , the doors being shut , and stood in the midst , and said , Peace be unto you .
text2: Eta çortzi egunen buruän berriz ciraden haren discipuluac barnean , eta Thomas hequin : ethor cedin Iesus borthác ertsiac ceudela , eta gueldi cedin hayén artean , eta erran ceçan , Baquea dela çuequin .

text: Then saith he to Thomas , reach hither thy finger , and behold my hands ; and reach hither thy hand , and thrust it into my side : and be not faithless , but believing .
text2: Guero diotsa Thomasi , Eçarrac eure erhia hemen , eta ikus itzac ene escuac : eta heda eçac eure escua , eta eçarrac ene seihetsean : eta ezaicela sinheste - gabe , baina sinheste - dun .

text: And Thomas answered and said unto him , My Lord and my God .
text2: Eta ihardets ceçan Thomasec : eta erran cieçón , Ene Iauna eta ene Iaincoá .

text: Jesus saith unto him , Thomas , because thou hast seen me , thou hast believed : blessed are they that have not seen , and yet have believed .
text2: Diotsa Iesusec , Ceren ikussi bainauc , Thomas sinhesten duc : dohatsu dituc ikussi ez , eta sinhetsi dutenac .

text: And many other signs truly did Jesus in the presence of his disciples , which are not written in this book :
text2: Bada anhitz berce signoric - ere eguin ceçan Iesusec bere discipuluén aitzinean , cein ezpaitirade scribatuac liburu hunetan .

text: But these are written , that ye might believe that Jesus is the Christ , the Son of God ; and that believing ye might have life through his name .
text2: Baina gauça hauc scribatu içan dirade , sinhets deçaçuençát ecen Iesus dela Christ Iaincoaren Semea , eta sinhesten duçuela vicitzea duçuençát haren icenean .

text: After these things Jesus shewed himself again to the disciples at the sea of Tiberias ; and on this wise shewed he himself .
text2: Guero manifesta cequién berriz Iesus discipuluey Tiberiaco itsas aldean , manifesta cedin bada hunela :

text: There were together Simon Peter , and Thomas called Didymus , and Nathanael of Cana in Galilee , and the sons of Zebedee , and two other of his disciples .
text2: Ciraden elkarrequin Simon Pierris , eta Thomas Didymus deitzen dena , eta Nathanael , cein baitzén Cana Galileaco , eta Zebedeoren semeac , eta haren discipuluetaric berceric biga .

text: Simon Peter saith unto them , I go a fishing . They say unto him , We also go with thee . They went forth , and entered into a ship immediately ; and that night they caught nothing .
text2: Dioste Simon Pierrisec , Banoa arrainçara . Diotsate , Baguioaçac gu - ere hirequin . Parti citecen , eta igan citecen vncira bertan : eta gau hartan etzeçaten deus har .

text: But when the morning was now come , Jesus stood on the shore : but the disciples knew not that it was Jesus .
text2: Baina goiça ethorri cenean , eriden cedin Iesus vr bazterrean : badaric - ere etzeçaten eçagut discipuluéc Iesus cela .

text: Then Jesus saith unto them , Children , have ye any meat ? They answered him , No .
text2: Dioste bada Iesusec , Haourrác , iaquiric batre baduçue ? Ihardets cieçoten , Ez .

text: And he said unto them , Cast the net on the right side of the ship , and ye shall find . They cast therefore , and now they were not able to draw it for the multitude of fishes .
text2: Eta harc dioste , Egotzaçue sarea vnciaren escuineco aldera , eta eridenen duçue . Egotz ceçaten bada , eta guehiagoric ecin hura tira ceçaqueten arrainén anhitzez .

text: Therefore that disciple whom Jesus loved saith unto Peter , It is the Lord . Now when Simon Peter heard that it was the Lord , he girt his fisher ' s coat unto him , ( for he was naked , ) and did cast himself into the sea .
text2: Diotsa bada Iesusec maite çuen discipulu harc Pierrisi , Iauna duc . Simon Pierris bada , ençun çuenean ecen Iauna cela , bere iuppáz ingura cedin ( ceren billuzgorria baitzén ) eta egotz ceçan bere buruä itsassora .

text: And the other disciples came in a little ship ; ( for they were not far from land , but as it were two hundred cubits , ) dragging the net with fishes .
text2: Eta berce discipuluac vncian ethor citecen , ( ecen etziraden lurretic vrrun , baina ber - ehun bessoren inguruä ) tiratzun çutela sarea arrainez bethea .

text: As soon then as they were come to land , they saw a fire of coals there , and fish laid thereon , and bread .
text2: Eta lurrera iautsi ciradenean ikus citzaten ikatzac eçarriac , eta arraina gainean eçarria eta oguia .

text: Jesus saith unto them , Bring of the fish which ye have now caught .
text2: Dioste Iesusec , Ekarçue orain hartu dituçuen arrainetaric .

text: Simon Peter went up , and drew the net to land full of great fishes , and hundred and fifty and three : and for all there were so many , yet was not the net broken .
text2: Igan cedin Simon Pierris , eta tira ceçan sarea lurrera , ehun eta berroguey eta hamairur arrain handiz bethea : eta hambat bacen - ere , etzedin ethen sarea .

text: Jesus saith unto them , Come and dine . And none of the disciples durst ask him , Who art thou ? knowing that it was the Lord .
text2: Dioste Iesusec , Çatozte barazcal çaitezte . Eta discipuluetaric batre etzayón venturatzen interrogatzera , Hi nor aiz ? çaquitelaric ecen Iauna cela .

text: Jesus then cometh , and taketh bread , and giveth them , and fish likewise .
text2: Ethorten da bada Iesus eta hartzen du oguia eta emaiten draue , eta arrainetic halaber .

text: This is now the third time that Jesus shewed himself to his disciples , after that he was risen from the dead .
text2: Haur cen ia heren aldia Iesus bere discipuluey manifestatu içan çayena hiletaric resuscitatuz gueroztic .

text: So when they had dined , Jesus saith to Simon Peter , Simon , son of Jonas , lovest thou me more than these ? He saith unto him , Yea , Lord ; thou knowest that I love thee . He saith unto him , Feed my lambs .
text2: Bada barazcaldu ciradenean , diotsá Simon Pierrisi Iesusec , Simon Ionaren semeá , hauc baino hobe dariztac ? Diotsa , Bay Iauna : hic badaquic ecen on dariçadala . Diotsa , Bazcaitzac ene bildotsac .

text: He saith to him again the second time , Simon , son of Jonas , lovest thou me ? He saith unto him , Yea , Lord ; thou knowest that I love thee . He saith unto him , Feed my sheep .
text2: Diotsa are berriz , Simon Ionaren semeá , on dariztac niri ? Diotsa , Bay Iauna , hic badaquic ecen on dariçadala . Diotsa , Bazcaitzac ene ardiac .

text: He saith unto him the third time , Simon , son of Jonas , lovest thou me ? Peter was grieved because he said unto him the third time , Lovest thou me ? And he said unto him , Lord , thou knowest all things ; thou knowest that I love thee . Jesus saith unto him , Feed my sheep .
text2: Erraiten drauca herenean , Simon Ionaren semeá , on dariztac niri ? Triste cedin Pierris ceren erran baitzieçón herenean , On dariztac niri ? Eta erran cieçón , Iauna , hic gauça guciac badaquizquic , hic badaquic ecen on dariçadala . Diotsa Iesusec , Bazcaitzac ene ardiac .

text: Verily , verily , I say unto thee , When thou wast young , thou girdedst thyself , and walkedst whither thou wouldest : but when thou shalt be old , thou shalt stretch forth thy hands , and another shall gird thee , and carry thee whither thou wouldest not .
text2: Eguiaz eguiaz erraiten drauat , gazteago incenean , guerricatzen incén , eta bahindoan norat nahi baihincén : baina çahar adinean , hedaturen dituc eure escuac , eta bercec guerricaturen au , eta eramanen au nahi eztuquean lekura .

text: This spake he , signifying by what death he should glorify God . And when he had spoken this , he saith unto him , Follow me .
text2: Eta haur erran ceçan , aditzera emaiten çuela cer herioz glorificaturen çuen Iaincoa . Eta haur erran çuenean , diotsa , Arreit niri .

text: Then Peter , turning about , seeth the disciple whom Jesus loved following ; which also leaned on his breast at supper , and said , Lord , which is he that betrayeth thee ?
text2: Itzuliric Pierrisec ikus ceçan Iesusec maite çuen discipulu hura , iarreiquiten cela , cein sustengatu - ere baitzén affarian haren estomac gainera , eta erran baitzeçan , Iauna , nor da hi traditzen auena ?

text: Peter seeing him saith to Jesus , Lord , and what shall this man do ?
text2: Haur bada ikussi çuenean Pierrisec , diotsa Iesusi , Iauna , eta haur cer ?

text: Jesus saith unto him , If I will that he tarry till I come , what is that to thee ? follow thou me .
text2: Diotsa Iesusec , Baldin hori nahi badut dagoen nathorreno , cer mengoa duc hic ? hi arreit niri .

text: Then went this saying abroad among the brethren , that that disciple should not die : yet Jesus said not unto him , He shall not die ; but , If I will that he tarry till I come , what is that to thee ?
text2: Eta ilki cedin hitz haur anayén artean ecen discipulu hura etzela hilen : baina etzeraucan erran Iesusec , eztuc hilen : baina , Baldin hori nahi badut dagoen nathorreno , cer mengoa duc hic ?

text: This is the disciple which testifieth of these things , and wrote these things : and we know that his testimony is true .
text2: Haur da discipulu hura ceinec testificatzen baitu gauça hauçaz , eta gauça hauc harc scribatu ditu : eta badaquigu ecen eguiazco dela haren testimoniagea .

text: And there are also many other things which Jesus did , the which , if they should be written every one , I suppose that even the world itself could not contain the books that should be written . Amen .
text2: Baina bada anhitz berce gauçaric - ere Iesusec eguinic , cein baldin scribatuac balirade punctuz punctu , munduac - ere eztut vste eduqui litzaqueela scriba litezquen liburuäc .

text: The former treatise have I made , O Theophilus , of all that Jesus began both to do and teach ,
text2: LEHENIC minçatu içan nauc , Theophile , Iesus eguiten eta iracasten hassi içan cen gauça guciéz .

text: Until the day in which he was taken up , after that he through the Holy Ghost had given commandments unto the apostles whom he had chosen :
text2: Elegitu cituen Apostoluey Spiritu sainduaz manamenduac emanic , goiti recebitu cen egunerano .

text: To whom also he shewed himself alive after his passion by many infallible proofs , being seen of them forty days , and speaking of the things pertaining to the kingdom of God :
text2: Ceiney eracutsi - ere baitu bere buruä viciric bere passioneaz gueroztic anthitz seignale segurez , berroguey egunez hæy eracusten eta Iaincoaren resumáz minçatzen çayela .

text: And , being assembled together with them , commanded them that they should not depart from Jerusalem , but wait for the promise of the Father , which , saith he , ye have heard of me .
text2: Eta bildu cituenean , mana citzan ezlitecen parti Ierusalemetic , baina iguriqui leçaten Aitaren promessa , Cein , dio , ençun baituçue eneganic .

text: For John truly baptized with water ; but ye shall be baptized with the Holy Ghost not many days hence .
text2: Ecen Ioannesec batheyatu du vrez , baina çuec batheyaturen çarete Spiritu sainduaz anhitz egun gabe .

text: When they therefore were come together , they asked of him , saying , Lord , wilt thou at this time restore again the kingdom to Israel ?
text2: Hec bada bildu ciradenean interroga ceçaten hura , cioitela , Iauna , dembora hunetan bere staturaco draucac resumá Israeli ?

text: And he said unto them , It is not for you to know the times or the seasons , which the Father hath put in his own power .
text2: Eta erran ciecén , Ezta çuey eman Aitac bere bothere proprian eçarri dituen demborén edo sasoinén eçagutzea .

text: But ye shall receive power , after that the Holy Ghost is come upon you : and ye shall be witnesses unto me both in Jerusalem , and in all Judaea , and in Samaria , and unto the uttermost part of the earth .
text2: Baina recibituren duçue çuen gainera ethorriren den Spiritu sainduaren verthutea , eta içanen çaizquidate testimonio Ierusalemen , eta Iudea gucian , eta Samarian , eta lurraren bazterrerano

text: And when he had spoken these things , while they beheld , he was taken up ; and a cloud received him out of their sight .
text2: Eta gauça hauc erran cituenean , hec çacussatela altcha cedin : eta hodey batec harturic eraman ceçan hayén beguietaric .

text: And while they looked stedfastly toward heaven as he went up , behold , two men stood by them in white apparel ;
text2: Eta cerurat beguiac fincatuac çadutzatela hura ioaten cenean , huná , bi guiçon presenta citecen hayén aitzinean veztidura churitan :

text: Which also said , Ye men of Galilee , why stand ye gazing up into heaven ? this same Jesus , which is taken up from you into heaven , shall so come in like manner as ye have seen him go into heaven .
text2: Ceinéc erran - ere baitzeçaten , Galileaco guiçonác , cergatic zaudete , cerurat beha çaudetela ? goiti çuetaric cerurat recebitu den Iesus haur , hala ethorriren da nola ikussi baituçue cerurat ioaiten .

text: Then returned they unto Jerusalem from the mount called Olivet , which is from Jerusalem a sabbath day ' s journey .
text2: Orduan itzul citecen Ierusalemera Oliuatzetaco deitzen den menditic , cein baita Ierusalemeco aldean , Sabbath baten bidean .

text: And when they were come in , they went up into an upper room , where abode both Peter , and James , and John , and Andrew , Philip , and Thomas , Bartholomew , and Matthew , James the son of Alphaeus , and Simon Zelotes , and Judas the brother of James .
text2: Eta sarthu içan ciradenean , igan citecen gambera gora batetara non baitzeuden Pierris eta Iacques , Ioannes eta Andriu , Philippe eta Thomas , Bartholomeo eta Mattheu , Iacques Alpheoren semea eta Simon Zelotes , eta Iuda Iacquesen anayea .

text: These all continued with one accord in prayer and supplication , with the women , and Mary the mother of Jesus , and with his brethren .
text2: Hauc guciéc perseueratzen çutén gogobatez othoitzatan eta orationetan emaztequin , eta Iesusen ama Mariarequin , eta haren anayequin ,

text: And in those days Peter stood up in the midst of the disciples , and said , ( the number of names together were about an hundred and twenty , )
text2: Eta egun hetan iaiquiric Pierrisec discipuluen artean , erran ceçan ( eta cen han berean compainiabat seioguey personaren ingurucoric )

text: Men and brethren , this scripture must needs have been fulfilled , which the Holy Ghost by the mouth of David spake before concerning Judas , which was guide to them that took Jesus .
text2: Guiçon anayeác , complitu behar cen Scriptura haur , cein aitzinetic erran baitu Spiritu sainduac Dauid - en ahoz , Iudasez , cein içan baita Iesusen hatzamailén guidari :

text: For he was numbered with us , and had obtained part of this ministry .
text2: Ecen contuco cen gurequin , eta recebitu vkan çuen administratione hunetaco portionea .

text: Now this man purchased a field with the reward of iniquity ; and falling headlong , he burst asunder in the midst , and all his bowels gushed out .
text2: Harc bada acquisitu du landabat iniquitatezco alocairutic , eta bere buruä egotziric erditic leher eguin vkan du , eta vrratu içan dirade haren halsar guciac .

text: And it was known unto all the dwellers at Jerusalem ; insomuch as that field is called in their proper tongue , Aceldama , that is to say , The field of blood .
text2: Eta gauça haur eçagutu içan da Ierusalemeco habitant guciéz : hala non deithu içan baita landa hura hayén lengoage propriz , Haceldama : erran nahi baita , odol landa .

text: For it is written in the book of Psalms , Let his habitation be desolate , and let no man dwell therein : and his bishoprick let another take .
text2: Ecen scribatua da Psalmuen liburuän , Eguin bedi haren habitationea desert , eta eztén han habita dadinic . Eta , Haren administrationea har deçan berce batec .

text: Wherefore of these men which have companied with us all the time that the Lord Jesus went in and out among us ,
text2: Behar da beraz gurequin bildu içan diraden guiçon hautaric , Iesus Iauna gure artean ioan eta ethorri içan den dembora gucian ,

text: Beginning from the baptism of John , unto that same day that he was taken up from us , must one be ordained to be a witness with us of his resurrection .
text2: Hassiric Ioannesen Baptismotic , gureganic goiti recebitu içan den egunerano , bat eguin dadin haren resurrectionearen testimonio gurequin .

text: And they appointed two , Joseph called Barsabas , who was surnamed Justus , and Matthias .
text2: Presenta citzaten bada biga , Ioseph Barsabas deitzen cena , cein icen goiticoz Iusto deithu içan baita , eta Matthias .

text: And they prayed , and said , Thou , Lord , which knowest the hearts of all men , shew whether of these two thou hast chosen ,
text2: Eta othoizte eguiten çutela erran ceçaten , Hic Iauna gucien bihotzac baiteçaguzquic , eracutsac cein elegitu duán bi hautaric ,

text: That he may take part of this ministry and apostleship , from which Judas by transgression fell , that he might go to his own place .
text2: Har deçançát ministerio hunetaco eta Apostolutassuneco , portionea , ceinetaric erauci içan baita Iudas , ioan ledinçat bere lekurát .

text: And they gave forth their lots ; and the lot fell upon Matthias ; and he was numbered with the eleven apostles .
text2: Eta egotz citzaten hayén çortheac , eta eror cedin çorthea Matthiasen gainera , eta consentimendu batez eçar cedin hameca Apostoluen contuan

text: And when the day of Pentecost was fully come , they were all with one accord in one place .
text2: Eta ethorri cenean Mendecoste eguna , guciac ciraden gogo batez leku batetan berean .

text: And suddenly there came a sound from heaven as of a rushing mighty wind , and it filled all the house where they were sitting .
text2: Eta eguin cedin subitoqui cerutic soinubat botheretsuqui heldu den haice baten ançora , eta bethe ceçan etche gucia non baitzeuden iarriric :

text: And there appeared unto them cloven tongues like as of fire , and it sat upon each of them .
text2: Eta aguer cequizquien suaren ançoco mihi partituac , eta paussa cedin hetaric batbederaren gainean .

text: And they were all filled with the Holy Ghost , and began to speak with other tongues , as the Spirit gave them utterance .
text2: Eta bethe citecen guciac Spiritu sainduaz , eta has citecen minçatzen lengoage arrotzez , Spirituac minçatzera emaiten cerauen beçala .

text: And there were dwelling at Jerusalem Jews , devout men , out of every nation under heaven .
text2: Eta bacén Ierusalemen egoiten ciraden Iudu Iaincoaren beldurra çuten guiçonetaric , ceruaren azpico natione orotaric .

text: Now when this was noised abroad , the multitude came together , and were confounded , because that every man heard them speak in his own language .
text2: Bada hots haur eguin cenean , bil cedin gendaldebat , eta trubla cedin , ceren batbederac ençuten baitzituen bere lengoage propriz hec minçatzen .

text: And they were all amazed and marvelled , saying one to another , Behold , are not all these which speak Galilaeans ?
text2: Eta spantatuac ceuden guciac , eta miresten çutén elkarri ciotsatela , Huná , minço diraden hauc gucioc , eztirade Galileano ?

text: And how hear we every man in our own tongue , wherein we were born ?
text2: Nolatan bada guc dançuzquigu batbedera iayo içan garen lengoage propriaz minçatzen ?

text: Parthians , and Medes , and Elamites , and the dwellers in Mesopotamia , and in Judaea , and Cappadocia , in Pontus , and Asia ,
text2: Parthianoéc eta Medianoéc eta Elamitéc , eta Mesopotamian egoiten diradenéc , eta Iudean , eta Cappadocian , Ponten , eta Asian ,

text: Phrygia , and Pamphylia , in Egypt , and in the parts of Libya about Cyrene , and strangers of Rome , Jews and proselytes ,
text2: Phrygian eta Pamphylian , Egypten , eta Lybia bazterretan , baita Cyreneco aurkán , eta Roman daudenéc , eta Iuduéc eta Proselytoéc , Cretianoéc eta Arabianoéc :

text: Cretes and Arabians , we do hear them speak in our tongues the wonderful works of God .
text2: Ençuten ditugu hauc gure lengoagez minço diradela Iaincoaren gauça magnificoez .

text: And they were all amazed , and were in doubt , saying one to another , What meaneth this ?
text2: Eta spantatuac ceuden guciac , eta etzaquitén cer pensa , elkarri ciotsatela , Cer erran nahi da haur ?

text: Others mocking said , These men are full of new wine .
text2: Eta bercéc truffatzen ciradela , cioiten , Mahatsarno eztiz betheac dirade hauc .

text: But Peter , standing up with the eleven , lifted up his voice , and said unto them , Ye men of Judaea , and all ye that dwell at Jerusalem , be this known unto you , and hearken to my words :
text2: Baina çutic cegoela Pierrisec hamequequin , altcha ceçan bere voza , eta minça cequién , cioela , Guiçon Iuduác eta Ierusalemen habitatzen çareten guciác , haur iaquiçue , eta beharriez har itzaçue ene hitzac .

text: For these are not drunken , as ye suppose , seeing it is but the third hour of the day .
text2: Ecen eztirade , çuec vste duçuen beçala hauc hordi , ikussiric ecen egunaren heren orena dela

text: But this is that which was spoken by the prophet Joel ;
text2: Baina haur da Ioel prophetáz erran içan dena .

text: And it shall come to pass in the last days , saith God , I will pour out of my Spirit upon all flesh : and your sons and your daughters shall prophesy , and your young men shall see visions , and your old men shall dream dreams :
text2: Eta içanen da , azquen egunetan ( dio Iain - coac ) erautsiren baitut neure Spiritutic haragui guciren gainera : eta prophetizaturen dute çuen seméc eta çuen alabéc , eta çuen gaztéc visioneac ikussiren dituzte , eta çuen çaharréc ametsez amets eguinen duté .

text: And on my servants and on my handmaidens I will pour out in those days of my Spirit ; and they shall prophesy :
text2: Eta segur neure muthilén eta neure nescatoen gainera egun hetan erautsiren dut neure Spiritutic , eta prophetizaturen duté .

text: And I will shew wonders in heaven above , and signs in the earth beneath ; blood , and fire , and vapour of smoke :
text2: Eta eguinen ditut gauça miraculuzcoac ceruän garayan , eta signoac lurrean beherean , odol eta su eta kezco vapore .

text: The sun shall be turned into darkness , and the moon into blood , before that great and notable day of the Lord come :
text2: Iguzquia cambiaturen date ilhumbetara , eta ilharguia odoletara , Iaunaren egun handia eta notablea dathorren baino lehen .

text: And it shall come to pass , that whosoever shall call on the name of the Lord shall be saved .
text2: Eta içanen da norc - ere inuocaturen baitu Iaunaren icena , saluaturen baita haina .

text: Ye men of Israel , hear these words ; Jesus of Nazareth , a man approved of God among you by miracles and wonders and signs , which God did by him in the midst of you , as ye yourselves also know :
text2: Israeltar guiçonác , ençun itzaçue hitz hauc : Iesus Nazarenoa , guiçon Iaincoaz approbatua çuec baithan obra excellentez eta miraculuz eta signoz , cein eguin baititu Iaincoac harçaz çuen artean , ceuroc - ere daquiçuen beçala :

text: Him , being delivered by the determinate counsel and foreknowledge of God , ye have taken , and by wicked hands have crucified and slain :
text2: Haur , Iaincoaren confeillu arrastatuz eta prouidentiaz emana hartu cindutenean , gaichtoén escuz crucificaturic hil vkan duçue .

text: Whom God hath raised up , having loosed the pains of death : because it was not possible that he should be holden of it .
text2: Cein Iaincoac resuscitatu baitu , herioaren doloreac lachaturic , ceren ezpaitzén possible hura harçaz , eduqui ledin .

text: For David speaketh concerning him , I foresaw the Lord always before my face , for he is on my right hand , that I should not be moved :
text2: Ecen Dauid - ec erraiten du harçaz , Contemplatzen nuen Iauna neure aitzinean bethiere : ecen neure escuineco aldean daut higui eznadin

text: Therefore did my heart rejoice , and my tongue was glad ; moreover also my flesh shall rest in hope :
text2: Halacotz alegueratu da ene bihotza , eta boztu da ene mihia , eta are guehiago ene haraguia paussaturen da sperançatan .

text: Because thou wilt not leave my soul in hell , neither wilt thou suffer thine Holy One to see corruption .
text2: Ecen eztuc vtziren ene arimá sepulchrean , eta eztuc permettituren hire Sainduac corruptioneric sendi deçan .

text: Thou hast made known to me the ways of life ; thou shalt make me full of joy with thy countenance .
text2: Eçagut eraci drauzquidac vicitzearen bideac , betheren nauc bozcarioz eure beguitharte aitzinean .

text: Men and brethren , let me freely speak unto you of the patriarch David , that he is both dead and buried , and his sepulchre is with us unto this day .
text2: Guiçon anayeác , frangoqui erran ahal deçaqueçuet Dauid patriarcház , ecen hura hil içan dela eta ohortze içan dela , eta haren sepulchrea gure artean dela egungo egunerano .

text: Therefore being a prophet , and knowing that God had sworn with an oath to him , that of the fruit of his loins , according to the flesh , he would raise up Christ to sit on his throne ;
text2: Bada Propheta nola baitzén , eta baitzaquian ecen iuramenduz iuratu ceraucala Iaincoac ecen haren guerrunceco fructutic , haraguiaren arauez , Christ suscitaturen çuela , haren throno gainean iar eraciteco .

text: He seeing this before spake of the resurrection of Christ , that his soul was not left in hell , neither his flesh did see corruption .
text2: Aitzinetic ikussiric minçatu içan da Christen resurrectioneaz , ecen eztela vtzi içan haren arima sepulchrean , eta haren haraguiac eztuela ikussi corruptioneric .

text: This Jesus hath God raised up , whereof we all are witnesses .
text2: Iesus haur resuscitatu vkan du Iaincoac , eta gauça hunez gu gucioc gara testimonio .

text: Therefore being by the right hand of God exalted , and having received of the Father the promise of the Holy Ghost , he hath shed forth this , which ye now see and hear .
text2: Bada Iaincoaren escuinaz altchatu içan denean eta Spiritu sainduaren promessa Aitaganic recebitu duenean , erautsi vkan du çuec orain dacussaçuen eta dançuçuen haur .

text: For David is not ascended into the heavens : but he saith himself , The LORD said unto my Lord , Sit thou on my right hand ,
text2: Ecen Dauid ezta igan ceruètara : baina dio berac , Erran drauca Iaunac ene Iaunari , Iar adi ene escuinean ,

text: Until I make thy foes thy footstool .
text2: Eçar ditzaçuedano hire etsayac hire oinén scabella .

text: Therefore let all the house of Israel know assuredly , that God hath made that same Jesus , whom ye have crucified , both Lord and Christ .
text2: Segur iaquin beça bada Israeleco etche guciac , ecen hura Iaun eta Christ eguin duela Iaincoac : Iesus çuec crucificatu duçuen haur diot .

text: Now when they heard this , they were pricked in their heart , and said unto Peter and to the rest of the apostles , Men and brethren , what shall we do ?
text2: Eta gauça hauc ençunic bihotz - chimico har ceçaten , eta erran cieçoten Pierrisi eta berce Apostoluey , Cer eguinen dugu guiçon anayeác ?

text: Then Peter said unto them , Repent , and be baptized every one of you in the name of Jesus Christ for the remission of sins , and ye shall receive the gift of the Holy Ghost .
text2: Eta Pierrisec dioste , Emenda çaitezte eta batheya bedi çuetaric batbedera Iesus Christen icenean bekatuén barkamendutan : eta recebituren duçue Spiritu sainduaren dohaina .

text: For the promise is unto you , and to your children , and to all that are afar off , even as many as the Lord our God shall call .
text2: Ecen çuey eguin çaiçue promessa eta çuen haourrey , eta vrrun diraden guciey , cembat - ere deithuren baititu gure Iainco Iaunac .

text: And with many other words did he testify and exhort , saying , Save yourselves from this untoward generation .
text2: Eta anhitz berce hitzez testificatzen çuen , eta exhortatzen cituen , cioela , Salua çaitezte natione gaichto hunetaric .

text: Then they that gladly received his word were baptized : and the same day there were added unto them about three thousand souls .
text2: Bada gogotic haren hitza recebitu çutenac , batheya citecen , eta augmenta citecen egun hartan hirur milla arimaren inguruäz .

text: And they continued stedfastly in the apostles ' doctrine and fellowship , and in breaking of bread , and in prayers .
text2: Eta perseueratzen çuten Apostoluén doctrinán , eta communicationean , eta oguiaren haustean , eta orationétan .

text: And fear came upon every soul : and many wonders and signs were done by the apostles .
text2: Eta arima guciari beldurtassun lot cequion , eta anhitz gauça miraculuzco eta signo Apostoluez eguiten cen .

text: And all that believed were together , and had all things common ;
text2: Eta sinhesten çuten guciac - ere elkarrequin ciraden , eta gauça guciac commun cituztén .

text: And sold their possessions and goods , and parted them to all men , as every man had need .
text2: Possessioneac eta onhassunac saltzen cituzten , eta partitzen cerezten guciey batbederac beharra çuenaren araura .

text: And they , continuing daily with one accord in the temple , and breaking bread from house to house , did eat their meat with gladness and singleness of heart ,
text2: Eta egun oroz perseueratzen çutén gogo batez templean , eta hausten çutela oguia etchez etche , hartzen çuten bere othorançá alegrançarequin eta bihotzezco simplicitaterequin :

text: Praising God , and having favour with all the people . And the Lord added to the church daily such as should be saved .
text2: Laudatzen çutela Iaincoa , eta gratia çutela populu gucia baithan . Eta Iaunac eratchequiten ceraucan gende saluatu içatecoric egun oroz Eliçari .

text: Now Peter and John went up together into the temple at the hour of prayer , being the ninth hour .
text2: Bada Pierris eta Ioannes elkarrequin igaiten ciraden templera othoitz ordutan , baitzén bedratzi orenetan .

text: And a certain man lame from his mother ' s womb was carried , whom they laid daily at the gate of the temple which is called Beautiful , to ask alms of them that entered into the temple ;
text2: Eta guiçon bere amaren sabeleandanic maingu cembat ekarten cen : cein eçarten baitzutén egun oroz templeco bortha Ederra deitzen denean , elemosyna esca lequiençát templean sartzen ciradeney .

text: Who seeing Peter and John about to go into the temple asked an alms .
text2: Harc ikus citzanean Pierris eta Ioannes templean sartzera cioacela , othoitz eguin ciecen elemosynabat luençát .

text: And Peter , fastening his eyes upon him with John , said , Look on us .
text2: Baina harenganat beguiac çorrozturic Pierrisec Ioannesequin erran ceçan , Beheçac gureganat .

text: And he gave heed unto them , expecting to receive something of them .
text2: Eta hura beguira çayen çorrozqui , hetaric cerbait recebitu vstez .

text: Then Peter said , Silver and gold have I none ; but such as I have give I thee : In the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth rise up and walk .
text2: Orduan Pierrisec erran ceçan , Cilharric ez vrrheric eztiát : baina cer baitut hura emaiten drauat : Iesus Chrift Nazarenoren icenean iaiqui adi eta ebil adi .

text: And he took him by the right hand , and lifted him up : and immediately his feet and ancle bones received strength .
text2: Eta hura escu escuinetic harturic , goiti ceçan , eta bertan erscont citecen haren oin çolác eta aztalac .

text: And he leaping up stood , and walked , and entered with them into the temple , walking , and leaping , and praising God .
text2: Eta iauciric gueldi cedin çutic , eta baçabilan : eta sar cedin hequin templean , ebilten eta iauzten cela eta laudatzen çuela Iaincoa .

text: And all the people saw him walking and praising God :
text2: Eta ikus ceçan hura populu guciac çabilala , eta laudatzen çuela Iaincoa .

text: And they knew that it was he which sat for alms at the Beautiful gate of the temple : and they were filled with wonder and amazement at that which had happened unto him .
text2: Eta eçagut ceçaten , hura ecen hura cela elemosyna esquez templeco bortha Ederrean iarten cena : eta bethe citecen iciapenez eta spantamenduz hari heldu içan çayón gauçaren gainean .

text: And as the lame man which was healed held Peter and John , all the people ran together unto them in the porch that is called Solomon ' s , greatly wondering .
text2: Eta maingu sendatu içanac Pierris eta Ioannes çadutzala , laster eguin ceçan hetara populu guciac Salomonen deitzen den galeriara , spantaturic .

text: And when Peter saw it , he answered unto the people , Ye men of Israel , why marvel ye at this ? or why look ye so earnestly on us , as though by our own power or holiness we had made this man to walk ?
text2: Hori ikussiric Pierrisec ihardets cieçón populuari , Israeltar guiçonác , cergatic miraculuz çaudete huneçaz ? edo cergatic guregana beguiac çorrozturic çaudete , gure verthutez edo saindutassunez haur ebil eraci baguindu beçala ?

text: The God of Abraham , and of Isaac , and of Jacob , the God of our fathers , hath glorified his Son Jesus ; whom ye delivered up , and denied him in the presence of Pilate , when he was determined to let him go .
text2: Abrahamen eta Isaac - en eta Iacob - en Iaincoac , gure aiten Iaincoac glorificatu du Iesus bere Semea , çuec liuratu eta vkatu duçuena Pilaten aitzinean , harc largatzeco cela iugeatu baçuen - ere .

text: But ye denied the Holy One and the Just , and desired a murderer to be granted unto you ;
text2: Baina çuec saindua eta iustoa vkatu duçue , eta requeritu duçue guicerhailebat eman lequiçuen :

text: And killed the Prince of life , whom God hath raised from the dead ; whereof we are witnesses .
text2: Eta vicitzearen princea hil vkan duçue , cein Iaincoac hiletaric resuscitatu baitu : eta gauça hunez testimonio gara gu .

text: And his name through faith in his name hath made this man strong , whom ye see and know : yea , the faith which is by him hath given him this perfect soundness in the presence of you all .
text2: Eta haren icena baithango fedeaz , ikusten eta eçagutzen duçuen haur , fortificatu vkan du haren icenac : eta harçaz den fedeac bere membro gucietaco dispositione haur huni eman drauca çuen gución presentián .

text: And now , brethren , I wot that through ignorance ye did it , as did also your rulers .
text2: Eta orain , anayeác , badaquit ecen ignorantiaz eguin vkan duçuela , çuen Gobernadorec - ere beçala .

text: But those things , which God before had shewed by the mouth of all his prophets , that Christ should suffer , he hath so fulfilled .
text2: Baina Iaincoac aitzinetic bere Propheta gucién ahoz erran cituen gauçác , Christec suffrituren çuela , hala complitu vkan ditu .

text: Repent ye therefore , and be converted , that your sins may be blotted out , when the times of refreshing shall come from the presence of the Lord ;
text2: Emenda çaitezte bada , eta conuerti çaitezte , ken ditecençát çuen bekatuac .

text: And he shall send Jesus Christ , which before was preached unto you :
text2: Refrigeramendutaco demborác ethorri diratenean Iaunaren presentiatic , eta igorri duqueenean çuey aitzinetic erran içan çaiçuena , Iesus Christ :

text: Whom the heaven must receive until the times of restitution of all things , which God hath spoken by the mouth of all his holy prophets since the world began .
text2: Cein ceruäc eduqui behar baitu , Iaincoac , munduaren hatseandanic Propheta saindu gucién ahoz erran dituen gauça gucién restaurationeco demboretarano .

text: For Moses truly said unto the fathers , A prophet shall the Lord your God raise up unto you of your brethren , like unto me ; him shall ye hear in all things whatsoever he shall say unto you .
text2: Ecen Moysesec aitey erran vkan draue , Prophetabat suscitaturen drauçue çuen Iainco Iaunac çuen anayetaric ni beçalacoric : ençunen duçue hura minçaturen çaiqueçuen gauça gucietan .

text: And it shall come to pass , that every soul , which will not hear that prophet , shall be destroyed from among the people .
text2: Eta içanean da , nor - ere Propheta hari behaturen ezpaitzayo , deseguinen baita populuaren artetic .

text: Yea , and all the prophets from Samuel and those that follow after , as many as have spoken , have likewise foretold of these days .
text2: Etare Samuelez guerozco Propheta guciéc , eta gueroz prophetizatu duten guciéc aitzinetic erran - ere badituzte egun hauc .

text: Ye are the children of the prophets , and of the covenant which God made with our fathers , saying unto Abraham , And in thy seed shall all the kindreds of the earth be blessed .
text2: Çuec çarete Prophetén , eta Iaincoac gure aitey ordenatu drauen aliançaren seme , ciotsala Abrahami , Eta hire hacian benedicatuac içanen dituc lurreco familia guciac .

text: Unto you first God , having raised up his Son Jesus , sent him to bless you , in turning away every one of you from his iniquities .
text2: Çuey lehenic Iaincoac suscitaturic Iesus bere Semea igorri vkan drauçue , harc benedica cinçatençat , çuetaric batbedera çuen gaichtaquerietaric conuertituz .

text: And as they spake unto the people , the priests , and the captain of the temple , and the Sadducees , came upon them ,
text2: Baina hec populuari minço çaizcala , ethor cequiztén Sacrificadoreac eta templeco Capitaina , eta Sadduceuac ,

text: Being grieved that they taught the people , and preached through Jesus the resurrection from the dead .
text2: Gaitzituric ceren iracasten baitzutén populua , eta predicatzen baitzutén Iesusen icenean hiletarico resurrectionea .

text: And they laid hands on them , and put them in hold unto the next day : for it was now eventide .
text2: Eta escuac egotz citzaten hayén gainera , eta eçar citzaten presoindeguian biharamunerano . Ecen ia arratsa cen .

text: Howbeit many of them which heard the word believed ; and the number of the men was about five thousand .
text2: Eta hitza ençun çutenetaric anhitzec sinhets ceçaten : eta guiçonén contua eguin cedin borz millatarano .

text: And it came to pass on the morrow , that their rulers , and elders , and scribes ,
text2: Eta guertha cedin biharamunean bil baitzitecen hayén Gobernadoreac eta Ancianoac eta Scribác Ierusalemera :

text: And Annas the high priest , and Caiaphas , and John , and Alexander , and as many as were of the kindred of the high priest , were gathered together at Jerusalem .
text2: Eta Annas Sacrificadore subiranoa , eta Caiphas eta Ioannes , eta Alexander , eta Sacrificadorén arraçatic ciraden guciac .

text: And when they had set them in the midst , they asked , By what power , or by what name , have ye done this ?
text2: Eta artean eçarri cituztenean , interroga citzaten , Cer botherez edo noren icenean gauça haur eguin duçue çuec ?

text: Then Peter , filled with the Holy Ghost , said unto them , Ye rulers of the people , and elders of Israel ,
text2: Orduan Pierrisec Spiritu sainduaz hetheric , erran ciecen , Populuaren Gobernadoreác eta Israeleco Ancianoác ,

text: If we this day be examined of the good deed done to the impotent man , by what means he is made whole ;
text2: Egungo egunean guiçon impotent bati eguin içan çayón vnguiaz examinatzen garenaz gueroz , cer moienez haur sendatu içan den :

text: Be it known unto you all , and to all the people of Israel , that by the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth , whom ye crucified , whom God raised from the dead , even by him doth this man stand here before you whole .
text2: Iaquiçue çuec gucioc eta Israeleco populu guciac , ecen Iesus Christ Nazarenoren icenean cein çuec crucificatu baituçue , cein Iaincoac resuscitatu baitu hiletaric , harçaz guiçon haur dagoela sendoric çuen aitzinean .

text: This is the stone which was set at nought of you builders , which is become the head of the corner .
text2: Haur da harri çueçaz edificaçaleoz arbuyatu içan den hura , cein eguin içan baita cantoin buru .

text: Neither is there salvation in any other : for there is none other name under heaven given among men , whereby we must be saved .
text2: Eta ezta bercetan batetan - ere saluamenduric : ecen berce icenic ezta ceruären azpian guiçoney eman çayenic , ceinez saluatu behar garén .

text: Now when they saw the boldness of Peter and John , and perceived that they were unlearned and ignorant men , they marvelled ; and they took knowledge of them , that they had been with Jesus .
text2: Orduan ikussiric Pierrisen minçatzeco hardieçá eta Ioannesena , eta eçaguturic ecen guiçon letra - gabeac eta idiotac ciradela , miresten çutén , eta eçagutzen çutén hec Iesusequin içanac ciradela .

text: And beholding the man which was healed standing with them , they could say nothing against it .
text2: Eta çacussatenean sendatu içan cen guiçona hequin present cela , ecin deusetan contrasta ahal citaqueen .

text: But when they had commanded them to go aside out of the council , they conferred among themselves ,
text2: Orduan hec conseillutic campora ilkitera manaturic : compartitzen çutén elkarren artean ,

text: Saying , What shall we do to these men ? for that indeed a notable miracle hath been done by them is manifest to all them that dwell in Jerusalem ; and we cannot deny it .
text2: Cioitela , Cer eguinen drauègu guiçon hoey ? ecen signo clarobat hauçaz eguin içan dela , manifest da Ierusalemeco habitant guciey , eta ecin vka deçaquegu .

text: But that it spread no further among the people , let us straitly threaten them , that they speak henceforth to no man in this name .
text2: Baina guehiagoric publica eztadin populuaren artean , defenda diecegun mehatchuz , eztaquizquión guehiagoric minça icen horretan nehori - ere .

text: And they called them , and commanded them not to speak at all nor teach in the name of Jesus .
text2: Bada hec deithuric mana citzaten neholetan - ere ezlitecen minça , eta ezleçaten iracats Iesusen icenean .

text: But Peter and John answered and said unto them , Whether it be right in the sight of God to hearken unto you more than unto God , judge ye .
text2: Baina Pierrisec eta Ioannesec ihardesten çutela erran ciecén , Eya Iaincoaren aitzinean gauça iustoa denez lehen çuey obeditzea ecen ez Iaincoari , iugea eçaçue .

text: For we cannot but speak the things which we have seen and heard .
text2: Ecen segur , ecin daidiquegu ençun eta ikussi ditugun gauçác erran eztitzagun .

text: So when they had further threatened them , they let them go , finding nothing how they might punish them , because of the people : for all men glorified God for that which was done .
text2: Orduan hec mehatchurequin vtzi citzaten ioaitera , ez eridenez nolatan puni ahal litzaqueizten , populuaren causaz , ceren guciéc Iaincoa glorificatzen baitzutén eguin içan cenaz .

text: For the man was above forty years old , on whom this miracle of healing was shewed .
text2: Ecen berroguey vrthe baino guehiago cituen guiçonac , ceinen gainean sendatzeco signo haur eguin içan baitzén .

text: And being let go , they went to their own company , and reported all that the chief priests and elders had said unto them .
text2: Eta ioaitera vtzi cituztenean ethor citecen bere gendetara , eta conta ciecén cer - ere Sacrificadore principaléc eta Ancianoéc erran baitzerauècén .

text: And when they heard that , they lifted up their voice to God with one accord , and said , Lord , thou art God , which hast made heaven , and earth , and the sea , and all that in them is :
text2: Eta hec ençun cituztenean gogo batez altcha ceçaten voza Iaincoagana , eta erran ceçaten , Iauna , hi aiz ceruä eta lurra , itsassoa eta hetan diraden gauça guciac eguin dituán Iaincoa ,

text: Who by the mouth of thy servant David hast said , Why did the heathen rage , and the people imagine vain things ?
text2: Dauid eure cerbitzariaren ahoz erran duana , Cergatic mutinatu içan dirade gendeac , eta populuéc pensatu vkan dituzté gauça vanoac ?

text: The kings of the earth stood up , and the rulers were gathered together against the Lord , and against his Christ .
text2: Bildu içan dirade lurreco regueac , eta princeac elkarrequin bathu içan dirade Iaunaren eta haren Christen contra .

text: For of a truth against thy holy child Jesus , whom thou hast anointed , both Herod , and Pontius Pilate , with the Gentiles , and the people of Israel , were gathered together ,
text2: Ecen bildu içan dituc eguiaz hire seme saindu Iesusen contra , cein vnctatu baituc , Herodes eta Ponce Pilate Gentilequin eta Israeleco populuarequin .

text: For to do whatsoever thy hand and thy counsel determined before to be done .
text2: Eguin leçatençát cer - ere hire escuac eta hire conseilluac lehenetic eguitera determinatu baitzuen .

text: And now , Lord , behold their threatenings : and grant unto thy servants , that with all boldness they may speak thy word ,
text2: Orain bada Iauna , beha eçac hayén mehatchuetara , eta eman iecéc eure cerbitzariey libertate gucirequin hire hitzaz minça ditecen :

text: By stretching forth thine hand to heal ; and that signs and wonders may be done by the name of thy holy child Jesus .
text2: Eure escua hedaturic ossassun emaitera , signoac eta miraculuac eguin ditecen Iesus hire Seme Sainduaren icenean .

text: And when they had prayed , the place was shaken where they were assembled together ; and they were all filled with the Holy Ghost , and they spake the word of God with boldness .
text2: Eta othoitz eguin çutenean , ikara cedin lekua ceinetan bilduac baitziraden : eta bethe citecen guciac Spiritu sainduaz , eta minçatzen ciraden Iaincoaren hitzaz hardieçarequin .

text: And the multitude of them that believed were of one heart and of one soul : neither said any of them that ought of the things which he possessed was his own ; but they had all things common .
text2: Eta aralde sinhetsi vkan çutenén bihotza eta arimá cen bat : eta nehorc posseditzen cituen gaucetaric etzuen erraiten deus bereric çuela , baina gauça guciac cituztén commun .

text: And with great power gave the apostles witness of the resurrection of the Lord Jesus : and great grace was upon them all .
text2: Apostoluec - ere verthute handitan testificatzen çutén Iesus Iaunaren resurrectioneaz , eta gratia handia cen bayen gucién gainean .

text: Neither was there any among them that lacked : for as many as were possessors of lands or houses sold them , and brought the prices of the things that were sold ,
text2: Ecen nehorc deusen beharric etzuen hayén artean : ceren landaric edo etcheric çuten guciéc saltzen baitzituztén , eta saldu içan ciraden gaucén precioa ekarten baitzutén

text: And laid them down at the apostles ' feet : and distribution was made unto every man according as he had need .
text2: Eta eçarten Apostoluén oinetara : eta partitzen çayón batbederari , beharra çuenaren araura .

text: And Joses , who by the apostles was surnamed Barnabas , ( which is , being interpreted , The son of consolation , ) a Levite , and of the country of Cyprus ,
text2: Iosesec bada , cein icen goiticoz dei baitzedin Apostoluéz Barnabas ( erran nahi baita consolationezco semea ) Leuitác , nationez Cyprianoac ,

text: Having land , sold it , and brought the money , and laid it at the apostles ' feet .
text2: Possessionebat nola baitzuen sal ceçan hura , eta ekarriric diruä eçar ceçan Apostoluén oinetara .

text: But a certain man named Ananias , with Sapphira his wife , sold a possession ,
text2: Baina Ananias deitzen cen guiçon batec , Sapphira bere emaztearequin sal ceçan possessionebat :

text: And kept back part of the price , his wife also being privy to it , and brought a certain part , and laid it at the apostles ' feet .
text2: Eta apparta ceçan preciotic partebat , haren emazteac - ere çaquialaric : eta cembeit parte ekarriric , Apostoluén oinetara eçar ceçan .

text: But Peter said , Ananias , why hath Satan filled thine heart to lie to the Holy Ghost , and to keep back part of the price of the land ?
text2: Eta erran ceçan Pierrisec , Ananias , cergatic bethe du Satanec hire bihotza Spiritu sainduari gueçur erraitera , eta landaren preciotic appartatzera ?

text: Whiles it remained , was it not thine own ? and after it was sold , was it not in thine own power ? why hast thou conceived this thing in thine heart ? thou hast not lied unto men , but unto God .
text2: Baldin beguiratu bahau etzena hire guelditzen ? eta salduric hire botherean etzena ? cer cen cergatic gauça hori gogoan eçarri behar auen ? eztrauec guiçoney gueçur erran , baina Iaincoari .

text: And Ananias hearing these words fell down , and gave up the ghost : and great fear came on all them that heard these things .
text2: Eta Ananias hitz hauc ençunic , eror cedin , eta renda ceçan spiritua : eta beldurtassun handia iar cedin gauça hauc ençuten cituzten gucién gainean .

text: And the young men arose , wound him up , and carried him out , and buried him .
text2: Eta iaiquiric lagun gazte batzuc har ceçaten hura , eta camporat eramanic ohortz ceçaten .

text: And it was about the space of three hours after , when his wife , not knowing what was done , came in .
text2: Eta guertha cedin quasi hirur orenen buruän , haren emaztea - ere , cer eguin cen etzaquialaric , sar baitzedin :

text: And Peter answered unto her , Tell me whether ye sold the land for so much ? And she said , Yea , for so much .
text2: Eta erran cieçón Pierrisec , Erran ieçadan hambatetan landá saldu duçue ? Eta harc erran ceçan , Bay , hambatetan .

text: Then Peter said unto her , How is it that ye have agreed together to tempt the Spirit of the Lord ? behold , the feet of them which have buried thy husband are at the door , and shall carry thee out .
text2: Orduan Pierrisec diotsa , Cer da iunctatu içan baitzarete çuen artean Iaunaren spirituaren tentatzera ? horrá , hire senharra ohortze dutenén oinac borthán , eta eramanen aute hi .

text: Then fell she down straightway at his feet , and yielded up the ghost : and the young men came in , and found her dead , and , carrying her forth , buried her by her husband .
text2: Eta bertan eror cedin haren oinetara eta renda ceçan spiritua . Eta sarthuric lagun gaztéc eriden ceçaten hura hila , eta camporat eramanic ohortz ceçaten bere senharraren aldean .

text: And great fear came upon all the church , and upon as many as heard these things .
text2: Eta beldurtassun handia eguin cedin Eliça guciaren gainean , eta gauça hauc ençuten cituzten gucién gainean .

text: And by the hands of the apostles were many signs and wonders wrought among the people ; ( and they were all with one accord in Solomon ' s porch .
text2: Eta Apostoluén escuz eguiten cen anhitz signo eta miraculu populuan : ( eta ciraden guciac gogo batetaco Salomonen galerián .

text: And of the rest durst no man join himself to them : but the people magnified them .
text2: Eta bercetaric batre etzén venturatzen hequin nahastecatzera : baina magnificatzen cituen hec populuac .

text: And believers were the more added to the Lord , multitudes both of men and women . )
text2: Eta emendatzenago cen Iaunean sinhesten çutenen compainiá , hambat guiçonez nola emaztez )

text: Insomuch that they brought forth the sick into the streets , and laid them on beds and couches , that at the least the shadow of Peter passing by might overshadow some of them .
text2: Hambat non karriquetara ekarten baitzituztén . eriac , eta ohetan eçarten eta licteretan , Pierris ethor ledinean haren itzala berere hetaric cembeiten gainetic iragan ledinçát .

text: There came also a multitude out of the cities round about unto Jerusalem , bringing sick folks , and them which were vexed with unclean spirits : and they were healed every one .
text2: Eta biltzen cen hiri hurbiletaco communa - ere Ierusalemera , ekarten cituztela eriac eta spiritu satsuez tormentatuac : eta guciac sendatzen ciraden .

text: Then the high priest rose up , and all they that were with him , ( which is the sect of the Sadducees , ) and were filled with indignation ,
text2: Orduan iaiquiric Sacrificadore subiranoa , eta harequin ciraden guciac ( cein baita Saddu - ceuen sectá ) inuidiaz bethe citecen .

text: And laid their hands on the apostles , and put them in the common prison .
text2: Eta egotz citzaten escuac Apostoluén gainera , eta eçar citzaten presoindegui publicoan .

text: But the angel of the Lord by night opened the prison doors , and brought them forth , and said ,
text2: Baina Iaunaren Aingueruäc gauaz irequi citzan presoindeguico borthác : eta hec campora idoquiric , erran ceçan ,

text: Go , stand and speak in the temple to the people all the words of this life .
text2: Çoazte , eta templean çaudetela declaira ietzoçue populuari vicitze hunetaco hitz guciac .

text: And when they heard that , they entered into the temple early in the morning , and taught . But the high priest came , and they that were with him , and called the council together , and all the senate of the children of Israel and sent to the prison to have them brought .
text2: Eta hec haur ençunic far citecen arthatsean templean , eta iracasten ari ciraden . Eta ethorriric Sacrificadore subiranoac , eta harequin ciradenéc bil ceçaten conseillua eta Israeleco haourrén Anciano guciac : eta igor ceçaten presoindeguira erekar litecençát .

text: But when the officers came , and found them not in the prison , they returned , and told ,
text2: Baina ethorriric officieréc etzitzaten eriden presoindeguian , eta itzuliric conta ceçaten ,

text: Saying , The prison truly found we shut with all safety , and the keepers standing without before the doors : but when we had opened , we found no man within .
text2: Cioitela , Presoindeguia behinçát eriden dugu ertsia diligentia gucirequin , eta goardác campotic borthén aitzinean ceudela : baina irequi dugunean , nehor eztugu barnean eriden .

text: Now when the high priest and the captain of the temple and the chief priests heard these things , they doubted of them whereunto this would grow .
text2: Hitz hauc ençun eta , Sacrificadore subiranoa eta templeco Capitaina , eta Sacrificadore principalac , dudán ceuden heçaz cer içanen cen .

text: Then came one and told them , saying , Behold , the men whom ye put in prison are standing in the temple , and teaching the people .
text2: Baina ethorriric cembeitec erran ciecén , Hará , presoindeguian eçarri cintuzten giçonac templean dirade , eta iracasten dute populua .

text: Then went the captain with the officers , and brought them without violence : for they feared the people , lest they should have been stoned .
text2: Orduan templeco Capitainac ioanic officierequin ekar citzan bortcha gabe : ( ecen po - puluaren beldur ciraden lapida ezlitecen )

text: And when they had brought them , they set them before the council : and the high priest asked them ,
text2: Eta ekarriric hec presenta citzaten conseilluan : eta interroga citzan Sacrificadore subiranoac ,

text: Saying , Did not we straitly command you that ye should not teach in this name ? and , behold , ye have filled Jerusalem with your doctrine , and intend to bring this man ' s blood upon us .
text2: Cioela , Eztrauçuegu manamendu expressez defendatu etzineçaten iracats icen horretan ? eta huná , bethe duçue Ierusaleme çuen doctrináz , eta nahi duçue gure gainera erekarri guiçon horren odola .

text: Then Peter and the other apostles answered and said , We ought to obey God rather than men .
text2: Orduan ihardesten çuela Pierrisec eta berce Apostoluéc erran ceçaten , Lehen obeditu behar da Iaincoa ecen ez guiçonac .

text: The God of our fathers raised up Jesus , whom ye slew and hanged on a tree .
text2: Gure Aitén Iaincoac resuscitatu vkan du Iesus , cein çuec çurean vrkaturic hil vkan baituçue .

text: Him hath God exalted with his right hand to be a Prince and a Saviour , for to give repentance to Israel , and forgiveness of sins .
text2: Haur Iaincoac prince eta saluadore goratu vkan du bere escuinaz , eman lieçonçat emendamendua Israeli eta bekatuén barkamendua .

text: And we are his witnesses of these things ; and so is also the Holy Ghost , whom God hath given to them that obey him .
text2: Eta guc ekarten draucagu testimoniage erraiten ditugun gauça hauçaz : bay eta Spiritu sainduac , cein eman baitraue Iaincoac hura obeditzen duteney .

text: When they heard that , they were cut to the heart , and took counsel to slay them .
text2: Eta hec haur ençunic despitez leher eguiteco ceuden , eta consultatzen çuten hayén hiltzera .

text: Then stood there up one in the council , a Pharisee , named Gamaliel , a doctor of the law , had in reputation among all the people , and commanded to put the apostles forth a little space ;
text2: Orduan iaiquiric conseilluan Phariseu Gamaliel deitzen cen Legueco doctor batec , cein populu guciac ohoratzen baitzuen , mana ceçan lekorerat appurbat retira litecen Apostoluac :

text: And said unto them , Ye men of Israel , take heed to yourselves what ye intend to do as touching these men .
text2: Guero erran ciecén , Israeltar guiçonác , gogoauçue ceurotara , guiçon hauçaz cer eguinen duçuen .

text: For before these days rose up Theudas , boasting himself to be somebody ; to whom a number of men , about four hundred , joined themselves : who was slain ; and all , as many as obeyed him , were scattered , and brought to nought .
text2: Ecen dembora hauc baino lehen altcha cedin Theudas , cioela tiere buruäz cerbait cela , ceini lagund baitzequión guiçon araldebat , laur ehunetarano : cein hil baitzeçaten , eta hari behatu , içan çaizcan guciac hautsi içan dirade eta ezdeus bilhatu .

text: After this man rose up Judas of Galilee in the days of the taxing , and drew away much people after him : he also perished ; and all , even as many as obeyed him , were dispersed .
text2: Haren ondoan altcha cedin Iudas Galileanoa descriptioneco demboretan , eta erauz ceçan populu handi bere ondoan : gal cedin hura - ere , eta hari behatu içan çaizcan guciac deseguin citecen .

text: And now I say unto you , Refrain from these men , and let them alone : for if this counsel or this work be of men , it will come to nought :
text2: Eta orain diotsuet , parti çaquiztez guiçon horiey , eta vtzitzaçue : ecen baldin guiçonetaric bada conseillu edo obra hori , deseguinen da :

text: But if it be of God , ye cannot overthrow it ; lest haply ye be found even to fight against God .
text2: Baina baldin Iaincoaganic bada , ezteçaqueçue deseguin , beguirauçue etzaitezten Iaincoagana contrariant eriden . Eta haren opinioneco içan ciraden .

text: And to him they agreed : and when they had called the apostles , and beaten them , they commanded that they should not speak in the name of Jesus , and let them go .
text2: Orduan deithuric Apostoluac , açotatu ondoan mana citzaten ezlitecen minça Iesusen icenean , eta vtzi citzaten ioaitera .

text: And they departed from the presence of the council , rejoicing that they were counted worthy to suffer shame for his name .
text2: Hec bada ioan citecen alegueraric conseilluaren aitzinetic , ceren Iesusen icenean iniuria suffritzeco ohore hura eguin içan baitzayen .

text: And daily in the temple , and in every house , they ceased not to teach and preach Jesus Christ .
text2: Eta egun guciaz templean eta etchean etziraden guelditzen iracastetic eta Iesus Christen predicatzetic .

text: And in those days , when the number of the disciples was multiplied , there arose a murmuring of the Grecians against the Hebrews , because their widows were neglected in the daily ministration .
text2: Eta egun hetan nola discipuluac multiplicatzen baitziraden , eguin cedin Grecoén murmuratzebat Hebraicoén contra ceren menospreciatzen baitziraden cerbitzu ordinarioan hayén emazte alhargunac .

text: Then the twelve called the multitude of the disciples unto them , and said , It is not reason that we should leave the word of God , and serve tables .
text2: Halacotz hamabiéc discipuluzco compainiá deithuric , erran ceçaten , Ezta raçoin guc Iaincoaren hitza vtziric mahainac cerbitza ditzagun .

text: Wherefore , brethren , look ye out among you seven men of honest report , full of the Holy Ghost and wisdom , whom we may appoint over this business .
text2: Hautaitzaçue beraz , anayeác , çuetaric çazpi guiçon testimoniage onetacoric , Spiritu sainduaz eta sapientiaz betheac , eta cargu haur emanen baitrauègu .

text: But we will give ourselves continually to prayer , and to the ministry of the word .
text2: Eta guçaz den becembatean orationeari eta hitzaren administrationeari iarreiquiren gniaizquió .

text: And the saying pleased the whole multitude : and they chose Stephen , a man full of faith and of the Holy Ghost , and Philip , and Prochorus , and Nicanor , and Timon , and Parmenas , and Nicolas a proselyte of Antioch :
text2: Eta propos haur compainia guciaren gogaraco içan cen : eta elegi citzaten Esteben , guiçon fedez eta Spiritu sainduaz bethea , eta Philippe , eta Prochoro , eta Nicanor , eta Timon , eta Parmenas , eta Nicolas proselyto Antiocheanoa :

text: Whom they set before the apostles : and when they had prayed , they laid their hands on them .
text2: Hauc presenta citzaten Apostoluén aitzinera , eta hec othoitze eguinic escuac gainean paussa cietzén .

text: And the word of God increased ; and the number of the disciples multiplied in Jerusalem greatly ; and a great company of the priests were obedient to the faith .
text2: Eta Iaincoaren hitza aitzinaratzen cen , eta haguitz multiplicatzen cen discipuluén contua Ierusalemen : Sacrificadoretaric - ere tropel handiac fedea obeditzen çuen .

text: And Stephen , full of faith and power , did great wonders and miracles among the people .
text2: Eta Estebenec betheric fedez eta botherez , eguiten çuen miraculu eta signo handiric populuan .

text: Then there arose certain of the synagogue , which is called the synagogue of the Libertines , and Cyrenians , and Alexandrians , and of them of Cilicia and of Asia , disputing with Stephen .
text2: Eta altcha citecen batzu , Libertinén , eta Cyreneanoén eta Alexandrianoén , eta Ciliciaco eta Asiaco diradenén deitzen den synagogatic , disputatzen ciradela Estebenequin .

text: And they were not able to resist the wisdom and the spirit by which he spake .
text2: Eta ecin resisti ceçaqueoten sapientiari eta hura minça eraciten çuen Spirituari .

text: Then they suborned men , which said , We have heard him speak blasphemous words against Moses , and against God .
text2: Orduan suborna citzaten guiçon batzu erraiten çutenic , Ençun dugu hori erraiten hitz blasphemiotacoric Moysesen eta Iaincoaren contra .

text: And they stirred up the people , and the elders , and the scribes , and came upon him , and caught him , and brought him to the council ,
text2: Eta moui citzaten populua eta Ancianoac eta Scribác : eta oldarturic harrapa ceçaten hura , eta eraman ceçaten conseillura .

text: And set up false witnesses , which said , This man ceaseth not to speak blasphemous words against this holy place , and the law :
text2: Eta presenta citzaten testimonio falsuac erraiten çutenic , Guiçon haur ezta ichiltzen blasphemiotaco hitz erraitetic leku saindu hunen , eta Leguearen contra .

text: For we have heard him say , that this Jesus of Nazareth shall destroy this place , and shall change the customs which Moses delivered us .
text2: Ecen ençun vkan dugu haur erraiten , ecen Iesus Nazareno horrec deseguinen duela leku haur , eta muthaturen dituela Moysesec eman drauzquigun ordenançác .

text: And all that sat in the council , looking stedfastly on him , saw his face as it had been the face of an angel .
text2: Eta beguiac harenganat egotziric , conseilluan iarriric ceuden guciéc ikus ceçaten haren beguithartea quasi Aingueru baten beguithartea beçalaco .

text: Then said the high priest , Are these things so ?
text2: Orduan erran ceçan Sacrificadore subiranoac , Gauça horiac horrela othe dirade ?

text: And he said , Men , brethren , and fathers , hearken ; The God of glory appeared unto our father Abraham , when he was in Mesopotamia , before he dwelt in Charran ,
text2: Eta harc erran ceçan , Guiçon anayeác eta aitác , ençuçue , Gloriazco Iaincoa aguer cequión gure aita Abrahami Mesopotamian cenean , Charranen habita cedin baino lehen :

text: And said unto him , Get thee out of thy country , and from thy kindred , and come into the land which I shall shew thee .
text2: Eta erran cieçón , Ilki adi eure herritic , eta eure ahaidetaric , eta athor nic eracutsiren drauädan lurrera .

text: Then came he out of the land of the Chaldaeans , and dwelt in Charran : and from thence , when his father was dead , he removed him into this land , wherein ye now dwell .
text2: Orduan ilkiric Chaldeoén herritic habita cedin Charranen . Eta handic , haren aita hil cenean Iaincoac eraman ceçan hura çuec habitatzen çareten lur hunetara .

text: And he gave him none inheritance in it , no , not so much as to set his foot on : yet he promised that he would give it to him for a possession , and to his seed after him , when as yet he had no child .
text2: Eta etzieçón heretageric eman hartan , ez are oinaren bethea - ere : possessionetan hura emanen ceraucala promettatu baceraucan - ere , eta haren haciari haren ondoan , haourric ezpaçuen - ere .

text: And God spake on this wise , That his seed should sojourn in a strange land ; and that they should bring them into bondage , and entreat them evil four hundred years .
text2: Baina hunela erran ceçan Iaincoac , Habitaturen duc hire hacia berceren lurrean : eta han hura suiectionetaco eguinen dié , eta gaizqui tractaturen laur ehun vrthez .

text: And the nation to whom they shall be in bondage will I judge , said God : and after that shall they come forth , and serve me in this place .
text2: Baina hec cerbitzatu duqueiten gendea punituren diat nic , dio Iaincoac : eta guero ilkiren dituc , eta cerbitzaturen nié leku hunetan .

text: And he gave him the covenant of circumcision : and so Abraham begat Isaac , and circumcised him the eighth day ; and Isaac begat Jacob ; and Jacob begat the twelve patriarchs .
text2: Eta eman cieçón Circoncisionezco alliançá : eta hunela Abrahamec engendra ceçan Isaac , eta circoncidi ceçan hura çortzigarreneco egunean : eta Isaac - ec engendra ceçan Iacob , eta Iacob - ec hamabi Patriarchác .

text: And the patriarchs , moved with envy , sold Joseph into Egypt : but God was with him ,
text2: Eta Patriarchéc inuidiaz mouituric , sal ceçaten Ioseph Egypterát eraman ledinçat : baina Iaincoa cen harequin :

text: And delivered him out of all his afflictions , and gave him favour and wisdom in the sight of Pharaoh king of Egypt ; and he made him governor over Egypt and all his house .
text2: Eta idoqui ceçan hura bere tribulatione gucietaric , eta eman cieçón gratia eta sapientia Egypteco regue Pharaoren aitzinean , ceinec ordena baitzeçan hura Egypteco eta bere etche gucico gobernadore .

text: Now there came a dearth over all the land of Egypt and Chanaan , and great affliction : and our fathers found no sustenance .
text2: Eta ethor cedin gossetebat Egypteco herri gucira , eta Chanaan - era , eta herstura handia : eta etzutén erideiten iatecoric gure Aitéc .

text: But when Jacob heard that there was corn in Egypt , he sent out our fathers first .
text2: Baina ençun ceçanean Iacob - ec bacela ogui Egypten , igor citzan gure Aitác lehenic .

text: And at the second time Joseph was made known to his brethren ; and Joseph ' s kindred was made known unto Pharaoh .
text2: Eta bigarren aldian eçagut cedin Ioseph bere anayéz , eta declara cequion Pharaori Iosephen leinua .

text: Then sent Joseph , and called his father Jacob to him , and all his kindred , threescore and fifteen souls .
text2: Orduan mandatariac igorriric Iosephec erekar ceçan bere aita Iacob , eta bere ahacoa gucia , baitziraden hiruroguey eta hamaborz persona .

text: So Jacob went down into Egypt , and died , he , and our fathers ,
text2: Iauts cedin bada Iacob Egyptera , eta hil cedin hura , eta gure Aitác .

text: And were carried over into Sychem , and laid in the sepulchre that Abraham bought for a sum of money of the sons of Emmor the father of Sychem .
text2: Eta eraman içan ciraden Sichemera , eta eçarri içan ciraden sepulchrean , cein erossi baitzuen Abrahamec diruren preciotan Emor Sichemeco semearen semetaric .

text: But when the time of the promise drew nigh , which God had sworn to Abraham , the people grew and multiplied in Egypt ,
text2: Baina Iaincoac Abrahami iuratu ceraucan promessaren dembora hurbiltzen cela , augmenta cedin populua eta multiplica Egypten :

text: Till another king arose , which knew not Joseph .
text2: Berce reguebat Ioseph eçagutu etzuenic altcha cedino .

text: The same dealt subtilly with our kindred , and evil entreated our fathers , so that they cast out their young children , to the end they might not live .
text2: Hare gure nationearen contra fineciaz vsatzen çuela , gaizqui tracta citzan gure aitác , bere haourrén heriotara abandonna eraciterano , arraçá falta ledinçát .

text: In which time Moses was born , and was exceeding fair , and nourished up in his father ' s house three months :
text2: Dembora hartan sor cedin Moyses , eta cen Iaincoaren gogaraco : cein hirur hilebethez haci içan baitzén bere aitaren etchean .

text: And when he was cast out , Pharaoh ' s daughter took him up , and nourished him for her own son .
text2: Guero hura abandonnatu içan cenean , era - man ceçan Pharaoren alabác , eta haz ceçan beretaco semetan .

text: And Moses was learned in all the wisdom of the Egyptians , and was mighty in words and in deeds .
text2: Eta instruitu içan cen Moyses Egyptecoen sapientia gucian , eta cen botheretsu erranetan eta eguinetan .

text: And when he was full forty years old , it came into his heart to visit his brethren the children of Israel .
text2: Baina bethe çayonean berroguey vrtheren demborá , igan cequión bihotzera bere anayén Israeleco semén , visitatzera ioan ledin :

text: And seeing one of them suffer wrong , he defended him , and avenged him that was oppressed , and smote the Egyptian :
text2: Eta ikussiric iniuria hartzen çuembat , defenda ceçan eta mendeca bidegabe hartzen çuena , Egyptianoa ioric .

text: For he supposed his brethren would have understood how that God by his hand would deliver them : but they understood not .
text2: Eta vste çuen aditzen çutela haren anayéc ecen Iaincoac haren escuz deliurança eman behar cerauela : baina hec etzeçaten adi .

text: And the next day he shewed himself unto them as they strove , and would have set them at one again , saying , Sirs , ye are brethren ; why do ye wrong one to another ?
text2: Eta biharamunean hec guducatzen ciradela , eriden cedin hayén artean , eta enseya cedin hayén baquetzen , cioela , Guiçonác , anaye çarete çuec : cergatic batac berceari gaizqui eguiten draucaçue ?

text: But he that did his neighbour wrong thrust him away , saying , Who made thee a ruler and a judge over us ?
text2: Baina hurcoari gaizqui eguiten ceraucanac bulka ceçan hura , cioela , Norc ordenatu au gure gaineco prince eta iuge ?

text: Wilt thou kill me , as thou diddest the Egyptian yesterday ?
text2: Ala ni hic nahi nauc hil , atzo Egyptianoa hil auen beçala ?

text: Then fled Moses at this saying , and was a stranger in the land of Madian , where he begat two sons .
text2: Orduan ihes eguin ceçan Moysesec hitz hunegatic , eta arrotz eguin cedin Madiango lurrean , non engendra baitzitzan bi seme .

text: And when forty years were expired , there appeared to him in the wilderness of mount Sina an angel of the Lord in a flame of fire in a bush .
text2: Eta berroguey vrthe complitu cituenean aguer cequión Sinaco mendico desertuan Iaunaren Aingueruä , berro batetaco su - garrean .

text: When Moses saw it , he wondered at the sight : and as he drew near to behold it , the voice of the Lord came unto him ,
text2: Eta Moyses hori ikussiric miraz iar cedin visioneaz : eta consideratzera hurbiltzen cela eguin cedin harengana Iaunaren voza ,

text: Saying , I am the God of thy fathers , the God of Abrham , and the God of Isaac , and the God of Jacob . Then Moses trembled , and durst not behold .
text2: Cioela , Ni nauc hire aitén Iaincoa , Abrahamen Iaincoa . , eta Isaac - en Iaincoa , eta Iacob - en Iaincoa . Eta Moyses ikara çabilala etzén consideratzera venturatzen .

text: Then said the Lord to him , Put off thy shoes from thy feet : for the place where thou standest is holy ground .
text2: Orduan erran cieçon Iaunac , Eraunzquic eure oinetaco çapatác : ecen hi aicen lekua lur saindua duc .

text: I have seen , I have seen the affliction of my people which is in Egypt , and I have heard their groaning , and am come down to deliver them . And now come , I will send thee into Egypt .
text2: Ikussi diat , ikussi diat neure populu Egypten denaren afflictionea , eta hayén suspirioa ençun diat , eta iautsi içan nauc hayén idoquitera , orain bada athor , igorriren aut Egyptera .

text: This Moses whom they refused , saying , Who made thee a ruler and a judge ? the same did God send to be a ruler and a deliverer by the hand of the angel which appeared to him in the bush .
text2: Moyses arnegatu çutén haur , cioitela , Norc hi ordenatu au prince eta iuge ? haur bada Iaincoac prince eta liberaçale igor çeçan , Aingueru berroan aguertu içan çayonaren escuz .

text: He brought them out , after that he had shewed wonders and signs in the land of Egypt , and in the Red sea , and in the wilderness forty years .
text2: Hunec campora idoqui citzan hec , miraculuac eta signoac eguinez Egypten , eta itsasso gorrian , eta desertuan , berroguey vrthez .

text: This is that Moses , which said unto the children of Israel , A prophet shall the Lord your God raise up unto you of your brethren , like unto me ; him shall ye hear .
text2: Moyses haur da erran cerauena Israeleco haourrey , Prophetabat suscitaturen drauçue çuen Iainco Iaunac çuen anayetaric ni beçalacoric : hari beha çaquizquiote .

text: This is he , that was in the church in the wilderness with the angel which spake to him in the mount Sina , and with our fathers : who received the lively oracles to give unto us :
text2: Haur da congregationean desertuan içan cena , Aingueruärequin , cein minçatzen baitzayón Sinaco mendian , eta gure Aitequin içana , ceinec recebitu baititu hitz viciac guri emaiteco .

text: To whom our fathers would not obey , but thrust him from them , and in their hearts turned back again into Egypt ,
text2: Ceini ezpaitzaizca behatu nahi içan gure Aitác , baina refusatu vkan duté , eta itzuli içan dirade bere bihotzez Egypterát :

text: Saying unto Aaron , Make us gods to go before us : for as for this Moses , which brought us out of the land of Egypt , we wot not what is become of him .
text2: Ciotsatela Aaroni , Eguin ietzaguc gure aitzinean dohazquen Iaincoac : ecen Moysesi , ceinec Egypteco lurretic campora eraman baiquaitu , etzeaquiagu cer heldu içan çayón .

text: And they made a calf in those days , and offered sacrifice unto the idol , and rejoiced in the works of their own hands .
text2: . Eta aretzebat eguin ceçaten egun hetan , eta offrenda cieçoten sacrificio idolari : eta delectatzen ciraden bere escuezco obra eguinetan .

text: Then God turned , and gave them up to worship the host of heaven ; as it is written in the book of the prophets , O ye house of Israel , have ye offered to me slain beasts and sacrifices by the space of forty years in the wilderness ?
