text2: Guero Ierusalemera arriuaturic , recebitu içan ciraden Eliçáz eta Apostoluéz eta Ancianoéz , eta conta citzaten Iaincoac heçaz eguin vkan cituen gauça guciac .

text: But there rose up certain of the sect of the Pharisees which believed , saying , That it was needful to circumcise them , and to command them to keep the law of Moses .
text2: Baina ( cioiten ) altchatu içan dirade Phariseuén sectaco sinhetsi çuten batzu , cioitela , ecen circonciditu behar çutela , eta manatu Moysesen Leguearen beguiratzera .

text: And the apostles and elders came together for to consider of this matter .
text2: Orduan bil citecen Apostoluac eta Ancianoac eguiteco hunez consideratzera .

text: And when there had been much disputing , Peter rose up , and said unto them , Men and brethren , ye know how that a good while ago God made choice among us , that the Gentiles by my mouth should hear the word of the gospel , and believe .
text2: Eta disputa handiren ondoan , Pierrisec iaiquiric erran ciecén , Guiçon anayeác , çuec badaquiçue ecen haraitzinadanic Iaincoac gure artean elegitu vkan nauela , ene ahoz ençun leçaten Gentiléc Euangelioco hitza , eta sinhets leçaten .

text: And God , which knoweth the hearts , bare them witness , giving them the Holy Ghost , even as he did unto us ;
text2: Eta Iaincoac eçagutzen baititu bihotzac , testificatu draue , hæy Spiritu saindua emanez guriere beçala .

text: And put no difference between us and them , purifying their hearts by faith .
text2: Eta eztu differentiaric batre eguin gure eta hayén artean , fedez purificaturic hayén bihotzac

text: Now therefore why tempt ye God , to put a yoke upon the neck of the disciples , which neither our fathers nor we were able to bear ?
text2: Orain bada cergatic tentatzen duçue Iaincoa , discipuluén leppo gainean vztarriaren eçartera , cein ez gure aitéc ez guc ecin ekarri vkan baitugu ?

text: But we believe that through the grace of the Lord Jesus Christ we shall be saved , even as they .
text2: Baina Iesus Christ Iaunaren gratiaz sinheften dugu saluaturen garela , hec - ere beçala .

text: Then all the multitude kept silence , and gave audience to Barnabas and Paul , declaring what miracles and wonders God had wrought among the Gentiles by them .
text2: Orduan ichil cedin compainia gucia , eta beha çaizten Barnabasi eta Pauli , ceinéc contatzen baitzuten cer signo eta miraculu eguin çuen Iaincoac heçaz Gentilén artean .

text: And after they had held their peace , James answered , saying , Men and brethren , hearken unto me :
text2: Eta ichildu ciradenean , ihardets ceçan Iacquesec , cioela , Guiçon anayeác , ençun neçaçue ni ,

text: Simeon hath declared how God at the first did visit the Gentiles , to take out of them a people for his name .
text2: Simonec declaratu vkan du nola lehenic Iaincoac visitatu dituen Gentilac hetaric populubat bere iceneco har leçançat .

text: And to this agree the words of the prophets ; as it is written ,
text2: Eta hunequin accordatzen dirade Prophetén hitzac : scribatua den beçala .

text: After this I will return , and will build again the tabernacle of David , which is fallen down ; and I will build again the ruins thereof , and I will set it up :
text2: Guero itzuliren naiz , eta berriz edificaturen dut Dauid - en tabernacle eroria , eta haren ruinác berriz edificaturen ditut , eta berriz altchaturen dut hura .

text: That the residue of men might seek after the Lord , and all the Gentiles , upon whom my name is called , saith the Lord , who doeth all these things .
text2: Requeri deçatençát goitico guiçonéc Iauna , eta Gentil guciéc , ceinén gainean inuocatu içan baita ene icena : dio gauça hauc guciac eguin dituen Iaunac .

text: Known unto God are all his works from the beginning of the world .
text2: Bethidanic Iaincoac badaçaguzqui bere obra guciac .

text: Wherefore my sentence is , that we trouble not them , which from among the Gentiles are turned to God :
text2: Harren nic dut estimatzen eztituela nehorc faschatzeco Gentiletaric Iaincoagana conuertitzen diradenac :

text: But that we write unto them , that they abstain from pollutions of idols , and from fornication , and from things strangled , and from blood .
text2: Baina scribatzeco çayela beguira ditecen idolén satsutassunetaric , eta paillardiçataric , eta gauça ithotic , eta odoletic .

text: For Moses of old time hath in every city them that preach him , being read in the synagogues every sabbath day .
text2: Ecen Moysesec haraitzinadanic baditu hirietaric batbederatan hura predicatzen dutenac , synagoguetan Sabbath guciaz iracurtzen denaz gueroz .

text: Then pleased it the apostles and elders , with the whole church , to send chosen men of their own company to Antioch with Paul and Barnabas ; namely , Judas surnamed Barsabas , and Silas , chief men among the brethren :
text2: Orduan nahi vkan dute Apostoluéc eta Ancianoéc Eliça guciarequin , beren artetic guiçon elegituac igor litecen Antiochera Paulequin eta Barnabasequin , hala nola , Iuda icen goiticoz Barsabas deitzen cena , eta Silas , guiçon principalac anayén artean .

text: And they wrote letters by them after this manner ; The apostles and elders and brethren send greeting unto the brethren which are of the Gentiles in Antioch and Syria and Cilicia :
text2: Hayén escuz scribatzen çutela seguitzen dena , Apostoluéc eta Ancianoéc eta anayéc Antiochen eta Syrian eta Cilician Gentiletaric diraden anayey , salutatione .

text: Forasmuch as we have heard , that certain which went out from us have troubled you with words , subverting your souls , saying , Ye must be circumcised , and keep the law : to whom we gave no such commandment :
text2: Ceren aditu baitugu ecen gutaric ilki diraden batzuc , cembeit proposez trublatu vkan çaituztela , çuen arimác erauciz eta circoncidi çaitezten eta Leguea beguira deçaçuen manatuz , ceiney ezpaiquendrauen carguric eman :

text: It seemed good unto us , being assembled with one accord , to send chosen men unto you with our beloved Barnabas and Paul ,
text2: Gure irudia içan da consentimendu batez bildu garenona , elegitu ditugun guiçonén çuetara igortera , Barnabas eta Paul gure maitequin ,

text: Men that have hazarded their lives for the name of our Lord Jesus Christ .
text2: Baitirade Iesus Christ gure Iaunagatic bere viciac abandonnatu dituztén guiçonac ,

text: We have sent therefore Judas and Silas , who shall also tell you the same things by mouth .
text2: Igorri ditugu bada Iuda eta Silas , hec - ere gauça berac ahoz contaturen drauzquiçue .

text: For it seemed good to the Holy Ghost , and to us , to lay upon you no greater burden than these necessary things ;
text2: Ecen on iruditu çayó Spiritu sainduari eta guri , ez eçartera carga handiagoric batre çuen gainera gauça necessario hauc baicen :

text: That ye abstain from meats offered to idols , and from blood , and from things strangled , and from fornication : from which if ye keep yourselves , ye shall do well . Fare ye well .
text2: Baitirade , Beguira çaitezten idoley sacrificatu diraden gaucetaric , eta odoletic , eta ithotic , eta paillardiçataric , baldin gauça hautaric çuen buruäc beguira baditzaçue , vngui eguinen duçue . Vngui duçuela .

text: So when they were dismissed , they came to Antioch : and when they had gathered the multitude together , they delivered the epistle :
text2: Hec bada congit harturic ethor citecen Antiochera : eta compainiá bilduric eman citzaten letrác .

text: Which when they had read , they rejoiced for the consolation .
text2: Eta iracurri cituztenean consolationearen gainean aleguera citecen .

text: And Judas and Silas , being prophets also themselves , exhorted the brethren with many words , and confirmed them .
text2: Halaber Iudac eta Silasec , nola hec - ere Propheta baitziraden , anhitz hitzez exhorta citzaten anayeac eta confirma .

text: And after they had tarried there a space , they were let go in peace from the brethren unto the apostles .
text2: Eta han cerbait dembora eguin çutenean , igorri ican ciraden anayéz baquerequin Apostoluetarát ,

text: Notwithstanding it pleased Silas to abide there still .
text2: Guciagatic - ere Silasi on irudi cequion han egoitera .

text: Paul also and Barnabas continued in Antioch , teaching and preaching the word of the Lord , with many others also .
text2: Eta Paul eta Barnabas - ere egon citecen Antiochen , iracasten eta euangelizatzen çutela anhitz bercerequin - ere , Iaunaren hitza .

text: And some days after Paul said unto Barnabas , Let us go again and visit our brethren in every city where we have preached the word of the Lord , and see how they do .
text2: Eta cembeit egunen buruän erran cieçón Paulec Barnabasi , Itzuliric visita ditzagun gure anayeac Iaunaren hitza denuntiatu dugun hiri gucietan , eya nola dauden .

text: And Barnabas determined to take with them John , whose surname was Mark .
text2: Eta Barnabasec conseillatzen çuen berequin har leçaten Ioannes , Marc deitzen cena :

text: But Paul thought not good to take him with them , who departed from them from Pamphylia , and went not with them to the work .
text2: Baina Pauli etzayón bidezco iruditzen hetaric ia Pamphiliatic bereci cena , eta obra hartara lagundu etzituena berequin har leçaten

text: And the contention was so sharp between them , that they departed asunder one from the other : and so Barnabas took Mark , and sailed unto Cyprus ;
text2: Hala iharduqui ceçaten bada , non bata berceaganic separa baitzitecen : eta Barnabas Marc harturic embarca baitzedin Cyprerat .

text: And Paul chose Silas , and departed , being recommended by the brethren unto the grace of God .
text2: Baina Paul Silas elegituric parti cedin , anayéz Iaincoaren gratiari gommendaturic .

text: And he went through Syria and Cilicia , confirming the churches .
text2: Eta iragan citzan Syria eta Cilicia , confirmatzen cituela Eliçác .

text: Then came he to Derbe and Lystra : and , behold , a certain disciple was there , named Timotheus , the son of a certain woman , which was a Jewess , and believed ; but his father was a Greek :
text2: Guero arriua cedin Derbera eta Lystrara : eta huná , discipulubat cén han Timotheo deitzen cenic , emazte fidel baten seme , baina , aita Grec - baten .

text: Which was well reported of by the brethren that were at Lystra and Iconium .
text2: Huni testimoniage on ekarten ceraucaten Lystran eta Iconion ciraden anayéc .

text: Him would Paul have to go forth with him ; and took and circumcised him because of the Jews which were in those quarters : for they knew all that his father was a Greek .
text2: Haur nahi vkan du Paulec harequin ioan ledin , eta harturic circoncidi ceçan hura leku hetan ciraden Iuduacgatic : ecen baçaquiten guciéc haren aita nola Grec cen .

text: And as they went through the cities , they delivered them the decrees for to keep , that were ordained of the apostles and elders which were at Jerusalem .
text2: Eta hirietan iragaiten ciradela iracasten cituzten hetangoac Ierusalemen ciraden Apostoluéz eta Ancianoéz eguin içan ciraden ordenancén beguiratzen .

text: And so were the churches established in the faith , and increased in number daily .
text2: Bada Eliçác fedean confirmatzen ciraden , eta contua egun guciaz emendatzen cen .

text: Now when they had gone throughout Phrygia and the region of Galatia , and were forbidden of the Holy Ghost to preach the word in Asia ,
text2: Guero iraganic Phrygia eta Galatiaco comarcá , debetatu içan ciraden Spiritu sainduaz hitzaren Asian predicatzetic :

text: After they were come to Mysia , they assayed to go into Bithynia : but the Spirit suffered them not .
text2: Ethorri ciradenean Mysiara , enseyatzen ciraden Bithiniara ioaiten : baina etziecén permetti Spirituac .

text: And they passing by Mysia came down to Troas .
text2: Baina Mysia iraganic iauts citecen Troasera .

text: And a vision appeared to Paul in the night ; There stood a man of Macedonia , and prayed him , saying , Come over into Macedonia , and help us .
text2: Eta visionebat gauaz aguer cequión Pauli , baitzen hunela , Macedoniaco guiçon - bat presenta cedin haren aitzinean othoitz eguiten ceraucala eta erraiten , Iragan adi Macedoniarat eta aiuta gaitzac .

text: And after he had seen the vision , immediately we endeavored to go into Macedonia , assuredly gathering that the Lord had called us for to preach the gospel unto them .
text2: Eta visionea ikussi vkan çuenean , bertan enseya guentecen Macedoniara ioaiten , seguratzen guenela ecen Iaunac deithu guentuela hæy euangelizatzera .

text: Therefore loosing from Troas , we came with a straight course to Samothracia , and the next day to Neapolis ;
text2: Partituric bada Troastic , chuchen ethor guentecen Samothracera , eta biharamunean Neapolisera .

text: And from thence to Philippi , which is the chief city of that part of Macedonia , and a colony : and we were in that city abiding certain days .
text2: Eta handic Philipposera , cein baita Macedonia quoartereco lehen hiria , eta da colonia . Eta egon guentecen hiri hartan cembatrebeit egun

text: And on the sabbath we went out of the city by a river side , where prayer was wont to be made ; and we sat down , and spake unto the women which resorted thither .
text2: Eta Sabbath egunean ilki guentecen hiritic campora fluuio bazterrera , non içaten ohi baitzén othoitzá : eta iarriric minça guenquinztén hara bildu içan ciraden emaztey .

text: And a certain woman named Lydia , a seller of purple , of the city of Thyatira , which worshipped God , heard us : whose heart the Lord opened , that she attended unto the things which were spoken of Paul .
text2: Eta Lydia deitzen cen Thiatira hirico emazte escarlata saltzale Iaincoa cerbitzatzen çuen batec ençun guençan : ceinen bihotza Iaunac irequi baitzeçan , Paulez erraiten ciraden gaucén gogoatzeco :

text: And when she was baptized , and her household , she besought us , saying , If ye have judged me to be faithful to the Lord , come into my house , and abide there . And she constrained us .
text2: Eta batheyatu içan cenean bera eta haren familia , othoitz ceguigun , cioela , Baldin estimatu baduçue Iaunagana fidel naicela , sarthuric ene etchean , çaudete . Eta bortcha guençan .

text: And it came to pass , as we went to prayer , a certain damsel possessed with a spirit of divination met us , which brought her masters much gain by soothsaying :
text2: Eta guertha cedin gu othoitzara guendoacela , nescato Pythonen spiritua çuembat aitzinera ethor baitzequigun : ceinec irabaci handia emaiten baitzerauen bere nabussiey , asmatzez .

text: The same followed Paul and us , and cried , saying , These men are the servants of the most high God , which shew unto us the way of salvation .
text2: Haur Pauli eta guri iarreiquiric , oihuz cegoen , cioela , Guiçon hauc Iainco subiranoaren cerbitzari dirade , ceinéc saluamenduco bidea denuntiatzen baitraucute .

text: And this did she many days . But Paul , being grieved , turned and said to the spirit , I command thee in the name of Jesus Christ to come out of her . And he came out the same hour .
text2: Eta haur eguin ceçan anhitz egunez : baina gaitzituric Paulec , eta itzuliric erran cieçón spirituari , Manatzen aut Iesus Christen icenaren partez horrenganic ilki adin . Eta ilki cedin ordu berean .

text: And when her masters saw that the hope of their gains was gone , they caught Paul and Silas , and drew them into the marketplace unto the rulers ,
text2: Orduan haren nabussiéc çacussatenean ecen hayén irabaci sperancá galdu cela , hatzamanic Paul eta Silas , eraman citzaten merkatuco plaçara Magistratuetara .

text: And brought them to the magistrates , saying , These men , being Jews , do exceedingly trouble our city ,
text2: Eta hec presentaturic Gobernadorey , erran ceçaten , Gende hauc trublatzen duté gure hiria Iudu diradelaric :

text: And teach customs , which are not lawful for us to receive , neither to observe , being Romans .
text2: Eta denuntiatzen dituzté recebi ez beguira ditzagun sori eztiraden ordenançác , ikussiric ecen Romano garela .

text: And the multitude rose up together against them : and the magistrates rent off their clothes , and commanded to beat them .
text2: Eta oldar cedin communa hayén contra : eta Gobernadoréc hayén arropác çathituric mana ceçaten , açota litecen .

text: And when they had laid many stripes upon them , they cast them into prison , charging the jailor to keep them safely :
text2: Eta anhitz çauri eguin cerauecenean eçar citzaten presoindeguian , manamendu eguinic geolerari , segurqui hec beguira litzan :

text: Who , having received such a charge , thrust them into the inner prison , and made their feet fast in the stocks .
text2: Ceinec halaco manamendua harturic eçar baitzitzan presoindegui çolán , eta hayén oinác hers citzan cepoaz .

text: And at midnight Paul and Silas prayed , and sang praises unto God : and the prisoners heard them .
text2: Eta gauaren erdian Paulec eta Silasec othoizten eta laudatzen çuten Iaincoa : eta ençuten cituzten estecaturic ceudenéc .

text: And suddenly there was a great earthquake , so that the foundations of the prison were shaken : and immediately all the doors were opened , and every one ' s bands were loosed .
text2: Eta subitoqui lur ikaratze handibat eguin cedin , hala non iharros baitzitecen presoindegui fundamentac : eta bertan irequi citecen bortha guciac , eta gucién estecailluac lacha citecen .

text: And the keeper of the prison awaking out of his sleep , and seeing the prison doors open , he drew out his sword , and would have killed himself , supposing that the prisoners had been fled .
text2: Orduan iratzarturic geolerac çacusquianean presoindegui borthác irequiac , ezpatá idoquiric bere buruä hil nahi çuen , vstez presoneréc ihes eguin çutén :

text: But Paul cried with a loud voice , saying , Do thyself no harm : for we are all here .
text2: Baina Paulec oihu eguin ceçan ocengui , cioela , Eztaguioala deus minic eure buruäri : ecen guciac hemen gaituc .

text: Then he called for a light , and sprang in , and came trembling , and fell down before Paul and Silas ,
text2: Orduan hura argui galdeguinic oldar cedin barnera , eta ikara çabilala egotz ceçan bere buruä Paulen eta Silasen oinetara .

text: And brought them out , and said , Sirs , what must I do to be saved ?
text2: Eta hec campora idoquiric dio , Iaunác , cer eguin behar dut saluatu içateco ?

text: And they said , Believe on the Lord Jesus Christ , and thou shalt be saved , and thy house .
text2: Eta hec erran cieçoten , Sinhets eçac Iesus Christ Iauna baithan eta saluaturen aiz hi eta hire etchea .

text: And they spake unto him the word of the Lord , and to all that were in his house .
text2: Eta minça cequizquión Iaincoaren hitzaz hari , eta haren etchean ciraden guciey .

text: And he took them the same hour of the night , and washed their stripes ; and was baptized , he and all his , straightway .
text2: Eta harc hec harturic gauaren ordu hartan berean ikuz cietzén çauriac : eta batheya cedin hura eta harenac guciac bertan .

text: And when he had brought them into his house , he set meat before them , and rejoiced , believing in God with all his house .
text2: Eta bere etchera eramanic , mahaina eçar ciecén : eta aleguera cedin , ceren bere etche guciarequin sinhetsi vkan baitzuen Iaincoa baithan .

text: And when it was day , the magistrates sent the serjeants , saying , Let those men go .
text2: Eta eguna ethorri içan cenean Gobernadoréc igor citzaten sargeantac , erran leçaten , Eyec congit guiçon horiey .

text: And the keeper of the prison told this saying to Paul , The magistrates have sent to let you go : now therefore depart , and go in peace .
text2: Orduan geolerac conta cietzon hitz hauc Pauli , cioela , Igorri dié Gobernadoréc erraitera , congit eman daquiçuen : orain beraz ilkiric çoazte baquerequin .

text: But Paul said unto them , They have beaten us openly uncondemned , being Romans , and have cast us into prison ; and now do they thrust us out privily ? nay verily ; but let them come themselves and fetch us out .
text2: Baina Paulec erran ciecén , Publicoqui açotatu gaituzten ondoan , iugemendu formaric gabe , Romano garelaric , egotzi vkan gaituzte presoindeguira : eta orain ichilic campora egoizten gaituzte ? ez balimba : baina beréc ethorriric idoqui gaitzate .

text: And the serjeants told these words unto the magistrates : and they feared , when they heard that they were Romans .
text2: Eta repporta cietzén sergeantéc Gobernadorey hitz hauc : eta beldur citecen , ençunic ecen Romano ciradela .

text: And they came and besought them , and brought them out , and desired them to depart out of the city .
text2: Eta ethorriric othoitz citzaten , eta idoquiric supplica cequiztén ilki litecen hiritic .

text: And they went out of the prison , and entered into the house of Lydia and when they had seen the brethren , they comforted them , and departed .
text2: Orduan ilkiric presoindeguitic sar citecen Lydia baithan : eta ikussiric anayeac , consola citzaten hec , eta parti citecen .

text: Now when they had passed through Amphipolis and Apollonia , they came to Thessalonica , where was a synagogue of the Jews :
text2: Guero iraganic Amphipolian eta Apollonian , ethor citecen Thessalonicara , non baitzen Iuduén synagogabat .

text: And Paul , as his manner was , went in unto them , and three sabbath days reasoned with them out of the scriptures ,
text2: Eta costumatu çuen beçala Paul sar cedin hetara , eta hirur Sabbathoz disputa cedin hequin Scripturetaric .

text: Opening and alleging , that Christ must needs have suffered , and risen again from the dead ; and that this Jesus , whom I preach unto you , is Christ .
text2: Declaratzen eta proposatzen cerauela , ecen behar içan dela Christec suffri leçan eta resuscita ledin hiletaric : eta ecen haur cela Iesus Christ cein dio , nic predicatzen baitrauçuet .

text: And some of them believed , and consorted with Paul and Silas ; and of the devout Greeks a great multitude , and of the chief women not a few .
text2: Eta hetaric batzuc sinhets ceçaten , eta Paulen eta Silasen compainiaco eguin citecen , eta Iaincoa cerbitzatzen çutén Grecoetaric compainia handia , eta emazte ohoraturic ez guti .

text: But the Jews which believed not , moved with envy , took unto them certain lewd fellows of the baser sort , and gathered a company , and set all the city on an uproar , and assaulted the house of Jason , and sought to bring them out to the people .
text2: Baina bekaizteriaz mouituric Iudu rebelléc , eta harturic hara huna çabiltzan guiçon gaichto batzu , eta populua bilduric , trubla ceçaten hiria : eta Iasonen etchea iauquiric , hec populura eraman nahiz çabiltzan .

text: And when they found them not , they drew Jason and certain brethren unto the rulers of the city , crying , These that have turned the world upside down are come hither also ;
text2: Eta eriden etzituztenean , tira citzaten Iason eta anayetaric batzu hirico Gobernadoretara , oihuz ceudela . Hauc mundu gucia erauci vkan duten ondoan , huna - ere ethorri içan dirade :

text: Whom Jason hath received : and these all do contrary to the decrees of Caesar , saying that there is another king , one Jesus .
text2: Eta Iasonec beregana recebitu vkan ditu : eta guciec Cesaren ordenancen contra eguiten dute , dioitela berce Reguebat badela , Iesus .

text: And they troubled the people and the rulers of the city , when they heard these things .
text2: Tharrita ceçaten bada populua eta hirico Gobernadoreac gauça hauc çançuzquitenean .

text: And when they had taken security of Jason , and of the other , they let them go .
text2: Baina fiadoregoa recebituric Iasonganic eta goiticoetaric , vtzi citzaten ioaitera .

text: And the brethren immediately sent away Paul and Silas by night unto Berea : who coming thither went into the synagogue of the Jews .
text2: Eta anayéc bertan gauaz idoqui citzaten campora Paul eta Silas Beroera ioan litecençát : cein hara ethorriric ioan baitzitecen Iuduén synagogara .

text: These were more noble than those in Thessalonica , in that they received the word with all readiness of mind , and searched the scriptures daily , whether those things were so .
text2: Eta hauc ciraden Thessalonicaco noblenetaric , ceinéc hitza recebi baitzeçaten alegrança gucirequin , egun oroz Scripturác bilhatzen cituztela , eya gauça hauc hala liradenez .

text: Therefore many of them believed ; also of honourable women which were Greeks , and of men , not a few .
text2: Eta hetaric anhitzec behinçát sinhets ceçaten , eta emazte Grec honestetaric , eta guiçonetaric ezgutic .

text: But when the Jews of Thessalonica had knowledge that the word of God was preached of Paul at Berea , they came thither also , and stirred up the people .
text2: Baina iaquin ceçatenean Thessalonicaco Iuduéc ecen Beroen - ere Iaincoaren hitza Paulez denuntiatu içan cela , ethor citecen hara - ere , populua tharritatzen çutela .

text: And then immediately the brethren sent away Paul to go as it were to the sea : but Silas and Timotheus abode there still .
text2: Baina bertan Paul igor ceçaten camporát anayéc , ioan ledinçát itsas alderat beçala : baina Silas eta Timotheo egon citecen han .

text: And they that conducted Paul brought him unto Athens : and receiving a commandment unto Silas and Timotheus for to come to him with all speed , they departed .
text2: Eta Paulen salbura heltzeco carguä hartu çutenéc , eraman ceçaten hura Atheneserano : eta hec harenganic manamendu recebituric Silasgana eta Timotheogana , guciz bertan ethor litecen hura Baithara , parti citecen .

text: Now while Paul waited for them at Athens , his spirit was stirred in him , when he saw the city wholly given to idolatry .
text2: Eta Paul Athenesen hayén beguira cegoela keichatzen cen haren spiritua hura baithan , çacussanean hiria idolatriari emana .

text: Therefore disputed he in the synagogue with the Jews , and with the devout persons , and in the market daily with them that met with him .
text2: Disputatzen cen bada synagogán Iuduequin , eta Iaincoa cerbitzatzen çutenequin , eta merkatuco plaçán egun oroz batzen cenequin

text: Then certain philosophers of the Epicureans , and of the Stoicks , encountered him . And some said , What will this babbler say ? other some , He seemeth to be a setter forth of strange gods : because he preached unto them Jesus , and the resurrection .
text2: Orduan Epicuriano eta Stoiciano philosopho batzu disputatzen ciraden harequin : eta batzuc erraiten çutén , Cer erran nahi du edasle hunec ? Eta bercéc cioiten , Iainco arrotzén eracusle dela dirudi : ceren Iesus denuntiatzen baitzerauen eta resurrectionea .

text: And they took him , and brought him unto Areopagus , saying , May we know what this new doctrine , whereof thou speakest , is ?
text2: Eta hatzamanic hura eraman ceçaten Marsen karricara , cioitela , Iaquin ahal deçaquegu ceric den hiçaz erraiten den doctrina berri hori ?

text: For thou bringest certain strange things to our ears : we would know therefore what these things mean .
text2: Ecen gauça arrotz batzu gure beharrietara ekarten dituc : nahi diagu bada iaquin gauça horiac cer erran nahi diraden .

text: ( For all the Athenians and strangers which were there spent their time in nothing else , but either to tell , or to hear some new thing . )
text2: ( Ecen Atheniano guciac eta han egoiten ciraden arrotzac eçeinere berce gauçatara etziraden applicatzen , cembeit berriren erraitera edo ençutera baicen )

text: Then Paul stood in the midst of Mars ' hill , and said , Ye men of Athens , I perceive that in all things ye are too superstitious .
text2: Orduan Paulec Marsen karricaren erdian cegoela , erran ceçan , Athenesco guiçonác , gauça gucietan deuotegui beçala ikusten çaituztet çuec .

text: For as I passed by , and beheld your devotions , I found an altar with this inscription , TO THE UNKNOWN GOD . Whom therefore ye ignorantly worship , him declare I unto you .
text2: Ecen iragaiten naicela eta çuen deuotioneac contemplatzen ditudala eriden - ere badut aldarebat , ceinetan scribatua baitzén , Iaincoa eçagun gabeari . Bada eçagutu gaberic ohoratzen duçuen hura nic denuntiatzen drauçuet :

text: God that made the world and all things therein , seeing that he is Lord of heaven and earth , dwelleth not in temples made with hands ;
text2: Mundua eta hartan diraden gauça guciac eguin dituen Iaincoa , ceruären eta lurraren Iaun delaric , ezta escuz eguin templetan habitatzen .

text: Neither is worshipped with men ' s hands , as though he needed any thing , seeing he giveth to all life , and breath , and all things ;
text2: Eta ezta guiçonén escuz cerbitzatzen deusen behar beçala , ikussiric ecen berac emaiten drauztela guciey vicia eta respirationea eta gauça guciac .

text: And hath made of one blood all nations of men for to dwell on all the face of the earth , and hath determined the times before appointed , and the bounds of their habitation ;
text2: Eta eguin vkan du natura humano gucia odol batetaric : lurraren hedamen gauciaren gainean habita litecençat , lehenetic sasoin ordenatuac determinaturic , eta hayén habitationearen mugarriac eçarriric :

text: That they should seek the Lord , if haply they might feel after him , and find him , though he be not far from every one of us :
text2: Iauna bilha leçatençát , aguian haztatuz hura eriden leçaquetenez gure batbederaganic vrrun ezpadere .

text: For in him we live , and move , and have our being ; as certain also of your own poets have said , For we are also his offspring .
text2: Ecen harçaz vicitzen eta higuitzen eta içaten gara : çuen poetetaric - ere batzuc erran dutén beçala , Ecen haren leinu - ere bagara .

text: Forasmuch then as we are the offspring of God , we ought not to think that the Godhead is like unto gold , or silver , or stone , graven by art and man ' s device .
text2: Beraz Iaincoaren leinu garenaz gueroz , eztugu estimatu behar Diuinitateac vrrhea edo cilharra edo harria guiçonen artez edo inuentionez moldatua irudi duela .

text: And the times of this ignorance God winked at ; but now commandeth all men every where to repent :
text2: Iaincoac bada ignorantiazco demborác dissimulaturic , orain denuntiatzen draue guiçon guciey leku gucietan emenda ditecen .

text: Because he hath appointed a day , in the which he will judge the world in righteousness by that man whom he hath ordained ; whereof he hath given assurance unto all men , in that he hath raised him from the dead .
text2: Ceren ordenatu baitu mundua iustoqui iugeaturen duen eguna determinatu duen guiçonaz , guciey eçagutzera emanic , hura hiletaric resuscitaturic .

text: And when they heard of the resurrection of the dead , some mocked : and others said , We will hear thee again of this matter .
text2: Eta ençun çutenean hilén resurrectionea , batzu truffatzen ciraden , eta bercéc erraiten çutén , Ençunen augu berriz horren gainean .

text: So Paul departed from among them .
text2: Eta hunela Paul ilki cedin hayén artetic .

text: Howbeit certain men clave unto him , and believed : among the which was Dionysius the Areopagite , and a woman named Damaris , and others with them .
text2: Batzuc halere , hari iunctaturic , sinhets ceçaten : ceinetaric baitzén Dionysio Areopagita - ere , eta Damaris deitzen cen emaztebat , eta berceric hequin .

text: After these things Paul departed from Athens , and came to Corinth ;
text2: Gauça hauen ondoan Paul partituric Athenestic , ethor cedin Corinthera .

text: And found a certain Jew named Aquila , born in Pontus , lately come from Italy , with his wife Priscilla ; ( because that Claudius had commanded all Jews to depart from Rome : ) and came unto them .
text2: Eta eridenic Aquila deitzen cen Ponte nationeco Iudubat , cein aitzinchetic ethorri baitzén Italiatic , eta Priscilla haren emaztea ( ceren Claudec ordenatu baitzuen Iudu guciac Romaric parti litecen ) retira cedin hetara .

text: And because he was of the same craft , he abode with them , and wrought : for by their occupation they were tentmakers .
text2: Eta ceren officio bereco baitzén , hequin egoiten cen , eta languiten ari cen . Eta hayen officioa cen tabernacle eguitea .

text: And he reasoned in the synagogue every sabbath , and persuaded the Jews and the Greeks .
text2: Eta disputatzen cen synagogán Sabbath guciaz , eta exhortatzen cituen hambat Iuduac nola Grecoac .

text: And when Silas and Timotheus were come from Macedonia , Paul was pressed in the spirit , and testified to the Jews that Jesus was Christ .
text2: Eta ethorri ciradenean Macedoniaric Silas eta Timotheo , Paulec Spirituaz hersturic testificatzen cerauen Iuduey Iesus cela Christ .

text: And when they opposed themselves , and blasphemed , he shook his raiment , and said unto them , Your blood be upon your own heads ; I am clean : from henceforth I will go unto the Gentiles .
text2: Eta hec contrastatzen eta blasphematzen ari ciradela , abillamenduac iharrossiric erran ciecén , Çuen odola çuen burun gain : chahu naiz ni , oraindanic Gentiletarat ioanen naiz .

text: And he departed thence , and entered into a certain man ' s house , named Justus , one that worshipped God , whose house joined hard to the synagogue .
text2: Eta handic partituric sar cedin Iustoa deitzen cen eta Iaincoa cerbitzatzen çuen baten etchean , ceinen etchea baitzatchecan synagogari .

text: And Crispus , the chief ruler of the synagogue , believed on the Lord with all his house ; and many of the Corinthians hearing believed , and were baptized .
text2: Eta Crispec synagogaco principalac sinhets ceçan Iauna baithan bere etche guciarequin : Corinthianoetaric - ere anhitzec ençunic sinhets ceçaten , eta batheya citecen .

text: Then spake the Lord to Paul in the night by a vision , Be not afraid , but speak , and hold not thy peace :
text2: Orduan erran cieçon Iaunac gauaz visionez Pauli Ezaicela beldur , baina minçadi eta ezadila ichil .

text: For I am with thee , and no man shall set on thee to hurt thee : for I have much people in this city .
text2: Ecen ni nauc hirequin , eta nehorc eztrauc escuric eçarriren hiri gaizqui eguitera : ecen populu handia diat hiri hunetan .

text: And he continued there a year and six months , teaching the word of God among them .
text2: Eta egon cedin han vrthebat eta sey hilebethe , iracasten çuela hayén artean Iaincoaren hitza .

text: And when Gallio was the deputy of Achaia , the Jews made insurrection with one accord against Paul , and brought him to the judgment seat ,
text2: Baina Gallion Achaiaco Proconsul cenean , altcha citecen gogo batez Iuduac Paulen contra , eta eraman ceçaten iudicioco iar lekura .

text: Saying , This fellow persuadeth men to worship God contrary to the law .
text2: Erraiten çutela , Leguearen contra hunec incitatzén ditu guiçonac Iaincoaren cerbitzatzera .

text: And when Paul was now about to open his mouth , Gallio said unto the Jews , If it were a matter of wrong or wicked lewdness , O ye Jews , reason would that I should bear with you :
text2: Eta Paulec ahoa irequi nahi çuen beçala , erran ciecén Gallionec Iuduey , Baldin cembeit bidegabe , edo gaichtaqueria baliz , o Iuduac , çucenac emaiten duen lekurano sustenga cinçaqueiztet :

text: But if it be a question of words and names , and of your law , look ye to it ; for I will be no judge of such matters .
text2: Baina baldin questione bada hitzaz eta icenéz eta çuen Legueaz ceuroc ikussiren duçue ecen gauça horién iuge ni ez naiz nahi .

text: And he drave them from the judgment seat .
text2: Eta ken citzan hec iudicioco iar lekutic .

text: Then all the Greeks took Sosthenes , the chief ruler of the synagogue , and beat him before the judgment seat . And Gallio cared for none of those things .
text2: Orduan Grec guciéc hatzamanic Sosthenes synagogaco principala cehatzen cutén iudicioco iar leku aitzinean : eta Gallionec ansiaric batre etzuen .

text: And Paul after this tarried there yet a good while , and then took his leave of the brethren , and sailed thence into Syria , and with him Priscilla and Aquila ; having shorn his head in Cenchrea : for he had a vow .
text2: Baina Paul oraino dembora lucescoz han egonic , anayetaric congit harturic , embarca cedin Syriarát ( eta harequin Priscilla eta Aquila ) buruä arradaturic Cenchren : ecen vot çuen .

text: And he came to Ephesus , and left them there : but he himself entered into the synagogue , and reasoned with the Jews .
text2: Guero arriua cedin Ephesera , eta hec han vtzi citzan : baina bera synagogara sarthuric , disputa cedin Iuduequin .

text: When they desired him to tarry longer time with them , he consented not ;
text2: Eta hec othoiztez çaizcala dembora luciagoz hequin egon ledin , etziecén accorda .

text: But bade them farewell , saying , I must by all means keep this feast that cometh in Jerusalem : but I will return again unto you , if God will . And he sailed from Ephesus .
text2: Baina congit har ceçan hetaric , cioela , Necessarioqui behar dut hurrenengo bestá Ierusalemen eguin : baina harçara itzuliren naiz çuetara , Iaincoac placer badu : eta parti cedin Ephesetic .

text: And when he had landed at Caesarea , and gone up , and saluted the church , he went down to Antioch .
text2: Eta Cesareara iautsi cenean , igan cedin Ierusalemera : eta Eliçá salutaturic iauts cedin Antiochera .

text: And after he had spent some time there , he departed , and went over all the country of Galatia and Phrygia in order , strengthening all the disciples .
text2: Eta cerbait dembora han egonic , ioan cedin chuchen chuchena Galatiaco eta Phrygiaco comarcá trebessaturic , confirmatzen cituela discipulu guciac .

text: And a certain Jew named Apollos , born at Alexandria , an eloquent man , and mighty in the scriptures , came to Ephesus .
text2: Baina Iudu nationez Alexandriano Apollos deitzen cen - bat , guiçon eloquenta , Scripturetan botheretsua , ethor cedin Ephesera .

text: This man was instructed in the way of the Lord ; and being fervent in the spirit , he spake and taught diligently the things of the Lord , knowing only the baptism of John .
text2: Haur cen Iaunaren bidean instruitzen hassia , eta spiritu beroz minçatzen cen , eta iracasten cituen diligentqui Iaunaren diraden gauçác , eçagutzen çuela solament Ioannesen Baptismoa

text: And he began to speak boldly in the synagogue : whom when Aquila and Priscilla had heard , they took him unto them , and expounded unto him the way of God more perfectly .
text2: Eta has cedin frangoqui minçatzen synagogán . Haur ençun ceçatenean Priscillac eta Aquilac berequin har ceçaten , eta aitzinago declara cieçoten Iaincoaren bidea .

text: And when he was disposed to pass into Achaia , the brethren wrote , exhorting the disciples to receive him : who , when he was come , helped them much which had believed through grace :
text2: Eta Achaiarát iragan nahi cenean , hura exhortaturic anayéc scriba ceçaten discipuluetara recebi leçaten hura : ceinec arriuatu cenean hara , probetchu handi eguin baitziecén gratiaz sinhetsi vkan çuteney .

text: For he mightily convinced the Jews , and that publickly , shewing by the scriptures that Jesus was Christ .
text2: Ecen viciqui garaitzen çayen Iuduey publicoqui , Scripturéz eracusten çuela ecen Iesus cela Christ .

text: And it came to pass , that , while Apollos was at Corinth , Paul having passed through the upper coasts came to Ephesus : and finding certain disciples ,
text2: Apollos Corinthen cela guertha cedin , Paul garaico bazter guciac iraganic ethor baitzedin Ephesera : eta han discipulu batzu eridenic erran ciecén ,

text: He said unto them , Have ye received the Holy Ghost since ye believed ? And they said unto him , We have not so much as heard whether there be any Holy Ghost .
text2: Ala recebitu duçue Spiritu saindua sinhetsi vkan duçuenean ? Eta hec erran cieçoten , Are Spiritu saindua denez - ere , eztiagu ençun .

text: And he said unto them , Unto what then were ye baptized ? And they said , Unto John ' s baptism .
text2: Orduan dioste , Certan bada batheyatu içan çarete ? Eta hec erran ceçaten , Ioannesen Baptismoan .

text: Then said Paul , John verily baptized with the baptism of repentance , saying unto the people , that they should believe on him which should come after him , that is , on Christ Jesus .
text2: Orduan Paulec erran ceçan , Ioannesec batheyatu vkan du emendamenduco Baptismoaz , ciotsala populuari , haren ondotic ethorteco cena baithan sinhets leçaten , erran nahi baita , Iesus Christ baithan .

text: When they heard this , they were baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus .
text2: Gauça hauc ençunic bada , batheya citecen Iesus Iaunaren icenean .

text: And when Paul had laid his hands upon them , the Holy Ghost came on them ; and they spake with tongues , and prophesied .
text2: Eta escuac gainean eçarri cerauztenean Paulec , ethor cedin Spiritu saindua hayén gainera , eta minçatzen ciraden lengoagez , eta prophetizatzen çutén .

text: And all the men were about twelve .
text2: Eta guiçon hauc gucioc ciraden hamabitarano .

text: And he went into the synagogue , and spake boldly for the space of three months , disputing and persuading the things concerning the kingdom of God .
text2: Guero bera sarthuric synagogán , Frangoqui minçatzen cen , hirur hilebethez disputatzen eta exhortatzen ari cela Iaunaren resumari dagozcan gaucéz .

text: But when divers were hardened , and believed not , but spake evil of that way before the multitude , he departed from them , and separated the disciples , disputing daily in the school of one Tyrannus .
text2: Eta nola batzu gogortzen baitziraden eta ezpaitzuten obeditu nahi , gaizqui Iaunaren bideaz minçatzen ciradela populuaren aitzinean , hetaric bera partituric , separa citzan discipuluac , egun oroz disputatzen ari cela Tyranno baten escholán .

text: And this continued by the space of two years ; so that all they which dwelt in Asia heard the word of the Lord Jesus , both Jews and Greeks .
text2: Eta haur eguin içan cen bi vrthez : hala non Asian habitatzen ciraden guciéc , ençuten baitzutén Iesus Iaunaren hitza , hambat Iuduéc nola Grecoéc .

text: And God wrought special miracles by the hands of Paul :
text2: Eta costumatu etziraden verthuteac eguiten cituen Iaincoac Paulen escuz :

text: So that from his body were brought unto the sick handkerchiefs or aprons , and the diseases departed from them , and the evil spirits went out of them .
text2: Hala non are erién gainera ekarten baitzituzten haren gorputz gainetic crobitchetac eta conciertoac , eta ioaiten baitziraden hetaric eritassunac , eta spiritu gaichtoac hetaric ilkiten baitziraden .

text: Then certain of the vagabond Jews , exorcists , took upon them to call over them which had evil spirits the name of the Lord Jesus , saying , We adjure you by Jesus whom Paul preacheth .
text2: Orduan enseya citecen hara huna ebilten ciraden Iudu exorcista batzu spiritu gaichtoac cituztenén gainean Iesus Iaunaren icenaren inuocatzen , erraiten çutela , Coniuratzen çaituztegu Paulec predicatzen duen Iesusen partez .

text: And there were seven sons of one Sceva , a Jew , and chief of the priests , which did so .
text2: ( Eta ciraden Sceua Iudu Sacrificadore principalarenic çazpi seme , haur eguiten çutenac )

text: And the evil spirit answered and said , Jesus I know , and Paul I know ; but who are ye ?
text2: Baina ihardesten çuela spiritu gaichtoac , erran ceçan , Iesus eçagutzen diat , eta Paul baceaquiat nor den : baina çuec nor çarete ?

text: And the man in whom the evil spirit was leaped on them , and overcame them , and prevailed against them , so that they fled out of that house naked and wounded .
text2: Eta oldarturic hetara spiritu gaichtoa çuen guiçonac , eta hæy garaithuric , bortcha eguin ceçan hayén contra : hala non biluzgorriric eta çaurthuric ihes eguin baitzeçaten etche hartaric .

text: And this was known to all the Jews and Greeks also dwelling at Ephesus ; and fear fell on them all , and the name of the Lord Jesus was magnified .
text2: Eta haur ethor cedin gucién eçagutzera hambat Iuduen nola Greco Ephesen habitatzen ciradenénera : eta eror cedin beldurra hayen gucien gainera , eta magnificatzen cen Iesus Iaunaren icena .

text: And many that believed came , and confessed , and shewed their deeds .
text2: Eta sinhetsi çutenetaric anhitz ethorten ciraden confessatzen eta declaratzen cituztela bere eguinac .

text: Many of them also which used curious arts brought their books together , and burned them before all men : and they counted the price of them , and found it fifty thousand pieces of silver .
text2: Arte curiositatezcoz vsatu vkan çutenec - ere , anhitzec bere liburuäc ekarriric erre citzaten gucién aitzinean : eta hayén valioa estimaturic eriden ceçaten berroguey eta hamar milla dinerorena .

text: So mightily grew the word of God and prevailed .
text2: Hala botheretsuqui augmentatzen cen Iaunaren hitza eta confirmatzen .

text: After these things were ended , Paul purposed in the spirit , when he had passed through Macedonia and Achaia , to go to Jerusalem , saying , After I have been there , I must also see Rome .
text2: Gauça hauc hunela complitu ciradenean delibera ceçan Paulec Spirituaz , Macedonia eta Achaia iraganic Ierusalemera ioaitera , cioela , Han içan ondoan , Roma - ere ikussi behar dut .

text: So he sent into Macedonia two of them that ministered unto him , Timotheus and Erastus ; but he himself stayed in Asia for a season .
text2: Eta igorriric Macedoniara aiutatzen çutenetaric biga baitziraden Timotheo eta Erasto , bera gueldi cedin dembora batetacotz Asian .

text: And the same time there arose no small stir about that way .
text2: Baina eguin cedin dembora hartan truble handibat doctrinaren causaz .

text: For a certain man named Demetrius , a silversmith , which made silver shrines for Diana , brought no small gain unto the craftsmen ;
text2: Ecen Demetrius deitzen cen cilharguile , Dianaren cilharrezco templetchoguile batec , anhitz irabaz eraciten cerauen officiocoey :

text: Whom he called together with the workmen of like occupation , and said , Sirs , ye know that by this craft we have our wealth .
text2: Hec bilduric , eta halaco gaucetaco officier ciradenac , erran ceçan , Guiçonác , badaquiçue ecen officio hunetaric heldu diradela gure onac :

text: Moreover ye see and hear , that not alone at Ephesus , but almost throughout all Asia , this Paul hath persuaded and turned away much people , saying that they be no gods , which are made with hands :
text2: Eta badacussaçue eta badançuçue nola ez Ephesen solament , baina quasi Asia gucian Paul hunec sinhets eraciric itzuli duela populu handi , erraiten duela , ecen eztiradela iainco escuz eguiten diradenac .

text: So that not only this our craft is in danger to be set at nought ; but also that the temple of the great goddess Diana should be despised , and her magnificence should be destroyed , whom all Asia and the world worshippeth .
text2: Eta peril da ez solament gure gauça descrida dadin , baina are Diana handiaren templea guehiagoric deus estima eztadin , eta deseguin eztadin haren maiestate Asia guciac eta munduac ohoratzen dutena .

text: And when they heard these sayings , they were full of wrath , and cried out , saying , Great is Diana of the Ephesians .
text2: Eta gauça hauc ençunic , eta hiraz betheric oihuz iar citecen , Ephesianoen Diana handiá !

text: And the whole city was filled with confusion : and having caught Gaius and Aristarchus , men of Macedonia , Paul ' s companions in travel , they rushed with one accord into the theatre .
text2: Eta bethe cedin hiri gucia confusionez , eta oldar citecen gogo batez theatrera , harturic Gayo eta Aristarche Macedonianoac , Paulen bideco lagunac .

text: And when Paul would have entered in unto the people , the disciples suffered him not .
text2: Eta Paul populua baithara sarthu nahi cenean , etzeçaten vtzi discipuluéc .

text: And certain of the chief of Asia , which were his friends , sent unto him , desiring him that he would not adventure himself into the theatre .
text2: Baina Asiaco principaletaric batzuc - ere , nola baitziraden haren adisquide , harengana igorriric othoitz ceguioten , ez ledin theatrera presenta .

text: Some therefore cried one thing , and some another : for the assembly was confused ; and the more part knew not wherefore they were come together .
text2: Bada batzu bataz oihuz ceuden , eta berceac berceaz : ecen confus cen compainiá , eta anhitzec etzaquiten cergatic bildu içan ciraden .

text: And they drew Alexander out of the multitude , the Jews putting him forward . And Alexander beckoned with the hand , and would have made his defence unto the people .
text2: Orduan gendetzetic campora auança ceçaten Alexandre , Iuduéc hura bulkatzen çutela . Eta Alexandrec , ichil litecen escuaz keinu eguinic , nahi ceraucan causá allegatu populuari .

text: But when they knew that he was a Jew , all with one voice about the space of two hours cried out , Great is Diana of the Ephesians .
text2: Baina eçagutu çutenean ecen hura Iudu cela , altcha cedin gucietaric vozbat , quasi bi orenez oihu eguiten çutela , Ephesianoén Diana handiá !

text: And when the townclerk had appeased the people , he said , Ye men of Ephesus , what man is there that knoweth not how that the city of the Ephesians is a worshipper of the great goddess Diana , and of the image which fell down from Jupiter ?
text2: Orduan scribariac gendetzea appacegaturic , erran ceçan , Epheseco guiçonác , cein da guiçona eztaquiana ecen Epheseco hiria dedicatua dela Diana handiaren , eta Iupiterganic iautsi içan den imaginaren cerbitzura ?

text: Seeing then that these things cannot be spoken against , ye ought to be quiet , and to do nothing rashly .
text2: Nehor bada gauça hautan contrasta ecin daitenaren gainean , appacega çaitezten beharda , eta deus desordenatuqui eztaguiçuen .

text: For ye have brought hither these men , which are neither robbers of churches , nor yet blasphemers of your goddess .
text2: Ecen ekarri vkan dituçue guiçon hauc ezpaitirade ez sacrilege , ez ezpaitute çuen iaincossá diffamatzen .

text: Wherefore if Demetrius , and the craftsmen which are with him , have a matter against any man , the law is open , and there are deputies : let them implead one another .
text2: Beraz baldin Demetriusec eta harequin diraden officieréc eguitecoric baduté cembeiten contra , gorte eduquiten da , eta badirade Proconsulac , elkar accusa beçate .

text: But if ye inquire any thing concerning other matters , it shall be determined in a lawful assembly .
text2: Eta baldin berce gauçaz deus galdeguiten baduçue , congregatione bidezqui bilduan concludi ahal daite .

text: For we are in danger to be called in question for this day ' s uproar , there being no cause whereby we may give an account of this concourse .
text2: Ecen peril da seditionez accusa ezgaitecen , egungo egunagatic , truble huneçaz raçoin eman ahal deçaquegun causaric eztenaz gueroz . Eta gauça hauc erran cituenean biltzarreari congit eman cieçón .

text: And after the uproar was ceased , Paul called unto him the disciples , and embraced them , and departed for to go into Macedonia .
text2: Bada tumultoa appacegatu cenean , Paul discipuluac beregana deithuric eta bessarcaturic , parti cedin Macedoniarát ioaiteco .

text: And when he had gone over those parts , and had given them much exhortation , he came into Greece ,
text2: Eta comarca hetan ebili cenean , eta exhortatu cituenean hitz anhitzez , ethor cedin Greciara .

text: And there abode three months . And when the Jews laid wait for him , as he was about to sail into Syria , he purposed to return through Macedonia .
text2: Eta han hirur hilebethe eguinic , ceren Iuduéc celata eguiten baitzeraucaten Syriarat embarcatu içan baliz : haren abisua içan cen Macedonian gaindi itzultzera .

text: And there accompanied him into Asia Sopater of Berea ; and of the Thessalonians , Aristarchus and Secundus ; and Gaius of Derbe , and Timotheus ; and of Asia , Tychicus and Trophimus .
text2: Eta lagund ceçan hura Sopater Beroenesac Asiarano : eta Thessaloniceanoetaric , Aristarquec eta Secondec , eta Gaio Derbianoac , eta Timotheoc : eta Asianoetaric , Tychiquec eta Trophimec .

text: These going before tarried for us at Troas .
text2: Hauc aitzinerát ioanic iguriqui guençaten Troasen .

text: And we sailed away from Philippi after the days of unleavened bread , and came unto them to Troas in five days ; where we abode seven days .
text2: Eta gu embarca guentecen altchagarri gaberico oguien egunén ondoan Philippestic , eta ethor guentecen hetara Troasera , borz egunen buruan : non egon baiquentecen çazpi egun .

text: And upon the first day of the week , when the disciples came together to break bread , Paul preached unto them , ready to depart on the morrow ; and continued his speech until midnight .
text2: Eta asteco lehen egunean oguiaren haustera discipuluac bilduac içan eta , Paul minço cen hequin ( ceren biharamunean partitzeco baitzén ) eta iraun ceçan haren proposac gauherdi arterano .

text: And there were many lights in the upper chamber , where they were gathered together .
text2: Eta cen anhitz lampa gambera gorán , non bilduac baiquinaden .

text: And there sat in a window a certain young man named Eutychus , being fallen into a deep sleep : and as Paul was long preaching , he sunk down with sleep , and fell down from the third loft , and was taken up dead .
text2: Eta iarriric cegoela guiçon gaztebat Eutyche deitzen cenic leiho gainean , logale handi batec harturic , Paul luçaqui minço cela , loa garaithuric eror cedin hirurgarren soillerutic beherera , eta hila altcha ceçaten .

text: And Paul went down , and fell on him , and embracing him said , Trouble not yourselves ; for his life is in him .
text2: Baina iautsiric Paul behera cedin haren gainera , eta bessarcaturic erran ceçan , Etzaiteztela trubla ecen hunen arimá haur baithan da .

text: When he therefore was come up again , and had broken bread , and eaten , and talked a long while , even till break of day , so he departed .
text2: Guero iganic eta oguia hautsiric eta ianic , eta luçaqui minçaturic arguirano , hala parti cedin .

text: And they brought the young man alive , and were not a little comforted .
text2: Eta guiçon gazteor viciric ekar ceçaten , eta haguitz consola citecen .

text: And we went before to ship , and sailed unto Assos , there intending to take in Paul : for so had he appointed , minding himself to go afoot .
text2: Eta gu vncira ethorriric embarca guentecen Assoserat , handic hartzeco guenduen Paul : ecen hala ordenatu çuen , berac bide hura oinez eguin gogoz .

text: And when he met with us at Assos , we took him in , and came to Mitylene .
text2: Bada Asson gurequin bathu cenean , hura harturic ethor guentecen Mitylenera .

text: And we sailed thence , and came the next day over against Chios ; and the next day we arrived at Samos , and tarried at Trogyllium ; and the next day we came to Miletus .
text2: Eta handic embarcaturic , biharamunean ethor guentecen Chiosen aurkara : eta hurrenengo egunean arriua guentecen Samosera : eta Trogillen egonic , ondoco egunean ethor guentecen Miletera .

text: For Paul had determined to sail by Ephesus , because he would not spend the time in Asia : for he hasted , if it were possible for him , to be at Jerusalem the day of Pentecost .
text2: Ecen deliberatu çuen Paulec Ephesez aitzinago iragaitera , demboraric gal ezleçançát Asian : ecen lehiatzen cen baldin possible balitzayo Mendecoste egunean Ierusalemen içatera .

text: And from Miletus he sent to Ephesus , and called the elders of the church .
text2: Eta Miletetic meçu igorriric Ephesera , dei citzan Eliçaco Ancianoac .

text: And when they were come to him , he said unto them , Ye know , from the first day that I came into Asia , after what manner I have been with you at all seasons ,
text2: Eta harengana ethorri ciradenean erran ciecén , Çuec badaquiçue , Asian sar nendin lehen egunaz gueroztic , nola çuequin dembora gucian içan naicén :

text: Serving the Lord with all humility of mind , and with many tears , and temptations , which befell me by the lying in wait of the Jews :
text2: Iauna cerbitzatzen nuela humilitate gucirequin eta anhitz nigar chortarequin , eta Iuduén celata egoitetaric ethorri içan çaizquidan tentationéquin :

text: And how I kept back nothing that was profitable unto you , but have shewed you , and have taught you publickly , and from house to house ,
text2: Nola çuen probetchutaco gaucetaric eztrauçuedan deus estali , çuey declaratu eta iracatsi gabe publicoqui eta etchez etche :

text: Testifying both to the Jews , and also to the Greeks , repentance toward God , and faith toward our Lord Jesus Christ .
text2: Testificatzen nerauela hambat Iuduey nola Grecoey Iaincoa baitharatco emendamendua , eta Iesus gure Iauna baitharatco fedea .

text: And now , behold , I go bound in the spirit unto Jerusalem , not knowing the things that shall befall me there :
text2: Eta orain huná , ni Spirituaz estecatua , banoa Ierusalemera , hartan heltzeco çaizquidan gauçác eztaquizquidalaric :

text: Save that the Holy Ghost witnesseth in every city , saying that bonds and afflictions abide me .
text2: Salbu Spiritu sainduac hiriz hiri testificatzen baitraut , dioela ecen estecadurác eta tribulationeac ene beguira daudela .

text: But none of these things move me , neither count I my life dear unto myself , so that I might finish my course with joy , and the ministry , which I have received of the Lord Jesus , to testify the gospel of the grace of God .
text2: Baina eztut deusen ansiaric , eta neure vicia etzait precioso , acaba deçadançát neure cursua bozcariorequin , Iesus Iaunaganic recebitu dudan carguä , Iaincoaren gratiaren Euangelioa testifica dadinçát .

text: And now , behold , I know that ye all , among whom I have gone preaching the kingdom of God , shall see my face no more .
text2: Eta orain huná , nic badaquit ecen guehiagoric eztuçuela ikussiren ene beguithartea çuetaric batec - ere , ceinén artetic iragan bainaiz Iaincoaren resumá predicatzen nuela .

text: Wherefore I take you to record this day , that I am pure from the blood of all men .
text2: Halacotz testificatzen drauçuet egungo egunean , ecen chahu naicela ni gucien odoletic .

text: For I have not shunned to declare unto you all the counsel of God .
text2: Ecen eztut dissimulatu çuey denuntia eznieçaçuen Iaunaren conseillu gucia .

text: Take heed therefore unto yourselves , and to all the flock , over the which the Holy Ghost hath made you overseers , to feed the church of God , which he hath purchased with his own blood .
text2: Gogoa eieçue bada çuen buruèy , eta arthalde guciari , ceinetan Spiritu sainduac eçarri baitzaituzte Ipizpicu , Iaincoaren Eliçaren bazcatzeco , cein conquestatu baitu bere odol propriaz .

text: For I know this , that after my departing shall grievous wolves enter in among you , not sparing the flock .
text2: Ecen nic badaquit haur , sarthuren diradela ene ioan ondoan otso dorpeac çuen artera , guppida eztutelaric arthaldea .

text: Also of your own selves shall men arise , speaking perverse things , to draw away disciples after them .
text2: Eta ceuron artetic iaiquiren dirade guiçonac denuntiatzen dituztela gauça gaichtoac , discipuluac bere ondoan erekar ditzatençát .

text: Therefore watch , and remember , that by the space of three years I ceased not to warn every one night and day with tears .
text2: Halacotz veilleçaçue , orhoit çaretelaric ecen hirur vrthez gau eta egun eznaicela cessatu nigar chortarequin çuetaric batbederaren aduertitzetic .

text: And now , brethren , I commend you to God , and to the word of his grace , which is able to build you up , and to give you an inheritance among all them which are sanctified .
text2: Eta orain - ere , anayeác , gommendatzen cerauzquiotet Iaincoari eta haren gratiaren hitzaric , cein baita botheretsu çuen edificatzen acabatzeco , eta çuey saindu guciequin heretagearen emaiteco .

text: I have coveted no man ' s silver , or gold , or apparel .
text2: Berceren vrrhea ez cilharra ez arropá eztut guthiciatu .

text: Yea , ye yourselves know , that these hands have ministered unto my necessities , and to them that were with me .
text2: Baina ceuroc badaquiçue nola ene , eta enequin ciradenén behar ciraden gauçác fornitu vkan dituztén escu hauèc .

text: I have shewed you all things , how that so labouring ye ought to support the weak , and to remember the words of the Lord Jesus , how he said , It is more blessed to give than to receive .
text2: Gucietan eracutsi drauçuet ecen hunela trabaillatuz behar diradela flacuac supportatu , eta Iesus Iaunaren hitzéz orhoit içan : ecen berac erran du , Gauça dohatsuagoa dela emaitea ecen ez hartzea .

text: And when he had thus spoken , he kneeled down , and prayed with them all .
text2: Eta hitz hauc erran cituenean belhaurico iarriric eguin ceçan othoitze hequin guciequin .

text: And they all wept sore , and fell on Paul ' s neck , and kissed him ,
text2: Orduan nigar handi guciéz eguin cedin : eta Paulen leppora bere buruäc egotziz pot eguiten ceraucaten :

text: Sorrowing most of all for the words which he spake , that they should see his face no more . And they accompanied him unto the ship .
text2: Triste ciradelaric principalqui erran vkan çuen hitzagatic , ecen guehiagoric haren beguithartea ezlutela ikussiren . Eta vncira lagundu çaizcan .

text: And it came to pass , that after we were gotten from them , and had launched , we came with a straight course unto Coos , and the day following unto Rhodes , and from thence unto Patara :
text2: Eta embarcatu guenenean , hetaric separaturic , chuchen - chuchena ethor guentecen Cosera , eta biharamunean Rhodesera , eta handic Patrasera .

text: And finding a ship sailing over unto Phenicia , we went aboard , and set forth .
text2: Eta han eridenic vnci Phenicerát trebessatzen çuen - bat hartara iganic parti guentecen .

text: Now when we had discovered Cyprus , we left it on the left hand , and sailed into Syria , and landed at Tyre : for there the ship was to unlade her burden .
text2: Guero Cypreren aguerrira guenenean , hura vtziric ezquér , Syria alderát vela eguin gueneçan , eta arriua guentecen Tyrera : ecen han vnciac behar çuen cargá descargatu .

text: And finding disciples , we tarried there seven days : who said to Paul through the Spirit , that he should not go up to Jerusalem .
text2: Eta discipuluac eridenic egon guentecen han çazpi egun : hec Pauli erraiten ceraucaten Spirituaz , ezledin igan Ierusalemera .

text: And when we had accomplished those days , we departed and went our way ; and they all brought us on our way , with wives and children , till we were out of the city : and we kneeled down on the shore , and prayed .
text2: Baina egun hec complitu ciradenean parti guentecen , guciéc emaztequin eta haourrequin laguncen guentuztela hiri lekorerano : eta belhaurico iarriric vr bazterrean othoitze eguin gueneçan .

text: And when we had taken our leave one of another , we took ship ; and they returned home again .
text2: Guero elkar bessarcaturic , vncira igan guentecen , eta berceac beretarát itzul citecen .

text: And when we had finished our course from Tyre , we came to Ptolemais , and saluted the brethren , and abode with them one day .
text2: Eta gu biagea acabaturic arriua guentecen Tyretic Ptolemaidara : eta anayeac salutaturic , egon guentecen egun - bat hequin .

text: And the next day we that were of Paul ' s company departed , and came unto Caesarea : and we entered into the house of Philip the evangelist , which was one of the seven ; and abode with him .
text2: Eta biharamunean ilkiric Paul eta harequin guenenac ethor guentecen Cesareara : eta sarthuric Philippe Euangelistaren etchean ( cein baitzén çazpietaric bat ) egon guentecen hura baithan .

text: And the same man had four daughters , virgins , which did prophesy .
text2: Eta hunec cituen laur alaba virgina prophetizatzen çutenic .

text: And as we tarried there many days , there came down from Judaea a certain prophet , named Agabus .
text2: Eta han dembora vnguisco egon guenenean , ethor cedin Iudeatic Agabus deitzen cen Prophetabat .

text: And when he was come unto us , he took Paul ' s girdle , and bound his own hands and feet , and said , Thus saith the Holy Ghost , So shall the Jews at Jerusalem bind the man that owneth this girdle , and shall deliver him into the hands of the Gentiles .
text2: Eta guregana ethorriric eta Paulen guerricoa harturic eta harçaz bere oinac eta escuac estecaturic , erran ceçan , Gauça hauc erraiten ditu Spiritu sainduac , Guerrico hunen iabe den guiçona , hunela estecaturen dute Ierusalemen Iuduéc , eta liuraturen duté Gentilén escuetara .

text: And when we heard these things , both we , and they of that place , besought him not to go up to Jerusalem .
text2: Eta gauça hauc ençun guentuenean , othoitz eguin gueneçón guc eta leku hartan ciradenéc , ezledin igan Ierusalemera .

text: Then Paul answered , What mean ye to weep and to break mine heart ? for I am ready not to be bound only , but also to die at Jerusalem for the name of the Lord Jesus .
text2: Orduan ihardets ceçan Paulec , Cer ari çarete nigarrez çaudetela , eta ene bihotza erdiratzen duçuela ? Ecen ni ez estecatu içatera solament , baina Ierusalemen hiltzera - ere prest naiz Iesus Iaunaren icenagatic .

text: And when he would not be persuaded , we ceased , saying , The will of the Lord be done .
text2: Bada , hari burutan ecin eman gueneçaqueonaren gainean , vtzi gueneçan , erraiten guenduela , Iaunaren vorondatea eguin dadila .

text: And after those days we took up our carriages , and went up to Jerusalem .
text2: Eta cembeit egunen buruän gure hatuac harturic igan guentecen Ierusalemera .

text: There went with us also certain of the disciples of Caesarea , and brought with them one Mnason of Cyprus , an old disciple , with whom we should lodge .
text2: Eta ethor citecen discipuluetaric - ere batzu Cesareatic gurequin çacarqueitela berequin Mnason Cypriano iaquin - bat , discipulu ancianoa , cein baithan ostatuz behar baiquenen .

text: And when we were come to Jerusalem , the brethren received us gladly .
text2: Bada ethorri guenenean Ierusalemera , gogotic recebi guençaten anayéc .

text: And the day following Paul went in with us unto James ; and all the elders were present .
text2: Eta biharamunean sar cedin Paul gurequin Iacques baithara , eta Anciano guciac hara bil citecen .

text: And when he had saluted them , he declared particularly what things God had wrought among the Gentiles by his ministry .
text2: Eta hec bessarcaturic , conta citzan punctuz punctu Iaincoac Gentilén artean haren ministerioz eguin cituen gauçác .

text: And when they heard it , they glorified the Lord , and said unto him , Thou seest , brother , how many thousands of Jews there are which believe ; and they are all zealous of the law :
text2: Eta hec ençun citzatenean , glorifica ceçaten Iauna , eta erran cieçoten , Anayé , badacussac cembat milla diraden Iudu sinhetsi dutenac : eta guciey baitacheté Iaincoaren zeloa .

text: And they are informed of thee , that thou teachest all the Jews which are among the Gentiles to forsake Moses , saying that they ought not to circumcise their children , neither to walk after the customs .
text2: Eta ençun dié erraiten hiçaz , ecen hic Moysesen vtzitera iracasten dituala Gentilen artean diraden Iudu guciac , erraiten duála , ecen eztituztela haourrac circonciditu behar , eta eztutela ordenancén araura ebili behar .

text: What is it therefore ? the multitude must needs come together : for they will hear that thou art come .
text2: Cer eguiteco da bada ? ossoqui populuac bildu behar dic : ecen ençunen dié nola ethorri aicén .

text: Do therefore this that we say to thee : We have four men which have a vow on them ;
text2: Eguic bada guc erraiten drauäguna . Laur guiçon citiagu vot eguin dutenic :

text: Them take , and purify thyself with them , and be at charges with them , that they may shave their heads : and all may know that those things , whereof they were informed concerning thee , are nothing ; but that thou thyself also walkest orderly , and keepest the law .
text2: Hec harturic purificadi hequin , eta contribui eçac hequin , buruäc arrada ditzatençát : eta daquitén guciéc ecen hiçaz ençun dituztén gaucetaric deus eztela : baina euror - ere Leguea beguiratuz abilala .

text: As touching the Gentiles which believe , we have written and concluded that they observe no such thing , save only that they keep themselves from things offered to idols , and from blood , and from strangled , and from fornication .
text2: Baina Gentil sinhetsi dutenez den becembatean , guc scribatu diagu , eta ordenatu deus halacoric beguira ezteçaten , baina beguira litecen idoley sacrificatuetaric , eta odoletic , eta ithoetaric , eta paillardiçataric .

text: Then Paul took the men , and the next day purifying himself with them entered into the temple , to signify the accomplishment of the days of purifcation , until that an offering should be offered for every one of them .
text2: Orduan Paul guiçon hec berequin harturic , eta biharamunean hequin purificaturic sar cedin templean denuntiatzen çuela purificationeco egunén complimendua , hetaric batbederagatic oblationea offrenda ledin artean .

text: And when the seven days were almost ended , the Jews which were of Asia , when they saw him in the temple , stirred up all the people , and laid hands on him ,
text2: Eta nola çazpi egunac ia hurren iragan baitziraden , Asiaco Iudu batzuc hura ikussi çutenean templean , moui ceçaten populu gucia , eta eçar citzaten escuac haren gainean :

text: Crying out , Men of Israel , help : This is the man , that teacheth all men every where against the people , and the law , and this place : and further brought Greeks also into the temple , and hath polluted this holy place .
text2: Heyagoraz ceudela , Israeltar guiçonác , hel çaquizquigute : haur da guiçona populuaren eta Leguearen eta leku hunen contra guciac leku gucietan iracasten dituena : are guehiago Grecoac - ere erekarri ditu temple barnera , eta prophanatu du leku saindu haur .

text: ( For they had seen before with him in the city Trophimus an Ephesian , whom they supposed that Paul had brought into the temple . )
text2: ( Ecen lehen ikussi vkan çutén Trophime Ephesianoa hirian harequin , cein vste baitzutén Paulec temple barnera eraman vkan çuela . )

text: And all the city was moved , and the people ran together : and they took Paul , and drew him out of the temple : and forthwith the doors were shut .
text2: Eta moui cedin hiri gucia , eta oldar cedin populua : eta Paul hatzamanic templetic campora idoquiten çutén : eta bertan borthac erts citecen .

text: And as they went about to kill him , tidings came unto the chief captain of the band , that all Jerusalem was in an uproar .
text2: Baina hec hura hil nahiz çabiltzala , hel cedin famá garniçoinaren bandaco Capitainagana , ecen Ierusaleme gucia nahassi cela .

text: Who immediately took soldiers and centurions , and ran down unto them : and when they saw the chief captain and the soldiers , they left beating of Paul .
text2: Ceinec ordu berean gendarmesac eta Centenerac harturic laster eguin baitzeçan hetara : eta hec ikussi cituztenean Capitaina eta gendarmesac gueldi citecen Paulen cehatzetic .

text: Then the chief captain came near , and took him , and commanded him to be bound with two chains ; and demanded who he was , and what he had done .
text2: Orduan hurbilduric Capitainac har ceçan hura , eta mana ceçan esteca ledin bi cadenaz : eta interroga ceçan nor licén , eta cer eguin çuen .

text: And some cried one thing , some another , among the multitude : and when he could not know the certainty for the tumult , he commanded him to be carried into the castle .
text2: Eta batzu bataz ceuden oihuz gendetzean eta berceac berceaz : eta nahastecamenduaren causaz deus seguric ecin eçagutuz , mana ceçan fortaleçara eraman ledin .

text: And when he came upon the stairs , so it was , that he was borne of the soldiers for the violence of the people .
text2: Eta ethorri cenean gradoetara , guertha cedin gendarmeséz eramaiten baitzén gendetzearen boaldaren causaz .

text: For the multitude of the people followed after , crying , Away with him .
text2: Ecen iarreiquiten çayón populuco gendetzea heyagoraz , Ken eçac hori .

text: And as Paul was to be led into the castle , he said unto the chief captain , May I speak unto thee ? Who said , Canst thou speak Greek ?
text2: Eta Paulec fortaleçán sartzeracoan diotsa Capitainari , Hauçu naiz hirequin minçatzera ? Harc erran cieçón , Grecquic badaquic ?

text: Art not thou that Egyptian , which before these days madest an uproar , and leddest out into the wilderness four thousand men that were murderers ?
text2: Ezaiz hi Egyptiano iragan egun hautan seditionebat viztu duana , eta laur milla gaichtaguin desertura retiratu dituana ?

text: But Paul said , I am a man which am a Jew of Tarsus , a city in Cilicia , a citizen of no mean city : and , I beseech thee , suffer me to speak unto the people .
text2: Eta erran ceçan Paulec , Ni segur guiçon Iudua nauc Tarsen , Ciliciaco hiri famatuan burgés iayoa : othoitz eguiten drauat bada , permetti ieçadac minça naquión populuari .

text: And when he had given him licence , Paul stood on the stairs , and beckoned with the hand unto the people . And when there was made a great silence , he spake unto them in the Hebrew tongue , saying ,
text2: Eta harc permettitu ceraucanean , Paulec , gradoetan cegoela , ichilcera escuaz keinu eguin cieçón populuari , eta silentio handi eguin içanic , minça cedin Hebraicoén lengoagez , erraiten çuela .

text: Men , brethren , and fathers , hear ye my defence which I make now unto you .
text2: Guiçon anayeác eta aitác , ençuçue orain çuec baithan emaiten dudan defensá .

text: ( And when they heard that he spake in the Hebrew tongue to them , they kept the more silence : and he saith , )
text2: ( Eta ençun vkan çutenean ecen Hebraicoén lengoagez minço litzayela , hambat silentio handiago eguin ceçaten : eta erran ceçan , )

text: I am verily a man which am a Jew , born in Tarsus , a city in Cilicia , yet brought up in this city at the feet of Gamaliel , and taught according to the perfect manner of the law of the fathers , and was zealous toward God , as ye all are this day .
text2: Ni naiz guiçon Iudua , Tarse Ciliciacoan iayoa , baina hacia hiri hunetan berean Gamalielen oinetan , aitén Leguearen perfectionean instruitua , Iaincogana zelotaco nincela , egun çuec guciac - ere çareten beçala :

text: And I persecuted this way unto the death , binding and delivering into prisons both men and women .
text2: Doctrina haur persecutatu vkan dudana heriorano , estecatuz eta presoindeguietara eçarriz hambat guiçonac nola emazteac :

text: As also the high priest doth bear me witness , and all the estate of the elders : from whom also I received letters unto the brethren , and went to Damascus , to bring them which were there bound unto Jerusalem , for to be punished .
text2: Sacrificadore subiranoa - ere testimonio dudan beçala , eta Ancianoén compainia gucia : are hetaric guthunac anayetara harturic , Damascerat ioaiten nincén , han ciradenac estecaturic Ierusalemera ekartera , puni litecençát .

text: And it came to pass , that , as I made my journey , and was come nigh unto Damascus about noon , suddenly there shone from heaven a great light round about me .
text2: Eta guertha cedin bidean ioaiten eta Damascera hurbiltzen nincela egu - erdi irian , subitoqui cerutico chistmist ançoco argui handi batec ingura bainençan :

text: And I fell unto the ground , and heard a voice saying unto me , Saul , Saul , why persecutest thou me ?
text2: Eta eror nendin lurrera , eta ençun neçan voz - bat , ciostala , Saul , Saul , cergatic ni persecutatzen nauc ?

text: And I answered , Who art thou , Lord ? And he said unto me , I am Jesus of Nazareth , whom thou persecutest .
text2: Eta nic ihardets neçan , Nor aiz Iauna ? Eta Iaunac erran cieçadan , Ni nauc Iesus Nazareno hic persecutatzen duana .

text: And they that were with me saw indeed the light , and were afraid ; but they heard not the voice of him that spake to me .
text2: Eta enequin ciradenéc , arguia ikus ceçaten , eta icit citecen , baina enequin minço cenaren voza etzeçaten ençun .

text: And I said , What shall I do , Lord ? And the Lord said unto me , Arise , and go into Damascus ; and there it shall be told thee of all things which are appointed for thee to do .
text2: Orduan erran neçan , Cer eguinen dut Iauna ? Eta Iaunac erran cieçadan , Iaiquiric oha Damascera , eta han erranen çaizquic , eguin ditzán ordenatu çaizquian gauça guciac .

text: And when I could not see for the glory of that light , being led by the hand of them that were with me , I came into Damascus .
text2: Eta ceren deus ezpainuen ikusten argui haren claretatearen causaz , enequin ciradenéz escutic eraman içanic Damascera ethor nendin .

text: And one Ananias , a devout man according to the law , having a good report of all the Jews which dwelt there ,
text2: Gueroztic Ananias Leguearen araura Iaincoaren beldur cen guiçombat , han egoiten ciraden Iudu gucietaric testimoniage ona çuena , enegana ethor cedin .

text: Came unto me , and stood , and said unto me , Brother Saul , receive thy sight . And the same hour I looked up upon him .
text2: Eta ene aldean cegoela erran cieçadan , Saul anayé , recebi eçac ikustea . Eta nic ordu hartan berean harenganat beha neçan :

text: And he said , The God of our fathers hath chosen thee , that thou shouldest know his will , and see that Just One , and shouldest hear the voice of his mouth .
text2: Eta harc erran ceçan , Gure aitén Iaincoac elegitu au hi bere vorondatearen eçagutzeco eta Iustoaren ikusteco , eta haren ahotic vozaren ençuteco .

text: For thou shalt be his witness unto all men of what thou hast seen and heard .
text2: Ecen testimonio içanen atzayo guiçon guciac baithara , ikussi eta ençun dituan gaucéz .

text: And now why tarriest thou ? arise , and be baptized , and wash away thy sins , calling on the name of the Lord .
text2: Orain bada cer berancen duc ? Iaiqui adi eta batheyadi , eta chahu itzac eure bekatuac , Iaunaren icena inuocaturic .

text: And it came to pass , that , when I was come again to Jerusalem , even while I prayed in the temple , I was in a trance ;
text2: Guero guertha cequidan , ni Ierusalemera bihurtu nincenean , eta templean othoitz eguiten nengoela transporta bainendin spirituz .

text: And saw him saying unto me , Make haste , and get thee quickly out of Jerusalem : for they will not receive thy testimony concerning me .
text2: Eta ikus baineçan ciostana , Lehiadi eta ilki adi fitetz Ierusalemetic , ecen eztié recebituren hic niçaz emanen drauean testimoniagea .

text: And I said , Lord , they know that I imprisoned and beat in every synagogue them that believed on thee :
text2: Eta nic erran neçan , Iauna , hec baceaquié ecen ni presoindeguira eçarten ari nincela eta açotatzen nituela synagoga gucietan hi baithan sinhesten çutenac .

text: And when the blood of thy martyr Stephen was shed , I also was standing by , and consenting unto his death , and kept the raiment of them that slew him .
text2: Eta issurten cenean Esteben hire martyraren odola , ni - ere present ninduán , eta consentitzen nián haren hiltzean , eta beguiratzen nitián hura hiltzen çutenén arropác .

text: And he said unto me , Depart : for I will send thee far hence unto the Gentiles .
text2: Eta harc erran cieçadan , Habil : ecen nic Gentiletara vrrun igorriren aut .
