text2: Fedez egon cedin promettatu içan çayón lurrean bercerenean beçala , tabernacletan egoiten cela Isaac - equin eta Iacob - equin promes beraren herederoquidequin .

text: For he looked for a city which hath foundations , whose builder and maker is God .
text2: Ecen ciuitate fundament - dunaren beguira cegoen ceinen eguilea eta fundaçalea baita Iaincoa .

text: Through faith also Sara herself received strength to conceive seed , and was delivered of a child when she was past age , because she judged him faithful who had promised .
text2: Fedez Sarac - ere haciaren concebitzeco indarra recebi ceçan , eta adinetic lekora erdi cedin , ceren estima baitzeçan hari promes eguin ceraucana fidel cela .

text: Therefore sprang there even of one , and him as good as dead , so many as the stars of the sky in multitude , and as the sand which is by the sea shore innumerable .
text2: Eta halacotz batetaric ( etare ia hilaganic ) sorthu içan da gende handi ceruco içarrac beçala , eta itsas costaco conta ecin daiten sablea beçala .

text: These all died in faith , not having received the promises , but having seen them afar off , and were persuaded of them , and embraced them , and confessed that they were strangers and pilgrims on the earth .
text2: Fedean hauc gucioc hil içan dirade promessac recebitu gabe : baina vrrundanic hec ikussiric eta sinhetsiric eta salutaturic , eta aithorturic ecen arrotz eta estrangér ciradela lurrean .

text: For they that say such things declare plainly that they seek a country .
text2: Ecen gauça hauc erraiten dituztenéc , claroqui eracusten dute ecen bere herriaren ondoan dabiltzala .

text: And truly , if they had been mindful of that country from whence they came out , they might have had opportunity to have returned .
text2: Eta segur , baldin harçaz orhoit içan balirade ceinetaric ilki içan baitziraden , itzultzeco dembora baçuten :

text: But now they desire a better country , that is , an heavenly : wherefore God is not ashamed to be called their God : for he hath prepared for them a city .
text2: Baina orain hobeagobat desiratzen duté , erran nahi baita celestiala : hunegatic Iaincoari berari - ere etzayó laido hayén Iainco deitzera , ecen preparatu cerauen ciuitatebat .

text: By faith Abraham , when he was tried , offered up Isaac : and he that had received the promises offered up his only begotten son ,
text2: Fedez offrenda ceçan Abrahamec Isaac , enseyatu içan cenean , eta seme bakoitza offrenda ceçan , promessac recebitu vkan cituenac :

text: Of whom it was said , That in Isaac shall thy seed be called :
text2: ( Ceini erran içan baitzayón , Isaactan deithuren çaic hacia )

text: Accounting that God was able to raise him up , even from the dead ; from whence also he received him in a figure .
text2: Estimaturic ecen Iaincoac hiletaric - ere resuscita ahal leçaquela : nondic are hura conformitatez recruba baitzeçan .

text: By faith Isaac blessed Jacob and Esau concerning things to come .
text2: Fedez , ethorteco ciraden gaucéz benedica citzan Isaac - ec Iacob eta Esau .

text: By faith Jacob , when he was a dying , blessed both the sons of Joseph ; and worshipped , leaning upon the top of his staff .
text2: Fedez , Iacob - ec hiltzean Iosephen semetaric batbedera benedica ceçan : eta adora ceçan bere makila buru gainean bermaturic .

text: By faith Joseph , when he died , made mention of the departing of the children of Israel ; and gave commandment concerning his bones .
text2: Fedez , Iosephec hiltzean eguin ceçan mentione Israeleco haourrén ilkiteaz : eta bere heçurréz manamendu eman ceçan .

text: By faith Moses , when he was born , was hid three months of his parents , because they saw he was a proper child ; and they were not afraid of the king ' s commandment .
text2: Fedez , Moyses sorthu içan cenean , gorde içan cen bere ahaidéz hirur hilebethez , ceren haour ederra baitzacussaten , eta ezpaitziraden beldur Regueren ordenançaren .

text: By faith Moses , when he was come to years , refused to be called the son of Pharaoh ' s daughter ;
text2: Fedez , Moysesec ia handituric refusa ceçan Pharaoren alabaren seme deithu içatera :

text: Choosing rather to suffer affliction with the people of God , than to enjoy the pleasures of sin for a season ;
text2: Hautatzenago çuela Iaincoaren populuarequin affligitu içatera , ecen ez dembora guti batetacotz bekatuzco atseguinén vkaitera :

text: Esteeming the reproach of Christ greater riches than the treasures in Egypt : for he had respect unto the recompence of the reward .
text2: Abrastassun handiago estimaturic Christen iniuriá , ecen ez Egypten ciraden thesaurac , ecen recompensara beha cegoen .

text: By faith he forsook Egypt , not fearing the wrath of the king : for he endured , as seeing him who is invisible .
text2: Fedez vtzi ceçan Egypte , Regueren hiraren beldurric gabe : ecen inuisible dena ikusten balu beçala , fermu eduqui ceçan .

text: Through faith he kept the passover , and the sprinkling of blood , lest he that destroyed the firstborn should touch them .
text2: Fedez eguin citzan Bazcoa eta odol issurtzea : lehen sorthuac deseguiten cituenac , hec hunqui ezlitzançát .

text: By faith they passed through the Red sea as by dry land : which the Egyptians assaying to do were drowned .
text2: Fedez iragan ceçaten itsas gorria leyhorrez beçala : cein gauça enseyaturic , Egyptianoac hundatu içan baitziraden .

text: By faith the walls of Jericho fell down , after they were compassed about seven days .
text2: Fedez Ierichoco murruac eror citecen , çazpi egunez inguratuac egonic .

text: By faith the harlot Rahab perished not with them that believed not , when she had received the spies with peace .
text2: Fedez , Rahab paillardá etzedin gal incredulequin batean , espiác baquerequin ostatuz recebitu vkan cituenean .

text: And what shall I more say ? for the time would fail me to tell of Gedeon , and of Barak , and of Samson , and of Jephthae ; of David also , and Samuel , and of the prophets :
text2: Eta cer erranen dut guehiago ? ecen dembora faltaturen çait , contatu nahi badut Gedeonez , eta Barac - ez , eta Samsonez , eta Iephthez , eta Dauid - ez , eta Samuelez , eta Prophetez :

text: Who through faith subdued kingdoms , wrought righteousness , obtained promises , stopped the mouths of lions ,
text2: Ceinéc fedez combatitu vkan baitituzte resumác , fedez eguin vkan duté iustitia obtenitu vkan dituzte promessac , boçatu lehoinén ahoac ,

text: Quenched the violence of fire , escaped the edge of the sword , out of weakness were made strong , waxed valiant in fight , turned to flight the armies of the aliens .
text2: Iraungui suaren indarra , itzuri içan çaizte ezpata ahoey , sendo eguin içan dirade erietaric , borthitz eguin içan dirade guerlán , estrangerén campoac ihessitan irion dituzté ,

text: Women received their dead raised to life again : and others were tortured , not accepting deliverance ; that they might obtain a better resurrection :
text2: Emaztéc recebitu vkan dituzte resurrectionez bere hilac : eta batzu hedatu içan dirade , deliuratu içatera conturic eguiten etzutelaric resurrectione hobebat obteni leçatençát .

text: And others had trial of cruel mockings and scourgings , yea , moreover of bonds and imprisonment :
text2: Eta berceac phorogatu içan dirade escarnioz eta vkaldiz , bayeta guehiago estecaduraz eta presoindeguiz :

text: They were stoned , they were sawn asunder , were tempted , were slain with the sword : they wandered about in sheepskins and goatskins ; being destitute , afflicted , tormented ;
text2: Lapidatu içan dirade , segatu içan dirade , tentatu içan dirade , ezpata herioz hil içan dirade : hara huna ebili içan dirade ardi eta ahunz larruz veztituric , abandonnaturic , affligituric , tormentaturic .

text: ( Of whom the world was not worthy : ) they wandered in deserts , and in mountains , and in dens and caves of the earth .
text2: Eta ezpaitzén mundua hayén digne : desertuetan errebelatuac çabiltzala eta mendietan eta lecetan eta lur çulhoetan .

text: And these all , having obtained a good report through faith , received not the promise :
text2: Eta hauc guciéc fedez testimoniage obtenituric , eztuté recebitu vkan promessa :

text: God having provided some better thing for us , that they without us should not be made perfect .
text2: Iaincoac cerbait hoberic guretaco probedituric , gu gabe perfectionetara ethor ezlitecençát .

text: Wherefore seeing we also are compassed about with so great a cloud of witnesses , let us lay aside every weight , and the sin which doth so easily beset us , and let us run with patience the race that is set before us ,
text2: Gu - ere bada , hain testimoniozco hodey handiac inguratzen gaituenaz gueroz , carga gucia , eta gu errachqui trabatzen gaituen bekatua egotziric , constantqui garreitzan proposatu içan çaicun lasterrari :

text: Looking unto Jesus the author and finisher of our faith ; who for the joy that was set before him endured the cross , despising the shame , and is set down at the right hand of the throne of God .
text2: Beha gaudelaric fedearen capitainagana eta , compliçaleagana , Iesusgana : ceinec escutan çuen bozcarioaren orde suffritu vkan baitu crutzea , ahalquea menospreciaturic , eta Iaincoaren thronoaren escuinean iarri içan da .

text: For consider him that endured such contradiction of sinners against himself , lest ye be wearied and faint in your minds .
text2: Considera eçaçue bada diligentqui nor den halaco contradictionea bere buruären contra bekatoretaric suffritu vkan duena , çuen gogoetan faltaturic akit etzaiteztençat .

text: Ye have not yet resisted unto blood , striving against sin .
text2: Oraino eztuçue odolerano resistitu vkan , bekatuaren contra combatitzen çaretela :

text: And ye have forgotten the exhortation which speaketh unto you as unto children , My son , despise not thou the chastening of the Lord , nor faint when thou art rebuked of him :
text2: Eta ahanci çaiçue exhortationea , ceinec çuey haourrey beçala erraiten baitrauçue , Ene haourrá , ezteçála menosprecia Iaunaren gaztiguä , eta eztaquiála gogoa falta harçaz corregitzen aicenean .

text: For whom the Lord loveth he chasteneth , and scourgeth every son whom he receiveth .
text2: Ecen maite duena Iaunac gaztigatzen dic , eta recebitzen duen haour gucia cehatzen dic .

text: If ye endure chastening , God dealeth with you as with sons ; for what son is he whom the father chasteneth not ?
text2: Baldin gaztigamenduric suffritzen baduçue , Iaincoa bere haourrey anço presentatzen çaiçue : ecen cein da haourra aitác gaztigatzen eztuena ?

text: But if ye be without chastisement , whereof all are partakers , then are ye bastards , and not sons .
text2: Bada baldin gaztigamendu gabe baçarete , ceinetan participant baitirade guciac , beraz bastard çarete eta ez seme .

text: Furthermore we have had fathers of our flesh which corrected us , and we gave them reverence : shall we not much rather be in subjection unto the Father of spirits , and live ?
text2: Eta gure gorputzén aitác gaztigari vkan ditugu , eta reuerentiatan eduqui ditugu : ezgaitzaitza spirituén Aitari vnguiz suietago içanen , eta vicico baicara ?

text: For they verily for a few days chastened us after their own pleasure ; but he for our profit , that we might be partakers of his holiness .
text2: Ecen hec egun gutitacotz , berey irudi çayen beçala , gaztigatzen guentuztén : baina hunec gure probetchutan , haren saindutassunean participant garençát .

text: Now no chastening for the present seemeth to be joyous , but grievous : nevertheless afterward it yieldeth the peaceable fruit of righteousness unto them which are exercised thereby .
text2: Bada gaztigu guciac ordu berean eztirudi bozcariotaco dela , aitzitic tristitiataco : baina guero iustitiazco fructu baquezcoa rendatzen draue harçaz exercitatu dirateney .

text: Wherefore lift up the hands which hang down , and the feeble knees ;
text2: Goititzaçue bada çuen escu lachoac , eta çuen belhaun iunctura partituac chuchent itzaçue :

text: And make straight paths for your feet , lest that which is lame be turned out of the way ; but let it rather be healed .
text2: Eta bidesca chuchenac eguin ietzeçue çuen oiney : maingu den gauçá bidetic aldara eztadinçát , bainaitzitic sendo dadin .

text: Follow peace with all men , and holiness , without which no man shall see the Lord :
text2: Baqueari çarreitzate guciequin , eta saindutassunari , cein gabe nehorc ezpaitu Iauna ikussiren .

text: Looking diligently lest any man fail of the grace of God ; lest any root of bitterness springing up trouble you , and thereby many be defiled ;
text2: Gogoatzen duçuelaric nehor aldara eztadin Iaincoaren gratiatic : cembeit erro karmin goiti ialguiten denec trubla etzaitzatençát : eta anhitz harçaz satsu eztitecençát .

text: Lest there be any fornicator , or profane person , as Esau , who for one morsel of meat sold his birthright .
text2: Eztén nehor paillard edo profano , Esau beçala , ceinec vianda batetan sal baitzeçan bere lehen sortzezco primeçá .

text: For ye know how that afterward , when he would have inherited the blessing , he was rejected : for he found no place of repentance , though he sought it carefully with tears .
text2: Ecen badaquiçue are guero heretatzeco benedictionea desiratzen çuelaric , refusatu içan dela : ecen etzeçan eriden penitentiataco lekuric , nigar vrirequin benedictionearen escatu içan bacen - ere .

text: For ye are not come unto the mount that might be touched , and that burned with fire , nor unto blackness , and darkness , and tempest ,
text2: Ecen etzarete ethorri escuz hunqui ahal daitequeen mendi batetara , ez erratzen den sura , ez haice buhumbara , ez lanhora eta tempestatera ,

text: And the sound of a trumpet , and the voice of words ; which voice they that heard intreated that the word should not be spoken to them any more :
text2: Eta trompetta soinura eta hitzén vozera , cein ençun vkan çutenéc , requeri baitzeçaten guehiagoric ezlaquién dreça hitza .

text: ( For they could not endure that which was commanded , And if so much as a beast touch the mountain , it shall be stoned , or thrust through with a dart :
text2: ( Ecen manatzen cena ecin suffri ceçaqueten , cein baitzen , Baldin abre batec - ere mendia hunqui badeça , lapidaturen da edo gueciaz iraganen da .

text: And so terrible was the sight , that Moses said , I exceedingly fear and quake : )
text2: Eta Moysesec ( hambat cen terrible eracusten cena ) erran ceçan , Icitu naiz eta ikaratu )

text: But ye are come unto mount Sion , and unto the city of the living God , the heavenly Jerusalem , and to an innumerable company of angels ,
text2: Baina ethorri içan çarete Siongo mendira , eta Iainco viciaren ciuitatera , Ierusalem celestialera , eta Aingueruén anhitz millataco compainiara ,

text: To the general assembly and church of the firstborn , which are written in heaven , and to God the Judge of all , and to the spirits of just men made perfect ,
text2: Eta ceruètan scribatuac diraden lehen sorthuén congregationera , eta gucién iuge den Iaincoagana , eta iusto sanctificatuen spirituetara :

text: And to Jesus the mediator of the new covenant , and to the blood of sprinkling , that speaketh better things than that of Abel .
text2: Eta Iesusgana alliança berrico Arartecoagana , eta Abelenac baino gauça hobeac erraiten dituen odol issurira .

text: See that ye refuse not him that speaketh . For if they escaped not who refused him that spake on earth , much more shall not we escape , if we turn away from him that speaketh from heaven :
text2: Beguirauçue refusa ezteçaçuen minço dena : ecen baldin itzuri içan ezpadirade Iaincoaren icenean minço cena menospreciatzen çutenac lurrean , gu anhitzez guehiago punituren gara , baldin cerutic minço denaganic erauz bagaitez .

text: Whose voice then shook the earth : but now he hath promised , saying , Yet once more I shake not the earth only , but also heaven .
text2: Ceinen vozac orduan higui baitzeçan lurra : baina orain denuntiatu vkan du , dioela , Oraino behin nic higuituren dut ez solament lurra , baina ceruä - ere .

text: And this word , Yet once more , signifieth the removing of those things that are shaken , as of things that are made , that those things which cannot be shaken may remain .
text2: Eta hitz hunec Oraino behin , declaratzen du fermu eztiraden gaucen , hala nola escuz eguin diradenen deseguitea : fermu diradenac daudecençat .

text: Wherefore we receiving a kingdom which cannot be moved , let us have grace , whereby we may serve God acceptably with reverence and godly fear :
text2: Hunegatic higui ecin daitequeen resumá hartzen dugularic , daducagun gratiá , ceinez hala cerbitza baiteçaquegu Iaincoa non haren gogaraco baiquirate , reuerentiarequin eta beldurrequin .

text: For our God is a consuming fire .
text2: Ecen gure Iaincoa su consumitzen duen - bat da .

text: Let brotherly love continue .
text2: Charitate fraternala egon bedi .

text: Be not forgetful to entertain strangers : for thereby some have entertained angels unawares .
text2: Hospitalitatea eztaquiçuela ahanz : ecen harçaz batzuc etzaquitelaric ostatuz recebitu vkan dituzte Aingueruäc .

text: Remember them that are in bonds , as bound with them ; and them which suffer adversity , as being yourselves also in the body .
text2: Çaretén orhoit presoneréz , hequin presoner bacinete beçala : affligitzen diradenez , ceuroc - ere gorputzez affligitzen bacinete beçala .

text: Marriage is honourable in all , and the bed undefiled : but whoremongers and adulterers God will judge .
text2: Honorable da gucién artean ezconçá , eta ohe macula gabea : baina paillartac eta adulteroac iugeaturen ditu Iaincoac .

text: Let your conversation be without covetousness ; and be content with such things as ye have : for he hath said , I will never leave thee , nor forsake thee .
text2: Çuen conditioneac bire auaritia gabe , çareten content presentecoéz : ecen erran vkan du berac , Ezaut vtziren , eta ezaut abandonnaturen .

text: So that we may boldly say , The Lord is my helper , and I will not fear what man shall do unto me .
text2: Hala non segurançarequin erran ahal baiteçaquegu , Iauna ene aiutaçale , eznaiz beldur içanen guiçonac ahal daididan gauçaren .

text: Remember them which have the rule over you , who have spoken unto you the word of God : whose faith follow , considering the end of their conversation .
text2: Çareten orhoit çuen guidaçaléz , Iaincoaren hitza declaratu vkan drauçuenéz , ceinén fedea imitatzen baituçue , consideratzen duçuelaric ceric içan den hayén conuersationearen fina .

text: Jesus Christ the same yesterday , and to day , and for ever .
text2: Iesus Christ atzo içan dena eta egun , hura bera da eternalqui - ere .

text: Be not carried about with divers and strange doctrines . For it is a good thing that the heart be established with grace ; not with meats , which have not profited them that have been occupied therein .
text2: Doctrina diuersez eta estrangerez etzaiteztela hara huna erabil : ecen on da bihotza gratiaz confirma dadin , ez viandéz , ceinétan ezpaitute probetchuric vkan applicatu içan diradenéc .

text: We have an altar , whereof they have no right to eat which serve the tabernacle .
text2: Badugu aldarebat ceinetaric iateco çucenic ezpaitute Tabernaclea cerbitzatzen dutenéc .

text: For the bodies of those beasts , whose blood is brought into the sanctuary by the high priest for sin , are burned without the camp .
text2: Ecen abrén gorputzac , ceinén odola ekarten baita bekatuagatic sanctuariora Sacrificadore subiranoaz , erratzen dirade tendetaric lekora .

text: Wherefore Jesus also , that he might sanctify the people with his own blood , suffered without the gate .
text2: Halacotz Iesusec - ere , sanctifica leçançát populua bere - odolaz , suffritu vkan du portaleaz campotic .

text: Let us go forth therefore unto him without the camp , bearing his reproach .
text2: Ilki gaitecen bada harengana tendetaric lekora haren ignominiá ekarten dugula .

text: For here have we no continuing city , but we seek one to come .
text2: Ecen eztugu hemen ciuitate permanentic : baina ethorteco denaren ondoan gabiltza .

text: By him therefore let us offer the sacrifice of praise to God continually , that is , the fruit of our lips giving thanks to his name .
text2: Harçaz bada offrenda dieçogun ardura Iaincoari , laudoriozco sacrificio , erran nahi baita , haren icena confessatzen duten ezpainén fructua .

text: But to do good and to communicate forget not : for with such sacrifices God is well pleased .
text2: Bada beneficentia eta communicationea eztaquizquiçuela ahanz : ecen halaco sacrificioéz placer hartzen du Iaincoac .

text: Obey them that have the rule over you , and submit yourselves : for they watch for your souls , as they that must give account , that they may do it with joy , and not with grief : for that is unprofitable for you .
text2: Obeditzaçue çuen guidaçaleac , eta susmetti çaquiztéz ecen hec veillatzen duté çuen arimacgatic , contu rendatu behar dutenec beçala : eguiten dutena alegueraqui eguin deçatençat , eta ez gogoz garaitic : ecen hura ezliçateque çuen probetchutan .

text: Pray for us : for we trust we have a good conscience , in all things willing to live honestly .
text2: Othoitz eguiçue guregatic : ecen asseguratzen gara conscientia ona dugula , desiratzen dugularic gauça gucietan honestqui conuersatzera .

text: But I beseech you the rather to do this , that I may be restored to you the sooner .
text2: Eta hambatez guehiago othoitz eguiten drauçuet haur daguiçuen , sarriago restitui naquiçuençát .

text: Now the God of peace , that brought again from the dead our Lord Jesus , that great shepherd of the sheep , through the blood of the everlasting covenant ,
text2: Iainco baquezcoac bada ( ceinec hiletaric itzul eraci baitu ardién Artzain handia alliança eternalezco odolaz , Iesus Christ gure Iauna )

text: Make you perfect in every good work to do his will , working in you that which is wellpleasing in his sight , through Jesus Christ ; to whom be glory for ever and ever . Amen .
text2: Confirma çaitzatela obra on orotan , bere vorondatearen eguitera , eguiten duelaric çuetan haren aitzinean placent datenic , Iesus Christez , ceini gloria secula seculacotz . Amen .

text: And I beseech you , brethren , suffer the word of exhortation : for I have written a letter unto you in few words .
text2: Halaber othoitz eguiten drauçuet , anayeác , suffri eçaçue exhortationetaco hitza : ecen hitz gutitan scribatu drauçuet .

text: Know ye that our brother Timothy is set at liberty ; with whom , if he come shortly , I will see you .
text2: Iaquiçue gure anaye Timotheo largatu içan dela , ceinequin ( baldin sarri badator ) ikussiren baitzaituztet .

text: Salute all them that have the rule over you , and all the saints . They of Italy salute you .
text2: Salutaitzaçue çuen guidaçale guciac , eta saindu guciac . Salutatzen çaituztéz Italiacoec .

text: Grace be with you all . Amen .
text2: Gratia dela çuequin gucioquin . Amen .

text: James , a servant of God and of the Lord Jesus Christ , to the twelve tribes which are scattered abroad , greeting .
text2: IACQVES Iaincoaren eta Iesus Christ Iaunaren cerbitzariac , hamabi leinu barreyatuey , salutatione .

text: My brethren , count it all joy when ye fall into divers temptations ;
text2: Ene anayeác , bozcario perfectotan educaçue tentatione diuersetara eror çaiteztenean :

text: Knowing this , that the trying of your faith worketh patience .
text2: Daquiçuelaric ecen çuen fedearen phorogançác patientia engendratzen duela .

text: But let patience have her perfect work , that ye may be perfect and entire , wanting nothing .
text2: Baina patientiác obra perfectoa biu , perfect eta integro çaretençat , deusen falta etzaretelaric .

text: If any of you lack wisdom , let him ask of God , that giveth to all men liberally , and upbraideth not ; and it shall be given him .
text2: Eta baldin çuetaric cembeitec sapientia faltaric badu , esca bequió Iaincoari , ceinec emaiten baitraue guciey benignoqui , eta ez reprotchatzen : eta emanen çayó .

text: But let him ask in faith , nothing wavering . For he that wavereth is like a wave of the sea driven with the wind and tossed .
text2: Baina federequin esca bedi , batre dudatzen eztuela : ecen dudatzen duena , haiceaz erabilten eta tormentatzen den itsas bagaren pare da .

text: For let not that man think that he shall receive any thing of the Lord .
text2: Ezteçala bada estima guiçon harc deus Iaunaganic recebituren duela :

text: A double minded man is unstable in all his ways .
text2: Guiçon gogo doblatacoa , inconstant da bere bide gucietan .

text: Let the brother of low degree rejoice in that he is exalted :
text2: Gloria bedi bada anaye conditione bachotacoa bere goratassunean :

text: But the rich , in that he is made low : because as the flower of the grass he shall pass away .
text2: Baina abrats dena , gloria bedi bere bachotassunean : ecen belhar lilia beçala iraganen da .

text: For the sun is no sooner risen with a burning heat , but it withereth the grass , and the flower thereof falleth , and the grace of the fashion of it perisheth : so also shall the rich man fade away in his ways .
text2: Ecen nola iguzquia beroarequin goratu eta , erre baita belharra , eta haren lilia erori , eta haren irudi ederra galdu : hala abratsa - ere bere bide gucietan chimalduren da .

text: Blessed is the man that endureth temptation : for when he is tried , he shall receive the crown of life , which the Lord hath promised to them that love him .
text2: Dahatsu da tentatione suffritzen duen guiçona : ecen phorogatu datenean recebituren duque , Iaunac hura maite duteney promettatu drauen vicitzeco coroá .

text: Let no man say when he is tempted , I am tempted of God : for God cannot be tempted with evil , neither tempteth he any man :
text2: Nehorc , tentatzen denean , ezterrala Iaincoaz tentatzen dela : ecen Iaincoa ecin tenta daite gaizquiz , eta nehor eztu tentatzen .

text: But every man is tempted , when he is drawn away of his own lust , and enticed .
text2: Baina batbedera tentatzen da bere guthicia propriaz tiratzen eta bazcatzen denean .

text: Then when lust hath conceived , it bringeth forth sin : and sin , when it is finished , bringeth forth death .
text2: Guero guthiciá , concebitu duenean , ertzen da bekatuz : eta bekatuac acabatu denean , herio engendratzen du .

text: Do not err , my beloved brethren .
text2: Etzaiteztela abusa , ene anaye maiteác .

text: Every good gift and every perfect gift is from above , and cometh down from the Father of lights , with whom is no variableness , neither shadow of turning .
text2: Donatione on oro , eta dohain perfect oro garaitic da arguién Aitaganic iausten dela , cein baithan ezpaita cambiamenduric , ez aldizcazco itzalic .

text: Of his own will begat he us with the word of truth , that we should be a kind of firstfruits of his creatures .
text2: Harc bere vorondatez engendratu vkan gaitu eguiazco hitzaz , haren creaturetaco primitiác beçala guinençát .

text: Wherefore , my beloved brethren , let every man be swift to hear , slow to speak , slow to wrath :
text2: Halacotz , ene anaye maiteác , biz guiçon gucia ençutera lehiati , berantcor minçatzera , eta berantcor asserretzera .

text: For the wrath of man worketh not the righteousness of God .
text2: Ecen guiçonaren asserreac Iaincoaren iustitiá eztu complitzen .

text: Wherefore lay apart all filthiness and superfluity of naughtiness , and receive with meekness the engrafted word , which is able to save your souls .
text2: Halacotz , iraitziric cithalqueria gucia eta malitiazco superfluitatea , emetassunequin recebi eçaçue , çuetan landatu hitza , ceinec salua ahal baititzaque çuen arimác .

text: But be ye doers of the word , and not hearers only , deceiving your own selves .
text2: Eta çareten hitzaren eguile eta ez solament ençule , ceuron buruäc enganatzen dituçuela .

text: For if any be a hearer of the word , and not a doer , he is like unto a man beholding his natural face in a glass :
text2: Ecen baldin norbeit hitzaren ençule bada eta ez eguile , hura mirailean bere beguitharte naturala consideratzen duen guiçonaren pare da .

text: For he beholdeth himself , and goeth his way , and straightway forgetteth what manner of man he was .
text2: Ecen consideratu vkan du bere buruä , eta ioan içan da , eta bertan ahance çayó nolaco cen .

text: But whoso looketh into the perfect law of liberty , and continueth therein , he being not a forgetful hearer , but a doer of the work , this man shall be blessed in his deed .
text2: Baina miratu datena Legue perfectoan , cein baita libertatezcoa , eta hartan perseueratu duqueena , ceren ezpaitate ençule ahanzcor içan , baina obraren eguile : hura dohatsu içanen da bere eguinean .

text: If any man among you seem to be religious , and bridleth not his tongue , but deceiveth his own heart , this man ' s religion is vain .
text2: Baldin cembeitec vste badu religioso dela çuen artean , bridatzen eztuelaric bere mihia , baina bere bihotza enganatzen duelaric , halacoaren religionea vano da .

text: Pure religion and undefiled before God and the Father is this , To visit the fatherless and widows in their affliction , and to keep himself unspotted from the world .
text2: Religione pura eta macula gabea Iainco eta Aita baithan , haur da , çurtzén eta emazte alhargunén visitatzea bere tribulationetan : eta macula gabe bere buruären beguiratzea mundu hunetaric .

text: My brethren , have not the faith of our Lord Jesus Christ , the Lord of glory , with respect of persons .
text2: Ene anayeác , eztuçuela Iesus Christ gure Iaun gloriazcoaren fedea , personén acceptionerequin .

text: For if there come unto your assembly a man with a gold ring , in goodly apparel , and there come in also a poor man in vile raiment ;
text2: Ecen baldin sar badadi çuen congregationera guiçon - bat vrrhezco erhaztun - bat duela , preciosqui veztituric : eta sar dadin halaber edocein paubre charqui veztituric ,

text: And ye have respect to him that weareth the gay clothing , and say unto him , Sit thou here in a good place ; and say to the poor , Stand thou there , or sit here under my footstool :
text2: Eta ikartze duçuen preciosqui veztitua denagana , eta erran dieçoçuen hari , Hi iar adi hemen honestqui : eta paubreari derroçuen , Hi ago çutic han , edo iar adi hemen ene scabella azpian :

text: Are ye not then partial in yourselves , and are become judges of evil thoughts ?
text2: Eztuçue differentia eguin vkan ceuroc baithan , eta eguin içan baitzarete pensamendu gaichtoezco iuge ?

text: Hearken , my beloved brethren , Hath not God chosen the poor of this world rich in faith , and heirs of the kingdom which he hath promised to them that love him ?
text2: Ençuçue , ene anaye maiteác , eztitu Iaincoac elegitu mundu hunetaco paubreac fedez abrats içateco , eta hura maite duteney promettatu drauen resumaco heredero ?

text: But ye have despised the poor . Do not rich men oppress you , and draw you before the judgment seats ?
text2: Baina çuec desohoratu vkan duçue paubrea . Ala abratsec etzaituztez tyrannizatzen , eta etzaituztez gortetara erekarten ?

text: Do not they blaspheme that worthy name by the which ye are called ?
text2: Eztute hec blasphematzen çuen gainean inuocatu içan den Icen ona ?

text: If ye fulfil the royal law according to the scripture , Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself , ye do well :
text2: Badaric - ere baldin Legue reala complitzen baduçue Scripturaren araura , cein baita , On eritziren draucac eure hurcoari eure buruäri beçala , vngui eguiten duçue :

text: But if ye have respect to persons , ye commit sin , and are convinced of the law as transgressors .
text2: Baina baldin personén acceptioneric baduçue , bekatu eguiten duçue , eta reprehenditzen çarete Legueaz transgrediçale beçala .

text: For whosoever shall keep the whole law , and yet offend in one point , he is guilty of all .
text2: Ecen norc - ere Legue gucia beguiraturen baitu , eta punctu batetan faltaturen , gucietan hoguendun da .

text: For he that said , Do not commit adultery , said also , Do not kill . Now if thou commit no adultery , yet if thou kill , thou art become a transgressor of the law .
text2: Ecen erran duenac , Eztuc adulteraturen , erran du halaber , Eztuc hilen . Bada baldin adulteratzen ezpaduc , baina hiltzen bay , Leguearen transgrediçale eguin aiz .

text: So speak ye , and so do , as they that shall be judged by the law of liberty .
text2: Hala minça çaitezte eta hala eguiçue nola libertatezco Legueaz iugeatu behar diradenéc .

text: For he shall have judgment without mercy , that hath shewed no mercy ; and mercy rejoiceth against judgment .
text2: Ecen condemnatione misericordia gabe eguinen çayó misericordia eguin eztuqueenari : eta gloriatzen da misericordia condemnationearen contra .

text: What doth it profit , my brethren , though a man say he hath faith , and have not works ? can faith save him ?
text2: Ene anayeác , cer probetchu , baldin norbeitec badarra fede baduela , eta obrác eztituén ? ala fede harc hura salua ahal deçaque ?

text: If a brother or sister be naked , and destitute of daily food ,
text2: Eta baldin anayea edo arrebá billuciac badirade , eta peitu eguneco vitançaren :

text: And one of you say unto them , Depart in peace , be ye warmed and filled ; notwithstanding ye give them not those things which are needful to the body ; what doth it profit ?
text2: Eta çuetaric cembeitec hæy erran diecén , Çoazte baquerequin , bero çaitezte eta asse çaitezte : eta eztinguzteçuen gorputzaren necessario diraden gauçác , cer probetchu duqueite ?

text: Even so faith , if it hath not works , is dead , being alone .
text2: Hala fedea - ere , baldin obrác ezpaditu , hila da bere berez .

text: Yea , a man may say , Thou hast faith , and I have works : shew me thy faith without thy works , and I will shew thee my faith by my works .
text2: Baina are erranén du edoceinec , Hic fedea duc , eta nic obrác citiat , eracuts ieçadac eure fedea eure obrác gabe , eta nic eracutsiren drauat hiri neure obretaric neure fedea .

text: Thou believest that there is one God ; thou doest well : the devils also believe , and tremble .
text2: Hic sinhesten duc ecen Iaincobat dela : vngui eguiten duc : deabruec - ere sinhesten dié , eta ikara diabiltzac .

text: But wilt thou know , O vain man , that faith without works is dead ?
text2: Baina nahi duc iaquin , o guiçon vanoá , ecen fedea obrác gabe hila dela ?

text: Was not Abraham our father justified by works , when he had offered Isaac his son upon the altar ?
text2: Gure aita Abraham ezta obretaric iustificatu içan , Isaac bere semea aldare gainean offrendatu çuenean ?

text: Seest thou how faith wrought with his works , and by works was faith made perfect ?
text2: Badacussac nola fedeac obratzen çuen haren obretan , eta obretaric fedea acabatu içan dela ?

text: And the scripture was fulfilled which saith , Abraham believed God , and it was imputed unto him for righteousness : and he was called the Friend of God .
text2: Eta complitu içan dela Scripturá dioela , Sinhetsi vkan du Abrahamec Iaincoa , eta imputatu içan çayó iustitiatara , eta Iaincoaren adisquide deithu içan da .

text: Ye see then how that by works a man is justified , and not by faith only .
text2: Badacussaçue bada ecen obretaric iustificatzen dela guiçona , eta ez fedetic solament ?

text: Likewise also was not Rahab the harlot justified by works , when she had received the messengers , and had sent them out another way ?
text2: Halaber Rahab paillarda - ere ala ezta obretaric iustificatu içan , recebitu cituenean mandatariac , eta berce bidez idoqui cituenean ?

text: For as the body without the spirit is dead , so faith without works is dead also .
text2: Ecen nola gorputza spiritu gabe hila baita , hala fedea - ere obrác gabe hila da .

text: My brethren , be not many masters , knowing that we shall receive the greater condemnation .
text2: Ene anayeác , etzaretela magistru anhitz : daquigularic ecen condemnatione handiagoa recebituren dugula .

text: For in many things we offend all . If any man offend not in word , the same is a perfect man , and able also to bridle the whole body .
text2: Ecen anhitz gauçatan huts eguiten dugu guciéc Baldin cembeitec hitzean huts eguiten ezpadu , hura guiçon perfectoa da , eta bridatan eduqui ahal deçaque gorputz gucia - ere .

text: Behold , we put bits in the horses ' mouths , that they may obey us ; and we turn about their whole body .
text2: Huná , çamariey bridác ahoetara emaiten drauztegu obedi gaitzatençát , eta hayén gorputz gucia hara huna drabilagu :

text: Behold also the ships , which though they be so great , and are driven of fierce winds , yet are they turned about with a very small helm , whithersoever the governor listeth .
text2: Huná , barcác - ere , hain handi diradelaric , eta haice borthitzéz erabilten diradelaric , hara huna erabilten dirade gobernail chipito batez , norat - ere gobernaçalearen placerac nahi baituque .

text: Even so the tongue is a little member , and boasteth great things . Behold , how great a matter a little fire kindleth !
text2: Hala mihia - ere membro tipitobat da , eta gauça handiz vantatzen da : huná , su chipito batec cein egurtze handia irachequiten duen .

text: And the tongue is a fire , a world of iniquity : so is the tongue among our members , that it defileth the whole body , and setteth on fire the course of nature ; and it is set on fire of hell .
text2: Mihia - ere subat da , eta iniquitatezco mundubat : hala diot mihia eçarria dela gure membroén artean , ceinec maculatzen baitu gorputz gucia , eta irachequiten gure naturaren cursua , eta irachequia da gehennáz .

text: For every kind of beasts , and of birds , and of serpents , and of things in the sea , is tamed , and hath been tamed of mankind :
text2: Ecen bestién , eta chorién , eta suguén , eta itsassoco arrainén natura gucia hetzen da , eta heci içan da natura humanoaz :

text: But the tongue can no man tame ; it is an unruly evil , full of deadly poison .
text2: Baina mihia eceinere guiçonec ecin hez deçaque : ceba ecin daiten gaitzbat da poçoin mortalez bethea .

text: Therewith bless we God , even the Father ; and therewith curse we men , which are made after the similitude of God .
text2: Harçaz benedicatzen dugu gure Iainco eta Aita : eta harçaz maradicatzen ditugu Iaincoaren irudira eguinico guiçonac .

text: Out of the same mouth proceedeth blessing and cursing . My brethren , these things ought not so to be .
text2: Aho ber - batetaric ilkiten da benedictione eta maledictione : Ezta behar , ene anayeác , hauc hunela eguin ditecen .

text: Doth a fountain send forth at the same place sweet water and bitter ?
text2: Ala ithurri batec çulho beretic emaiten du dulcea eta mina ?

text: Can the fig tree , my brethren , bear olive berries ? either a vine , figs ? so can no fountain both yield salt water and fresh .
text2: Ala ficotze batec oliuaric ekar ahal deçaque , edo aihenac ficoric ? hala ecin ekar deçaque ithurribatec - ere vr gaci eta gueça .

text: Who is a wise man and endued with knowledge among you ? let him shew out of a good conversation his works with meekness of wisdom .
text2: Nor da çuhur eta iaquinsu çuen artean ? eracuts bitza conuersatione onez bere obrác , çuhurtziazco emetassunequin .

text: But if ye have bitter envying and strife in your hearts , glory not , and lie not against the truth .
text2: Eta baldin inuidia saminic baduçue , eta tharritamenduric çuen bihotzetan , etzaiteztela gloria , eta gueçurric ezterraçuela eguiaren contra .

text: This wisdom descendeth not from above , but is earthly , sensual , devilish .
text2: Ecen çuhurtzia haur ezta garaitic iausten dena , baina da lurrecoa , sensuala eta deabruezcoa .

text: For where envying and strife is , there is confusion and every evil work .
text2: Ecen non baita inuidiaric eta tharritamenduric , han nahastecamendu eta obra gaichto gucia .

text: But the wisdom that is from above is first pure , then peaceable , gentle , and easy to be intreated , full of mercy and good fruits , without partiality , and without hypocrisy .
text2: Baina garaitico çuhurtziá , lehenic da pur , guero baquezco , moderatu , maneioso , misericordiaz eta fructu onez bethea , distinctioneric gabea , hypocrisia gabea .

text: And the fruit of righteousness is sown in peace of them that make peace .
text2: Eta iustitiazco fructua baquerequin ereiten çaye baquezcoéy .

text: From whence come wars and fightings among you ? come they not hence , even of your lusts that war in your members ?
text2: Nondic guerlác eta guduac çuen artean ? eza hemendic , diot , çuen voluptate çuen membroetan guerla eguiten dutenetaric ?

text: Ye lust , and have not : ye kill , and desire to have , and cannot obtain : ye fight and war , yet ye have not , because ye ask not .
text2: Desiratzen duçue eta eztuçue vkaiten , inuidioso çarete eta bekaitz , eta ecin ardiets deçaqueçue : combatitzen çarete eta guerla eguiten duçue , baina eztuçue desiratzen duçuena , ceren ezpaitzarete escatzen .

text: Ye ask , and receive not , because ye ask amiss , that ye may consume it upon your lusts .
text2: Escatzen çarete eta eztuçue recebitzen : ceren gaizqui escatzon baitzarete , çuen voluptatetan despenda deçaçuençát .

text: Ye adulterers and adulteresses , know ye not that the friendship of the world is enmity with God ? whosoever therefore will be a friend of the world is the enemy of God .
text2: Adulteroác eta adulterác , eztaquiçue ecen munduaren adisquidetassuna , Iaincoaren etsaytassun dela ? nor - ere bada nahi içanen baita munduarequin adisquide , Iaincoaren etsay iartenda .

text: Do ye think that the scripture saith in vain , The spirit that dwelleth in us lusteth to envy ?
text2: Ala vste duçue ecen Scripturác alferretan erraiten duela , Inuidiatara aurthiten du çuetan habitatzen den spirituac ?

text: But he giveth more grace . Wherefore he saith , God resisteth the proud , but giveth grace unto the humble .
text2: Aitzitic du gratia handiagoa emaiten , halacotz dio , Iaincoac vrgulutsuey resistitzen draue , eta humiley gratia emaiten .

text: Submit yourselves therefore to God . Resist the devil , and he will flee from you .
text2: Çareten bada suiet Iaincoaren , resisti ieçoçue deabruari , eta ihes eguinen du çuetaric .

text: Draw nigh to God , and he will draw nigh to you . Cleanse your hands , ye sinners ; and purify your hearts , ye double minded .
text2: Hurbil çaquitzate Iaincoari , eta hurbilduren çaiçue : garbitzaçue escuac , o bekatoreác , eta purificaitzaçue bihotzac , o gogo doblatacoác .

text: Be afflicted , and mourn , and weep : let your laughter be turned to mourning , and your joy to heaviness .
text2: Affligi çaitezte eta eguiçue lamentatione eta nigar : çuen irria nigarretara conuerti bedi , eta çuen alegrançá tristitiatara .

text: Humble yourselves in the sight of the Lord , and he shall lift you up .
text2: Humilia çaitezte Iaunaren aitzinean , eta goraturen çaituzté .

text: Speak not evil one of another , brethren . He that speaketh evil of his brother , and judgeth his brother , speaketh evil of the law , and judgeth the law : but if thou judge the law , thou art not a doer of the law , but a judge .
text2: Elkarren contra etzaiteztela gaizqui minça , anayeác : anayearen contra minço denac , eta bere anayea condemnatzen duenac , Leguearen contra gaizqui erraiten du , eta Leguea condemnatzen du : eta baldin Leguea condemnatzen baduc , ezaiz Leguearen eguile , baina iuge .

text: There is one lawgiver , who is able to save and to destroy : who art thou that judgest another ?
text2: Legue eçarlea bat da salua eta gal ahal deçaquena : hi nor aiz bercea iugeatzen duana ?

text: Go to now , ye that say , To day or to morrow we will go into such a city , and continue there a year , and buy and sell , and get gain :
text2: Eya orain erraiten duçuenác , Egun edo bihar ioanen gara hiri batetara , eta egonen gara han vrthebat , eta merkatalgoa eguinen dugu , eta irabaciren dugu :

text: Whereas ye know not what shall be on the morrow . For what is your life ? It is even a vapour , that appeareth for a little time , and then vanisheth away .
text2: Eztaquiçuelaric biharamunean cer içanen den : ecen cer da çuen vicia ? ecen appur batetacotz aguertzen eta guero deseguiten den vaporebat da .

text: For that ye ought to say , If the Lord will , we shall live , and do this , or that .
text2: Erran behar cindutenaren lekuan , Baldin Iaunac nahi badu , eta vici bagara , eguinen dugu haur edo hura .

text: But now ye rejoice in your boastings : all such rejoicing is evil .
text2: Baina orain gloriatzen çarete çuen vanterietan : horlaco gloriatze gucia gaichto da .

text: Therefore to him that knoweth to do good , and doeth it not , to him it is sin .
text2: Bada vngui eguiten daquianac eta ez eguiten , bekatu eguiten du .

text: Go to now , ye rich men , weep and howl for your miseries that shall come upon you .
text2: Eya orain abratsác , nigar eguiçue , vrhubi eguiten duçuela çuen miseria helduren çaizquiçuenacgatic .

text: Your riches are corrupted , and your garments are motheaten .
text2: Çuen abrastassunac vsteldu dirade , çuen abillamenduac cerrenez betheac dirade .

text: Your gold and silver is cankered ; and the rust of them shall be a witness against you , and shall eat your flesh as it were fire . Ye have heaped treasure together for the last days .
text2: Çuen vrrhea eta çuen cilharra herdoildu da , eta hayén herdoildurác testificaturen du çuen contra , eta harc ditu ianen çuen haraguiac suac beçala : thesaurizatu duçue azquen egunetaco .

text: Behold , the hire of the labourers who have reaped down your fields , which is of you kept back by fraud , crieth : and the cries of them which have reaped are entered into the ears of the Lord of sabaoth .
text2: Huná , çuen landác errequeitatu dituzten languilén alocairu çueçaz defraudatu içan dena , oihuz dago , eta errequeitaçalén oihuac armadén Iaunaren beharrietan sarthu dirade .

text: Ye have lived in pleasure on the earth , and been wanton ; ye have nourished your hearts , as in a day of slaughter .
text2: Deliciotan vici içan çarete lurraren gainean eta çuen atseguinac hartu vkan dituçue , eta çuen bihotzac ressasiatu vkan dituçue sacrificiotaco egunean beçala .

text: Ye have condemned and killed the just ; and he doth not resist you .
text2: Condemnatu eta hil vkan duçue iustoa : eta eztrauçue resistitzen .

text: Be patient therefore , brethren , unto the coming of the Lord . Behold , the husbandman waiteth for the precious fruit of the earth , and hath long patience for it , until he receive the early and latter rain .
text2: Çareten bada patient , anayeác , Iaunaren aduenimendurano . Huná , laboraria lurreco fructu preciosoaren beguira egoiten da , patientqui haren beguira dagoela goiceco eta arratseco vria recebi deçaqueno .

text: Be ye also patient ; stablish your hearts : for the coming of the Lord draweth nigh .
text2: Çareten patient çuec - ere eta confirmaitzaçue çuen bihotzac : ecen Iaunaren aduenimendua hurbil da .

text: Grudge not one against another , brethren , lest ye be condemned : behold , the judge standeth before the door .
text2: Etzaiteztela arrangura elkarren contra , anayeác , condemna etzaiteztençát : huná , iugea borthaitzinean dago .

text: Take , my brethren , the prophets , who have spoken in the name of the Lord , for an example of suffering affliction , and of patience .
text2: Ene anayeác , har - itzaçue afflictionetaco eta patientiataco exemplutan Prophetác , cein minçatu baitirade Iaunaren icenean .

text: Behold , we count them happy which endure . Ye have heard of the patience of Job , and have seen the end of the Lord ; that the Lord is very pitiful , and of tender mercy .
text2: Huná , dohatsu eduquiten ditugu afflictione suffritzen dutenac : Iob - en patientiá ençun vkan duçue , eta Iaunaren fina ikussi duçue , nola guciz misericordioso den Iauna eta gogabera .

text: But above all things , my brethren , swear not , neither by heaven , neither by the earth , neither by any other oath : but let your yea be yea ; and your nay , nay ; lest ye fall into condemnation .
text2: Bada gauça ororen aitzinetic , ene anayeác , iura ezteçaçuela ez ceruäz , ez lurraz , ez edocein berce iuramenduz : baina biz çuen baya , Bay : eta çuen eza , Ez : condemnationetara eror etzaiteztençát .

text: Is any among you afflicted ? let him pray . Is any merry ? let him sing psalms .
text2: Affligitzen da cembeit çuen artean ? othoitz begui : bihotz aleguerataco da cembeit ? canta beça .

text: Is any sick among you ? let him call for the elders of the church ; and let them pray over him , anointing him with oil in the name of the Lord :
text2: Eri da cembeit çuen artean ? erekar bitza Eliçaco ancianoac , eta othoitz beguité harengatic , vnctatzen dutela hura olioz Iaunaren icenean .

text: And the prayer of faith shall save the sick , and the Lord shall raise him up ; and if he have committed sins , they shall be forgiven him .
text2: Eta fedezco orationeac saluaturen du eria , eta eraiquiren du hura Iaunac : eta baldin bekaturic eguin badu barkaturen çaizquió .

text: Confess your faults one to another , and pray one for another , that ye may be healed . The effectual fervent prayer of a righteous man availeth much .
text2: Confessa ietzoçue batac berceari çuen faltác , eta othoitz eguiçue batac berceagatic , senda çaiteztençát : ecen anhitz balio du iustoaren efficaciorequin den orationeac .

text: Elias was a man subject to like passions as we are , and he prayed earnestly that it might not rain : and it rained not on the earth by the space of three years and six months .
text2: Elias cen gu bay passionén suiectionetaco guiçona , eta othoiztez othoitz eguin ceçan , ezlaguian vriric , eta etzeçan eguin vriric lurraren gainean hirur vrthez eta sey hilebethez .

text: And he prayed again , and the heaven gave rain , and the earth brought forth her fruit .
text2: Eta berriz othoitz eguin ceçan , eta ceruäc vri eman ceçan , eta lurrac bere fructua ekar ceçan .

text: Brethren , if any of you do err from the truth , and one convert him ;
text2: Anayeác , baldin çuetaric cembeit eguiatic errebela badadi , eta hura conuerti badeça cembeitec ,

text: Let him know , that he which converteth the sinner from the error of his way shall save a soul from death , and shall hide a multitude of sins .
text2: Iaquin beça ecen conuerti eraci duqueenac bekatorebat bere bideco errebelamendutic , saluaturen duqueela arimabat heriotaric , eta bekatu mulçoa estaliren duqueela .

text: Peter , an apostle of Jesus Christ , to the strangers scattered throughout Pontus , Galatia , Cappadocia , Asia , and Bithynia ,
text2: PIERRISEC , Iesus Christen Apostoluac , Ponten , Galatian , Cappadocian , Asian , eta Bithinian gaindi barreyatuac çareten estrangerey .

text: Elect according to the foreknowledge of God the Father , through sanctification of the Spirit , unto obedience and sprinkling of the blood of Jesus Christ : Grace unto you , and peace , be multiplied .
text2: Iainco Aitaren prouidentiaren arauez Spirituaren sanctificationetan elegituey , obeditzeco eta Iesus Christen odolaz ihiztatu içateco : Gratia eta baque multiplica daquiçuela .

text: Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ , which according to his abundant mercy hath begotten us again unto a lively hope by the resurrection of Jesus Christ from the dead ,
text2: Laudatu dela Iaincoa cein baita Iesus Christ gure Iaunaren Aita , ceinec bere misericordia handiaz regeneratu vkan baiquaitu sperança vicitara , Iesus Christen hiletarico resurrectioneaz ,

text: To an inheritance incorruptible , and undefiled , and that fadeth not away , reserved in heaven for you ,
text2: Heretage corrumpi ecin daitenera , ez macula , ez chimal , ceruètan çuençát conseruatura ,

text: Who are kept by the power of God through faith unto salvation ready to be revealed in the last time .
text2: Iaincoaren verthutean fedez beguiratzen çaretenonçat , azquen demborán reuelatu içateco prest den saluamendutacotz .

text: Wherein ye greatly rejoice , though now for a season , if need be , ye are in heaviness through manifold temptations :
text2: Cein gauçatan alegueratzen baitzarete , dembora appurbat orain ( baldin behar bada ) tristetuac çaretelaric tentatione diuersetan :

text: That the trial of your faith , being much more precious than of gold that perisheth , though it be tried with fire , might be found unto praise and honour and glory at the appearing of Jesus Christ :
text2: Çuen fedearen phorogançá vnguiz preciosoagoa ecen ez vrrhearena ( cein galtzen baita eta halere suz phorogatzen ) eriden dadinçát , çuen laudoriotan eta gloriatan eta ohoretan dela , Iesus Christ aguer dadinean :

text: Whom having not seen , ye love ; in whom , though now ye see him not , yet believing , ye rejoice with joy unspeakable and full of glory :
text2: Cein ikussi eztuçuelaric maite baituçue : ceinetan orain ikusten eztuçuelaric , baina sinhesten duçuelaric , alegrança erran ecin daitenez eta gloriosoz alegueratzen baitzarete .

text: Receiving the end of your faith , even the salvation of your souls .
text2: Eramaiten duçuelaric çuen fedearen fina , cein baita , arimén saluamendua .

text: Of which salvation the prophets have inquired and searched diligently , who prophesied of the grace that should come unto you :
text2: Saluamendu hunez informatu içan dirade , eta haur diligentqui bilhatu vkan duté , çuetara ethorteco cen gratiaz prophetizatu vkan duten Prophetéc .

text: Searching what , or what manner of time the Spirit of Christ which was in them did signify , when it testified beforehand the sufferings of Christ , and the glory that should follow .
text2: Informatzen ciradelaric noizco edo cer demborataco Christen Spiritu prophetiazco hetan cenac declaratzen cituen Christi ethorteco çaizcan suffrançác eta hayén ondoco gloriác :

text: Unto whom it was revealed , that not unto themselves , but unto us they did minister the things , which are now reported unto you by them that have preached the gospel unto you with the Holy Ghost sent down from heaven ; which things the angels desire to look into .
text2: Eta reuelatu içan çaye , ez bere buruey , baina guri administratzen cerauzquigutela orain çuey denuntiatu içan çaizquiçuen gauçác çuey Euangelioa predicatu drauçueçatenez , cerutic igorririco Spiritu sainduaz , cein gaucén contemplatzeco desira baitute Aingueruéc .

text: Wherefore gird up the loins of your mind , be sober , and hope to the end for the grace that is to be brought unto you at the revelation of Jesus Christ ;
text2: Halacotz çuen adimenduco guerruncea guerricaturic , sobrietaterequin , auçue perfectoqui sperança çuey presentatzen çaiçuen gratián Iesus Christ aguer daiteno .

text: As obedient children , not fashioning yourselves according to the former lusts in your ignorance :
text2: Eta haur , haour obedientéc beçala , çuen buruäc conformatzen eztituçuelaric lehenago çuen ignorantián centuzten desiretara :

text: But as he which hath called you is holy , so be ye holy in all manner of conversation ;
text2: Baina çuec deithu çaituztena saindu den beçala , çuec - ere çareten saindu çuen conuersatione orotan .

text: Because it is written , Be ye holy ; for I am holy .
text2: Halacotz da scribatua , Çareten saindu : ecen ni saindu naiz .

text: And if ye call on the Father , who without respect of persons judgeth according to every man ' s work , pass the time of your sojourning here in fear :
text2: Eta baldin Aitatan inuocatzen baduçue , personén acceptioneric gabe batbederaren obraren arauez iugeatzen duena , beldurrequin conuersa çaitezte çuen egoitza hunetaco demborán .

text: Forasmuch as ye know that ye were not redeemed with corruptible things , as silver and gold , from your vain conversation received by tradition from your fathers ;
text2: Daquiçuelaric ecen redemitu içan çaretela çuen conuersatione vano aitén ordenancetaric hartutic : ez gauça corruptiblez , nola baita , cilharrez edo vrrhez :

text: But with the precious blood of Christ , as of a lamb without blemish and without spot :
text2: Baina Christen odol preciosoaz , bildots macula eta satsutassun gabe batenaz beçala :

text: Who verily was foreordained before the foundation of the world , but was manifest in these last times for you ,
text2: Ia munduaren fundationea baino lehen ordenatuarenaz , baina azquen dembora hautan manifestatuarenaz , çuengatic ,

text: Who by him do believe in God , that raised him up from the dead , and gave him glory ; that your faith and hope might be in God .
text2: Eta harçaz sinhesten duçue hura hiletaric resuscitatu duen eta hari gloria eman draucan Iaincoa baithan , çuen fedea eta sperançá Iaincoa baithan licençat .

text: Seeing ye have purified your souls in obeying the truth through the Spirit unto unfeigned love of the brethren , see that ye love one another with a pure heart fervently :
text2: Bada çuen arimác purificatu içanic , obeditzen duçuela eguia Spirituaz , anayetassunezco charitate fictione gabecorequin , bihotz chahuz elkarri on eritzoçue affectionatuqui :

text: Being born again , not of corruptible seed , but of incorruptible , by the word of God , which liveth and abideth for ever .
text2: Regeneraturic ez haci corruptibleaz , baina incorruptibleaz , Iaincoaren hitz viciaz , eta eternalqui egoiten denaz .

text: For all flesh is as grass , and all the glory of man as the flower of grass . The grass withereth , and the flower thereof falleth away :
text2: Ceren haragui gucia baita belharra beçala , eta guiçonaren gloria gucia belhar lilia beçala : eyhartu da belharra , eta haren lilia erori :

text: But the word of the Lord endureth for ever . And this is the word which by the gospel is preached unto you .
text2: Baina Iaunaren hitza badago eternalqui : eta haur da çuey euangelizatu içan çaiçuen hitza .

text: Wherefore laying aside all malice , and all guile , and hypocrisies , and envies , and all evil speakings ,
text2: Beraz vtziric malitia gucia , eta enganio guciá , eta hypocrisiác , eta inuidiác , eta gaitzerraite guciac ,

text: As newborn babes , desire the sincere milk of the word , that ye may grow thereby :
text2: Desira eçaçue , haour heuraguiric eztuela sorthuen ançora , adimenduzco eta enganio gabeco eznea , harçaz haz çaiteztençát .

text: If so be ye have tasted that the Lord is gracious .
text2: Baldin dastatu baduçue ecen benigno dela Iauna .

text: To whom coming , as unto a living stone , disallowed indeed of men , but chosen of God , and precious ,
text2: Harengana hurbiltzen çaretelaric cein baita harri vicia , guiçonéz arbuyatua , baina Iaincoa baithan elegitua eta preciosoa .

text: Ye also , as lively stones , are built up a spiritual house , an holy priesthood , to offer up spiritual sacrifices , acceptable to God by Jesus Christ .
text2: Çuec - ere harri vici anço edifica çaitezte , etche spiritual , Sacrificadoregoa saindu , Iesus Christez Iaincoaren gogaraco sacrificio spiritual offrendatzeco .

text: Wherefore also it is contained in the scripture , Behold , I lay in Sion a chief corner stone , elect , precious : and he that believeth on him shall not be confounded .
text2: Halacotz contenitzen - ere da Scripturán , Huná , eçarten dut Sionen , har cantoin principala , elegitua eta preciosoa : eta hartan sinhesten duena ezta confus içanen .

text: Unto you therefore which believe he is precious : but unto them which be disobedient , the stone which the builders disallowed , the same is made the head of the corner ,
text2: Hurá da bada ohore çuen sinhesten duçuenón : baina sinhesten eztutenen , harri edificaçaléc arbuyatu vkan dutena cantoineco principal eguin içan da , eta behaztopamendutaco harri , eta trebucamendutaco harri .

text: And a stone of stumbling , and a rock of offence , even to them which stumble at the word , being disobedient : whereunto also they were appointed .
text2: Cein trebucatzen baitirade hitzaren contra desobedient diradelaric : hartaco ordenatu - ere dirade .

text: But ye are a chosen generation , a royal priesthood , an holy nation , a peculiar people ; that ye should shew forth the praises of him who hath called you out of darkness into his marvellous light :
text2: Baina çuec çarete generatione elegitua , Sacrificadoregoa reala , gende saindua , populu acquisitua : ilhumbetic bere miragarrizco arguira deithu vkan çaituztenaren verthuteac denuntia ditzaçuençát .

text: Which in time past were not a people , but are now the people of God : which had not obtained mercy , but now have obtained mercy .
text2: Noizpait cinetenac ez populu , orain çarete Iaincoaren populu : çuec misericordia obtenitu etzendutenóc , orain misericordia obtenitu vkan duçue .

text: Dearly beloved , I beseech you as strangers and pilgrims , abstain from fleshly lusts , which war against the soul ;
text2: Maiteác , othoitz eguiten drauçuet , estrangeren eta bideazcoén ançora , beguira çaitezten haraguiaren guthicietaric , ceinéc guerla eguiten baitute arimén contra :

text: Having your conversation honest among the Gentiles : that , whereas they speak against you as evildoers , they may by your good works , which they shall behold , glorify God in the day of visitation .
text2: Çuen conuersationea duçuelaric honest Gentillén artean çueçaz gaizquiguilez beçala minço diraden gaucetan , ikussi dituqueizten obra onetaric glorifica deçatençát Iaincoa visitationeco egunean .

text: Submit yourselves to every ordinance of man for the Lord ' s sake : whether it be to the king , as supreme ;
text2: Çareten bada suiet gobernamendu humano guciaren Iaunagatic : edo regueren , superioraren beçala :

text: Or unto governors , as unto them that are sent by him for the punishment of evildoers , and for the praise of them that do well .
text2: Edo gobernadorén , harçaz igorri içan diradenén beçala , gaizquiguilén mendequiotan eta vnguiguilén laudoriotan .

text: For so is the will of God , that with well doing ye may put to silence the ignorance of foolish men :
text2: Ecen hunela da Iaincoaren vorondatea , vngui eguitez , guiçon erhoén ignorantiari ahoa boça dieçoçuen :

text: As free , and not using your liberty for a cloke of maliciousness , but as the servants of God .
text2: Libertatetan çaretenéc beçala , eta ez libertatea malitiaren estalquitan bacendute beçala , aitzitic Iaincoaren cerbitzariéc beçala .

text: Honour all men . Love the brotherhood . Fear God . Honour the king .
text2: Guciac ohoraitzaçue : anayetassunari on eritzoçue . Çareten Iaincoaren beldur . Regue ohora eçaçue .

text: Servants , be subject to your masters with all fear ; not only to the good and gentle , but also to the froward .
text2: Cerbitzariác , çareten beldur gucirequin nabussién suiet , ez solament onén eta humanoén , baina dorpén - ere .

text: For this is thankworthy , if a man for conscience toward God endure grief , suffering wrongfully .
text2: Ecen haur da gogaraco , baldin norbeitec Iaincoaganaco conscientiagatic fascheriaric suffritzen badu , iniustoqui suffritzen duelaric :

text: For what glory is it , if , when ye be buffeted for your faults , ye shall take it patiently ? but if , when ye do well , and suffer for it , ye take it patiently , this is acceptable with God .
text2: Ecen cer laudorio da , baldin falta eguinic buffetatzen çaretenean pairatzen baduçue ? baina baldin vngui eguiten duçuelaric eta affligitzen çaretelaric pairatzen baduçue , haur da Iaincoaren gogaraco .

text: For even hereunto were ye called : because Christ also suffered for us , leaving us an example , that ye should follow his steps :
text2: Ecen hunetacotzát deithu içan çarete : ecen Christec - ere suffritu vkan du guregatic , guri exemplu vtziten draucula , haren oin hatzey iarreiqui çaquiztençat :

text: Who did no sin , neither was guile found in his mouth :
text2: Ceinec ezpaitu bekaturic eguin vkan , eta eceinere enganioric ezta eriden içan haren ahoan .

text: Who , when he was reviled , reviled not again ; when he suffered , he threatened not ; but committed himself to him that judgeth righteously :
text2: Ceinec iniuriatzen cenean , ezpaitzuen iniuriatzen : gaizqui eguiten ceraucatenean , ezpaitzuen mehatchuric eguiten : baina remettitzen cen iustoqui iugeatzen duenagana .

text: Who his own self bare our sins in his own body on the tree , that we , being dead to sins , should live unto righteousness : by whose stripes ye were healed .
text2: Ceinec gure bekatuac ekarri vkan baititu bere gorputzean çur gainean : bekatuey hilic , iustitiari vici guiaizquionçat : ceinen vkalduráz sendatu içan baitzarete .

text: For ye were as sheep going astray ; but are now returned unto the Shepherd and Bishop of your souls .
text2: Ecen ardi errebelatuac beçala cineten , baina orain conuertitu içan çarete çuen arimén Artzainagana eta Ipizpicuagana .

text: Likewise , ye wives , be in subjection to your own husbands ; that , if any obey not the word , they also may without the word be won by the conversation of the wives ;
text2: Halaber emazteac suiet diraden bere senharrén , baldineta batzu hitzaren desobedient badirade , emaztén conuersationeaz hitza gabe irabaz ditecençat ,

text: While they behold your chaste conversation coupled with fear .
text2: Ikussi duqueitenean çuen conuersatione caste beldurrequin dena :

text: Whose adorning let it not be that outward adorning of plaiting the hair , and of wearing of gold , or of putting on of apparel ;
text2: Ceinén ornamendua eztén lekoreco bilo içurduratan , edo vrrhezco paramendutan , edo abillamenduetaco habitutan :

text: But let it be the hidden man of the heart , in that which is not corruptible , even the ornament of a meek and quiet spirit , which is in the sight of God of great price .
text2: Baina bihotzeco guiçon gordea , spiritu eme eta sossegu batetaco incorruptionean consistitzen dena , cein baita Iaincoaren aitzinean precioso .

text: For after this manner in the old time the holy women also , who trusted in God , adorned themselves , being in subjection unto their own husbands :
text2: Ecen hunela lehenago emazte sainda Iaincoa baithan sperança çutenac - ere appaincen ciraden , suiet ciradelaric bere senharrén :

text: Even as Sara obeyed Abraham , calling him lord : whose daughters ye are , as long as ye do well , and are not afraid with any amazement .
text2: Sarac Abraham obeditzen çuen beçala , hura iaun deitzen çuela , ceinen alaba eguin içan baitzarete , vngui eguiten duçuela , eta eceinere iciapenen beldur etzaretela .

text: Likewise , ye husbands , dwell with them according to knowledge , giving honour unto the wife , as unto the weaker vessel , and as being heirs together of the grace of life ; that your prayers be not hindered .
text2: Senharrác , halaber conuersa eçaçue hequin discretqui emaztezco vnci fragilagoarequin beçala , ohore emaiten draucaçuela , elkarrequin vicitzeco gratiaren heredero quide - ere çaretenoc beçala , çuen orationeac empatcha eztitecençát .

text: Finally , be ye all of one mind , having compassion one of another , love as brethren , be pitiful , be courteous :
text2: Eta finalqui guciac çareten consentimendu batetaco eta compassione batetaco , fraternalqui onhetsle çaretelaric misericordioso , gratioso :

text: Not rendering evil for evil , or railing for railing : but contrariwise blessing ; knowing that ye are thereunto called , that ye should inherit a blessing .
text2: Gaitza gaitzagatic rendatzen eztuçuela edo iniuria iniuriagatic , baina contrariora , benedicatzen duçuela : daquiçuelaric ecen hartara deithuac çaretela , benedictionezco heretagea possedi deçaçuençát .

text: For he that will love life , and see good days , let him refrain his tongue from evil , and his lips that they speak no guile :
text2: Ecen nahi duenac onhetsi vicia , eta ikussi egun onac , beguira beça bere mihia gaitzetaric , eta bere ezpainac enganioren pronuntiatzetic :

text: Let him eschew evil , and do good ; let him seek peace , and ensue it .
text2: Itzul bedi gaizquitic , eta begui vngui : bilha beça baquea , eta iarreiqui bequió hari .

text: For the eyes of the Lord are over the righteous , and his ears are open unto their prayers : but the face of the Lord is against them that do evil .
text2: Ecen Iaunaren beguiac iustoén gainera beha daude , eta haren beharriac hayén othoitzetara , eta Iaunaren beguithartea da gaizquiac eguiten dituztenén gainean .

text: And who is he that will harm you , if ye be followers of that which is good ?
text2: Eta nor da çuey calteric eguinen drauçuena , baldin vnguiari baçarreitzate ?

text: But and if ye suffer for righteousness ' sake , happy are ye : and be not afraid of their terror , neither be troubled ;
text2: Baina baldin cerbait suffritzen baduçue vngui eguinagatic , dohatsu çarete . Baina hayén beldurrez icit etzaiteztela , ezeta trubla :

text: But sanctify the Lord God in your hearts : and be ready always to give an answer to every man that asketh you a reason of the hope that is in you with meekness and fear :
text2: Aitzitic Iainco Iauna sanctifica eçaçue çuen bihotzetan : eta çareten bethi prest ihardestera çuetan den sperançáz raçoin galde eguiten duen guciari , emetassunequin eta reuerentiarequin ,

text: Having a good conscience ; that , whereas they speak evil of you , as of evildoers , they may be ashamed that falsely accuse your good conversation in Christ .
text2: Conscientia ona duçuelaric : çuen contra gaizquiguiléz beçala minço diraden gauçán , confus diradençat , çuen conuersatione Christ baithango ona calumniatzen dutenac .

text: For it is better , if the will of God be so , that ye suffer for well doing , than for evil doing .
text2: Ecen hobe da vngui eguiten duçuela affligi çaitezten , baldin Iaincoaren vorondateac hala nahi badu , ecen ez gaizqui eguiten duçuela .

text: For Christ also hath once suffered for sins , the just for the unjust , that he might bring us to God , being put to death in the flesh , but quickened by the Spirit :
text2: Ecen Christec - ere behin bekatuagatic suffritu vkan du , iustoac iniustoacgatic : gu Iaincoagana eraman guençançát , haraguiz mortificaturic , baina viuificaturic Spirituaz .

text: By which also he went and preached unto the spirits in prison ;
text2: Cein Spirituz carceleco spirituey - ere partituric predicatu vkan baitraue ,

text: Which sometime were disobedient , when once the longsuffering of God waited in the days of Noah , while the ark was a preparing , wherein few , that is , eight souls were saved by water .
text2: Lehenago desobedient ciradeney , behin beha cegoenean Iaincoaren patientiá Noeren egunetan , appaincen cenean arká : ceinetan gutiac , da iaquiteco , çortzi arima salua baitzitecen vrez :

text: The like figure whereunto even baptism doth also now save us ( not the putting away of the filth of the flesh , but the answer of a good conscience toward God , ) by the resurrection of Jesus Christ :
text2: Ceini orain ihardesten draucan baptismoaren figurác gu - ere saluatzen gaitu : ez haraguico satsutassunac chahutzen dituenac , baina conscientiá onaren attestationeac Iaincoaren aitzinean Iesus Christen resurrectioneaz :

text: Who is gone into heaven , and is on the right hand of God ; angels and authorities and powers being made subject unto him .
text2: Cein baita Iaincoaren escuinean , cerurát ioanic , ceini suiet eguin baitzaitza Aingueruäc , eta puissançac eta verthuteac .

text: Forasmuch then as Christ hath suffered for us in the flesh , arm yourselves likewise with the same mind : for he that hath suffered in the flesh hath ceased from sin ;
text2: Bada Christec guregatic suffritu vkan duenaz gueroz haraguian , çuec - ere pensatze hunez beraz harma çaitezte , nola haraguian suffritu duena bekatutaric cessatu den ,

text: That he no longer should live the rest of his time in the flesh to the lusts of men , but to the will of God .
text2: Guehiagoric ez guiçonén guthicién araura , baina Iaincoaren vorondatearen araura goitico haraguian den demborán vici dençat .

text: For the time past of our life may suffice us to have wrought the will of the Gentiles , when we walked in lasciviousness , lusts , excess of wine , revellings , banquetings , and abominable idolatries :
text2: Ecen asco içateco çaicu ceren gure vicico dembora iraganean Gentilén vorondatea complitu dugun , conuersatzen guenduenean insolentiétan , guthiciétan , hordiqueriétan , gormandicétan , edatétan , eta idolatria abominablétan .

text: Wherein they think it strange that ye run not with them to the same excess of riot , speaking evil of you :
text2: Halacotz bere buruäc estranger iruditzen çaizté dissolutionezco insolentia berera hequin laster eguiten eztuçuenean , çuec gaitzerraiten çaituztela .

text: Who shall give account to him that is ready to judge the quick and the dead .
text2: Ceinéc contu rendaturen baitraucate vicién eta hilén iugeatzeco prest dagoenari .

text: For for this cause was the gospel preached also to them that are dead , that they might be judged according to men in the flesh , but live according to God in the spirit .
text2: Ecen hunetacotz hiley - ere euangelizatu içan çaye : condemna litecençat guiçonén arauez , haraguiz : eta vici liraden Iaincoaren arauez spirituz .

text: But the end of all things is at hand : be ye therefore sober , and watch unto prayer .
text2: Bada gauça gucién fina hurbiltzen da . Çareten beraz sobre eta iratzarri othoitz eguitera :

text: And above all things have fervent charity among yourselves : for charity shall cover the multitude of sins .
text2: Eta gauça gucién gainetic çuen artean charitate affectionezcoa duçuelaric : ecen charitateac estaliren du bekatuén anhitztassuna .

text: Use hospitality one to another without grudging .
text2: Çareten elkarren ostatuz recebiçale , murmurationeric gabe .

text: As every man hath received the gift , even so minister the same one to another , as good stewards of the manifold grace of God .
text2: Batbederac dohaina recebitu duenaren arauez bercey administra biecé , Iaincoaren anhitz aldezco gratiaren dispensaçale onéc beçala .

text: If any man speak , let him speak as the oracles of God ; if any man minister , let him do it as of the ability which God giveth : that God in all things may be glorified through Jesus Christ , to whom be praise and dominion for ever and ever . Amen .
text2: Baldin norbeit minço bada , minça bedi Iaincoaren hitzéz beçala : baldin norbeit administratzen ari bada , administra beça Iaincoac administratzen duen puissançaren araura : gauça gucietan glorifica dadinçat Iaincoa Iesus Christez , ceini gloria eta indar secula seculacotz . Amen .

text: Beloved , think it not strange concerning the fiery trial which is to try you , as though some strange thing happened unto you :
text2: Gucizco maiteác , ezteçaçuela estranio eriden , labean beçala çaretenean çuen phorogatzeagatic , cerbait gauça vste gaberic ethorten balitzeiçue beçala :

text: But rejoice , inasmuch as ye are partakers of Christ ' s sufferings ; that , when his glory shall be revealed , ye may be glad also with exceeding joy .
text2: Aitzitic Christen afflictionetan communicatzen duçuen becembatean , aleguera çaitezte : haren gloriaren reuelationean - ere , atseguin hartzen duçuela aleguera çaiteztençát .

text: If ye be reproached for the name of Christ , happy are ye ; for the spirit of glory and of God resteth upon you : on their part he is evil spoken of , but on your part he is glorified .
text2: Baldin Christen icenean iniuriatzen baçarete , dohatsu çarete ecen çuen gainean reposatzen da gloriaren eta Iaincoaren Spiritua , heçaz den becembatean blasphematzen dena , baina çueçaz den becembatean glorificatzen dena .

text: But let none of you suffer as a murderer , or as a thief , or as an evildoer , or as a busybody in other men ' s matters .
text2: Bada çuetaric nehor eztadila affligi guicerhaile , edo ohoin , edo gaizquiguile , edo berceren onén guthicioso beçala :

text: Yet if any man suffer as a Christian , let him not be ashamed ; but let him glorify God on this behalf .
text2: Baina baldin Christino beçala affligitzen bada etzayola laido , aitzitic glorifica beça Iaincoa alde harçaz .

text: For the time is come that judgment must begin at the house of God : and if it first begin at us , what shall the end be of them that obey not the gospel of God ?
text2: Ecen ordu da has dadin iugemendua Iaincoaren etchetic : eta baldin lehenic gureganic hatsen bada , ceric içanen da Iaincoaren Euangelioa obeditzen eztutenén fina ?

text: And if the righteous scarcely be saved , where shall the ungodly and the sinner appear ?
text2: Eta baldin iustoa nequez saluatzen bada , infidela eta bekatorea non comparituren da ?

text: Wherefore let them that suffer according to the will of God commit the keeping of their souls to him in well doing , as unto a faithful Creator .
text2: Halacotz bada Iaincoaren vorondatez affligitzen diradenéc , creaçale fidelari beçala bere arimác gommenda bietzote vngui eguinéz .

text: The elders which are among you I exhort , who am also an elder , and a witness of the sufferings of Christ , and also a partaker of the glory that shall be revealed :
text2: Çuen artean diraden Ancianoey othoitz eguiten drauet nic , bainaiz hayén Ancianoquide : eta Christen afflictionén testimonio , eta manifestatzeco den glorián participant :

text: Feed the flock of God which is among you , taking the oversight thereof , not by constraint , but willingly ; not for filthy lucre , but of a ready mind ;
text2: Bazca eçaçue Iaincoaren arthalde cargutan eman çaiçuena , harçaz artha duçuelaric , ez gogoz garaitic , baina gogotic : ez irabazte deshonestagatic , baina gogo prest batez .

text: Neither as being lords over God ' s heritage , but being ensamples to the flock .
text2: Eta ez Iaunaren heretagén gainean seignoriatzen bacendute beçala , baina arthaldearen exemplu çaratezten beçala .

text: And when the chief Shepherd shall appear , ye shall receive a crown of glory that fadeth not away .
text2: Eta aguer dadinean Pastor principala recebituren duqueçue gloriazco coroa incorruptiblea .

text: Likewise , ye younger , submit yourselves unto the elder . Yea , all of you be subject one to another , and be clothed with humility : for God resisteth the proud , and giveth grace to the humble .
text2: Halaber gazteác , çareten çaharrén suiet , eta guciac çareten bata bercearen suiet : çareten humilitatez barnetic appainduac : ecen Iaincoac vrgulutsuey resistitzen draue , eta humiley gratia eguiten .

text: Humble yourselves therefore under the mighty hand of God , that he may exalt you in due time :
text2: Humilia çaitezte bada Iaincoaren escu botheretsuaren azpian , ordu datenean goiti çaitzatençat :

text: Casting all your care upon him ; for he careth for you .
text2: Çuen artha gucia haren gainera egoizten duçuela : ecen harc artha du çueçaz .

text: Be sober , be vigilant ; because your adversary the devil , as a roaring lion , walketh about , seeking whom he may devour :
text2: Çareten sobre , eta veilla eçaçue , ecen çuen etsay deabrua , lehoin marrumalaribat beçala , çuen inguru dabila , cein irets deçaqueen bilha :

text: Whom resist stedfast in the faith , knowing that the same afflictions are accomplished in your brethren that are in the world .
text2: Resisti ieçoçue fedez fermu çaretelaric : daquiçuelaric ecen afflictione berac çuen anayén compainia munducoan complitzen diradela .

text: But the God of all grace , who hath called us unto his eternal glory by Christ Jesus , after that ye have suffered a while , make you perfect , stablish , strengthen , settle you .
